column2: Matthew 1:1 The book of the generation of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.
column3: Mattheus 1:1 DIE geslagsregister van Jesus Christus, die seun van Dawid, die seun van Abraham:

column2: Matthew 1:2 Abraham begat Isaac; and Isaac begat Jacob; and Jacob begat Judas and his brethren;
column3: Mattheus 1:2 Abraham was die vader van Isak, en Isak die vader van Jakob, en Jakob die vader van Juda en sy broers;

column2: Matthew 1:3 And Judas begat Phares and Zara of Thamar; and Phares begat Esrom; and Esrom begat Aram;
column3: Mattheus 1:3 en Juda was die vader van Peres en Serag by Tamar, en Peres was die vader van Hesron, en Hesron die vader van Ram,

column2: Matthew 1:4 And Aram begat Aminadab; and Aminadab begat Naasson; and Naasson begat Salmon;
column3: Mattheus 1:4 en Ram die vader van Ammínadab, en Ammínadab die vader van Nagson, en Nagson die vader van Salmon,

column2: Matthew 1:5 And Salmon begat Booz of Rachab; and Booz begat Obed of Ruth; and Obed begat Jesse;
column3: Mattheus 1:5 en Salmon die vader van Boas by Ragab, en Boas die vader van Obed by Rut, en Obed die vader van Ísai,

column2: Matthew 1:6 And Jesse begat David the king; and David the king begat Solomon of her [that had been the wife] of Urias;
column3: Mattheus 1:6 en Ísai die vader van koning Dawid, en koning Dawid die vader van Salomo by die vrou van Uría,

column2: Matthew 1:7 And Solomon begat Roboam; and Roboam begat Abia; and Abia begat Asa;
column3: Mattheus 1:7 en Salomo die vader van Rehábeam, en Rehábeam die vader van Abía, en Abía die vader van Asa,

column2: Matthew 1:8 And Asa begat Josaphat; and Josaphat begat Joram; and Joram begat Ozias;
column3: Mattheus 1:8 en Asa die vader van Jósafat, en Jósafat die vader van Joram, en Joram die vader van Ussía,

column2: Matthew 1:9 And Ozias begat Joatham; and Joatham begat Achaz; and Achaz begat Ezekias;
column3: Mattheus 1:9 en Ussía die vader van Jotam, en Jotam die vader van Agas, en Agas die vader van Hiskía,

column2: Matthew 1:10 And Ezekias begat Manasses; and Manasses begat Amon; and Amon begat Josias;
column3: Mattheus 1:10 en Hiskía die vader van Manasse, en Manasse die vader van Amon, en Amon die vader van Josía,

column2: Matthew 1:11 And Josias begat Jechonias and his brethren, about the time they were carried away to Babylon:
column3: Mattheus 1:11 en Josía die vader van Jegónia en sy broers in die tyd van die Babiloniese ballingskap.

column2: Matthew 1:12 And after they were brought to Babylon, Jechonias begat Salathiel; and Salathiel begat Zorobabel;
column3: Mattheus 1:12 En ná die Babiloniese ballingskap het Jegónia die vader geword van Seáltiël, en Seáltiël was die vader van Serubbábel,

column2: Matthew 1:13 And Zorobabel begat Abiud; and Abiud begat Eliakim; and Eliakim begat Azor;
column3: Mattheus 1:13 en Serubbábel die vader van Abíud, en Abíud die vader van Éljakim, en Éljakim die vader van Asor,

column2: Matthew 1:14 And Azor begat Sadoc; and Sadoc begat Achim; and Achim begat Eliud;
column3: Mattheus 1:14 en Asor die vader van Sadok, en Sadok die vader van Agim, en Agim die vader van Elíud,

column2: Matthew 1:15 And Eliud begat Eleazar; and Eleazar begat Matthan; and Matthan begat Jacob;
column3: Mattheus 1:15 en Elíud die vader van Eleásar, en Eleásar die vader van Mattan, en Mattan die vader van Jakob,

column2: Matthew 1:16 And Jacob begat Joseph the husband of Mary, of whom was born Jesus, who is called Christ.
column3: Mattheus 1:16 en Jakob die vader van Josef, die man van Maria uit wie gebore is Jesus wat Christus genoem word.

column2: Matthew 1:17 So all the generations from Abraham to David [are] fourteen generations; and from David until the carrying away into Babylon [are] fourteen generations; and from the carrying away into Babylon unto Christ [are] fourteen generations.
column3: Mattheus 1:17 Al die geslagte dan van Abraham tot Dawid is veertien geslagte, en van Dawid tot die Babiloniese ballingskap veertien geslagte, en van die Babiloniese ballingskap tot Christus veertien geslagte.

column2: Matthew 1:18 Now the birth of Jesus Christ was on this wise: When as his mother Mary was espoused to Joseph, before they came together, she was found with child of the Holy Ghost.
column3: Mattheus 1:18 DIE geboorte van Jesus Christus was dan só: Toe sy moeder Maria verloof was aan Josef, voordat hulle saamgekom het, is sy swanger bevind uit die Heilige Gees.

column2: Matthew 1:19 Then Joseph her husband, being a just [man], and not willing to make her a publick example, was minded to put her away privily.
column3: Mattheus 1:19 En Josef, haar man, omdat hy regverdig was en onwillig om haar openbaar te maak, het hom voorgeneem om in die geheim van haar te skei.

column2: Matthew 1:20 But while he thought on these things, behold, the angel of the Lord appeared unto him in a dream, saying, Joseph, thou son of David, fear not to take unto thee Mary thy wife: for that which is conceived in her is of the Holy Ghost.
column3: Mattheus 1:20 Maar terwyl hy dit in die gedagte gehad het, verskyn daar ’n engel van die Here in ’n droom aan hom en sê: Josef, seun van Dawid, wees nie bevrees om Maria, jou vrou, by jou te neem nie, want wat in haar verwek is, is uit die Heilige Gees;

column2: Matthew 1:21 And she shall bring forth a son, and thou shalt call his name JESUS: for he shall save his people from their sins.
column3: Mattheus 1:21 en sy sal ’n seun baar, en jy moet Hom Jesus noem, want dit is Hy wat sy volk van hulle sondes sal verlos.

column2: Matthew 1:22 Now all this was done, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken of the Lord by the prophet, saying,
column3: Mattheus 1:22 En dit het alles gebeur, sodat die woord vervul sou word wat die Here deur die profeet gespreek het:

column2: Matthew 1:23 Behold, a virgin shall be with child, and shall bring forth a son, and they shall call his name Emmanuel, which being interpreted is, God with us.
column3: Mattheus 1:23 Kyk, die maagd sal swanger word en ’n seun baar, en hulle sal Hom Emmánuel noem, dit is, as dit vertaal word: God met ons.

column2: Matthew 1:24 Then Joseph being raised from sleep did as the angel of the Lord had bidden him, and took unto him his wife:
column3: Mattheus 1:24 En toe Josef uit die slaap wakker word, het hy gedoen soos die engel van die Here hom beveel het en sy vrou by hom geneem;

column2: Matthew 1:25 And knew her not till she had brought forth her firstborn son: and he called his name JESUS.
column3: Mattheus 1:25 en hy het haar nie beken totdat sy haar eersgebore Seun gebaar het nie; en hy het Hom Jesus genoem.

column2: Matthew 2:1 Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judaea in the days of Herod the king, behold, there came wise men from the east to Jerusalem,
column3: Mattheus 2:1 EN toe Jesus te Betlehem in Judéa gebore is, in die dae van koning Herodes, het daar wyse manne uit die Ooste in Jerusalem aangekom

column2: Matthew 2:2 Saying, Where is he that is born King of the Jews? for we have seen his star in the east, and are come to worship him.
column3: Mattheus 2:2 en gesê: Waar is die Koning van die Jode, wat gebore is? Want ons het sy ster in die Ooste gesien en gekom om Hom hulde te bewys.

column2: Matthew 2:3 When Herod the king had heard [these things], he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.
column3: Mattheus 2:3 En toe koning Herodes dit hoor, was hy ontsteld en die hele Jerusalem saam met hom;

column2: Matthew 2:4 And when he had gathered all the chief priests and scribes of the people together, he demanded of them where Christ should be born.
column3: Mattheus 2:4 en hy het al die owerpriesters en die skrifgeleerdes van die volk bymekaar laat kom en by hulle navraag gedoen waar die Christus gebore sou word.

column2: Matthew 2:5 And they said unto him, In Bethlehem of Judaea: for thus it is written by the prophet,
column3: Mattheus 2:5 En hulle het vir hom gesê: Te Betlehem in Judéa, want so is daar deur die profeet geskrywe:

column2: Matthew 2:6 And thou Bethlehem, [in] the land of Juda, art not the least among the princes of Juda: for out of thee shall come a Governor, that shall rule my people Israel.
column3: Mattheus 2:6 En jy, Betlehem, land van Juda, is volstrek nie die geringste onder die vorste van Juda nie, want uit jou sal ’n leidsman voortkom wat vir my volk Israel ’n herder sal wees.

column2: Matthew 2:7 Then Herod, when he had privily called the wise men, enquired of them diligently what time the star appeared.
column3: Mattheus 2:7 Toe het Herodes die wyse manne in die geheim geroep en hulle na die tyd van die ster se verskyning uitgevra;

column2: Matthew 2:8 And he sent them to Bethlehem, and said, Go and search diligently for the young child; and when ye have found [him], bring me word again, that I may come and worship him also.
column3: Mattheus 2:8 en hy het hulle na Betlehem gestuur en gesê: Gaan doen noukeurig ondersoek na die Kindjie, en as julle Hom vind, laat my weet, sodat ek ook kan gaan en Hom hulde bewys.

column2: Matthew 2:9 When they had heard the king, they departed; and, lo, the star, which they saw in the east, went before them, till it came and stood over where the young child was.
column3: Mattheus 2:9 En nadat hulle die koning aangehoor het, het hulle vertrek. En kyk, die ster wat hulle in die Ooste gesien het, gaan voor hulle uit totdat hy kom en bly staan bo-oor die plek waar die Kindjie was.

column2: Matthew 2:10 When they saw the star, they rejoiced with exceeding great joy.
column3: Mattheus 2:10 En toe hulle die ster sien, het hulle hul met baie groot blydskap verheug.

column2: Matthew 2:11 And when they were come into the house, they saw the young child with Mary his mother, and fell down, and worshipped him: and when they had opened their treasures, they presented unto him gifts; gold, and frankincense, and myrrh.
column3: Mattheus 2:11 En hulle het in die huis gegaan en die Kindjie by Maria, sy moeder, gevind en neergeval en Hom hulde bewys. Daarop maak hulle hul skatte oop en bring vir Hom geskenke: goud en wierook en mirre.

column2: Matthew 2:12 And being warned of God in a dream that they should not return to Herod, they departed into their own country another way.
column3: Mattheus 2:12 En omdat hulle in ’n droom ’n goddelike waarskuwing ontvang het om nie na Herodes terug te keer nie, het hulle met ’n ander pad na hul land teruggegaan.

column2: Matthew 2:13 And when they were departed, behold, the angel of the Lord appeareth to Joseph in a dream, saying, Arise, and take the young child and his mother, and flee into Egypt, and be thou there until I bring thee word: for Herod will seek the young child to destroy him.
column3: Mattheus 2:13 EN toe hulle teruggegaan het, verskyn daar ’n engel van die Here in ’n droom aan Josef en sê: Staan op, neem die Kindjie en sy moeder en vlug na Egipte, en bly daar totdat ek jou sê; want Herodes gaan die Kindjie soek om Hom dood te maak.

column2: Matthew 2:14 When he arose, he took the young child and his mother by night, and departed into Egypt:
column3: Mattheus 2:14 Hy het toe opgestaan, die Kindjie en sy moeder in die nag geneem en na Egipte vertrek.

column2: Matthew 2:15 And was there until the death of Herod: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken of the Lord by the prophet, saying, Out of Egypt have I called my son.
column3: Mattheus 2:15 En hy was daar tot die dood van Herodes, sodat die woord vervul sou word wat die Here gespreek het deur die profeet: Uit Egipte het Ek my Seun geroep.

column2: Matthew 2:16 Then Herod, when he saw that he was mocked of the wise men, was exceeding wroth, and sent forth, and slew all the children that were in Bethlehem, and in all the coasts thereof, from two years old and under, according to the time which he had diligently enquired of the wise men.
column3: Mattheus 2:16 Toe Herodes sien dat hy deur die wyse manne mislei was, het hy baie woedend geword en gestuur en in Betlehem en in al die omstreke daarvan al die seuntjies van twee jaar en daaronder laat ombring, ooreenkomstig die tyd wat hy van die wyse manne uitgevra het.

column2: Matthew 2:17 Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremy the prophet, saying,
column3: Mattheus 2:17 Toe is vervul wat deur Jeremia, die profeet, gespreek is toe hy gesê het:

column2: Matthew 2:18 In Rama was there a voice heard, lamentation, and weeping, and great mourning, Rachel weeping [for] her children, and would not be comforted, because they are not.
column3: Mattheus 2:18 ’n Stem is in Rama gehoor: rouklag en geween en groot gekerm; Ragel beween haar kinders en wil nie vertroos word nie, omdat hulle daar nie meer is nie.

column2: Matthew 2:19 But when Herod was dead, behold, an angel of the Lord appeareth in a dream to Joseph in Egypt,
column3: Mattheus 2:19 EN ná die dood van Herodes het daar ’n engel van die Here in ’n droom aan Josef in Egipte verskyn

column2: Matthew 2:20 Saying, Arise, and take the young child and his mother, and go into the land of Israel: for they are dead which sought the young child's life.
column3: Mattheus 2:20 en gesê: Staan op, neem die Kindjie en sy moeder, en gaan na die land van Israel; want hulle is dood wat die lewe van die Kindjie gesoek het.

column2: Matthew 2:21 And he arose, and took the young child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel.
column3: Mattheus 2:21 En hy het opgestaan, die Kindjie en sy moeder geneem en in die land van Israel gekom.

column2: Matthew 2:22 But when he heard that Archelaus did reign in Judaea in the room of his father Herod, he was afraid to go thither: notwithstanding, being warned of God in a dream, he turned aside into the parts of Galilee:
column3: Mattheus 2:22 Maar toe hy hoor dat Archeláüs oor Judéa koning was in die plek van sy vader Herodes, was hy bevrees om daarheen te gaan. En hy het ’n goddelike waarskuwing in ’n droom ontvang en na die streke van Galiléa teruggekeer.

column2: Matthew 2:23 And he came and dwelt in a city called Nazareth: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophets, He shall be called a Nazarene.
column3: Mattheus 2:23 En hy het gaan woon in ’n stad met die naam van Násaret, sodat vervul sou word wat deur die profete gespreek is, dat Hy Nasaréner genoem sou word.

column2: Matthew 3:1 In those days came John the Baptist, preaching in the wilderness of Judaea,
column3: Mattheus 3:1 IN daardie dae het Johannes die Doper opgetree en in die woestyn van Judéa

column2: Matthew 3:2 And saying, Repent ye: for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.
column3: Mattheus 3:2 gepreek en gesê: Bekeer julle, want die koninkryk van die hemele het naby gekom.

column2: Matthew 3:3 For this is he that was spoken of by the prophet Esaias, saying, The voice of one crying in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make his paths straight.
column3: Mattheus 3:3 Want dit is hy van wie deur die profeet Jesaja gespreek is toe hy gesê het: Die stem van een wat roep in die woestyn: Berei die weg van die Here, maak sy paaie reguit!

column2: Matthew 3:4 And the same John had his raiment of camel's hair, and a leathern girdle about his loins; and his meat was locusts and wild honey.
column3: Mattheus 3:4 En hy, Johannes, het ’n kleed gedra van kameelhare en ’n leergord om sy heupe, en sy voedsel was sprinkane en wilde heuning.

column2: Matthew 3:5 Then went out to him Jerusalem, and all Judaea, and all the region round about Jordan,
column3: Mattheus 3:5 En Jerusalem en die hele Judéa en die hele omtrek van die Jordaan het uitgegaan na hom toe.

column2: Matthew 3:6 And were baptized of him in Jordan, confessing their sins.
column3: Mattheus 3:6 En hulle is deur hom in die Jordaan gedoop met belydenis van hulle sondes.

column2: Matthew 3:7 But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees come to his baptism, he said unto them, O generation of vipers, who hath warned you to flee from the wrath to come?
column3: Mattheus 3:7 Maar toe hy baie van die Fariseërs en Sadduseërs na sy doop sien kom, sê hy vir hulle: Addergeslag, wie het julle aangewys om te vlug vir die toorn wat aan kom is?

column2: Matthew 3:8 Bring forth therefore fruits meet for repentance:
column3: Mattheus 3:8 Dra dan vrugte wat by die bekering pas.

column2: Matthew 3:9 And think not to say within yourselves, We have Abraham to [our] father: for I say unto you, that God is able of these stones to raise up children unto Abraham.
column3: Mattheus 3:9 En moenie dink om by julleself te sê: ons het Abraham as vader nie; want ek sê vir julle dat God mag het om uit hierdie klippe kinders vir Abraham op te wek.

column2: Matthew 3:10 And now also the axe is laid unto the root of the trees: therefore every tree which bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.
column3: Mattheus 3:10 Maar die byl lê ook al teen die wortel van die bome. Elke boom wat geen goeie vrugte dra nie, word uitgekap en in die vuur gegooi.

column2: Matthew 3:11 I indeed baptize you with water unto repentance: but he that cometh after me is mightier than I, whose shoes I am not worthy to bear: he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost, and [with] fire:
column3: Mattheus 3:11 Ek doop julle wel met water tot bekering; maar Hy wat ná my kom, is sterker as ek, wie se skoene ek nie waardig is om aan te dra nie. Hy sal julle doop met die Heilige Gees en met vuur.

column2: Matthew 3:12 Whose fan [is] in his hand, and he will throughly purge his floor, and gather his wheat into the garner; but he will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.
column3: Mattheus 3:12 Sy skop is in sy hand, en Hy sal sy dorsvloer deur en deur skoonmaak en sy koring in die skuur saambring, maar die kaf sal Hy met onuitbluslike vuur verbrand.

column2: Matthew 3:13 Then cometh Jesus from Galilee to Jordan unto John, to be baptized of him.
column3: Mattheus 3:13 TOE het Jesus van Galiléa na die Jordaan, na Johannes gekom om deur hom gedoop te word.

column2: Matthew 3:14 But John forbad him, saying, I have need to be baptized of thee, and comest thou to me?
column3: Mattheus 3:14 Maar Johannes het Hom ernstig teëgegaan en gesê: Ek het nodig om deur U gedoop te word, en kom U na my toe?

column2: Matthew 3:15 And Jesus answering said unto him, Suffer [it to be so] now: for thus it becometh us to fulfil all righteousness. Then he suffered him.
column3: Mattheus 3:15 Maar Jesus het geantwoord en vir hom gesê: Laat dit nou toe, want só pas dit ons om alle geregtigheid te vervul. Daarna het hy Hom toegelaat.

column2: Matthew 3:16 And Jesus, when he was baptized, went up straightway out of the water: and, lo, the heavens were opened unto him, and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove, and lighting upon him:
column3: Mattheus 3:16 En nadat Jesus gedoop was, het Hy dadelik uit die water opgeklim, en meteens gaan die hemele vir Hom oop, en Hy sien die Gees van God soos ’n duif neerdaal en op Hom kom.

column2: Matthew 3:17 And lo a voice from heaven, saying, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.
column3: Mattheus 3:17 En daar kom ’n stem uit die hemele wat sê: Dit is my geliefde Seun in wie Ek ’n welbehae het.

column2: Matthew 4:1 Then was Jesus led up of the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted of the devil.
column3: Mattheus 4:1 TOE is Jesus deur die Gees weggelei die woestyn in om versoek te word deur die duiwel.

column2: Matthew 4:2 And when he had fasted forty days and forty nights, he was afterward an hungred.
column3: Mattheus 4:2 En nadat Hy veertig dae en veertig nagte gevas het, het Hy naderhand honger geword.

column2: Matthew 4:3 And when the tempter came to him, he said, If thou be the Son of God, command that these stones be made bread.
column3: Mattheus 4:3 En die versoeker het na Hom gekom en gesê: As U die Seun van God is, sê dat hierdie klippe brode word.

column2: Matthew 4:4 But he answered and said, It is written, Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceedeth out of the mouth of God.
column3: Mattheus 4:4 Maar Hy antwoord en sê: Daar is geskrywe: Die mens sal nie van brood alleen lewe nie, maar van elke woord wat deur die mond van God uitgaan.

column2: Matthew 4:5 Then the devil taketh him up into the holy city, and setteth him on a pinnacle of the temple,
column3: Mattheus 4:5 Toe neem die duiwel Hom saam na die heilige stad en laat Hom op die dak van die tempel staan

column2: Matthew 4:6 And saith unto him, If thou be the Son of God, cast thyself down: for it is written, He shall give his angels charge concerning thee: and in [their] hands they shall bear thee up, lest at any time thou dash thy foot against a stone.
column3: Mattheus 4:6 en sê vir Hom: As U die Seun van God is, werp Uself af; want daar is geskrywe: Hy sal sy engele bevel gee aangaande U, en hulle sal U op die hande dra, sodat U nie miskien u voet teen ’n klip stamp nie.

column2: Matthew 4:7 Jesus said unto him, It is written again, Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God.
column3: Mattheus 4:7 Jesus sê vir hom: Daar is óók geskrywe: Jy mag die Here jou God nie versoek nie.

column2: Matthew 4:8 Again, the devil taketh him up into an exceeding high mountain, and sheweth him all the kingdoms of the world, and the glory of them;
column3: Mattheus 4:8 Weer neem die duiwel Hom saam na ’n baie hoë berg en wys Hom al die koninkryke van die wêreld en hulle heerlikheid,

column2: Matthew 4:9 And saith unto him, All these things will I give thee, if thou wilt fall down and worship me.
column3: Mattheus 4:9 en sê vir Hom: Al hierdie dinge sal ek aan U gee as U neerval en my aanbid.

column2: Matthew 4:10 Then saith Jesus unto him, Get thee hence, Satan: for it is written, Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and him only shalt thou serve.
column3: Mattheus 4:10 Toe sê Jesus vir hom: Gaan weg, Satan! want daar is geskrywe: Die Here jou God moet jy aanbid en Hom alleen dien.

column2: Matthew 4:11 Then the devil leaveth him, and, behold, angels came and ministered unto him.
column3: Mattheus 4:11 Daarna het die duiwel Hom laat staan, en daar het engele gekom en Hom gedien.

column2: Matthew 4:12 Now when Jesus had heard that John was cast into prison, he departed into Galilee;
column3: Mattheus 4:12 EN toe Jesus hoor dat Johannes in die gevangenis gesit was, het Hy na Galiléa teruggegaan.

column2: Matthew 4:13 And leaving Nazareth, he came and dwelt in Capernaum, which is upon the sea coast, in the borders of Zabulon and Nephthalim:
column3: Mattheus 4:13 En Hy het Násaret verlaat en gaan woon in Kapérnaüm aan die see, in die gebied van Sébulon en Náftali,

column2: Matthew 4:14 That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet, saying,
column3: Mattheus 4:14 sodat vervul sou word wat gespreek is deur Jesaja, die profeet, toe hy gesê het:

column2: Matthew 4:15 The land of Zabulon, and the land of Nephthalim, [by] the way of the sea, beyond Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles;
column3: Mattheus 4:15 Die land Sébulon en die land Náftali, na die see toe, oorkant die Jordaan, Galiléa van die heidene —

column2: Matthew 4:16 The people which sat in darkness saw great light; and to them which sat in the region and shadow of death light is sprung up.
column3: Mattheus 4:16 die volk wat in duisternis sit, het ’n groot lig gesien, en die wat sit in die land en skaduwee van die dood, vir hulle het ’n lig opgegaan.

column2: Matthew 4:17 From that time Jesus began to preach, and to say, Repent: for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.
column3: Mattheus 4:17 Van toe af het Jesus begin om te preek en te sê: Bekeer julle, want die koninkryk van die hemele het naby gekom.

column2: Matthew 4:18 And Jesus, walking by the sea of Galilee, saw two brethren, Simon called Peter, and Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea: for they were fishers.
column3: Mattheus 4:18 En terwyl Jesus langs die see van Galiléa loop, sien Hy twee broers, Simon wat genoem word Petrus, en Andréas, sy broer, besig om ’n net in die see uit te gooi; want hulle was vissers.

column2: Matthew 4:19 And he saith unto them, Follow me, and I will make you fishers of men.
column3: Mattheus 4:19 En Hy sê vir hulle: Kom agter My aan, en Ek sal julle vissers van mense maak.

column2: Matthew 4:20 And they straightway left [their] nets, and followed him.
column3: Mattheus 4:20 En hulle het dadelik die nette laat staan en Hom gevolg.

column2: Matthew 4:21 And going on from thence, he saw other two brethren, James [the son] of Zebedee, and John his brother, in a ship with Zebedee their father, mending their nets; and he called them.
column3: Mattheus 4:21 En toe Hy daarvandaan verder gaan, sien Hy twee ander broers, Jakobus, die seun van Sebedéüs, en Johannes, sy broer, in die skuit saam met hulle vader Sebedéüs, besig om hulle nette heel te maak; en Hy het hulle geroep.

column2: Matthew 4:22 And they immediately left the ship and their father, and followed him.
column3: Mattheus 4:22 En hulle het dadelik die skuit en hulle vader verlaat en Hom gevolg.

column2: Matthew 4:23 And Jesus went about all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing all manner of sickness and all manner of disease among the people.
column3: Mattheus 4:23 En Jesus het deur die hele Galiléa rondgegaan en in hulle sinagoges geleer en die evangelie van die koninkryk verkondig en elke siekte en elke kwaal onder die volk genees.

column2: Matthew 4:24 And his fame went throughout all Syria: and they brought unto him all sick people that were taken with divers diseases and torments, and those which were possessed with devils, and those which were lunatick, and those that had the palsy; and he healed them.
column3: Mattheus 4:24 En die gerug aangaande Hom is versprei oor die hele Sírië; en hulle het na Hom gebring almal wat ongesteld was, wat gekwel was deur allerhande siektes en pyne en wat van duiwels besete was, en maansiekes en verlamdes; en Hy het hulle gesond gemaak.

column2: Matthew 4:25 And there followed him great multitudes of people from Galilee, and [from] Decapolis, and [from] Jerusalem, and [from] Judaea, and [from] beyond Jordan.
column3: Mattheus 4:25 En groot menigtes het Hom gevolg van Galiléa en Dekápolis en Jerusalem en Judéa en van oorkant die Jordaan af.

column2: Matthew 5:1 And seeing the multitudes, he went up into a mountain: and when he was set, his disciples came unto him:
column3: Mattheus 5:1 EN toe Hy die skare sien, het Hy op die berg geklim; en nadat Hy gaan sit het, het sy dissipels na Hom gekom;

column2: Matthew 5:2 And he opened his mouth, and taught them, saying,
column3: Mattheus 5:2 en Hy het sy mond geopen en hulle geleer en gesê:

column2: Matthew 5:3 Blessed [are] the poor in spirit: for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
column3: Mattheus 5:3 Salig is die wat arm van gees is, want aan hulle behoort die koninkryk van die hemele.

column2: Matthew 5:4 Blessed [are] they that mourn: for they shall be comforted.
column3: Mattheus 5:4 Salig is die wat treur, want hulle sal vertroos word.

column2: Matthew 5:5 Blessed [are] the meek: for they shall inherit the earth.
column3: Mattheus 5:5 Salig is die sagmoediges, want hulle sal die aarde beërwe.

column2: Matthew 5:6 Blessed [are] they which do hunger and thirst after righteousness: for they shall be filled.
column3: Mattheus 5:6 Salig is die wat honger en dors na die geregtigheid, want hulle sal versadig word.

column2: Matthew 5:7 Blessed [are] the merciful: for they shall obtain mercy.
column3: Mattheus 5:7 Salig is die barmhartiges, want aan hulle sal barmhartigheid bewys word.

column2: Matthew 5:8 Blessed [are] the pure in heart: for they shall see God.
column3: Mattheus 5:8 Salig is die wat rein van hart is, want hulle sal God sien.

column2: Matthew 5:9 Blessed [are] the peacemakers: for they shall be called the children of God.
column3: Mattheus 5:9 Salig is die vredemakers, want hulle sal kinders van God genoem word.

column2: Matthew 5:10 Blessed [are] they which are persecuted for righteousness' sake: for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
column3: Mattheus 5:10 Salig is die wat vervolg word ter wille van die geregtigheid, want aan hulle behoort die koninkryk van die hemele.

column2: Matthew 5:11 Blessed are ye, when [men] shall revile you, and persecute [you], and shall say all manner of evil against you falsely, for my sake.
column3: Mattheus 5:11 Salig is julle wanneer die mense julle beledig en vervolg en valslik allerhande kwaad teen julle spreek om My ontwil.

column2: Matthew 5:12 Rejoice, and be exceeding glad: for great [is] your reward in heaven: for so persecuted they the prophets which were before you.
column3: Mattheus 5:12 Verbly en verheug julle omdat julle loon groot is in die hemele; want so het hulle die profete vervolg wat voor julle gewees het.

column2: Matthew 5:13 Ye are the salt of the earth: but if the salt have lost his savour, wherewith shall it be salted? it is thenceforth good for nothing, but to be cast out, and to be trodden under foot of men.
column3: Mattheus 5:13 JULLE is die sout van die aarde, maar as die sout laf geword het, waarmee sal dit gesout word? Dit deug nêrens meer voor as om buite gegooi en deur die mense vertrap te word nie.

column2: Matthew 5:14 Ye are the light of the world. A city that is set on an hill cannot be hid.
column3: Mattheus 5:14 Julle is die lig van die wêreld. ’n Stad wat bo-op ’n berg lê, kan nie weggesteek word nie;

column2: Matthew 5:15 Neither do men light a candle, and put it under a bushel, but on a candlestick; and it giveth light unto all that are in the house.
column3: Mattheus 5:15 en ’n mens steek ook nie ’n lamp op en sit dit onder die maatemmer nie, maar op die staander, en dit skyn vir almal wat in die huis is.

column2: Matthew 5:16 Let your light so shine before men, that they may see your good works, and glorify your Father which is in heaven.
column3: Mattheus 5:16 Laat julle lig só skyn voor die mense, dat hulle julle goeie werke kan sien en julle Vader wat in die hemele is, verheerlik.

column2: Matthew 5:17 Think not that I am come to destroy the law, or the prophets: I am not come to destroy, but to fulfil.
column3: Mattheus 5:17 MOENIE dink dat Ek gekom het om die wet of die profete te ontbind nie. Ek het nie gekom om te ontbind nie, maar om te vervul.

column2: Matthew 5:18 For verily I say unto you, Till heaven and earth pass, one jot or one tittle shall in no wise pass from the law, till all be fulfilled.
column3: Mattheus 5:18 Want voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, voordat die hemel en die aarde verbygaan, sal nie een jota of een titteltjie van die wet ooit verbygaan totdat alles gebeur het nie.

column2: Matthew 5:19 Whosoever therefore shall break one of these least commandments, and shall teach men so, he shall be called the least in the kingdom of heaven: but whosoever shall do and teach [them], the same shall be called great in the kingdom of heaven.
column3: Mattheus 5:19 Elkeen dus wat een van die minste van hierdie gebooie breek en die mense só leer, sal die minste genoem word in die koninkryk van die hemele; maar elkeen wat dit doen en leer, hy sal groot genoem word in die koninkryk van die hemele.

column2: Matthew 5:20 For I say unto you, That except your righteousness shall exceed [the righteousness] of the scribes and Pharisees, ye shall in no case enter into the kingdom of heaven.
column3: Mattheus 5:20 Want Ek sê vir julle dat, as julle geregtigheid nie oorvloediger is as dié van die skrifgeleerdes en Fariseërs nie, julle nooit in die koninkryk van die hemele sal ingaan nie.

column2: Matthew 5:21 Ye have heard that it was said by them of old time, Thou shalt not kill; and whosoever shall kill shall be in danger of the judgment:
column3: Mattheus 5:21 Julle het gehoor dat aan die mense van die ou tyd gesê is: Jy mag nie doodslaan nie, maar elkeen wat doodslaan, moet verantwoording doen voor die gereg.

column2: Matthew 5:22 But I say unto you, That whosoever is angry with his brother without a cause shall be in danger of the judgment: and whosoever shall say to his brother, Raca, shall be in danger of the council: but whosoever shall say, Thou fool, shall be in danger of hell fire.
column3: Mattheus 5:22 Maar Ek sê vir julle dat elkeen wat vir sy broeder sonder rede kwaad is, verantwoording moet doen voor die gereg; en elkeen wat vir sy broeder sê: Raka! moet verantwoording doen voor die Groot Raad; en elkeen wat sê: Jou dwaas! moet verantwoording doen in die helse vuur.

column2: Matthew 5:23 Therefore if thou bring thy gift to the altar, and there rememberest that thy brother hath ought against thee;
column3: Mattheus 5:23 As jy dan jou gawe na die altaar bring en dit jou daar byval dat jou broeder iets teen jou het,

column2: Matthew 5:24 Leave there thy gift before the altar, and go thy way; first be reconciled to thy brother, and then come and offer thy gift.
column3: Mattheus 5:24 laat jou gawe daar voor die altaar bly en gaan versoen jou eers met jou broeder, en kom dan en bring jou gawe.

column2: Matthew 5:25 Agree with thine adversary quickly, whiles thou art in the way with him; lest at any time the adversary deliver thee to the judge, and the judge deliver thee to the officer, and thou be cast into prison.
column3: Mattheus 5:25 Wees gou goedgesind teenoor jou teëparty so lank as jy nog saam met hom op die pad is, sodat die teëparty jou nie miskien oorgee aan die regter en die regter jou oorgee aan die geregsdienaar en jy in die gevangenis gewerp word nie.

column2: Matthew 5:26 Verily I say unto thee, Thou shalt by no means come out thence, till thou hast paid the uttermost farthing.
column3: Mattheus 5:26 Voorwaar Ek sê vir jou, jy sal daar sekerlik nie uitkom voordat jy die laaste oortjie betaal het nie.

column2: Matthew 5:27 Ye have heard that it was said by them of old time, Thou shalt not commit adultery:
column3: Mattheus 5:27 Julle het gehoor dat aan die mense van die ou tyd gesê is: Jy mag nie egbreek nie.

column2: Matthew 5:28 But I say unto you, That whosoever looketh on a woman to lust after her hath committed adultery with her already in his heart.
column3: Mattheus 5:28 Maar Ek sê vir julle dat elkeen wat na ’n vrou kyk om haar te begeer, reeds in sy hart met haar egbreuk gepleeg het.

column2: Matthew 5:29 And if thy right eye offend thee, pluck it out, and cast [it] from thee: for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members should perish, and not [that] thy whole body should be cast into hell.
column3: Mattheus 5:29 As jou regteroog jou dan laat struikel, ruk dit uit en gooi dit weg van jou af; want dit is vir jou beter dat een van jou lede vergaan en nie jou hele liggaam in die hel gewerp word nie.

column2: Matthew 5:30 And if thy right hand offend thee, cut it off, and cast [it] from thee: for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members should perish, and not [that] thy whole body should be cast into hell.
column3: Mattheus 5:30 En as jou regterhand jou laat struikel, kap dit af en gooi dit weg van jou af; want dit is vir jou beter dat een van jou lede vergaan en nie jou hele liggaam in die hel gewerp word nie.

column2: Matthew 5:31 It hath been said, Whosoever shall put away his wife, let him give her a writing of divorcement:
column3: Mattheus 5:31 Daar is ook gesê: Elkeen wat van sy vrou skei, moet haar ’n skeibrief gee.

column2: Matthew 5:32 But I say unto you, That whosoever shall put away his wife, saving for the cause of fornication, causeth her to commit adultery: and whosoever shall marry her that is divorced committeth adultery.
column3: Mattheus 5:32 Maar Ek sê vir julle dat elkeen wat van sy vrou skei, behalwe omrede van hoerery, maak dat sy egbreuk pleeg, en elkeen wat die geskeie vrou trou, pleeg egbreuk.

column2: Matthew 5:33 Again, ye have heard that it hath been said by them of old time, Thou shalt not forswear thyself, but shalt perform unto the Lord thine oaths:
column3: Mattheus 5:33 Verder het julle gehoor dat aan die mense van die ou tyd gesê is: Jy mag nie vals sweer nie, maar jy moet jou ede aan die Here hou.

column2: Matthew 5:34 But I say unto you, Swear not at all; neither by heaven; for it is God's throne:
column3: Mattheus 5:34 Maar Ek sê vir julle: Sweer hoegenaamd nie — nie by die hemel nie, omdat dit die troon van God is;

column2: Matthew 5:35 Nor by the earth; for it is his footstool: neither by Jerusalem; for it is the city of the great King.
column3: Mattheus 5:35 ook nie by die aarde nie, omdat dit die voetbank van sy voete is; ook nie by Jerusalem nie, omdat dit die stad is van die groot Koning;

column2: Matthew 5:36 Neither shalt thou swear by thy head, because thou canst not make one hair white or black.
column3: Mattheus 5:36 ook by jou hoof mag jy nie sweer nie, omdat jy nie een haar wit of swart kan maak nie.

column2: Matthew 5:37 But let your communication be, Yea, yea; Nay, nay: for whatsoever is more than these cometh of evil.
column3: Mattheus 5:37 Maar laat julle woord wees: Ja ja, nee nee. Wat meer as dit is, is uit die Bose.

column2: Matthew 5:38 Ye have heard that it hath been said, An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth:
column3: Mattheus 5:38 Julle het gehoor dat daar gesê is: Oog vir oog en tand vir tand.

column2: Matthew 5:39 But I say unto you, That ye resist not evil: but whosoever shall smite thee on thy right cheek, turn to him the other also.
column3: Mattheus 5:39 Maar Ek sê vir julle dat julle ’n slegte mens nie moet weerstaan nie; maar as iemand jou op jou regterwang slaan, draai ook die ander een na hom toe.

column2: Matthew 5:40 And if any man will sue thee at the law, and take away thy coat, let him have [thy] cloke also.
column3: Mattheus 5:40 En hy wat met jou na die gereg wil gaan en jou onderkleed wil neem, laat hom ook die bo-kleed kry.

column2: Matthew 5:41 And whosoever shall compel thee to go a mile, go with him twain.
column3: Mattheus 5:41 En elkeen wat van jou een myl afdwing, loop met hom twee myl saam.

column2: Matthew 5:42 Give to him that asketh thee, and from him that would borrow of thee turn not thou away.
column3: Mattheus 5:42 Gee aan hom wat jou iets vra, en wys hom nie af wat van jou wil leen nie.

column2: Matthew 5:43 Ye have heard that it hath been said, Thou shalt love thy neighbour, and hate thine enemy.
column3: Mattheus 5:43 Julle het gehoor dat daar gesê is: Jy moet jou naaste liefhê en jou vyand moet jy haat.

column2: Matthew 5:44 But I say unto you, Love your enemies, bless them that curse you, do good to them that hate you, and pray for them which despitefully use you, and persecute you;
column3: Mattheus 5:44 Maar Ek sê vir julle: Julle moet jul vyande liefhê; seën die wat vir julle vervloek, doen goed aan die wat vir julle haat, en bid vir die wat julle beledig en julle vervolg;

column2: Matthew 5:45 That ye may be the children of your Father which is in heaven: for he maketh his sun to rise on the evil and on the good, and sendeth rain on the just and on the unjust.
column3: Mattheus 5:45 sodat julle kinders kan word van julle Vader wat in die hemele is; want Hy laat sy son opgaan oor slegtes en goeies, en Hy laat reën op regverdiges en onregverdiges.

column2: Matthew 5:46 For if ye love them which love you, what reward have ye? do not even the publicans the same?
column3: Mattheus 5:46 Want as julle liefhet die wat vir julle liefhet, watter loon het julle? Doen die tollenaars nie ook dieselfde nie?

column2: Matthew 5:47 And if ye salute your brethren only, what do ye more [than others]? do not even the publicans so?
column3: Mattheus 5:47 En as julle net jul broeders groet, wat besonders doen julle dan? Doen die tollenaars nie ook so nie?

column2: Matthew 5:48 Be ye therefore perfect, even as your Father which is in heaven is perfect.
column3: Mattheus 5:48 Wees julle dan volmaak soos julle Vader in die hemele volmaak is.

column2: Matthew 6:1 Take heed that ye do not your alms before men, to be seen of them: otherwise ye have no reward of your Father which is in heaven.
column3: Mattheus 6:1 PAS op dat julle nie jul liefdadigheid voor die mense bewys om deur hulle gesien te word nie; anders het julle geen loon by julle Vader wat in die hemele is nie.

column2: Matthew 6:2 Therefore when thou doest [thine] alms, do not sound a trumpet before thee, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may have glory of men. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.
column3: Mattheus 6:2 Wanneer jy dan liefdadigheid bewys, moenie ’n trompet voor jou blaas soos die geveinsdes in die sinagoges en op die strate doen, dat hulle deur die mense geëer kan word nie. Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, hulle het hul loon weg.

column2: Matthew 6:3 But when thou doest alms, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth:
column3: Mattheus 6:3 Maar jy, as jy liefdadigheid bewys, laat jou linkerhand nie weet wat jou regterhand doen nie,

column2: Matthew 6:4 That thine alms may be in secret: and thy Father which seeth in secret himself shall reward thee openly.
column3: Mattheus 6:4 sodat jou liefdadigheid in die verborgene kan wees; en jou Vader wat in die verborgene sien, Hy sal jou in die openbaar vergelde.

column2: Matthew 6:5 And when thou prayest, thou shalt not be as the hypocrites [are]: for they love to pray standing in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen of men. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.
column3: Mattheus 6:5 En wanneer jy bid, moet jy nie wees soos die geveinsdes nie; want hulle hou daarvan om in die sinagoges en op die hoeke van die strate te staan en bid, om deur die mense gesien te word. Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle dat hulle hul loon weg het.

column2: Matthew 6:6 But thou, when thou prayest, enter into thy closet, and when thou hast shut thy door, pray to thy Father which is in secret; and thy Father which seeth in secret shall reward thee openly.
column3: Mattheus 6:6 Maar jy, wanneer jy bid, gaan in jou binnekamer, sluit jou deur en bid jou Vader wat in die verborgene is; en jou Vader wat in die verborgene sien, sal jou in die openbaar vergelde.

column2: Matthew 6:7 But when ye pray, use not vain repetitions, as the heathen [do]: for they think that they shall be heard for their much speaking.
column3: Mattheus 6:7 En as julle bid, gebruik nie ’n ydele herhaling van woorde soos die heidene nie, want hulle dink dat hulle deur hul baie woorde verhoor sal word.

column2: Matthew 6:8 Be not ye therefore like unto them: for your Father knoweth what things ye have need of, before ye ask him.
column3: Mattheus 6:8 Moet dan nie soos hulle word nie, want jul Vader weet wat julle nodig het voordat julle Hom vra.

column2: Matthew 6:9 After this manner therefore pray ye: Our Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy name.
column3: Mattheus 6:9 Só moet julle dan bid: Onse Vader wat in die hemele is, laat u Naam geheilig word;

column2: Matthew 6:10 Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done in earth, as [it is] in heaven.
column3: Mattheus 6:10 laat u koninkryk kom; laat u wil geskied, soos in die hemel net so ook op die aarde;

column2: Matthew 6:11 Give us this day our daily bread.
column3: Mattheus 6:11 gee ons vandag ons daaglikse brood;

column2: Matthew 6:12 And forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtors.
column3: Mattheus 6:12 en vergeef ons ons skulde, soos ons ook ons skuldenaars vergewe;

column2: Matthew 6:13 And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil: For thine is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory, for ever. Amen.
column3: Mattheus 6:13 en lei ons nie in versoeking nie, maar verlos ons van die Bose. Want aan U behoort die koninkryk en die krag en die heerlikheid tot in ewigheid. Amen.

column2: Matthew 6:14 For if ye forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you:
column3: Mattheus 6:14 Want as julle die mense hulle oortredinge vergewe, sal julle hemelse Vader julle ook vergewe.

column2: Matthew 6:15 But if ye forgive not men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.
column3: Mattheus 6:15 Maar as julle die mense hulle oortredinge nie vergewe nie, sal julle Vader julle oortredinge ook nie vergewe nie.

column2: Matthew 6:16 Moreover when ye fast, be not, as the hypocrites, of a sad countenance: for they disfigure their faces, that they may appear unto men to fast. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.
column3: Mattheus 6:16 En wanneer julle vas, moenie lang gesigte trek soos die geveinsdes nie; want hulle mismaak hul gesigte, sodat dit deur die mense gesien kan word dat hulle vas. Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, hulle het hul loon weg.

column2: Matthew 6:17 But thou, when thou fastest, anoint thine head, and wash thy face;
column3: Mattheus 6:17 Maar jy, as jy vas, salf jou hoof en was jou gesig,

column2: Matthew 6:18 That thou appear not unto men to fast, but unto thy Father which is in secret: and thy Father, which seeth in secret, shall reward thee openly.
column3: Mattheus 6:18 sodat jy nie die mense laat sien dat jy vas nie, maar jou Vader wat in die verborgene is; en jou Vader wat in die verborgene sien, sal jou in die openbaar vergelde.

column2: Matthew 6:19 Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon earth, where moth and rust doth corrupt, and where thieves break through and steal:
column3: Mattheus 6:19 MOENIE vir julle skatte bymekaarmaak op die aarde, waar mot en roes verniel en waar diewe inbreek en steel nie;

column2: Matthew 6:20 But lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust doth corrupt, and where thieves do not break through nor steal:
column3: Mattheus 6:20 maar maak vir julle skatte bymekaar in die hemel, waar geen mot of roes verniel nie en waar diewe nie inbreek en steel nie;

column2: Matthew 6:21 For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.
column3: Mattheus 6:21 want waar julle skat is, daar sal julle hart ook wees.

column2: Matthew 6:22 The light of the body is the eye: if therefore thine eye be single, thy whole body shall be full of light.
column3: Mattheus 6:22 Die lamp van die liggaam is die oog. As jou oog dan reg is, sal jou hele liggaam verlig wees.

column2: Matthew 6:23 But if thine eye be evil, thy whole body shall be full of darkness. If therefore the light that is in thee be darkness, how great [is] that darkness!
column3: Mattheus 6:23 Maar as jou oog verkeerd is, sal jou hele liggaam donker wees. As dan die lig in jou donkerheid is, hoe groot is die donkerheid nie!

column2: Matthew 6:24 No man can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.
column3: Mattheus 6:24 Niemand kan twee here dien nie; want òf hy sal die een haat en die ander liefhê, òf hy sal die een aanhang en die ander verag. Julle kan nie God én Mammon dien nie!

column2: Matthew 6:25 Therefore I say unto you, Take no thought for your life, what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink; nor yet for your body, what ye shall put on. Is not the life more than meat, and the body than raiment?
column3: Mattheus 6:25 Daarom sê Ek vir julle: Moenie julle kwel oor jul lewe — wat julle sal eet en wat julle sal drink nie; of oor jul liggaam — wat julle sal aantrek nie. Is die lewe nie meer as die voedsel en die liggaam as die klere nie?

column2: Matthew 6:26 Behold the fowls of the air: for they sow not, neither do they reap, nor gather into barns; yet your heavenly Father feedeth them. Are ye not much better than they?
column3: Mattheus 6:26 Kyk na die voëls van die hemel; hulle saai nie en hulle maai nie en hulle bring nie bymekaar in skure nie, en tog voed julle hemelse Vader hulle. Is julle nie baie meer werd as hulle nie?

column2: Matthew 6:27 Which of you by taking thought can add one cubit unto his stature?
column3: Mattheus 6:27 Wie tog onder julle kan, deur hom te kwel, een el by sy lengte voeg?

column2: Matthew 6:28 And why take ye thought for raiment? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow; they toil not, neither do they spin:
column3: Mattheus 6:28 En wat kwel julle jul oor klere? Let op die lelies van die veld, hoe hulle groei; hulle arbei nie en hulle spin nie;

column2: Matthew 6:29 And yet I say unto you, That even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.
column3: Mattheus 6:29 en Ek sê vir julle dat selfs Salomo in al sy heerlikheid nie bekleed was soos een van hulle nie.

column2: Matthew 6:30 Wherefore, if God so clothe the grass of the field, which to day is, and to morrow is cast into the oven, [shall he] not much more [clothe] you, O ye of little faith?
column3: Mattheus 6:30 As God dan die gras van die veld, wat vandag daar is en môre in ’n oond gegooi word, so beklee, hoeveel te meer vir julle, kleingelowiges?

column2: Matthew 6:31 Therefore take no thought, saying, What shall we eat? or, What shall we drink? or, Wherewithal shall we be clothed?
column3: Mattheus 6:31 Daarom moet julle jul nie kwel en sê: Wat sal ons eet, of wat sal ons drink, of wat sal ons aantrek nie?

column2: Matthew 6:32 (For after all these things do the Gentiles seek:) for your heavenly Father knoweth that ye have need of all these things.
column3: Mattheus 6:32 Want na al hierdie dinge soek die heidene; want julle hemelse Vader weet dat julle al hierdie dinge nodig het.

column2: Matthew 6:33 But seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness; and all these things shall be added unto you.
column3: Mattheus 6:33 Maar soek eers die koninkryk van God en sy geregtigheid, en al hierdie dinge sal vir julle bygevoeg word.

column2: Matthew 6:34 Take therefore no thought for the morrow: for the morrow shall take thought for the things of itself. Sufficient unto the day [is] the evil thereof.
column3: Mattheus 6:34 Kwel julle dus nie oor môre nie, want môre sal hom oor sy eie dinge kwel. Elke dag het genoeg aan sy eie kwaad.

column2: Matthew 7:1 Judge not, that ye be not judged.
column3: Mattheus 7:1 MOENIE oordeel nie, sodat julle nie geoordeel word nie.

column2: Matthew 7:2 For with what judgment ye judge, ye shall be judged: and with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you again.
column3: Mattheus 7:2 Want met die oordeel waarmee julle oordeel, sal julle geoordeel word; en met die maat waarmee julle meet, sal weer vir julle gemeet word.

column2: Matthew 7:3 And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother's eye, but considerest not the beam that is in thine own eye?
column3: Mattheus 7:3 En waarom sien jy die splinter in die oog van jou broeder, maar die balk in jou eie oog merk jy nie op nie?

column2: Matthew 7:4 Or how wilt thou say to thy brother, Let me pull out the mote out of thine eye; and, behold, a beam [is] in thine own eye?
column3: Mattheus 7:4 Of hoe sal jy vir jou broeder sê: Laat my toe om die splinter uit jou oog uit te haal, en kyk, in jou eie oog is die balk!

column2: Matthew 7:5 Thou hypocrite, first cast out the beam out of thine own eye; and then shalt thou see clearly to cast out the mote out of thy brother's eye.
column3: Mattheus 7:5 Geveinsde, haal eers die balk uit jou oog uit, en dan sal jy goed sien om die splinter uit die oog van jou broeder uit te haal.

column2: Matthew 7:6 Give not that which is holy unto the dogs, neither cast ye your pearls before swine, lest they trample them under their feet, and turn again and rend you.
column3: Mattheus 7:6 Moenie wat heilig is, aan die honde gee nie; en gooi julle pêrels nie voor die varke nie, sodat hulle dit nie miskien met hulle pote vertrap en omdraai en julle verskeur nie.

column2: Matthew 7:7 Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you:
column3: Mattheus 7:7 Bid, en vir julle sal gegee word; soek, en julle sal vind; klop, en vir julle sal oopgemaak word.

column2: Matthew 7:8 For every one that asketh receiveth; and he that seeketh findeth; and to him that knocketh it shall be opened.
column3: Mattheus 7:8 Want elkeen wat bid, ontvang; en hy wat soek, vind; en vir hom wat klop, sal oopgemaak word.

column2: Matthew 7:9 Or what man is there of you, whom if his son ask bread, will he give him a stone?
column3: Mattheus 7:9 Of watter mens is daar onder julle wat, as sy seun hom brood vra, aan hom ’n klip sal gee;

column2: Matthew 7:10 Or if he ask a fish, will he give him a serpent?
column3: Mattheus 7:10 en as hy ’n vis vra, aan hom ’n slang sal gee?

column2: Matthew 7:11 If ye then, being evil, know how to give good gifts unto your children, how much more shall your Father which is in heaven give good things to them that ask him?
column3: Mattheus 7:11 As julle wat sleg is, dan weet om goeie gawes aan julle kinders te gee, hoeveel te meer sal julle Vader wat in die hemele is, goeie dinge gee aan die wat Hom bid!

column2: Matthew 7:12 Therefore all things whatsoever ye would that men should do to you, do ye even so to them: for this is the law and the prophets.
column3: Mattheus 7:12 Alles wat julle dan wil hê dat die mense aan julle moet doen, net so moet julle aan hulle ook doen; want dit is die wet en die profete.

column2: Matthew 7:13 Enter ye in at the strait gate: for wide [is] the gate, and broad [is] the way, that leadeth to destruction, and many there be which go in thereat:
column3: Mattheus 7:13 Gaan in deur die nou poort, want breed is die poort en wyd is die pad wat na die verderf lei, en daar is baie wat daardeur ingaan.

column2: Matthew 7:14 Because strait [is] the gate, and narrow [is] the way, which leadeth unto life, and few there be that find it.
column3: Mattheus 7:14 Want die poort is nou en die pad is smal wat na die lewe lei, en daar is min wat dit vind.

column2: Matthew 7:15 Beware of false prophets, which come to you in sheep's clothing, but inwardly they are ravening wolves.
column3: Mattheus 7:15 Maar pas op vir die valse profete wat in skaapsklere na julle kom en van binne roofsugtige wolwe is.

column2: Matthew 7:16 Ye shall know them by their fruits. Do men gather grapes of thorns, or figs of thistles?
column3: Mattheus 7:16 Aan hulle vrugte sal julle hulle ken. ’n Mens pluk tog nie druiwe van dorings of vye van distels nie!

column2: Matthew 7:17 Even so every good tree bringeth forth good fruit; but a corrupt tree bringeth forth evil fruit.
column3: Mattheus 7:17 So dra elke goeie boom goeie vrugte; maar ’n slegte boom dra slegte vrugte.

column2: Matthew 7:18 A good tree cannot bring forth evil fruit, neither [can] a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit.
column3: Mattheus 7:18 ’n Goeie boom kan geen slegte vrugte dra nie, en ’n slegte boom ook geen goeie vrugte nie.

column2: Matthew 7:19 Every tree that bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.
column3: Mattheus 7:19 Elke boom wat nie goeie vrugte dra nie, word uitgekap en in die vuur gegooi.

column2: Matthew 7:20 Wherefore by their fruits ye shall know them.
column3: Mattheus 7:20 So sal julle hulle dan aan hul vrugte ken.

column2: Matthew 7:21 Not every one that saith unto me, Lord, Lord, shall enter into the kingdom of heaven; but he that doeth the will of my Father which is in heaven.
column3: Mattheus 7:21 Nie elkeen wat vir My sê: Here, Here! sal ingaan in die koninkryk van die hemele nie, maar hy wat die wil doen van my Vader wat in die hemele is.

column2: Matthew 7:22 Many will say to me in that day, Lord, Lord, have we not prophesied in thy name? and in thy name have cast out devils? and in thy name done many wonderful works?
column3: Mattheus 7:22 Baie sal in daardie dag vir My sê: Here, Here, het ons nie in u Naam geprofeteer en in u Naam duiwels uitgedrywe en in u Naam baie kragte gedoen nie?

column2: Matthew 7:23 And then will I profess unto them, I never knew you: depart from me, ye that work iniquity.
column3: Mattheus 7:23 En dan sal Ek aan hulle sê: Ek het julle nooit geken nie. Gaan weg van My, julle wat die ongeregtigheid werk!

column2: Matthew 7:24 Therefore whosoever heareth these sayings of mine, and doeth them, I will liken him unto a wise man, which built his house upon a rock:
column3: Mattheus 7:24 Elkeen dan wat na hierdie woorde van My luister en dit doen, hom sal Ek vergelyk met ’n verstandige man wat sy huis op die rots gebou het.

column2: Matthew 7:25 And the rain descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat upon that house; and it fell not: for it was founded upon a rock.
column3: Mattheus 7:25 En die reën het geval en die waterstrome het gekom en die winde het gewaai en teen daardie huis aangestorm, en dit het nie geval nie, want sy fondament was op die rots.

column2: Matthew 7:26 And every one that heareth these sayings of mine, and doeth them not, shall be likened unto a foolish man, which built his house upon the sand:
column3: Mattheus 7:26 En elkeen wat na hierdie woorde van My luister en dit nie doen nie, sal vergelyk word met ’n dwase man wat sy huis op die sand gebou het.

column2: Matthew 7:27 And the rain descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat upon that house; and it fell: and great was the fall of it.
column3: Mattheus 7:27 En die reën het geval en die waterstrome het gekom en die winde het gewaai en teen daardie huis aangestorm en dit het geval, en sy val was groot.

column2: Matthew 7:28 And it came to pass, when Jesus had ended these sayings, the people were astonished at his doctrine:
column3: Mattheus 7:28 En toe Jesus hierdie woorde geëindig het, was die skare verslae oor sy leer;

column2: Matthew 7:29 For he taught them as [one] having authority, and not as the scribes.
column3: Mattheus 7:29 want Hy het hulle geleer soos een wat gesag het, en nie soos die skrifgeleerdes nie.

column2: Matthew 8:1 When he was come down from the mountain, great multitudes followed him.
column3: Mattheus 8:1 EN toe Hy van die berg afkom, het groot menigtes Hom gevolg;

column2: Matthew 8:2 And, behold, there came a leper and worshipped him, saying, Lord, if thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.
column3: Mattheus 8:2 en daar het ’n melaatse man gekom en voor Hom neergeval en gesê: Here, as U wil, kan U my reinig.

column2: Matthew 8:3 And Jesus put forth [his] hand, and touched him, saying, I will; be thou clean. And immediately his leprosy was cleansed.
column3: Mattheus 8:3 Daarop steek Jesus die hand uit en raak hom aan en sê: Ek wil; word gereinig! En dadelik is hy van sy melaatsheid gereinig.

column2: Matthew 8:4 And Jesus saith unto him, See thou tell no man; but go thy way, shew thyself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.
column3: Mattheus 8:4 En Jesus sê vir hom: Pas op dat jy dit aan niemand vertel nie, maar gaan vertoon jou aan die priester en offer die gawe wat Moses voorgeskrywe het, tot ’n getuienis vir hulle.

column2: Matthew 8:5 And when Jesus was entered into Capernaum, there came unto him a centurion, beseeching him,
column3: Mattheus 8:5 EN nadat Jesus in Kapérnaüm ingegaan het, kom daar ’n hoofman oor honderd na Hom toe en smeek Hom

column2: Matthew 8:6 And saying, Lord, my servant lieth at home sick of the palsy, grievously tormented.
column3: Mattheus 8:6 en sê: Here, my kneg lê tuis verlam en hy ly hewige pyne.

column2: Matthew 8:7 And Jesus saith unto him, I will come and heal him.
column3: Mattheus 8:7 Daarop sê Jesus vir hom: Ek sal kom en hom gesond maak.

column2: Matthew 8:8 The centurion answered and said, Lord, I am not worthy that thou shouldest come under my roof: but speak the word only, and my servant shall be healed.
column3: Mattheus 8:8 En die hoofman oor honderd antwoord en sê: Here, ek is nie werd dat U onder my dak inkom nie; maar spreek net ’n woord, en my kneg sal gesond word.

column2: Matthew 8:9 For I am a man under authority, having soldiers under me: and I say to this [man], Go, and he goeth; and to another, Come, and he cometh; and to my servant, Do this, and he doeth [it].
column3: Mattheus 8:9 Want ek is ook ’n man onder gesag, en ek het soldate onder my. En vir hierdie een sê ek: Gaan! en hy gaan; en vir ’n ander een: Kom! en hy kom; en vir my dienskneg: Doen dit! en hy doen dit.

column2: Matthew 8:10 When Jesus heard [it], he marvelled, and said to them that followed, Verily I say unto you, I have not found so great faith, no, not in Israel.
column3: Mattheus 8:10 Toe Jesus dit hoor, het Hy Hom verwonder en aan sy volgelinge gesê: Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, selfs in Israel het Ek so ’n groot geloof nie gevind nie.

column2: Matthew 8:11 And I say unto you, That many shall come from the east and west, and shall sit down with Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, in the kingdom of heaven.
column3: Mattheus 8:11 Maar Ek sê vir julle dat baie sal kom van ooste en weste en saam met Abraham en Isak en Jakob sal aansit in die koninkryk van die hemele.

column2: Matthew 8:12 But the children of the kingdom shall be cast out into outer darkness: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
column3: Mattheus 8:12 Maar die kinders van die koninkryk sal uitgedryf word in die buitenste duisternis. Daar sal geween wees en gekners van die tande.

column2: Matthew 8:13 And Jesus said unto the centurion, Go thy way; and as thou hast believed, [so] be it done unto thee. And his servant was healed in the selfsame hour.
column3: Mattheus 8:13 Toe sê Jesus vir die hoofman oor honderd: Gaan, en laat dit vir jou wees soos jy geglo het. En sy kneg het gesond geword in daardie uur.

column2: Matthew 8:14 And when Jesus was come into Peter's house, he saw his wife's mother laid, and sick of a fever.
column3: Mattheus 8:14 EN toe Jesus in die huis van Petrus kom, sien Hy sy skoonmoeder siek lê aan die koors.

column2: Matthew 8:15 And he touched her hand, and the fever left her: and she arose, and ministered unto them.
column3: Mattheus 8:15 En Hy het haar hand aangeraak, en die koors het haar verlaat, en sy het opgestaan en hulle bedien.

column2: Matthew 8:16 When the even was come, they brought unto him many that were possessed with devils: and he cast out the spirits with [his] word, and healed all that were sick:
column3: Mattheus 8:16 En toe dit aand geword het, het hulle baie na Hom gebring, wat van duiwels besete was; en Hy het die geeste met ’n woord uitgedrywe; en almal wat ongesteld was, het Hy gesond gemaak,

column2: Matthew 8:17 That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet, saying, Himself took our infirmities, and bare [our] sicknesses.
column3: Mattheus 8:17 sodat vervul sou word wat gespreek is deur Jesaja, die profeet, toe hy gesê het: Hy het ons krankhede op Hom geneem en ons siektes gedra.

column2: Matthew 8:18 Now when Jesus saw great multitudes about him, he gave commandment to depart unto the other side.
column3: Mattheus 8:18 EN toe Jesus groot menigtes rondom Hom sien, het Hy bevel gegee om te vertrek na die oorkant.

column2: Matthew 8:19 And a certain scribe came, and said unto him, Master, I will follow thee whithersoever thou goest.
column3: Mattheus 8:19 En ’n sekere skrifgeleerde het gekom en vir Hom gesê: Meester, ek sal U volg waar U ook al mag gaan.

column2: Matthew 8:20 And Jesus saith unto him, The foxes have holes, and the birds of the air [have] nests; but the Son of man hath not where to lay [his] head.
column3: Mattheus 8:20 En Jesus sê vir hom: Die jakkalse het gate en die voëls van die hemel neste, maar die Seun van die mens het geen plek waar Hy sy hoof kan neerlê nie.

column2: Matthew 8:21 And another of his disciples said unto him, Lord, suffer me first to go and bury my father.
column3: Mattheus 8:21 En ’n ander een van sy dissipels het vir Hom gesê: Here, laat my toe om eers te gaan en my vader te begrawe.

column2: Matthew 8:22 But Jesus said unto him, Follow me; and let the dead bury their dead.
column3: Mattheus 8:22 Maar Jesus sê vir hom: Volg My, en laat die dooies hul eie dooies begrawe.

column2: Matthew 8:23 And when he was entered into a ship, his disciples followed him.
column3: Mattheus 8:23 EN toe Hy in die skuit klim, het sy dissipels Hom gevolg.

column2: Matthew 8:24 And, behold, there arose a great tempest in the sea, insomuch that the ship was covered with the waves: but he was asleep.
column3: Mattheus 8:24 En daar het ’n groot storm op die see gekom, sodat die skuit toe was onder die golwe; maar Hy was aan die slaap.

column2: Matthew 8:25 And his disciples came to [him], and awoke him, saying, Lord, save us: we perish.
column3: Mattheus 8:25 Daarop kom sy dissipels en maak Hom wakker en sê: Here, red ons, ons vergaan!

column2: Matthew 8:26 And he saith unto them, Why are ye fearful, O ye of little faith? Then he arose, and rebuked the winds and the sea; and there was a great calm.
column3: Mattheus 8:26 En Hy sê vir hulle: Waarom is julle bang, kleingelowiges? Toe staan Hy op en bestraf die winde en die see, en daar het ’n groot stilte gekom.

column2: Matthew 8:27 But the men marvelled, saying, What manner of man is this, that even the winds and the sea obey him!
column3: Mattheus 8:27 En die manne het hulle verwonder en gesê: Wat vir ’n mens is Hy, dat selfs die winde en die see Hom gehoorsaam is?

column2: Matthew 8:28 And when he was come to the other side into the country of the Gergesenes, there met him two possessed with devils, coming out of the tombs, exceeding fierce, so that no man might pass by that way.
column3: Mattheus 8:28 EN toe Hy aan die oorkant kom, in die land van die Gergeséners, het twee duiwelbesetenes Hom ontmoet, wat uit die grafte uitgekom het en baie kwaai was, sodat niemand met daardie pad kon verbygaan nie.

column2: Matthew 8:29 And, behold, they cried out, saying, What have we to do with thee, Jesus, thou Son of God? art thou come hither to torment us before the time?
column3: Mattheus 8:29 En meteens skreeu hulle en sê: Wat het ons met U te doen, Jesus, Seun van God? Het U hier gekom om ons voor die tyd te pynig?

column2: Matthew 8:30 And there was a good way off from them an herd of many swine feeding.
column3: Mattheus 8:30 En ver van hulle af het ’n groot trop varke gewei.

column2: Matthew 8:31 So the devils besought him, saying, If thou cast us out, suffer us to go away into the herd of swine.
column3: Mattheus 8:31 En die duiwels het Hom gesmeek en gesê: As U ons uitdryf, laat ons toe om in die trop varke te vaar.

column2: Matthew 8:32 And he said unto them, Go. And when they were come out, they went into the herd of swine: and, behold, the whole herd of swine ran violently down a steep place into the sea, and perished in the waters.
column3: Mattheus 8:32 En Hy sê vir hulle: Gaan! Toe gaan hulle uit en vaar in die trop varke in; en daar storm die hele trop varke van die krans af die see in en kom in die water om.

column2: Matthew 8:33 And they that kept them fled, and went their ways into the city, and told every thing, and what was befallen to the possessed of the devils.
column3: Mattheus 8:33 En die wagters het gevlug; en toe hulle in die stad kom, het hulle alles vertel, ook wat met die besetenes gebeur het.

column2: Matthew 8:34 And, behold, the whole city came out to meet Jesus: and when they saw him, they besought [him] that he would depart out of their coasts.
column3: Mattheus 8:34 En kyk, die hele stad het uitgekom, Jesus tegemoet; en toe hulle Hom sien, smeek hulle dat Hy uit hulle gebied moet weggaan.

column2: Matthew 9:1 And he entered into a ship, and passed over, and came into his own city.
column3: Mattheus 9:1 EN nadat Hy in die skuit geklim het, het Hy oorgevaar en in sy eie stad gekom.

column2: Matthew 9:2 And, behold, they brought to him a man sick of the palsy, lying on a bed: and Jesus seeing their faith said unto the sick of the palsy; Son, be of good cheer; thy sins be forgiven thee.
column3: Mattheus 9:2 En hulle het ’n verlamde man wat op ’n bed lê, na Hom gebring. En toe Jesus hulle geloof sien, sê Hy aan die verlamde: Seun, hou goeie moed, jou sondes is jou vergewe.

column2: Matthew 9:3 And, behold, certain of the scribes said within themselves, This [man] blasphemeth.
column3: Mattheus 9:3 En sommige van die skrifgeleerdes het by hulleself gesê: Hierdie man praat godslasterlik.

column2: Matthew 9:4 And Jesus knowing their thoughts said, Wherefore think ye evil in your hearts?
column3: Mattheus 9:4 En toe Jesus merk wat hulle gedagtes was, sê Hy: Waarom bedink julle slegte dinge in julle harte?

column2: Matthew 9:5 For whether is easier, to say, [Thy] sins be forgiven thee; or to say, Arise, and walk?
column3: Mattheus 9:5 Want wat is makliker, om te sê: Die sondes is jou vergewe! of om te sê: Staan op en loop?

column2: Matthew 9:6 But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power on earth to forgive sins, (then saith he to the sick of the palsy,) Arise, take up thy bed, and go unto thine house.
column3: Mattheus 9:6 Maar dat julle kan weet dat die Seun van die mens mag het om op aarde sondes te vergewe — toe sê Hy vir die verlamde man: Staan op, neem jou bed op en gaan na jou huis toe.

column2: Matthew 9:7 And he arose, and departed to his house.
column3: Mattheus 9:7 En hy het opgestaan en huis toe gegaan.

column2: Matthew 9:8 But when the multitudes saw [it], they marvelled, and glorified God, which had given such power unto men.
column3: Mattheus 9:8 En toe die skare dit sien, was hulle verwonderd en het God verheerlik wat so ’n mag aan die mense gegee het.

column2: Matthew 9:9 And as Jesus passed forth from thence, he saw a man, named Matthew, sitting at the receipt of custom: and he saith unto him, Follow me. And he arose, and followed him.
column3: Mattheus 9:9 EN toe Jesus daarvandaan verder gaan, sien Hy ’n man met die naam van Matthéüs by die tolhuis sit; en Hy sê vir hom: Volg My. En hy het opgestaan en Hom gevolg.

column2: Matthew 9:10 And it came to pass, as Jesus sat at meat in the house, behold, many publicans and sinners came and sat down with him and his disciples.
column3: Mattheus 9:10 En terwyl Hy in die huis aan tafel was, het daar baie tollenaars en sondaars saam met Jesus en sy dissipels aan tafel gegaan.

column2: Matthew 9:11 And when the Pharisees saw [it], they said unto his disciples, Why eateth your Master with publicans and sinners?
column3: Mattheus 9:11 En toe die Fariseërs dit sien, sê hulle vir sy dissipels: Waarom eet julle Meester saam met tollenaars en sondaars?

column2: Matthew 9:12 But when Jesus heard [that], he said unto them, They that be whole need not a physician, but they that are sick.
column3: Mattheus 9:12 Maar toe Jesus dit hoor, sê Hy vir hulle: Die wat gesond is, het die geneesheer nie nodig nie, maar die wat ongesteld is.

column2: Matthew 9:13 But go ye and learn what [that] meaneth, I will have mercy, and not sacrifice: for I am not come to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.
column3: Mattheus 9:13 Maar gaan leer wat dit beteken: Ek wil barmhartigheid hê en nie offerande nie; want Ek het nie gekom om regverdiges te roep nie, maar sondaars tot bekering.

column2: Matthew 9:14 Then came to him the disciples of John, saying, Why do we and the Pharisees fast oft, but thy disciples fast not?
column3: Mattheus 9:14 DAARNA kom die dissipels van Johannes na Hom en sê: Waarom vas ons en die Fariseërs dikwels, maar u dissipels vas nie?

column2: Matthew 9:15 And Jesus said unto them, Can the children of the bridechamber mourn, as long as the bridegroom is with them? but the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken from them, and then shall they fast.
column3: Mattheus 9:15 En Jesus sê vir hulle: Kan die bruilofsgaste dan treur so lank as die bruidegom by hulle is? Maar daar sal dae kom wanneer die bruidegom van hulle weggeneem word, en dan sal hulle vas.

column2: Matthew 9:16 No man putteth a piece of new cloth unto an old garment, for that which is put in to fill it up taketh from the garment, and the rent is made worse.
column3: Mattheus 9:16 En niemand sit ’n nuwe stuk lap op ’n ou kleed nie; want die aangelapte stuk skeur van die kleed af en daar kom ’n erger skeur.

column2: Matthew 9:17 Neither do men put new wine into old bottles: else the bottles break, and the wine runneth out, and the bottles perish: but they put new wine into new bottles, and both are preserved.
column3: Mattheus 9:17 ’n Mens gooi ook nie nuwe wyn in ou leersakke nie; anders bars die sakke en die wyn loop uit en die sakke vergaan. Maar ’n mens gooi nuwe wyn in nuwe sakke en altwee bly behoue.

column2: Matthew 9:18 While he spake these things unto them, behold, there came a certain ruler, and worshipped him, saying, My daughter is even now dead: but come and lay thy hand upon her, and she shall live.
column3: Mattheus 9:18 TERWYL Hy vir hulle dit sê, kom daar ’n sekere owerste en val voor Hom neer en sê: My dogter het nou net gesterwe, maar kom en lê u hand op haar, en sy sal lewe.

column2: Matthew 9:19 And Jesus arose, and followed him, and [so did] his disciples.
column3: Mattheus 9:19 En Jesus het opgestaan en hom gevolg, en ook sy dissipels.

column2: Matthew 9:20 And, behold, a woman, which was diseased with an issue of blood twelve years, came behind [him], and touched the hem of his garment:
column3: Mattheus 9:20 En daar het ’n vrou wat twaalf jaar lank aan bloedvloeiing gely het, van agter gekom en die soom van sy kleed aangeraak.

column2: Matthew 9:21 For she said within herself, If I may but touch his garment, I shall be whole.
column3: Mattheus 9:21 Want sy het by haarself gesê: As ek maar net sy kleed kan aanraak, sal ek gesond word.

column2: Matthew 9:22 But Jesus turned him about, and when he saw her, he said, Daughter, be of good comfort; thy faith hath made thee whole. And the woman was made whole from that hour.
column3: Mattheus 9:22 En Jesus het omgedraai en haar gesien en gesê: Hou goeie moed, dogter, jou geloof het jou gered. En die vrou het gesond geword van daardie uur af.

column2: Matthew 9:23 And when Jesus came into the ruler's house, and saw the minstrels and the people making a noise,
column3: Mattheus 9:23 En toe Jesus in die huis van die owerste kom en die fluitspelers sien, en die skare wat te kere gaan,

column2: Matthew 9:24 He said unto them, Give place: for the maid is not dead, but sleepeth. And they laughed him to scorn.
column3: Mattheus 9:24 sê Hy vir hulle: Gaan weg, want die dogtertjie is nie dood nie, maar sy slaap. En hulle het Hom uitgelag.

column2: Matthew 9:25 But when the people were put forth, he went in, and took her by the hand, and the maid arose.
column3: Mattheus 9:25 En nadat die skare uitgedryf was, het Hy ingegaan en haar hand gegryp; en die dogtertjie het opgestaan.

column2: Matthew 9:26 And the fame hereof went abroad into all that land.
column3: Mattheus 9:26 En die gerug hiervan het deur daardie hele land versprei.

column2: Matthew 9:27 And when Jesus departed thence, two blind men followed him, crying, and saying, [Thou] Son of David, have mercy on us.
column3: Mattheus 9:27 EN toe Jesus daarvandaan verder gaan, het twee blindes Hom gevolg, terwyl hulle uitroep en sê: Wees ons barmhartig, Seun van Dawid!

column2: Matthew 9:28 And when he was come into the house, the blind men came to him: and Jesus saith unto them, Believe ye that I am able to do this? They said unto him, Yea, Lord.
column3: Mattheus 9:28 En nadat Hy in die huis gegaan het, kom die blindes na Hom toe. En Jesus sê vir hulle: Glo julle dat Ek dit kan doen? Hulle antwoord Hom: Ja, Here.

column2: Matthew 9:29 Then touched he their eyes, saying, According to your faith be it unto you.
column3: Mattheus 9:29 Toe raak Hy hulle oë aan en sê: Laat dit vir julle wees volgens julle geloof.

column2: Matthew 9:30 And their eyes were opened; and Jesus straitly charged them, saying, See [that] no man know [it].
column3: Mattheus 9:30 En hulle oë het oopgegaan. En Jesus het hulle skerp aangespreek en gesê: Pas op, laat niemand dit te wete kom nie.

column2: Matthew 9:31 But they, when they were departed, spread abroad his fame in all that country.
column3: Mattheus 9:31 Maar hulle het heengegaan en Hom in daardie hele land bekend gemaak.

column2: Matthew 9:32 As they went out, behold, they brought to him a dumb man possessed with a devil.
column3: Mattheus 9:32 En terwyl hulle weggaan, bring die mense ’n stom man wat van die duiwel besete was, na Hom toe.

column2: Matthew 9:33 And when the devil was cast out, the dumb spake: and the multitudes marvelled, saying, It was never so seen in Israel.
column3: Mattheus 9:33 En nadat die duiwel uitgedryf was, het die stomme gepraat. En die skare het hulle verwonder en gesê: So iets is nog nooit in Israel gesien nie!

column2: Matthew 9:34 But the Pharisees said, He casteth out devils through the prince of the devils.
column3: Mattheus 9:34 Maar die Fariseërs het gesê: Deur die owerste van die duiwels dryf Hy die duiwels uit.

column2: Matthew 9:35 And Jesus went about all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every sickness and every disease among the people.
column3: Mattheus 9:35 EN Jesus het by al die stede en dorpe rondgegaan en in hulle sinagoges geleer en die evangelie van die koninkryk verkondig en elke siekte en elke kwaal onder die volk genees.

column2: Matthew 9:36 But when he saw the multitudes, he was moved with compassion on them, because they fainted, and were scattered abroad, as sheep having no shepherd.
column3: Mattheus 9:36 En toe Hy die skare sien, het Hy innig jammer gevoel vir hulle, omdat hulle moeg en uitgeput was, soos skape wat geen herder het nie.

column2: Matthew 9:37 Then saith he unto his disciples, The harvest truly [is] plenteous, but the labourers [are] few;
column3: Mattheus 9:37 Toe sê Hy vir sy dissipels: Die oes is wel groot, maar die arbeiders min.

column2: Matthew 9:38 Pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest, that he will send forth labourers into his harvest.
column3: Mattheus 9:38 Bid dan die Here van die oes, dat Hy arbeiders in sy oes mag uitstuur.

column2: Matthew 10:1 And when he had called unto [him] his twelve disciples, he gave them power [against] unclean spirits, to cast them out, and to heal all manner of sickness and all manner of disease.
column3: Mattheus 10:1 EN Hy het sy twaalf dissipels na Hom geroep en aan hulle mag gegee oor onreine geeste, om hulle uit te dryf en om elke siekte en elke kwaal te genees.

column2: Matthew 10:2 Now the names of the twelve apostles are these; The first, Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother; James [the son] of Zebedee, and John his brother;
column3: Mattheus 10:2 En dit is die name van die twaalf apostels: die eerste Simon wat Petrus genoem word, en Andréas, sy broer; Jakobus, die seun van Sebedéüs, en Johannes, sy broer;

column2: Matthew 10:3 Philip, and Bartholomew; Thomas, and Matthew the publican; James [the son] of Alphaeus, and Lebbaeus, whose surname was Thaddaeus;
column3: Mattheus 10:3 Filippus en Bartholoméüs; Thomas en Matthéüs, die tollenaar; Jakobus, die seun van Alféüs, en Lebbéüs wat genoem word Thaddéüs;

column2: Matthew 10:4 Simon the Canaanite, and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him.
column3: Mattheus 10:4 Simon Kananítes en Judas Iskáriot, die een wat Hom verraai het.

column2: Matthew 10:5 These twelve Jesus sent forth, and commanded them, saying, Go not into the way of the Gentiles, and into [any] city of the Samaritans enter ye not:
column3: Mattheus 10:5 Jesus het hierdie twaalf uitgestuur en hulle bevel gegee en gesê: Moenie gaan op pad na die heidene nie, en moenie ingaan in ’n stad van die Samaritane nie;

column2: Matthew 10:6 But go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.
column3: Mattheus 10:6 maar gaan liewer na die verlore skape van die huis van Israel.

column2: Matthew 10:7 And as ye go, preach, saying, The kingdom of heaven is at hand.
column3: Mattheus 10:7 En gaan preek en sê: Die koninkryk van die hemele het naby gekom.

column2: Matthew 10:8 Heal the sick, cleanse the lepers, raise the dead, cast out devils: freely ye have received, freely give.
column3: Mattheus 10:8 Maak siekes gesond, reinig melaatses, wek dooies op, dryf duiwels uit. Julle het dit verniet ontvang, verniet moet julle dit gee.
