column2: Matthew 10:9 Provide neither gold, nor silver, nor brass in your purses,
column3: Mattheus 10:9 Moenie vir julle goud of silwer of koper in julle beurse aanskaf nie;

column2: Matthew 10:10 Nor scrip for [your] journey, neither two coats, neither shoes, nor yet staves: for the workman is worthy of his meat.
column3: Mattheus 10:10 geen reissak vir die pad of twee kledingstukke of skoene of ’n stok nie; want die arbeider is sy voedsel werd.

column2: Matthew 10:11 And into whatsoever city or town ye shall enter, enquire who in it is worthy; and there abide till ye go thence.
column3: Mattheus 10:11 En in watter stad of dorp julle ook al mag ingaan, ondersoek wie daarin waardig is, en bly dáár totdat julle vertrek.

column2: Matthew 10:12 And when ye come into an house, salute it.
column3: Mattheus 10:12 En as julle die huis ingaan, groet dit;

column2: Matthew 10:13 And if the house be worthy, let your peace come upon it: but if it be not worthy, let your peace return to you.
column3: Mattheus 10:13 en as die huis dit waardig is, laat julle vrede daarop kom, maar as dit nie waardig is nie, laat julle vrede na julle terugkeer.

column2: Matthew 10:14 And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear your words, when ye depart out of that house or city, shake off the dust of your feet.
column3: Mattheus 10:14 En as iemand julle nie ontvang nie en na julle woorde nie luister nie, gaan uit daardie huis of daardie stad uit en skud die stof van julle voete af.

column2: Matthew 10:15 Verily I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment, than for that city.
column3: Mattheus 10:15 Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, dit sal vir die land van Sodom en Gomorra verdraagliker wees in die oordeelsdag as vir daardie stad.

column2: Matthew 10:16 Behold, I send you forth as sheep in the midst of wolves: be ye therefore wise as serpents, and harmless as doves.
column3: Mattheus 10:16 Kyk, Ek stuur julle soos skape onder die wolwe in; wees dan versigtig soos die slange en opreg soos die duiwe.

column2: Matthew 10:17 But beware of men: for they will deliver you up to the councils, and they will scourge you in their synagogues;
column3: Mattheus 10:17 Maar pas op vir die mense; want hulle sal jul oorlewer aan regbanke, en in hulle sinagoges sal hulle julle gésel.

column2: Matthew 10:18 And ye shall be brought before governors and kings for my sake, for a testimony against them and the Gentiles.
column3: Mattheus 10:18 En ook voor goewerneurs en konings sal julle gebring word om My ontwil tot ’n getuienis vir hulle en vir die heidene.

column2: Matthew 10:19 But when they deliver you up, take no thought how or what ye shall speak: for it shall be given you in that same hour what ye shall speak.
column3: Mattheus 10:19 Maar wanneer hulle jul oorlewer, moenie julle kwel oor hoe of wat julle sal spreek nie, want dit sal julle in daardie uur gegee word wat julle moet spreek;

column2: Matthew 10:20 For it is not ye that speak, but the Spirit of your Father which speaketh in you.
column3: Mattheus 10:20 want dit is nie julle wat spreek nie, maar die Gees van julle Vader wat in julle spreek.

column2: Matthew 10:21 And the brother shall deliver up the brother to death, and the father the child: and the children shall rise up against [their] parents, and cause them to be put to death.
column3: Mattheus 10:21 Maar die een broer sal die ander tot die dood oorlewer en die vader sy kind, en die kinders sal teen hulle ouers opstaan en hulle doodmaak.

column2: Matthew 10:22 And ye shall be hated of all [men] for my name's sake: but he that endureth to the end shall be saved.
column3: Mattheus 10:22 En julle sal deur almal gehaat word ter wille van my Naam. Maar wie volhard tot die einde toe, hy sal gered word.

column2: Matthew 10:23 But when they persecute you in this city, flee ye into another: for verily I say unto you, Ye shall not have gone over the cities of Israel, till the Son of man be come.
column3: Mattheus 10:23 En wanneer hulle julle vervolg in die een stad, vlug na die ander toe. Want voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, julle sal met die stede van Israel sekerlik nie klaar kry voordat die Seun van die mens kom nie.

column2: Matthew 10:24 The disciple is not above [his] master, nor the servant above his lord.
column3: Mattheus 10:24 ’n Leerling is nie bo die meester nie en ’n dienskneg ook nie bo sy heer nie.

column2: Matthew 10:25 It is enough for the disciple that he be as his master, and the servant as his lord. If they have called the master of the house Beelzebub, how much more [shall they call] them of his household?
column3: Mattheus 10:25 Dit is vir die leerling genoeg dat hy soos sy meester word en die dienskneg soos sy heer. As hulle die heer van die huis Beëlsebul genoem het, hoeveel te meer sy huisgenote!

column2: Matthew 10:26 Fear them not therefore: for there is nothing covered, that shall not be revealed; and hid, that shall not be known.
column3: Mattheus 10:26 Vrees hulle dan nie; want daar is niks bedek wat nie ontdek sal word nie, en verborge wat nie bekend sal word nie.

column2: Matthew 10:27 What I tell you in darkness, [that] speak ye in light: and what ye hear in the ear, [that] preach ye upon the housetops.
column3: Mattheus 10:27 Wat Ek vir julle in die donker sê, vertel dit in die lig; en wat julle in die oor hoor, verkondig dit op die dakke.

column2: Matthew 10:28 And fear not them which kill the body, but are not able to kill the soul: but rather fear him which is able to destroy both soul and body in hell.
column3: Mattheus 10:28 En moenie vrees vir die wat die liggaam doodmaak, maar die siel nie kan doodmaak nie; maar vrees Hom liewer wat die siel sowel as die liggaam kan verderwe in die hel.

column2: Matthew 10:29 Are not two sparrows sold for a farthing? and one of them shall not fall on the ground without your Father.
column3: Mattheus 10:29 Word twee mossies nie vir ’n stuiwer verkoop nie? En nie een van hulle sal op die aarde val sonder julle Vader nie.

column2: Matthew 10:30 But the very hairs of your head are all numbered.
column3: Mattheus 10:30 En van julle is selfs die hare van die hoof almal getel.

column2: Matthew 10:31 Fear ye not therefore, ye are of more value than many sparrows.
column3: Mattheus 10:31 Wees dan nie bevrees nie: julle is meer werd as baie mossies.

column2: Matthew 10:32 Whosoever therefore shall confess me before men, him will I confess also before my Father which is in heaven.
column3: Mattheus 10:32 Elkeen dan wat My sal bely voor die mense, hom sal Ek ook bely voor my Vader wat in die hemele is.

column2: Matthew 10:33 But whosoever shall deny me before men, him will I also deny before my Father which is in heaven.
column3: Mattheus 10:33 Maar elkeen wat My verloën voor die mense, hom sal Ek ook verloën voor my Vader wat in die hemele is.

column2: Matthew 10:34 Think not that I am come to send peace on earth: I came not to send peace, but a sword.
column3: Mattheus 10:34 Moenie dink dat Ek gekom het om vrede op die aarde te bring nie. Ek het nie gekom om vrede te bring nie, maar die swaard.

column2: Matthew 10:35 For I am come to set a man at variance against his father, and the daughter against her mother, and the daughter in law against her mother in law.
column3: Mattheus 10:35 Want Ek het gekom om tweedrag te verwek tussen ’n man en sy vader, en tussen ’n dogter en haar moeder, en ’n skoondogter en haar skoonmoeder.

column2: Matthew 10:36 And a man's foes [shall be] they of his own household.
column3: Mattheus 10:36 En ’n mens se huisgenote sal sy vyande wees.

column2: Matthew 10:37 He that loveth father or mother more than me is not worthy of me: and he that loveth son or daughter more than me is not worthy of me.
column3: Mattheus 10:37 Wie vader of moeder bo My liefhet, is My nie waardig nie; en wie seun of dogter bo My liefhet, is My nie waardig nie.

column2: Matthew 10:38 And he that taketh not his cross, and followeth after me, is not worthy of me.
column3: Mattheus 10:38 En wie sy kruis nie neem en agter My volg nie, is My nie waardig nie.

column2: Matthew 10:39 He that findeth his life shall lose it: and he that loseth his life for my sake shall find it.
column3: Mattheus 10:39 Wie sy lewe vind, sal dit verloor; en wie sy lewe verloor om My ontwil, sal dit vind.

column2: Matthew 10:40 He that receiveth you receiveth me, and he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent me.
column3: Mattheus 10:40 Wie julle ontvang, ontvang My; en wie My ontvang, ontvang Hom wat My gestuur het.

column2: Matthew 10:41 He that receiveth a prophet in the name of a prophet shall receive a prophet's reward; and he that receiveth a righteous man in the name of a righteous man shall receive a righteous man's reward.
column3: Mattheus 10:41 Wie ’n profeet ontvang omdat hy ’n profeet is, sal die loon van ’n profeet ontvang; en wie ’n regverdige ontvang omdat hy ’n regverdige is, sal die loon van ’n regverdige ontvang.

column2: Matthew 10:42 And whosoever shall give to drink unto one of these little ones a cup of cold [water] only in the name of a disciple, verily I say unto you, he shall in no wise lose his reward.
column3: Mattheus 10:42 En elkeen wat een van hierdie kleintjies net ’n beker kou water laat drink, omdat hy ’n dissipel is, voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, hy sal sy loon sekerlik nie verloor nie.

column2: Matthew 11:1 And it came to pass, when Jesus had made an end of commanding his twelve disciples, he departed thence to teach and to preach in their cities.
column3: Mattheus 11:1 EN toe Jesus klaar was met bevele aan sy twaalf dissipels te gee, het Hy daarvandaan weggegaan om te leer en te preek in hulle stede.

column2: Matthew 11:2 Now when John had heard in the prison the works of Christ, he sent two of his disciples,
column3: Mattheus 11:2 En Johannes het in die gevangenis gehoor van die werke van Christus, en twee van sy dissipels gestuur

column2: Matthew 11:3 And said unto him, Art thou he that should come, or do we look for another?
column3: Mattheus 11:3 en vir Hom gesê: Is U die Een wat sou kom, of moet ons ’n ander een verwag?

column2: Matthew 11:4 Jesus answered and said unto them, Go and shew John again those things which ye do hear and see:
column3: Mattheus 11:4 En Jesus het geantwoord en vir hulle gesê: Gaan vertel aan Johannes wat julle hoor en sien:

column2: Matthew 11:5 The blind receive their sight, and the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, and the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, and the poor have the gospel preached to them.
column3: Mattheus 11:5 blindes sien weer en kreupeles loop, melaatses word gereinig en dowes hoor, dooies word opgewek en aan armes word die evangelie verkondig.

column2: Matthew 11:6 And blessed is [he], whosoever shall not be offended in me.
column3: Mattheus 11:6 En salig is elkeen wat aan My nie aanstoot neem nie.

column2: Matthew 11:7 And as they departed, Jesus began to say unto the multitudes concerning John, What went ye out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken with the wind?
column3: Mattheus 11:7 En toe hulle vertrek, begin Jesus vir die skare aangaande Johannes te sê: Wat het julle uitgegaan om in die woestyn te aanskou? ’n Riet wat deur die wind beweeg word?

column2: Matthew 11:8 But what went ye out for to see? A man clothed in soft raiment? behold, they that wear soft [clothing] are in kings' houses.
column3: Mattheus 11:8 Maar wat het julle uitgegaan om te sien? ’n Man met sagte klere aan? Kyk, die wat sagte klere dra, is in die huise van konings.

column2: Matthew 11:9 But what went ye out for to see? A prophet? yea, I say unto you, and more than a prophet.
column3: Mattheus 11:9 Maar wat het julle uitgegaan om te sien? ’n Profeet? Ja, Ek sê vir julle, ook baie meer as ’n profeet!

column2: Matthew 11:10 For this is [he], of whom it is written, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, which shall prepare thy way before thee.
column3: Mattheus 11:10 Want dit is hy van wie daar geskrywe is: Kyk, Ek stuur my boodskapper voor u aangesig, wat u weg voor U uit sal regmaak.

column2: Matthew 11:11 Verily I say unto you, Among them that are born of women there hath not risen a greater than John the Baptist: notwithstanding he that is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he.
column3: Mattheus 11:11 Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, onder die wat uit vroue gebore is, het daar nie een opgestaan wat groter is as Johannes die Doper nie; maar die kleinste in die koninkryk van die hemele is groter as hy.

column2: Matthew 11:12 And from the days of John the Baptist until now the kingdom of heaven suffereth violence, and the violent take it by force.
column3: Mattheus 11:12 Maar van die dae van Johannes die Doper af tot nou toe word die koninkryk van die hemele bestorm, en bestormers gryp dit met geweld.

column2: Matthew 11:13 For all the prophets and the law prophesied until John.
column3: Mattheus 11:13 Want al die profete en die wet het tot op Johannes geprofeteer.

column2: Matthew 11:14 And if ye will receive [it], this is Elias, which was for to come.
column3: Mattheus 11:14 En as julle dit wil aanneem: hy is Elía wat sou kom.

column2: Matthew 11:15 He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
column3: Mattheus 11:15 Wie ore het om te hoor, laat hom hoor.

column2: Matthew 11:16 But whereunto shall I liken this generation? It is like unto children sitting in the markets, and calling unto their fellows,
column3: Mattheus 11:16 Maar waarmee sal Ek hierdie geslag vergelyk? Dit is net soos kindertjies wat op die markte sit en na hulle maats roep

column2: Matthew 11:17 And saying, We have piped unto you, and ye have not danced; we have mourned unto you, and ye have not lamented.
column3: Mattheus 11:17 en sê: Ons het vir julle op die fluit gespeel, en julle het nie gedans nie; ons het vir julle ’n klaaglied gesing, en julle het nie getreur nie.

column2: Matthew 11:18 For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, He hath a devil.
column3: Mattheus 11:18 Want Johannes het gekom en nie geëet of gedrink nie, en hulle sê: Hy het ’n duiwel.

column2: Matthew 11:19 The Son of man came eating and drinking, and they say, Behold a man gluttonous, and a winebibber, a friend of publicans and sinners. But wisdom is justified of her children.
column3: Mattheus 11:19 Die Seun van die mens het gekom — Hy eet en drink, en hulle sê: Dáár is ’n mens wat ’n vraat en ’n wynsuiper is, ’n vriend van tollenaars en sondaars. Maar die wysheid is geregverdig deur sy kinders.

column2: Matthew 11:20 Then began he to upbraid the cities wherein most of his mighty works were done, because they repented not:
column3: Mattheus 11:20 TOE het Hy die stede waarin die meeste van sy kragtige dade plaasgevind het, begin verwyt, omdat hulle hul nie bekeer het nie:

column2: Matthew 11:21 Woe unto thee, Chorazin! woe unto thee, Bethsaida! for if the mighty works, which were done in you, had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.
column3: Mattheus 11:21 Wee jou, Górasin, wee jou, Betsáida! want as in Tirus en Sidon die kragtige dade plaasgevind het wat in julle plaasgevind het, sou hulle hul lankal in sak en as bekeer het.

column2: Matthew 11:22 But I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the day of judgment, than for you.
column3: Mattheus 11:22 Maar Ek sê vir julle, dit sal vir Tirus en Sidon verdraagliker wees in die oordeelsdag as vir julle.

column2: Matthew 11:23 And thou, Capernaum, which art exalted unto heaven, shalt be brought down to hell: for if the mighty works, which have been done in thee, had been done in Sodom, it would have remained until this day.
column3: Mattheus 11:23 En jy, Kapérnaüm, wat tot die hemel toe verhoog is, jy sal tot die doderyk toe neergestoot word; want as in Sodom die kragtige dade plaasgevind het wat in jou plaasgevind het, sou hy bly staan het tot vandag toe.

column2: Matthew 11:24 But I say unto you, That it shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom in the day of judgment, than for thee.
column3: Mattheus 11:24 Maar Ek sê vir julle dat dit vir die land van Sodom verdraagliker sal wees in die oordeelsdag as vir jou.

column2: Matthew 11:25 At that time Jesus answered and said, I thank thee, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because thou hast hid these things from the wise and prudent, and hast revealed them unto babes.
column3: Mattheus 11:25 IN daardie tyd het Jesus gespreek en gesê: Ek loof U, Vader, Here van die hemel en die aarde, dat U hierdie dinge verberg het vir wyse en verstandige mense en dit aan kindertjies geopenbaar het.

column2: Matthew 11:26 Even so, Father: for so it seemed good in thy sight.
column3: Mattheus 11:26 Ja, Vader, want so was dit u welbehae.

column2: Matthew 11:27 All things are delivered unto me of my Father: and no man knoweth the Son, but the Father; neither knoweth any man the Father, save the Son, and [he] to whomsoever the Son will reveal [him].
column3: Mattheus 11:27 Alles is aan My oorgegee deur my Vader, en niemand ken die Seun nie, behalwe die Vader; ook ken niemand die Vader nie, behalwe die Seun en elkeen aan wie die Seun dit wil openbaar.

column2: Matthew 11:28 Come unto me, all [ye] that labour and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.
column3: Mattheus 11:28 Kom na My toe, almal wat vermoeid en belas is, en Ek sal julle rus gee.

column2: Matthew 11:29 Take my yoke upon you, and learn of me; for I am meek and lowly in heart: and ye shall find rest unto your souls.
column3: Mattheus 11:29 Neem my juk op julle en leer van My, want Ek is sagmoedig en nederig van hart, en julle sal rus vind vir julle siele;

column2: Matthew 11:30 For my yoke [is] easy, and my burden is light.
column3: Mattheus 11:30 want my juk is sag en my las is lig.

column2: Matthew 12:1 At that time Jesus went on the sabbath day through the corn; and his disciples were an hungred, and began to pluck the ears of corn, and to eat.
column3: Mattheus 12:1 IN daardie tyd het Jesus op die sabbat deur die gesaaides geloop, en sy dissipels het honger geword en are begin pluk en eet.

column2: Matthew 12:2 But when the Pharisees saw [it], they said unto him, Behold, thy disciples do that which is not lawful to do upon the sabbath day.
column3: Mattheus 12:2 Maar toe die Fariseërs dit sien, sê hulle vir Hom: Kyk, u dissipels doen wat nie geoorloof is om op die sabbat te doen nie.

column2: Matthew 12:3 But he said unto them, Have ye not read what David did, when he was an hungred, and they that were with him;
column3: Mattheus 12:3 Maar Hy sê vir hulle: Het julle nie gelees wat Dawid gedoen het nie — toe hy en die wat saam met hom was, honger gehad het —

column2: Matthew 12:4 How he entered into the house of God, and did eat the shewbread, which was not lawful for him to eat, neither for them which were with him, but only for the priests?
column3: Mattheus 12:4 hoe hy in die huis van God gegaan en die toonbrode geëet het wat vir hom en die wat saam met hom was, nie geoorloof was om te eet nie, maar net vir die priesters alleen?

column2: Matthew 12:5 Or have ye not read in the law, how that on the sabbath days the priests in the temple profane the sabbath, and are blameless?
column3: Mattheus 12:5 Of het julle nie in die wet gelees dat die priesters op die sabbat in die tempel die sabbat ontheilig en onskuldig is nie?

column2: Matthew 12:6 But I say unto you, That in this place is [one] greater than the temple.
column3: Mattheus 12:6 En Ek sê vir julle: Een wat groter is as die tempel, is hier.

column2: Matthew 12:7 But if ye had known what [this] meaneth, I will have mercy, and not sacrifice, ye would not have condemned the guiltless.
column3: Mattheus 12:7 Maar as julle geweet het wat dit beteken: Ek wil barmhartigheid hê en nie offerande nie, sou julle die onskuldiges nie veroordeel het nie;

column2: Matthew 12:8 For the Son of man is Lord even of the sabbath day.
column3: Mattheus 12:8 want die Seun van die mens is Here óók van die sabbat.

column2: Matthew 12:9 And when he was departed thence, he went into their synagogue:
column3: Mattheus 12:9 EN Hy het daarvandaan weggegaan en in hulle sinagoge gekom.

column2: Matthew 12:10 And, behold, there was a man which had [his] hand withered. And they asked him, saying, Is it lawful to heal on the sabbath days? that they might accuse him.
column3: Mattheus 12:10 En daar was ’n man met ’n verdorde hand, en hulle het Hom gevra en gesê: Is dit geoorloof om op die sabbat gesond te maak? — sodat hulle Hom sou kan aanklae.

column2: Matthew 12:11 And he said unto them, What man shall there be among you, that shall have one sheep, and if it fall into a pit on the sabbath day, will he not lay hold on it, and lift [it] out?
column3: Mattheus 12:11 Maar Hy sê vir hulle: Watter mens sal daar onder julle wees wat een skaap het, en as dit op die sabbat in ’n sloot val, dit nie sal gryp en uithaal nie?

column2: Matthew 12:12 How much then is a man better than a sheep? Wherefore it is lawful to do well on the sabbath days.
column3: Mattheus 12:12 Hoeveel meer is ’n mens dan nie werd as ’n skaap nie! So is dit dan geoorloof om op die sabbat goed te doen.

column2: Matthew 12:13 Then saith he to the man, Stretch forth thine hand. And he stretched [it] forth; and it was restored whole, like as the other.
column3: Mattheus 12:13 Toe sê Hy vir die man: Steek jou hand uit! En hy het dit uitgesteek, en dit is herstel, gesond soos die ander een.

column2: Matthew 12:14 Then the Pharisees went out, and held a council against him, how they might destroy him.
column3: Mattheus 12:14 Daarop het die Fariseërs uitgegaan en saam raad gehou teen Hom, sodat hulle Hom sou kan ombring.

column2: Matthew 12:15 But when Jesus knew [it], he withdrew himself from thence: and great multitudes followed him, and he healed them all;
column3: Mattheus 12:15 Toe Jesus dit bemerk, het Hy daarvandaan weggegaan, en groot menigtes het Hom gevolg, en Hy het hulle almal gesond gemaak,

column2: Matthew 12:16 And charged them that they should not make him known:
column3: Mattheus 12:16 en hulle ’n streng bevel gegee dat hulle Hom nie bekend moes maak nie,

column2: Matthew 12:17 That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet, saying,
column3: Mattheus 12:17 sodat vervul sou word die woord wat gespreek is deur Jesaja, die profeet:

column2: Matthew 12:18 Behold my servant, whom I have chosen; my beloved, in whom my soul is well pleased: I will put my spirit upon him, and he shall shew judgment to the Gentiles.
column3: Mattheus 12:18 Kyk, my Kneg wat Ek uitverkies het, my Geliefde in wie my siel ’n welbehae het! Ek sal my Gees op Hom lê, en Hy sal aan die nasies die reg aankondig.

column2: Matthew 12:19 He shall not strive, nor cry; neither shall any man hear his voice in the streets.
column3: Mattheus 12:19 Hy sal nie twis of uitroep nie, en niemand sal sy stem op die strate hoor nie.

column2: Matthew 12:20 A bruised reed shall he not break, and smoking flax shall he not quench, till he send forth judgment unto victory.
column3: Mattheus 12:20 ’n Geknakte riet sal Hy nie verbreek nie, en ’n lamppit wat rook, sal Hy nie uitblus nie, totdat Hy die reg tot oorwinning uitbring.

column2: Matthew 12:21 And in his name shall the Gentiles trust.
column3: Mattheus 12:21 En op sy Naam sal die heidene hoop.

column2: Matthew 12:22 Then was brought unto him one possessed with a devil, blind, and dumb: and he healed him, insomuch that the blind and dumb both spake and saw.
column3: Mattheus 12:22 TOE het hulle ’n duiwelbesetene wat blind en stom was, na Hom gebring; en Hy het hom gesond gemaak, sodat die blinde en stomme kon praat en sien.

column2: Matthew 12:23 And all the people were amazed, and said, Is not this the son of David?
column3: Mattheus 12:23 En die hele menigte was verbaas en het gesê: Is Hy nie miskien die seun van Dawid nie?

column2: Matthew 12:24 But when the Pharisees heard [it], they said, This [fellow] doth not cast out devils, but by Beelzebub the prince of the devils.
column3: Mattheus 12:24 Maar toe die Fariseërs dit hoor, sê hulle: Hy dryf die duiwels nie anders uit as deur Beëlsebul, die owerste van die duiwels, nie.

column2: Matthew 12:25 And Jesus knew their thoughts, and said unto them, Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation; and every city or house divided against itself shall not stand:
column3: Mattheus 12:25 Maar Jesus het hulle gedagtes geken en vir hulle gesê: Elke koninkryk wat teen homself verdeeld is, word verwoes; en elke stad of huis wat teen homself verdeeld is, sal nie bly staan nie.

column2: Matthew 12:26 And if Satan cast out Satan, he is divided against himself; how shall then his kingdom stand?
column3: Mattheus 12:26 En as die Satan die Satan uitdryf, dan is hy teen homself verdeeld. Hoe sal sy koninkryk dan bly staan?

column2: Matthew 12:27 And if I by Beelzebub cast out devils, by whom do your children cast [them] out? therefore they shall be your judges.
column3: Mattheus 12:27 En as Ek deur Beëlsebul die duiwels uitdryf, deur wie dryf julle seuns hulle uit? Daarom sal hulle jul regters wees.

column2: Matthew 12:28 But if I cast out devils by the Spirit of God, then the kingdom of God is come unto you.
column3: Mattheus 12:28 Maar as Ek deur die Gees van God die duiwels uitdryf, dan het die koninkryk van God by julle gekom.

column2: Matthew 12:29 Or else how can one enter into a strong man's house, and spoil his goods, except he first bind the strong man? and then he will spoil his house.
column3: Mattheus 12:29 Of hoe kan iemand in die huis van ’n sterk man ingaan en sy goed roof, as hy nie eers die sterk man geboei het nie? En dan sal hy sy huis beroof.

column2: Matthew 12:30 He that is not with me is against me; and he that gathereth not with me scattereth abroad.
column3: Mattheus 12:30 Hy wat nie met My is nie, is teen My; en hy wat nie saam met My versamel nie, verstrooi.

column2: Matthew 12:31 Wherefore I say unto you, All manner of sin and blasphemy shall be forgiven unto men: but the blasphemy [against] the [Holy] Ghost shall not be forgiven unto men.
column3: Mattheus 12:31 Daarom sê Ek vir julle: Elke sonde en lastering sal die mense vergewe word, maar die lastering teen die Gees sal die mense nie vergewe word nie.

column2: Matthew 12:32 And whosoever speaketh a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven him: but whosoever speaketh against the Holy Ghost, it shall not be forgiven him, neither in this world, neither in the [world] to come.
column3: Mattheus 12:32 En elkeen wat ’n woord spreek teen die Seun van die mens, dit sal hom vergewe word; maar elkeen wat spreek teen die Heilige Gees, dit sal hom nie vergewe word nie, in hierdie eeu nie en ook in die toekomende nie.

column2: Matthew 12:33 Either make the tree good, and his fruit good; or else make the tree corrupt, and his fruit corrupt: for the tree is known by [his] fruit.
column3: Mattheus 12:33 JULLE moet òf die boom goed maak en sy vrugte goed, òf julle moet die boom sleg maak en sy vrugte sleg; want aan die vrugte word die boom geken.

column2: Matthew 12:34 O generation of vipers, how can ye, being evil, speak good things? for out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaketh.
column3: Mattheus 12:34 Addergeslag, hoe kan julle goeie dinge praat terwyl julle sleg is? Want uit die oorvloed van die hart praat die mond.

column2: Matthew 12:35 A good man out of the good treasure of the heart bringeth forth good things: and an evil man out of the evil treasure bringeth forth evil things.
column3: Mattheus 12:35 Die goeie mens bring uit die goeie skat van sy hart goeie dinge te voorskyn, en die slegte mens bring uit die slegte skat slegte dinge te voorskyn.

column2: Matthew 12:36 But I say unto you, That every idle word that men shall speak, they shall give account thereof in the day of judgment.
column3: Mattheus 12:36 Maar Ek sê vir julle dat van elke ydele woord wat die mense praat, daarvan moet hulle rekenskap gee in die oordeelsdag.

column2: Matthew 12:37 For by thy words thou shalt be justified, and by thy words thou shalt be condemned.
column3: Mattheus 12:37 Want uit jou woorde sal jy geregverdig word, en uit jou woorde sal jy veroordeel word.

column2: Matthew 12:38 Then certain of the scribes and of the Pharisees answered, saying, Master, we would see a sign from thee.
column3: Mattheus 12:38 TOE spreek sommige van die skrifgeleerdes en Fariseërs en sê: Meester, ons wil graag ’n teken van U sien.

column2: Matthew 12:39 But he answered and said unto them, An evil and adulterous generation seeketh after a sign; and there shall no sign be given to it, but the sign of the prophet Jonas:
column3: Mattheus 12:39 Maar Hy antwoord en sê vir hulle: ’n Slegte en owerspelige geslag soek na ’n teken, en geen teken sal aan hom gegee word nie, behalwe die teken van die profeet Jona.

column2: Matthew 12:40 For as Jonas was three days and three nights in the whale's belly; so shall the Son of man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth.
column3: Mattheus 12:40 Want soos Jona drie dae en drie nagte in die buik van die groot vis was, só sal die Seun van die mens drie dae en drie nagte in die hart van die aarde wees.

column2: Matthew 12:41 The men of Nineveh shall rise in judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: because they repented at the preaching of Jonas; and, behold, a greater than Jonas [is] here.
column3: Mattheus 12:41 Die manne van Ninevé sal in die oordeel opstaan saam met hierdie geslag en dit veroordeel; want hulle het hul op die prediking van Jona bekeer, en — meer as Jona is hier!

column2: Matthew 12:42 The queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: for she came from the uttermost parts of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and, behold, a greater than Solomon [is] here.
column3: Mattheus 12:42 Die koningin van die Suide sal in die oordeel opstaan saam met hierdie geslag en dit veroordeel; want sy het gekom van die eindes van die aarde af om die wysheid van Salomo te hoor, en — meer as Salomo is hier!

column2: Matthew 12:43 When the unclean spirit is gone out of a man, he walketh through dry places, seeking rest, and findeth none.
column3: Mattheus 12:43 En wanneer die onreine gees uit die mens uitgegaan het, gaan hy deur waterlose plekke en soek rus en vind dit nie.

column2: Matthew 12:44 Then he saith, I will return into my house from whence I came out; and when he is come, he findeth [it] empty, swept, and garnished.
column3: Mattheus 12:44 Dan sê hy: Ek sal teruggaan na my huis waar ek uitgegaan het. En hy kom en vind dit leeg, uitgeveeg en versier.

column2: Matthew 12:45 Then goeth he, and taketh with himself seven other spirits more wicked than himself, and they enter in and dwell there: and the last [state] of that man is worse than the first. Even so shall it be also unto this wicked generation.
column3: Mattheus 12:45 Dan gaan hy en neem sewe ander geeste slegter as hy self met hom saam, en hulle kom in en woon daar; en die laaste van daardie mens word erger as die eerste. Só sal dit ook wees met hierdie bose geslag.

column2: Matthew 12:46 While he yet talked to the people, behold, [his] mother and his brethren stood without, desiring to speak with him.
column3: Mattheus 12:46 EN terwyl Hy nog met die skare spreek, staan sy moeder en broers daarbuite en wou graag met Hom praat.

column2: Matthew 12:47 Then one said unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren stand without, desiring to speak with thee.
column3: Mattheus 12:47 Toe sê iemand vir Hom: Dáár staan u moeder en u broers buite en wil graag met U praat.

column2: Matthew 12:48 But he answered and said unto him that told him, Who is my mother? and who are my brethren?
column3: Mattheus 12:48 Maar Hy antwoord en sê vir die een wat Hom dit vertel het: Wie is my moeder? En wie is my broers?

column2: Matthew 12:49 And he stretched forth his hand toward his disciples, and said, Behold my mother and my brethren!
column3: Mattheus 12:49 En Hy steek sy hand oor sy dissipels uit en sê: Dáár is my moeder en my broers.

column2: Matthew 12:50 For whosoever shall do the will of my Father which is in heaven, the same is my brother, and sister, and mother.
column3: Mattheus 12:50 Want elkeen wat die wil doen van my Vader wat in die hemele is, dié is my broer en suster en moeder.

column2: Matthew 13:1 The same day went Jesus out of the house, and sat by the sea side.
column3: Mattheus 13:1 EN op daardie dag het Jesus uit die huis uitgegaan en by die see gaan sit.

column2: Matthew 13:2 And great multitudes were gathered together unto him, so that he went into a ship, and sat; and the whole multitude stood on the shore.
column3: Mattheus 13:2 En groot menigtes het by Hom vergader, sodat Hy in ’n skuit geklim en gaan sit het. En die hele skare het op die strand gestaan.

column2: Matthew 13:3 And he spake many things unto them in parables, saying, Behold, a sower went forth to sow;
column3: Mattheus 13:3 En Hy het baie dinge deur gelykenisse tot hulle gespreek en gesê: ’n Saaier het uitgegaan om te saai;

column2: Matthew 13:4 And when he sowed, some [seeds] fell by the way side, and the fowls came and devoured them up:
column3: Mattheus 13:4 en terwyl hy saai, val ’n deel langs die pad, en die voëls het gekom en dit opgeëet.

column2: Matthew 13:5 Some fell upon stony places, where they had not much earth: and forthwith they sprung up, because they had no deepness of earth:
column3: Mattheus 13:5 En ’n ander deel het op rotsagtige plekke geval waar daar nie baie grond was nie; en dadelik het dit opgekom, omdat daar geen diepte van grond was nie;

column2: Matthew 13:6 And when the sun was up, they were scorched; and because they had no root, they withered away.
column3: Mattheus 13:6 maar toe die son opgaan, is dit verskroei, en omdat dit geen wortel gehad het nie, het dit verdroog.

column2: Matthew 13:7 And some fell among thorns; and the thorns sprung up, and choked them:
column3: Mattheus 13:7 En ’n ander deel het in die dorings geval, en die dorings het opgekom en dit verstik.

column2: Matthew 13:8 But other fell into good ground, and brought forth fruit, some an hundredfold, some sixtyfold, some thirtyfold.
column3: Mattheus 13:8 En ’n ander deel het in die goeie grond geval en vrug opgelewer: die een honderd-, die ander sestig-, die ander dertigvoudig.

column2: Matthew 13:9 Who hath ears to hear, let him hear.
column3: Mattheus 13:9 Wie ore het om te hoor, laat hom hoor!

column2: Matthew 13:10 And the disciples came, and said unto him, Why speakest thou unto them in parables?
column3: Mattheus 13:10 En die dissipels het gekom en vir Hom gesê: Waarom spreek U tot hulle deur gelykenisse?

column2: Matthew 13:11 He answered and said unto them, Because it is given unto you to know the mysteries of the kingdom of heaven, but to them it is not given.
column3: Mattheus 13:11 Toe antwoord Hy en sê vir hulle: Omdat dit aan julle gegee is om die verborgenhede van die koninkryk van die hemele te ken, maar aan hulle is dit nie gegee nie.

column2: Matthew 13:12 For whosoever hath, to him shall be given, and he shall have more abundance: but whosoever hath not, from him shall be taken away even that he hath.
column3: Mattheus 13:12 Want hy wat het, aan hom sal gegee word, en hy sal oorvloed hê; maar hy wat nie het nie, van hom sal weggeneem word ook wat hy het.

column2: Matthew 13:13 Therefore speak I to them in parables: because they seeing see not; and hearing they hear not, neither do they understand.
column3: Mattheus 13:13 Daarom spreek Ek tot hulle deur gelykenisse, omdat hulle, terwyl hulle sien, nie sien nie, en terwyl hulle hoor, nie hoor of verstaan nie.

column2: Matthew 13:14 And in them is fulfilled the prophecy of Esaias, which saith, By hearing ye shall hear, and shall not understand; and seeing ye shall see, and shall not perceive:
column3: Mattheus 13:14 En aan hulle word die profesie van Jesaja vervul wat sê: Met die gehoor sal julle hoor en glad nie verstaan nie, en julle sal kyk en kyk, en glad nie sien nie.

column2: Matthew 13:15 For this people's heart is waxed gross, and [their] ears are dull of hearing, and their eyes they have closed; lest at any time they should see with [their] eyes, and hear with [their] ears, and should understand with [their] heart, and should be converted, and I should heal them.
column3: Mattheus 13:15 Want die hart van hierdie volk het stomp geword, en met die ore het hulle beswaarlik gehoor; en hul oë het hulle toegesluit, sodat hulle nie miskien met die oë sou sien en met die ore hoor en met die hart verstaan en hulle bekeer en Ek hulle genees nie.

column2: Matthew 13:16 But blessed [are] your eyes, for they see: and your ears, for they hear.
column3: Mattheus 13:16 Maar julle oë is gelukkig, omdat hulle sien; en julle ore, omdat hulle hoor.

column2: Matthew 13:17 For verily I say unto you, That many prophets and righteous [men] have desired to see [those things] which ye see, and have not seen [them]; and to hear [those things] which ye hear, and have not heard [them].
column3: Mattheus 13:17 Want, voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, baie profete en regverdiges het begeer om te sien wat julle sien, en het dit nie gesien nie, en om te hoor wat julle hoor, en het dit nie gehoor nie.

column2: Matthew 13:18 Hear ye therefore the parable of the sower.
column3: Mattheus 13:18 Luister julle dan na die gelykenis van die saaier.

column2: Matthew 13:19 When any one heareth the word of the kingdom, and understandeth [it] not, then cometh the wicked [one], and catcheth away that which was sown in his heart. This is he which received seed by the way side.
column3: Mattheus 13:19 As iemand die woord van die koninkryk hoor en nie verstaan nie, kom die Bose en roof wat in sy hart gesaai is — dit is hy by wie langs die pad gesaai is.

column2: Matthew 13:20 But he that received the seed into stony places, the same is he that heareth the word, and anon with joy receiveth it;
column3: Mattheus 13:20 En by wie op rotsagtige plekke gesaai is — dit is hy wat die woord hoor en dit dadelik met blydskap aanneem;

column2: Matthew 13:21 Yet hath he not root in himself, but dureth for a while: for when tribulation or persecution ariseth because of the word, by and by he is offended.
column3: Mattheus 13:21 maar hy het geen wortel in homself nie, hy is net vir ’n tyd, en as daar verdrukking en vervolging kom ter wille van die woord, struikel hy dadelik.

column2: Matthew 13:22 He also that received seed among the thorns is he that heareth the word; and the care of this world, and the deceitfulness of riches, choke the word, and he becometh unfruitful.
column3: Mattheus 13:22 En by wie in die dorings gesaai is — dit is hy wat die woord hoor, maar die sorg van hierdie wêreld en die verleiding van die rykdom verstik die woord, en hy word onvrugbaar.

column2: Matthew 13:23 But he that received seed into the good ground is he that heareth the word, and understandeth [it]; which also beareth fruit, and bringeth forth, some an hundredfold, some sixty, some thirty.
column3: Mattheus 13:23 En by wie op die goeie grond gesaai is — dit is hy wat die woord hoor en verstaan, wat dan ook vrug dra en oplewer: die een honderd-, die ander sestig-, die ander dertigvoudig.

column2: Matthew 13:24 Another parable put he forth unto them, saying, The kingdom of heaven is likened unto a man which sowed good seed in his field:
column3: Mattheus 13:24 ’n ANDER gelykenis het Hy hulle voorgehou en gesê: Die koninkryk van die hemele is soos ’n man wat goeie saad in sy land gesaai het;

column2: Matthew 13:25 But while men slept, his enemy came and sowed tares among the wheat, and went his way.
column3: Mattheus 13:25 maar terwyl die mense slaap, het sy vyand gekom en onkruid onder die koring gesaai en weggegaan.

column2: Matthew 13:26 But when the blade was sprung up, and brought forth fruit, then appeared the tares also.
column3: Mattheus 13:26 En toe die spruitjies opgeskiet en vrug gevorm het, toe verskyn die onkruid ook.

column2: Matthew 13:27 So the servants of the householder came and said unto him, Sir, didst not thou sow good seed in thy field? from whence then hath it tares?
column3: Mattheus 13:27 En die diensknegte van die huisheer het gekom en vir hom gesê: Meneer, het u dan nie goeie saad in u land gesaai nie? Waar kry dit dan die onkruid vandaan?

column2: Matthew 13:28 He said unto them, An enemy hath done this. The servants said unto him, Wilt thou then that we go and gather them up?
column3: Mattheus 13:28 En hy antwoord hulle: ’n Vyandige mens het dit gedoen. Toe sê die diensknegte vir hom: Wil u dan hê dat ons dit moet gaan bymekaarmaak?

column2: Matthew 13:29 But he said, Nay; lest while ye gather up the tares, ye root up also the wheat with them.
column3: Mattheus 13:29 Maar hy antwoord: Nee, dat julle nie miskien, as julle die onkruid bymekaarmaak, die koring daarmee saam uittrek nie.

column2: Matthew 13:30 Let both grow together until the harvest: and in the time of harvest I will say to the reapers, Gather ye together first the tares, and bind them in bundles to burn them: but gather the wheat into my barn.
column3: Mattheus 13:30 Laat altwee saam groei tot die oes toe, en in die oestyd sal ek vir die maaiers sê: Maak eers die onkruid bymekaar en bind dit in bondels om dit te verbrand, maar bring die koring bymekaar in my skuur.

column2: Matthew 13:31 Another parable put he forth unto them, saying, The kingdom of heaven is like to a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and sowed in his field:
column3: Mattheus 13:31 ’n ANDER gelykenis het Hy hulle voorgehou en gesê: Die koninkryk van die hemele is soos ’n mosterdsaad wat ’n man neem en in sy land saai;

column2: Matthew 13:32 Which indeed is the least of all seeds: but when it is grown, it is the greatest among herbs, and becometh a tree, so that the birds of the air come and lodge in the branches thereof.
column3: Mattheus 13:32 wat wel die kleinste is van al die soorte saad, maar as dit gegroei het, groter is as die groentesoorte en ’n boom word, sodat die voëls van die hemel kom en nes maak in sy takke.

column2: Matthew 13:33 Another parable spake he unto them; The kingdom of heaven is like unto leaven, which a woman took, and hid in three measures of meal, till the whole was leavened.
column3: Mattheus 13:33 ’n Ander gelykenis het Hy hulle vertel: Die koninkryk van die hemele is soos suurdeeg wat ’n vrou neem en in drie mate meel inwerk totdat dit heeltemal ingesuur is.

column2: Matthew 13:34 All these things spake Jesus unto the multitude in parables; and without a parable spake he not unto them:
column3: Mattheus 13:34 Al hierdie dinge het Jesus deur gelykenisse vir die skare gesê, en sonder gelykenis het Hy vir hulle niks gesê nie;

column2: Matthew 13:35 That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, saying, I will open my mouth in parables; I will utter things which have been kept secret from the foundation of the world.
column3: Mattheus 13:35 sodat vervul sou word die woord wat gespreek is deur die profeet: Ek sal my mond open deur gelykenisse; Ek sal uitspreek dinge wat verborge was van die grondlegging van die wêreld af.

column2: Matthew 13:36 Then Jesus sent the multitude away, and went into the house: and his disciples came unto him, saying, Declare unto us the parable of the tares of the field.
column3: Mattheus 13:36 NADAT Hy die skare weggestuur het, het Jesus huis toe gegaan; en sy dissipels het na Hom gekom en gesê: Verklaar vir ons die gelykenis van die onkruid in die saailand.

column2: Matthew 13:37 He answered and said unto them, He that soweth the good seed is the Son of man;
column3: Mattheus 13:37 En Hy het geantwoord en vir hulle gesê: Hy wat die goeie saad saai, is die Seun van die mens,

column2: Matthew 13:38 The field is the world; the good seed are the children of the kingdom; but the tares are the children of the wicked [one];
column3: Mattheus 13:38 en die saailand is die wêreld. Die goeie saad — dit is die kinders van die koninkryk, en die onkruid is die kinders van die Bose,

column2: Matthew 13:39 The enemy that sowed them is the devil; the harvest is the end of the world; and the reapers are the angels.
column3: Mattheus 13:39 en die vyand wat dit gesaai het, is die duiwel. Die oes is die voleinding van die wêreld, en die maaiers is die engele.

column2: Matthew 13:40 As therefore the tares are gathered and burned in the fire; so shall it be in the end of this world.
column3: Mattheus 13:40 Net soos die onkruid dan bymekaargemaak en met vuur verbrand word, so sal dit wees in die voleinding van hierdie wêreld:

column2: Matthew 13:41 The Son of man shall send forth his angels, and they shall gather out of his kingdom all things that offend, and them which do iniquity;
column3: Mattheus 13:41 die Seun van die mens sal sy engele uitstuur, en hulle sal uit sy koninkryk bymekaarmaak al die struikelblokke en die wat die ongeregtigheid doen,

column2: Matthew 13:42 And shall cast them into a furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth.
column3: Mattheus 13:42 en sal hulle in die vuuroond gooi. Daar sal geween wees en gekners van die tande.

column2: Matthew 13:43 Then shall the righteous shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father. Who hath ears to hear, let him hear.
column3: Mattheus 13:43 Dan sal die regverdiges skyn soos die son in die koninkryk van hulle Vader. Wie ore het om te hoor, laat hom hoor.

column2: Matthew 13:44 Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto treasure hid in a field; the which when a man hath found, he hideth, and for joy thereof goeth and selleth all that he hath, and buyeth that field.
column3: Mattheus 13:44 VERDER is die koninkryk van die hemele soos ’n skat wat verborge is in die saailand, wat ’n man kry en wegsteek; en uit blydskap daaroor gaan hy en verkoop alles wat hy het, en koop daardie saailand.

column2: Matthew 13:45 Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a merchant man, seeking goodly pearls:
column3: Mattheus 13:45 Verder is die koninkryk van die hemele soos ’n koopman wat mooi pêrels soek;

column2: Matthew 13:46 Who, when he had found one pearl of great price, went and sold all that he had, and bought it.
column3: Mattheus 13:46 en toe hy een baie kosbare pêrel kry, gaan hy weg en verkoop alles wat hy het, en koop dit.

column2: Matthew 13:47 Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a net, that was cast into the sea, and gathered of every kind:
column3: Mattheus 13:47 Verder is die koninkryk van die hemele soos ’n net wat in die see gegooi word en van elke soort bymekaarbring;

column2: Matthew 13:48 Which, when it was full, they drew to shore, and sat down, and gathered the good into vessels, but cast the bad away.
column3: Mattheus 13:48 en as dit vol geword het, trek hulle dit op die strand uit en gaan sit en maak die goeies in bakke bymekaar, maar gooi die slegtes weg.

column2: Matthew 13:49 So shall it be at the end of the world: the angels shall come forth, and sever the wicked from among the just,
column3: Mattheus 13:49 So sal dit wees in die voleinding van die wêreld: die engele sal uitgaan en die slegte mense onder die regverdiges uit afskei

column2: Matthew 13:50 And shall cast them into the furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth.
column3: Mattheus 13:50 en hulle in die vuuroond gooi. Daar sal geween wees en gekners van die tande.

column2: Matthew 13:51 Jesus saith unto them, Have ye understood all these things? They say unto him, Yea, Lord.
column3: Mattheus 13:51 Jesus sê vir hulle: Het julle ál hierdie dinge verstaan? Hulle antwoord Hom: Ja, Here!

column2: Matthew 13:52 Then said he unto them, Therefore every scribe [which is] instructed unto the kingdom of heaven is like unto a man [that is] an householder, which bringeth forth out of his treasure [things] new and old.
column3: Mattheus 13:52 Toe sê Hy vir hulle: Daarom is elke skrifgeleerde wat ’n leerling geword het in die koninkryk van die hemele, soos ’n huisheer wat uit sy skat nuwe en ou dinge te voorskyn bring.

column2: Matthew 13:53 And it came to pass, [that] when Jesus had finished these parables, he departed thence.
column3: Mattheus 13:53 EN toe Jesus hierdie gelykenisse geëindig het, het Hy daarvandaan weggegaan.

column2: Matthew 13:54 And when he was come into his own country, he taught them in their synagogue, insomuch that they were astonished, and said, Whence hath this [man] this wisdom, and [these] mighty works?
column3: Mattheus 13:54 En Hy het in sy vaderstad gekom en hulle geleer in hul sinagoge, sodat hulle verslae was en gesê het: Waar kry Hy hierdie wysheid en kragte vandaan?

column2: Matthew 13:55 Is not this the carpenter's son? is not his mother called Mary? and his brethren, James, and Joses, and Simon, and Judas?
column3: Mattheus 13:55 Is Hy nie die seun van die timmerman nie? Is die naam van sy moeder nie Maria en dié van sy broers Jakobus en Joses en Simon en Judas nie?

column2: Matthew 13:56 And his sisters, are they not all with us? Whence then hath this [man] all these things?
column3: Mattheus 13:56 En sy susters, is hulle nie almal by ons nie? Waar kry Hy dan al hierdie dinge vandaan?

column2: Matthew 13:57 And they were offended in him. But Jesus said unto them, A prophet is not without honour, save in his own country, and in his own house.
column3: Mattheus 13:57 En hulle het aanstoot aan Hom geneem. Maar Jesus sê vir hulle: ’n Profeet is nie ongeëerd nie, behalwe in sy vaderland en in sy huis.

column2: Matthew 13:58 And he did not many mighty works there because of their unbelief.
column3: Mattheus 13:58 En Hy het daar vanweë hulle ongeloof nie baie kragtige dade gedoen nie.

column2: Matthew 14:1 At that time Herod the tetrarch heard of the fame of Jesus,
column3: Mattheus 14:1 EN in daardie tyd het Herodes, die viervors, die gerug van Jesus gehoor

column2: Matthew 14:2 And said unto his servants, This is John the Baptist; he is risen from the dead; and therefore mighty works do shew forth themselves in him.
column3: Mattheus 14:2 en aan sy knegte gesê: Hierdie man is Johannes die Doper. Hy het uit die dode opgestaan, en daarom werk dié kragte in hom.

column2: Matthew 14:3 For Herod had laid hold on John, and bound him, and put [him] in prison for Herodias' sake, his brother Philip's wife.
column3: Mattheus 14:3 Want Herodes het Johannes gevang, hom geboei en in die gevangenis gesit vanweë Heródias, die vrou van Filippus, sy broer.

column2: Matthew 14:4 For John said unto him, It is not lawful for thee to have her.
column3: Mattheus 14:4 Want Johannes het vir hom gesê: Dit is u nie geoorloof om haar te hê nie.

column2: Matthew 14:5 And when he would have put him to death, he feared the multitude, because they counted him as a prophet.
column3: Mattheus 14:5 En hoewel hy hom wou doodmaak, het hy die skare gevrees, omdat hulle hom vir ’n profeet gehou het.

column2: Matthew 14:6 But when Herod's birthday was kept, the daughter of Herodias danced before them, and pleased Herod.
column3: Mattheus 14:6 Maar by die viering van die verjaarsdag van Herodes het die dogter van Heródias voor hulle gedans en Herodes behaag.

column2: Matthew 14:7 Whereupon he promised with an oath to give her whatsoever she would ask.
column3: Mattheus 14:7 Daarom het hy met ’n eed beloof om haar enigiets te gee wat sy sou vra.

column2: Matthew 14:8 And she, being before instructed of her mother, said, Give me here John Baptist's head in a charger.
column3: Mattheus 14:8 Toe sê sy, nadat sy deur haar moeder aangehits was: Gee my hier op ’n skottel die hoof van Johannes die Doper.

column2: Matthew 14:9 And the king was sorry: nevertheless for the oath's sake, and them which sat with him at meat, he commanded [it] to be given [her].
column3: Mattheus 14:9 En die koning het treurig geword, maar ter wille van die eed en die feesgenote het hy beveel dat dit gegee moes word.

column2: Matthew 14:10 And he sent, and beheaded John in the prison.
column3: Mattheus 14:10 En hy het gestuur en Johannes in die gevangenis onthoof.

column2: Matthew 14:11 And his head was brought in a charger, and given to the damsel: and she brought [it] to her mother.
column3: Mattheus 14:11 Sy hoof is toe op ’n skottel gebring en aan die meisie gegee, en sy het dit na haar moeder gebring.

column2: Matthew 14:12 And his disciples came, and took up the body, and buried it, and went and told Jesus.
column3: Mattheus 14:12 En sy dissipels het gekom en sy liggaam weggeneem en dit begrawe; en hulle het gegaan en dit aan Jesus vertel.

column2: Matthew 14:13 When Jesus heard [of it], he departed thence by ship into a desert place apart: and when the people had heard [thereof], they followed him on foot out of the cities.
column3: Mattheus 14:13 En toe Jesus dit hoor, het Hy daarvandaan in ’n skuit vertrek na ’n verlate plek alleen. En die skare het dit gehoor en Hom van die stede af te voet gevolg.

column2: Matthew 14:14 And Jesus went forth, and saw a great multitude, and was moved with compassion toward them, and he healed their sick.
column3: Mattheus 14:14 EN toe Jesus uitgaan, het Hy ’n groot skare gesien en innig jammer vir hulle gevoel, en Hy het hulle siekes gesond gemaak.

column2: Matthew 14:15 And when it was evening, his disciples came to him, saying, This is a desert place, and the time is now past; send the multitude away, that they may go into the villages, and buy themselves victuals.
column3: Mattheus 14:15 En toe dit aand geword het, kom sy dissipels na Hom en sê: Die plek is verlate, en dit is al oor die tyd; stuur die skare weg, sodat hulle na die dorpe kan gaan en vir hulle voedsel koop.

column2: Matthew 14:16 But Jesus said unto them, They need not depart; give ye them to eat.
column3: Mattheus 14:16 Maar Jesus sê vir hulle: Hulle hoef nie weg te gaan nie; gee julle vir hulle iets om te eet.

column2: Matthew 14:17 And they say unto him, We have here but five loaves, and two fishes.
column3: Mattheus 14:17 Maar hulle antwoord Hom: Ons het hier net vyf brode en twee visse.

column2: Matthew 14:18 He said, Bring them hither to me.
column3: Mattheus 14:18 En Hy sê: Bring dit hier vir My.

column2: Matthew 14:19 And he commanded the multitude to sit down on the grass, and took the five loaves, and the two fishes, and looking up to heaven, he blessed, and brake, and gave the loaves to [his] disciples, and the disciples to the multitude.
column3: Mattheus 14:19 Toe gee Hy die skare bevel om op die gras te gaan sit; en Hy neem die vyf brode en die twee visse, kyk op na die hemel en dank; en nadat Hy die brode gebreek het, gee Hy dit aan die dissipels en die dissipels aan die skare.

column2: Matthew 14:20 And they did all eat, and were filled: and they took up of the fragments that remained twelve baskets full.
column3: Mattheus 14:20 En almal het geëet en versadig geword, en hulle het die oorskot van die brokstukke opgetel, twaalf mandjies vol.

column2: Matthew 14:21 And they that had eaten were about five thousand men, beside women and children.
column3: Mattheus 14:21 En dit was omtrent vyfduisend manne wat geëet het, buiten die vroue en kinders.

column2: Matthew 14:22 And straightway Jesus constrained his disciples to get into a ship, and to go before him unto the other side, while he sent the multitudes away.
column3: Mattheus 14:22 EN Jesus het dadelik sy dissipels gedwing om in die skuit te gaan en voor Hom uit te vaar na die oorkant, terwyl Hy die skare wegstuur.

column2: Matthew 14:23 And when he had sent the multitudes away, he went up into a mountain apart to pray: and when the evening was come, he was there alone.
column3: Mattheus 14:23 En nadat Hy die skare weggestuur het, klim Hy op die berg om in die eensaamheid te bid. En toe dit aand geword het, was Hy daar alleen.

column2: Matthew 14:24 But the ship was now in the midst of the sea, tossed with waves: for the wind was contrary.
column3: Mattheus 14:24 En die skuit was al in die middel van die see, geteister deur die golwe; want die wind was teen hulle.

column2: Matthew 14:25 And in the fourth watch of the night Jesus went unto them, walking on the sea.
column3: Mattheus 14:25 Maar in die vierde nagwaak het Jesus na hulle gekom, al wandelende op die see.

column2: Matthew 14:26 And when the disciples saw him walking on the sea, they were troubled, saying, It is a spirit; and they cried out for fear.
column3: Mattheus 14:26 En toe die dissipels Hom op die see sien loop, word hulle ontsteld en sê: Dit is ’n spook! En hulle het geskreeu van vrees.

column2: Matthew 14:27 But straightway Jesus spake unto them, saying, Be of good cheer; it is I; be not afraid.
column3: Mattheus 14:27 Maar Jesus het dadelik met hulle gespreek en gesê: Hou goeie moed, dit is Ek! Moenie vrees nie.

column2: Matthew 14:28 And Peter answered him and said, Lord, if it be thou, bid me come unto thee on the water.
column3: Mattheus 14:28 En Petrus antwoord Hom en sê: Here, as dit U is, beveel my om op die water na U te kom.

column2: Matthew 14:29 And he said, Come. And when Peter was come down out of the ship, he walked on the water, to go to Jesus.
column3: Mattheus 14:29 En Hy sê: Kom! Petrus klim toe van die skuit af en loop op die water om na Jesus te gaan.

column2: Matthew 14:30 But when he saw the wind boisterous, he was afraid; and beginning to sink, he cried, saying, Lord, save me.
column3: Mattheus 14:30 Maar toe hy die sterk wind sien, het hy bang geword; en toe hy begin sink, roep hy uit en sê: Here, red my!

column2: Matthew 14:31 And immediately Jesus stretched forth [his] hand, and caught him, and said unto him, O thou of little faith, wherefore didst thou doubt?
column3: Mattheus 14:31 En Jesus het dadelik sy hand uitgesteek en hom gegryp en vir hom gesê: Kleingelowige, waarom het jy getwyfel?

column2: Matthew 14:32 And when they were come into the ship, the wind ceased.
column3: Mattheus 14:32 Daarop klim hulle in die skuit, en die wind het gaan lê.

column2: Matthew 14:33 Then they that were in the ship came and worshipped him, saying, Of a truth thou art the Son of God.
column3: Mattheus 14:33 Toe kom die wat in die skuit was, en val voor Hom neer en sê: Waarlik, U is die Seun van God!

column2: Matthew 14:34 And when they were gone over, they came into the land of Gennesaret.
column3: Mattheus 14:34 En hulle het oorgevaar en in die land Gennésaret gekom.

column2: Matthew 14:35 And when the men of that place had knowledge of him, they sent out into all that country round about, and brought unto him all that were diseased;
column3: Mattheus 14:35 En die manne van daardie plek het Hom herken en in daardie hele omtrek uitgestuur en almal wat ongesteld was, na Hom gebring;

column2: Matthew 14:36 And besought him that they might only touch the hem of his garment: and as many as touched were made perfectly whole.
column3: Mattheus 14:36 en hulle het Hom gesmeek dat hulle net maar die soom van sy kleed mag aanraak; en almal wat dit aangeraak het, het gesond geword.

column2: Matthew 15:1 Then came to Jesus scribes and Pharisees, which were of Jerusalem, saying,
column3: Mattheus 15:1 TOE kom daar skrifgeleerdes en Fariseërs van Jerusalem na Jesus en sê:

column2: Matthew 15:2 Why do thy disciples transgress the tradition of the elders? for they wash not their hands when they eat bread.
column3: Mattheus 15:2 Waarom oortree u dissipels die oorlewering van die ou mense? Want hulle was nie hul hande as hulle brood eet nie.

column2: Matthew 15:3 But he answered and said unto them, Why do ye also transgress the commandment of God by your tradition?
column3: Mattheus 15:3 Maar Hy antwoord en sê vir hulle: Waarom oortree julle ook die gebod van God ter wille van julle oorlewering?

column2: Matthew 15:4 For God commanded, saying, Honour thy father and mother: and, He that curseth father or mother, let him die the death.
column3: Mattheus 15:4 Want God het bevel gegee en gesê: Eer jou vader en moeder; en: Hy wat vader of moeder vloek, moet sekerlik sterwe.

column2: Matthew 15:5 But ye say, Whosoever shall say to [his] father or [his] mother, [It is] a gift, by whatsoever thou mightest be profited by me;
column3: Mattheus 15:5 Maar julle sê: Elkeen wat aan vader of moeder sê: enige voordeel wat u van my sou kan geniet, is ’n offergawe — dié hoef sy vader of sy moeder glad nie te eer nie.

column2: Matthew 15:6 And honour not his father or his mother, [he shall be free]. Thus have ye made the commandment of God of none effect by your tradition.
column3: Mattheus 15:6 So het julle dan die gebod van God kragteloos gemaak ter wille van julle oorlewering.

column2: Matthew 15:7 [Ye] hypocrites, well did Esaias prophesy of you, saying,
column3: Mattheus 15:7 Geveinsdes, tereg het Jesaja oor julle geprofeteer toe hy gesê het:

column2: Matthew 15:8 This people draweth nigh unto me with their mouth, and honoureth me with [their] lips; but their heart is far from me.
column3: Mattheus 15:8 Hierdie volk nader My met hulle mond en eer My met die lippe, maar hulle hart is ver van My af.

column2: Matthew 15:9 But in vain they do worship me, teaching [for] doctrines the commandments of men.
column3: Mattheus 15:9 Maar tevergeefs vereer hulle My deur leringe te leer wat gebooie van mense is.

column2: Matthew 15:10 And he called the multitude, and said unto them, Hear, and understand:
column3: Mattheus 15:10 En Hy het die skare na Hom geroep en vir hulle gesê: Luister en verstaan!

column2: Matthew 15:11 Not that which goeth into the mouth defileth a man; but that which cometh out of the mouth, this defileth a man.
column3: Mattheus 15:11 Nie wat in die mond ingaan, maak die mens onrein nie; maar wat uit die mond uitgaan, dit maak die mens onrein.

column2: Matthew 15:12 Then came his disciples, and said unto him, Knowest thou that the Pharisees were offended, after they heard this saying?
column3: Mattheus 15:12 Daarop kom sy dissipels nader en sê vir Hom: Weet U dat die Fariseërs, toe hulle die woord hoor, aanstoot geneem het?

column2: Matthew 15:13 But he answered and said, Every plant, which my heavenly Father hath not planted, shall be rooted up.
column3: Mattheus 15:13 Maar Hy antwoord en sê: Elke plant wat my hemelse Vader nie geplant het nie, sal ontwortel word.

column2: Matthew 15:14 Let them alone: they be blind leaders of the blind. And if the blind lead the blind, both shall fall into the ditch.
column3: Mattheus 15:14 Laat hulle staan; hulle is blinde leiers van blindes. En as ’n blinde ’n ander blinde lei, sal altwee in die sloot val.

column2: Matthew 15:15 Then answered Peter and said unto him, Declare unto us this parable.
column3: Mattheus 15:15 En Petrus antwoord en sê vir Hom: Verklaar vir ons hierdie gelykenis.

column2: Matthew 15:16 And Jesus said, Are ye also yet without understanding?
column3: Mattheus 15:16 Maar Jesus sê: Is julle dan ook nog sonder verstand?

column2: Matthew 15:17 Do not ye yet understand, that whatsoever entereth in at the mouth goeth into the belly, and is cast out into the draught?
column3: Mattheus 15:17 Begryp julle nog nie dat alles wat in die mond ingaan, in die maag kom en in die heimlikheid uitgewerp word nie?

column2: Matthew 15:18 But those things which proceed out of the mouth come forth from the heart; and they defile the man.
column3: Mattheus 15:18 Maar die dinge wat uit die mond uitgaan, kom uit die hart, en dit is dié wat die mens onrein maak.

column2: Matthew 15:19 For out of the heart proceed evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, fornications, thefts, false witness, blasphemies:
column3: Mattheus 15:19 Want uit die hart kom daar slegte gedagtes, moord, egbreuk, hoerery, diewery, valse getuienis, lastertaal.

column2: Matthew 15:20 These are [the things] which defile a man: but to eat with unwashen hands defileth not a man.
column3: Mattheus 15:20 Dit is hierdie dinge wat die mens onrein maak; maar om met ongewaste hande te eet, maak die mens nie onrein nie.

column2: Matthew 15:21 Then Jesus went thence, and departed into the coasts of Tyre and Sidon.
column3: Mattheus 15:21 EN Jesus het daarvandaan weggegaan en na die streke van Tirus en Sidon vertrek.

column2: Matthew 15:22 And, behold, a woman of Canaan came out of the same coasts, and cried unto him, saying, Have mercy on me, O Lord, [thou] Son of David; my daughter is grievously vexed with a devil.
column3: Mattheus 15:22 En ’n Kananése vrou het van daardie gebied gekom en na Hom geroep en gesê: Wees my barmhartig, Here, Seun van Dawid! My dogter is erg van die duiwel besete.

column2: Matthew 15:23 But he answered her not a word. And his disciples came and besought him, saying, Send her away; for she crieth after us.
column3: Mattheus 15:23 Maar Hy het haar nie ’n woord geantwoord nie. Toe kom sy dissipels nader en vra Hom en sê: Stuur haar weg, want sy roep agter ons aan.

column2: Matthew 15:24 But he answered and said, I am not sent but unto the lost sheep of the house of Israel.
column3: Mattheus 15:24 Maar Hy antwoord en sê: Ek is net gestuur na die verlore skape van die huis van Israel.

column2: Matthew 15:25 Then came she and worshipped him, saying, Lord, help me.
column3: Mattheus 15:25 Daarop kom sy en val voor Hom neer en sê: Here, help my!

column2: Matthew 15:26 But he answered and said, It is not meet to take the children's bread, and to cast [it] to dogs.
column3: Mattheus 15:26 Maar Hy antwoord en sê: Dit is nie mooi om die brood van die kinders te neem en dit vir die hondjies te gooi nie.

column2: Matthew 15:27 And she said, Truth, Lord: yet the dogs eat of the crumbs which fall from their masters' table.
column3: Mattheus 15:27 En sy sê: Ja, Here, maar die hondjies eet darem van die krummels wat van die tafel van hulle base afval.

column2: Matthew 15:28 Then Jesus answered and said unto her, O woman, great [is] thy faith: be it unto thee even as thou wilt. And her daughter was made whole from that very hour.
column3: Mattheus 15:28 Toe antwoord Jesus en sê vir haar: O Vrou, groot is jou geloof; laat dit vir jou wees soos jy wil hê. En haar dogter het gesond geword van daardie uur af.

column2: Matthew 15:29 And Jesus departed from thence, and came nigh unto the sea of Galilee; and went up into a mountain, and sat down there.
column3: Mattheus 15:29 TOE gaan Jesus daarvandaan weg en kom by die see van Galiléa; en Hy het op die berg geklim en daar gaan sit.

column2: Matthew 15:30 And great multitudes came unto him, having with them [those that were] lame, blind, dumb, maimed, and many others, and cast them down at Jesus' feet; and he healed them:
column3: Mattheus 15:30 En ondertussen kom daar groot menigtes na Hom met kreupeles, blindes, stommes, gebreklikes en baie ander by hulle, en hulle het dié by die voete van Jesus neergesit, en Hy het hulle gesond gemaak,

column2: Matthew 15:31 Insomuch that the multitude wondered, when they saw the dumb to speak, the maimed to be whole, the lame to walk, and the blind to see: and they glorified the God of Israel.
column3: Mattheus 15:31 sodat die skare verbaas was om te sien dat stommes praat, gebreklikes gesond word, kreupeles loop en blindes sien; en hulle het die God van Israel verheerlik.

column2: Matthew 15:32 Then Jesus called his disciples [unto him], and said, I have compassion on the multitude, because they continue with me now three days, and have nothing to eat: and I will not send them away fasting, lest they faint in the way.
column3: Mattheus 15:32 Toe het Jesus sy dissipels na Hom geroep en gesê: Ek voel innig jammer vir die skare, omdat hulle al drie dae by My bly en niks het om te eet nie; en Ek wil hulle nie graag honger wegstuur nie, sodat hulle nie miskien op die pad beswyk nie.

column2: Matthew 15:33 And his disciples say unto him, Whence should we have so much bread in the wilderness, as to fill so great a multitude?
column3: Mattheus 15:33 En sy dissipels sê vir Hom: Waar sal ons in die woestyn soveel brode vandaan kry om so ’n groot skare te versadig?

column2: Matthew 15:34 And Jesus saith unto them, How many loaves have ye? And they said, Seven, and a few little fishes.
column3: Mattheus 15:34 Toe sê Jesus vir hulle: Hoeveel brode het julle? En hulle antwoord: Sewe, en ’n paar vissies.

column2: Matthew 15:35 And he commanded the multitude to sit down on the ground.
column3: Mattheus 15:35 En Hy het bevel gegee aan die skare om op die grond te gaan sit.

column2: Matthew 15:36 And he took the seven loaves and the fishes, and gave thanks, and brake [them], and gave to his disciples, and the disciples to the multitude.
column3: Mattheus 15:36 Toe neem Hy die sewe brode en die visse, en nadat Hy gedank het, breek Hy dit en gee dit aan sy dissipels, en die dissipels aan die skare.

column2: Matthew 15:37 And they did all eat, and were filled: and they took up of the broken [meat] that was left seven baskets full.
column3: Mattheus 15:37 En hulle het almal geëet en versadig geword; en hulle het die oorskot van die brokstukke opgetel, sewe mandjies vol.

column2: Matthew 15:38 And they that did eat were four thousand men, beside women and children.
column3: Mattheus 15:38 En die wat geëet het, was vierduisend manne buiten die vroue en kinders.

column2: Matthew 15:39 And he sent away the multitude, and took ship, and came into the coasts of Magdala.
column3: Mattheus 15:39 En nadat Hy die skare weggestuur het, het Hy in die skuit gegaan en in die gebied van Mágdala gekom.

column2: Matthew 16:1 The Pharisees also with the Sadducees came, and tempting desired him that he would shew them a sign from heaven.
column3: Mattheus 16:1 EN die Fariseërs en Sadduseërs het nader gekom om Hom te versoek en het Hom gevra om hulle ’n teken uit die hemel te laat sien.

column2: Matthew 16:2 He answered and said unto them, When it is evening, ye say, [It will be] fair weather: for the sky is red.
column3: Mattheus 16:2 Maar Hy antwoord en sê vir hulle: In die aand sê julle: Mooi weer, want die lug is rooi.

column2: Matthew 16:3 And in the morning, [It will be] foul weather to day: for the sky is red and lowring. O [ye] hypocrites, ye can discern the face of the sky; but can ye not [discern] the signs of the times?
column3: Mattheus 16:3 En in die môre: Stormweer vandag, want die lug is donkerrooi. Geveinsdes, julle weet wel om die voorkoms van die lug te onderskei, en kan julle nie die tekens van die tye onderskei nie?

column2: Matthew 16:4 A wicked and adulterous generation seeketh after a sign; and there shall no sign be given unto it, but the sign of the prophet Jonas. And he left them, and departed.
column3: Mattheus 16:4 ’n Slegte en owerspelige geslag soek na ’n teken, en geen teken sal aan hom gegee word nie, behalwe die teken van Jona, die profeet. En Hy het hulle verlaat en weggegaan.

column2: Matthew 16:5 And when his disciples were come to the other side, they had forgotten to take bread.
column3: Mattheus 16:5 En toe sy dissipels na die oorkant gegaan het, het hulle vergeet om brode saam te neem.

column2: Matthew 16:6 Then Jesus said unto them, Take heed and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees.
column3: Mattheus 16:6 Daarop sê Jesus vir hulle: Pas op en wees op julle hoede vir die suurdeeg van die Fariseërs en Sadduseërs.

column2: Matthew 16:7 And they reasoned among themselves, saying, [It is] because we have taken no bread.
column3: Mattheus 16:7 En hulle het onder mekaar geredeneer en gesê: Dit is omdat ons geen brode saamgeneem het nie.

column2: Matthew 16:8 [Which] when Jesus perceived, he said unto them, O ye of little faith, why reason ye among yourselves, because ye have brought no bread?
column3: Mattheus 16:8 Maar Jesus het dit opgemerk en vir hulle gesê: Wat redeneer julle onder mekaar, kleingelowiges, dat julle geen brode saamgeneem het nie?

column2: Matthew 16:9 Do ye not yet understand, neither remember the five loaves of the five thousand, and how many baskets ye took up?
column3: Mattheus 16:9 Begryp julle nog nie, en onthou julle nie die vyf brode van die vyfduisend, en hoeveel mandjiesvol julle opgetel het nie?

column2: Matthew 16:10 Neither the seven loaves of the four thousand, and how many baskets ye took up?
column3: Mattheus 16:10 Of die sewe brode van die vierduisend, en hoeveel mandjiesvol julle opgetel het nie?

column2: Matthew 16:11 How is it that ye do not understand that I spake [it] not to you concerning bread, that ye should beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees?
column3: Mattheus 16:11 Hoe is dit dat julle nie begryp dat Ek nie in verband met brood vir julle gesê het om op te pas vir die suurdeeg van die Fariseërs en Sadduseërs nie?

column2: Matthew 16:12 Then understood they how that he bade [them] not beware of the leaven of bread, but of the doctrine of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees.
column3: Mattheus 16:12 Toe het hulle begryp dat Hy nie gesê het dat hulle moes oppas vir die suurdeeg van die brood nie, maar vir die leer van die Fariseërs en Sadduseërs.

column2: Matthew 16:13 When Jesus came into the coasts of Caesarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, saying, Whom do men say that I the Son of man am?
column3: Mattheus 16:13 EN toe Jesus in die streke van Cesaréa-Filíppi kom, vra Hy sy dissipels en sê: Wie sê die mense dat Ek, die Seun van die mens, is?

column2: Matthew 16:14 And they said, Some [say that thou art] John the Baptist: some, Elias; and others, Jeremias, or one of the prophets.
column3: Mattheus 16:14 En hulle antwoord: Sommige Johannes die Doper, en sommige Elía, en ander Jeremia of een van die profete.

column2: Matthew 16:15 He saith unto them, But whom say ye that I am?
column3: Mattheus 16:15 Hy sê vir hulle: Maar julle, wie sê julle is Ek?

column2: Matthew 16:16 And Simon Peter answered and said, Thou art the Christ, the Son of the living God.
column3: Mattheus 16:16 En Simon Petrus antwoord en sê: U is die Christus, die Seun van die lewende God.

column2: Matthew 16:17 And Jesus answered and said unto him, Blessed art thou, Simon Barjona: for flesh and blood hath not revealed [it] unto thee, but my Father which is in heaven.
column3: Mattheus 16:17 Toe antwoord Jesus en sê vir hom: Salig is jy, Simon Bar-Jona, want vlees en bloed het dit nie aan jou geopenbaar nie, maar my Vader wat in die hemele is.

column2: Matthew 16:18 And I say also unto thee, That thou art Peter, and upon this rock I will build my church; and the gates of hell shall not prevail against it.
column3: Mattheus 16:18 En Ek sê ook vir jou: Jy is Petrus, en op hierdie rots sal Ek my gemeente bou, en die poorte van die doderyk sal dit nie oorweldig nie.

column2: Matthew 16:19 And I will give unto thee the keys of the kingdom of heaven: and whatsoever thou shalt bind on earth shall be bound in heaven: and whatsoever thou shalt loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven.
column3: Mattheus 16:19 En Ek sal jou die sleutels van die koninkryk van die hemele gee; en wat jy ook op die aarde mag bind, sal in die hemel gebonde wees, en wat jy ook op die aarde mag ontbind, sal in die hemel ontbonde wees.

column2: Matthew 16:20 Then charged he his disciples that they should tell no man that he was Jesus the Christ.
column3: Mattheus 16:20 Daarop het Hy sy dissipels bevel gegee dat hulle vir niemand moes sê dat Hy Jesus die Christus is nie.

column2: Matthew 16:21 From that time forth began Jesus to shew unto his disciples, how that he must go unto Jerusalem, and suffer many things of the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and be raised again the third day.
column3: Mattheus 16:21 Van toe af het Jesus begin om sy dissipels te toon dat Hy na Jerusalem moes gaan en veel van die ouderlinge en owerpriesters en skrifgeleerdes moes ly, en gedood en op die derde dag opgewek word.

column2: Matthew 16:22 Then Peter took him, and began to rebuke him, saying, Be it far from thee, Lord: this shall not be unto thee.
column3: Mattheus 16:22 Toe neem Petrus Hom opsy en begin Hom bestraf en sê: Mag God dit verhoed, Here, dit sal U nooit oorkom nie!

column2: Matthew 16:23 But he turned, and said unto Peter, Get thee behind me, Satan: thou art an offence unto me: for thou savourest not the things that be of God, but those that be of men.
column3: Mattheus 16:23 Maar Hy het omgedraai en vir Petrus gesê: Gaan weg agter My, Satan! Jy is vir My ’n struikelblok, omdat jy nie die dinge van God bedink nie, maar die dinge van die mense.

column2: Matthew 16:24 Then said Jesus unto his disciples, If any [man] will come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.
column3: Mattheus 16:24 TOE sê Jesus vir sy dissipels: As iemand agter My aan wil kom, moet hy homself verloën en sy kruis opneem en My volg.

column2: Matthew 16:25 For whosoever will save his life shall lose it: and whosoever will lose his life for my sake shall find it.
column3: Mattheus 16:25 Want elkeen wat sy lewe wil red, sal dit verloor; maar elkeen wat sy lewe om My ontwil verloor, sal dit vind.

column2: Matthew 16:26 For what is a man profited, if he shall gain the whole world, and lose his own soul? or what shall a man give in exchange for his soul?
column3: Mattheus 16:26 Want wat baat dit ’n mens as hy die hele wêreld win, maar aan sy siel skade ly? Of wat sal ’n mens gee as losprys vir sy siel?

column2: Matthew 16:27 For the Son of man shall come in the glory of his Father with his angels; and then he shall reward every man according to his works.
column3: Mattheus 16:27 Want die Seun van die mens staan gereed om met sy engele in die heerlikheid van sy Vader te kom, en dan sal Hy elkeen vergeld volgens sy dade.

column2: Matthew 16:28 Verily I say unto you, There be some standing here, which shall not taste of death, till they see the Son of man coming in his kingdom.
column3: Mattheus 16:28 Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, daar is sommige van die wat hier staan, wat die dood sekerlik nie sal smaak voordat hulle die Seun van die mens in sy koninkryk sien kom het nie.

column2: Matthew 17:1 And after six days Jesus taketh Peter, James, and John his brother, and bringeth them up into an high mountain apart,
column3: Mattheus 17:1 EN ná ses dae het Jesus vir Petrus en Jakobus en Johannes, sy broer, saamgeneem en hulle op ’n hoë berg in die eensaamheid gebring.

column2: Matthew 17:2 And was transfigured before them: and his face did shine as the sun, and his raiment was white as the light.
column3: Mattheus 17:2 En Hy het voor hulle van gedaante verander, en sy aangesig het geblink soos die son, en sy klere het wit geword soos die lig.

column2: Matthew 17:3 And, behold, there appeared unto them Moses and Elias talking with him.
column3: Mattheus 17:3 En kyk, daar verskyn aan hulle Moses en Elía in gesprek met Hom.

column2: Matthew 17:4 Then answered Peter, and said unto Jesus, Lord, it is good for us to be here: if thou wilt, let us make here three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias.
column3: Mattheus 17:4 Toe begin Petrus vir Jesus te sê: Here, dit is goed dat ons hier is; as U wil, laat ons hier drie hutte maak: vir U een en vir Moses een en een vir Elía.

column2: Matthew 17:5 While he yet spake, behold, a bright cloud overshadowed them: and behold a voice out of the cloud, which said, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased; hear ye him.
column3: Mattheus 17:5 Terwyl hy nog spreek, oordek ’n helderligte wolk hulle meteens en daar sê ’n stem uit die wolk: Dit is my geliefde Seun in wie Ek ’n welbehae het. Luister na Hom!

column2: Matthew 17:6 And when the disciples heard [it], they fell on their face, and were sore afraid.
column3: Mattheus 17:6 En toe die dissipels dit hoor, het hulle op hul aangesig geval en was baie bevrees.

column2: Matthew 17:7 And Jesus came and touched them, and said, Arise, and be not afraid.
column3: Mattheus 17:7 En Jesus het nader gekom en hulle aangeraak en gesê: Staan op en moenie vrees nie.

column2: Matthew 17:8 And when they had lifted up their eyes, they saw no man, save Jesus only.
