column3: Mattheus 17:8 Toe slaan hulle hul oë op en sien niemand meer nie, behalwe Jesus alleen.

column2: Matthew 17:9 And as they came down from the mountain, Jesus charged them, saying, Tell the vision to no man, until the Son of man be risen again from the dead.
column3: Mattheus 17:9 En onderwyl hulle van die berg afklim, het Jesus hulle bevel gegee en gesê: Julle moet vir niemand iets van die gesig sê voordat die Seun van die mens uit die dode opgestaan het nie.

column2: Matthew 17:10 And his disciples asked him, saying, Why then say the scribes that Elias must first come?
column3: Mattheus 17:10 En sy dissipels vra Hom en sê: Waarom sê die skrifgeleerdes dan dat Elía eers moet kom?

column2: Matthew 17:11 And Jesus answered and said unto them, Elias truly shall first come, and restore all things.
column3: Mattheus 17:11 En Jesus antwoord en sê vir hulle: Dis waar, Elía kom eers en sal alles herstel;

column2: Matthew 17:12 But I say unto you, That Elias is come already, and they knew him not, but have done unto him whatsoever they listed. Likewise shall also the Son of man suffer of them.
column3: Mattheus 17:12 maar Ek sê vir julle dat Elía al gekom het, en hulle het hom nie erken nie, maar aan hom alles gedoen wat hulle wou. So sal die Seun van die mens ook deur hulle ly.

column2: Matthew 17:13 Then the disciples understood that he spake unto them of John the Baptist.
column3: Mattheus 17:13 Toe verstaan die dissipels dat Hy met hulle van Johannes die Doper gespreek het.

column2: Matthew 17:14 And when they were come to the multitude, there came to him a [certain] man, kneeling down to him, and saying,
column3: Mattheus 17:14 EN toe hulle by die skare kom, gaan daar ’n man na Hom en val voor Hom op die knieë en sê:

column2: Matthew 17:15 Lord, have mercy on my son: for he is lunatick, and sore vexed: for ofttimes he falleth into the fire, and oft into the water.
column3: Mattheus 17:15 Here, ontferm U oor my seun, want hy is maansiek en ly swaar; want dikwels val hy in die vuur en dikwels in die water.

column2: Matthew 17:16 And I brought him to thy disciples, and they could not cure him.
column3: Mattheus 17:16 En ek het hom na u dissipels gebring, en hulle kon hom nie gesond maak nie.

column2: Matthew 17:17 Then Jesus answered and said, O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you? how long shall I suffer you? bring him hither to me.
column3: Mattheus 17:17 Toe antwoord Jesus en sê: O Ongelowige en verdraaide geslag, hoe lank sal Ek by julle wees, hoe lank sal Ek julle verdra? Bring hom hier vir My.

column2: Matthew 17:18 And Jesus rebuked the devil; and he departed out of him: and the child was cured from that very hour.
column3: Mattheus 17:18 Daarop bestraf Jesus hom; en die duiwel het van hom uitgegaan, en die seun het gesond geword van daardie uur af.

column2: Matthew 17:19 Then came the disciples to Jesus apart, and said, Why could not we cast him out?
column3: Mattheus 17:19 Toe kom die dissipels na Jesus afsonderlik en sê: Waarom kon ons hom nie uitdryf nie?

column2: Matthew 17:20 And Jesus said unto them, Because of your unbelief: for verily I say unto you, If ye have faith as a grain of mustard seed, ye shall say unto this mountain, Remove hence to yonder place; and it shall remove; and nothing shall be impossible unto you.
column3: Mattheus 17:20 En Jesus antwoord hulle: Deur julle ongeloof; want, voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, as julle geloof het soos ’n mosterdsaad sal julle vir hierdie berg sê: Gaan weg hiervandaan daarnatoe! en hy sal weggaan, en niks sal vir julle onmoontlik wees nie.

column2: Matthew 17:21 Howbeit this kind goeth not out but by prayer and fasting.
column3: Mattheus 17:21 Maar hierdie geslag gaan nie uit behalwe deur gebed en vas nie.

column2: Matthew 17:22 And while they abode in Galilee, Jesus said unto them, The Son of man shall be betrayed into the hands of men:
column3: Mattheus 17:22 En terwyl hulle in Galiléa rondgaan, het Jesus vir hulle gesê: Die Seun van die mens sal oorgelewer word in die hande van die mense;

column2: Matthew 17:23 And they shall kill him, and the third day he shall be raised again. And they were exceeding sorry.
column3: Mattheus 17:23 en hulle sal Hom doodmaak, en op die derde dag sal Hy opstaan. En hulle het baie bedroef geword.

column2: Matthew 17:24 And when they were come to Capernaum, they that received tribute [money] came to Peter, and said, Doth not your master pay tribute?
column3: Mattheus 17:24 EN toe hulle in Kapérnaüm kom, het die wat die tempelbelasting ontvang, na Petrus gegaan en gesê: Betaal julle Meester nie die tempelbelasting nie?

column2: Matthew 17:25 He saith, Yes. And when he was come into the house, Jesus prevented him, saying, What thinkest thou, Simon? of whom do the kings of the earth take custom or tribute? of their own children, or of strangers?
column3: Mattheus 17:25 Hy antwoord: Ja. En toe hy in die huis inkom, was Jesus hom voor en sê: Wat dink jy, Simon? Van wie neem die konings van die aarde tol of belasting — van hulle seuns of van die vreemdelinge?

column2: Matthew 17:26 Peter saith unto him, Of strangers. Jesus saith unto him, Then are the children free.
column3: Mattheus 17:26 Petrus antwoord Hom: Van die vreemdelinge. Jesus sê vir hom: Dan is die seuns vry.

column2: Matthew 17:27 Notwithstanding, lest we should offend them, go thou to the sea, and cast an hook, and take up the fish that first cometh up; and when thou hast opened his mouth, thou shalt find a piece of money: that take, and give unto them for me and thee.
column3: Mattheus 17:27 Maar dat ons hulle geen aanstoot mag gee nie, gaan na die see toe, gooi ’n hoek uit en neem die eerste vis wat opkom; en as jy sy bek oopmaak, sal jy ’n stater kry; neem dit en gee dit aan hulle vir My en vir jou.

column2: Matthew 18:1 At the same time came the disciples unto Jesus, saying, Who is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?
column3: Mattheus 18:1 IN daardie uur het die dissipels na Jesus gekom en gesê: Wie is tog die grootste in die koninkryk van die hemele?

column2: Matthew 18:2 And Jesus called a little child unto him, and set him in the midst of them,
column3: Mattheus 18:2 Toe roep Jesus ’n kindjie na Hom en laat hom in hulle midde staan

column2: Matthew 18:3 And said, Verily I say unto you, Except ye be converted, and become as little children, ye shall not enter into the kingdom of heaven.
column3: Mattheus 18:3 en Hy sê: Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, as julle nie verander en soos die kindertjies word nie, sal julle nooit in die koninkryk van die hemele ingaan nie!

column2: Matthew 18:4 Whosoever therefore shall humble himself as this little child, the same is greatest in the kingdom of heaven.
column3: Mattheus 18:4 Elkeen dan wat homself verneder soos hierdie kindjie, hy is die grootste in die koninkryk van die hemele.

column2: Matthew 18:5 And whoso shall receive one such little child in my name receiveth me.
column3: Mattheus 18:5 En elkeen wat een van sulke kindertjies in my Naam ontvang, ontvang My;

column2: Matthew 18:6 But whoso shall offend one of these little ones which believe in me, it were better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck, and [that] he were drowned in the depth of the sea.
column3: Mattheus 18:6 maar elkeen wat een van hierdie kleintjies wat in My glo, laat struikel, dit is vir hom beter dat ’n meulsteen aan sy nek gehang word en hy wegsink in die diepte van die see.

column2: Matthew 18:7 Woe unto the world because of offences! for it must needs be that offences come; but woe to that man by whom the offence cometh!
column3: Mattheus 18:7 Wee die wêreld weens die struikelblokke! Want dit is noodsaaklik dat daar struikelblokke kom, maar wee die mens deur wie die struikelblok kom.

column2: Matthew 18:8 Wherefore if thy hand or thy foot offend thee, cut them off, and cast [them] from thee: it is better for thee to enter into life halt or maimed, rather than having two hands or two feet to be cast into everlasting fire.
column3: Mattheus 18:8 En as jou hand of jou voet jou laat struikel, kap dit af en gooi dit weg van jou af; dit is vir jou beter om in die lewe in te gaan, kreupel of vermink, as om twee hande of voete te hê en in die ewige vuur gewerp te word.

column2: Matthew 18:9 And if thine eye offend thee, pluck it out, and cast [it] from thee: it is better for thee to enter into life with one eye, rather than having two eyes to be cast into hell fire.
column3: Mattheus 18:9 En as jou oog jou laat struikel, ruk dit uit en werp dit weg van jou af. Dit is vir jou beter om met een oog in die lewe in te gaan, as om twee oë te hê en in die helse vuur gewerp te word.

column2: Matthew 18:10 Take heed that ye despise not one of these little ones; for I say unto you, That in heaven their angels do always behold the face of my Father which is in heaven.
column3: Mattheus 18:10 Pas op dat julle nie een van hierdie kleintjies verag nie; want Ek sê vir julle dat hulle engele in die hemele altyd die aangesig sien van my Vader wat in die hemele is.

column2: Matthew 18:11 For the Son of man is come to save that which was lost.
column3: Mattheus 18:11 Want die Seun van die mens het gekom om te red wat verlore is.

column2: Matthew 18:12 How think ye? if a man have an hundred sheep, and one of them be gone astray, doth he not leave the ninety and nine, and goeth into the mountains, and seeketh that which is gone astray?
column3: Mattheus 18:12 Wat dink julle? As iemand honderd skape het en een van hulle verdwaal, sal hy nie die negen-en-negentig laat staan en op die berge die verdwaalde een gaan soek nie?

column2: Matthew 18:13 And if so be that he find it, verily I say unto you, he rejoiceth more of that [sheep], than of the ninety and nine which went not astray.
column3: Mattheus 18:13 En as hy hom kry, voorwaar Ek sê vir julle dat hy blyer is oor hom as oor die negen-en-negentig wat nie verdwaal het nie.

column2: Matthew 18:14 Even so it is not the will of your Father which is in heaven, that one of these little ones should perish.
column3: Mattheus 18:14 So is dit nie die wil van julle Vader wat in die hemele is, dat een van hierdie kleintjies verlore gaan nie.

column2: Matthew 18:15 Moreover if thy brother shall trespass against thee, go and tell him his fault between thee and him alone: if he shall hear thee, thou hast gained thy brother.
column3: Mattheus 18:15 EN as jou broeder teen jou sondig, gaan bestraf hom tussen jou en hom alleen. As hy na jou luister, dan het jy jou broeder gewin;

column2: Matthew 18:16 But if he will not hear [thee, then] take with thee one or two more, that in the mouth of two or three witnesses every word may be established.
column3: Mattheus 18:16 maar as hy nie luister nie, neem nog een of twee met jou saam, sodat in die mond van twee of drie getuies elke woord kan vasstaan.

column2: Matthew 18:17 And if he shall neglect to hear them, tell [it] unto the church: but if he neglect to hear the church, let him be unto thee as an heathen man and a publican.
column3: Mattheus 18:17 En as hy na hulle nie luister nie, sê dit aan die gemeente; en as hy na die gemeente ook nie luister nie, laat hom vir jou wees soos die heiden en die tollenaar.

column2: Matthew 18:18 Verily I say unto you, Whatsoever ye shall bind on earth shall be bound in heaven: and whatsoever ye shall loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven.
column3: Mattheus 18:18 Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, alles wat julle op die aarde bind, sal in die hemel gebonde wees; en alles wat julle op die aarde ontbind, sal in die hemel ontbonde wees.

column2: Matthew 18:19 Again I say unto you, That if two of you shall agree on earth as touching any thing that they shall ask, it shall be done for them of my Father which is in heaven.
column3: Mattheus 18:19 Weer sê Ek vir julle: As twee van julle saamstem op die aarde oor enige saak wat hulle mag vra, dit sal hulle ten deel val van my Vader wat in die hemele is.

column2: Matthew 18:20 For where two or three are gathered together in my name, there am I in the midst of them.
column3: Mattheus 18:20 Want waar twee of drie in my Naam vergader, daar is Ek in hul midde.

column2: Matthew 18:21 Then came Peter to him, and said, Lord, how oft shall my brother sin against me, and I forgive him? till seven times?
column3: Mattheus 18:21 Toe kom Petrus na Hom en sê: Here, hoe dikwels sal my broeder teen my sondig en ek hom vergewe? Tot sewe maal toe?

column2: Matthew 18:22 Jesus saith unto him, I say not unto thee, Until seven times: but, Until seventy times seven.
column3: Mattheus 18:22 Jesus antwoord hom: Ek sê vir jou, nie tot sewe maal toe nie, maar tot sewentig maal sewe toe.

column2: Matthew 18:23 Therefore is the kingdom of heaven likened unto a certain king, which would take account of his servants.
column3: Mattheus 18:23 Daarom word die koninkryk van die hemele vergelyk met ’n sekere koning wat met sy diensknegte wou afreken.

column2: Matthew 18:24 And when he had begun to reckon, one was brought unto him, which owed him ten thousand talents.
column3: Mattheus 18:24 En toe hy begin afreken, word daar een na hom gebring wat tienduisend talente skuldig was.

column2: Matthew 18:25 But forasmuch as he had not to pay, his lord commanded him to be sold, and his wife, and children, and all that he had, and payment to be made.
column3: Mattheus 18:25 En omdat hy nie kon betaal nie, gee sy heer bevel dat hy verkoop moet word, en sy vrou en sy kinders en alles wat hy het, en dat betaal moet word.

column2: Matthew 18:26 The servant therefore fell down, and worshipped him, saying, Lord, have patience with me, and I will pay thee all.
column3: Mattheus 18:26 Toe val die dienskneg neer en buig voor hom en sê: Heer, wees lankmoedig met my, en ek sal u alles betaal.

column2: Matthew 18:27 Then the lord of that servant was moved with compassion, and loosed him, and forgave him the debt.
column3: Mattheus 18:27 En die heer van daardie dienskneg het innig jammer vir hom gevoel en hom losgelaat en hom die skuld kwytgeskeld.

column2: Matthew 18:28 But the same servant went out, and found one of his fellowservants, which owed him an hundred pence: and he laid hands on him, and took [him] by the throat, saying, Pay me that thou owest.
column3: Mattheus 18:28 Maar toe daardie dienskneg uitgaan en een van sy medediensknegte vind wat hom honderd pennings skuldig was, het hy hom aan die keel gegryp en gesê: Betaal my wat jy skuld.

column2: Matthew 18:29 And his fellowservant fell down at his feet, and besought him, saying, Have patience with me, and I will pay thee all.
column3: Mattheus 18:29 Sy mededienskneg val toe voor sy voete neer en smeek hom en sê: Wees lankmoedig met my, en ek sal jou alles betaal.

column2: Matthew 18:30 And he would not: but went and cast him into prison, till he should pay the debt.
column3: Mattheus 18:30 En hy wou nie, maar het gegaan en hom in die gevangenis gewerp totdat hy die skuld sou betaal het.

column2: Matthew 18:31 So when his fellowservants saw what was done, they were very sorry, and came and told unto their lord all that was done.
column3: Mattheus 18:31 En toe sy medediensknegte sien wat gebeur het, was hulle baie bedroef, en hulle het gegaan en aan hulle heer meegedeel alles wat gebeur het.

column2: Matthew 18:32 Then his lord, after that he had called him, said unto him, O thou wicked servant, I forgave thee all that debt, because thou desiredst me:
column3: Mattheus 18:32 Daarop roep sy heer hom en sê vir hom: Jou slegte dienskneg, al daardie skuld het ek jou kwytgeskeld, omdat jy my gesmeek het;

column2: Matthew 18:33 Shouldest not thou also have had compassion on thy fellowservant, even as I had pity on thee?
column3: Mattheus 18:33 moes jy nie jou mededienskneg ook barmhartig wees soos ek jou ook barmhartig gewees het nie?

column2: Matthew 18:34 And his lord was wroth, and delivered him to the tormentors, till he should pay all that was due unto him.
column3: Mattheus 18:34 En sy heer het hom in toorn oorgegee aan die pynigers totdat hy sou betaal het alles wat hy hom skuldig was.

column2: Matthew 18:35 So likewise shall my heavenly Father do also unto you, if ye from your hearts forgive not every one his brother their trespasses.
column3: Mattheus 18:35 So sal ook my hemelse Vader aan julle doen as julle nie elkeen sy broeder van harte sy oortredinge vergewe nie.

column2: Matthew 19:1 And it came to pass, [that] when Jesus had finished these sayings, he departed from Galilee, and came into the coasts of Judaea beyond Jordan;
column3: Mattheus 19:1 EN toe Jesus hierdie woorde geëindig het, het Hy van Galiléa vertrek en in die gebied van Judéa oorkant die Jordaan gekom.

column2: Matthew 19:2 And great multitudes followed him; and he healed them there.
column3: Mattheus 19:2 En groot menigtes het Hom gevolg, en Hy het hulle daar gesond gemaak.

column2: Matthew 19:3 The Pharisees also came unto him, tempting him, and saying unto him, Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife for every cause?
column3: Mattheus 19:3 Toe kom die Fariseërs na Hom om Hom te versoek, en sê vir Hom: Is dit ’n man geoorloof om oor allerhande redes van sy vrou te skei?

column2: Matthew 19:4 And he answered and said unto them, Have ye not read, that he which made [them] at the beginning made them male and female,
column3: Mattheus 19:4 En Hy antwoord hulle en sê: Het julle nie gelees dat Hy wat hulle gemaak het, hulle van die begin af man en vrou gemaak het nie,

column2: Matthew 19:5 And said, For this cause shall a man leave father and mother, and shall cleave to his wife: and they twain shall be one flesh?
column3: Mattheus 19:5 en gesê het: Om hierdie rede sal die man sy vader en sy moeder verlaat en sy vrou aankleef, en hulle twee sal een vlees wees;

column2: Matthew 19:6 Wherefore they are no more twain, but one flesh. What therefore God hath joined together, let not man put asunder.
column3: Mattheus 19:6 sodat hulle nie meer twee is nie, maar een vlees? Wat God dan saamgevoeg het, mag geen mens skei nie.

column2: Matthew 19:7 They say unto him, Why did Moses then command to give a writing of divorcement, and to put her away?
column3: Mattheus 19:7 Hulle sê vir Hom: Waarom het Moses dan beveel om ’n skeibrief te gee en van haar te skei?

column2: Matthew 19:8 He saith unto them, Moses because of the hardness of your hearts suffered you to put away your wives: but from the beginning it was not so.
column3: Mattheus 19:8 Hy antwoord hulle: Omdat Moses weens die hardheid van jul harte julle toegelaat het om van julle vroue te skei; maar van die begin af was dit nie so nie.

column2: Matthew 19:9 And I say unto you, Whosoever shall put away his wife, except [it be] for fornication, and shall marry another, committeth adultery: and whoso marrieth her which is put away doth commit adultery.
column3: Mattheus 19:9 Maar Ek sê vir julle, elkeen wat van sy vrou skei, behalwe oor hoerery, en ’n ander een trou, pleeg egbreuk; en die wat die geskeie vrou trou, pleeg egbreuk.

column2: Matthew 19:10 His disciples say unto him, If the case of the man be so with [his] wife, it is not good to marry.
column3: Mattheus 19:10 Sy dissipels sê vir Hom: As die saak van ’n man met ’n vrou so is, dan is dit nie wenslik om te trou nie.

column2: Matthew 19:11 But he said unto them, All [men] cannot receive this saying, save [they] to whom it is given.
column3: Mattheus 19:11 Maar Hy sê vir hulle: Almal vat hierdie woord nie, maar net dié aan wie dit gegee is.

column2: Matthew 19:12 For there are some eunuchs, which were so born from [their] mother's womb: and there are some eunuchs, which were made eunuchs of men: and there be eunuchs, which have made themselves eunuchs for the kingdom of heaven's sake. He that is able to receive [it], let him receive [it].
column3: Mattheus 19:12 Want daar is persone wat onbekwaam is om te trou, wat van die moederskoot af so gebore is, en daar is persone wat deur die mense onbekwaam gemaak is, en daar is persone wat hulleself onbekwaam gemaak het ter wille van die koninkryk van die hemele. Wie dit kan vat, laat hom dit vat.

column2: Matthew 19:13 Then were there brought unto him little children, that he should put [his] hands on them, and pray: and the disciples rebuked them.
column3: Mattheus 19:13 TOE bring hulle kindertjies na Hom, dat Hy hulle die hande sou oplê en bid; en die dissipels het hulle bestraf.

column2: Matthew 19:14 But Jesus said, Suffer little children, and forbid them not, to come unto me: for of such is the kingdom of heaven.
column3: Mattheus 19:14 Maar Jesus sê: Laat die kindertjies staan en verhinder hulle nie om na My te kom nie; want aan sulkes behoort die koninkryk van die hemele.

column2: Matthew 19:15 And he laid [his] hands on them, and departed thence.
column3: Mattheus 19:15 En Hy het hulle die hande opgelê en daarvandaan vertrek.

column2: Matthew 19:16 And, behold, one came and said unto him, Good Master, what good thing shall I do, that I may have eternal life?
column3: Mattheus 19:16 EN daar kom een na Hom en sê vir Hom: Goeie Meester, watter goeie ding moet ek doen, dat ek die ewige lewe kan hê?

column2: Matthew 19:17 And he said unto him, Why callest thou me good? [there is] none good but one, [that is], God: but if thou wilt enter into life, keep the commandments.
column3: Mattheus 19:17 En Hy sê vir hom: Waarom noem jy My goed? Niemand is goed nie, behalwe een, naamlik God. Maar as jy in die lewe wil ingaan, onderhou die gebooie.

column2: Matthew 19:18 He saith unto him, Which? Jesus said, Thou shalt do no murder, Thou shalt not commit adultery, Thou shalt not steal, Thou shalt not bear false witness,
column3: Mattheus 19:18 Hy vra Hom: Watter? En Jesus sê — dit: Jy mag nie doodslaan nie, jy mag nie egbreek nie, jy mag nie steel nie, jy mag geen valse getuienis gee nie;

column2: Matthew 19:19 Honour thy father and [thy] mother: and, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.
column3: Mattheus 19:19 eer jou vader en moeder; en: Jy moet jou naaste liefhê soos jouself.

column2: Matthew 19:20 The young man saith unto him, All these things have I kept from my youth up: what lack I yet?
column3: Mattheus 19:20 Die jongman sê vir Hom: Al hierdie dinge het ek onderhou van my jeug af. Wat kom ek nog kort?

column2: Matthew 19:21 Jesus said unto him, If thou wilt be perfect, go [and] sell that thou hast, and give to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven: and come [and] follow me.
column3: Mattheus 19:21 Jesus antwoord hom: As jy volmaak wil wees, gaan verkoop jou goed en gee dit aan die armes, en jy sal ’n skat in die hemel hê; en kom hier, volg My.

column2: Matthew 19:22 But when the young man heard that saying, he went away sorrowful: for he had great possessions.
column3: Mattheus 19:22 Maar toe die jongman dié woord hoor, het hy bedroef weggegaan; want hy het baie besittings gehad.

column2: Matthew 19:23 Then said Jesus unto his disciples, Verily I say unto you, That a rich man shall hardly enter into the kingdom of heaven.
column3: Mattheus 19:23 En Jesus sê vir sy dissipels: Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle dat ’n ryk man beswaarlik in die koninkryk van die hemele sal ingaan.

column2: Matthew 19:24 And again I say unto you, It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.
column3: Mattheus 19:24 En verder sê Ek vir julle, dit is makliker vir ’n kameel om deur die oog van ’n naald te gaan as vir ’n ryk man om in die koninkryk van God in te gaan.

column2: Matthew 19:25 When his disciples heard [it], they were exceedingly amazed, saying, Who then can be saved?
column3: Mattheus 19:25 Toe sy dissipels dit hoor, was hulle baie verslae en sê: Wie kan dan gered word?

column2: Matthew 19:26 But Jesus beheld [them], and said unto them, With men this is impossible; but with God all things are possible.
column3: Mattheus 19:26 Maar Jesus het hulle aangekyk en vir hulle gesê: By mense is dit onmoontlik, maar by God is alle dinge moontlik.

column2: Matthew 19:27 Then answered Peter and said unto him, Behold, we have forsaken all, and followed thee; what shall we have therefore?
column3: Mattheus 19:27 Daarop antwoord Petrus en sê vir Hom: Kyk, ons het alles verlaat en U gevolg. Wat sal daar dan vir ons wees?

column2: Matthew 19:28 And Jesus said unto them, Verily I say unto you, That ye which have followed me, in the regeneration when the Son of man shall sit in the throne of his glory, ye also shall sit upon twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
column3: Mattheus 19:28 En Jesus sê vir hulle: Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle dat julle wat My gevolg het, in die wedergeboorte wanneer die Seun van die mens op sy heerlike troon gaan sit, julle ook op twaalf trone sal sit en die twaalf stamme van Israel sal oordeel.

column2: Matthew 19:29 And every one that hath forsaken houses, or brethren, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or lands, for my name's sake, shall receive an hundredfold, and shall inherit everlasting life.
column3: Mattheus 19:29 En elkeen wat huise of broers of susters of vader of moeder of vrou of kinders of grond ter wille van my Naam verlaat het, sal honderd maal soveel ontvang en die ewige lewe beërwe.

column2: Matthew 19:30 But many [that are] first shall be last; and the last [shall be] first.
column3: Mattheus 19:30 Maar baie wat eerste is, sal laaste wees, en wat laaste is, eerste.

column2: Matthew 20:1 For the kingdom of heaven is like unto a man [that is] an householder, which went out early in the morning to hire labourers into his vineyard.
column3: Mattheus 20:1 WANT die koninkryk van die hemele is soos ’n huisheer wat vroeg in die môre uitgegaan het om arbeiders vir sy wingerd te huur.

column2: Matthew 20:2 And when he had agreed with the labourers for a penny a day, he sent them into his vineyard.
column3: Mattheus 20:2 En nadat hy met die arbeiders ooreengekom het vir ’n penning op ’n dag, stuur hy hulle in sy wingerd.

column2: Matthew 20:3 And he went out about the third hour, and saw others standing idle in the marketplace,
column3: Mattheus 20:3 En omtrent die derde uur gaan hy uit en sien ander ledig op die mark staan.

column2: Matthew 20:4 And said unto them; Go ye also into the vineyard, and whatsoever is right I will give you. And they went their way.
column3: Mattheus 20:4 En hy sê vir hulle: Gaan julle ook in die wingerd, en wat reg is, sal ek aan julle gee. En hulle het gegaan.

column2: Matthew 20:5 Again he went out about the sixth and ninth hour, and did likewise.
column3: Mattheus 20:5 Weer het hy omtrent die sesde en die negende uur uitgegaan en net dieselfde gedoen.

column2: Matthew 20:6 And about the eleventh hour he went out, and found others standing idle, and saith unto them, Why stand ye here all the day idle?
column3: Mattheus 20:6 En omtrent die elfde uur gaan hy uit en vind ander ledig staan en sê vir hulle: Wat staan julle hier die hele dag ledig?

column2: Matthew 20:7 They say unto him, Because no man hath hired us. He saith unto them, Go ye also into the vineyard; and whatsoever is right, [that] shall ye receive.
column3: Mattheus 20:7 Hulle antwoord hom: Omdat niemand ons gehuur het nie. Hy sê vir hulle: Gaan julle ook in die wingerd, en wat reg is, sal julle ontvang.

column2: Matthew 20:8 So when even was come, the lord of the vineyard saith unto his steward, Call the labourers, and give them [their] hire, beginning from the last unto the first.
column3: Mattheus 20:8 En toe dit aand geword het, sê die heer van die wingerd vir sy opsigter: Roep die arbeiders en betaal hulle hul loon; en begin van die laastes af tot by die eerstes.

column2: Matthew 20:9 And when they came that [were hired] about the eleventh hour, they received every man a penny.
column3: Mattheus 20:9 En die wat omtrent die elfde uur begin het, het gekom en elkeen ’n penning ontvang.

column2: Matthew 20:10 But when the first came, they supposed that they should have received more; and they likewise received every man a penny.
column3: Mattheus 20:10 Die eerstes kom toe en dink dat hulle meer sal ontvang, en hulle het ook elkeen ’n penning ontvang.

column2: Matthew 20:11 And when they had received [it], they murmured against the goodman of the house,
column3: Mattheus 20:11 En toe hulle dit ontvang, murmureer hulle by die huisheer

column2: Matthew 20:12 Saying, These last have wrought [but] one hour, and thou hast made them equal unto us, which have borne the burden and heat of the day.
column3: Mattheus 20:12 en sê: Hierdie laastes het een uur gewerk, en u het hulle gelykop behandel met ons wat die las van die dag en die hitte gedra het.

column2: Matthew 20:13 But he answered one of them, and said, Friend, I do thee no wrong: didst not thou agree with me for a penny?
column3: Mattheus 20:13 Maar hy antwoord en sê vir een van hulle: Vriend, ek doen jou geen onreg aan nie. Het jy nie met my ooreengekom vir ’n penning nie?

column2: Matthew 20:14 Take [that] thine [is], and go thy way: I will give unto this last, even as unto thee.
column3: Mattheus 20:14 Neem dan wat joue is, en gaan heen. Ek wil aan hierdie laaste een gee net soos aan jou.

column2: Matthew 20:15 Is it not lawful for me to do what I will with mine own? Is thine eye evil, because I am good?
column3: Mattheus 20:15 Of staan dit my nie vry om met my eie goed te maak wat ek wil nie? Of is jou oog verkeerd, omdat ek goed is?

column2: Matthew 20:16 So the last shall be first, and the first last: for many be called, but few chosen.
column3: Mattheus 20:16 So sal die wat laaste is, eerste wees, en die wat eerste is, laaste; want baie is geroep, maar min uitverkies.

column2: Matthew 20:17 And Jesus going up to Jerusalem took the twelve disciples apart in the way, and said unto them,
column3: Mattheus 20:17 EN toe Jesus opgaan na Jerusalem, het Hy die twaalf dissipels op die pad alleen geneem en vir hulle gesê:

column2: Matthew 20:18 Behold, we go up to Jerusalem; and the Son of man shall be betrayed unto the chief priests and unto the scribes, and they shall condemn him to death,
column3: Mattheus 20:18 Kyk, ons gaan op na Jerusalem, en die Seun van die mens sal oorgelewer word aan die owerpriesters en skrifgeleerdes; en hulle sal Hom tot die dood veroordeel

column2: Matthew 20:19 And shall deliver him to the Gentiles to mock, and to scourge, and to crucify [him]: and the third day he shall rise again.
column3: Mattheus 20:19 en Hom oorlewer aan die heidene om Hom te bespot en te gésel en te kruisig; en op die derde dag sal Hy opstaan.

column2: Matthew 20:20 Then came to him the mother of Zebedee's children with her sons, worshipping [him], and desiring a certain thing of him.
column3: Mattheus 20:20 Toe kom die moeder van die seuns van Sebedéüs met haar seuns na Hom en buig voor Hom neer om iets van Hom te vra.

column2: Matthew 20:21 And he said unto her, What wilt thou? She saith unto him, Grant that these my two sons may sit, the one on thy right hand, and the other on the left, in thy kingdom.
column3: Mattheus 20:21 En Hy sê vir haar: Wat wil jy hê? Sy antwoord Hom: Sê dat hierdie twee seuns van my in u koninkryk mag sit, een aan u regter- en een aan u linkerhand.

column2: Matthew 20:22 But Jesus answered and said, Ye know not what ye ask. Are ye able to drink of the cup that I shall drink of, and to be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with? They say unto him, We are able.
column3: Mattheus 20:22 Maar Jesus antwoord en sê: Julle weet nie wat julle vra nie. Kan julle die beker drink wat Ek aanstons gaan drink, en gedoop word met die doop waarmee Ek gedoop word? Hulle sê vir Hom: Ons kan.

column2: Matthew 20:23 And he saith unto them, Ye shall drink indeed of my cup, and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with: but to sit on my right hand, and on my left, is not mine to give, but [it shall be given to them] for whom it is prepared of my Father.
column3: Mattheus 20:23 En Hy sê vir hulle: Dis waar, my beker sal julle drink en met die doop waarmee Ek gedoop word, sal julle gedoop word; maar om te sit aan my regter- en aan my linkerhand berus nie by My om te gee nie, maar is vir hulle vir wie dit deur my Vader berei is.

column2: Matthew 20:24 And when the ten heard [it], they were moved with indignation against the two brethren.
column3: Mattheus 20:24 En toe die tien dit hoor, was hulle verontwaardig oor die twee broers.

column2: Matthew 20:25 But Jesus called them [unto him], and said, Ye know that the princes of the Gentiles exercise dominion over them, and they that are great exercise authority upon them.
column3: Mattheus 20:25 Maar Jesus het hulle na Hom geroep en gesê: Julle weet dat die owerstes van die nasies oor hulle heers en die groot manne oor hulle gesag uitoefen;

column2: Matthew 20:26 But it shall not be so among you: but whosoever will be great among you, let him be your minister;
column3: Mattheus 20:26 maar só moet dit onder julle nie wees nie; maar elkeen wat onder julle groot wil word, moet julle dienaar wees.

column2: Matthew 20:27 And whosoever will be chief among you, let him be your servant:
column3: Mattheus 20:27 En elkeen wat onder julle die eerste wil word, moet julle dienskneg wees;

column2: Matthew 20:28 Even as the Son of man came not to be ministered unto, but to minister, and to give his life a ransom for many.
column3: Mattheus 20:28 net soos die Seun van die mens nie gekom het om gedien te word nie, maar om te dien en sy lewe te gee as ’n losprys vir baie.

column2: Matthew 20:29 And as they departed from Jericho, a great multitude followed him.
column3: Mattheus 20:29 EN toe hulle uit Jérigo uitgaan, het ’n groot menigte Hom gevolg.

column2: Matthew 20:30 And, behold, two blind men sitting by the way side, when they heard that Jesus passed by, cried out, saying, Have mercy on us, O Lord, [thou] Son of David.
column3: Mattheus 20:30 En daar het twee blindes langs die pad gesit; en toe hulle hoor dat Jesus verbygaan, roep hulle uit en sê: Wees ons barmhartig, Here, Seun van Dawid!

column2: Matthew 20:31 And the multitude rebuked them, because they should hold their peace: but they cried the more, saying, Have mercy on us, O Lord, [thou] Son of David.
column3: Mattheus 20:31 En die skare het hulle bestraf, dat hulle moes stilbly; maar hulle het al harder geroep en gesê: Wees ons barmhartig, Here, Seun van Dawid!

column2: Matthew 20:32 And Jesus stood still, and called them, and said, What will ye that I shall do unto you?
column3: Mattheus 20:32 Toe gaan Jesus staan en roep hulle en sê: Wat wil julle hê moet Ek vir julle doen?

column2: Matthew 20:33 They say unto him, Lord, that our eyes may be opened.
column3: Mattheus 20:33 Hulle antwoord Hom: Here, dat ons oë geopen mag word.

column2: Matthew 20:34 So Jesus had compassion [on them], and touched their eyes: and immediately their eyes received sight, and they followed him.
column3: Mattheus 20:34 En Jesus het innig jammer vir hulle gevoel en hulle oë aangeraak, en dadelik het hulle oë gesien, en hulle het Hom gevolg.

column2: Matthew 21:1 And when they drew nigh unto Jerusalem, and were come to Bethphage, unto the mount of Olives, then sent Jesus two disciples,
column3: Mattheus 21:1 EN toe hulle naby Jerusalem gekom en Bétfagé aan die Olyfberg bereik het, stuur Jesus twee dissipels uit en sê vir hulle:

column2: Matthew 21:2 Saying unto them, Go into the village over against you, and straightway ye shall find an ass tied, and a colt with her: loose [them], and bring [them] unto me.
column3: Mattheus 21:2 Gaan na daardie dorp reg voor julle, en dadelik sal julle ’n eselin vind wat vasgemaak is, en ’n vul by haar. Maak haar los en bring hulle vir My.

column2: Matthew 21:3 And if any [man] say ought unto you, ye shall say, The Lord hath need of them; and straightway he will send them.
column3: Mattheus 21:3 En as iemand vir julle iets sê, moet julle antwoord: Die Here het hulle nodig; en dadelik sal hy hulle stuur.

column2: Matthew 21:4 All this was done, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, saying,
column3: Mattheus 21:4 En dit het alles gebeur, sodat vervul sou word die woord wat deur die profeet gespreek is:

column2: Matthew 21:5 Tell ye the daughter of Sion, Behold, thy King cometh unto thee, meek, and sitting upon an ass, and a colt the foal of an ass.
column3: Mattheus 21:5 Sê vir die dogter van Sion: Kyk, jou Koning kom na jou toe, sagmoedig, en Hy sit op ’n esel, ja, ’n jong esel, die vul van ’n pakdier.

column2: Matthew 21:6 And the disciples went, and did as Jesus commanded them,
column3: Mattheus 21:6 En die dissipels het gegaan en gedoen soos Jesus hulle beveel het;

column2: Matthew 21:7 And brought the ass, and the colt, and put on them their clothes, and they set [him] thereon.
column3: Mattheus 21:7 hulle het die esel en die vul gebring en hulle klere daarop gelê, en Hy het daarop gaan sit.

column2: Matthew 21:8 And a very great multitude spread their garments in the way; others cut down branches from the trees, and strawed [them] in the way.
column3: Mattheus 21:8 En die grootste deel van die skare het hulle klere op die pad oopgegooi, en ander het takke van die bome afgekap en op die pad gestrooi.

column2: Matthew 21:9 And the multitudes that went before, and that followed, cried, saying, Hosanna to the Son of David: Blessed [is] he that cometh in the name of the Lord; Hosanna in the highest.
column3: Mattheus 21:9 En die skare wat voor geloop en die wat gevolg het, het uitgeroep en gesê: Hosanna vir die Seun van Dawid! Geseënd is Hy wat kom in die Naam van die Here! Hosanna in die hoogste hemele!

column2: Matthew 21:10 And when he was come into Jerusalem, all the city was moved, saying, Who is this?
column3: Mattheus 21:10 En toe Hy in Jerusalem inkom, het die hele stad in opskudding geraak en gesê: Wie is hierdie man?

column2: Matthew 21:11 And the multitude said, This is Jesus the prophet of Nazareth of Galilee.
column3: Mattheus 21:11 En die skare sê: Dit is Jesus, die profeet, van Násaret in Galiléa.

column2: Matthew 21:12 And Jesus went into the temple of God, and cast out all them that sold and bought in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers, and the seats of them that sold doves,
column3: Mattheus 21:12 EN Jesus het in die tempel van God ingegaan en almal wat in die tempel verkoop en koop, uitgejaag en die tafels van die geldwisselaars en die stoele van die duiweverkopers omgegooi.

column2: Matthew 21:13 And said unto them, It is written, My house shall be called the house of prayer; but ye have made it a den of thieves.
column3: Mattheus 21:13 En Hy sê vir hulle: Daar is geskrywe: My huis moet ’n huis van gebed genoem word. Maar julle het dit ’n rowerspelonk gemaak.

column2: Matthew 21:14 And the blind and the lame came to him in the temple; and he healed them.
column3: Mattheus 21:14 En daar het blindes en kreupeles na Hom gekom in die tempel, en Hy het hulle gesond gemaak.

column2: Matthew 21:15 And when the chief priests and scribes saw the wonderful things that he did, and the children crying in the temple, and saying, Hosanna to the Son of David; they were sore displeased,
column3: Mattheus 21:15 En toe die owerpriesters en skrifgeleerdes die wonderwerke sien wat Hy gedoen het, en die kinders wat in die tempel uitroep en sê: Hosanna vir die Seun van Dawid! was hulle verontwaardig

column2: Matthew 21:16 And said unto him, Hearest thou what these say? And Jesus saith unto them, Yea; have ye never read, Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings thou hast perfected praise?
column3: Mattheus 21:16 en sê vir Hom: Hoor U wat hulle daar sê? En Jesus antwoord hulle: Ja, het julle nooit gelees: Uit die mond van kinders en suigelinge het U vir U lof berei nie?

column2: Matthew 21:17 And he left them, and went out of the city into Bethany; and he lodged there.
column3: Mattheus 21:17 En Hy het hulle verlaat en uit die stad uitgegaan na Betánië en daar vernag.

column2: Matthew 21:18 Now in the morning as he returned into the city, he hungered.
column3: Mattheus 21:18 EN vroeg in die môre toe Hy teruggaan na die stad, het Hy honger gehad;

column2: Matthew 21:19 And when he saw a fig tree in the way, he came to it, and found nothing thereon, but leaves only, and said unto it, Let no fruit grow on thee henceforward for ever. And presently the fig tree withered away.
column3: Mattheus 21:19 en Hy sien ’n vyeboom langs die pad en gaan daarnatoe; maar Hy het niks daaraan gevind nie as net blare alleen; en Hy sê vir hom: Laat daar uit jou tot in ewigheid nooit weer ’n vrug kom nie! En onmiddellik het die vyeboom verdroog.

column2: Matthew 21:20 And when the disciples saw [it], they marvelled, saying, How soon is the fig tree withered away!
column3: Mattheus 21:20 En toe die dissipels dit sien, was hulle verwonderd en sê: Hoe het die vyeboom so onmiddellik verdroog?

column2: Matthew 21:21 Jesus answered and said unto them, Verily I say unto you, If ye have faith, and doubt not, ye shall not only do this [which is done] to the fig tree, but also if ye shall say unto this mountain, Be thou removed, and be thou cast into the sea; it shall be done.
column3: Mattheus 21:21 Maar Jesus antwoord en sê vir hulle: Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, as julle geloof het en nie twyfel nie, sal julle nie alleen doen wat met die vyeboom gebeur het nie; maar al sê julle ook vir hierdie berg: Hef jou op en werp jou in die see — sal dit gebeur.

column2: Matthew 21:22 And all things, whatsoever ye shall ask in prayer, believing, ye shall receive.
column3: Mattheus 21:22 En alles wat julle in die gebed vra, sal julle ontvang as julle glo.

column2: Matthew 21:23 And when he was come into the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people came unto him as he was teaching, and said, By what authority doest thou these things? and who gave thee this authority?
column3: Mattheus 21:23 EN toe Hy in die tempel gegaan het, kom die owerpriesters en die ouderlinge van die volk na Hom terwyl Hy besig was om te leer, en hulle sê: Deur watter gesag doen U hierdie dinge, en wie het U hierdie gesag gegee?

column2: Matthew 21:24 And Jesus answered and said unto them, I also will ask you one thing, which if ye tell me, I in like wise will tell you by what authority I do these things.
column3: Mattheus 21:24 En Jesus antwoord en sê vir hulle: Ek sal julle ook een ding vra, en as julle dit vir My sê, sal Ek julle ook vertel deur watter gesag Ek hierdie dinge doen.

column2: Matthew 21:25 The baptism of John, whence was it? from heaven, or of men? And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say unto us, Why did ye not then believe him?
column3: Mattheus 21:25 Die doop van Johannes, waar was dit vandaan, uit die hemel of uit mense? En hulle het by hulleself geredeneer en gesê: As ons sê: Uit die hemel — dan sal Hy ons vra: Waarom het julle hom dan nie geglo nie?

column2: Matthew 21:26 But if we shall say, Of men; we fear the people; for all hold John as a prophet.
column3: Mattheus 21:26 En as ons sê: Uit mense — dan moet ons oppas vir die menigte, want almal hou Johannes vir ’n profeet.

column2: Matthew 21:27 And they answered Jesus, and said, We cannot tell. And he said unto them, Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things.
column3: Mattheus 21:27 Toe antwoord hulle Jesus en sê: Ons weet nie. Hy sê toe ook vir hulle: Dan vertel Ek julle ook nie deur watter gesag Ek hierdie dinge doen nie.

column2: Matthew 21:28 But what think ye? A [certain] man had two sons; and he came to the first, and said, Son, go work to day in my vineyard.
column3: Mattheus 21:28 MAAR wat dink julle? ’n Man het twee kinders gehad, en hy gaan na die eerste en sê: Kind, gaan werk vandag in my wingerd.

column2: Matthew 21:29 He answered and said, I will not: but afterward he repented, and went.
column3: Mattheus 21:29 En hy antwoord en sê: Ek wil nie; maar later het hy berou gekry en gegaan.

column2: Matthew 21:30 And he came to the second, and said likewise. And he answered and said, I [go], sir: and went not.
column3: Mattheus 21:30 Toe het hy na die tweede gegaan en vir hom net so gesê; en hy antwoord en sê: Ja, heer. En hy het nie gegaan nie.

column2: Matthew 21:31 Whether of them twain did the will of [his] father? They say unto him, The first. Jesus saith unto them, Verily I say unto you, That the publicans and the harlots go into the kingdom of God before you.
column3: Mattheus 21:31 Wie van die twee het die wil van die vader gedoen? Hulle antwoord Hom: Die eerste. Jesus sê vir hulle: Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, die tollenaars en die hoere gaan julle voor in die koninkryk van God.

column2: Matthew 21:32 For John came unto you in the way of righteousness, and ye believed him not: but the publicans and the harlots believed him: and ye, when ye had seen [it], repented not afterward, that ye might believe him.
column3: Mattheus 21:32 Want Johannes het na julle gekom in die weg van geregtigheid, en julle het hom nie geglo nie; maar die tollenaars en die hoere het hom geglo. En julle het dit gesien en tog nie later berou gekry om hom te glo nie.

column2: Matthew 21:33 Hear another parable: There was a certain householder, which planted a vineyard, and hedged it round about, and digged a winepress in it, and built a tower, and let it out to husbandmen, and went into a far country:
column3: Mattheus 21:33 LUISTER na ’n ander gelykenis: Daar was ’n sekere huisheer wat ’n wingerd geplant het; en hy het ’n heining daarom gesit en ’n parskuip daarin gegrawe en ’n wagtoring gebou, en hy het dit aan landbouers verhuur en op reis gegaan.

column2: Matthew 21:34 And when the time of the fruit drew near, he sent his servants to the husbandmen, that they might receive the fruits of it.
column3: Mattheus 21:34 En toe die vrugtetyd nader kom, stuur hy sy diensknegte na die landbouers om sy vrugte te ontvang.

column2: Matthew 21:35 And the husbandmen took his servants, and beat one, and killed another, and stoned another.
column3: Mattheus 21:35 Maar die landbouers het sy diensknegte geneem en een geslaan en ’n ander een doodgemaak en ’n ander een gestenig.

column2: Matthew 21:36 Again, he sent other servants more than the first: and they did unto them likewise.
column3: Mattheus 21:36 Weer het hy ander diensknegte gestuur, meer as die eerstes, en hulle het met dié net so gemaak.

column2: Matthew 21:37 But last of all he sent unto them his son, saying, They will reverence my son.
column3: Mattheus 21:37 Oplaas het hy sy seun na hulle gestuur en gesê: Hulle sal my seun ontsien.

column2: Matthew 21:38 But when the husbandmen saw the son, they said among themselves, This is the heir; come, let us kill him, and let us seize on his inheritance.
column3: Mattheus 21:38 Maar toe die landbouers die seun sien, het hulle onder mekaar gesê: Dit is die erfgenaam; kom laat ons hom doodmaak en sy erfdeel in besit neem.

column2: Matthew 21:39 And they caught him, and cast [him] out of the vineyard, and slew [him].
column3: Mattheus 21:39 En hulle het hom geneem en buitekant die wingerd uitgewerp en doodgemaak.

column2: Matthew 21:40 When the lord therefore of the vineyard cometh, what will he do unto those husbandmen?
column3: Mattheus 21:40 Wanneer die eienaar van die wingerd dan kom, wat sal hy met daardie landbouers doen?

column2: Matthew 21:41 They say unto him, He will miserably destroy those wicked men, and will let out [his] vineyard unto other husbandmen, which shall render him the fruits in their seasons.
column3: Mattheus 21:41 Hulle antwoord Hom: Die slegte mense — hy sal hulle ’n slegte dood laat sterwe en die wingerd verhuur aan ander landbouers wat hom die vrugte op die regte tyd sal gee.

column2: Matthew 21:42 Jesus saith unto them, Did ye never read in the scriptures, The stone which the builders rejected, the same is become the head of the corner: this is the Lord's doing, and it is marvellous in our eyes?
column3: Mattheus 21:42 Jesus sê vir hulle: Het julle nooit in die Skrifte gelees nie: Die steen wat die bouers verwerp het, dit het ’n hoeksteen geword. Hy het van die Here gekom en is wonderbaar in ons oë?

column2: Matthew 21:43 Therefore say I unto you, The kingdom of God shall be taken from you, and given to a nation bringing forth the fruits thereof.
column3: Mattheus 21:43 Daarom sê Ek vir julle: Die koninkryk van God sal van julle weggeneem en aan ’n volk gegee word wat die vrugte daarvan sal dra.

column2: Matthew 21:44 And whosoever shall fall on this stone shall be broken: but on whomsoever it shall fall, it will grind him to powder.
column3: Mattheus 21:44 En hy wat op hierdie steen val, sal verpletter word; maar elkeen op wie hy val, dié sal hy vermorsel.

column2: Matthew 21:45 And when the chief priests and Pharisees had heard his parables, they perceived that he spake of them.
column3: Mattheus 21:45 En toe die owerpriesters en die Fariseërs sy gelykenisse hoor, het hulle begryp dat Hy van hulle spreek.

column2: Matthew 21:46 But when they sought to lay hands on him, they feared the multitude, because they took him for a prophet.
column3: Mattheus 21:46 En hulle het probeer om Hom in hulle mag te kry, maar hulle was bang vir die skare, omdat dié Hom vir ’n profeet gehou het.

column2: Matthew 22:1 And Jesus answered and spake unto them again by parables, and said,
column3: Mattheus 22:1 EN Jesus het weer deur gelykenisse met hulle begin spreek en gesê:

column2: Matthew 22:2 The kingdom of heaven is like unto a certain king, which made a marriage for his son,
column3: Mattheus 22:2 Die koninkryk van die hemele is soos ’n koning wat ’n bruilof vir sy seun berei het

column2: Matthew 22:3 And sent forth his servants to call them that were bidden to the wedding: and they would not come.
column3: Mattheus 22:3 en sy diensknegte uitgestuur het om die genooides na die bruilof te roep, en hulle wou nie kom nie.

column2: Matthew 22:4 Again, he sent forth other servants, saying, Tell them which are bidden, Behold, I have prepared my dinner: my oxen and [my] fatlings [are] killed, and all things [are] ready: come unto the marriage.
column3: Mattheus 22:4 Weer het hy ander diensknegte uitgestuur met die boodskap: Sê vir die genooides: Kyk, my maaltyd het ek berei, my beeste en vetgemaakte vee is geslag en alles is gereed. Kom na die bruilof.

column2: Matthew 22:5 But they made light of [it], and went their ways, one to his farm, another to his merchandise:
column3: Mattheus 22:5 Maar hulle het hul daaraan nie gesteur nie en weggegaan, een na sy eie stuk land en ’n ander na sy handelsaak.

column2: Matthew 22:6 And the remnant took his servants, and entreated [them] spitefully, and slew [them].
column3: Mattheus 22:6 En die origes het sy diensknegte gegryp en mishandel en doodgemaak.

column2: Matthew 22:7 But when the king heard [thereof], he was wroth: and he sent forth his armies, and destroyed those murderers, and burned up their city.
column3: Mattheus 22:7 Toe die koning dit hoor, het hy kwaad geword en sy manskappe gestuur en daardie moordenaars omgebring en hulle stad aan die brand gesteek.

column2: Matthew 22:8 Then saith he to his servants, The wedding is ready, but they which were bidden were not worthy.
column3: Mattheus 22:8 Daarop sê hy vir sy diensknegte: Die bruilof is wel gereed, maar die genooides was dit nie werd nie.

column2: Matthew 22:9 Go ye therefore into the highways, and as many as ye shall find, bid to the marriage.
column3: Mattheus 22:9 Gaan dan op die kruispaaie en nooi almal wat julle mag vind, na die bruilof.

column2: Matthew 22:10 So those servants went out into the highways, and gathered together all as many as they found, both bad and good: and the wedding was furnished with guests.
column3: Mattheus 22:10 En daardie diensknegte het uitgegaan op die paaie en almal versamel wat hulle gevind het, slegtes sowel as goeies, en die bruilofsaal het vol gaste geword.

column2: Matthew 22:11 And when the king came in to see the guests, he saw there a man which had not on a wedding garment:
column3: Mattheus 22:11 En toe die koning ingaan om na die gaste te kyk, sien hy daar iemand wat nie ’n bruilofskleed aan het nie.

column2: Matthew 22:12 And he saith unto him, Friend, how camest thou in hither not having a wedding garment? And he was speechless.
column3: Mattheus 22:12 En hy sê vir hom: Vriend, hoe het jy hier ingekom sonder ’n bruilofskleed aan? En hy kon geen woord sê nie.

column2: Matthew 22:13 Then said the king to the servants, Bind him hand and foot, and take him away, and cast [him] into outer darkness; there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
column3: Mattheus 22:13 Toe sê die koning vir sy dienaars: Bind sy hande en voete, neem hom weg en werp hom in die buitenste duisternis. Daar sal geween wees en gekners van die tande.

column2: Matthew 22:14 For many are called, but few [are] chosen.
column3: Mattheus 22:14 Want baie is geroep, maar min uitverkies.

column2: Matthew 22:15 Then went the Pharisees, and took counsel how they might entangle him in [his] talk.
column3: Mattheus 22:15 TOE gaan die Fariseërs saam raad hou hoe om Hom in sy woord te verstrik.

column2: Matthew 22:16 And they sent out unto him their disciples with the Herodians, saying, Master, we know that thou art true, and teachest the way of God in truth, neither carest thou for any [man]: for thou regardest not the person of men.
column3: Mattheus 22:16 En hulle stuur hul dissipels saam met die Herodiane na Hom en sê: Meester, ons weet dat U waaragtig is en die weg van God in waarheid leer en U aan niemand steur nie, want U sien nie die persoon van mense aan nie —

column2: Matthew 22:17 Tell us therefore, What thinkest thou? Is it lawful to give tribute unto Caesar, or not?
column3: Mattheus 22:17 sê dan vir ons, wat dink U: Is dit geoorloof om aan die keiser belasting te betaal of nie?

column2: Matthew 22:18 But Jesus perceived their wickedness, and said, Why tempt ye me, [ye] hypocrites?
column3: Mattheus 22:18 Maar Jesus het hulle boosheid bemerk en gesê:

column2: Matthew 22:19 Shew me the tribute money. And they brought unto him a penny.
column3: Mattheus 22:19 Geveinsdes, waarom versoek julle My? Wys My die belastingmunt. En hulle het vir Hom ’n penning gebring.

column2: Matthew 22:20 And he saith unto them, Whose [is] this image and superscription?
column3: Mattheus 22:20 En Hy sê vir hulle: Wie se beeld en opskrif is dit?

column2: Matthew 22:21 They say unto him, Caesar's. Then saith he unto them, Render therefore unto Caesar the things which are Caesar's; and unto God the things that are God's.
column3: Mattheus 22:21 Hulle antwoord Hom: Die keiser s’n. Daarop sê Hy vir hulle: Betaal dan aan die keiser wat die keiser toekom, en aan God wat God toekom.

column2: Matthew 22:22 When they had heard [these words], they marvelled, and left him, and went their way.
column3: Mattheus 22:22 En toe hulle dit hoor, was hulle verwonderd en het Hom verlaat en weggegaan.

column2: Matthew 22:23 The same day came to him the Sadducees, which say that there is no resurrection, and asked him,
column3: Mattheus 22:23 DIESELFDE dag kom daar na Hom Sadduseërs, hulle wat sê dat daar geen opstanding is nie, en vra Hom

column2: Matthew 22:24 Saying, Master, Moses said, If a man die, having no children, his brother shall marry his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.
column3: Mattheus 22:24 en sê: Meester, Moses het gesê: As iemand sonder kinders sterwe, moet sy broer sy vrou trou en kinders vir sy broer verwek.

column2: Matthew 22:25 Now there were with us seven brethren: and the first, when he had married a wife, deceased, and, having no issue, left his wife unto his brother:
column3: Mattheus 22:25 Nou was daar by ons sewe broers, en die eerste het getrou en gesterwe; en omdat hy geen kinders gehad het nie, het hy sy vrou vir sy broer agtergelaat.

column2: Matthew 22:26 Likewise the second also, and the third, unto the seventh.
column3: Mattheus 22:26 So ook die tweede en die derde tot die sewende toe.

column2: Matthew 22:27 And last of all the woman died also.
column3: Mattheus 22:27 En laaste van almal het die vrou ook gesterwe.

column2: Matthew 22:28 Therefore in the resurrection whose wife shall she be of the seven? for they all had her.
column3: Mattheus 22:28 In die opstanding dan, van watter een van die sewe sal sy die vrou wees — want hulle almal het haar gehad?

column2: Matthew 22:29 Jesus answered and said unto them, Ye do err, not knowing the scriptures, nor the power of God.
column3: Mattheus 22:29 Toe antwoord Jesus en sê vir hulle: Julle dwaal, omdat julle die Skrifte nie ken nie en ook nie die krag van God nie.

column2: Matthew 22:30 For in the resurrection they neither marry, nor are given in marriage, but are as the angels of God in heaven.
column3: Mattheus 22:30 Want in die opstanding trou hulle nie en word ook nie in die huwelik uitgegee nie, maar is soos engele van God in die hemel.

column2: Matthew 22:31 But as touching the resurrection of the dead, have ye not read that which was spoken unto you by God, saying,
column3: Mattheus 22:31 En wat die opstanding van die dode betref — het julle nie die woord gelees wat tot julle deur God gespreek is nie:

column2: Matthew 22:32 I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob? God is not the God of the dead, but of the living.
column3: Mattheus 22:32 Ek is die God van Abraham en die God van Isak en die God van Jakob? God is nie ’n God van dooies nie, maar van lewendes.

column2: Matthew 22:33 And when the multitude heard [this], they were astonished at his doctrine.
column3: Mattheus 22:33 En toe die skare dit hoor, was hulle verslae oor sy leer.

column2: Matthew 22:34 But when the Pharisees had heard that he had put the Sadducees to silence, they were gathered together.
column3: Mattheus 22:34 EN toe die Fariseërs hoor dat Hy die Sadduseërs die mond gestop het, het hulle almal saam vergader.

column2: Matthew 22:35 Then one of them, [which was] a lawyer, asked [him a question], tempting him, and saying,
column3: Mattheus 22:35 En een van hulle, ’n wetgeleerde, het ’n vraag gestel om Hom te versoek en gesê:

column2: Matthew 22:36 Master, which [is] the great commandment in the law?
column3: Mattheus 22:36 Meester, wat is die groot gebod in die wet?

column2: Matthew 22:37 Jesus said unto him, Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy mind.
column3: Mattheus 22:37 En Jesus antwoord hom: Jy moet die Here jou God liefhê met jou hele hart en met jou hele siel en met jou hele verstand.

column2: Matthew 22:38 This is the first and great commandment.
column3: Mattheus 22:38 Dit is die eerste en groot gebod.

column2: Matthew 22:39 And the second [is] like unto it, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.
column3: Mattheus 22:39 En die tweede wat hiermee gelykstaan: Jy moet jou naaste liefhê soos jouself.

column2: Matthew 22:40 On these two commandments hang all the law and the prophets.
column3: Mattheus 22:40 Aan hierdie twee gebooie hang die hele wet en die profete.

column2: Matthew 22:41 While the Pharisees were gathered together, Jesus asked them,
column3: Mattheus 22:41 EN toe die Fariseërs saamgekom het, vra Jesus hulle

column2: Matthew 22:42 Saying, What think ye of Christ? whose son is he? They say unto him, [The Son] of David.
column3: Mattheus 22:42 en sê: Wat dink julle van die Christus? Wie se seun is Hy? Hulle antwoord Hom: Dawid s’n.

column2: Matthew 22:43 He saith unto them, How then doth David in spirit call him Lord, saying,
column3: Mattheus 22:43 Hy sê vir hulle: Hoe is dit dan dat Dawid Hom in die Gees Here noem as hy sê:

column2: Matthew 22:44 The LORD said unto my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand, till I make thine enemies thy footstool?
column3: Mattheus 22:44 Die Here het tot my Here gespreek: Sit aan my regterhand totdat Ek u vyande gemaak het ’n voetbank van u voete?

column2: Matthew 22:45 If David then call him Lord, how is he his son?
column3: Mattheus 22:45 As Dawid Hom dan Here noem, hoe is Hy sy seun?

column2: Matthew 22:46 And no man was able to answer him a word, neither durst any [man] from that day forth ask him any more [questions].
column3: Mattheus 22:46 En niemand kon Hom ’n woord antwoord nie; ook het geeneen van daardie dag af dit meer gewaag om Hom vrae te stel nie.

column2: Matthew 23:1 Then spake Jesus to the multitude, and to his disciples,
column3: Mattheus 23:1 TOE het Jesus die skare en sy dissipels toegespreek

column2: Matthew 23:2 Saying, The scribes and the Pharisees sit in Moses' seat:
column3: Mattheus 23:2 en gesê: Die skrifgeleerdes en die Fariseërs sit op die stoel van Moses.

column2: Matthew 23:3 All therefore whatsoever they bid you observe, [that] observe and do; but do not ye after their works: for they say, and do not.
column3: Mattheus 23:3 Alles wat hulle dan vir julle mag sê om te onderhou, onderhou en doen dit; maar volgens hulle werke moet julle nie doen nie, want hulle praat en doen nie.

column2: Matthew 23:4 For they bind heavy burdens and grievous to be borne, and lay [them] on men's shoulders; but they [themselves] will not move them with one of their fingers.
column3: Mattheus 23:4 Want hulle bind pakke saam wat swaar en moeilik is om te dra, en sit dit op die skouers van die mense, maar self wil hulle dit nie met hulle vinger verroer nie.

column2: Matthew 23:5 But all their works they do for to be seen of men: they make broad their phylacteries, and enlarge the borders of their garments,
column3: Mattheus 23:5 En hulle doen al hul werke om deur die mense gesien te word, en hulle maak hul gedenkseëls breed en die some van hul klere groot.

column2: Matthew 23:6 And love the uppermost rooms at feasts, and the chief seats in the synagogues,
column3: Mattheus 23:6 En hulle hou van die voorste plekke by die maaltye en die voorste banke in die sinagoges

column2: Matthew 23:7 And greetings in the markets, and to be called of men, Rabbi, Rabbi.
column3: Mattheus 23:7 en die begroetinge op die markte en om deur die mense genoem te word: Rabbi, Rabbi!

column2: Matthew 23:8 But be not ye called Rabbi: for one is your Master, [even] Christ; and all ye are brethren.
column3: Mattheus 23:8 Maar julle, laat jul nie Rabbi noem nie, want een is julle leermeester: Christus, en julle is almal broeders.

column2: Matthew 23:9 And call no [man] your father upon the earth: for one is your Father, which is in heaven.
column3: Mattheus 23:9 En julle moet niemand op die aarde julle vader noem nie, want een is julle Vader, Hy wat in die hemele is.

column2: Matthew 23:10 Neither be ye called masters: for one is your Master, [even] Christ.
column3: Mattheus 23:10 Julle moet julle ook nie leermeesters laat noem nie, want een is julle leermeester: Christus.

column2: Matthew 23:11 But he that is greatest among you shall be your servant.
column3: Mattheus 23:11 Maar die grootste van julle moet jul dienaar wees.

column2: Matthew 23:12 And whosoever shall exalt himself shall be abased; and he that shall humble himself shall be exalted.
column3: Mattheus 23:12 Wie homself verhoog, sal verneder word, en wie homself verneder, sal verhoog word.

column2: Matthew 23:13 But woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye shut up the kingdom of heaven against men: for ye neither go in [yourselves], neither suffer ye them that are entering to go in.
column3: Mattheus 23:13 Maar wee julle, skrifgeleerdes en Fariseërs, geveinsdes, want julle sluit die koninkryk van die hemele toe voor die mense; want julle gaan self nie in nie, en die wat sou ingaan, laat julle nie toe om in te gaan nie.

column2: Matthew 23:14 Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye devour widows' houses, and for a pretence make long prayer: therefore ye shall receive the greater damnation.
column3: Mattheus 23:14 Wee julle, skrifgeleerdes en Fariseërs, geveinsdes, want julle eet die huise van die weduwees op, en doen vir die skyn lang gebede. Daarom sal julle ’n swaarder oordeel ontvang.

column2: Matthew 23:15 Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye compass sea and land to make one proselyte, and when he is made, ye make him twofold more the child of hell than yourselves.
column3: Mattheus 23:15 Wee julle, skrifgeleerdes en Fariseërs, geveinsdes, want julle trek rond oor see en land om een bekeerling te maak; en as hy dit geword het, maak julle hom ’n kind van die hel, twee maal erger as julle self.

column2: Matthew 23:16 Woe unto you, [ye] blind guides, which say, Whosoever shall swear by the temple, it is nothing; but whosoever shall swear by the gold of the temple, he is a debtor!
column3: Mattheus 23:16 Wee julle, blinde leiers, julle wat sê: Elkeen wat sweer by die tempel — dit is niks nie; maar elkeen wat sweer by die goud van die tempel, hy is gebonde.

column2: Matthew 23:17 [Ye] fools and blind: for whether is greater, the gold, or the temple that sanctifieth the gold?
column3: Mattheus 23:17 Julle dwase en blindes, want wat is meer: die goud, of die tempel wat die goud heilig?

column2: Matthew 23:18 And, Whosoever shall swear by the altar, it is nothing; but whosoever sweareth by the gift that is upon it, he is guilty.
column3: Mattheus 23:18 En: Elkeen wat sweer by die altaar — dit is niks nie; maar elkeen wat sweer by die gawe daar bo-op, hy is gebonde.

column2: Matthew 23:19 [Ye] fools and blind: for whether [is] greater, the gift, or the altar that sanctifieth the gift?
column3: Mattheus 23:19 Julle dwase en blindes, want wat is meer: die gawe, of die altaar wat die gawe heilig?

column2: Matthew 23:20 Whoso therefore shall swear by the altar, sweareth by it, and by all things thereon.
column3: Mattheus 23:20 Wie dan sweer by die altaar, sweer dáárby en by alles wat daarop is;

column2: Matthew 23:21 And whoso shall swear by the temple, sweareth by it, and by him that dwelleth therein.
column3: Mattheus 23:21 en wie sweer by die tempel, sweer dáárby en by Hom wat daarin woon;

column2: Matthew 23:22 And he that shall swear by heaven, sweareth by the throne of God, and by him that sitteth thereon.
column3: Mattheus 23:22 en wie sweer by die hemel, sweer by die troon van God en by Hom wat daarop sit.

column2: Matthew 23:23 Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye pay tithe of mint and anise and cummin, and have omitted the weightier [matters] of the law, judgment, mercy, and faith: these ought ye to have done, and not to leave the other undone.
column3: Mattheus 23:23 Wee julle, skrifgeleerdes en Fariseërs, geveinsdes, want julle gee tiendes van kruisement en anys en koljander, en die swaarste van die wet laat julle ná: die reg en die barmhartigheid en die trou. Hierdie dinge behoort julle te doen sonder om die ander na te laat.

column2: Matthew 23:24 [Ye] blind guides, which strain at a gnat, and swallow a camel.
column3: Mattheus 23:24 Blinde leiers, julle wat die muggie uitsif, maar die kameel insluk!

column2: Matthew 23:25 Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye make clean the outside of the cup and of the platter, but within they are full of extortion and excess.
column3: Mattheus 23:25 Wee julle, skrifgeleerdes en Fariseërs, geveinsdes, want julle maak die buitekant van die beker en die skottel skoon, maar binnekant is dit vol roof en onmatigheid.

column2: Matthew 23:26 [Thou] blind Pharisee, cleanse first that [which is] within the cup and platter, that the outside of them may be clean also.
column3: Mattheus 23:26 Blinde Fariseër, maak eers die binnekant van die beker en die skottel skoon, sodat ook die buitekant daarvan skoon kan word.

column2: Matthew 23:27 Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye are like unto whited sepulchres, which indeed appear beautiful outward, but are within full of dead [men's] bones, and of all uncleanness.
column3: Mattheus 23:27 Wee julle, skrifgeleerdes en Fariseërs, geveinsdes, want julle is net soos gewitte grafte wat van buite wel fraai lyk, maar van binne vol doodsbene en allerhande onreinheid is.

column2: Matthew 23:28 Even so ye also outwardly appear righteous unto men, but within ye are full of hypocrisy and iniquity.
column3: Mattheus 23:28 So lyk julle ook van buite vir die mense wel regverdig, maar van binne is julle vol geveinsdheid en ongeregtigheid.

column2: Matthew 23:29 Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! because ye build the tombs of the prophets, and garnish the sepulchres of the righteous,
column3: Mattheus 23:29 Wee julle, skrifgeleerdes en Fariseërs, geveinsdes, want julle bou die grafte van die profete en versier die grafstene van die regverdiges;

column2: Matthew 23:30 And say, If we had been in the days of our fathers, we would not have been partakers with them in the blood of the prophets.
column3: Mattheus 23:30 en julle sê: As ons in die dae van ons vaders geleef het, sou ons geen deel met hulle gehad het aan die bloed van die profete nie.

column2: Matthew 23:31 Wherefore ye be witnesses unto yourselves, that ye are the children of them which killed the prophets.
column3: Mattheus 23:31 Julle gee dus teen julself getuienis dat julle kinders is van die wat die profete vermoor het.

column2: Matthew 23:32 Fill ye up then the measure of your fathers.
column3: Mattheus 23:32 Maak die maat van julle vaders dan vol!

column2: Matthew 23:33 [Ye] serpents, [ye] generation of vipers, how can ye escape the damnation of hell?
column3: Mattheus 23:33 Slange, addergeslag, hoe sal julle die oordeel van die hel ontvlug?

column2: Matthew 23:34 Wherefore, behold, I send unto you prophets, and wise men, and scribes: and [some] of them ye shall kill and crucify; and [some] of them shall ye scourge in your synagogues, and persecute [them] from city to city:
column3: Mattheus 23:34 Daarom, kyk, Ek stuur profete en wyse manne en skrifgeleerdes na julle toe, en julle sal sommige van hulle doodmaak en kruisig en sommige van hulle in jul sinagoges gésel en van die een stad na die ander vervolg,

column2: Matthew 23:35 That upon you may come all the righteous blood shed upon the earth, from the blood of righteous Abel unto the blood of Zacharias son of Barachias, whom ye slew between the temple and the altar.
column3: Mattheus 23:35 sodat oor julle kan kom al die regverdige bloed wat vergiet is op die aarde, van die bloed van die regverdige Abel af tot op die bloed van Sagaría, die seun van Berégja, wat julle vermoor het tussen die tempel en die altaar.

column2: Matthew 23:36 Verily I say unto you, All these things shall come upon this generation.
column3: Mattheus 23:36 Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, al hierdie dinge sal oor hierdie geslag kom.

column2: Matthew 23:37 O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, [thou] that killest the prophets, and stonest them which are sent unto thee, how often would I have gathered thy children together, even as a hen gathereth her chickens under [her] wings, and ye would not!
column3: Mattheus 23:37 Jerusalem, Jerusalem, jy wat die profete doodmaak en stenig dié wat na jou gestuur is, hoe dikwels wou Ek jou kinders bymekaarmaak net soos ’n hen haar kuikens onder die vlerke bymekaarmaak, en julle wou nie!

column2: Matthew 23:38 Behold, your house is left unto you desolate.
column3: Mattheus 23:38 Kyk, julle huis word vir julle woes gelaat!

column2: Matthew 23:39 For I say unto you, Ye shall not see me henceforth, till ye shall say, Blessed [is] he that cometh in the name of the Lord.
column3: Mattheus 23:39 Want Ek sê vir julle: Julle sal My van nou af sekerlik nie sien nie totdat julle sal sê: Geseënd is Hy wat kom in die Naam van die Here!

column2: Matthew 24:1 And Jesus went out, and departed from the temple: and his disciples came to [him] for to shew him the buildings of the temple.
column3: Mattheus 24:1 EN Jesus het uitgegaan en van die tempel vertrek, en sy dissipels het nader gekom om Hom die geboue van die tempel te wys.

column2: Matthew 24:2 And Jesus said unto them, See ye not all these things? verily I say unto you, There shall not be left here one stone upon another, that shall not be thrown down.
column3: Mattheus 24:2 En Jesus sê vir hulle: Sien julle al hierdie dinge? Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, daar sal hier sekerlik nie een klip op die ander gelaat word, wat nie afgebreek sal word nie.

column2: Matthew 24:3 And as he sat upon the mount of Olives, the disciples came unto him privately, saying, Tell us, when shall these things be? and what [shall be] the sign of thy coming, and of the end of the world?
column3: Mattheus 24:3 En toe Hy op die Olyfberg gaan sit het, kom die dissipels alleen na Hom en sê: Vertel ons, wanneer sal hierdie dinge wees, en wat is die teken van u koms en van die voleinding van die wêreld?

column2: Matthew 24:4 And Jesus answered and said unto them, Take heed that no man deceive you.
column3: Mattheus 24:4 En Jesus antwoord en sê vir hulle: Pas op dat niemand julle mislei nie.

column2: Matthew 24:5 For many shall come in my name, saying, I am Christ; and shall deceive many.
column3: Mattheus 24:5 Want baie sal onder my Naam kom en sê: Ek is die Christus! en hulle sal baie mense mislei.

column2: Matthew 24:6 And ye shall hear of wars and rumours of wars: see that ye be not troubled: for all [these things] must come to pass, but the end is not yet.
column3: Mattheus 24:6 En julle sal hoor van oorloë en gerugte van oorloë. Pas op, moenie verskrik word nie, want alles moet plaasvind, maar dit is nog nie die einde nie.

column2: Matthew 24:7 For nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom: and there shall be famines, and pestilences, and earthquakes, in divers places.
column3: Mattheus 24:7 Want die een nasie sal teen die ander opstaan en die een koninkryk teen die ander; en daar sal hongersnode wees en pessiektes en aardbewings op verskillende plekke.

column2: Matthew 24:8 All these [are] the beginning of sorrows.
column3: Mattheus 24:8 Maar al hierdie dinge is ’n begin van die smarte.

column2: Matthew 24:9 Then shall they deliver you up to be afflicted, and shall kill you: and ye shall be hated of all nations for my name's sake.
column3: Mattheus 24:9 Dan sal hulle jul aan verdrukking oorgee en julle doodmaak; en julle sal deur al die nasies gehaat word ter wille van my Naam.

column2: Matthew 24:10 And then shall many be offended, and shall betray one another, and shall hate one another.
column3: Mattheus 24:10 En dan sal baie tot struikel gebring word en mekaar verraai en mekaar haat.

column2: Matthew 24:11 And many false prophets shall rise, and shall deceive many.
column3: Mattheus 24:11 En baie valse profete sal opstaan en baie mense mislei.

column2: Matthew 24:12 And because iniquity shall abound, the love of many shall wax cold.
column3: Mattheus 24:12 En omdat die ongeregtigheid vermeerder word, sal die liefde van die meeste verkoel.

column2: Matthew 24:13 But he that shall endure unto the end, the same shall be saved.
column3: Mattheus 24:13 Maar wie volhard tot die einde toe, hy sal gered word.

column2: Matthew 24:14 And this gospel of the kingdom shall be preached in all the world for a witness unto all nations; and then shall the end come.
column3: Mattheus 24:14 En hierdie evangelie van die koninkryk sal verkondig word in die hele wêreld tot ’n getuienis vir al die nasies; en dan sal die einde kom.

column2: Matthew 24:15 When ye therefore shall see the abomination of desolation, spoken of by Daniel the prophet, stand in the holy place, (whoso readeth, let him understand:)
column3: Mattheus 24:15 WANNEER julle dan die gruwel van die verwoesting, waarvan gespreek is deur die profeet Daniël, sien staan in die heiligdom — laat hy wat lees, oplet —

column2: Matthew 24:16 Then let them which be in Judaea flee into the mountains:
column3: Mattheus 24:16 dan moet die wat in Judéa is, na die berge vlug;

column2: Matthew 24:17 Let him which is on the housetop not come down to take any thing out of his house:
column3: Mattheus 24:17 wie op die dak is, moet nie afkom om iets uit sy huis weg te neem nie;

column2: Matthew 24:18 Neither let him which is in the field return back to take his clothes.
column3: Mattheus 24:18 en wie op die land is, moet nie omdraai om sy klere weg te neem nie.

column2: Matthew 24:19 And woe unto them that are with child, and to them that give suck in those days!
column3: Mattheus 24:19 Maar wee die vroue wat swanger is en die wat nog soog, in daardie dae.

column2: Matthew 24:20 But pray ye that your flight be not in the winter, neither on the sabbath day:
column3: Mattheus 24:20 En bid dat julle vlug nie in die winter of op die sabbat mag plaasvind nie.

column2: Matthew 24:21 For then shall be great tribulation, such as was not since the beginning of the world to this time, no, nor ever shall be.
column3: Mattheus 24:21 Want dan sal daar groot verdrukking wees soos daar van die begin van die wêreld af tot nou toe nie gewees het en ook nooit sal wees nie.

column2: Matthew 24:22 And except those days should be shortened, there should no flesh be saved: but for the elect's sake those days shall be shortened.
column3: Mattheus 24:22 En as daardie dae nie verkort was nie, sou geen vlees gered word nie; maar ter wille van die uitverkorenes sal daardie dae verkort word.

column2: Matthew 24:23 Then if any man shall say unto you, Lo, here [is] Christ, or there; believe [it] not.
column3: Mattheus 24:23 As iemand dán vir julle sê: Kyk, hier is die Christus! of: Daar! — moet dit nie glo nie.

column2: Matthew 24:24 For there shall arise false Christs, and false prophets, and shall shew great signs and wonders; insomuch that, if [it were] possible, they shall deceive the very elect.
column3: Mattheus 24:24 Want daar sal valse christusse en valse profete opstaan, en hulle sal groot tekens en wonders doen om, as dit moontlik was, ook die uitverkorenes te mislei.

column2: Matthew 24:25 Behold, I have told you before.
column3: Mattheus 24:25 Kyk, Ek het dit vir julle vooruit gesê.

column2: Matthew 24:26 Wherefore if they shall say unto you, Behold, he is in the desert; go not forth: behold, [he is] in the secret chambers; believe [it] not.
column3: Mattheus 24:26 As hulle dan vir julle sê: Kyk, Hy is in die woestyn — moenie uitgaan nie; kyk, Hy is in die binnekamer — moet dit nie glo nie.

column2: Matthew 24:27 For as the lightning cometh out of the east, and shineth even unto the west; so shall also the coming of the Son of man be.
column3: Mattheus 24:27 Want soos die weerlig uit die ooste uitslaan en tot in die weste skyn, so sal ook die koms van die Seun van die mens wees.

column2: Matthew 24:28 For wheresoever the carcase is, there will the eagles be gathered together.
column3: Mattheus 24:28 Want oral waar die dooie liggaam lê, daar sal die aasvoëls saamkom.

column2: Matthew 24:29 Immediately after the tribulation of those days shall the sun be darkened, and the moon shall not give her light, and the stars shall fall from heaven, and the powers of the heavens shall be shaken:
column3: Mattheus 24:29 EN dadelik ná die verdrukking van daardie dae sal die son verduister word, en die maan sal sy glans nie gee nie, en die sterre sal van die hemel val, en die kragte van die hemele sal geskud word.

column2: Matthew 24:30 And then shall appear the sign of the Son of man in heaven: and then shall all the tribes of the earth mourn, and they shall see the Son of man coming in the clouds of heaven with power and great glory.
column3: Mattheus 24:30 En dan sal die teken van die Seun van die mens in die hemel verskyn, en dan sal al die stamme van die aarde rou bedryf en die Seun van die mens sien kom op die wolke van die hemel met groot krag en heerlikheid.

column2: Matthew 24:31 And he shall send his angels with a great sound of a trumpet, and they shall gather together his elect from the four winds, from one end of heaven to the other.
