column3: Mattheus 24:31 En Hy sal sy engele uitstuur met harde trompetgeluid, en hulle sal sy uitverkorenes versamel uit die vier windstreke, van die een einde van die hemele af tot die ander einde daarvan.

column2: Matthew 24:32 Now learn a parable of the fig tree; When his branch is yet tender, and putteth forth leaves, ye know that summer [is] nigh:
column3: Mattheus 24:32 En leer van die vyeboom hierdie gelykenis: Wanneer sy tak al sag word en sy blare uitbot, weet julle dat die somer naby is.

column2: Matthew 24:33 So likewise ye, when ye shall see all these things, know that it is near, [even] at the doors.
column3: Mattheus 24:33 So weet julle ook, wanneer julle ál hierdie dinge sien, dat dit naby is, voor die deur.

column2: Matthew 24:34 Verily I say unto you, This generation shall not pass, till all these things be fulfilled.
column3: Mattheus 24:34 Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, hierdie geslag sal sekerlik nie verbygaan voordat al hierdie dinge gebeur het nie.

column2: Matthew 24:35 Heaven and earth shall pass away, but my words shall not pass away.
column3: Mattheus 24:35 Die hemel en die aarde sal verbygaan, maar my woorde sal nooit verbygaan nie.

column2: Matthew 24:36 But of that day and hour knoweth no [man], no, not the angels of heaven, but my Father only.
column3: Mattheus 24:36 MAAR van dié dag en dié uur weet niemand nie, ook die engele van die hemele nie, maar net my Vader alleen.

column2: Matthew 24:37 But as the days of Noe [were], so shall also the coming of the Son of man be.
column3: Mattheus 24:37 En net soos die dae van Noag was, so sal ook die koms van die Seun van die mens wees.

column2: Matthew 24:38 For as in the days that were before the flood they were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until the day that Noe entered into the ark,
column3: Mattheus 24:38 Want net soos hulle was in die dae voor die sondvloed toe hulle geëet en gedrink het, getrou en in die huwelik uitgegee het, tot op die dag dat Noag in die ark gegaan het,

column2: Matthew 24:39 And knew not until the flood came, and took them all away; so shall also the coming of the Son of man be.
column3: Mattheus 24:39 en dit nie verstaan het voordat die sondvloed gekom en almal weggevoer het nie, so sal ook die koms van die Seun van die mens wees.

column2: Matthew 24:40 Then shall two be in the field; the one shall be taken, and the other left.
column3: Mattheus 24:40 Dan sal daar twee op die land wees; die een word aangeneem en die ander word verlaat.

column2: Matthew 24:41 Two [women shall be] grinding at the mill; the one shall be taken, and the other left.
column3: Mattheus 24:41 Twee vroue sal by die meul maal; die een word aangeneem en die ander word verlaat.

column2: Matthew 24:42 Watch therefore: for ye know not what hour your Lord doth come.
column3: Mattheus 24:42 Waak dan, omdat julle nie weet watter uur julle Here kom nie.

column2: Matthew 24:43 But know this, that if the goodman of the house had known in what watch the thief would come, he would have watched, and would not have suffered his house to be broken up.
column3: Mattheus 24:43 Maar weet dit: as die huisheer geweet het in watter nagwaak die dief sou kom, sou hy gewaak en nie toegelaat het dat in sy huis ingebreek word nie.

column2: Matthew 24:44 Therefore be ye also ready: for in such an hour as ye think not the Son of man cometh.
column3: Mattheus 24:44 Daarom moet julle ook gereed wees, want die Seun van die mens kom op ’n uur dat julle dit nie verwag nie.

column2: Matthew 24:45 Who then is a faithful and wise servant, whom his lord hath made ruler over his household, to give them meat in due season?
column3: Mattheus 24:45 WIE is dan die getroue en verstandige dienskneg vir wie sy heer oor sy diensvolk aangestel het om hulle hul voedsel op tyd te gee?

column2: Matthew 24:46 Blessed [is] that servant, whom his lord when he cometh shall find so doing.
column3: Mattheus 24:46 Gelukkig is daardie dienskneg vir wie sy heer, as hy kom, op hierdie manier besig sal vind.

column2: Matthew 24:47 Verily I say unto you, That he shall make him ruler over all his goods.
column3: Mattheus 24:47 Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, hy sal hom oor al sy besittings aanstel.

column2: Matthew 24:48 But and if that evil servant shall say in his heart, My lord delayeth his coming;
column3: Mattheus 24:48 Maar as daardie slegte dienskneg in sy hart sê: My heer talm om te kom —

column2: Matthew 24:49 And shall begin to smite [his] fellowservants, and to eat and drink with the drunken;
column3: Mattheus 24:49 en hy sy medediensknegte begin slaan en saam met die dronkaards begin eet en drink,

column2: Matthew 24:50 The lord of that servant shall come in a day when he looketh not for [him], and in an hour that he is not aware of,
column3: Mattheus 24:50 dan sal die heer van dié dienskneg kom op ’n dag dat hy dit nie verwag nie en op ’n uur dat hy dit nie weet nie;

column2: Matthew 24:51 And shall cut him asunder, and appoint [him] his portion with the hypocrites: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
column3: Mattheus 24:51 en sal hom pynig en hom ’n deelgenoot van die geveinsdes maak. Daar sal geween wees en gekners van die tande.

column2: Matthew 25:1 Then shall the kingdom of heaven be likened unto ten virgins, which took their lamps, and went forth to meet the bridegroom.
column3: Mattheus 25:1 DAN sal die koninkryk van die hemele wees soos tien maagde wat hulle lampe geneem en uitgegaan het om die bruidegom te ontmoet.

column2: Matthew 25:2 And five of them were wise, and five [were] foolish.
column3: Mattheus 25:2 En vyf van hulle was verstandig en vyf dwaas.

column2: Matthew 25:3 They that [were] foolish took their lamps, and took no oil with them:
column3: Mattheus 25:3 En toe die wat dwaas was, hul lampe neem, het hulle geen olie met hulle saamgeneem nie.

column2: Matthew 25:4 But the wise took oil in their vessels with their lamps.
column3: Mattheus 25:4 Maar die verstandiges het olie in hulle kanne saam met hul lampe geneem.

column2: Matthew 25:5 While the bridegroom tarried, they all slumbered and slept.
column3: Mattheus 25:5 En terwyl die bruidegom talm om te kom, het hulle almal vaak geword en aan die slaap geraak.

column2: Matthew 25:6 And at midnight there was a cry made, Behold, the bridegroom cometh; go ye out to meet him.
column3: Mattheus 25:6 En middernag was daar ’n geroep: Daar kom die bruidegom; gaan uit hom tegemoet!

column2: Matthew 25:7 Then all those virgins arose, and trimmed their lamps.
column3: Mattheus 25:7 Toe staan al daardie maagde op en maak hulle lampe gereed.

column2: Matthew 25:8 And the foolish said unto the wise, Give us of your oil; for our lamps are gone out.
column3: Mattheus 25:8 En die wat dwaas was, sê aan die verstandiges: Gee vir ons van julle olie, want ons lampe gaan uit.

column2: Matthew 25:9 But the wise answered, saying, [Not so]; lest there be not enough for us and you: but go ye rather to them that sell, and buy for yourselves.
column3: Mattheus 25:9 Maar die verstandiges antwoord en sê: Miskien sal daar nie genoeg wees vir ons en vir julle nie. Maar gaan liewer na die verkopers en koop vir julleself.

column2: Matthew 25:10 And while they went to buy, the bridegroom came; and they that were ready went in with him to the marriage: and the door was shut.
column3: Mattheus 25:10 En onderwyl hulle gaan om te koop, het die bruidegom gekom. En die wat gereed was, het saam met hom ingegaan na die bruilof, en die deur is gesluit.

column2: Matthew 25:11 Afterward came also the other virgins, saying, Lord, Lord, open to us.
column3: Mattheus 25:11 Later kom toe die ander maagde ook en sê: Meneer, Meneer, maak vir ons oop!

column2: Matthew 25:12 But he answered and said, Verily I say unto you, I know you not.
column3: Mattheus 25:12 Maar hy antwoord en sê: Voorwaar ek sê vir julle, ek ken julle nie.

column2: Matthew 25:13 Watch therefore, for ye know neither the day nor the hour wherein the Son of man cometh.
column3: Mattheus 25:13 Waak dan, omdat julle die dag en die uur nie weet waarop die Seun van die mens kom nie.

column2: Matthew 25:14 For [the kingdom of heaven is] as a man travelling into a far country, [who] called his own servants, and delivered unto them his goods.
column3: Mattheus 25:14 WANT dit is soos ’n man wat op reis wou gaan en sy diensknegte roep en aan hulle sy besittings toevertrou.

column2: Matthew 25:15 And unto one he gave five talents, to another two, and to another one; to every man according to his several ability; and straightway took his journey.
column3: Mattheus 25:15 En aan die een gee hy vyf talente en aan die ander twee en aan die ander een, aan elkeen na sy vermoë; en hy het dadelik op reis gegaan.

column2: Matthew 25:16 Then he that had received the five talents went and traded with the same, and made [them] other five talents.
column3: Mattheus 25:16 En die een wat die vyf talente ontvang het, het daarmee gaan werk en vyf ander talente gewin.

column2: Matthew 25:17 And likewise he that [had received] two, he also gained other two.
column3: Mattheus 25:17 Net so het die een wat die twee ontvang het, self ook twee ander verdien.

column2: Matthew 25:18 But he that had received one went and digged in the earth, and hid his lord's money.
column3: Mattheus 25:18 Maar hy wat die een ontvang het, het in die grond gaan grawe en die geld van sy heer weggesteek.

column2: Matthew 25:19 After a long time the lord of those servants cometh, and reckoneth with them.
column3: Mattheus 25:19 En ná ’n lang tyd het die heer van daardie diensknegte gekom en met hulle afgereken.

column2: Matthew 25:20 And so he that had received five talents came and brought other five talents, saying, Lord, thou deliveredst unto me five talents: behold, I have gained beside them five talents more.
column3: Mattheus 25:20 En die een wat die vyf talente ontvang het, kom en bring vyf ander talente en sê: Meneer, vyf talente het u aan my toevertrou; hier het ek vyf ander talente daarby verdien.

column2: Matthew 25:21 His lord said unto him, Well done, [thou] good and faithful servant: thou hast been faithful over a few things, I will make thee ruler over many things: enter thou into the joy of thy lord.
column3: Mattheus 25:21 En sy heer sê vir hom: Mooi so, goeie en getroue dienskneg, oor weinig was jy getrou, oor veel sal ek jou aanstel. Gaan in in die vreugde van jou heer.

column2: Matthew 25:22 He also that had received two talents came and said, Lord, thou deliveredst unto me two talents: behold, I have gained two other talents beside them.
column3: Mattheus 25:22 En die een wat die twee talente ontvang het, kom ook en sê: Meneer, twee talente het u aan my toevertrou; hier het ek twee ander talente daarby verdien.

column2: Matthew 25:23 His lord said unto him, Well done, good and faithful servant; thou hast been faithful over a few things, I will make thee ruler over many things: enter thou into the joy of thy lord.
column3: Mattheus 25:23 Sy heer sê vir hom: Mooi so, goeie en getroue dienskneg, oor weinig was jy getrou, oor veel sal ek jou aanstel. Gaan in in die vreugde van jou heer.

column2: Matthew 25:24 Then he which had received the one talent came and said, Lord, I knew thee that thou art an hard man, reaping where thou hast not sown, and gathering where thou hast not strawed:
column3: Mattheus 25:24 En die een wat die een talent ontvang het, kom ook en sê: Meneer, ek het u geken, dat u ’n harde man is wat maai waar u nie gesaai het nie, en bymekaarmaak waar u nie uitgestrooi het nie;

column2: Matthew 25:25 And I was afraid, and went and hid thy talent in the earth: lo, [there] thou hast [that is] thine.
column3: Mattheus 25:25 omdat ek bang was, het ek gegaan en u talent in die grond weggesteek. Hier het u wat aan u behoort.

column2: Matthew 25:26 His lord answered and said unto him, [Thou] wicked and slothful servant, thou knewest that I reap where I sowed not, and gather where I have not strawed:
column3: Mattheus 25:26 Maar sy heer antwoord en sê vir hom: Jou slegte en luie dienskneg, jy het geweet dat ek maai waar ek nie gesaai het nie, en bymekaarmaak waar ek nie uitgestrooi het nie.

column2: Matthew 25:27 Thou oughtest therefore to have put my money to the exchangers, and [then] at my coming I should have received mine own with usury.
column3: Mattheus 25:27 Daarom moes jy my geld by die wisselaars gestort het, en ek sou by my koms wat aan my behoort, met rente ontvang het.

column2: Matthew 25:28 Take therefore the talent from him, and give [it] unto him which hath ten talents.
column3: Mattheus 25:28 Neem dan die talent van hom weg en gee dit aan die een wat die tien talente het;

column2: Matthew 25:29 For unto every one that hath shall be given, and he shall have abundance: but from him that hath not shall be taken away even that which he hath.
column3: Mattheus 25:29 want aan elkeen wat het, sal gegee word, en hy sal oorvloed hê; maar van hom wat nie het nie, van hom sal weggeneem word ook wat hy het.

column2: Matthew 25:30 And cast ye the unprofitable servant into outer darkness: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
column3: Mattheus 25:30 En werp die nuttelose dienskneg uit in die buitenste duisternis; daar sal geween wees en gekners van die tande.

column2: Matthew 25:31 When the Son of man shall come in his glory, and all the holy angels with him, then shall he sit upon the throne of his glory:
column3: Mattheus 25:31 EN wanneer die Seun van die mens in sy heerlikheid kom en al die heilige engele saam met Hom, dan sal Hy op sy heerlike troon sit;

column2: Matthew 25:32 And before him shall be gathered all nations: and he shall separate them one from another, as a shepherd divideth [his] sheep from the goats:
column3: Mattheus 25:32 en voor Hom sal al die nasies versamel word, en Hy sal hulle van mekaar afskei soos die herder die skape van die bokke afskei;

column2: Matthew 25:33 And he shall set the sheep on his right hand, but the goats on the left.
column3: Mattheus 25:33 en Hy sal die skape aan sy regterhand en die bokke aan sy linkerhand sit.

column2: Matthew 25:34 Then shall the King say unto them on his right hand, Come, ye blessed of my Father, inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world:
column3: Mattheus 25:34 Dan sal die Koning vir die wat aan sy regterhand is, sê: Kom, julle geseëndes van my Vader, beërf die koninkryk wat vir julle berei is van die grondlegging van die wêreld af.

column2: Matthew 25:35 For I was an hungred, and ye gave me meat: I was thirsty, and ye gave me drink: I was a stranger, and ye took me in:
column3: Mattheus 25:35 Want Ek het honger gehad, en julle het My te ete gegee; Ek het dors gehad, en julle het My te drinke gegee; Ek was ’n vreemdeling, en julle het My herberg gegee;

column2: Matthew 25:36 Naked, and ye clothed me: I was sick, and ye visited me: I was in prison, and ye came unto me.
column3: Mattheus 25:36 Ek was naak, en julle het My geklee; Ek was siek, en julle het My besoek; in die gevangenis was Ek, en julle het na My gekom.

column2: Matthew 25:37 Then shall the righteous answer him, saying, Lord, when saw we thee an hungred, and fed [thee]? or thirsty, and gave [thee] drink?
column3: Mattheus 25:37 Dan sal die regverdiges Hom antwoord en sê: Here, wanneer het ons U honger gesien en gevoed; of dors, en te drinke gegee?

column2: Matthew 25:38 When saw we thee a stranger, and took [thee] in? or naked, and clothed [thee]?
column3: Mattheus 25:38 En wanneer het ons U ’n vreemdeling gesien, en herberg gegee; of naak, en geklee?

column2: Matthew 25:39 Or when saw we thee sick, or in prison, and came unto thee?
column3: Mattheus 25:39 En wanneer het ons U siek gesien of in die gevangenis, en na U gekom?

column2: Matthew 25:40 And the King shall answer and say unto them, Verily I say unto you, Inasmuch as ye have done [it] unto one of the least of these my brethren, ye have done [it] unto me.
column3: Mattheus 25:40 En die Koning sal antwoord en vir hulle sê: Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, vir sover julle dit gedoen het aan een van die geringstes van hierdie broeders van My, het julle dit aan My gedoen.

column2: Matthew 25:41 Then shall he say also unto them on the left hand, Depart from me, ye cursed, into everlasting fire, prepared for the devil and his angels:
column3: Mattheus 25:41 Dan sal Hy ook vir dié aan sy linkerhand sê: Gaan weg van My, julle vervloektes, in die ewige vuur wat berei is vir die duiwel en sy engele.

column2: Matthew 25:42 For I was an hungred, and ye gave me no meat: I was thirsty, and ye gave me no drink:
column3: Mattheus 25:42 Want Ek het honger gehad, en julle het My nie te ete gegee nie; Ek het dors gehad, en julle het My nie te drinke gegee nie.

column2: Matthew 25:43 I was a stranger, and ye took me not in: naked, and ye clothed me not: sick, and in prison, and ye visited me not.
column3: Mattheus 25:43 Ek was ’n vreemdeling, en julle het vir My nie herberg gegee nie; naak, en julle het My nie geklee nie; siek en in die gevangenis, en julle het My nie besoek nie.

column2: Matthew 25:44 Then shall they also answer him, saying, Lord, when saw we thee an hungred, or athirst, or a stranger, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and did not minister unto thee?
column3: Mattheus 25:44 Dan sal hulle Hom ook antwoord en sê: Here, wanneer het ons U honger gesien of dors of ’n vreemdeling of naak of siek of in die gevangenis, en U nie gedien nie?

column2: Matthew 25:45 Then shall he answer them, saying, Verily I say unto you, Inasmuch as ye did [it] not to one of the least of these, ye did [it] not to me.
column3: Mattheus 25:45 Dan sal Hy hulle antwoord en sê: Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, vir sover julle dit nie gedoen het aan een van hierdie geringstes nie, het julle dit aan My ook nie gedoen nie.

column2: Matthew 25:46 And these shall go away into everlasting punishment: but the righteous into life eternal.
column3: Mattheus 25:46 En hulle sal weggaan in die ewige straf, maar die regverdiges in die ewige lewe.

column2: Matthew 26:1 And it came to pass, when Jesus had finished all these sayings, he said unto his disciples,
column3: Mattheus 26:1 EN toe Jesus al hierdie woorde geëindig het, sê Hy vir sy dissipels:

column2: Matthew 26:2 Ye know that after two days is [the feast of] the passover, and the Son of man is betrayed to be crucified.
column3: Mattheus 26:2 Julle weet dat oor twee dae die pasga kom, dan word die Seun van die mens oorgelewer om gekruisig te word.

column2: Matthew 26:3 Then assembled together the chief priests, and the scribes, and the elders of the people, unto the palace of the high priest, who was called Caiaphas,
column3: Mattheus 26:3 Toe kom die owerpriesters en die skrifgeleerdes en die ouderlinge van die volk bymekaar in die paleis van die hoëpriester wat Kájafas genoem word,

column2: Matthew 26:4 And consulted that they might take Jesus by subtilty, and kill [him].
column3: Mattheus 26:4 en hou saam raad om Jesus met lis gevange te neem en om die lewe te bring.

column2: Matthew 26:5 But they said, Not on the feast [day], lest there be an uproar among the people.
column3: Mattheus 26:5 Maar hulle het gesê: Nie op die fees nie, sodat daar nie miskien oproer onder die volk kom nie.

column2: Matthew 26:6 Now when Jesus was in Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper,
column3: Mattheus 26:6 EN toe Jesus in Betánië was in die huis van Simon, die melaatse,

column2: Matthew 26:7 There came unto him a woman having an alabaster box of very precious ointment, and poured it on his head, as he sat [at meat].
column3: Mattheus 26:7 kom ’n vrou na Hom met ’n albaste fles met baie kosbare salf, en sy gooi dit op sy hoof uit terwyl Hy aan tafel was.

column2: Matthew 26:8 But when his disciples saw [it], they had indignation, saying, To what purpose [is] this waste?
column3: Mattheus 26:8 En toe sy dissipels dit sien, was hulle verontwaardig en sê: Waarvoor is hierdie verkwisting?

column2: Matthew 26:9 For this ointment might have been sold for much, and given to the poor.
column3: Mattheus 26:9 Want hierdie salf kon duur verkoop en die geld aan die armes gegee geword het.

column2: Matthew 26:10 When Jesus understood [it], he said unto them, Why trouble ye the woman? for she hath wrought a good work upon me.
column3: Mattheus 26:10 Maar toe Jesus dit merk, sê Hy vir hulle: Waarom val julle die vrou lastig? Want sy het ’n goeie werk aan My gedoen.

column2: Matthew 26:11 For ye have the poor always with you; but me ye have not always.
column3: Mattheus 26:11 Want die armes het julle altyd by julle, maar My het julle nie altyd nie.

column2: Matthew 26:12 For in that she hath poured this ointment on my body, she did [it] for my burial.
column3: Mattheus 26:12 Want toe sy hierdie salf op my liggaam uitgegooi het, het sy dit gedoen met die oog op my begrafnis.

column2: Matthew 26:13 Verily I say unto you, Wheresoever this gospel shall be preached in the whole world, [there] shall also this, that this woman hath done, be told for a memorial of her.
column3: Mattheus 26:13 Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, oral waar hierdie evangelie verkondig sal word in die hele wêreld, sal ook gespreek word van wat sy gedoen het, tot ’n gedagtenis aan haar.

column2: Matthew 26:14 Then one of the twelve, called Judas Iscariot, went unto the chief priests,
column3: Mattheus 26:14 TOE gaan een van die twaalf, met die naam van Judas Iskáriot, na die owerpriesters

column2: Matthew 26:15 And said [unto them], What will ye give me, and I will deliver him unto you? And they covenanted with him for thirty pieces of silver.
column3: Mattheus 26:15 en sê: Wat wil u my gee, en ek sal Hom aan u oorlewer? En hulle het vir hom dertig silwerstukke afgeweeg.

column2: Matthew 26:16 And from that time he sought opportunity to betray him.
column3: Mattheus 26:16 En van toe af het hy ’n goeie geleentheid gesoek om Hom oor te lewer.

column2: Matthew 26:17 Now the first [day] of the [feast of] unleavened bread the disciples came to Jesus, saying unto him, Where wilt thou that we prepare for thee to eat the passover?
column3: Mattheus 26:17 EN op die eerste dag van die ongesuurde brode kom die dissipels na Jesus en sê vir Hom: Waar wil U hê moet ons vir U klaarmaak om die pasga te eet?

column2: Matthew 26:18 And he said, Go into the city to such a man, and say unto him, The Master saith, My time is at hand; I will keep the passover at thy house with my disciples.
column3: Mattheus 26:18 En Hy antwoord: Gaan na die stad na ’n sekere iemand en sê vir hom: Die Meester laat weet: My tyd is naby. By jou sal Ek die pasga hou met my dissipels.

column2: Matthew 26:19 And the disciples did as Jesus had appointed them; and they made ready the passover.
column3: Mattheus 26:19 Daarop het die dissipels gedoen soos Jesus hulle beveel het, en hulle het die pasga berei.

column2: Matthew 26:20 Now when the even was come, he sat down with the twelve.
column3: Mattheus 26:20 En toe dit aand geword het, was Hy met die twaalf aan tafel.

column2: Matthew 26:21 And as they did eat, he said, Verily I say unto you, that one of you shall betray me.
column3: Mattheus 26:21 En terwyl hulle eet, sê Hy: Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, een van julle sal My verraai.

column2: Matthew 26:22 And they were exceeding sorrowful, and began every one of them to say unto him, Lord, is it I?
column3: Mattheus 26:22 Toe word hulle baie bedroef en begin elkeen van hulle aan Hom te sê: Is dit miskien ek, Here?

column2: Matthew 26:23 And he answered and said, He that dippeth [his] hand with me in the dish, the same shall betray me.
column3: Mattheus 26:23 Toe antwoord Hy en sê: Hy wat saam met My sy hand in die skottel insteek, hy sal My verraai.

column2: Matthew 26:24 The Son of man goeth as it is written of him: but woe unto that man by whom the Son of man is betrayed! it had been good for that man if he had not been born.
column3: Mattheus 26:24 Die Seun van die mens gaan wel heen soos daar van Hom geskrywe is, maar wee daardie man deur wie die Seun van die mens verraai word! Dit sou vir hom goed gewees het as daardie man nie gebore was nie.

column2: Matthew 26:25 Then Judas, which betrayed him, answered and said, Master, is it I? He said unto him, Thou hast said.
column3: Mattheus 26:25 En Judas, wat Hom sou verraai, antwoord en sê: Is dit miskien ek, Rabbi? Hy antwoord hom: Jy het dit gesê.

column2: Matthew 26:26 And as they were eating, Jesus took bread, and blessed [it], and brake [it], and gave [it] to the disciples, and said, Take, eat; this is my body.
column3: Mattheus 26:26 En terwyl hulle eet, neem Jesus die brood, en nadat Hy gedank het, breek Hy dit en gee dit aan sy dissipels en sê: Neem, eet, dit is my liggaam.

column2: Matthew 26:27 And he took the cup, and gave thanks, and gave [it] to them, saying, Drink ye all of it;
column3: Mattheus 26:27 Toe neem Hy die beker, en nadat Hy gedank het, gee Hy dit aan hulle en sê: Drink almal daaruit.

column2: Matthew 26:28 For this is my blood of the new testament, which is shed for many for the remission of sins.
column3: Mattheus 26:28 Want dit is my bloed, die bloed van die nuwe testament, wat vir baie uitgestort word tot vergifnis van sondes.

column2: Matthew 26:29 But I say unto you, I will not drink henceforth of this fruit of the vine, until that day when I drink it new with you in my Father's kingdom.
column3: Mattheus 26:29 Maar Ek sê vir julle: Ek sal van nou af nooit meer van hierdie vrug van die wynstok drink nie, tot op daardie dag wanneer Ek dit met julle nuut sal drink in die koninkryk van my Vader.

column2: Matthew 26:30 And when they had sung an hymn, they went out into the mount of Olives.
column3: Mattheus 26:30 En nadat hulle die lofsang gesing het, het hulle uitgegaan na die Olyfberg.

column2: Matthew 26:31 Then saith Jesus unto them, All ye shall be offended because of me this night: for it is written, I will smite the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock shall be scattered abroad.
column3: Mattheus 26:31 TOE sê Jesus vir hulle: Julle sal almal in hierdie nag aanstoot neem aan My, want daar is geskrywe: Ek sal die herder slaan, en die skape van die kudde sal verstrooi word.

column2: Matthew 26:32 But after I am risen again, I will go before you into Galilee.
column3: Mattheus 26:32 Maar nadat Ek opgestaan het, sal Ek voor julle uit na Galiléa gaan.

column2: Matthew 26:33 Peter answered and said unto him, Though all [men] shall be offended because of thee, [yet] will I never be offended.
column3: Mattheus 26:33 Daarop antwoord Petrus en sê vir Hom: Al sal almal ook aanstoot aan U neem, ek sal nooit aanstoot neem nie.

column2: Matthew 26:34 Jesus said unto him, Verily I say unto thee, That this night, before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice.
column3: Mattheus 26:34 Jesus sê vir hom: Voorwaar Ek sê vir jou, in hierdie nag, voordat die haan gekraai het, sal jy My drie maal verloën.

column2: Matthew 26:35 Peter said unto him, Though I should die with thee, yet will I not deny thee. Likewise also said all the disciples.
column3: Mattheus 26:35 Petrus sê vir Hom: Al moes ek ook saam met U sterwe, ek sal U nooit verloën nie! So het ook al die dissipels gesê.

column2: Matthew 26:36 Then cometh Jesus with them unto a place called Gethsemane, and saith unto the disciples, Sit ye here, while I go and pray yonder.
column3: Mattheus 26:36 TOE kom Jesus met hulle in ’n plek met die naam van Getsémané, en Hy sê vir die dissipels: Sit hier onderwyl Ek daar gaan bid.

column2: Matthew 26:37 And he took with him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, and began to be sorrowful and very heavy.
column3: Mattheus 26:37 En Hy neem Petrus en die twee seuns van Sebedéüs saam en begin bedroef en benoud word.

column2: Matthew 26:38 Then saith he unto them, My soul is exceeding sorrowful, even unto death: tarry ye here, and watch with me.
column3: Mattheus 26:38 Toe sê Hy vir hulle: My siel is diep bedroef tot die dood toe; bly hier en waak saam met My.

column2: Matthew 26:39 And he went a little further, and fell on his face, and prayed, saying, O my Father, if it be possible, let this cup pass from me: nevertheless not as I will, but as thou [wilt].
column3: Mattheus 26:39 En Hy het ’n bietjie verder gegaan en op sy aangesig geval en gebid en gesê: My Vader, as dit moontlik is, laat hierdie beker by My verbygaan; nogtans nie soos Ek wil nie, maar soos U wil.

column2: Matthew 26:40 And he cometh unto the disciples, and findeth them asleep, and saith unto Peter, What, could ye not watch with me one hour?
column3: Mattheus 26:40 En Hy kom by die dissipels en vind hulle aan die slaap, en Hy sê vir Petrus: So was julle dan nie in staat om een uur saam met My te waak nie?

column2: Matthew 26:41 Watch and pray, that ye enter not into temptation: the spirit indeed [is] willing, but the flesh [is] weak.
column3: Mattheus 26:41 Waak en bid, dat julle nie in versoeking kom nie. Die gees is wel gewillig, maar die vlees is swak.

column2: Matthew 26:42 He went away again the second time, and prayed, saying, O my Father, if this cup may not pass away from me, except I drink it, thy will be done.
column3: Mattheus 26:42 Weer het Hy vir die tweede maal gaan bid en gesê: My Vader, as hierdie beker nie by My kan verbygaan sonder dat Ek dit drink nie, laat u wil geskied.

column2: Matthew 26:43 And he came and found them asleep again: for their eyes were heavy.
column3: Mattheus 26:43 Toe kom Hy en vind hulle weer aan die slaap, want hulle oë was swaar.

column2: Matthew 26:44 And he left them, and went away again, and prayed the third time, saying the same words.
column3: Mattheus 26:44 En Hy het hulle met rus gelaat en weer vir die derde maal gaan bid en dieselfde woorde gesê.

column2: Matthew 26:45 Then cometh he to his disciples, and saith unto them, Sleep on now, and take [your] rest: behold, the hour is at hand, and the Son of man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.
column3: Mattheus 26:45 Daarop kom Hy by sy dissipels en sê vir hulle: Slaap maar voort en rus. Kyk, die uur is naby, en die Seun van die mens word oorgelewer in die hande van sondaars.

column2: Matthew 26:46 Rise, let us be going: behold, he is at hand that doth betray me.
column3: Mattheus 26:46 Staan op, laat ons gaan; kyk, hy is naby wat My verraai.

column2: Matthew 26:47 And while he yet spake, lo, Judas, one of the twelve, came, and with him a great multitude with swords and staves, from the chief priests and elders of the people.
column3: Mattheus 26:47 EN terwyl Hy nog spreek, daar kom Judas, een van die twaalf, en saam met hom ’n groot menigte met swaarde en stokke, gestuur deur die owerpriesters en ouderlinge van die volk.

column2: Matthew 26:48 Now he that betrayed him gave them a sign, saying, Whomsoever I shall kiss, that same is he: hold him fast.
column3: Mattheus 26:48 En sy verraaier het vir hulle ’n teken gegee en gesê: Die een wat ek sal soen, dit is Hy, gryp Hom!

column2: Matthew 26:49 And forthwith he came to Jesus, and said, Hail, master; and kissed him.
column3: Mattheus 26:49 En dadelik gaan hy na Jesus en sê: Gegroet, Rabbi! en hy het Hom gesoen.

column2: Matthew 26:50 And Jesus said unto him, Friend, wherefore art thou come? Then came they, and laid hands on Jesus, and took him.
column3: Mattheus 26:50 Maar Jesus sê vir hom: Vriend, waarvoor is jy hier? Toe kom hulle nader en slaan die hande aan Jesus en gryp Hom.

column2: Matthew 26:51 And, behold, one of them which were with Jesus stretched out [his] hand, and drew his sword, and struck a servant of the high priest's, and smote off his ear.
column3: Mattheus 26:51 En een van die wat saam met Jesus was, het meteens sy hand uitgesteek en sy swaard getrek; en hy het die dienskneg van die hoëpriester geslaan en sy oor afgekap.

column2: Matthew 26:52 Then said Jesus unto him, Put up again thy sword into his place: for all they that take the sword shall perish with the sword.
column3: Mattheus 26:52 Toe sê Jesus vir hom: Sit jou swaard in sy plek terug; want almal wat die swaard neem, sal deur die swaard vergaan.

column2: Matthew 26:53 Thinkest thou that I cannot now pray to my Father, and he shall presently give me more than twelve legions of angels?
column3: Mattheus 26:53 Of dink jy dat Ek nie nou my Vader kan bid en Hy vir My meer as twaalf legioene van engele beskikbaar sal stel nie?

column2: Matthew 26:54 But how then shall the scriptures be fulfilled, that thus it must be?
column3: Mattheus 26:54 Hoe sou die Skrifte dan vervul word dat dit so moet gebeur?

column2: Matthew 26:55 In that same hour said Jesus to the multitudes, Are ye come out as against a thief with swords and staves for to take me? I sat daily with you teaching in the temple, and ye laid no hold on me.
column3: Mattheus 26:55 In daardie uur het Jesus vir die skare gesê: Het julle soos teen ’n rower uitgekom met swaarde en stokke om My gevange te neem? Dag vir dag het Ek by julle gesit en leer in die tempel, en julle het My nie gegryp nie.

column2: Matthew 26:56 But all this was done, that the scriptures of the prophets might be fulfilled. Then all the disciples forsook him, and fled.
column3: Mattheus 26:56 Maar dit het alles gebeur, dat die Skrifte van die profete vervul sou word. Toe het al die dissipels Hom verlaat en gevlug.

column2: Matthew 26:57 And they that had laid hold on Jesus led [him] away to Caiaphas the high priest, where the scribes and the elders were assembled.
column3: Mattheus 26:57 EN die wat Jesus gevange geneem het, het Hom weggelei na Kájafas, die hoëpriester, waar die skrifgeleerdes en die ouderlinge vergader het.

column2: Matthew 26:58 But Peter followed him afar off unto the high priest's palace, and went in, and sat with the servants, to see the end.
column3: Mattheus 26:58 En Petrus het Hom van ver af gevolg tot by die paleis van die hoëpriester, en hy het ingegaan en by die dienaars gaan sit om die einde te sien.

column2: Matthew 26:59 Now the chief priests, and elders, and all the council, sought false witness against Jesus, to put him to death;
column3: Mattheus 26:59 En die owerpriesters en die ouderlinge en die hele Raad het valse getuienis teen Jesus gesoek om Hom dood te maak, en niks gevind nie.

column2: Matthew 26:60 But found none: yea, though many false witnesses came, [yet] found they none. At the last came two false witnesses,
column3: Mattheus 26:60 En alhoewel daar baie valse getuies gekom het, het hulle niks gevind nie.

column2: Matthew 26:61 And said, This [fellow] said, I am able to destroy the temple of God, and to build it in three days.
column3: Mattheus 26:61 Maar oplaas kom daar twee valse getuies en sê: Hierdie man het gesê: Ek kan die tempel van God afbreek en dit in drie dae opbou.

column2: Matthew 26:62 And the high priest arose, and said unto him, Answerest thou nothing? what [is it which] these witness against thee?
column3: Mattheus 26:62 Daarop staan die hoëpriester op en sê vir Hom: Antwoord U niks nie? Wat getuig hierdie manne teen U?

column2: Matthew 26:63 But Jesus held his peace. And the high priest answered and said unto him, I adjure thee by the living God, that thou tell us whether thou be the Christ, the Son of God.
column3: Mattheus 26:63 Maar Jesus het stilgebly. En die hoëpriester antwoord en sê vir Hom: Ek besweer U by die lewende God dat U vir ons sê of U die Christus, die Seun van God, is?

column2: Matthew 26:64 Jesus saith unto him, Thou hast said: nevertheless I say unto you, Hereafter shall ye see the Son of man sitting on the right hand of power, and coming in the clouds of heaven.
column3: Mattheus 26:64 Jesus antwoord hom: U het dit gesê. Maar Ek sê vir u almal: Van nou af sal u die Seun van die mens sien sit aan die regterhand van die krag van God en kom op die wolke van die hemel.

column2: Matthew 26:65 Then the high priest rent his clothes, saying, He hath spoken blasphemy; what further need have we of witnesses? behold, now ye have heard his blasphemy.
column3: Mattheus 26:65 Toe verskeur die hoëpriester sy klere en sê: Hy het godslasterlik gespreek, wat het ons nog getuies nodig? Kyk, nou het julle sy godslastering gehoor!

column2: Matthew 26:66 What think ye? They answered and said, He is guilty of death.
column3: Mattheus 26:66 Wat dink julle? En hulle antwoord en sê: Hy is die dood skuldig.

column2: Matthew 26:67 Then did they spit in his face, and buffeted him; and others smote [him] with the palms of their hands,
column3: Mattheus 26:67 Toe het hulle in sy aangesig gespuug en Hom met die vuis geslaan,

column2: Matthew 26:68 Saying, Prophesy unto us, thou Christ, Who is he that smote thee?
column3: Mattheus 26:68 en ander het Hom met stokke geslaan en gesê: Profeteer vir ons, Christus! Wie is dit wat U geslaan het?

column2: Matthew 26:69 Now Peter sat without in the palace: and a damsel came unto him, saying, Thou also wast with Jesus of Galilee.
column3: Mattheus 26:69 EN Petrus het buitekant gesit in die binneplaas van die paleis, en ’n sekere diensmeisie het na hom gekom en gesê: Jy was ook by Jesus, die Galiléër!

column2: Matthew 26:70 But he denied before [them] all, saying, I know not what thou sayest.
column3: Mattheus 26:70 Maar hy het dit voor almal ontken en gesê: Ek weet nie wat jy sê nie.

column2: Matthew 26:71 And when he was gone out into the porch, another [maid] saw him, and said unto them that were there, This [fellow] was also with Jesus of Nazareth.
column3: Mattheus 26:71 En terwyl hy uitgaan na die poort toe, sien ’n ander diensmeisie hom en sê aan die wat daar was: Hierdie een was ook by Jesus, die Nasaréner.

column2: Matthew 26:72 And again he denied with an oath, I do not know the man.
column3: Mattheus 26:72 En met ’n eed ontken hy dit weer: Ek ken die man nie.

column2: Matthew 26:73 And after a while came unto [him] they that stood by, and said to Peter, Surely thou also art [one] of them; for thy speech bewrayeth thee.
column3: Mattheus 26:73 Maar ’n bietjie later kom die wat daar staan, en sê vir Petrus: Waarlik, jy is ook een van hulle, want ook jou spraak maak jou bekend.

column2: Matthew 26:74 Then began he to curse and to swear, [saying], I know not the man. And immediately the cock crew.
column3: Mattheus 26:74 Toe begin hy homself te verwens en te sweer: Ek ken die man nie.

column2: Matthew 26:75 And Peter remembered the word of Jesus, which said unto him, Before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice. And he went out, and wept bitterly.
column3: Mattheus 26:75 En dadelik het die haan gekraai, en Petrus het die woord van Jesus onthou wat Hy vir hom gesê het: Voor die haan kraai, sal jy My drie maal verloën. En hy het buitentoe gegaan en bitterlik geween.

column2: Matthew 27:1 When the morning was come, all the chief priests and elders of the people took counsel against Jesus to put him to death:
column3: Mattheus 27:1 EN toe dit dag geword het, het al die owerpriesters en die ouderlinge van die volk saam raad gehou teen Jesus om Hom dood te maak.

column2: Matthew 27:2 And when they had bound him, they led [him] away, and delivered him to Pontius Pilate the governor.
column3: Mattheus 27:2 En hulle het Hom geboei en weggelei en Hom oorgelewer aan Pontius Pilatus, die goewerneur.

column2: Matthew 27:3 Then Judas, which had betrayed him, when he saw that he was condemned, repented himself, and brought again the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders,
column3: Mattheus 27:3 Daarna het Judas, sy verraaier, toe hy sien dat Hy veroordeel was, berou gekry en die dertig silwerstukke teruggebring na die owerpriesters en die ouderlinge

column2: Matthew 27:4 Saying, I have sinned in that I have betrayed the innocent blood. And they said, What [is that] to us? see thou [to that].
column3: Mattheus 27:4 en gesê: Ek het gesondig deur onskuldige bloed te verraai. Maar hulle sê: Wat gaan dit ons aan? Jy kan toesien!

column2: Matthew 27:5 And he cast down the pieces of silver in the temple, and departed, and went and hanged himself.
column3: Mattheus 27:5 En hy het die silwerstukke in die tempel neergegooi en weggeloop en homself gaan ophang.

column2: Matthew 27:6 And the chief priests took the silver pieces, and said, It is not lawful for to put them into the treasury, because it is the price of blood.
column3: Mattheus 27:6 En die owerpriesters het die silwerstukke geneem en gesê: Dit is nie geoorloof om dit in die skatkis te stort nie, omdat dit bloedgeld is.

column2: Matthew 27:7 And they took counsel, and bought with them the potter's field, to bury strangers in.
column3: Mattheus 27:7 En nadat hulle saam raad gehou het, het hulle die stuk grond van die pottebakker daarmee gekoop as ’n begraafplaas vir vreemdelinge.

column2: Matthew 27:8 Wherefore that field was called, The field of blood, unto this day.
column3: Mattheus 27:8 Daarom is dié stuk grond genoem Bloedgrond, tot vandag toe.

column2: Matthew 27:9 Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremy the prophet, saying, And they took the thirty pieces of silver, the price of him that was valued, whom they of the children of Israel did value;
column3: Mattheus 27:9 Toe is vervul wat gespreek is deur Jeremia, die profeet, toe hy gesê het: En hulle het die dertig silwerstukke geneem, die prys van die gewaardeerde wat hulle gewaardeer het vanweë die kinders van Israel;

column2: Matthew 27:10 And gave them for the potter's field, as the Lord appointed me.
column3: Mattheus 27:10 en hulle het dit gegee vir die grond van die pottebakker, soos die Here my beveel het.

column2: Matthew 27:11 And Jesus stood before the governor: and the governor asked him, saying, Art thou the King of the Jews? And Jesus said unto him, Thou sayest.
column3: Mattheus 27:11 EN Jesus het voor die goewerneur gestaan, en die goewerneur het Hom die vraag gestel en gesê: Is U die Koning van die Jode? En Jesus antwoord hom: U sê dit.

column2: Matthew 27:12 And when he was accused of the chief priests and elders, he answered nothing.
column3: Mattheus 27:12 En terwyl Hy deur die owerpriesters en die ouderlinge beskuldig word, het Hy niks geantwoord nie.

column2: Matthew 27:13 Then said Pilate unto him, Hearest thou not how many things they witness against thee?
column3: Mattheus 27:13 Toe sê Pilatus vir Hom: Hoor U nie hoe baie dinge hulle teen U getuig nie?

column2: Matthew 27:14 And he answered him to never a word; insomuch that the governor marvelled greatly.
column3: Mattheus 27:14 En Hy het hom op geen enkele woord geantwoord nie, sodat die goewerneur hom baie verwonder het.

column2: Matthew 27:15 Now at [that] feast the governor was wont to release unto the people a prisoner, whom they would.
column3: Mattheus 27:15 En op die fees was die goewerneur gewoond om een gevangene, die een wat hulle wou hê, vir die skare los te laat.

column2: Matthew 27:16 And they had then a notable prisoner, called Barabbas.
column3: Mattheus 27:16 En in daardie tyd het hulle ’n berugte gevangene gehad met die naam van Barábbas.

column2: Matthew 27:17 Therefore when they were gathered together, Pilate said unto them, Whom will ye that I release unto you? Barabbas, or Jesus which is called Christ?
column3: Mattheus 27:17 Nadat hulle dan byeengekom het, sê Pilatus vir hulle: Wie wil julle hê moet ek vir julle loslaat: Barábbas, of Jesus wat genoem word Christus?

column2: Matthew 27:18 For he knew that for envy they had delivered him.
column3: Mattheus 27:18 Want hy het geweet dat hulle Hom uit nydigheid oorgelewer het.

column2: Matthew 27:19 When he was set down on the judgment seat, his wife sent unto him, saying, Have thou nothing to do with that just man: for I have suffered many things this day in a dream because of him.
column3: Mattheus 27:19 En terwyl hy op die regbank sit, het sy vrou na hom gestuur en gesê: Moet tog niks te doen hê met dié regverdige man nie, want ek het vandag in ’n droom baie gely om sy ontwil.

column2: Matthew 27:20 But the chief priests and elders persuaded the multitude that they should ask Barabbas, and destroy Jesus.
column3: Mattheus 27:20 Maar die owerpriesters en die ouderlinge het die skare oorgehaal dat hulle Barábbas moes begeer en Jesus ombring.

column2: Matthew 27:21 The governor answered and said unto them, Whether of the twain will ye that I release unto you? They said, Barabbas.
column3: Mattheus 27:21 Toe antwoord die goewerneur en sê vir hulle: Wie van die twee wil julle hê moet ek vir julle loslaat? En hulle antwoord: Barábbas!

column2: Matthew 27:22 Pilate saith unto them, What shall I do then with Jesus which is called Christ? [They] all say unto him, Let him be crucified.
column3: Mattheus 27:22 Pilatus sê vir hulle: Wat moet ek dan doen met Jesus wat genoem word Christus? Hulle sê almal vir hom: Laat Hom gekruisig word!

column2: Matthew 27:23 And the governor said, Why, what evil hath he done? But they cried out the more, saying, Let him be crucified.
column3: Mattheus 27:23 En die goewerneur sê: Watter kwaad het Hy dan gedoen? Maar hulle skreeu nog harder en sê: Laat Hom gekruisig word!

column2: Matthew 27:24 When Pilate saw that he could prevail nothing, but [that] rather a tumult was made, he took water, and washed [his] hands before the multitude, saying, I am innocent of the blood of this just person: see ye [to it].
column3: Mattheus 27:24 En toe Pilatus sien dat niks help nie, maar dat daar eerder ’n oproer kom, het hy water geneem en sy hande voor die skare gewas en gesê: Ek is onskuldig aan die bloed van hierdie regverdige man; julle kan toesien!

column2: Matthew 27:25 Then answered all the people, and said, His blood [be] on us, and on our children.
column3: Mattheus 27:25 En die hele volk antwoord en sê: Laat sy bloed op ons en op ons kinders kom!

column2: Matthew 27:26 Then released he Barabbas unto them: and when he had scourged Jesus, he delivered [him] to be crucified.
column3: Mattheus 27:26 Toe laat hy vir hulle Barábbas los, maar Jesus het hy laat gésel en oorgelewer om gekruisig te word.

column2: Matthew 27:27 Then the soldiers of the governor took Jesus into the common hall, and gathered unto him the whole band [of soldiers].
column3: Mattheus 27:27 Daarop neem die soldate van die goewerneur Jesus met hulle saam in die goewerneur se paleis en bring die hele leërafdeling teen Hom bymekaar.

column2: Matthew 27:28 And they stripped him, and put on him a scarlet robe.
column3: Mattheus 27:28 Toe trek hulle sy klere uit en werp ’n rooi mantel om Hom;

column2: Matthew 27:29 And when they had platted a crown of thorns, they put [it] upon his head, and a reed in his right hand: and they bowed the knee before him, and mocked him, saying, Hail, King of the Jews!
column3: Mattheus 27:29 en hulle vleg ’n kroon van dorings en sit dit op sy hoof, en ’n riet in sy regterhand; en hulle val op hul knieë voor Hom en bespot Hom en sê: Wees gegroet, Koning van die Jode!

column2: Matthew 27:30 And they spit upon him, and took the reed, and smote him on the head.
column3: Mattheus 27:30 En hulle spuug op Hom en neem die riet en slaan Hom op sy hoof.

column2: Matthew 27:31 And after that they had mocked him, they took the robe off from him, and put his own raiment on him, and led him away to crucify [him].
column3: Mattheus 27:31 En nadat hulle Hom bespot het, trek hulle Hom die mantel uit en trek Hom sy klere aan en lei Hom weg om gekruisig te word.

column2: Matthew 27:32 And as they came out, they found a man of Cyrene, Simon by name: him they compelled to bear his cross.
column3: Mattheus 27:32 EN toe hulle uitgaan, kry hulle ’n man van Ciréne, met die naam van Simon; hom het hulle gedwing om sy kruis te dra.

column2: Matthew 27:33 And when they were come unto a place called Golgotha, that is to say, a place of a skull,
column3: Mattheus 27:33 En hulle het gekom op ’n plek wat Gólgota genoem word — dit beteken: Plek van die Hoofskedel —

column2: Matthew 27:34 They gave him vinegar to drink mingled with gall: and when he had tasted [thereof], he would not drink.
column3: Mattheus 27:34 en vir Hom asyn, met gal gemeng, gegee om te drink; en toe Hy dit proe, wou Hy nie drink nie.

column2: Matthew 27:35 And they crucified him, and parted his garments, casting lots: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, They parted my garments among them, and upon my vesture did they cast lots.
column3: Mattheus 27:35 En nadat hulle Hom gekruisig het, het hulle sy klere verdeel deur die lot te werp, sodat vervul sou word wat deur die profeet gespreek is: Hulle het my klere onder mekaar verdeel en oor my gewaad die lot gewerp.

column2: Matthew 27:36 And sitting down they watched him there;
column3: Mattheus 27:36 En hulle het gaan sit en Hom daar bewaak.

column2: Matthew 27:37 And set up over his head his accusation written, THIS IS JESUS THE KING OF THE JEWS.
column3: Mattheus 27:37 En bokant sy hoof het hulle sy beskuldiging in skrif opgestel: DIT IS JESUS, DIE KONING VAN DIE JODE.

column2: Matthew 27:38 Then were there two thieves crucified with him, one on the right hand, and another on the left.
column3: Mattheus 27:38 Toe word daar saam met Hom twee rowers gekruisig, een aan die regter- en een aan die linkerkant.

column2: Matthew 27:39 And they that passed by reviled him, wagging their heads,
column3: Mattheus 27:39 En die verbygangers het Hom gesmaad terwyl hulle hul hoofde skud

column2: Matthew 27:40 And saying, Thou that destroyest the temple, and buildest [it] in three days, save thyself. If thou be the Son of God, come down from the cross.
column3: Mattheus 27:40 en sê: U wat die tempel afbreek en in drie dae opbou, red Uself! As U die Seun van God is, kom af van die kruis!

column2: Matthew 27:41 Likewise also the chief priests mocking [him], with the scribes and elders, said,
column3: Mattheus 27:41 En so het ook die owerpriesters saam met die skrifgeleerdes en ouderlinge gespot en gesê:

column2: Matthew 27:42 He saved others; himself he cannot save. If he be the King of Israel, let him now come down from the cross, and we will believe him.
column3: Mattheus 27:42 Ander het Hy verlos, Homself kan Hy nie verlos nie. As Hy die Koning van Israel is, laat Hom nou van die kruis afkom, en ons sal in Hom glo.

column2: Matthew 27:43 He trusted in God; let him deliver him now, if he will have him: for he said, I am the Son of God.
column3: Mattheus 27:43 Hy het op God vertrou; laat Hy Hom nou verlos as Hy behae in Hom het; want Hy het gesê: Ek is die Seun van God.

column2: Matthew 27:44 The thieves also, which were crucified with him, cast the same in his teeth.
column3: Mattheus 27:44 En op dieselfde manier het die rowers wat saam met Hom gekruisig was, Hom ook beledig.

column2: Matthew 27:45 Now from the sixth hour there was darkness over all the land unto the ninth hour.
column3: Mattheus 27:45 En van die sesde uur af het daar duisternis gekom oor die hele aarde tot die negende uur toe;

column2: Matthew 27:46 And about the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani? that is to say, My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?
column3: Mattheus 27:46 en omtrent die negende uur het Jesus met ’n groot stem geroep en gesê: Eli, Eli, lama sabagtáni? Dit is: My God, my God, waarom het U My verlaat?

column2: Matthew 27:47 Some of them that stood there, when they heard [that], said, This [man] calleth for Elias.
column3: Mattheus 27:47 En sommige van die wat daar staan, hoor dit en sê: Hy roep Elía.

column2: Matthew 27:48 And straightway one of them ran, and took a spunge, and filled [it] with vinegar, and put [it] on a reed, and gave him to drink.
column3: Mattheus 27:48 Toe hardloop daar dadelik een van hulle en neem ’n spons en maak dit vol asyn, en sit dit op ’n riet en laat Hom drink.

column2: Matthew 27:49 The rest said, Let be, let us see whether Elias will come to save him.
column3: Mattheus 27:49 Maar die ander sê: Wag, laat ons sien of Elía kom om Hom te verlos.

column2: Matthew 27:50 Jesus, when he had cried again with a loud voice, yielded up the ghost.
column3: Mattheus 27:50 Daarop het Jesus weer met ’n groot stem geroep en die gees gegee.

column2: Matthew 27:51 And, behold, the veil of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom; and the earth did quake, and the rocks rent;
column3: Mattheus 27:51 En kyk, die voorhangsel van die tempel het in twee geskeur, van bo tot onder, en die aarde het gebewe en die rotse het geskeur;

column2: Matthew 27:52 And the graves were opened; and many bodies of the saints which slept arose,
column3: Mattheus 27:52 en die grafte het oopgegaan en baie liggame van die ontslape heiliges het opgestaan.

column2: Matthew 27:53 And came out of the graves after his resurrection, and went into the holy city, and appeared unto many.
column3: Mattheus 27:53 En ná sy opstanding het hulle uit die grafte uitgegaan en in die heilige stad ingekom en aan baie verskyn.

column2: Matthew 27:54 Now when the centurion, and they that were with him, watching Jesus, saw the earthquake, and those things that were done, they feared greatly, saying, Truly this was the Son of God.
column3: Mattheus 27:54 En toe die hoofman oor honderd en die wat saam met hom Jesus bewaak het, die aardbewing sien en die dinge wat daar gebeur, het hulle baie bevrees geword en gesê: Waarlik, Hy was die Seun van God.

column2: Matthew 27:55 And many women were there beholding afar off, which followed Jesus from Galilee, ministering unto him:
column3: Mattheus 27:55 En daar was baie vroue wat dit van ver af aanskou het, wat vir Jesus van Galiléa af gevolg en Hom gedien het.

column2: Matthew 27:56 Among which was Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James and Joses, and the mother of Zebedee's children.
column3: Mattheus 27:56 Onder hulle was daar Maria Magdaléna en Maria, die moeder van Jakobus en Joses, en die moeder van die seuns van Sebedéüs.

column2: Matthew 27:57 When the even was come, there came a rich man of Arimathaea, named Joseph, who also himself was Jesus' disciple:
column3: Mattheus 27:57 EN toe dit aand geword het, het daar ’n ryk man van Arimathéa gekom met die naam van Josef, wat self ook ’n dissipel van Jesus was.

column2: Matthew 27:58 He went to Pilate, and begged the body of Jesus. Then Pilate commanded the body to be delivered.
column3: Mattheus 27:58 Hy het na Pilatus gegaan en die liggaam van Jesus gevra. Toe beveel Pilatus dat die liggaam afgegee moes word.

column2: Matthew 27:59 And when Joseph had taken the body, he wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,
column3: Mattheus 27:59 En Josef het die liggaam geneem en dit met skoon linne toegedraai

column2: Matthew 27:60 And laid it in his own new tomb, which he had hewn out in the rock: and he rolled a great stone to the door of the sepulchre, and departed.
column3: Mattheus 27:60 en dit in sy nuwe graf gelê wat hy in die rots uitgekap het; en nadat hy ’n groot steen teen die opening van die graf gerol het, het hy weggegaan.

column2: Matthew 27:61 And there was Mary Magdalene, and the other Mary, sitting over against the sepulchre.
column3: Mattheus 27:61 En Maria Magdaléna was daar en die ander Maria, en hulle het reg voor die graf gesit.

column2: Matthew 27:62 Now the next day, that followed the day of the preparation, the chief priests and Pharisees came together unto Pilate,
column3: Mattheus 27:62 Die volgende dag — dit is die dag ná die voorbereiding — kom die owerpriesters en die Fariseërs by Pilatus saam

column2: Matthew 27:63 Saying, Sir, we remember that that deceiver said, while he was yet alive, After three days I will rise again.
column3: Mattheus 27:63 en sê: My heer, ons herinner ons dat dié verleier, toe hy in die lewe was, gesê het: Oor drie dae staan ek op.

column2: Matthew 27:64 Command therefore that the sepulchre be made sure until the third day, lest his disciples come by night, and steal him away, and say unto the people, He is risen from the dead: so the last error shall be worse than the first.
column3: Mattheus 27:64 Gee dan bevel dat die graf verseker word tot die derde dag toe, dat sy dissipels nie miskien in die nag kom en Hom steel nie, en vir die volk sê: Hy het opgestaan uit die dode. En die laaste dwaling sal erger wees as die eerste.

column2: Matthew 27:65 Pilate said unto them, Ye have a watch: go your way, make [it] as sure as ye can.
column3: Mattheus 27:65 Daarop sê Pilatus vir hulle: Julle sal ’n wag kry; gaan verseker dit soos julle dit verstaan.

column2: Matthew 27:66 So they went, and made the sepulchre sure, sealing the stone, and setting a watch.
column3: Mattheus 27:66 En hulle het gegaan en die graf verseker deur die steen te verseël in teenwoordigheid van die wag.

column2: Matthew 28:1 In the end of the sabbath, as it began to dawn toward the first [day] of the week, came Mary Magdalene and the other Mary to see the sepulchre.
column3: Mattheus 28:1 EN laat ná die sabbat toe dit begin lig word, teen die eerste dag van die week, kom Maria Magdaléna en die ander Maria om na die graf te gaan kyk.

column2: Matthew 28:2 And, behold, there was a great earthquake: for the angel of the Lord descended from heaven, and came and rolled back the stone from the door, and sat upon it.
column3: Mattheus 28:2 En daar kom ’n groot aardbewing, want ’n engel van die Here het uit die hemel neergedaal en gekom en die steen van die opening weggerol en daarop gaan sit.

column2: Matthew 28:3 His countenance was like lightning, and his raiment white as snow:
column3: Mattheus 28:3 En sy gedaante was soos weerlig en sy kleding wit soos sneeu.

column2: Matthew 28:4 And for fear of him the keepers did shake, and became as dead [men].
column3: Mattheus 28:4 En uit vrees vir hom het die wagte gebewe en soos dooies geword.

column2: Matthew 28:5 And the angel answered and said unto the women, Fear not ye: for I know that ye seek Jesus, which was crucified.
column3: Mattheus 28:5 Maar die engel antwoord en sê vir die vroue: Moenie vrees nie, want ek weet julle soek Jesus wat gekruisig is.

column2: Matthew 28:6 He is not here: for he is risen, as he said. Come, see the place where the Lord lay.
column3: Mattheus 28:6 Hy is nie hier nie, want Hy het opgestaan soos Hy gesê het. Kom kyk na die plek waar die Here gelê het;

column2: Matthew 28:7 And go quickly, and tell his disciples that he is risen from the dead; and, behold, he goeth before you into Galilee; there shall ye see him: lo, I have told you.
column3: Mattheus 28:7 en gaan haastig, sê vir sy dissipels: Hy het opgestaan uit die dode en gaan voor julle uit na Galiléa. Daar sal julle Hom sien. Kyk, ek het julle dit gesê.

column2: Matthew 28:8 And they departed quickly from the sepulchre with fear and great joy; and did run to bring his disciples word.
column3: Mattheus 28:8 En hulle het haastig weggegaan van die graf met vrees en groot blydskap, en gehardloop om dit aan sy dissipels te vertel.

column2: Matthew 28:9 And as they went to tell his disciples, behold, Jesus met them, saying, All hail. And they came and held him by the feet, and worshipped him.
column3: Mattheus 28:9 En terwyl hulle op weg was om dit aan sy dissipels te vertel, kom Jesus hulle meteens teë en sê: Wees gegroet! Toe kom hulle nader en gryp sy voete en aanbid Hom.

column2: Matthew 28:10 Then said Jesus unto them, Be not afraid: go tell my brethren that they go into Galilee, and there shall they see me.
column3: Mattheus 28:10 En Jesus sê vir hulle: Moenie vrees nie. Gaan heen en vertel my broeders dat hulle na Galiléa moet gaan; en daar sal hulle My sien.

column2: Matthew 28:11 Now when they were going, behold, some of the watch came into the city, and shewed unto the chief priests all the things that were done.
column3: Mattheus 28:11 EN terwyl hulle op weg was, kom daar sommige van die wag in die stad en vertel die owerpriesters alles wat gebeur het.

column2: Matthew 28:12 And when they were assembled with the elders, and had taken counsel, they gave large money unto the soldiers,
column3: Mattheus 28:12 En nadat hulle saam met die ouderlinge vergader en raad gehou het, het hulle die soldate baie geld gegee

column2: Matthew 28:13 Saying, Say ye, His disciples came by night, and stole him [away] while we slept.
column3: Mattheus 28:13 en gesê: Julle moet sê: Sy dissipels het in die nag gekom en Hom gesteel terwyl ons aan die slaap was.

column2: Matthew 28:14 And if this come to the governor's ears, we will persuade him, and secure you.
column3: Mattheus 28:14 En as dit by die goewerneur gehoor word, sal ons hom tevrede stel en maak dat julle sonder sorg is.

column2: Matthew 28:15 So they took the money, and did as they were taught: and this saying is commonly reported among the Jews until this day.
column3: Mattheus 28:15 Hulle het toe die geld geneem en gedoen soos hulle geleer was. En hierdie verhaal is versprei onder die Jode, tot vandag toe.

column2: Matthew 28:16 Then the eleven disciples went away into Galilee, into a mountain where Jesus had appointed them.
column3: Mattheus 28:16 EN die elf dissipels het na Galiléa gegaan, na die berg waar Jesus hulle bestel het.

column2: Matthew 28:17 And when they saw him, they worshipped him: but some doubted.
column3: Mattheus 28:17 En toe hulle Hom sien, het hulle Hom aanbid; maar sommige het getwyfel.

column2: Matthew 28:18 And Jesus came and spake unto them, saying, All power is given unto me in heaven and in earth.
column3: Mattheus 28:18 En Jesus het nader gekom en met hulle gespreek en gesê: Aan My is gegee alle mag in die hemel en op aarde.

column2: Matthew 28:19 Go ye therefore, and teach all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost:
column3: Mattheus 28:19 Gaan dan heen, maak dissipels van al die nasies, en doop hulle in die Naam van die Vader en die Seun en die Heilige Gees; en leer hulle om alles te onderhou wat Ek julle beveel het.

column2: Matthew 28:20 Teaching them to observe all things whatsoever I have commanded you: and, lo, I am with you alway, [even] unto the end of the world. Amen.
column3: Mattheus 28:20 En kyk, Ek is met julle al die dae tot aan die voleinding van die wêreld. Amen.

column2: Mark 1:1 The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God;
column3: Markus 1:1 DIE begin van die evangelie van Jesus Christus, die Seun van God.

column2: Mark 1:2 As it is written in the prophets, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, which shall prepare thy way before thee.
column3: Markus 1:2 Soos geskrywe is in die Profete: Kyk, Ek stuur my boodskapper voor u aangesig, wat u pad voor U uit sal regmaak —

column2: Mark 1:3 The voice of one crying in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make his paths straight.
column3: Markus 1:3 die stem van een wat roep in die woestyn: Berei die weg van die Here, maak sy paaie reguit!

column2: Mark 1:4 John did baptize in the wilderness, and preach the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins.
column3: Markus 1:4 Johannes het gekom en was besig om in die woestyn te doop en die doop van bekering tot vergifnis van sondes te verkondig.

column2: Mark 1:5 And there went out unto him all the land of Judaea, and they of Jerusalem, and were all baptized of him in the river of Jordan, confessing their sins.
column3: Markus 1:5 En die hele Joodse land en die inwoners van Jerusalem het uitgegaan na hom toe, en almal is deur hom gedoop in die Jordaanrivier met belydenis van hulle sondes.

column2: Mark 1:6 And John was clothed with camel's hair, and with a girdle of a skin about his loins; and he did eat locusts and wild honey;
column3: Markus 1:6 En Johannes was gekleed met kameelhare en ’n leergord om sy heupe, en hy het sprinkane en wilde heuning geëet.

column2: Mark 1:7 And preached, saying, There cometh one mightier than I after me, the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to stoop down and unloose.
column3: Markus 1:7 En hy het gepreek en gesê: Hy wat sterker is as ek, kom ná my, en ek is nie waardig om neer te buk en sy skoenriem los te maak nie.

column2: Mark 1:8 I indeed have baptized you with water: but he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost.
column3: Markus 1:8 Ek het julle wel met water gedoop, maar Hy sal julle doop met die Heilige Gees.

column2: Mark 1:9 And it came to pass in those days, that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and was baptized of John in Jordan.
column3: Markus 1:9 EN in daardie dae het Jesus van Násaret in Galiléa gekom en is deur Johannes in die Jordaan gedoop.

column2: Mark 1:10 And straightway coming up out of the water, he saw the heavens opened, and the Spirit like a dove descending upon him:
column3: Markus 1:10 En dadelik toe Hy opklim uit die water, sien Hy die hemele skeur en die Gees soos ’n duif op Hom neerdaal.

column2: Mark 1:11 And there came a voice from heaven, [saying], Thou art my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.
column3: Markus 1:11 En daar het ’n stem uit die hemele gekom: U is my geliefde Seun in wie Ek ’n welbehae het.

column2: Mark 1:12 And immediately the Spirit driveth him into the wilderness.
column3: Markus 1:12 En dadelik het die Gees Hom uitgedryf in die woestyn.

column2: Mark 1:13 And he was there in the wilderness forty days, tempted of Satan; and was with the wild beasts; and the angels ministered unto him.
column3: Markus 1:13 En Hy was daar in die woestyn veertig dae lank, terwyl Hy deur die Satan versoek is; en Hy was saam met die wilde diere, en die engele het Hom gedien.

column2: Mark 1:14 Now after that John was put in prison, Jesus came into Galilee, preaching the gospel of the kingdom of God,
column3: Markus 1:14 EN nadat Johannes oorgelewer was, het Jesus in Galiléa gekom en die evangelie van die koninkryk van God verkondig

column2: Mark 1:15 And saying, The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand: repent ye, and believe the gospel.
column3: Markus 1:15 en gesê: Die tyd is vervul en die koninkryk van God het naby gekom; bekeer julle en glo die evangelie.

column2: Mark 1:16 Now as he walked by the sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew his brother casting a net into the sea: for they were fishers.
column3: Markus 1:16 En terwyl Hy langs die see van Galiléa loop, sien Hy Simon en Andréas, sy broer, besig om ’n net in die see uit te gooi; want hulle was vissers.

column2: Mark 1:17 And Jesus said unto them, Come ye after me, and I will make you to become fishers of men.
column3: Markus 1:17 En Jesus sê vir hulle: Kom agter My aan, en Ek sal maak dat julle vissers van mense word.

column2: Mark 1:18 And straightway they forsook their nets, and followed him.
column3: Markus 1:18 En dadelik het hulle hul nette laat staan en Hom gevolg.

column2: Mark 1:19 And when he had gone a little further thence, he saw James the [son] of Zebedee, and John his brother, who also were in the ship mending their nets.
column3: Markus 1:19 En toe Hy daarvandaan ’n bietjie verder gaan, sien Hy Jakobus, die seun van Sebedéüs, en Johannes, sy broer, wat besig was om die nette in die skuit heel te maak.

column2: Mark 1:20 And straightway he called them: and they left their father Zebedee in the ship with the hired servants, and went after him.
column3: Markus 1:20 En dadelik het Hy hulle geroep, en hulle het hul vader Sebedéüs met die gehuurde mense in die skuit laat staan en Hom gevolg.

column2: Mark 1:21 And they went into Capernaum; and straightway on the sabbath day he entered into the synagogue, and taught.
column3: Markus 1:21 EN hulle het in Kapérnaüm gekom, en dadelik op die sabbat het Hy in die sinagoge ingegaan en begin leer.

column2: Mark 1:22 And they were astonished at his doctrine: for he taught them as one that had authority, and not as the scribes.
column3: Markus 1:22 En hulle was verslae oor sy leer, want Hy het hulle geleer soos een wat gesag het en nie soos die skrifgeleerdes nie.

column2: Mark 1:23 And there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit; and he cried out,
column3: Markus 1:23 En daar was in hulle sinagoge ’n man met ’n onreine gees; en hy het uitgeskreeu

column2: Mark 1:24 Saying, Let [us] alone; what have we to do with thee, thou Jesus of Nazareth? art thou come to destroy us? I know thee who thou art, the Holy One of God.
column3: Markus 1:24 en gesê: Hou op! Wat het ons met U te doen, Jesus, Nasaréner? Het U gekom om ons te verdelg? Ek ken U, wie U is: die Heilige van God!

column2: Mark 1:25 And Jesus rebuked him, saying, Hold thy peace, and come out of him.
column3: Markus 1:25 En Jesus het hom bestraf en gesê: Bly stil en gaan uit hom uit!

column2: Mark 1:26 And when the unclean spirit had torn him, and cried with a loud voice, he came out of him.
column3: Markus 1:26 En die onreine gees het hom stuiptrekkings laat kry en met ’n groot stem geskreeu en uit hom uitgegaan.

column2: Mark 1:27 And they were all amazed, insomuch that they questioned among themselves, saying, What thing is this? what new doctrine [is] this? for with authority commandeth he even the unclean spirits, and they do obey him.
column3: Markus 1:27 En almal was verbaas, sodat hulle onder mekaar vra en sê: Wat is dit? Watter nuwe leer is dit, dat Hy met gesag ook aan die onreine geeste bevel gee en hulle Hom gehoorsaam is?

column2: Mark 1:28 And immediately his fame spread abroad throughout all the region round about Galilee.
column3: Markus 1:28 En die gerug aangaande Hom is dadelik versprei in die hele omtrek van Galiléa.

column2: Mark 1:29 And forthwith, when they were come out of the synagogue, they entered into the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.
column3: Markus 1:29 EN dadelik toe hulle uit die sinagoge uitgegaan het, kom hulle saam met Jakobus en Johannes in die huis van Simon en Andréas.

column2: Mark 1:30 But Simon's wife's mother lay sick of a fever, and anon they tell him of her.
column3: Markus 1:30 En die skoonmoeder van Simon het siek gelê aan die koors; en dadelik het hulle Hom van haar gesê.

column2: Mark 1:31 And he came and took her by the hand, and lifted her up; and immediately the fever left her, and she ministered unto them.
column3: Markus 1:31 Daarop gaan Hy na haar, neem haar hand en rig haar op, en dadelik het die koors haar verlaat, en sy het hulle bedien.

column2: Mark 1:32 And at even, when the sun did set, they brought unto him all that were diseased, and them that were possessed with devils.
column3: Markus 1:32 En toe dit aand geword het en die son onder was, het hulle na Hom gebring almal wat ongesteld en van duiwels besete was.

column2: Mark 1:33 And all the city was gathered together at the door.
column3: Markus 1:33 En die hele stad het by die deur saamgekom.

column2: Mark 1:34 And he healed many that were sick of divers diseases, and cast out many devils; and suffered not the devils to speak, because they knew him.
column3: Markus 1:34 En baie wat aan allerhande siektes gely het, het Hy gesond gemaak en baie duiwels uitgedryf en die duiwels nie toegelaat om te praat nie, omdat hulle Hom geken het.

column2: Mark 1:35 And in the morning, rising up a great while before day, he went out, and departed into a solitary place, and there prayed.
column3: Markus 1:35 En vroeg in die môre, nog diep in die nag, het Hy opgestaan en uitgegaan en na ’n eensame plek vertrek en daar gebid.

column2: Mark 1:36 And Simon and they that were with him followed after him.
column3: Markus 1:36 En Simon en die wat by hom was, het Hom gevolg.

column2: Mark 1:37 And when they had found him, they said unto him, All [men] seek for thee.
column3: Markus 1:37 En toe hulle Hom vind, sê hulle vir Hom: Almal soek U.

column2: Mark 1:38 And he said unto them, Let us go into the next towns, that I may preach there also: for therefore came I forth.
column3: Markus 1:38 En Hy sê vir hulle: Laat ons na die naburige dorpe gaan, sodat Ek ook daar kan preek; want daarvoor het Ek uitgegaan.

column2: Mark 1:39 And he preached in their synagogues throughout all Galilee, and cast out devils.
column3: Markus 1:39 En Hy het die hele Galiléa deur in hulle sinagoges gepreek en die duiwels uitgedryf.

column2: Mark 1:40 And there came a leper to him, beseeching him, and kneeling down to him, and saying unto him, If thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.
column3: Markus 1:40 EN daar kom ’n melaatse na Hom toe wat Hom smeek en voor Hom op die knieë val en vir Hom sê: As U wil, kan U my reinig.

column2: Mark 1:41 And Jesus, moved with compassion, put forth [his] hand, and touched him, and saith unto him, I will; be thou clean.
column3: Markus 1:41 En Jesus het vir hom innig jammer gevoel en die hand uitgesteek en hom aangeraak en vir hom gesê: Ek wil, word gereinig!

column2: Mark 1:42 And as soon as he had spoken, immediately the leprosy departed from him, and he was cleansed.
column3: Markus 1:42 En toe Hy dit sê, het die melaatsheid hom dadelik verlaat, en hy is gereinig.

column2: Mark 1:43 And he straitly charged him, and forthwith sent him away;
column3: Markus 1:43 En nadat Hy hom ernstig aangespreek het, stuur Hy hom dadelik weg

column2: Mark 1:44 And saith unto him, See thou say nothing to any man: but go thy way, shew thyself to the priest, and offer for thy cleansing those things which Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.
column3: Markus 1:44 en sê vir hom: Pas op dat jy aan niemand iets vertel nie, maar gaan vertoon jou aan die priester en offer vir jou reiniging wat Moses voorgeskryf het, tot ’n getuienis vir hulle.

column2: Mark 1:45 But he went out, and began to publish [it] much, and to blaze abroad the matter, insomuch that Jesus could no more openly enter into the city, but was without in desert places: and they came to him from every quarter.
column3: Markus 1:45 Maar hy het uitgegaan en begin om baie dinge rond te vertel en die saak rugbaar te maak, sodat Hy nie meer openlik in ’n stad kon ingaan nie; maar Hy was buite in verlate plekke, en hulle het van alle kante na Hom gekom.

column2: Mark 2:1 And again he entered into Capernaum after [some] days; and it was noised that he was in the house.
column3: Markus 2:1 EN ná ’n paar dae het Hy weer in Kapérnaüm gekom, en die mense het gehoor dat Hy in die huis was.

column2: Mark 2:2 And straightway many were gathered together, insomuch that there was no room to receive [them], no, not so much as about the door: and he preached the word unto them.
column3: Markus 2:2 En dadelik het baie saamgekom, sodat daar selfs by die deur nie meer plek was nie; en Hy was besig om aan hulle die woord te verkondig.

column2: Mark 2:3 And they come unto him, bringing one sick of the palsy, which was borne of four.
column3: Markus 2:3 En daar kom mense na Hom met ’n verlamde man wat deur vier gedra word.

column2: Mark 2:4 And when they could not come nigh unto him for the press, they uncovered the roof where he was: and when they had broken [it] up, they let down the bed wherein the sick of the palsy lay.
column3: Markus 2:4 En toe hulle vanweë die skare nie naby Hom kon kom nie, maak hulle die dak oop waar Hy was, en nadat hulle dit oopgebreek het, het hulle die bed waar die verlamde op lê, laat afsak.

column2: Mark 2:5 When Jesus saw their faith, he said unto the sick of the palsy, Son, thy sins be forgiven thee.
column3: Markus 2:5 En toe Jesus hulle geloof sien, sê Hy vir die verlamde: Seun, jou sondes is jou vergewe!

column2: Mark 2:6 But there were certain of the scribes sitting there, and reasoning in their hearts,
column3: Markus 2:6 En sommige van die skrifgeleerdes het daar gesit en in hulle harte geredeneer:

column2: Mark 2:7 Why doth this [man] thus speak blasphemies? who can forgive sins but God only?
column3: Markus 2:7 Waarom praat hierdie man so godslasterlik? Wie kan sondes vergewe behalwe Een, naamlik God?

column2: Mark 2:8 And immediately when Jesus perceived in his spirit that they so reasoned within themselves, he said unto them, Why reason ye these things in your hearts?
column3: Markus 2:8 En Jesus het dadelik in sy gees geweet dat hulle by hulleself so redeneer, en Hy sê vir hulle: Wat redeneer julle oor hierdie dinge in jul harte?

column2: Mark 2:9 Whether is it easier to say to the sick of the palsy, [Thy] sins be forgiven thee; or to say, Arise, and take up thy bed, and walk?
column3: Markus 2:9 Wat is makliker, om vir die verlamde te sê: Die sondes is jou vergewe! of om te sê: Staan op en neem jou bed op en loop?

column2: Mark 2:10 But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power on earth to forgive sins, (he saith to the sick of the palsy,)
column3: Markus 2:10 Maar dat julle kan weet dat die Seun van die mens mag het om op die aarde sondes te vergewe — sê Hy vir die verlamde man:

column2: Mark 2:11 I say unto thee, Arise, and take up thy bed, and go thy way into thine house.
column3: Markus 2:11 Ek sê vir jou: Staan op, neem jou bed op en gaan na jou huis toe.

column2: Mark 2:12 And immediately he arose, took up the bed, and went forth before them all; insomuch that they were all amazed, and glorified God, saying, We never saw it on this fashion.
column3: Markus 2:12 En dadelik staan hy op en neem sy bed op en gaan voor die oë van almal uit, sodat almal verbaas was en God verheerlik en sê: So iets het ons nog nooit gesien nie!

column2: Mark 2:13 And he went forth again by the sea side; and all the multitude resorted unto him, and he taught them.
column3: Markus 2:13 EN Hy het weer uitgegaan langs die see, en die hele skare het na Hom gekom, en Hy het hulle geleer.

column2: Mark 2:14 And as he passed by, he saw Levi the [son] of Alphaeus sitting at the receipt of custom, and said unto him, Follow me. And he arose and followed him.
column3: Markus 2:14 En toe Hy verbygaan, sien Hy Levi, die seun van Alféüs, by die tolhuis sit en sê vir hom: Volg My. En hy het opgestaan en Hom gevolg.

column2: Mark 2:15 And it came to pass, that, as Jesus sat at meat in his house, many publicans and sinners sat also together with Jesus and his disciples: for there were many, and they followed him.
column3: Markus 2:15 En terwyl Hy in sy huis aan tafel was, kom daar baie tollenaars en sondaars saam met Jesus en sy dissipels aan tafel; want daar was baie, en hulle het Hom gevolg.

column2: Mark 2:16 And when the scribes and Pharisees saw him eat with publicans and sinners, they said unto his disciples, How is it that he eateth and drinketh with publicans and sinners?
column3: Markus 2:16 En toe die skrifgeleerdes en die Fariseërs Hom saam met die tollenaars en sondaars sien eet, sê hulle vir sy dissipels: Wat is dit dat Hy saam met die tollenaars en sondaars eet en drink?

column2: Mark 2:17 When Jesus heard [it], he saith unto them, They that are whole have no need of the physician, but they that are sick: I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.
column3: Markus 2:17 En toe Jesus dit hoor, sê Hy vir hulle: Die wat gesond is, het die geneesheer nie nodig nie, maar die wat ongesteld is. Ek het nie gekom om regverdiges te roep nie, maar sondaars tot bekering.

column2: Mark 2:18 And the disciples of John and of the Pharisees used to fast: and they come and say unto him, Why do the disciples of John and of the Pharisees fast, but thy disciples fast not?
column3: Markus 2:18 EN die dissipels van Johannes en dié van die Fariseërs was besig om te vas. Toe kom hulle en sê vir Hom: Waarom vas die dissipels van Johannes en dié van die Fariseërs, maar u dissipels vas nie?

column2: Mark 2:19 And Jesus said unto them, Can the children of the bridechamber fast, while the bridegroom is with them? as long as they have the bridegroom with them, they cannot fast.
column3: Markus 2:19 En Jesus sê vir hulle: Kan die bruilofsgaste dan vas terwyl die bruidegom by hulle is? So lank as hulle die bruidegom by hulle het, kan hulle nie vas nie.

column2: Mark 2:20 But the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them, and then shall they fast in those days.
column3: Markus 2:20 Maar daar sal dae kom wanneer die bruidegom van hulle weggeneem word, en dan sal hulle vas, in daardie dae.

column2: Mark 2:21 No man also seweth a piece of new cloth on an old garment: else the new piece that filled it up taketh away from the old, and the rent is made worse.
