column3: Markus 2:21 En niemand werk ’n nuwe stuk lap op ’n ou kleed nie; anders skeur sy nuwe aangelapte stuk van die oue af, en daar kom ’n erger skeur.

column2: Mark 2:22 And no man putteth new wine into old bottles: else the new wine doth burst the bottles, and the wine is spilled, and the bottles will be marred: but new wine must be put into new bottles.
column3: Markus 2:22 En niemand gooi nuwe wyn in ou leersakke nie; anders sal die nuwe wyn die sakke laat bars, en die wyn loop uit en die sakke vergaan. Maar nuwe wyn moet in nuwe sakke gegooi word.

column2: Mark 2:23 And it came to pass, that he went through the corn fields on the sabbath day; and his disciples began, as they went, to pluck the ears of corn.
column3: Markus 2:23 EN terwyl Hy op die sabbat deur die gesaaides loop, het sy dissipels al gaande are begin pluk.

column2: Mark 2:24 And the Pharisees said unto him, Behold, why do they on the sabbath day that which is not lawful?
column3: Markus 2:24 Toe sê die Fariseërs vir Hom: Kyk, waarom doen hulle op die sabbat wat nie geoorloof is nie?

column2: Mark 2:25 And he said unto them, Have ye never read what David did, when he had need, and was an hungred, he, and they that were with him?
column3: Markus 2:25 En Hy sê vir hulle: Het julle nooit gelees wat Dawid gedoen het nie — toe hy in die nood was, en hy en die wat by hom was, honger gehad het —

column2: Mark 2:26 How he went into the house of God in the days of Abiathar the high priest, and did eat the shewbread, which is not lawful to eat but for the priests, and gave also to them which were with him?
column3: Markus 2:26 hoe hy in die huis van God gegaan het in die tyd van Ábjatar, die hoëpriester, en die toonbrode geëet het wat vir niemand behalwe die priesters geoorloof is om te eet nie; en ook aan die wat saam met hom was, gegee het?

column2: Mark 2:27 And he said unto them, The sabbath was made for man, and not man for the sabbath:
column3: Markus 2:27 En Hy sê vir hulle: Die sabbat is gemaak vir die mens, nie die mens vir die sabbat nie.

column2: Mark 2:28 Therefore the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath.
column3: Markus 2:28 Daarom is die Seun van die mens Here ook van die sabbat.

column2: Mark 3:1 And he entered again into the synagogue; and there was a man there which had a withered hand.
column3: Markus 3:1 EN Hy het weer in die sinagoge gegaan, en dáár was ’n man met ’n verdorde hand.

column2: Mark 3:2 And they watched him, whether he would heal him on the sabbath day; that they might accuse him.
column3: Markus 3:2 En hulle het Hom in die oog gehou, of Hy hom op die sabbat gesond sou maak, sodat hulle Hom kon aanklae.

column2: Mark 3:3 And he saith unto the man which had the withered hand, Stand forth.
column3: Markus 3:3 En Hy sê vir die man met die verdorde hand: Staan op in hul midde.

column2: Mark 3:4 And he saith unto them, Is it lawful to do good on the sabbath days, or to do evil? to save life, or to kill? But they held their peace.
column3: Markus 3:4 Daarop sê Hy vir hulle: Is dit geoorloof om op die sabbat goed of kwaad te doen, ’n lewe te red of dood te maak? Maar hulle het stilgebly.

column2: Mark 3:5 And when he had looked round about on them with anger, being grieved for the hardness of their hearts, he saith unto the man, Stretch forth thine hand. And he stretched [it] out: and his hand was restored whole as the other.
column3: Markus 3:5 En nadat Hy hulle rondom met toorn aangekyk het en tegelykertyd bedroef was oor die hardheid van hulle hart, sê Hy vir die man: Steek jou hand uit! En hy het dit uitgesteek, en sy hand is herstel, gesond soos die ander een.

column2: Mark 3:6 And the Pharisees went forth, and straightway took counsel with the Herodians against him, how they might destroy him.
column3: Markus 3:6 Toe gaan die Fariseërs uit en hou dadelik raad met die Herodiane teen Hom, sodat hulle Hom sou kan ombring.

column2: Mark 3:7 But Jesus withdrew himself with his disciples to the sea: and a great multitude from Galilee followed him, and from Judaea,
column3: Markus 3:7 En Jesus het met sy dissipels teruggegaan na die see toe, en ’n groot menigte het Hom gevolg uit Galiléa en Judéa

column2: Mark 3:8 And from Jerusalem, and from Idumaea, and [from] beyond Jordan; and they about Tyre and Sidon, a great multitude, when they had heard what great things he did, came unto him.
column3: Markus 3:8 en Jerusalem en Iduméa en van oorkant die Jordaan af. En die wat om Tirus en Sidon gewoon het, ’n groot menigte, het na Hom gekom toe hulle hoor wat Hy alles doen.

column2: Mark 3:9 And he spake to his disciples, that a small ship should wait on him because of the multitude, lest they should throng him.
column3: Markus 3:9 En Hy het aan sy dissipels gesê dat ’n skuitjie altyd vir Hom moes klaar lê vanweë die skare, sodat hulle Hom nie miskien sou verdring nie.

column2: Mark 3:10 For he had healed many; insomuch that they pressed upon him for to touch him, as many as had plagues.
column3: Markus 3:10 Want Hy het baie gesond gemaak, sodat almal wat vol kwale was, op Hom toegeloop het om Hom aan te raak.

column2: Mark 3:11 And unclean spirits, when they saw him, fell down before him, and cried, saying, Thou art the Son of God.
column3: Markus 3:11 En elke keer as die onreine geeste Hom sien, het hulle voor Hom neergeval en geskreeu en gesê: U is die Seun van God!

column2: Mark 3:12 And he straitly charged them that they should not make him known.
column3: Markus 3:12 En Hy het hulle herhaaldelik streng gebied om Hom nie bekend te maak nie.

column2: Mark 3:13 And he goeth up into a mountain, and calleth [unto him] whom he would: and they came unto him.
column3: Markus 3:13 EN Hy het op die berg geklim en na Hom geroep die wat Hy wou hê, en hulle het na Hom gekom.

column2: Mark 3:14 And he ordained twelve, that they should be with him, and that he might send them forth to preach,
column3: Markus 3:14 En Hy het twaalf aangestel, sodat hulle saam met Hom kon wees en Hy hulle kon uitstuur om te preek

column2: Mark 3:15 And to have power to heal sicknesses, and to cast out devils:
column3: Markus 3:15 en mag te hê om siektes te genees en die duiwels uit te dryf.

column2: Mark 3:16 And Simon he surnamed Peter;
column3: Markus 3:16 En aan Simon het Hy die bynaam Petrus gegee;

column2: Mark 3:17 And James the [son] of Zebedee, and John the brother of James; and he surnamed them Boanerges, which is, The sons of thunder:
column3: Markus 3:17 en verder Jakobus, die seun van Sebedéüs, en Johannes, die broer van Jakobus — aan hulle het Hy die bynaam Boanérges gegee, dit is, seuns van die donder —

column2: Mark 3:18 And Andrew, and Philip, and Bartholomew, and Matthew, and Thomas, and James the [son] of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus, and Simon the Canaanite,
column3: Markus 3:18 en Andréas en Filippus, en Bartholoméüs en Matthéüs, en Thomas en Jakobus, die seun van Alféüs, en Thaddéüs en Simon Kananítes,

column2: Mark 3:19 And Judas Iscariot, which also betrayed him: and they went into an house.
column3: Markus 3:19 en Judas Iskáriot, hy wat Hom verraai het.

column2: Mark 3:20 And the multitude cometh together again, so that they could not so much as eat bread.
column3: Markus 3:20 EN hulle het in ’n huis gegaan, en ’n skare het weer saamgekom, sodat hulle selfs nie brood kon eet nie.

column2: Mark 3:21 And when his friends heard [of it], they went out to lay hold on him: for they said, He is beside himself.
column3: Markus 3:21 Toe sy mense dit hoor, gaan hulle uit om Hom in die hande te kry; want hulle het gesê: Hy is buite sy sinne.

column2: Mark 3:22 And the scribes which came down from Jerusalem said, He hath Beelzebub, and by the prince of the devils casteth he out devils.
column3: Markus 3:22 En die skrifgeleerdes wat van Jerusalem af gekom het, het gesê: Hy het Beëlsebul! en: Deur die owerste van die duiwels dryf Hy die duiwels uit.

column2: Mark 3:23 And he called them [unto him], and said unto them in parables, How can Satan cast out Satan?
column3: Markus 3:23 En Hy het hulle na Hom geroep en vir hulle deur gelykenisse gesê: Hoe kan die Satan die Satan uitdryf?

column2: Mark 3:24 And if a kingdom be divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.
column3: Markus 3:24 En as ’n koninkryk teen homself verdeeld is, kan daardie koninkryk nie bly staan nie;

column2: Mark 3:25 And if a house be divided against itself, that house cannot stand.
column3: Markus 3:25 en as ’n huis teen homself verdeeld is, kan daardie huis nie bly staan nie;

column2: Mark 3:26 And if Satan rise up against himself, and be divided, he cannot stand, but hath an end.
column3: Markus 3:26 en as die Satan teen homself opstaan en verdeeld is, kan hy nie bly staan nie, maar hy kom tot ’n einde.

column2: Mark 3:27 No man can enter into a strong man's house, and spoil his goods, except he will first bind the strong man; and then he will spoil his house.
column3: Markus 3:27 Niemand kan in die huis van ’n sterk man ingaan en sy goed roof as hy nie eers die sterk man boei nie; en dan sal hy sy huis berowe.

column2: Mark 3:28 Verily I say unto you, All sins shall be forgiven unto the sons of men, and blasphemies wherewith soever they shall blaspheme:
column3: Markus 3:28 Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, al die sondes sal die mensekinders vergewe word en al die lasteringe wat hulle mag uitgespreek het;

column2: Mark 3:29 But he that shall blaspheme against the Holy Ghost hath never forgiveness, but is in danger of eternal damnation:
column3: Markus 3:29 maar wie teen die Heilige Gees gelaster het, het geen vergifnis tot in ewigheid nie, maar is skuldig aan die ewige oordeel —

column2: Mark 3:30 Because they said, He hath an unclean spirit.
column3: Markus 3:30 omdat hulle gesê het: Hy het ’n onreine gees.

column2: Mark 3:31 There came then his brethren and his mother, and, standing without, sent unto him, calling him.
column3: Markus 3:31 SY broers en sy moeder het toe gekom, en terwyl hulle buite staan, stuur hulle na Hom om Hom te roep.

column2: Mark 3:32 And the multitude sat about him, and they said unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren without seek for thee.
column3: Markus 3:32 En ’n skare het rondom Hom gesit Hulle sê toe vir Hom: U moeder en u broers soek U daarbuite.

column2: Mark 3:33 And he answered them, saying, Who is my mother, or my brethren?
column3: Markus 3:33 En Hy antwoord hulle en sê: Wie is my moeder of my broers?

column2: Mark 3:34 And he looked round about on them which sat about him, and said, Behold my mother and my brethren!
column3: Markus 3:34 En Hy kyk rond na die wat rondom Hom sit, en sê: Dáár is my moeder en my broers!

column2: Mark 3:35 For whosoever shall do the will of God, the same is my brother, and my sister, and mother.
column3: Markus 3:35 Want elkeen wat die wil van God doen, dié is my broer en my suster en moeder.

column2: Mark 4:1 And he began again to teach by the sea side: and there was gathered unto him a great multitude, so that he entered into a ship, and sat in the sea; and the whole multitude was by the sea on the land.
column3: Markus 4:1 EN Hy het nog ’n maal by die see begin leer; en ’n groot menigte het by Hom saamgekom, sodat Hy in die skuit geklim en op die see gaan sit het, en die hele skare was op die land by die see.

column2: Mark 4:2 And he taught them many things by parables, and said unto them in his doctrine,
column3: Markus 4:2 En Hy het hulle baie dinge geleer deur gelykenisse en vir hulle in sy lering gesê:

column2: Mark 4:3 Hearken; Behold, there went out a sower to sow:
column3: Markus 4:3 Luister! ’n Saaier het uitgegaan om te saai.

column2: Mark 4:4 And it came to pass, as he sowed, some fell by the way side, and the fowls of the air came and devoured it up.
column3: Markus 4:4 En terwyl hy saai, het ’n deel langs die pad geval, en die voëls van die hemel het gekom en dit opgeëet.

column2: Mark 4:5 And some fell on stony ground, where it had not much earth; and immediately it sprang up, because it had no depth of earth:
column3: Markus 4:5 En ’n ander deel het op ’n rotsagtige plek geval waar dit nie baie grond gehad het nie; en dadelik het dit opgekom, omdat dit geen diepte van grond gehad het nie.

column2: Mark 4:6 But when the sun was up, it was scorched; and because it had no root, it withered away.
column3: Markus 4:6 En toe die son opgaan, is dit verskroei; en omdat dit geen wortel gehad het nie, het dit verdroog.

column2: Mark 4:7 And some fell among thorns, and the thorns grew up, and choked it, and it yielded no fruit.
column3: Markus 4:7 En ’n ander deel het in die dorings geval, en die dorings het opgekom en dit verstik; en dit het geen vrug opgelewer nie.

column2: Mark 4:8 And other fell on good ground, and did yield fruit that sprang up and increased; and brought forth, some thirty, and some sixty, and some an hundred.
column3: Markus 4:8 En ’n ander deel het in die goeie grond geval, en dit het vrug opgelewer; want dit het opgekom, en gegroei, en dit het gedra: een dertig- en een sestig- en een honderdvoudig.

column2: Mark 4:9 And he said unto them, He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
column3: Markus 4:9 En Hy sê vir hulle: Wie ore het om te hoor, laat hom hoor.

column2: Mark 4:10 And when he was alone, they that were about him with the twelve asked of him the parable.
column3: Markus 4:10 En toe Hy alleen was, het die wat saam met die twaalf rondom Hom was, Hom na die gelykenis gevra.

column2: Mark 4:11 And he said unto them, Unto you it is given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God: but unto them that are without, all [these] things are done in parables:
column3: Markus 4:11 En Hy sê vir hulle: Aan julle is dit gegee om die verborgenheid van die koninkryk van God te ken, maar vir hulle wat buite is, kom alles deur gelykenisse,

column2: Mark 4:12 That seeing they may see, and not perceive; and hearing they may hear, and not understand; lest at any time they should be converted, and [their] sins should be forgiven them.
column3: Markus 4:12 sodat hulle kan kyk en kyk, en nie sien nie; en hoor en hoor, en nie verstaan nie, dat hulle hul nie miskien bekeer en die sondes hulle vergewe word nie.

column2: Mark 4:13 And he said unto them, Know ye not this parable? and how then will ye know all parables?
column3: Markus 4:13 En Hy sê vir hulle: Begryp julle nie hierdie gelykenis nie? En hoe sal julle al die gelykenisse verstaan?

column2: Mark 4:14 The sower soweth the word.
column3: Markus 4:14 Die saaier saai die woord.

column2: Mark 4:15 And these are they by the way side, where the word is sown; but when they have heard, Satan cometh immediately, and taketh away the word that was sown in their hearts.
column3: Markus 4:15 En dit is hulle wat langs die pad is — waar die woord gesaai word, maar sodra hulle dit gehoor het, kom die Satan dadelik en neem die woord weg wat in hulle harte gesaai is.

column2: Mark 4:16 And these are they likewise which are sown on stony ground; who, when they have heard the word, immediately receive it with gladness;
column3: Markus 4:16 Net so ook is hulle by wie op rotsagtige plekke gesaai word — wat, as hulle die woord hoor, dit dadelik met blydskap aanneem,

column2: Mark 4:17 And have no root in themselves, and so endure but for a time: afterward, when affliction or persecution ariseth for the word's sake, immediately they are offended.
column3: Markus 4:17 maar geen wortel in hulleself het nie; hulle is net vir ’n tyd. Later as daar verdrukking of vervolging kom ter wille van die woord, struikel hulle dadelik.

column2: Mark 4:18 And these are they which are sown among thorns; such as hear the word,
column3: Markus 4:18 En hulle by wie in die dorings gesaai word — dit is hulle wat die woord hoor,

column2: Mark 4:19 And the cares of this world, and the deceitfulness of riches, and the lusts of other things entering in, choke the word, and it becometh unfruitful.
column3: Markus 4:19 en die sorge van hierdie wêreld en die verleiding van die rykdom en die begeerlikhede in verband met die ander dinge kom in en verstik die woord, en dit word onvrugbaar.

column2: Mark 4:20 And these are they which are sown on good ground; such as hear the word, and receive [it], and bring forth fruit, some thirtyfold, some sixty, and some an hundred.
column3: Markus 4:20 En dit is hulle by wie in die goeie grond gesaai is — hulle wat die woord hoor en aanneem en vrugte dra: een dertig- en een sestig- en een honderdvoudig.

column2: Mark 4:21 And he said unto them, Is a candle brought to be put under a bushel, or under a bed? and not to be set on a candlestick?
column3: Markus 4:21 EN Hy het vir hulle gesê: Die lamp kom tog nie om onder die maatemmer of onder die bed gesit te word nie. Is dit nie om op die staander gesit te word nie?

column2: Mark 4:22 For there is nothing hid, which shall not be manifested; neither was any thing kept secret, but that it should come abroad.
column3: Markus 4:22 Want daar is niks verborge wat nie openbaar sal word nie, en daar is niks weggesteek nie of dit moet in die lig kom.

column2: Mark 4:23 If any man have ears to hear, let him hear.
column3: Markus 4:23 As iemand ore het om te hoor, laat hom hoor.

column2: Mark 4:24 And he said unto them, Take heed what ye hear: with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you: and unto you that hear shall more be given.
column3: Markus 4:24 En Hy het vir hulle gesê: Pas op wat julle hoor; met die maat waarmee julle meet, sal vir julle gemeet word, en daar sal bygevoeg word vir julle wat hoor.

column2: Mark 4:25 For he that hath, to him shall be given: and he that hath not, from him shall be taken even that which he hath.
column3: Markus 4:25 Want wie het, vir hom sal gegee word; en wie nie het nie, van hom sal weggeneem word ook wat hy het.

column2: Mark 4:26 And he said, So is the kingdom of God, as if a man should cast seed into the ground;
column3: Markus 4:26 EN Hy het gesê: So is die koninkryk van God, soos wanneer ’n mens die saad in die grond gooi;

column2: Mark 4:27 And should sleep, and rise night and day, and the seed should spring and grow up, he knoweth not how.
column3: Markus 4:27 en hy gaan slaap en staan op, nag en dag, en die saad spruit uit en word groot — hoe, weet hy self nie.

column2: Mark 4:28 For the earth bringeth forth fruit of herself; first the blade, then the ear, after that the full corn in the ear.
column3: Markus 4:28 Want vanself bring die aarde vrug voort, eers ’n halm, dan ’n aar, dan die volle koring in die aar.

column2: Mark 4:29 But when the fruit is brought forth, immediately he putteth in the sickle, because the harvest is come.
column3: Markus 4:29 En wanneer die vrug dit toelaat, steek hy die sekel dadelik in, omdat die oes daar is.

column2: Mark 4:30 And he said, Whereunto shall we liken the kingdom of God? or with what comparison shall we compare it?
column3: Markus 4:30 EN Hy het gesê: Waarmee moet ons die koninkryk van God vergelyk, of met watter soort gelykenis moet ons dit voorstel?

column2: Mark 4:31 [It is] like a grain of mustard seed, which, when it is sown in the earth, is less than all the seeds that be in the earth:
column3: Markus 4:31 Dit is soos ’n mosterdsaad, wat die kleinste is van al die soorte saad op die aarde wanneer dit in die grond gesaai is;

column2: Mark 4:32 But when it is sown, it groweth up, and becometh greater than all herbs, and shooteth out great branches; so that the fowls of the air may lodge under the shadow of it.
column3: Markus 4:32 en wanneer dit gesaai is, kom dit op en word groter as al die groentesoorte en maak groot takke, sodat die voëls van die hemel onder sy skaduwee nes kan maak.

column2: Mark 4:33 And with many such parables spake he the word unto them, as they were able to hear [it].
column3: Markus 4:33 En met baie sulke gelykenisse het Hy die woord tot hulle gespreek volgens wat hulle kon verstaan;

column2: Mark 4:34 But without a parable spake he not unto them: and when they were alone, he expounded all things to his disciples.
column3: Markus 4:34 en sonder gelykenis het Hy tot hulle nie gespreek nie; maar afsonderlik het Hy vir sy dissipels alles uitgelê.

column2: Mark 4:35 And the same day, when the even was come, he saith unto them, Let us pass over unto the other side.
column3: Markus 4:35 EN toe dit aand geword het op daardie dag, het Hy vir hulle gesê: Laat ons oorvaar na die ander kant.

column2: Mark 4:36 And when they had sent away the multitude, they took him even as he was in the ship. And there were also with him other little ships.
column3: Markus 4:36 En hulle het die skare verlaat en Hom, net soos Hy was, saamgeneem in die skuit; en daar was ook ander skuitjies by Hom.

column2: Mark 4:37 And there arose a great storm of wind, and the waves beat into the ship, so that it was now full.
column3: Markus 4:37 En ’n groot stormwind het opgekom, en die golwe het in die skuit geslaan, sodat dit al vol wou word.

column2: Mark 4:38 And he was in the hinder part of the ship, asleep on a pillow: and they awake him, and say unto him, Master, carest thou not that we perish?
column3: Markus 4:38 Maar Hy was agter op die skuit aan die slaap op die kussing. En hulle het Hom wakker gemaak en vir Hom gesê: Meester, gee U nie om dat ons vergaan nie?

column2: Mark 4:39 And he arose, and rebuked the wind, and said unto the sea, Peace, be still. And the wind ceased, and there was a great calm.
column3: Markus 4:39 En Hy het opgestaan en die wind bestraf en vir die see gesê: Swyg, wees stil! En die wind het gaan lê, en daar het ’n groot stilte gekom.

column2: Mark 4:40 And he said unto them, Why are ye so fearful? how is it that ye have no faith?
column3: Markus 4:40 Toe sê Hy vir hulle: Waarom is julle so bang? Hoe het julle dan geen geloof nie?

column2: Mark 4:41 And they feared exceedingly, and said one to another, What manner of man is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?
column3: Markus 4:41 En ’n groot vrees het hulle oorweldig, en hulle het vir mekaar gesê: Wie is Hy tog, dat selfs die wind en die see Hom gehoorsaam is!

column2: Mark 5:1 And they came over unto the other side of the sea, into the country of the Gadarenes.
column3: Markus 5:1 EN hulle het aan die oorkant van die see gekom in die land van die Gadaréners.

column2: Mark 5:2 And when he was come out of the ship, immediately there met him out of the tombs a man with an unclean spirit,
column3: Markus 5:2 En toe Hy uit die skuit gaan, kom daar dadelik uit die grafte Hom tegemoet ’n man met ’n onreine gees,

column2: Mark 5:3 Who had [his] dwelling among the tombs; and no man could bind him, no, not with chains:
column3: Markus 5:3 wat sy verblyf in die grafte gehad het. En niemand kon selfs met kettings hom bind nie;

column2: Mark 5:4 Because that he had been often bound with fetters and chains, and the chains had been plucked asunder by him, and the fetters broken in pieces: neither could any [man] tame him.
column3: Markus 5:4 want hy was dikwels met voetboeie en kettings gebind, en die kettings is deur hom uitmekaar geruk en die voetboeie stukkend gebreek; en niemand was in staat om hom te tem nie.

column2: Mark 5:5 And always, night and day, he was in the mountains, and in the tombs, crying, and cutting himself with stones.
column3: Markus 5:5 En altyd, nag en dag, het hy aangehou om te skreeu op die berge en in die grafte en homself met klippe stukkend te slaan.

column2: Mark 5:6 But when he saw Jesus afar off, he ran and worshipped him,
column3: Markus 5:6 En toe hy Jesus van ver af sien, hardloop hy en val voor Hom neer

column2: Mark 5:7 And cried with a loud voice, and said, What have I to do with thee, Jesus, [thou] Son of the most high God? I adjure thee by God, that thou torment me not.
column3: Markus 5:7 en skreeu met ’n groot stem en sê: Wat het ek met U te doen, Jesus, Seun van die allerhoogste God? Ek besweer U by God om my nie te pynig nie.

column2: Mark 5:8 For he said unto him, Come out of the man, [thou] unclean spirit.
column3: Markus 5:8 Want Hy het vir hom gesê: Onreine gees, gaan uit die man uit!

column2: Mark 5:9 And he asked him, What [is] thy name? And he answered, saying, My name [is] Legion: for we are many.
column3: Markus 5:9 En Hy vra hom: Wat is jou naam? En hy antwoord en sê: Legio is my naam, want ons is baie.

column2: Mark 5:10 And he besought him much that he would not send them away out of the country.
column3: Markus 5:10 Toe smeek hy Hom dringend om hulle nie uit die land weg te stuur nie.

column2: Mark 5:11 Now there was there nigh unto the mountains a great herd of swine feeding.
column3: Markus 5:11 En dáár teen die berge het ’n groot trop varke gewei,

column2: Mark 5:12 And all the devils besought him, saying, Send us into the swine, that we may enter into them.
column3: Markus 5:12 en al die duiwels het Hom gesmeek en gesê: Stuur ons in die varke, sodat ons in hulle kan vaar.

column2: Mark 5:13 And forthwith Jesus gave them leave. And the unclean spirits went out, and entered into the swine: and the herd ran violently down a steep place into the sea, (they were about two thousand;) and were choked in the sea.
column3: Markus 5:13 En Jesus het hulle dit dadelik toegelaat; en die onreine geeste het uitgegaan en in die varke gevaar, en die trop — daar was omtrent tweeduisend — het van die krans af in die see gestorm en in die see verdrink.

column2: Mark 5:14 And they that fed the swine fled, and told [it] in the city, and in the country. And they went out to see what it was that was done.
column3: Markus 5:14 En die wagters van die varke het gevlug en dit in die stad en in die buitewyke vertel; en hulle het uitgekom om te sien wat daar gebeur het.

column2: Mark 5:15 And they come to Jesus, and see him that was possessed with the devil, and had the legion, sitting, and clothed, and in his right mind: and they were afraid.
column3: Markus 5:15 Toe kom hulle by Jesus en sien die besetene sit, gekleed en by sy verstand — die een wat die legioen gehad het. En hulle was bevrees.

column2: Mark 5:16 And they that saw [it] told them how it befell to him that was possessed with the devil, and [also] concerning the swine.
column3: Markus 5:16 Die wat dit gesien het, vertel toe aan hulle hoe dit met die besetene gegaan het, en ook van die varke.

column2: Mark 5:17 And they began to pray him to depart out of their coasts.
column3: Markus 5:17 En hulle het Hom begin smeek om weg te gaan uit hulle gebied.

column2: Mark 5:18 And when he was come into the ship, he that had been possessed with the devil prayed him that he might be with him.
column3: Markus 5:18 En toe Hy in die skuit klim, het die man wat van die duiwels besete gewees het, Hom gesmeek om by Hom te kan bly.

column2: Mark 5:19 Howbeit Jesus suffered him not, but saith unto him, Go home to thy friends, and tell them how great things the Lord hath done for thee, and hath had compassion on thee.
column3: Markus 5:19 Maar Jesus het hom dit nie toegelaat nie, maar vir hom gesê: Gaan na jou huis na jou mense toe, en vertel hulle watter groot dinge die Here aan jou gedoen het, en dat Hy jou barmhartig was.

column2: Mark 5:20 And he departed, and began to publish in Decapolis how great things Jesus had done for him: and all [men] did marvel.
column3: Markus 5:20 En hy het weggegaan en in Dekápolis begin verkondig watter groot dinge Jesus aan hom gedoen het, en almal was verwonderd.

column2: Mark 5:21 And when Jesus was passed over again by ship unto the other side, much people gathered unto him: and he was nigh unto the sea.
column3: Markus 5:21 EN toe Jesus weer in die skuit oorgevaar het na die ander kant, het ’n groot menigte by Hom vergader. En Hy was by die see.

column2: Mark 5:22 And, behold, there cometh one of the rulers of the synagogue, Jairus by name; and when he saw him, he fell at his feet,
column3: Markus 5:22 En daar kom een van die owerstes van die sinagoge met die naam van Jaïrus; en toe hy Hom sien, val hy aan sy voete neer

column2: Mark 5:23 And besought him greatly, saying, My little daughter lieth at the point of death: [I pray thee], come and lay thy hands on her, that she may be healed; and she shall live.
column3: Markus 5:23 en smeek Hom dringend en sê: My dogtertjie is op haar uiterste; kom lê haar die hande op, sodat sy gesond kan word, en sy sal lewe.

column2: Mark 5:24 And [Jesus] went with him; and much people followed him, and thronged him.
column3: Markus 5:24 En Hy het saam met hom gegaan. En ’n groot menigte het Hom gevolg en Hom verdring.

column2: Mark 5:25 And a certain woman, which had an issue of blood twelve years,
column3: Markus 5:25 En ’n sekere vrou wat twaalf jaar lank bloedvloeiing gehad het

column2: Mark 5:26 And had suffered many things of many physicians, and had spent all that she had, and was nothing bettered, but rather grew worse,
column3: Markus 5:26 en veel onder baie geneeshere gely en al haar besittings uitgegee het sonder om enige baat te vind, maar eerder erger geword het,

column2: Mark 5:27 When she had heard of Jesus, came in the press behind, and touched his garment.
column3: Markus 5:27 het van Jesus gehoor en onder die skare van agter gekom en sy kleed aangeraak;

column2: Mark 5:28 For she said, If I may touch but his clothes, I shall be whole.
column3: Markus 5:28 want sy het gesê: As ek maar sy klere kan aanraak, sal ek gesond word.

column2: Mark 5:29 And straightway the fountain of her blood was dried up; and she felt in [her] body that she was healed of that plague.
column3: Markus 5:29 En dadelik het die fontein van haar bloed opgedroog, en sy het aan haar liggaam bemerk dat sy van haar kwaal genees was.

column2: Mark 5:30 And Jesus, immediately knowing in himself that virtue had gone out of him, turned him about in the press, and said, Who touched my clothes?
column3: Markus 5:30 En dadelik toe Jesus in Homself die krag gewaarword wat van Hom uitgegaan het, draai Hy Hom om onder die skare en sê: Wie het my klere aangeraak?

column2: Mark 5:31 And his disciples said unto him, Thou seest the multitude thronging thee, and sayest thou, Who touched me?
column3: Markus 5:31 En sy dissipels antwoord Hom: U sien dat die skare U verdring, en U sê: Wie het My aangeraak?

column2: Mark 5:32 And he looked round about to see her that had done this thing.
column3: Markus 5:32 Toe kyk Hy rond om haar te sien wat dit gedoen het.

column2: Mark 5:33 But the woman fearing and trembling, knowing what was done in her, came and fell down before him, and told him all the truth.
column3: Markus 5:33 Die vrou, wat gevrees en gebeef het omdat sy wis wat met haar gebeur het, kom toe en val voor Hom neer en vertel Hom die hele waarheid.

column2: Mark 5:34 And he said unto her, Daughter, thy faith hath made thee whole; go in peace, and be whole of thy plague.
column3: Markus 5:34 En Hy sê vir haar: Dogter, jou geloof het jou gered. Gaan in vrede en wees van jou kwaal genees.

column2: Mark 5:35 While he yet spake, there came from the ruler of the synagogue's [house certain] which said, Thy daughter is dead: why troublest thou the Master any further?
column3: Markus 5:35 Terwyl Hy nog spreek, kom daar mense van die owerste van die sinagoge se huis en sê: U dogter is dood. Waarom val u die Meester nog lastig?

column2: Mark 5:36 As soon as Jesus heard the word that was spoken, he saith unto the ruler of the synagogue, Be not afraid, only believe.
column3: Markus 5:36 Maar dadelik, toe Jesus die woord hoor wat gespreek is, sê Hy vir die owerste van die sinagoge: Moenie vrees nie; glo net.

column2: Mark 5:37 And he suffered no man to follow him, save Peter, and James, and John the brother of James.
column3: Markus 5:37 En Hy het niemand toegelaat om saam met Hom te gaan nie, behalwe Petrus en Jakobus en Johannes, die broer van Jakobus.

column2: Mark 5:38 And he cometh to the house of the ruler of the synagogue, and seeth the tumult, and them that wept and wailed greatly.
column3: Markus 5:38 En Hy kom in die huis van die owerste van die sinagoge en sien ’n rumoer: mense wat baie ween en huil.

column2: Mark 5:39 And when he was come in, he saith unto them, Why make ye this ado, and weep? the damsel is not dead, but sleepeth.
column3: Markus 5:39 En toe Hy binnegaan, sê Hy vir hulle: Waarom gaan julle so te kere en ween julle? Die kind is nie dood nie, maar slaap.

column2: Mark 5:40 And they laughed him to scorn. But when he had put them all out, he taketh the father and the mother of the damsel, and them that were with him, and entereth in where the damsel was lying.
column3: Markus 5:40 En hulle het Hom uitgelag. Maar Hy het almal uitgedryf en die vader van die kind saamgeneem en die moeder en die wat by Hom was, en ingegaan waar die kind lê.

column2: Mark 5:41 And he took the damsel by the hand, and said unto her, Talitha cumi; which is, being interpreted, Damsel, I say unto thee, arise.
column3: Markus 5:41 Toe gryp Hy die hand van die kind en sê vir haar: Talíta, koemi! wat, as dit vertaal word, beteken: Dogtertjie, Ek sê vir jou, staan op!

column2: Mark 5:42 And straightway the damsel arose, and walked; for she was [of the age] of twelve years. And they were astonished with a great astonishment.
column3: Markus 5:42 En die dogtertjie het dadelik opgestaan en begin rondloop, want sy was twaalf jaar oud. En hulle was uitermate verbaas.

column2: Mark 5:43 And he charged them straitly that no man should know it; and commanded that something should be given her to eat.
column3: Markus 5:43 En Hy het hulle met nadruk beveel dat niemand dit moes weet nie, en gesê dat daar vir haar iets te ete gegee moes word.

column2: Mark 6:1 And he went out from thence, and came into his own country; and his disciples follow him.
column3: Markus 6:1 EN Hy het daarvandaan weggegaan en in sy vaderstad gekom, en sy dissipels het Hom gevolg.

column2: Mark 6:2 And when the sabbath day was come, he began to teach in the synagogue: and many hearing [him] were astonished, saying, From whence hath this [man] these things? and what wisdom [is] this which is given unto him, that even such mighty works are wrought by his hands?
column3: Markus 6:2 En toe dit sabbat geword het, begin Hy in die sinagoge te leer, en baie wat Hom gehoor het, was verslae en sê: Waar kry Hy hierdie dinge vandaan, en watter wysheid is aan Hom gegee, dat ook sulke kragte deur sy hande plaasvind?

column2: Mark 6:3 Is not this the carpenter, the son of Mary, the brother of James, and Joses, and of Juda, and Simon? and are not his sisters here with us? And they were offended at him.
column3: Markus 6:3 Is Hy nie die timmerman, die seun van Maria, en die broer van Jakobus en Joses en Judas en Simon nie? En is sy susters nie hier by ons nie? En hulle het aanstoot aan Hom geneem.

column2: Mark 6:4 But Jesus said unto them, A prophet is not without honour, but in his own country, and among his own kin, and in his own house.
column3: Markus 6:4 En Jesus sê vir hulle: ’n Profeet is nie ongeëerd nie, behalwe in sy vaderland en onder sy familie en in sy huis.

column2: Mark 6:5 And he could there do no mighty work, save that he laid his hands upon a few sick folk, and healed [them].
column3: Markus 6:5 En Hy kon daar geen krag doen nie, behalwe dat Hy ’n paar siekes die hande opgelê en hulle gesond gemaak het.

column2: Mark 6:6 And he marvelled because of their unbelief. And he went round about the villages, teaching.
column3: Markus 6:6 En Hy was verwonderd oor hulle ongeloof. Daarop het Hy die dorpe rondom deurgegaan en geleer.

column2: Mark 6:7 And he called [unto him] the twelve, and began to send them forth by two and two; and gave them power over unclean spirits;
column3: Markus 6:7 EN Hy het die twaalf na Hom geroep en hulle twee-twee begin uitstuur en het hulle mag gegee oor die onreine geeste,

column2: Mark 6:8 And commanded them that they should take nothing for [their] journey, save a staff only; no scrip, no bread, no money in [their] purse:
column3: Markus 6:8 en hulle bevel gegee om niks vir die pad saam te neem nie as net ’n stok alleen — geen reissak, geen brood, geen geld in die beurs nie,

column2: Mark 6:9 But [be] shod with sandals; and not put on two coats.
column3: Markus 6:9 maar skoene aan die voete; en: Julle moet nie twee kledingstukke aantrek nie.

column2: Mark 6:10 And he said unto them, In what place soever ye enter into an house, there abide till ye depart from that place.
column3: Markus 6:10 En Hy het vir hulle gesê: Waar julle ook al in ’n huis mag kom, bly dáár totdat julle daarvandaan vertrek.

column2: Mark 6:11 And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear you, when ye depart thence, shake off the dust under your feet for a testimony against them. Verily I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment, than for that city.
column3: Markus 6:11 En almal wat julle nie ontvang of na julle luister nie, gaan daarvandaan weg en skud die stof onder julle voete af tot ’n getuienis teen hulle. Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, dit sal vir Sodom of Gomorra verdraagliker wees in die oordeelsdag as vir daardie stad.

column2: Mark 6:12 And they went out, and preached that men should repent.
column3: Markus 6:12 En hulle het uitgegaan en gepreek dat die mense hulle moes bekeer.

column2: Mark 6:13 And they cast out many devils, and anointed with oil many that were sick, and healed [them].
column3: Markus 6:13 En hulle het baie duiwels uitgedryf en baie siekes met olie gesalf en gesond gemaak.

column2: Mark 6:14 And king Herod heard [of him]; (for his name was spread abroad:) and he said, That John the Baptist was risen from the dead, and therefore mighty works do shew forth themselves in him.
column3: Markus 6:14 TOE koning Herodes dit hoor — want sy naam het bekend geword — het hy gesê: Johannes die Doper het uit die dode opgestaan, en daarom werk dié kragte in Hom.

column2: Mark 6:15 Others said, That it is Elias. And others said, That it is a prophet, or as one of the prophets.
column3: Markus 6:15 Ander het gesê: Hy is Elía, en ander weer het gesê: Hy is ’n profeet of soos een van die profete.

column2: Mark 6:16 But when Herod heard [thereof], he said, It is John, whom I beheaded: he is risen from the dead.
column3: Markus 6:16 Maar toe Herodes dit hoor, sê hy: Johannes wat ek onthoof het, dit is hy; hy het uit die dode opgestaan.

column2: Mark 6:17 For Herod himself had sent forth and laid hold upon John, and bound him in prison for Herodias' sake, his brother Philip's wife: for he had married her.
column3: Markus 6:17 Want Herodes self het gestuur en Johannes gevange geneem en hom in die gevangenis geboei, vanweë Heródias, die vrou van Filippus, sy broer, omdat hy met haar getrou het.

column2: Mark 6:18 For John had said unto Herod, It is not lawful for thee to have thy brother's wife.
column3: Markus 6:18 Want Johannes het aan Herodes gesê: Dit is u nie geoorloof om u broer se vrou te hê nie.

column2: Mark 6:19 Therefore Herodias had a quarrel against him, and would have killed him; but she could not:
column3: Markus 6:19 En Heródias het ’n oog op hom gehad en wou hom om die lewe bring en sy kon nie.

column2: Mark 6:20 For Herod feared John, knowing that he was a just man and an holy, and observed him; and when he heard him, he did many things, and heard him gladly.
column3: Markus 6:20 Want Herodes was bang vir Johannes, omdat hy wis dat hy ’n regverdige en heilige man was, en hy het hom beskerm; en nadat hy hom gehoor het, het hy baie dinge gedoen en graag na hom geluister.

column2: Mark 6:21 And when a convenient day was come, that Herod on his birthday made a supper to his lords, high captains, and chief [estates] of Galilee;
column3: Markus 6:21 En op die geskikte dag, toe Herodes op sy verjaarsdag vir sy groot manne en die owerstes oor duisend en die vernaamstes van Galiléa ’n maaltyd gegee het;

column2: Mark 6:22 And when the daughter of the said Herodias came in, and danced, and pleased Herod and them that sat with him, the king said unto the damsel, Ask of me whatsoever thou wilt, and I will give [it] thee.
column3: Markus 6:22 en toe die dogter van dieselfde Heródias inkom en dans, en Herodes en die wat saam aan tafel was, behaag, sê die koning vir die meisie: Vra my net wat jy wil, en ek sal dit aan jou gee.

column2: Mark 6:23 And he sware unto her, Whatsoever thou shalt ask of me, I will give [it] thee, unto the half of my kingdom.
column3: Markus 6:23 En hy het vir haar gesweer: Net wat jy my vra, sal ek jou gee, al was dit ook die helfte van my koninkryk.

column2: Mark 6:24 And she went forth, and said unto her mother, What shall I ask? And she said, The head of John the Baptist.
column3: Markus 6:24 Daarop gaan sy uit en sê vir haar moeder: Wat sal ek vra? Toe antwoord sy: Die hoof van Johannes die Doper.

column2: Mark 6:25 And she came in straightway with haste unto the king, and asked, saying, I will that thou give me by and by in a charger the head of John the Baptist.
column3: Markus 6:25 En dadelik gaan sy haastig in na die koning en vra en sê: Ek wil hê dat u my op die daad die hoof van Johannes die Doper op ’n skottel gee.

column2: Mark 6:26 And the king was exceeding sorry; [yet] for his oath's sake, and for their sakes which sat with him, he would not reject her.
column3: Markus 6:26 Toe word die koning baie bedroef, maar ter wille van die eed en die wat saam aan tafel was, wou hy haar nie afwys nie.

column2: Mark 6:27 And immediately the king sent an executioner, and commanded his head to be brought: and he went and beheaded him in the prison,
column3: Markus 6:27 En die koning stuur dadelik een van sy lyfwag met die bevel om sy hoof te bring; en hy het gegaan en hom in die gevangenis onthoof

column2: Mark 6:28 And brought his head in a charger, and gave it to the damsel: and the damsel gave it to her mother.
column3: Markus 6:28 en sy hoof op ’n skottel gebring en dit aan die meisie gegee, en die meisie het dit aan haar moeder gegee.

column2: Mark 6:29 And when his disciples heard [of it], they came and took up his corpse, and laid it in a tomb.
column3: Markus 6:29 En toe sy dissipels dit hoor, het hulle gekom en sy lyk weggeneem en dit in ’n graf neergelê.

column2: Mark 6:30 And the apostles gathered themselves together unto Jesus, and told him all things, both what they had done, and what they had taught.
column3: Markus 6:30 EN die apostels het by Jesus saamgekom en Hom alles vertel wat hulle gedoen sowel as wat hulle geleer het.

column2: Mark 6:31 And he said unto them, Come ye yourselves apart into a desert place, and rest a while: for there were many coming and going, and they had no leisure so much as to eat.
column3: Markus 6:31 En Hy sê vir hulle: Kom julle self in die eensaamheid na ’n verlate plek en rus ’n bietjie. Want daar was baie wat kom en gaan, en hulle het selfs geen geskikte tyd gehad om te eet nie.

column2: Mark 6:32 And they departed into a desert place by ship privately.
column3: Markus 6:32 En hulle het met die skuit vertrek na ’n verlate plek in die eensaamheid.

column2: Mark 6:33 And the people saw them departing, and many knew him, and ran afoot thither out of all cities, and outwent them, and came together unto him.
column3: Markus 6:33 En die skare het hulle sien weggaan, en baie het Hom herken en te voet van al die stede af daar saamgestroom en voor hulle uit gegaan en by Hom vergader.

column2: Mark 6:34 And Jesus, when he came out, saw much people, and was moved with compassion toward them, because they were as sheep not having a shepherd: and he began to teach them many things.
column3: Markus 6:34 En toe Jesus uitklim, sien Hy ’n groot menigte, en Hy het vir hulle innig jammer gevoel, omdat hulle soos skape sonder herder was; en Hy het hulle baie dinge begin leer.

column2: Mark 6:35 And when the day was now far spent, his disciples came unto him, and said, This is a desert place, and now the time [is] far passed:
column3: Markus 6:35 En toe dit reeds laat geword het, kom sy dissipels na Hom en sê: Die plek is verlate en dit is reeds laat.

column2: Mark 6:36 Send them away, that they may go into the country round about, and into the villages, and buy themselves bread: for they have nothing to eat.
column3: Markus 6:36 Stuur hulle weg, sodat hulle na die buitewyke en dorpe rondom kan gaan om brood vir hulleself te koop, want hulle het niks om te eet nie.

column2: Mark 6:37 He answered and said unto them, Give ye them to eat. And they say unto him, Shall we go and buy two hundred pennyworth of bread, and give them to eat?
column3: Markus 6:37 Maar Hy antwoord en sê vir hulle: Gee julle aan hulle iets om te eet. En hulle sê vir Hom: Moet ons gaan en vir tweehonderd pennings brood koop en aan hulle gee om te eet?

column2: Mark 6:38 He saith unto them, How many loaves have ye? go and see. And when they knew, they say, Five, and two fishes.
column3: Markus 6:38 En Hy sê vir hulle: Hoeveel brode het julle? Gaan kyk. En toe hulle dit te wete gekom het, sê hulle: Vyf, en twee visse.

column2: Mark 6:39 And he commanded them to make all sit down by companies upon the green grass.
column3: Markus 6:39 En Hy het hulle beveel om almal klompies-klompies op die groen gras te laat sit.

column2: Mark 6:40 And they sat down in ranks, by hundreds, and by fifties.
column3: Markus 6:40 En hulle het gaan sit in groepe van honderd en van vyftig.

column2: Mark 6:41 And when he had taken the five loaves and the two fishes, he looked up to heaven, and blessed, and brake the loaves, and gave [them] to his disciples to set before them; and the two fishes divided he among them all.
column3: Markus 6:41 Hy neem toe die vyf brode en die twee visse, kyk op na die hemel en dank; en Hy breek die brode en gee dit aan sy dissipels om dit aan hulle voor te sit. Ook die twee visse het Hy onder almal verdeel.

column2: Mark 6:42 And they did all eat, and were filled.
column3: Markus 6:42 En almal het geëet en versadig geword;

column2: Mark 6:43 And they took up twelve baskets full of the fragments, and of the fishes.
column3: Markus 6:43 en hulle het van die brokstukke twaalf mandjies vol opgetel, en van die visse.

column2: Mark 6:44 And they that did eat of the loaves were about five thousand men.
column3: Markus 6:44 En die wat van die brood geëet het, was omtrent vyfduisend manne.

column2: Mark 6:45 And straightway he constrained his disciples to get into the ship, and to go to the other side before unto Bethsaida, while he sent away the people.
column3: Markus 6:45 EN dadelik het Hy sy dissipels gedwing om in die skuit te gaan en vooruit te vaar na die oorkant, na Betsáida, onderwyl Hy die skare sou wegstuur.

column2: Mark 6:46 And when he had sent them away, he departed into a mountain to pray.
column3: Markus 6:46 En nadat Hy van hulle afskeid geneem het, het Hy na die berg gegaan om te bid.

column2: Mark 6:47 And when even was come, the ship was in the midst of the sea, and he alone on the land.
column3: Markus 6:47 En toe dit aand geword het, was die skuit in die middel van die see en Hy alleen op die land.

column2: Mark 6:48 And he saw them toiling in rowing; for the wind was contrary unto them: and about the fourth watch of the night he cometh unto them, walking upon the sea, and would have passed by them.
column3: Markus 6:48 En Hy het gesien dat hulle swaar kry met roei, want die wind was teen hulle. En omtrent die vierde nagwaak het Hy na hulle gekom, al wandelende op die see. En Hy wou by hulle verbygaan.

column2: Mark 6:49 But when they saw him walking upon the sea, they supposed it had been a spirit, and cried out:
column3: Markus 6:49 En toe hulle Hom op die see sien loop, het hulle gemeen dat dit ’n spook was en hard uitgeskreeu;

column2: Mark 6:50 For they all saw him, and were troubled. And immediately he talked with them, and saith unto them, Be of good cheer: it is I; be not afraid.
column3: Markus 6:50 want hulle het Hom almal gesien en was ontsteld. Toe spreek Hy dadelik met hulle en sê vir hulle: Hou goeie moed, dit is Ek; moenie vrees nie.

column2: Mark 6:51 And he went up unto them into the ship; and the wind ceased: and they were sore amazed in themselves beyond measure, and wondered.
column3: Markus 6:51 En Hy het by hulle in die skuit geklim, en die wind het gaan lê; en hulle was by hulleself uitermate verbaas en verwonderd.

column2: Mark 6:52 For they considered not [the miracle] of the loaves: for their heart was hardened.
column3: Markus 6:52 Want hulle het by die wonder van die brode nie verstandig geword nie, omdat hulle hart verhard was.

column2: Mark 6:53 And when they had passed over, they came into the land of Gennesaret, and drew to the shore.
column3: Markus 6:53 En nadat hulle oorgevaar het, het hulle by die land Gennésaret aangekom en daar aan wal gaan lê.

column2: Mark 6:54 And when they were come out of the ship, straightway they knew him,
column3: Markus 6:54 En toe hulle uit die skuit gaan, het die mense Hom dadelik herken,

column2: Mark 6:55 And ran through that whole region round about, and began to carry about in beds those that were sick, where they heard he was.
column3: Markus 6:55 en hulle het in daardie hele omtrek rondgeloop en die wat ongesteld was, op bedde begin ronddra na die plek waar hulle hoor dat Hy is.

column2: Mark 6:56 And whithersoever he entered, into villages, or cities, or country, they laid the sick in the streets, and besought him that they might touch if it were but the border of his garment: and as many as touched him were made whole.
column3: Markus 6:56 En waar Hy ook al ingegaan het in dorpe of stede of buitewyke, het hulle die wat ongesteld was, op die markpleine neergesit en Hom gesmeek om, al was dit maar die soom van sy kleed, aan te raak; en almal wat Hom aangeraak het, het gesond geword.

column2: Mark 7:1 Then came together unto him the Pharisees, and certain of the scribes, which came from Jerusalem.
column3: Markus 7:1 EN die Fariseërs en sommige van die skrifgeleerdes wat van Jerusalem gekom het, het by Hom saamgekom;

column2: Mark 7:2 And when they saw some of his disciples eat bread with defiled, that is to say, with unwashen, hands, they found fault.
column3: Markus 7:2 en toe hulle sommige van sy dissipels met onrein, dit is met ongewaste, hande sien brood eet, het hulle dit afgekeur.

column2: Mark 7:3 For the Pharisees, and all the Jews, except they wash [their] hands oft, eat not, holding the tradition of the elders.
column3: Markus 7:3 Want die Fariseërs en al die Jode eet nie as hulle nie deeglik die hande gewas het nie, omdat hulle vashou aan die oorlewering van die ou mense.

column2: Mark 7:4 And [when they come] from the market, except they wash, they eat not. And many other things there be, which they have received to hold, [as] the washing of cups, and pots, brasen vessels, and of tables.
column3: Markus 7:4 En wanneer hulle van die mark kom, eet hulle nie as hulle nie gewas het nie; en baie ander dinge is daar wat hulle aangeneem het om te onderhou: die wassery van bekers en kanne en kopergoed en bedde.

column2: Mark 7:5 Then the Pharisees and scribes asked him, Why walk not thy disciples according to the tradition of the elders, but eat bread with unwashen hands?
column3: Markus 7:5 Daarop stel die Fariseërs en die skrifgeleerdes Hom die vraag: Waarom wandel u dissipels nie ooreenkomstig die oorlewering van die ou mense nie, maar eet brood met ongewaste hande?

column2: Mark 7:6 He answered and said unto them, Well hath Esaias prophesied of you hypocrites, as it is written, This people honoureth me with [their] lips, but their heart is far from me.
column3: Markus 7:6 En Hy antwoord en sê vir hulle: Tereg het Jesaja oor julle, geveinsdes, geprofeteer soos geskrywe is: Hierdie volk eer My met die lippe, maar hulle hart is ver van My af.

column2: Mark 7:7 Howbeit in vain do they worship me, teaching [for] doctrines the commandments of men.
column3: Markus 7:7 Maar tevergeefs vereer hulle My deur leringe te leer wat gebooie van mense is.

column2: Mark 7:8 For laying aside the commandment of God, ye hold the tradition of men, [as] the washing of pots and cups: and many other such like things ye do.
column3: Markus 7:8 Want terwyl julle die gebod van God nalaat, hou julle aan die oorlewering van mense vas: die wassery van kanne en bekers, en ander dergelike dinge van dieselfde aard doen julle baie.

column2: Mark 7:9 And he said unto them, Full well ye reject the commandment of God, that ye may keep your own tradition.
column3: Markus 7:9 En Hy sê vir hulle: Julle verstaan dit goed om die gebod van God opsy te sit en so julle oorlewering te onderhou.

column2: Mark 7:10 For Moses said, Honour thy father and thy mother; and, Whoso curseth father or mother, let him die the death:
column3: Markus 7:10 Want Moses het gesê: Eer jou vader en jou moeder; en: Hy wat vader of moeder vloek, moet sekerlik sterwe.

column2: Mark 7:11 But ye say, If a man shall say to his father or mother, [It is] Corban, that is to say, a gift, by whatsoever thou mightest be profited by me; [he shall be free].
column3: Markus 7:11 Maar julle sê: As ’n mens aan vader of moeder sê: Enige voordeel wat u van my mag geniet, is korban, dit is ’n offergawe —

column2: Mark 7:12 And ye suffer him no more to do ought for his father or his mother;
column3: Markus 7:12 dan laat julle hom nie meer toe om iets vir sy vader of sy moeder te doen nie.

column2: Mark 7:13 Making the word of God of none effect through your tradition, which ye have delivered: and many such like things do ye.
column3: Markus 7:13 So maak julle dan die woord van God kragteloos deur julle oorlewering wat julle bewaar het; en dergelike dinge van dieselfde aard doen julle baie.

column2: Mark 7:14 And when he had called all the people [unto him], he said unto them, Hearken unto me every one [of you], and understand:
column3: Markus 7:14 En Hy het die hele skare na Hom geroep en vir hulle gesê: Luister almal na My en verstaan.

column2: Mark 7:15 There is nothing from without a man, that entering into him can defile him: but the things which come out of him, those are they that defile the man.
column3: Markus 7:15 Daar is niks wat van buite af in die mens ingaan wat hom onrein kan maak nie; maar die dinge wat van hom uitgaan, dít is die dinge wat die mens onrein maak.

column2: Mark 7:16 If any man have ears to hear, let him hear.
column3: Markus 7:16 As iemand ore het om te hoor, laat hom hoor!

column2: Mark 7:17 And when he was entered into the house from the people, his disciples asked him concerning the parable.
column3: Markus 7:17 En toe Hy van die skare af in ’n huis gekom het, vra sy dissipels Hom oor die gelykenis.

column2: Mark 7:18 And he saith unto them, Are ye so without understanding also? Do ye not perceive, that whatsoever thing from without entereth into the man, [it] cannot defile him;
column3: Markus 7:18 En Hy sê vir hulle: Is julle ook so sonder verstand? Begryp julle nie dat alles wat van buite af in die mens ingaan, hom nie onrein kan maak nie,

column2: Mark 7:19 Because it entereth not into his heart, but into the belly, and goeth out into the draught, purging all meats?
column3: Markus 7:19 omdat dit nie ingaan in sy hart nie, maar in die maag, en dit gaan in die heimlikheid uit en maak al die voedsel rein?

column2: Mark 7:20 And he said, That which cometh out of the man, that defileth the man.
column3: Markus 7:20 En Hy sê: Wat uit die mens uitgaan, dit maak die mens onrein.

column2: Mark 7:21 For from within, out of the heart of men, proceed evil thoughts, adulteries, fornications, murders,
column3: Markus 7:21 Want van binne, uit die hart van die mense, kom die slegte gedagtes, egbreuk, hoerery, moord,

column2: Mark 7:22 Thefts, covetousness, wickedness, deceit, lasciviousness, an evil eye, blasphemy, pride, foolishness:
column3: Markus 7:22 diewery, hebsug, boosheid, bedrog, losbandigheid, afguns, lastering, hoogmoed, dwaasheid.

column2: Mark 7:23 All these evil things come from within, and defile the man.
column3: Markus 7:23 Al hierdie booshede kom van binne uit en maak die mens onrein.

column2: Mark 7:24 And from thence he arose, and went into the borders of Tyre and Sidon, and entered into an house, and would have no man know [it]: but he could not be hid.
column3: Markus 7:24 EN Hy het opgestaan en daarvandaan na die gebied van Tirus en Sidon vertrek. En toe Hy in die huis gegaan het, wou Hy nie dat iemand dit sou weet nie; maar Hy kon nie verborge bly nie.

column2: Mark 7:25 For a [certain] woman, whose young daughter had an unclean spirit, heard of him, and came and fell at his feet:
column3: Markus 7:25 Want ’n vrou wie se dogtertjie ’n onreine gees gehad het, het van Hom gehoor en gekom en voor sy voete neergeval.

column2: Mark 7:26 The woman was a Greek, a Syrophenician by nation; and she besought him that he would cast forth the devil out of her daughter.
column3: Markus 7:26 En sy was ’n Griekse vrou, ’n Siro-Feniciese van geboorte, en sy het Hom gevra om die duiwel uit haar dogter uit te dryf.

column2: Mark 7:27 But Jesus said unto her, Let the children first be filled: for it is not meet to take the children's bread, and to cast [it] unto the dogs.
column3: Markus 7:27 Maar Jesus sê vir haar: Laat eers die kinders versadig word; want dit is nie mooi om die brood van die kinders te neem en vir die hondjies te gooi nie.

column2: Mark 7:28 And she answered and said unto him, Yes, Lord: yet the dogs under the table eat of the children's crumbs.
column3: Markus 7:28 En sy antwoord en sê vir Hom: Ja, Here, maar die hondjies eet darem onder die tafel van die kinders se krummels.

column2: Mark 7:29 And he said unto her, For this saying go thy way; the devil is gone out of thy daughter.
column3: Markus 7:29 En Hy sê vir haar: Ter wille van hierdie woord kan jy gaan; die duiwel het uit jou dogter uitgevaar.

column2: Mark 7:30 And when she was come to her house, she found the devil gone out, and her daughter laid upon the bed.
column3: Markus 7:30 En toe sy huis toe gaan, vind sy dat die duiwel uitgevaar het en dat haar dogter op die bed lê.

column2: Mark 7:31 And again, departing from the coasts of Tyre and Sidon, he came unto the sea of Galilee, through the midst of the coasts of Decapolis.
column3: Markus 7:31 EN Hy het weer uit die gebied van Tirus en Sidon vertrek en na die see van Galiléa gegaan, deur die gebied van Dekápolis.

column2: Mark 7:32 And they bring unto him one that was deaf, and had an impediment in his speech; and they beseech him to put his hand upon him.
column3: Markus 7:32 Toe bring hulle na Hom ’n dowe wat swaar praat, en smeek Hom om hom die hande op te lê.

column2: Mark 7:33 And he took him aside from the multitude, and put his fingers into his ears, and he spit, and touched his tongue;
column3: Markus 7:33 En Hy neem hom opsy, weg van die skare, en steek sy vingers in sy ore, en spuug en raak sy tong aan;

column2: Mark 7:34 And looking up to heaven, he sighed, and saith unto him, Ephphatha, that is, Be opened.
column3: Markus 7:34 en nadat Hy opgekyk het na die hemel, sug Hy en sê aan hom: Éffata, dit is: Gaan oop!

column2: Mark 7:35 And straightway his ears were opened, and the string of his tongue was loosed, and he spake plain.
column3: Markus 7:35 En dadelik het sy ore oopgegaan en die band van sy tong losgeraak, en hy het reg gepraat.

column2: Mark 7:36 And he charged them that they should tell no man: but the more he charged them, so much the more a great deal they published [it];
column3: Markus 7:36 En Hy het hulle beveel om dit aan niemand te sê nie; maar hoe meer Hy hulle dit beveel, hoe meer hulle dit verkondig.

column2: Mark 7:37 And were beyond measure astonished, saying, He hath done all things well: he maketh both the deaf to hear, and the dumb to speak.
column3: Markus 7:37 En hulle was uitermate verslae en het gesê: Hy het alles goed gedoen: die dowes laat Hy hoor en die stommes praat.

column2: Mark 8:1 In those days the multitude being very great, and having nothing to eat, Jesus called his disciples [unto him], and saith unto them,
column3: Markus 8:1 IN dié dae toe daar ’n baie groot menigte was en hulle niks gehad het om te eet nie, het Jesus sy dissipels na Hom geroep en vir hulle gesê:

column2: Mark 8:2 I have compassion on the multitude, because they have now been with me three days, and have nothing to eat:
column3: Markus 8:2 Ek voel innig jammer vir die skare, omdat hulle al drie dae by My bly en niks het om te eet nie.

column2: Mark 8:3 And if I send them away fasting to their own houses, they will faint by the way: for divers of them came from far.
column3: Markus 8:3 En as Ek hulle honger huis toe stuur, sal hulle op die pad beswyk, want sommige van hulle kom van ver.

column2: Mark 8:4 And his disciples answered him, From whence can a man satisfy these [men] with bread here in the wilderness?
column3: Markus 8:4 En sy dissipels antwoord Hom: Waarvandaan sal ’n mens hulle hier in die woestyn kan versadig met brood?

column2: Mark 8:5 And he asked them, How many loaves have ye? And they said, Seven.
column3: Markus 8:5 Toe vra Hy hulle: Hoeveel brode het julle? En hulle sê: Sewe.

column2: Mark 8:6 And he commanded the people to sit down on the ground: and he took the seven loaves, and gave thanks, and brake, and gave to his disciples to set before [them]; and they did set [them] before the people.
column3: Markus 8:6 En Hy gee aan die skare bevel om op die grond te gaan sit; daarop neem Hy die sewe brode, en nadat Hy gedank het, breek Hy dit en gee dit aan sy dissipels om dit voor te sit; en hulle sit dit aan die skare voor.

column2: Mark 8:7 And they had a few small fishes: and he blessed, and commanded to set them also before [them].
column3: Markus 8:7 Hulle het ook ’n paar vissies gehad; en nadat Hy gedank het, sê Hy dat hulle dit ook moet voorsit.

column2: Mark 8:8 So they did eat, and were filled: and they took up of the broken [meat] that was left seven baskets.
column3: Markus 8:8 En hulle het geëet en versadig geword en die oorskot van die brokstukke opgetel, sewe mandjies vol.

column2: Mark 8:9 And they that had eaten were about four thousand: and he sent them away.
column3: Markus 8:9 En die wat geëet het, was omtrent vierduisend. En Hy het hulle weggestuur.

column2: Mark 8:10 And straightway he entered into a ship with his disciples, and came into the parts of Dalmanutha.
column3: Markus 8:10 EN dadelik het Hy met sy dissipels in die skuit geklim en in die streke van Dalmanúta gekom.

column2: Mark 8:11 And the Pharisees came forth, and began to question with him, seeking of him a sign from heaven, tempting him.
column3: Markus 8:11 En die Fariseërs het uitgegaan en met Hom begin redetwis en van Hom ’n teken uit die hemel gevra om Hom te versoek.

column2: Mark 8:12 And he sighed deeply in his spirit, and saith, Why doth this generation seek after a sign? verily I say unto you, There shall no sign be given unto this generation.
column3: Markus 8:12 Toe sug Hy swaar in sy gees en sê: Waarom begeer hierdie geslag ’n teken? Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, aan hierdie geslag sal sekerlik geen teken gegee word nie.

column2: Mark 8:13 And he left them, and entering into the ship again departed to the other side.
column3: Markus 8:13 En Hy het hulle verlaat en weer in die skuit geklim en na die oorkant gegaan.

column2: Mark 8:14 Now [the disciples] had forgotten to take bread, neither had they in the ship with them more than one loaf.
column3: Markus 8:14 En hulle het vergeet om brode saam te neem, en het net een brood by hulle in die skuit gehad.

column2: Mark 8:15 And he charged them, saying, Take heed, beware of the leaven of the Pharisees, and [of] the leaven of Herod.
column3: Markus 8:15 En Hy het hulle beveel en gesê: Pas op, wees op julle hoede vir die suurdeeg van die Fariseërs en die suurdeeg van Herodes.

column2: Mark 8:16 And they reasoned among themselves, saying, [It is] because we have no bread.
column3: Markus 8:16 Toe redeneer hulle onder mekaar en sê: Dit is omdat ons geen brode het nie.

column2: Mark 8:17 And when Jesus knew [it], he saith unto them, Why reason ye, because ye have no bread? perceive ye not yet, neither understand? have ye your heart yet hardened?
column3: Markus 8:17 En Jesus merk dit en sê vir hulle: Waarom redeneer julle dat julle geen brode het nie? Begryp julle nie en verstaan julle nie? Het julle nog jul verharde hart?

column2: Mark 8:18 Having eyes, see ye not? and having ears, hear ye not? and do ye not remember?
column3: Markus 8:18 Het julle oë en sien julle nie? En het julle ore en hoor julle nie?

column2: Mark 8:19 When I brake the five loaves among five thousand, how many baskets full of fragments took ye up? They say unto him, Twelve.
column3: Markus 8:19 En onthou julle nie toe Ek die vyf brode vir die vyfduisend gebreek het, hoeveel mandjies vol brokstukke julle opgetel het nie? Hulle sê vir Hom: Twaalf.

column2: Mark 8:20 And when the seven among four thousand, how many baskets full of fragments took ye up? And they said, Seven.
column3: Markus 8:20 En die sewe vir die vierduisend — hoeveel mandjies vol brokstukke het julle opgetel? En hulle sê: Sewe.

column2: Mark 8:21 And he said unto them, How is it that ye do not understand?
column3: Markus 8:21 Toe sê Hy vir hulle: Hoe verstaan julle dan nie!

column2: Mark 8:22 And he cometh to Bethsaida; and they bring a blind man unto him, and besought him to touch him.
column3: Markus 8:22 EN Hy het in Betsáida gekom, en hulle het ’n blinde man na Hom gebring en Hom gesmeek om hom aan te raak.

column2: Mark 8:23 And he took the blind man by the hand, and led him out of the town; and when he had spit on his eyes, and put his hands upon him, he asked him if he saw ought.
column3: Markus 8:23 Hy neem toe die blinde by die hand en lei hom uit buitekant die dorp; en nadat Hy in sy oë gespuug en hom die hande opgelê het, vra Hy hom of hy iets sien.

column2: Mark 8:24 And he looked up, and said, I see men as trees, walking.
column3: Markus 8:24 En hy kyk op en sê: Ek sien die mense, want ek sien hulle soos bome rondloop.

column2: Mark 8:25 After that he put [his] hands again upon his eyes, and made him look up: and he was restored, and saw every man clearly.
column3: Markus 8:25 Daarna lê Hy weer die hande op sy oë en laat hom opkyk, en hy is herstel en het almal van ver af duidelik gesien.

column2: Mark 8:26 And he sent him away to his house, saying, Neither go into the town, nor tell [it] to any in the town.
column3: Markus 8:26 En Hy het hom na sy huis gestuur en gesê: Moenie in die dorp gaan of dit aan iemand in die dorp vertel nie.

column2: Mark 8:27 And Jesus went out, and his disciples, into the towns of Caesarea Philippi: and by the way he asked his disciples, saying unto them, Whom do men say that I am?
column3: Markus 8:27 EN Jesus en sy dissipels het uitgegaan na die dorpe van Cesaréa-Filíppi; en op die pad vra Hy sy dissipels en sê vir hulle: Wie sê die mense is Ek?

column2: Mark 8:28 And they answered, John the Baptist: but some [say], Elias; and others, One of the prophets.
column3: Markus 8:28 En hulle antwoord: Johannes die Doper, en ander: Elía, en ander: Een van die profete.

column2: Mark 8:29 And he saith unto them, But whom say ye that I am? And Peter answereth and saith unto him, Thou art the Christ.
column3: Markus 8:29 En Hy sê vir hulle: Maar julle, wie sê julle is Ek? En Petrus antwoord en sê vir Hom: U is die Christus.

column2: Mark 8:30 And he charged them that they should tell no man of him.
column3: Markus 8:30 En Hy het hulle streng beveel om niemand van Hom te vertel nie.

column2: Mark 8:31 And he began to teach them, that the Son of man must suffer many things, and be rejected of the elders, and [of] the chief priests, and scribes, and be killed, and after three days rise again.
column3: Markus 8:31 Toe het Hy hulle begin leer dat die Seun van die mens baie moet ly en verwerp word deur die ouderlinge en owerpriesters en skrifgeleerdes en gedood word en ná drie dae opstaan.

column2: Mark 8:32 And he spake that saying openly. And Peter took him, and began to rebuke him.
column3: Markus 8:32 En hierdie woord het Hy ronduit gespreek. En Petrus het Hom opsy geneem en Hom begin bestraf.

column2: Mark 8:33 But when he had turned about and looked on his disciples, he rebuked Peter, saying, Get thee behind me, Satan: for thou savourest not the things that be of God, but the things that be of men.
column3: Markus 8:33 Maar Hy het Hom omgedraai, en terwyl Hy sy dissipels aankyk, het Hy Petrus bestraf en gesê: Gaan weg agter My, Satan! Want jy bedink nie die dinge van God nie, maar dié van die mense.

column2: Mark 8:34 And when he had called the people [unto him] with his disciples also, he said unto them, Whosoever will come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.
column3: Markus 8:34 EN toe Hy die skare saam met sy dissipels na Hom geroep het, sê Hy vir hulle: Wie agter My aan wil kom, moet homself verloën en sy kruis opneem en My volg.

column2: Mark 8:35 For whosoever will save his life shall lose it; but whosoever shall lose his life for my sake and the gospel's, the same shall save it.
column3: Markus 8:35 Want elkeen wat sy lewe wil red, sal dit verloor; maar elkeen wat sy lewe om My ontwil en om die evangelie ontwil verloor, hy sal dit red.

column2: Mark 8:36 For what shall it profit a man, if he shall gain the whole world, and lose his own soul?
column3: Markus 8:36 Want wat sal dit ’n mens baat as hy die hele wêreld win en aan sy siel skade ly?

column2: Mark 8:37 Or what shall a man give in exchange for his soul?
column3: Markus 8:37 Of wat sal ’n mens gee as losprys vir sy siel?

column2: Mark 8:38 Whosoever therefore shall be ashamed of me and of my words in this adulterous and sinful generation; of him also shall the Son of man be ashamed, when he cometh in the glory of his Father with the holy angels.
column3: Markus 8:38 Want elkeen wat hom vir My en my woorde skaam in hierdie owerspelige en sondige geslag, vir hom sal die Seun van die mens Hom ook skaam wanneer Hy kom in die heerlikheid van sy Vader met die heilige engele.

column2: Mark 9:1 And he said unto them, Verily I say unto you, That there be some of them that stand here, which shall not taste of death, till they have seen the kingdom of God come with power.
column3: Markus 9:1 EN Hy sê vir hulle: Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, daar is sommige van die wat hier staan, wat die dood sekerlik nie sal smaak voordat hulle die koninkryk van God met krag sien kom het nie.

column2: Mark 9:2 And after six days Jesus taketh [with him] Peter, and James, and John, and leadeth them up into an high mountain apart by themselves: and he was transfigured before them.
column3: Markus 9:2 EN ná ses dae het Jesus vir Petrus en Jakobus en Johannes saamgeneem en hulle alleen op ’n hoë berg in die eensaamheid geneem; en Hy het voor hulle van gedaante verander,

column2: Mark 9:3 And his raiment became shining, exceeding white as snow; so as no fuller on earth can white them.
column3: Markus 9:3 en sy klere het blink geword, baie wit soos sneeu, wit soos geen bleiker op aarde dit kan maak nie.

column2: Mark 9:4 And there appeared unto them Elias with Moses: and they were talking with Jesus.
column3: Markus 9:4 En daar het aan hulle verskyn Elía saam met Moses, en hulle was in gesprek met Jesus.

column2: Mark 9:5 And Peter answered and said to Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here: and let us make three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias.
column3: Markus 9:5 Toe spreek Petrus en sê vir Jesus: Rabbi, dit is goed dat ons hier is. Laat ons dan drie hutte maak: vir U een en vir Moses een en vir Elía een.

column2: Mark 9:6 For he wist not what to say; for they were sore afraid.
column3: Markus 9:6 Want hy het nie geweet wat om te sê nie, want hulle was heeltemal verskrik.

column2: Mark 9:7 And there was a cloud that overshadowed them: and a voice came out of the cloud, saying, This is my beloved Son: hear him.
column3: Markus 9:7 En daar kom ’n wolk wat hulle oordek; en uit die wolk kom ’n stem wat sê: Dit is my geliefde Seun, luister na Hom!

column2: Mark 9:8 And suddenly, when they had looked round about, they saw no man any more, save Jesus only with themselves.
column3: Markus 9:8 En meteens kyk hulle rond en sien niemand meer by hulle nie, behalwe Jesus alleen.

column2: Mark 9:9 And as they came down from the mountain, he charged them that they should tell no man what things they had seen, till the Son of man were risen from the dead.
column3: Markus 9:9 En onderwyl hulle van die berg afklim, gee Hy aan hulle bevel om aan niemand te vertel wat hulle gesien het voordat die Seun van die mens uit die dode opgestaan het nie.

column2: Mark 9:10 And they kept that saying with themselves, questioning one with another what the rising from the dead should mean.
column3: Markus 9:10 En hulle het die woord vir hulleself gehou en onder mekaar gevra wat dit beteken om uit die dode op te staan.

column2: Mark 9:11 And they asked him, saying, Why say the scribes that Elias must first come?
column3: Markus 9:11 En hulle vra Hom en sê: Waarom sê die skrifgeleerdes dat Elía eers moet kom?

column2: Mark 9:12 And he answered and told them, Elias verily cometh first, and restoreth all things; and how it is written of the Son of man, that he must suffer many things, and be set at nought.
column3: Markus 9:12 Toe antwoord Hy en sê vir hulle: Dis waar, Elía kom eers om alles te herstel; en tog, hoe staan daar dan van die Seun van die mens geskrywe dat Hy baie moet ly en verag word?

column2: Mark 9:13 But I say unto you, That Elias is indeed come, and they have done unto him whatsoever they listed, as it is written of him.
column3: Markus 9:13 Maar Ek sê vir julle dat Elía al gekom het, en hulle het aan hom gedoen alles wat hulle wou, soos van hom geskrywe is.

column2: Mark 9:14 And when he came to [his] disciples, he saw a great multitude about them, and the scribes questioning with them.
column3: Markus 9:14 EN toe Hy by die dissipels kom, sien Hy ’n groot menigte om hulle, en skrifgeleerdes wat met hulle redetwis.

column2: Mark 9:15 And straightway all the people, when they beheld him, were greatly amazed, and running to [him] saluted him.
column3: Markus 9:15 En dadelik toe die hele skare Hom sien, was hulle baie verbaas en het na Hom gehardloop en Hom gegroet.

column2: Mark 9:16 And he asked the scribes, What question ye with them?
column3: Markus 9:16 Daarop vra Hy die skrifgeleerdes: Waarom redetwis julle met hulle?

column2: Mark 9:17 And one of the multitude answered and said, Master, I have brought unto thee my son, which hath a dumb spirit;
column3: Markus 9:17 En een uit die skare antwoord en sê: Meester, ek het my seun wat ’n stomme gees het, na U gebring;

column2: Mark 9:18 And wheresoever he taketh him, he teareth him: and he foameth, and gnasheth with his teeth, and pineth away: and I spake to thy disciples that they should cast him out; and they could not.
column3: Markus 9:18 en waar hy hom ook aangryp, skeur hy hom; en hy kry skuim in die mond, en hy kners met sy tande en word styf; en ek het u dissipels gevra om hom uit te dryf, en hulle kon nie.

column2: Mark 9:19 He answereth him, and saith, O faithless generation, how long shall I be with you? how long shall I suffer you? bring him unto me.
column3: Markus 9:19 Toe antwoord Hy hom en sê: O Ongelowige geslag, hoe lank sal Ek by julle wees, hoe lank sal Ek julle verdra? Bring hom na My toe.

column2: Mark 9:20 And they brought him unto him: and when he saw him, straightway the spirit tare him; and he fell on the ground, and wallowed foaming.
column3: Markus 9:20 En hulle bring hom na Hom toe; en toe hy Hom sien, laat die gees hom dadelik stuiptrekkings kry, en hy val op die grond neer en rol rond met skuim in die mond.

column2: Mark 9:21 And he asked his father, How long is it ago since this came unto him? And he said, Of a child.
column3: Markus 9:21 Daarop vra Hy sy vader: Hoe lank is dit al dat dit hom oorgekom het? En hy sê: Van sy kindsdae af;

column2: Mark 9:22 And ofttimes it hath cast him into the fire, and into the waters, to destroy him: but if thou canst do any thing, have compassion on us, and help us.
column3: Markus 9:22 en dikwels het hy hom selfs in die vuur en in die water gegooi om hom dood te maak. Maar as U iets kan doen, ontferm U oor ons en help ons.

column2: Mark 9:23 Jesus said unto him, If thou canst believe, all things [are] possible to him that believeth.
column3: Markus 9:23 En Jesus sê vir hom: Wat dit betref — as jy kan glo, alle dinge is moontlik vir die een wat glo.

column2: Mark 9:24 And straightway the father of the child cried out, and said with tears, Lord, I believe; help thou mine unbelief.
column3: Markus 9:24 En dadelik roep die vader van die kind met trane uit en sê: Ek glo, Here, kom my ongeloof te hulp!

column2: Mark 9:25 When Jesus saw that the people came running together, he rebuked the foul spirit, saying unto him, [Thou] dumb and deaf spirit, I charge thee, come out of him, and enter no more into him.
column3: Markus 9:25 En toe Jesus sien dat ’n skare bymekaar stroom, het Hy die onreine gees bestraf en vir hom gesê: Jou stom en dowe gees, Ek gebied jou, gaan uit hom uit en kom nooit weer in hom nie.

column2: Mark 9:26 And [the spirit] cried, and rent him sore, and came out of him: and he was as one dead; insomuch that many said, He is dead.
column3: Markus 9:26 En nadat hy geskreeu en hom baie stuiptrekkings laat kry het, het hy uitgegaan. En die seun het soos ’n dooie geword, sodat baie gesê het: Hy is dood.

column2: Mark 9:27 But Jesus took him by the hand, and lifted him up; and he arose.
column3: Markus 9:27 Maar Jesus het hom by die hand gegryp en hom opgerig; en hy het opgestaan.

column2: Mark 9:28 And when he was come into the house, his disciples asked him privately, Why could not we cast him out?
column3: Markus 9:28 En toe Hy in die huis kom, vra sy dissipels Hom afsonderlik: Waarom kon ons hom nie uitdrywe nie?

column2: Mark 9:29 And he said unto them, This kind can come forth by nothing, but by prayer and fasting.
column3: Markus 9:29 En Hy sê vir hulle: Hierdie geslag kan deur niks anders uitgaan as deur gebed en vas nie.

column2: Mark 9:30 And they departed thence, and passed through Galilee; and he would not that any man should know [it].
column3: Markus 9:30 EN hulle het daarvandaan weggegaan en verbygetrek deur Galiléa; en Hy wou nie hê dat iemand dit moes weet nie.

column2: Mark 9:31 For he taught his disciples, and said unto them, The Son of man is delivered into the hands of men, and they shall kill him; and after that he is killed, he shall rise the third day.
column3: Markus 9:31 Want Hy het sy dissipels geleer en vir hulle gesê: Die seun van die mens word oorgelewer in die hande van die mense, en hulle sal Hom doodmaak; en nadat Hy gedood is, sal Hy die derde dag opstaan.

column2: Mark 9:32 But they understood not that saying, and were afraid to ask him.
column3: Markus 9:32 En hulle het die gesegde nie verstaan nie en was bang om Hom uit te vra.

column2: Mark 9:33 And he came to Capernaum: and being in the house he asked them, What was it that ye disputed among yourselves by the way?
column3: Markus 9:33 En Hy het in Kapérnaüm gekom; en toe Hy in die huis was, vra Hy hulle: Wat het julle op die pad met mekaar geredeneer?

column2: Mark 9:34 But they held their peace: for by the way they had disputed among themselves, who [should be] the greatest.
column3: Markus 9:34 Maar hulle het stilgebly; want hulle het op die pad met mekaar gepraat oor wie die grootste is.

column2: Mark 9:35 And he sat down, and called the twelve, and saith unto them, If any man desire to be first, [the same] shall be last of all, and servant of all.
column3: Markus 9:35 En toe Hy gaan sit het, roep Hy die twaalf en sê vir hulle: As iemand die eerste wil wees, moet hy die laaste van almal en almal se dienaar wees.
