column3: Markus 15:32 Laat die Christus, die Koning van Israel, nou van die kruis afkom, sodat ons kan sien en glo! Ook die wat saam met Hom gekruisig is, het Hom beledig.

column2: Mark 15:33 And when the sixth hour was come, there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour.
column3: Markus 15:33 En toe dit die sesde uur was, kom daar duisternis oor die hele aarde tot die negende uur toe.

column2: Mark 15:34 And at the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani? which is, being interpreted, My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?
column3: Markus 15:34 En die negende uur het Jesus met ’n groot stem uitgeroep en gesê: Eloï, Eloï, lamma sabagtáni? wat, as dit vertaal word, beteken: My God, my God, waarom het U My verlaat?

column2: Mark 15:35 And some of them that stood by, when they heard [it], said, Behold, he calleth Elias.
column3: Markus 15:35 En sommige van die wat daar staan, hoor dit en sê: Kyk, Hy roep na Elía.

column2: Mark 15:36 And one ran and filled a spunge full of vinegar, and put [it] on a reed, and gave him to drink, saying, Let alone; let us see whether Elias will come to take him down.
column3: Markus 15:36 Toe hardloop een en maak ’n spons vol asyn en sit dit op ’n riet en laat Hom drink; en hy sê: Wag, laat ons sien of Elía kom om Hom af te haal.

column2: Mark 15:37 And Jesus cried with a loud voice, and gave up the ghost.
column3: Markus 15:37 Maar Jesus het met ’n groot stem geroep en die laaste asem uitgeblaas.

column2: Mark 15:38 And the veil of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom.
column3: Markus 15:38 En die voorhangsel van die tempel het in twee geskeur van bo tot onder.

column2: Mark 15:39 And when the centurion, which stood over against him, saw that he so cried out, and gave up the ghost, he said, Truly this man was the Son of God.
column3: Markus 15:39 En toe die hoofman oor honderd wat daar reg voor Hom staan, sien dat Hy so uitgeroep en die laaste asem uitgeblaas het, sê hy: Waarlik, Hy was die Seun van God.

column2: Mark 15:40 There were also women looking on afar off: among whom was Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the less and of Joses, and Salome;
column3: Markus 15:40 En daar was ook vroue wat van ver af dit aanskou het. Onder hulle was Maria Magdaléna ook, en Maria, die moeder van Jakobus, die kleine, en van Joses, en Salóme —

column2: Mark 15:41 (Who also, when he was in Galilee, followed him, and ministered unto him;) and many other women which came up with him unto Jerusalem.
column3: Markus 15:41 hulle wat Hom gevolg en Hom gedien het toe Hy in Galiléa was — en baie ander vroue wat saam met Hom opgegaan het na Jerusalem.

column2: Mark 15:42 And now when the even was come, because it was the preparation, that is, the day before the sabbath,
column3: Markus 15:42 EN toe dit aand geword het, omdat dit die voorbereiding was, dit is die voorsabbat,

column2: Mark 15:43 Joseph of Arimathaea, an honourable counsellor, which also waited for the kingdom of God, came, and went in boldly unto Pilate, and craved the body of Jesus.
column3: Markus 15:43 kom daar ’n vername raadslid, Josef van Arimathéa, wat self ook die koninkryk van God verwag het; en hy waag dit om na Pilatus in te gaan en die liggaam van Jesus te vra.

column2: Mark 15:44 And Pilate marvelled if he were already dead: and calling [unto him] the centurion, he asked him whether he had been any while dead.
column3: Markus 15:44 En Pilatus was verwonderd dat Hy al dood was, en hy het die hoofman oor honderd geroep en hom gevra of Hy al lank dood was.

column2: Mark 15:45 And when he knew [it] of the centurion, he gave the body to Joseph.
column3: Markus 15:45 En toe hy dit van die hoofman oor honderd verneem het, het hy die liggaam aan Josef geskenk.

column2: Mark 15:46 And he bought fine linen, and took him down, and wrapped him in the linen, and laid him in a sepulchre which was hewn out of a rock, and rolled a stone unto the door of the sepulchre.
column3: Markus 15:46 En hy het linne gekoop, en Hom afgehaal en in die linne toegedraai, en Hom neergelê in ’n graf wat in ’n rots uitgekap was. En hy het ’n steen teen die opening van die graf gerol.

column2: Mark 15:47 And Mary Magdalene and Mary [the mother] of Joses beheld where he was laid.
column3: Markus 15:47 En Maria Magdaléna en Maria, die moeder van Joses, het gesien waar Hy neergelê word.

column2: Mark 16:1 And when the sabbath was past, Mary Magdalene, and Mary the [mother] of James, and Salome, had bought sweet spices, that they might come and anoint him.
column3: Markus 16:1 EN toe die sabbat verby was, het Maria Magdaléna en Maria, die moeder van Jakobus, en Salóme speserye gekoop om Hom te gaan salf.

column2: Mark 16:2 And very early in the morning the first [day] of the week, they came unto the sepulchre at the rising of the sun.
column3: Markus 16:2 En baie vroeg op die eerste dag van die week, net ná sonop, kom hulle by die graf.

column2: Mark 16:3 And they said among themselves, Who shall roll us away the stone from the door of the sepulchre?
column3: Markus 16:3 En hulle sê vir mekaar: Wie sal vir ons die steen voor die opening van die graf wegrol?

column2: Mark 16:4 And when they looked, they saw that the stone was rolled away: for it was very great.
column3: Markus 16:4 En toe hulle opkyk, sien hulle dat die steen weggerol was, want dit was baie groot.

column2: Mark 16:5 And entering into the sepulchre, they saw a young man sitting on the right side, clothed in a long white garment; and they were affrighted.
column3: Markus 16:5 En toe hulle in die graf ingegaan het, sien hulle ’n jongman, met ’n lang wit kleed om, aan die regterkant sit, en hulle het baie geskrik.

column2: Mark 16:6 And he saith unto them, Be not affrighted: Ye seek Jesus of Nazareth, which was crucified: he is risen; he is not here: behold the place where they laid him.
column3: Markus 16:6 En hy sê vir hulle: Moenie verskrik wees nie. Julle soek Jesus die Nasaréner wat gekruisig is. Hy het opgestaan. Hy is nie hier nie. Dáár is die plek waar hulle Hom neergelê het.

column2: Mark 16:7 But go your way, tell his disciples and Peter that he goeth before you into Galilee: there shall ye see him, as he said unto you.
column3: Markus 16:7 Maar gaan sê vir sy dissipels en vir Petrus dat Hy voor julle uit gaan na Galiléa. Daar sal julle Hom sien soos Hy vir julle gesê het.

column2: Mark 16:8 And they went out quickly, and fled from the sepulchre; for they trembled and were amazed: neither said they any thing to any [man]; for they were afraid.
column3: Markus 16:8 Toe gaan hulle haastig uit en vlug van die graf af weg. En bewing en ontsetting het hulle aangegryp. En hulle het vir niemand iets gesê nie, want hulle het gevrees.

column2: Mark 16:9 Now when [Jesus] was risen early the first [day] of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, out of whom he had cast seven devils.
column3: Markus 16:9 EN nadat Hy opgestaan het, vroeg op die eerste dag van die week, het Hy eers verskyn aan Maria Magdaléna, uit wie Hy sewe duiwels uitgedryf het.

column2: Mark 16:10 [And] she went and told them that had been with him, as they mourned and wept.
column3: Markus 16:10 Sy het gegaan en dit vertel aan die wat saam met Hom gewees het, terwyl hulle treur en ween.

column2: Mark 16:11 And they, when they had heard that he was alive, and had been seen of her, believed not.
column3: Markus 16:11 En toe hulle hoor dat Hy lewe en deur haar gesien is, het hulle dit nie geglo nie.

column2: Mark 16:12 After that he appeared in another form unto two of them, as they walked, and went into the country.
column3: Markus 16:12 En hierna het Hy in ’n ander gedaante verskyn aan twee van hulle terwyl hulle loop, op pad in die veld.

column2: Mark 16:13 And they went and told [it] unto the residue: neither believed they them.
column3: Markus 16:13 Hulle het ook gegaan en dit aan die ander vertel, maar dié het hulle ook nie geglo nie.

column2: Mark 16:14 Afterward he appeared unto the eleven as they sat at meat, and upbraided them with their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they believed not them which had seen him after he was risen.
column3: Markus 16:14 Later het Hy aan die elf self verskyn toe hulle aan tafel was, en Hy het hulle hul ongeloof en hardheid van hart verwyt, omdat hulle die wat Hom ná sy opstanding gesien het, nie geglo het nie.

column2: Mark 16:15 And he said unto them, Go ye into all the world, and preach the gospel to every creature.
column3: Markus 16:15 En Hy het vir hulle gesê: Gaan die hele wêreld in en verkondig die evangelie aan die ganse mensdom.

column2: Mark 16:16 He that believeth and is baptized shall be saved; but he that believeth not shall be damned.
column3: Markus 16:16 Hy wat glo en hom laat doop, sal gered word; maar hy wat nie glo nie, sal veroordeel word.

column2: Mark 16:17 And these signs shall follow them that believe; In my name shall they cast out devils; they shall speak with new tongues;
column3: Markus 16:17 En vir die wat geglo het, sal hierdie tekens volg: in my Naam sal hulle duiwels uitdryf, met nuwe tale sal hulle spreek,

column2: Mark 16:18 They shall take up serpents; and if they drink any deadly thing, it shall not hurt them; they shall lay hands on the sick, and they shall recover.
column3: Markus 16:18 slange sal hulle opneem; en as hulle iets dodeliks drink, sal dit hulle geen kwaad doen nie; op siekes sal hulle die hande lê, en hulle sal gesond word.

column2: Mark 16:19 So then after the Lord had spoken unto them, he was received up into heaven, and sat on the right hand of God.
column3: Markus 16:19 Nadat die Here dan met hulle gespreek het, is Hy opgeneem in die hemel en het gaan sit aan die regterhand van God.

column2: Mark 16:20 And they went forth, and preached every where, the Lord working with [them], and confirming the word with signs following. Amen.
column3: Markus 16:20 Maar hulle het uitgegaan en oral gepreek, en die Here het saamgewerk en die woord bevestig deur die tekens wat daarop gevolg het. Amen.

column2: Luke 1:1 Forasmuch as many have taken in hand to set forth in order a declaration of those things which are most surely believed among us,
column3: Lukas 1:1 AANGESIEN baie onderneem het om ’n verhaal op te stel oor die dinge wat onder ons al vervul is,

column2: Luke 1:2 Even as they delivered them unto us, which from the beginning were eyewitnesses, and ministers of the word;
column3: Lukas 1:2 soos hulle wat van die begin af ooggetuies en dienaars van die Woord was, dit aan ons oorgelewer het,

column2: Luke 1:3 It seemed good to me also, having had perfect understanding of all things from the very first, to write unto thee in order, most excellent Theophilus,
column3: Lukas 1:3 het ek ook dit goedgedink, hooggeagte Theófilus, nadat ek van voor af alles noukeurig ondersoek het, om dit in volgorde aan u te skrywe,

column2: Luke 1:4 That thou mightest know the certainty of those things, wherein thou hast been instructed.
column3: Lukas 1:4 sodat u met volle sekerheid kan weet die dinge waaromtrent u onderrig is.

column2: Luke 1:5 There was in the days of Herod, the king of Judaea, a certain priest named Zacharias, of the course of Abia: and his wife [was] of the daughters of Aaron, and her name [was] Elisabeth.
column3: Lukas 1:5 DAAR was in die dae van Herodes, koning van Judéa, ’n sekere priester met die naam van Sagaría, uit die afdeling van Abía; en sy vrou was uit die dogters van Aäron, en haar naam was Elisabet.

column2: Luke 1:6 And they were both righteous before God, walking in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord blameless.
column3: Lukas 1:6 En hulle was altwee regverdig voor God en het in al die gebooie en regte van die Here onberispelik gewandel.

column2: Luke 1:7 And they had no child, because that Elisabeth was barren, and they both were [now] well stricken in years.
column3: Lukas 1:7 En hulle het geen kind gehad nie, omdat Elisabet onvrugbaar was en albei op ver gevorderde leeftyd.

column2: Luke 1:8 And it came to pass, that while he executed the priest's office before God in the order of his course,
column3: Lukas 1:8 En terwyl hy besig was om die priesteramp voor God te bedien in die beurt van sy afdeling,

column2: Luke 1:9 According to the custom of the priest's office, his lot was to burn incense when he went into the temple of the Lord.
column3: Lukas 1:9 het die lot volgens priesterlike gewoonte op hom geval om in te gaan in die tempel van die Here en reukwerk te brand.

column2: Luke 1:10 And the whole multitude of the people were praying without at the time of incense.
column3: Lukas 1:10 En die hele menigte van die volk was buite, besig om te bid op die uur van die reukoffer.

column2: Luke 1:11 And there appeared unto him an angel of the Lord standing on the right side of the altar of incense.
column3: Lukas 1:11 Toe verskyn daar aan hom ’n engel van die Here, wat aan die regterkant van die reukofferaltaar staan.

column2: Luke 1:12 And when Zacharias saw [him], he was troubled, and fear fell upon him.
column3: Lukas 1:12 En toe Sagaría hom sien, was hy ontsteld, en vrees het hom oorval.

column2: Luke 1:13 But the angel said unto him, Fear not, Zacharias: for thy prayer is heard; and thy wife Elisabeth shall bear thee a son, and thou shalt call his name John.
column3: Lukas 1:13 Maar die engel sê vir hom: Moenie vrees nie, Sagaría, want jou gebed is verhoor, en jou vrou Elisabet sal vir jou ’n seun baar, en jy moet hom Johannes noem.

column2: Luke 1:14 And thou shalt have joy and gladness; and many shall rejoice at his birth.
column3: Lukas 1:14 En hy sal blydskap en verheuging vir jou wees, en baie sal oor sy geboorte bly wees;

column2: Luke 1:15 For he shall be great in the sight of the Lord, and shall drink neither wine nor strong drink; and he shall be filled with the Holy Ghost, even from his mother's womb.
column3: Lukas 1:15 want hy sal groot wees voor die Here. En wyn en sterk drank sal hy nooit drink nie, en hy sal vervul word met die Heilige Gees reeds van die skoot van sy moeder af.

column2: Luke 1:16 And many of the children of Israel shall he turn to the Lord their God.
column3: Lukas 1:16 En hy sal baie van die kinders van Israel bekeer tot die Here hulle God.

column2: Luke 1:17 And he shall go before him in the spirit and power of Elias, to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children, and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just; to make ready a people prepared for the Lord.
column3: Lukas 1:17 En hy sal voor Hom uit gaan in die gees en die krag van Elía, om die harte van die vaders terug te bring tot die kinders en die ongehoorsames tot die gesindheid van die regverdiges, om vir die Here ’n toegeruste volk te berei.

column2: Luke 1:18 And Zacharias said unto the angel, Whereby shall I know this? for I am an old man, and my wife well stricken in years.
column3: Lukas 1:18 Toe sê Sagaría vir die engel: Waaraan sal ek dit weet? Want ek is ’n ou man, en my vrou is op ver gevorderde leeftyd.

column2: Luke 1:19 And the angel answering said unto him, I am Gabriel, that stand in the presence of God; and am sent to speak unto thee, and to shew thee these glad tidings.
column3: Lukas 1:19 En die engel antwoord en sê vir hom: Ek is Gabriël wat voor God staan, en ek is gestuur om met jou te spreek en jou hierdie goeie tyding te bring.

column2: Luke 1:20 And, behold, thou shalt be dumb, and not able to speak, until the day that these things shall be performed, because thou believest not my words, which shall be fulfilled in their season.
column3: Lukas 1:20 En kyk, jy sal swyg en nie kan praat nie tot op die dag dat hierdie dinge gebeur, omdat jy my woorde wat op hulle tyd vervul sal word, nie geglo het nie.

column2: Luke 1:21 And the people waited for Zacharias, and marvelled that he tarried so long in the temple.
column3: Lukas 1:21 En die volk het op Sagaría bly wag en was verwonderd dat hy so lank in die tempel vertoef.

column2: Luke 1:22 And when he came out, he could not speak unto them: and they perceived that he had seen a vision in the temple: for he beckoned unto them, and remained speechless.
column3: Lukas 1:22 Maar toe hy uitkom, kon hy met hulle nie praat nie; hulle bemerk toe dat hy ’n gesig in die tempel gesien het. En hy het aanhoudend vir hulle beduie en stom gebly.

column2: Luke 1:23 And it came to pass, that, as soon as the days of his ministration were accomplished, he departed to his own house.
column3: Lukas 1:23 En toe die dae van sy diens vervul was, het hy huis toe gegaan.

column2: Luke 1:24 And after those days his wife Elisabeth conceived, and hid herself five months, saying,
column3: Lukas 1:24 En ná hierdie dae het Elisabet, sy vrou, ontvang en haar vyf maande lank verberg en gesê:

column2: Luke 1:25 Thus hath the Lord dealt with me in the days wherein he looked on [me], to take away my reproach among men.
column3: Lukas 1:25 So het die Here met my gedoen in die dae toe Hy my aangesien het om my smaad onder die mense weg te neem.

column2: Luke 1:26 And in the sixth month the angel Gabriel was sent from God unto a city of Galilee, named Nazareth,
column3: Lukas 1:26 EN in die sesde maand is die engel Gabriël deur God gestuur na ’n stad in Galiléa met die naam van Násaret,

column2: Luke 1:27 To a virgin espoused to a man whose name was Joseph, of the house of David; and the virgin's name [was] Mary.
column3: Lukas 1:27 na ’n maagd wat verloof was aan ’n man met die naam van Josef, uit die huis van Dawid; en die naam van die maagd was Maria.

column2: Luke 1:28 And the angel came in unto her, and said, Hail, [thou that art] highly favoured, the Lord [is] with thee: blessed [art] thou among women.
column3: Lukas 1:28 En die engel het by haar binnegekom en gesê: Wees gegroet, begenadigde! Die Here is met jou; geseënd is jy onder die vroue.

column2: Luke 1:29 And when she saw [him], she was troubled at his saying, and cast in her mind what manner of salutation this should be.
column3: Lukas 1:29 En toe sy hom sien, was sy baie ontsteld oor sy woord, en sy het daaroor nagedink wat hierdie groet tog kon beteken.

column2: Luke 1:30 And the angel said unto her, Fear not, Mary: for thou hast found favour with God.
column3: Lukas 1:30 En die engel sê vir haar: Moenie vrees nie, Maria, want jy het genade by God gevind.

column2: Luke 1:31 And, behold, thou shalt conceive in thy womb, and bring forth a son, and shalt call his name JESUS.
column3: Lukas 1:31 En kyk, jy sal swanger word en ’n Seun baar, en jy moet Hom Jesus noem.

column2: Luke 1:32 He shall be great, and shall be called the Son of the Highest: and the Lord God shall give unto him the throne of his father David:
column3: Lukas 1:32 Hy sal groot wees en die Seun van die Allerhoogste genoem word; en die Here God sal aan Hom die troon van sy vader Dawid gee,

column2: Luke 1:33 And he shall reign over the house of Jacob for ever; and of his kingdom there shall be no end.
column3: Lukas 1:33 en Hy sal koning wees oor die huis van Jakob tot in ewigheid, en aan sy koninkryk sal daar geen einde wees nie.

column2: Luke 1:34 Then said Mary unto the angel, How shall this be, seeing I know not a man?
column3: Lukas 1:34 Toe sê Maria vir die engel: Hoe kan dit wees aangesien ek geen man het nie?

column2: Luke 1:35 And the angel answered and said unto her, The Holy Ghost shall come upon thee, and the power of the Highest shall overshadow thee: therefore also that holy thing which shall be born of thee shall be called the Son of God.
column3: Lukas 1:35 En die engel antwoord en sê vir haar: Die Heilige Gees sal oor jou kom en die krag van die Allerhoogste sal jou oorskadu. Daarom ook sal die Heilige wat gebore word, Seun van God genoem word.

column2: Luke 1:36 And, behold, thy cousin Elisabeth, she hath also conceived a son in her old age: and this is the sixth month with her, who was called barren.
column3: Lukas 1:36 En kyk, Elisabet, jou bloedverwant, het self ook ’n seun ontvang in haar ouderdom, en hierdie maand is die sesde vir haar wat onvrugbaar genoem is.

column2: Luke 1:37 For with God nothing shall be impossible.
column3: Lukas 1:37 Want geen ding sal by God onmoontlik wees nie.

column2: Luke 1:38 And Mary said, Behold the handmaid of the Lord; be it unto me according to thy word. And the angel departed from her.
column3: Lukas 1:38 En Maria sê: Hier is die diensmaagd van die Here. Laat dit met my gaan volgens u woord. En die engel het van haar weggegaan.

column2: Luke 1:39 And Mary arose in those days, and went into the hill country with haste, into a city of Juda;
column3: Lukas 1:39 EN in daardie dae het Maria opgestaan en haastig na die bergstreek gegaan, na ’n stad van Juda;

column2: Luke 1:40 And entered into the house of Zacharias, and saluted Elisabeth.
column3: Lukas 1:40 en sy het in die huis van Sagaría gekom en Elisabet gegroet.

column2: Luke 1:41 And it came to pass, that, when Elisabeth heard the salutation of Mary, the babe leaped in her womb; and Elisabeth was filled with the Holy Ghost:
column3: Lukas 1:41 En toe Elisabet die groet van Maria hoor, het die kindjie in haar skoot opgespring; en Elisabet is vervul met die Heilige Gees

column2: Luke 1:42 And she spake out with a loud voice, and said, Blessed [art] thou among women, and blessed [is] the fruit of thy womb.
column3: Lukas 1:42 en het met ’n groot stem uitgeroep en gesê: Geseënd is jy onder die vroue, en geseënd is die vrug van jou skoot!

column2: Luke 1:43 And whence [is] this to me, that the mother of my Lord should come to me?
column3: Lukas 1:43 En wat het my oorgekom dat die moeder van my Here na my toe kom?

column2: Luke 1:44 For, lo, as soon as the voice of thy salutation sounded in mine ears, the babe leaped in my womb for joy.
column3: Lukas 1:44 Want kyk, toe die geluid van jou groet in my ore klink, het die kindjie in my skoot van vreugde opgespring.

column2: Luke 1:45 And blessed [is] she that believed: for there shall be a performance of those things which were told her from the Lord.
column3: Lukas 1:45 En salig is sy wat geglo het, want die dinge wat deur die Here aan haar gesê is, sal vervul word.

column2: Luke 1:46 And Mary said, My soul doth magnify the Lord,
column3: Lukas 1:46 EN Maria het gesê: My siel maak die Here groot,

column2: Luke 1:47 And my spirit hath rejoiced in God my Saviour.
column3: Lukas 1:47 en my gees is verheug in God, my Saligmaker;

column2: Luke 1:48 For he hath regarded the low estate of his handmaiden: for, behold, from henceforth all generations shall call me blessed.
column3: Lukas 1:48 omdat Hy die nederige toestand van sy diensmaagd aangesien het; want kyk, van nou af sal al die geslagte my salig noem.

column2: Luke 1:49 For he that is mighty hath done to me great things; and holy [is] his name.
column3: Lukas 1:49 Want Hy wat magtig is, het groot dinge aan my gedoen, en heilig is sy Naam.

column2: Luke 1:50 And his mercy [is] on them that fear him from generation to generation.
column3: Lukas 1:50 En sy barmhartigheid is van geslag tot geslag vir die wat Hom vrees.

column2: Luke 1:51 He hath shewed strength with his arm; he hath scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts.
column3: Lukas 1:51 Hy het deur sy arm kragtige dade gedoen. Hoogmoediges in die gedagtes van hulle hart het Hy verstrooi.

column2: Luke 1:52 He hath put down the mighty from [their] seats, and exalted them of low degree.
column3: Lukas 1:52 Maghebbers het Hy van trone afgeruk en nederiges verhoog.

column2: Luke 1:53 He hath filled the hungry with good things; and the rich he hath sent empty away.
column3: Lukas 1:53 Hongeriges het Hy met goeie dinge vervul en rykes met leë hande weggestuur.

column2: Luke 1:54 He hath holpen his servant Israel, in remembrance of [his] mercy;
column3: Lukas 1:54 Hy het sy kneg Israel bygestaan, sodat Hy aan sy barmhartigheid sou dink —

column2: Luke 1:55 As he spake to our fathers, to Abraham, and to his seed for ever.
column3: Lukas 1:55 soos Hy tot ons vaders gespreek het — aan Abraham en sy nageslag tot in ewigheid.

column2: Luke 1:56 And Mary abode with her about three months, and returned to her own house.
column3: Lukas 1:56 En Maria het by haar omtrent drie maande gebly; en sy het teruggegaan na haar huis toe.

column2: Luke 1:57 Now Elisabeth's full time came that she should be delivered; and she brought forth a son.
column3: Lukas 1:57 EN die tyd dat sy moeder moes word, is vir Elisabet vervul, en sy het ’n seun gebaar.

column2: Luke 1:58 And her neighbours and her cousins heard how the Lord had shewed great mercy upon her; and they rejoiced with her.
column3: Lukas 1:58 En toe haar bure en bloedverwante hoor dat die Here sy barmhartigheid aan haar groot gemaak het, was hulle saam met haar bly.

column2: Luke 1:59 And it came to pass, that on the eighth day they came to circumcise the child; and they called him Zacharias, after the name of his father.
column3: Lukas 1:59 En op die agtste dag het hulle gekom om die kindjie te besny, en hulle wou hom Sagaría noem, na die naam van sy vader.

column2: Luke 1:60 And his mother answered and said, Not [so]; but he shall be called John.
column3: Lukas 1:60 Toe antwoord sy moeder en sê: Nee, maar hy moet Johannes genoem word.

column2: Luke 1:61 And they said unto her, There is none of thy kindred that is called by this name.
column3: Lukas 1:61 En hulle sê vir haar: Daar is niemand in jou familie wat dié naam het nie.

column2: Luke 1:62 And they made signs to his father, how he would have him called.
column3: Lukas 1:62 En hulle beduie vir sy vader hoe hy wou hê dat hy genoem moes word.

column2: Luke 1:63 And he asked for a writing table, and wrote, saying, His name is John. And they marvelled all.
column3: Lukas 1:63 Hy vra toe ’n skryfbordjie en skryf: Johannes is sy naam. En almal was verwonderd.

column2: Luke 1:64 And his mouth was opened immediately, and his tongue [loosed], and he spake, and praised God.
column3: Lukas 1:64 En onmiddellik is sy mond geopen en het sy tong losgeraak, en hy het gepraat en God geloof.

column2: Luke 1:65 And fear came on all that dwelt round about them: and all these sayings were noised abroad throughout all the hill country of Judaea.
column3: Lukas 1:65 En daar het vrees gekom oor almal wat rondom hulle gewoon het, en daar is baie gepraat oor al hierdie dinge in die hele bergstreek van Judéa.

column2: Luke 1:66 And all they that heard [them] laid [them] up in their hearts, saying, What manner of child shall this be! And the hand of the Lord was with him.
column3: Lukas 1:66 En almal wat dit gehoor het, het dit ter harte geneem en gesê: Wat sal tog van hierdie kindjie word? En die hand van die Here was met hom.

column2: Luke 1:67 And his father Zacharias was filled with the Holy Ghost, and prophesied, saying,
column3: Lukas 1:67 EN Sagaría, sy vader, is vervul met die Heilige Gees en het geprofeteer en gesê:

column2: Luke 1:68 Blessed [be] the Lord God of Israel; for he hath visited and redeemed his people,
column3: Lukas 1:68 Geloofd sy die Here, die God van Israel, omdat Hy sy volk besoek het en vir hulle verlossing teweeggebring het,

column2: Luke 1:69 And hath raised up an horn of salvation for us in the house of his servant David;
column3: Lukas 1:69 en ’n horing van heil vir ons opgerig het in die huis van Dawid, sy kneg —

column2: Luke 1:70 As he spake by the mouth of his holy prophets, which have been since the world began:
column3: Lukas 1:70 soos Hy gespreek het deur die mond van sy heilige profete van ouds af —

column2: Luke 1:71 That we should be saved from our enemies, and from the hand of all that hate us;
column3: Lukas 1:71 redding van ons vyande en uit die hand van almal wat vir ons haat,

column2: Luke 1:72 To perform the mercy [promised] to our fathers, and to remember his holy covenant;
column3: Lukas 1:72 om barmhartigheid te bewys aan ons vaders en aan sy heilige verbond te dink,

column2: Luke 1:73 The oath which he sware to our father Abraham,
column3: Lukas 1:73 aan die eed wat Hy gesweer het vir Abraham, ons vader, om aan ons te gee

column2: Luke 1:74 That he would grant unto us, that we being delivered out of the hand of our enemies might serve him without fear,
column3: Lukas 1:74 dat ons, verlos uit die hand van ons vyande, Hom sonder vrees kan dien,

column2: Luke 1:75 In holiness and righteousness before him, all the days of our life.
column3: Lukas 1:75 in heiligheid en geregtigheid voor Hom, al die dae van ons lewe.

column2: Luke 1:76 And thou, child, shalt be called the prophet of the Highest: for thou shalt go before the face of the Lord to prepare his ways;
column3: Lukas 1:76 En jy, kindjie, sal ’n profeet van die Allerhoogste genoem word, want jy sal voor die aangesig van die Here uitgaan om sy weë reg te maak;

column2: Luke 1:77 To give knowledge of salvation unto his people by the remission of their sins,
column3: Lukas 1:77 om kennis van saligheid aan sy volk te gee in die vergifnis van hulle sondes,

column2: Luke 1:78 Through the tender mercy of our God; whereby the dayspring from on high hath visited us,
column3: Lukas 1:78 deur die innige barmhartigheid van onse God waarmee die opgaande Lig uit die hoogte ons besoek het,

column2: Luke 1:79 To give light to them that sit in darkness and [in] the shadow of death, to guide our feet into the way of peace.
column3: Lukas 1:79 om te skyn oor die wat in duisternis en doodskaduwee sit, om ons voete na die pad van vrede te rig.

column2: Luke 1:80 And the child grew, and waxed strong in spirit, and was in the deserts till the day of his shewing unto Israel.
column3: Lukas 1:80 En die kindjie het gegroei en sterk geword in die Gees; en hy was in die woestyne tot op die dag van sy vertoning aan Israel.

column2: Luke 2:1 And it came to pass in those days, that there went out a decree from Caesar Augustus, that all the world should be taxed.
column3: Lukas 2:1 EN in daardie dae het daar ’n bevel uitgegaan van keiser Augustus dat die hele wêreld ingeskryf moes word.

column2: Luke 2:2 ([And] this taxing was first made when Cyrenius was governor of Syria.)
column3: Lukas 2:2 Hierdie eerste inskrywing het plaasgevind toe Cirénius goewerneur van Sírië was.

column2: Luke 2:3 And all went to be taxed, every one into his own city.
column3: Lukas 2:3 En almal het gegaan om ingeskryf te word, elkeen na sy eie stad.

column2: Luke 2:4 And Joseph also went up from Galilee, out of the city of Nazareth, into Judaea, unto the city of David, which is called Bethlehem; (because he was of the house and lineage of David:)
column3: Lukas 2:4 En Josef het ook opgegaan van Galiléa, uit die stad Násaret, na Judéa, na die stad van Dawid, wat Betlehem genoem word, omdat hy uit die huis en geslag van Dawid was,

column2: Luke 2:5 To be taxed with Mary his espoused wife, being great with child.
column3: Lukas 2:5 om hom te laat inskrywe saam met Maria, die vrou aan wie hy hom verloof het, wat swanger was.

column2: Luke 2:6 And so it was, that, while they were there, the days were accomplished that she should be delivered.
column3: Lukas 2:6 En terwyl hulle daar was, is die dae vervul dat sy moes baar;

column2: Luke 2:7 And she brought forth her firstborn son, and wrapped him in swaddling clothes, and laid him in a manger; because there was no room for them in the inn.
column3: Lukas 2:7 en sy het haar eersgebore Seun gebaar en Hom toegedraai in doeke en Hom in die krip neergelê, omdat daar vir hulle geen plek in die herberg was nie.

column2: Luke 2:8 And there were in the same country shepherds abiding in the field, keeping watch over their flock by night.
column3: Lukas 2:8 EN daar was herders in dieselfde landstreek, wat in die oop veld gebly en in die nag oor hulle skape wag gehou het.

column2: Luke 2:9 And, lo, the angel of the Lord came upon them, and the glory of the Lord shone round about them: and they were sore afraid.
column3: Lukas 2:9 En meteens staan daar ’n engel van die Here by hulle, en die heerlikheid van die Here het rondom hulle geskyn en groot vrees het hulle oorweldig.

column2: Luke 2:10 And the angel said unto them, Fear not: for, behold, I bring you good tidings of great joy, which shall be to all people.
column3: Lukas 2:10 En die engel sê vir hulle: Moenie vrees nie, want kyk, ek bring julle ’n goeie tyding van groot blydskap wat vir die hele volk sal wees,

column2: Luke 2:11 For unto you is born this day in the city of David a Saviour, which is Christ the Lord.
column3: Lukas 2:11 dat vir julle vandag in die stad van Dawid gebore is die Saligmaker wat Christus, die Here, is.

column2: Luke 2:12 And this [shall be] a sign unto you; Ye shall find the babe wrapped in swaddling clothes, lying in a manger.
column3: Lukas 2:12 En dit is vir julle die teken: julle sal ’n Kindjie vind wat in doeke toegedraai is en wat in die krip lê.

column2: Luke 2:13 And suddenly there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly host praising God, and saying,
column3: Lukas 2:13 En skielik was daar saam met die engel ’n menigte van die hemelse leërskare wat God prys en sê:

column2: Luke 2:14 Glory to God in the highest, and on earth peace, good will toward men.
column3: Lukas 2:14 Eer aan God in die hoogste hemele en vrede op aarde, in die mense ’n welbehae!

column2: Luke 2:15 And it came to pass, as the angels were gone away from them into heaven, the shepherds said one to another, Let us now go even unto Bethlehem, and see this thing which is come to pass, which the Lord hath made known unto us.
column3: Lukas 2:15 En toe die engele van hulle weggegaan het na die hemel, sê die herders vir mekaar: Laat ons dan na Betlehem gaan en hierdie ding sien wat gebeur het, wat die Here aan ons bekend gemaak het.

column2: Luke 2:16 And they came with haste, and found Mary, and Joseph, and the babe lying in a manger.
column3: Lukas 2:16 En hulle het met haas gegaan en Maria en Josef gevind en die kindjie wat in die krip lê.

column2: Luke 2:17 And when they had seen [it], they made known abroad the saying which was told them concerning this child.
column3: Lukas 2:17 En toe hulle dit gesien het, het hulle oral die woord bekend gemaak wat aan hulle van dié Kindjie vertel is.

column2: Luke 2:18 And all they that heard [it] wondered at those things which were told them by the shepherds.
column3: Lukas 2:18 En almal wat dit gehoor het, was verwonderd oor wat deur die herders aan hulle vertel is;

column2: Luke 2:19 But Mary kept all these things, and pondered [them] in her heart.
column3: Lukas 2:19 maar Maria het al hierdie woorde bewaar en in haar hart oordink.

column2: Luke 2:20 And the shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things that they had heard and seen, as it was told unto them.
column3: Lukas 2:20 En die herders het teruggegaan en God verheerlik en geprys oor alles wat hulle gehoor en gesien het, net soos aan hulle gesê is.

column2: Luke 2:21 And when eight days were accomplished for the circumcising of the child, his name was called JESUS, which was so named of the angel before he was conceived in the womb.
column3: Lukas 2:21 EN toe agt dae vervul was, dat hulle die Kindjie sou besny, het hulle Hom Jesus genoem, die naam wat deur die engel gegee is voor sy ontvangenis in die moederskoot.

column2: Luke 2:22 And when the days of her purification according to the law of Moses were accomplished, they brought him to Jerusalem, to present [him] to the Lord;
column3: Lukas 2:22 En nadat die dae van haar reiniging volgens die wet van Moses vervul was, het hulle Hom na Jerusalem gebring om Hom aan die Here voor te stel,

column2: Luke 2:23 (As it is written in the law of the Lord, Every male that openeth the womb shall be called holy to the Lord;)
column3: Lukas 2:23 soos geskrywe is in die wet van die Here: Elke manlike kind wat die moederskoot open, sal heilig vir die Here genoem word;

column2: Luke 2:24 And to offer a sacrifice according to that which is said in the law of the Lord, A pair of turtledoves, or two young pigeons.
column3: Lukas 2:24 en om die offer te gee volgens wat gesê is in die wet van die Here: ’n paar tortelduiwe of twee jong duiwe.

column2: Luke 2:25 And, behold, there was a man in Jerusalem, whose name [was] Simeon; and the same man [was] just and devout, waiting for the consolation of Israel: and the Holy Ghost was upon him.
column3: Lukas 2:25 EN daar was ’n man in Jerusalem met die naam van Símeon; en hierdie man was regverdig en vroom en het die vertroosting van Israel verwag, en die Heilige Gees was op hom.

column2: Luke 2:26 And it was revealed unto him by the Holy Ghost, that he should not see death, before he had seen the Lord's Christ.
column3: Lukas 2:26 En aan hom was dit deur die Heilige Gees geopenbaar dat hy die dood nie sou sien voordat hy die Christus van die Here gesien het nie.

column2: Luke 2:27 And he came by the Spirit into the temple: and when the parents brought in the child Jesus, to do for him after the custom of the law,
column3: Lukas 2:27 En hy het deur die Gees in die tempel gekom; en toe die ouers die Kindjie Jesus inbring om met Hom te handel volgens die gebruik van die wet,

column2: Luke 2:28 Then took he him up in his arms, and blessed God, and said,
column3: Lukas 2:28 het hy Hom in sy arms geneem en God geloof en gesê:

column2: Luke 2:29 Lord, now lettest thou thy servant depart in peace, according to thy word:
column3: Lukas 2:29 Nou laat U, Here, u dienskneg gaan in vrede volgens u woord,

column2: Luke 2:30 For mine eyes have seen thy salvation,
column3: Lukas 2:30 omdat my oë u heil gesien het,

column2: Luke 2:31 Which thou hast prepared before the face of all people;
column3: Lukas 2:31 wat U berei het voor die oë van al die volke —

column2: Luke 2:32 A light to lighten the Gentiles, and the glory of thy people Israel.
column3: Lukas 2:32 ’n lig tot verligting van die nasies en tot heerlikheid van u volk Israel.

column2: Luke 2:33 And Joseph and his mother marvelled at those things which were spoken of him.
column3: Lukas 2:33 En Josef en sy moeder het hulle verwonder oor die dinge wat van Hom gesê is.

column2: Luke 2:34 And Simeon blessed them, and said unto Mary his mother, Behold, this [child] is set for the fall and rising again of many in Israel; and for a sign which shall be spoken against;
column3: Lukas 2:34 En Símeon het hulle geseën en aan Maria, sy moeder, gesê: Kyk, hierdie Kind is bestemd tot ’n val en ’n opstanding van baie in Israel en tot ’n teken wat weerspreek sal word —

column2: Luke 2:35 (Yea, a sword shall pierce through thy own soul also,) that the thoughts of many hearts may be revealed.
column3: Lukas 2:35 ja, ’n swaard sal deur jou eie siel gaan — sodat die gedagtes uit baie harte openbaar kan word.

column2: Luke 2:36 And there was one Anna, a prophetess, the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Aser: she was of a great age, and had lived with an husband seven years from her virginity;
column3: Lukas 2:36 En daar was Anna, ’n profetes, die dogter van Fánuel, uit die stam van Aser. Sy was op baie ver gevorderde leeftyd en het van haar maagdom af sewe jaar lank met haar man saamgelewe;

column2: Luke 2:37 And she [was] a widow of about fourscore and four years, which departed not from the temple, but served [God] with fastings and prayers night and day.
column3: Lukas 2:37 en sy was ’n weduwee van omtrent vier-en-tagtig jaar. Sy het nie weggebly van die tempel nie, en met vaste en gebede God gedien, nag en dag.

column2: Luke 2:38 And she coming in that instant gave thanks likewise unto the Lord, and spake of him to all them that looked for redemption in Jerusalem.
column3: Lukas 2:38 En sy het in dieselfde uur daar gekom en die Here geprys en van Hom gespreek met almal in Jerusalem wat die verlossing verwag het.

column2: Luke 2:39 And when they had performed all things according to the law of the Lord, they returned into Galilee, to their own city Nazareth.
column3: Lukas 2:39 En toe hulle alles volbring het wat volgens die wet van die Here was, het hulle teruggegaan na Galiléa, na hulle stad Násaret.

column2: Luke 2:40 And the child grew, and waxed strong in spirit, filled with wisdom: and the grace of God was upon him.
column3: Lukas 2:40 En die Kindjie het gegroei en sterk geword in die Gees en vol van wysheid. En die genade van God was op Hom.

column2: Luke 2:41 Now his parents went to Jerusalem every year at the feast of the passover.
column3: Lukas 2:41 EN sy ouers was gewoond om elke jaar met die paasfees na Jerusalem te gaan.

column2: Luke 2:42 And when he was twelve years old, they went up to Jerusalem after the custom of the feast.
column3: Lukas 2:42 En toe Hy twaalf jaar oud was, het hulle, volgens die gebruik van die fees, na Jerusalem opgegaan.

column2: Luke 2:43 And when they had fulfilled the days, as they returned, the child Jesus tarried behind in Jerusalem; and Joseph and his mother knew not [of it].
column3: Lukas 2:43 En nadat die feesdae vir hulle verby was, en terwyl hulle teruggaan, het die Kind Jesus in Jerusalem agtergebly; en Josef en sy moeder het dit nie geweet nie.

column2: Luke 2:44 But they, supposing him to have been in the company, went a day's journey; and they sought him among [their] kinsfolk and acquaintance.
column3: Lukas 2:44 Maar omdat hulle gedink het dat Hy by die reisgeselskap was, het hulle ’n dagreis ver gegaan en Hom onder die familie en onder die bekendes gesoek.

column2: Luke 2:45 And when they found him not, they turned back again to Jerusalem, seeking him.
column3: Lukas 2:45 En toe hulle Hom nie vind nie, het hulle teruggegaan na Jerusalem en Hom gesoek.

column2: Luke 2:46 And it came to pass, that after three days they found him in the temple, sitting in the midst of the doctors, both hearing them, and asking them questions.
column3: Lukas 2:46 En ná drie dae het hulle Hom in die tempel gevind, terwyl Hy in die midde van die leraars sit en na hulle luister en hulle uitvra.

column2: Luke 2:47 And all that heard him were astonished at his understanding and answers.
column3: Lukas 2:47 En almal wat Hom gehoor het, was verbaas oor sy verstand en sy antwoorde.

column2: Luke 2:48 And when they saw him, they were amazed: and his mother said unto him, Son, why hast thou thus dealt with us? behold, thy father and I have sought thee sorrowing.
column3: Lukas 2:48 En toe hulle Hom sien, was hulle verslae. En sy moeder sê vir Hom: Kind, waarom het jy so met ons gemaak? Kyk, jou vader en ek het jou met angs gesoek.

column2: Luke 2:49 And he said unto them, How is it that ye sought me? wist ye not that I must be about my Father's business?
column3: Lukas 2:49 En Hy sê vir hulle: Waarom het u My gesoek? Het u nie geweet dat Ek in die dinge van my Vader moet wees nie?

column2: Luke 2:50 And they understood not the saying which he spake unto them.
column3: Lukas 2:50 En hulle het die woord wat Hy aan hulle gesê het, nie verstaan nie.

column2: Luke 2:51 And he went down with them, and came to Nazareth, and was subject unto them: but his mother kept all these sayings in her heart.
column3: Lukas 2:51 En Hy het saam met hulle gegaan en in Násaret gekom, en Hy was hulle onderdanig. En sy moeder het al hierdie dinge in haar hart bewaar.

column2: Luke 2:52 And Jesus increased in wisdom and stature, and in favour with God and man.
column3: Lukas 2:52 En Jesus het toegeneem in wysheid en grootte en in genade by God en die mense.

column2: Luke 3:1 Now in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, Pontius Pilate being governor of Judaea, and Herod being tetrarch of Galilee, and his brother Philip tetrarch of Ituraea and of the region of Trachonitis, and Lysanias the tetrarch of Abilene,
column3: Lukas 3:1 EN in die vyftiende jaar van die regering van keiser Tibérius, toe Pontius Pilatus goewerneur was van Judéa en Herodes viervors van Galiléa, en Filippus, sy broer, viervors van Ituréa en die land Trachonítus, en Lisánias viervors van Abiléne,

column2: Luke 3:2 Annas and Caiaphas being the high priests, the word of God came unto John the son of Zacharias in the wilderness.
column3: Lukas 3:2 tydens die hoëpriesterskap van Annas en Kájafas, het die woord van God gekom tot Johannes, die seun van Sagaría, in die woestyn.

column2: Luke 3:3 And he came into all the country about Jordan, preaching the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins;
column3: Lukas 3:3 En hy het gekom in die hele omtrek van die Jordaan en die doop van bekering tot vergifnis van sondes verkondig;

column2: Luke 3:4 As it is written in the book of the words of Esaias the prophet, saying, The voice of one crying in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make his paths straight.
column3: Lukas 3:4 soos geskrywe is in die boek van die woorde van Jesaja, die profeet, waar hy sê: Die stem van een wat roep in die woestyn: Berei die weg van die Here, maak sy paaie reguit.

column2: Luke 3:5 Every valley shall be filled, and every mountain and hill shall be brought low; and the crooked shall be made straight, and the rough ways [shall be] made smooth;
column3: Lukas 3:5 Elke dal moet opgevul word en elke berg en heuwel wegsak; en die krom draaie sal ’n reguit pad word en die skurwe plekke gelyk weë.

column2: Luke 3:6 And all flesh shall see the salvation of God.
column3: Lukas 3:6 En alle vlees sal die heil van God sien.

column2: Luke 3:7 Then said he to the multitude that came forth to be baptized of him, O generation of vipers, who hath warned you to flee from the wrath to come?
column3: Lukas 3:7 Toe sê hy vir die skare wat uitgegaan het om deur hom gedoop te word: Addergeslag, wie het julle aangewys om te vlug vir die toorn wat aan kom is?

column2: Luke 3:8 Bring forth therefore fruits worthy of repentance, and begin not to say within yourselves, We have Abraham to [our] father: for I say unto you, That God is able of these stones to raise up children unto Abraham.
column3: Lukas 3:8 Dra dan vrugte wat by die bekering pas, en moenie by julleself begin sê: Ons het Abraham as vader nie; want ek sê vir julle dat God mag het om uit hierdie klippe kinders vir Abraham te verwek.

column2: Luke 3:9 And now also the axe is laid unto the root of the trees: every tree therefore which bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.
column3: Lukas 3:9 Maar die byl lê ook al teen die wortel van die bome. Elke boom dan wat geen goeie vrugte dra nie, word uitgekap en in die vuur gegooi.

column2: Luke 3:10 And the people asked him, saying, What shall we do then?
column3: Lukas 3:10 En die skare het hom gevra en gesê: Wat moet ons dan doen?

column2: Luke 3:11 He answereth and saith unto them, He that hath two coats, let him impart to him that hath none; and he that hath meat, let him do likewise.
column3: Lukas 3:11 En hy antwoord en sê vir hulle: Wie twee kledingstukke het, moet meedeel aan hom wat nie het nie; en wie voedsel het, moet dieselfde doen.

column2: Luke 3:12 Then came also publicans to be baptized, and said unto him, Master, what shall we do?
column3: Lukas 3:12 En tollenaars het ook gekom om gedoop te word, en vir hom gesê: Meester, wat moet ons doen?

column2: Luke 3:13 And he said unto them, Exact no more than that which is appointed you.
column3: Lukas 3:13 En hy antwoord hulle: Moenie meer invorder as wat julle voorgeskrywe is nie.

column2: Luke 3:14 And the soldiers likewise demanded of him, saying, And what shall we do? And he said unto them, Do violence to no man, neither accuse [any] falsely; and be content with your wages.
column3: Lukas 3:14 En die soldate het hom ook gevra en gesê: En ons, wat moet ons doen? En hy sê vir hulle: Julle moet niemand geweld aandoen of iets afpers nie; en wees tevrede met julle soldy.

column2: Luke 3:15 And as the people were in expectation, and all men mused in their hearts of John, whether he were the Christ, or not;
column3: Lukas 3:15 En terwyl die volk in verwagting was, en almal in hulle hart oorweeg het aangaande Johannes of hy nie miskien die Christus was nie,

column2: Luke 3:16 John answered, saying unto [them] all, I indeed baptize you with water; but one mightier than I cometh, the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to unloose: he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost and with fire:
column3: Lukas 3:16 antwoord Johannes almal en sê: Ek doop julle wel met water, maar Hy kom wat sterker is as ek, wie se skoenriem ek nie waardig is om los te maak nie — Hy sal julle doop met die Heilige Gees en met vuur.

column2: Luke 3:17 Whose fan [is] in his hand, and he will throughly purge his floor, and will gather the wheat into his garner; but the chaff he will burn with fire unquenchable.
column3: Lukas 3:17 Sy skop is in sy hand, en Hy sal sy dorsvloer deur en deur skoonmaak en sy koring saambring in sy skuur, maar die kaf met onuitbluslike vuur verbrand.

column2: Luke 3:18 And many other things in his exhortation preached he unto the people.
column3: Lukas 3:18 Hy het dan ook met baie ander vermaninge die evangelie aan die volk verkondig.

column2: Luke 3:19 But Herod the tetrarch, being reproved by him for Herodias his brother Philip's wife, and for all the evils which Herod had done,
column3: Lukas 3:19 Maar toe Herodes, die viervors, deur hom bestraf is oor Heródias, die vrou van Filippus, sy broer, en oor al die slegte dinge wat Herodes gedoen het,

column2: Luke 3:20 Added yet this above all, that he shut up John in prison.
column3: Lukas 3:20 het hy by alles nog dít gevoeg, dat hy Johannes in die gevangenis opgesluit het.

column2: Luke 3:21 Now when all the people were baptized, it came to pass, that Jesus also being baptized, and praying, the heaven was opened,
column3: Lukas 3:21 EN toe die hele volk gedoop en Jesus ook gedoop is, en Hy besig was om te bid, het die hemel oopgegaan;

column2: Luke 3:22 And the Holy Ghost descended in a bodily shape like a dove upon him, and a voice came from heaven, which said, Thou art my beloved Son; in thee I am well pleased.
column3: Lukas 3:22 en die Heilige Gees het in liggaamlike gedaante soos ’n duif op Hom neergedaal; en ’n stem het uit die hemel gekom wat sê: U is my geliefde Seun; in U het Ek ’n welbehae.

column2: Luke 3:23 And Jesus himself began to be about thirty years of age, being (as was supposed) the son of Joseph, which was [the son] of Heli,
column3: Lukas 3:23 EN Hy, Jesus, was omtrent dertig jaar oud toe Hy begin leer het; en Hy was, soos hulle gemeen het, die seun van Josef, die seun van Eli,

column2: Luke 3:24 Which was [the son] of Matthat, which was [the son] of Levi, which was [the son] of Melchi, which was [the son] of Janna, which was [the son] of Joseph,
column3: Lukas 3:24 die seun van Mattat, die seun van Levi, die seun van Melgi, die seun van Janna, die seun van Josef,

column2: Luke 3:25 Which was [the son] of Mattathias, which was [the son] of Amos, which was [the son] of Naum, which was [the son] of Esli, which was [the son] of Nagge,
column3: Lukas 3:25 die seun van Mattatías, die seun van Amos, die seun van Nahum, die seun van Esli, die seun van Nággai,

column2: Luke 3:26 Which was [the son] of Maath, which was [the son] of Mattathias, which was [the son] of Semei, which was [the son] of Joseph, which was [the son] of Juda,
column3: Lukas 3:26 die seun van Maät, die seun van Mattatías, die seun van Sémeï, die seun van Josef, die seun van Juda,

column2: Luke 3:27 Which was [the son] of Joanna, which was [the son] of Rhesa, which was [the son] of Zorobabel, which was [the son] of Salathiel, which was [the son] of Neri,
column3: Lukas 3:27 die seun van Jóhanan, die seun van Resa, die seun van Serubbábel, die seun van Seáltiël, die seun van Neríja,

column2: Luke 3:28 Which was [the son] of Melchi, which was [the son] of Addi, which was [the son] of Cosam, which was [the son] of Elmodam, which was [the son] of Er,
column3: Lukas 3:28 die seun van Melgi, die seun van Addi, die seun van Kosam, die seun van Elmódam, die seun van Er,

column2: Luke 3:29 Which was [the son] of Jose, which was [the son] of Eliezer, which was [the son] of Jorim, which was [the son] of Matthat, which was [the son] of Levi,
column3: Lukas 3:29 die seun van Joses, die seun van Eliëser, die seun van Jorim, die seun van Mattat, die seun van Levi,

column2: Luke 3:30 Which was [the son] of Simeon, which was [the son] of Juda, which was [the son] of Joseph, which was [the son] of Jonan, which was [the son] of Eliakim,
column3: Lukas 3:30 die seun van Símeon, die seun van Juda, die seun van Josef, die seun van Jonan, die seun van Éljakim,

column2: Luke 3:31 Which was [the son] of Melea, which was [the son] of Menan, which was [the son] of Mattatha, which was [the son] of Nathan, which was [the son] of David,
column3: Lukas 3:31 die seun van Meléas, die seun van Mainan, die seun van Máttata, die seun van Natan, die seun van Dawid,

column2: Luke 3:32 Which was [the son] of Jesse, which was [the son] of Obed, which was [the son] of Booz, which was [the son] of Salmon, which was [the son] of Naasson,
column3: Lukas 3:32 die seun van Ísai, die seun van Obed, die seun van Boas, die seun van Salmon, die seun van Nagson,

column2: Luke 3:33 Which was [the son] of Aminadab, which was [the son] of Aram, which was [the son] of Esrom, which was [the son] of Phares, which was [the son] of Juda,
column3: Lukas 3:33 die seun van Ammínadab, die seun van Ram, die seun van Hesron, die seun van Peres, die seun van Juda,

column2: Luke 3:34 Which was [the son] of Jacob, which was [the son] of Isaac, which was [the son] of Abraham, which was [the son] of Thara, which was [the son] of Nachor,
column3: Lukas 3:34 die seun van Jakob, die seun van Isak, die seun van Abraham, die seun van Tera, die seun van Nahor,

column2: Luke 3:35 Which was [the son] of Saruch, which was [the son] of Ragau, which was [the son] of Phalec, which was [the son] of Heber, which was [the son] of Sala,
column3: Lukas 3:35 die seun van Serug, die seun van Rehu, die seun van Peleg, die seun van Heber, die seun van Sela,

column2: Luke 3:36 Which was [the son] of Cainan, which was [the son] of Arphaxad, which was [the son] of Sem, which was [the son] of Noe, which was [the son] of Lamech,
column3: Lukas 3:36 die seun van Kainan, die seun van Arpágsad, die seun van Sem, die seun van Noag, die seun van Lameg,

column2: Luke 3:37 Which was [the son] of Mathusala, which was [the son] of Enoch, which was [the son] of Jared, which was [the son] of Maleleel, which was [the son] of Cainan,
column3: Lukas 3:37 die seun van Metúsala, die seun van Henog, die seun van Jered, die seun van Mehaláleël, die seun van Kenan,

column2: Luke 3:38 Which was [the son] of Enos, which was [the son] of Seth, which was [the son] of Adam, which was [the son] of God.
column3: Lukas 3:38 die seun van Enos, die seun van Set, die seun van Adam, die seun van God.

column2: Luke 4:1 And Jesus being full of the Holy Ghost returned from Jordan, and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness,
column3: Lukas 4:1 EN Jesus het vol van die Heilige Gees teruggekeer van die Jordaan af, en is deur die Gees in die woestyn gelei,

column2: Luke 4:2 Being forty days tempted of the devil. And in those days he did eat nothing: and when they were ended, he afterward hungered.
column3: Lukas 4:2 waar Hy veertig dae lank deur die duiwel versoek is; en Hy het niks geëet in dié dae nie; en toe hulle verby was, het Hy naderhand honger geword.

column2: Luke 4:3 And the devil said unto him, If thou be the Son of God, command this stone that it be made bread.
column3: Lukas 4:3 Toe sê die duiwel vir Hom: As U die Seun van God is, sê vir hierdie klip dat dit brood moet word.

column2: Luke 4:4 And Jesus answered him, saying, It is written, That man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word of God.
column3: Lukas 4:4 Maar Jesus antwoord en sê vir hom: Daar is geskrywe: Die mens sal nie van brood alleen lewe nie, maar van elke woord van God.

column2: Luke 4:5 And the devil, taking him up into an high mountain, shewed unto him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time.
column3: Lukas 4:5 Toe bring die duiwel Hom op ’n hoë berg en wys Hom al die koninkryke van die wêreld in ’n oomblik se tyd.

column2: Luke 4:6 And the devil said unto him, All this power will I give thee, and the glory of them: for that is delivered unto me; and to whomsoever I will I give it.
column3: Lukas 4:6 En die duiwel sê vir Hom: Ek sal U al hierdie mag gee en hulle heerlikheid, want dit is aan my oorgegee, en ek gee dit aan wie ek wil.

column2: Luke 4:7 If thou therefore wilt worship me, all shall be thine.
column3: Lukas 4:7 As U my dan aanbid, sal alles aan U behoort.

column2: Luke 4:8 And Jesus answered and said unto him, Get thee behind me, Satan: for it is written, Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and him only shalt thou serve.
column3: Lukas 4:8 En Jesus antwoord en sê vir hom: Gaan weg agter My, Satan, want daar is geskrywe: Die Here jou God moet jy aanbid en Hom alleen dien.

column2: Luke 4:9 And he brought him to Jerusalem, and set him on a pinnacle of the temple, and said unto him, If thou be the Son of God, cast thyself down from hence:
column3: Lukas 4:9 Toe bring hy Hom na Jerusalem en stel Hom op die dak van die tempel en sê vir Hom: As U die Seun van God is, werp Uself hiervandaan neer.

column2: Luke 4:10 For it is written, He shall give his angels charge over thee, to keep thee:
column3: Lukas 4:10 Want daar is geskrywe: Hy sal sy engele bevel gee aangaande U om U te bewaar,

column2: Luke 4:11 And in [their] hands they shall bear thee up, lest at any time thou dash thy foot against a stone.
column3: Lukas 4:11 en hulle sal U op die hande dra, sodat U nie miskien u voet teen ’n klip stamp nie.

column2: Luke 4:12 And Jesus answering said unto him, It is said, Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God.
column3: Lukas 4:12 En Jesus antwoord en sê vir hom: Daar is gesê: Jy mag die Here jou God nie versoek nie.

column2: Luke 4:13 And when the devil had ended all the temptation, he departed from him for a season.
column3: Lukas 4:13 En toe die duiwel elke versoeking geëindig het, het hy ’n tyd lank van Hom gewyk.

column2: Luke 4:14 And Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit into Galilee: and there went out a fame of him through all the region round about.
column3: Lukas 4:14 EN Jesus het in die krag van die Gees na Galiléa teruggekeer, en daar het ’n gerug aangaande Hom deur die hele omtrek uitgegaan;

column2: Luke 4:15 And he taught in their synagogues, being glorified of all.
column3: Lukas 4:15 en Hy het in hulle sinagoges geleer en is deur almal geprys.

column2: Luke 4:16 And he came to Nazareth, where he had been brought up: and, as his custom was, he went into the synagogue on the sabbath day, and stood up for to read.
column3: Lukas 4:16 Toe kom Hy in Násaret waar Hy opgevoed was; en soos Hy gewoond was, gaan Hy op die sabbatdag in die sinagoge en staan op om te lees.

column2: Luke 4:17 And there was delivered unto him the book of the prophet Esaias. And when he had opened the book, he found the place where it was written,
column3: Lukas 4:17 En die boek van die profeet Jesaja is aan Hom oorhandig; en toe Hy die boek oopmaak, kry Hy die plek waar geskrywe is:

column2: Luke 4:18 The Spirit of the Lord [is] upon me, because he hath anointed me to preach the gospel to the poor; he hath sent me to heal the brokenhearted, to preach deliverance to the captives, and recovering of sight to the blind, to set at liberty them that are bruised,
column3: Lukas 4:18 Die Gees van die Here is op My, omdat Hy My gesalf het om die evangelie aan die armes te bring. Hy het My gestuur om die wat verbryseld van hart is, te genees;

column2: Luke 4:19 To preach the acceptable year of the Lord.
column3: Lukas 4:19 om aan gevangenes vrylating te verkondig en aan blindes herstel van gesig; om die wat gebroke is, in vryheid weg te stuur; om die aangename jaar van die Here aan te kondig.

column2: Luke 4:20 And he closed the book, and he gave [it] again to the minister, and sat down. And the eyes of all them that were in the synagogue were fastened on him.
column3: Lukas 4:20 En nadat Hy die boek toegemaak en aan die dienaar teruggegee het, gaan Hy sit, en die oë van almal in die sinagoge was op Hom gevestig.

column2: Luke 4:21 And he began to say unto them, This day is this scripture fulfilled in your ears.
column3: Lukas 4:21 Toe begin Hy vir hulle te sê: Vandag is hierdie Skrif in julle ore vervul.

column2: Luke 4:22 And all bare him witness, and wondered at the gracious words which proceeded out of his mouth. And they said, Is not this Joseph's son?
column3: Lukas 4:22 En almal het vir Hom getuienis gegee en was verwonderd oor die aangename woorde wat uit sy mond kom; en hulle sê: Is Hy nie die seun van Josef nie?

column2: Luke 4:23 And he said unto them, Ye will surely say unto me this proverb, Physician, heal thyself: whatsoever we have heard done in Capernaum, do also here in thy country.
column3: Lukas 4:23 En Hy antwoord hulle: Julle sal My ongetwyfeld hierdie spreekwoord toevoeg: Geneesheer, genees uself! Alles wat ons hoor wat in Kapérnaüm gebeur het, doen dit hier in u vaderstad ook.

column2: Luke 4:24 And he said, Verily I say unto you, No prophet is accepted in his own country.
column3: Lukas 4:24 En Hy sê: Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, geen profeet is aangenaam in sy vaderland nie.

column2: Luke 4:25 But I tell you of a truth, many widows were in Israel in the days of Elias, when the heaven was shut up three years and six months, when great famine was throughout all the land;
column3: Lukas 4:25 Maar Ek sê vir julle met waarheid, daar was baie weduwees in Israel in die dae van Elía toe die hemel toegesluit was drie jaar en ses maande lank, toe daar ’n groot hongersnood gekom het in die hele land,

column2: Luke 4:26 But unto none of them was Elias sent, save unto Sarepta, [a city] of Sidon, unto a woman [that was] a widow.
column3: Lukas 4:26 en na nie een van hulle is Elía gestuur nie, behalwe na Sarfat in Sidon, na ’n weduwee.

column2: Luke 4:27 And many lepers were in Israel in the time of Eliseus the prophet; and none of them was cleansed, saving Naaman the Syrian.
column3: Lukas 4:27 En daar was baie melaatses in Israel in die tyd van Elísa, die profeet, en nie een van hulle is gereinig nie, behalwe Naäman, die Síriër.

column2: Luke 4:28 And all they in the synagogue, when they heard these things, were filled with wrath,
column3: Lukas 4:28 En almal in die sinagoge is met woede vervul toe hulle dit hoor;

column2: Luke 4:29 And rose up, and thrust him out of the city, and led him unto the brow of the hill whereon their city was built, that they might cast him down headlong.
column3: Lukas 4:29 en hulle het opgestaan en Hom uit die stad uitgedryf en Hom gebring tot op die rand van die berg waarop hulle stad gebou was, om Hom van die krans af te gooi.

column2: Luke 4:30 But he passing through the midst of them went his way,
column3: Lukas 4:30 Maar Hy het tussen hulle deur geloop en weggegaan.

column2: Luke 4:31 And came down to Capernaum, a city of Galilee, and taught them on the sabbath days.
column3: Lukas 4:31 En Hy het afgekom na Kapérnaüm, ’n stad van Galiléa, en hulle op die sabbat geleer.

column2: Luke 4:32 And they were astonished at his doctrine: for his word was with power.
column3: Lukas 4:32 En hulle was verslae oor sy leer, want sy woord was met gesag.

column2: Luke 4:33 And in the synagogue there was a man, which had a spirit of an unclean devil, and cried out with a loud voice,
column3: Lukas 4:33 EN in die sinagoge was daar ’n man met die gees van ’n onreine duiwel, en hy het met ’n groot stem uitgeskreeu

column2: Luke 4:34 Saying, Let [us] alone; what have we to do with thee, [thou] Jesus of Nazareth? art thou come to destroy us? I know thee who thou art; the Holy One of God.
column3: Lukas 4:34 en gesê: Ha! wat het ons met U te doen, Jesus, Nasaréner? Het U gekom om ons te verdelg? Ek ken U, wie U is: die Heilige van God!

column2: Luke 4:35 And Jesus rebuked him, saying, Hold thy peace, and come out of him. And when the devil had thrown him in the midst, he came out of him, and hurt him not.
column3: Lukas 4:35 En Jesus het hom bestraf en gesê: Bly stil, en gaan uit hom uit! En die duiwel het hom tussen hulle neergegooi en uit hom uitgegaan sonder om hom seer te maak.

column2: Luke 4:36 And they were all amazed, and spake among themselves, saying, What a word [is] this! for with authority and power he commandeth the unclean spirits, and they come out.
column3: Lukas 4:36 Toe kom daar verbaasdheid oor almal, en hulle praat met mekaar en sê: Wat vir ’n woord is dit, dat Hy met gesag en mag die onreine geeste gebied, en hulle gaan uit!

column2: Luke 4:37 And the fame of him went out into every place of the country round about.
column3: Lukas 4:37 En daar het ’n gerug aangaande Hom uitgegaan na elke plek van die omgewing.

column2: Luke 4:38 And he arose out of the synagogue, and entered into Simon's house. And Simon's wife's mother was taken with a great fever; and they besought him for her.
column3: Lukas 4:38 EN Hy het opgestaan uit die sinagoge en in die huis van Simon gekom. En Simon se skoonmoeder was aangetas deur ’n hewige koors, en hulle het Hom geraadpleeg oor haar.

column2: Luke 4:39 And he stood over her, and rebuked the fever; and it left her: and immediately she arose and ministered unto them.
column3: Lukas 4:39 Toe gaan Hy oor haar staan en bestraf die koors, en dit het haar verlaat, en sy het onmiddellik opgestaan en hulle bedien.

column2: Luke 4:40 Now when the sun was setting, all they that had any sick with divers diseases brought them unto him; and he laid his hands on every one of them, and healed them.
column3: Lukas 4:40 En toe die son ondergaan, het almal hulle siekes, mense met allerhande kwale, na Hom gebring, en Hy het een vir een van hulle die hande opgelê en hulle gesond gemaak.

column2: Luke 4:41 And devils also came out of many, crying out, and saying, Thou art Christ the Son of God. And he rebuking [them] suffered them not to speak: for they knew that he was Christ.
column3: Lukas 4:41 En duiwels het ook uit baie uitgegaan en geskreeu en gesê: U is die Christus, die Seun van God! En Hy het hulle bestraf en nie toegelaat om te praat nie, omdat hulle geweet het dat Hy die Christus was.

column2: Luke 4:42 And when it was day, he departed and went into a desert place: and the people sought him, and came unto him, and stayed him, that he should not depart from them.
column3: Lukas 4:42 En toe dit dag geword het, het Hy uitgegaan en na ’n verlate plek vertrek; en die skare het Hom gesoek en by Hom gekom en Hom teëgehou, dat Hy nie van hulle sou weggaan nie.

column2: Luke 4:43 And he said unto them, I must preach the kingdom of God to other cities also: for therefore am I sent.
column3: Lukas 4:43 Maar Hy het vir hulle gesê: Ek moet aan die ander stede ook die evangelie van die koninkryk van God bring, want daarvoor is Ek gestuur.

column2: Luke 4:44 And he preached in the synagogues of Galilee.
column3: Lukas 4:44 En Hy het verder in die sinagoges van Galiléa gepreek.

column2: Luke 5:1 And it came to pass, that, as the people pressed upon him to hear the word of God, he stood by the lake of Gennesaret,
column3: Lukas 5:1 EN toe die skare by Hom aandring om die woord van God te hoor, gaan Hy by die meer Gennésaret staan

column2: Luke 5:2 And saw two ships standing by the lake: but the fishermen were gone out of them, and were washing [their] nets.
column3: Lukas 5:2 en sien twee skuite aan die kant van die meer lê; maar die vissers het van hulle af weggegaan en was besig om die nette uit te spoel.

column2: Luke 5:3 And he entered into one of the ships, which was Simon's, and prayed him that he would thrust out a little from the land. And he sat down, and taught the people out of the ship.
column3: Lukas 5:3 Toe klim Hy in een van die skuite wat aan Simon behoort het, en vra hom om ’n entjie van die land af weg te vaar, en Hy het gaan sit en die skare van die skuit uit geleer.

column2: Luke 5:4 Now when he had left speaking, he said unto Simon, Launch out into the deep, and let down your nets for a draught.
column3: Lukas 5:4 En toe Hy ophou met spreek, sê Hy vir Simon: Vaar uit na die diep water en laat julle nette sak om te vang.

column2: Luke 5:5 And Simon answering said unto him, Master, we have toiled all the night, and have taken nothing: nevertheless at thy word I will let down the net.
column3: Lukas 5:5 En Simon antwoord en sê vir Hom: Meester, ons het die hele nag deur hard gewerk en niks gevang nie; maar op u woord sal ek die net laat sak.

column2: Luke 5:6 And when they had this done, they inclosed a great multitude of fishes: and their net brake.
column3: Lukas 5:6 En toe hulle dit gedoen het, het hulle ’n groot menigte visse ingesluit; en hulle net wou skeur.

column2: Luke 5:7 And they beckoned unto [their] partners, which were in the other ship, that they should come and help them. And they came, and filled both the ships, so that they began to sink.
column3: Lukas 5:7 Daarop wink hulle vir hul maats in die ander skuit om hulle te kom help. En hulle het gekom en altwee die skuite vol gemaak, sodat hulle amper gesink het.

column2: Luke 5:8 When Simon Peter saw [it], he fell down at Jesus' knees, saying, Depart from me; for I am a sinful man, O Lord.
column3: Lukas 5:8 En toe Simon Petrus dit sien, val hy neer aan die knieë van Jesus en sê: Gaan weg van my, Here, want ek is ’n sondige man!

column2: Luke 5:9 For he was astonished, and all that were with him, at the draught of the fishes which they had taken:
column3: Lukas 5:9 Want verbaasdheid het hom aangegryp en almal wat by hom was, oor die vangs van visse wat hulle gemaak het;

column2: Luke 5:10 And so [was] also James, and John, the sons of Zebedee, which were partners with Simon. And Jesus said unto Simon, Fear not; from henceforth thou shalt catch men.
column3: Lukas 5:10 en net so ook vir Jakobus en Johannes, die seuns van Sebedéüs, wat Simon se maats was. En Jesus sê vir Simon: Moenie vrees nie; van nou af sal jy mense vang.

column2: Luke 5:11 And when they had brought their ships to land, they forsook all, and followed him.
column3: Lukas 5:11 En nadat hulle die skuite aan land gebring het, het hulle alles verlaat en Hom gevolg.

column2: Luke 5:12 And it came to pass, when he was in a certain city, behold a man full of leprosy: who seeing Jesus fell on [his] face, and besought him, saying, Lord, if thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.
column3: Lukas 5:12 EN terwyl Hy in een van die stede was, kom daar ’n man vol van melaatsheid; en toe hy Jesus sien, val hy op sy aangesig en smeek Hom en sê: Here, as U wil, kan U my reinig.

column2: Luke 5:13 And he put forth [his] hand, and touched him, saying, I will: be thou clean. And immediately the leprosy departed from him.
column3: Lukas 5:13 Daarop steek Hy die hand uit en raak hom aan en sê: Ek wil, word gereinig! En dadelik het die melaatsheid hom verlaat.

column2: Luke 5:14 And he charged him to tell no man: but go, and shew thyself to the priest, and offer for thy cleansing, according as Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.
column3: Lukas 5:14 Toe gee Hy hom bevel om dit aan niemand te vertel nie; maar, sê Hy, gaan vertoon jou aan die priester en offer vir jou reiniging, soos Moses voorgeskrywe het, vir hulle tot ’n getuienis.

column2: Luke 5:15 But so much the more went there a fame abroad of him: and great multitudes came together to hear, and to be healed by him of their infirmities.
column3: Lukas 5:15 Maar die gerug aangaande Hom is nog meer versprei, en groot menigtes het bymekaargekom om te luister en deur Hom van hulle siektes genees te word.

column2: Luke 5:16 And he withdrew himself into the wilderness, and prayed.
column3: Lukas 5:16 Maar Hy het Hom in verlate plekke teruggetrek en gebid.

column2: Luke 5:17 And it came to pass on a certain day, as he was teaching, that there were Pharisees and doctors of the law sitting by, which were come out of every town of Galilee, and Judaea, and Jerusalem: and the power of the Lord was [present] to heal them.
column3: Lukas 5:17 EN op een van dié dae was Hy besig om te leer; en Fariseërs en wetgeleerdes wat gekom het uit elke dorp van Galiléa en Judéa en uit Jerusalem, het daar gesit, en daar was krag van die Here om hulle te genees.

column2: Luke 5:18 And, behold, men brought in a bed a man which was taken with a palsy: and they sought [means] to bring him in, and to lay [him] before him.
column3: Lukas 5:18 En daar het manne ’n mens wat verlam was, op ’n bed gebring, en hulle het probeer om hom in te bring en voor Hom neer te sit.

column2: Luke 5:19 And when they could not find by what [way] they might bring him in because of the multitude, they went upon the housetop, and let him down through the tiling with [his] couch into the midst before Jesus.
column3: Lukas 5:19 En toe hulle vanweë die skare geen kans sien om hom in te bring nie, klim hulle op die dak en laat hom met die bed afsak deur die panne tussen die mense in en voor Jesus.

column2: Luke 5:20 And when he saw their faith, he said unto him, Man, thy sins are forgiven thee.
column3: Lukas 5:20 En toe Hy hulle geloof sien, sê Hy vir hom: Mens, jou sondes is jou vergewe.

column2: Luke 5:21 And the scribes and the Pharisees began to reason, saying, Who is this which speaketh blasphemies? Who can forgive sins, but God alone?
column3: Lukas 5:21 En die skrifgeleerdes en die Fariseërs het begin redeneer en sê: Wie is Hy wat so godslasterlik praat? Wie kan sondes vergewe behalwe God alleen?

column2: Luke 5:22 But when Jesus perceived their thoughts, he answering said unto them, What reason ye in your hearts?
column3: Lukas 5:22 Maar Jesus het hulle redeneringe gemerk, en Hy antwoord en sê vir hulle: Wat redeneer julle in jul harte?

column2: Luke 5:23 Whether is easier, to say, Thy sins be forgiven thee; or to say, Rise up and walk?
column3: Lukas 5:23 Wat is makliker, om te sê: Jou sondes is jou vergewe; of om te sê: Staan op en loop?

column2: Luke 5:24 But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power upon earth to forgive sins, (he said unto the sick of the palsy,) I say unto thee, Arise, and take up thy couch, and go into thine house.
column3: Lukas 5:24 Maar dat julle kan weet dat die Seun van die mens mag het om op aarde sondes te vergewe — sê Hy vir die verlamde man: Ek sê vir jou, staan op, neem jou bed op en gaan na jou huis toe.

column2: Luke 5:25 And immediately he rose up before them, and took up that whereon he lay, and departed to his own house, glorifying God.
column3: Lukas 5:25 Hy staan toe onmiddellik voor hulle op, neem die bed op waar hy op gelê het, en gaan na sy huis, terwyl hy God verheerlik.

column2: Luke 5:26 And they were all amazed, and they glorified God, and were filled with fear, saying, We have seen strange things to day.
column3: Lukas 5:26 En verbasing het almal aangegryp, en hulle het God verheerlik en is met vrees vervul en het gesê: Ons het vandag ongelooflike dinge gesien.

column2: Luke 5:27 And after these things he went forth, and saw a publican, named Levi, sitting at the receipt of custom: and he said unto him, Follow me.
column3: Lukas 5:27 EN ná hierdie dinge het Hy uitgegaan en ’n tollenaar met die naam van Levi by die tolhuis sien sit en vir hom gesê: Volg My.

column2: Luke 5:28 And he left all, rose up, and followed him.
column3: Lukas 5:28 En hy het alles verlaat en opgestaan en Hom gevolg.

column2: Luke 5:29 And Levi made him a great feast in his own house: and there was a great company of publicans and of others that sat down with them.
column3: Lukas 5:29 En Levi het ’n groot feesmaal vir Hom in sy huis gegee; en daar was ’n groot menigte van tollenaars en ander wat saam met hulle aan tafel was.

column2: Luke 5:30 But their scribes and Pharisees murmured against his disciples, saying, Why do ye eat and drink with publicans and sinners?
column3: Lukas 5:30 En hulle skrifgeleerdes en die Fariseërs het by sy dissipels gemurmureer en gesê: Waarom eet en drink julle saam met die tollenaars en sondaars?

column2: Luke 5:31 And Jesus answering said unto them, They that are whole need not a physician; but they that are sick.
column3: Lukas 5:31 En Jesus antwoord en sê vir hulle: Die wat gesond is, het die geneesheer nie nodig nie, maar die wat ongesteld is.

column2: Luke 5:32 I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.
column3: Lukas 5:32 Ek het nie gekom om regverdiges te roep nie, maar sondaars tot bekering.

column2: Luke 5:33 And they said unto him, Why do the disciples of John fast often, and make prayers, and likewise [the disciples] of the Pharisees; but thine eat and drink?
column3: Lukas 5:33 TOE sê hulle vir Hom: Waarom vas die dissipels van Johannes dikwels en doen gebede; so ook dié van die Fariseërs; maar u dissipels eet en drink?

column2: Luke 5:34 And he said unto them, Can ye make the children of the bridechamber fast, while the bridegroom is with them?
column3: Lukas 5:34 En Hy sê vir hulle: Kan julle die bruilofsgaste dan laat vas solank as die bruidegom by hulle is?

column2: Luke 5:35 But the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them, and then shall they fast in those days.
column3: Lukas 5:35 Maar daar sal dae kom wanneer die bruidegom van hulle weggeneem word; dan sal hulle vas, in daardie dae.

column2: Luke 5:36 And he spake also a parable unto them; No man putteth a piece of a new garment upon an old; if otherwise, then both the new maketh a rent, and the piece that was [taken] out of the new agreeth not with the old.
column3: Lukas 5:36 En Hy het ook aan hulle ’n gelykenis vertel: Niemand sit ’n lap van ’n nuwe kleed op ’n ou kleed nie; anders skeur dit die nuwe ook, en die lap wat van die nuwe af kom, pas nie by die oue nie.

column2: Luke 5:37 And no man putteth new wine into old bottles; else the new wine will burst the bottles, and be spilled, and the bottles shall perish.
column3: Lukas 5:37 En niemand gooi nuwe wyn in ou leersakke nie; anders sal die nuwe wyn die sakke skeur, en dit sal uitloop, en die sakke sal vergaan.

column2: Luke 5:38 But new wine must be put into new bottles; and both are preserved.
column3: Lukas 5:38 Maar nuwe wyn moet in nuwe sakke gegooi word, en altwee word saam behou.

column2: Luke 5:39 No man also having drunk old [wine] straightway desireth new: for he saith, The old is better.
column3: Lukas 5:39 En niemand wat ou wyn gedrink het, wil dadelik nuwe hê nie; want hy sê: Die oue is beter.

column2: Luke 6:1 And it came to pass on the second sabbath after the first, that he went through the corn fields; and his disciples plucked the ears of corn, and did eat, rubbing [them] in [their] hands.
column3: Lukas 6:1 EN op die tweede eerste sabbat het Hy deur die gesaaides geloop, en sy dissipels het die are gepluk en met hulle hande uitgevrywe en geëet.

column2: Luke 6:2 And certain of the Pharisees said unto them, Why do ye that which is not lawful to do on the sabbath days?
column3: Lukas 6:2 Toe sê sommige van die Fariseërs vir hulle: Waarom doen julle wat nie geoorloof is om op die sabbat te doen nie?

column2: Luke 6:3 And Jesus answering them said, Have ye not read so much as this, what David did, when himself was an hungred, and they which were with him;
column3: Lukas 6:3 En Jesus antwoord en sê vir hulle: Het julle dan nie gelees wat Dawid gedoen het nie — toe hy honger gehad het, hy en die wat by hom was —

column2: Luke 6:4 How he went into the house of God, and did take and eat the shewbread, and gave also to them that were with him; which it is not lawful to eat but for the priests alone?
column3: Lukas 6:4 hoe hy in die huis van God gegaan en die toonbrode geneem en geëet het, en ook aan die wat by hom was, gegee het, wat hulle nie geoorloof was om te eet nie, maar net vir die priesters alleen?

column2: Luke 6:5 And he said unto them, That the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath.
