column3: Lukas 6:5 Toe sê Hy vir hulle: Die Seun van die mens is Here óók van die sabbat.

column2: Luke 6:6 And it came to pass also on another sabbath, that he entered into the synagogue and taught: and there was a man whose right hand was withered.
column3: Lukas 6:6 EN op ’n ander sabbat het Hy in die sinagoge gegaan en geleer. En daar was ’n man, en sy regterhand was uitgedor.

column2: Luke 6:7 And the scribes and Pharisees watched him, whether he would heal on the sabbath day; that they might find an accusation against him.
column3: Lukas 6:7 En die skrifgeleerdes en die Fariseërs het Hom in die oog gehou, of Hy op die sabbat gesond maak, sodat hulle ’n aanklag teen Hom kon vind.

column2: Luke 6:8 But he knew their thoughts, and said to the man which had the withered hand, Rise up, and stand forth in the midst. And he arose and stood forth.
column3: Lukas 6:8 Maar Hy het hulle gedagtes geken en vir die man met die verdorde hand gesê: Staan op hier in hul midde. En hy het opgestaan.

column2: Luke 6:9 Then said Jesus unto them, I will ask you one thing; Is it lawful on the sabbath days to do good, or to do evil? to save life, or to destroy [it]?
column3: Lukas 6:9 Toe sê Jesus vir hulle: Ek sal aan julle ’n vraag stel: wat is geoorloof op die sabbat — om goed te doen of kwaad te doen; om ’n lewe te red of óm te bring?

column2: Luke 6:10 And looking round about upon them all, he said unto the man, Stretch forth thy hand. And he did so: and his hand was restored whole as the other.
column3: Lukas 6:10 En nadat Hy almal rondom aangekyk het, sê Hy vir die man: Steek jou hand uit! En hy het dit gedoen; en sy hand is herstel, gesond soos die ander een.

column2: Luke 6:11 And they were filled with madness; and communed one with another what they might do to Jesus.
column3: Lukas 6:11 En hulle is met uitsinnigheid vervul en het met mekaar gepraat wat hulle aan Jesus sou doen.

column2: Luke 6:12 And it came to pass in those days, that he went out into a mountain to pray, and continued all night in prayer to God.
column3: Lukas 6:12 EN Hy het in daardie dae uitgegaan na die berg om te bid en die nag in die gebed tot God deurgebring.

column2: Luke 6:13 And when it was day, he called [unto him] his disciples: and of them he chose twelve, whom also he named apostles;
column3: Lukas 6:13 En toe dit dag geword het, het Hy sy dissipels na Hom geroep en twaalf van hulle uitgekies, wat Hy apostels genoem het:

column2: Luke 6:14 Simon, (whom he also named Peter,) and Andrew his brother, James and John, Philip and Bartholomew,
column3: Lukas 6:14 Simon wat Hy Petrus genoem het, en Andréas, sy broer; Jakobus en Johannes; Filippus en Bartholoméüs;

column2: Luke 6:15 Matthew and Thomas, James the [son] of Alphaeus, and Simon called Zelotes,
column3: Lukas 6:15 Matthéüs en Thomas; Jakobus, die seun van Alféüs, en Simon wat Yweraar genoem word;

column2: Luke 6:16 And Judas [the brother] of James, and Judas Iscariot, which also was the traitor.
column3: Lukas 6:16 Judas, die seun van Jakobus, en Judas Iskáriot, wat die verraaier geword het.

column2: Luke 6:17 And he came down with them, and stood in the plain, and the company of his disciples, and a great multitude of people out of all Judaea and Jerusalem, and from the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon, which came to hear him, and to be healed of their diseases;
column3: Lukas 6:17 EN Hy het met hulle afgeklim en op ’n gelyk plek gaan staan, en daar was ’n skare van sy dissipels en ’n groot menigte van die volk van die hele Judéa en Jerusalem en die kusstreek van Tirus en Sidon af,

column2: Luke 6:18 And they that were vexed with unclean spirits: and they were healed.
column3: Lukas 6:18 wat gekom het om Hom te hoor en van hulle kwale genees te word; en die wat gekwel was deur onreine geeste, is ook genees.

column2: Luke 6:19 And the whole multitude sought to touch him: for there went virtue out of him, and healed [them] all.
column3: Lukas 6:19 En die hele skare het probeer om Hom aan te raak, omdat krag van Hom uitgegaan het, en Hy het almal gesond gemaak.

column2: Luke 6:20 And he lifted up his eyes on his disciples, and said, Blessed [be ye] poor: for yours is the kingdom of God.
column3: Lukas 6:20 Toe slaan Hy sy oë op oor sy dissipels en sê: Salig is julle, armes, want aan julle behoort die koninkryk van God.

column2: Luke 6:21 Blessed [are ye] that hunger now: for ye shall be filled. Blessed [are ye] that weep now: for ye shall laugh.
column3: Lukas 6:21 Salig is julle wat nou honger het, want julle sal versadig word. Salig is julle wat nou ween, want julle sal lag.

column2: Luke 6:22 Blessed are ye, when men shall hate you, and when they shall separate you [from their company], and shall reproach [you], and cast out your name as evil, for the Son of man's sake.
column3: Lukas 6:22 Salig is julle wanneer die mense julle haat, en wanneer hulle julle verstoot en beledig en jul naam weggooi soos iets wat sleg is, ter wille van die Seun van die mens.

column2: Luke 6:23 Rejoice ye in that day, and leap for joy: for, behold, your reward [is] great in heaven: for in the like manner did their fathers unto the prophets.
column3: Lukas 6:23 Wees bly in daardie dag en spring op, want kyk, julle loon is groot in die hemel, want hulle vaders het net so aan die profete gedoen.

column2: Luke 6:24 But woe unto you that are rich! for ye have received your consolation.
column3: Lukas 6:24 Maar wee julle, rykes, want julle het jul troos weg.

column2: Luke 6:25 Woe unto you that are full! for ye shall hunger. Woe unto you that laugh now! for ye shall mourn and weep.
column3: Lukas 6:25 Wee julle wat vol is, want julle sal honger ly. Wee julle wat nou lag, want julle sal treur en ween.

column2: Luke 6:26 Woe unto you, when all men shall speak well of you! for so did their fathers to the false prophets.
column3: Lukas 6:26 Wee julle wanneer al die mense goed van julle praat, want hulle vaders het net so aan die valse profete gedoen.

column2: Luke 6:27 But I say unto you which hear, Love your enemies, do good to them which hate you,
column3: Lukas 6:27 Maar Ek sê vir julle wat luister: Julle moet jul vyande liefhê en goed doen aan die wat vir julle haat.

column2: Luke 6:28 Bless them that curse you, and pray for them which despitefully use you.
column3: Lukas 6:28 Seën die wat vir julle vervloek, en bid vir die wat julle beledig.

column2: Luke 6:29 And unto him that smiteth thee on the [one] cheek offer also the other; and him that taketh away thy cloke forbid not [to take thy] coat also.
column3: Lukas 6:29 Aan hom wat jou op die wang slaan, moet jy ook die ander een aanbied; en aan hom wat jou bo-kleed neem, moet jy ook die onderkleed nie weier nie.

column2: Luke 6:30 Give to every man that asketh of thee; and of him that taketh away thy goods ask [them] not again.
column3: Lukas 6:30 Maar gee aan elkeen wat jou iets vra, en eis jou goed nie terug van hom wat dit neem nie.

column2: Luke 6:31 And as ye would that men should do to you, do ye also to them likewise.
column3: Lukas 6:31 En soos julle wil hê dat die mense aan julle moet doen, so moet julle ook aan hulle doen.

column2: Luke 6:32 For if ye love them which love you, what thank have ye? for sinners also love those that love them.
column3: Lukas 6:32 En as julle dié liefhet wat vir julle liefhet, watter dank het julle? Want die sondaars het ook dié lief wat vir hulle liefhet.

column2: Luke 6:33 And if ye do good to them which do good to you, what thank have ye? for sinners also do even the same.
column3: Lukas 6:33 En as julle goed doen aan die wat aan julle goed doen, watter dank het julle? Want die sondaars doen ook dieselfde.

column2: Luke 6:34 And if ye lend [to them] of whom ye hope to receive, what thank have ye? for sinners also lend to sinners, to receive as much again.
column3: Lukas 6:34 En as julle leen aan dié van wie julle hoop om terug te ontvang, watter dank het julle? Want die sondaars leen ook aan die sondaars, om net soveel terug te ontvang.

column2: Luke 6:35 But love ye your enemies, and do good, and lend, hoping for nothing again; and your reward shall be great, and ye shall be the children of the Highest: for he is kind unto the unthankful and [to] the evil.
column3: Lukas 6:35 Maar julle moet jul vyande liefhê en goed doen en leen sonder om iets terug te verwag, en julle loon sal groot wees; en julle sal kinders van die Allerhoogste wees; want Hy self is goedertieren oor die ondankbares en slegtes.

column2: Luke 6:36 Be ye therefore merciful, as your Father also is merciful.
column3: Lukas 6:36 Wees dan barmhartig, soos julle Vader ook barmhartig is.

column2: Luke 6:37 Judge not, and ye shall not be judged: condemn not, and ye shall not be condemned: forgive, and ye shall be forgiven:
column3: Lukas 6:37 En julle moet nie oordeel nie, dan sal julle nooit geoordeel word nie. Julle moet nie veroordeel nie, dan sal julle nooit veroordeel word nie. Spreek vry, en julle sal vrygespreek word.

column2: Luke 6:38 Give, and it shall be given unto you; good measure, pressed down, and shaken together, and running over, shall men give into your bosom. For with the same measure that ye mete withal it shall be measured to you again.
column3: Lukas 6:38 Gee, en aan julle sal gegee word. ’n Goeie maat wat ingedruk en geskud en oorlopend is, sal hulle in jul skoot gee, want met dieselfde maat waarmee julle meet, sal weer vir julle gemeet word.

column2: Luke 6:39 And he spake a parable unto them, Can the blind lead the blind? shall they not both fall into the ditch?
column3: Lukas 6:39 En Hy het vir hulle ’n gelykenis uitgespreek: ’n Blinde kan tog nie ’n blinde lei nie! Sal hulle nie altwee in die sloot val nie?

column2: Luke 6:40 The disciple is not above his master: but every one that is perfect shall be as his master.
column3: Lukas 6:40 ’n Leerling is nie bo sy meester nie; maar elkeen wat volleerd is, sal soos sy meester wees.

column2: Luke 6:41 And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother's eye, but perceivest not the beam that is in thine own eye?
column3: Lukas 6:41 En waarom sien jy die splinter in die oog van jou broeder, maar die balk wat in jou eie oog is, merk jy nie op nie?

column2: Luke 6:42 Either how canst thou say to thy brother, Brother, let me pull out the mote that is in thine eye, when thou thyself beholdest not the beam that is in thine own eye? Thou hypocrite, cast out first the beam out of thine own eye, and then shalt thou see clearly to pull out the mote that is in thy brother's eye.
column3: Lukas 6:42 Of hoe kan jy vir jou broeder sê: Broeder, laat my toe om die splinter wat in jou oog is, uit te haal, terwyl jy self die balk wat in jou oog is, nie sien nie? Geveinsde, haal eers die balk uit jou oog uit, en dan sal jy goed sien om die splinter wat in jou broeder se oog is, uit te haal.

column2: Luke 6:43 For a good tree bringeth not forth corrupt fruit; neither doth a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit.
column3: Lukas 6:43 Want dit is nie ’n goeie boom wat slegte vrugte dra nie, en ook nie ’n slegte boom wat goeie vrugte dra nie.

column2: Luke 6:44 For every tree is known by his own fruit. For of thorns men do not gather figs, nor of a bramble bush gather they grapes.
column3: Lukas 6:44 Want elke boom word geken aan sy eie vrugte. Van dorings pluk ’n mens tog nie vye nie, en ’n mens sny ook nie druiwe van ’n doringbos nie.

column2: Luke 6:45 A good man out of the good treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is good; and an evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is evil: for of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaketh.
column3: Lukas 6:45 Die goeie mens bring uit die goeie skat van sy hart te voorskyn wat goed is; en die slegte mens bring uit die slegte skat van sy hart te voorskyn wat sleg is; want uit die oorvloed van die hart spreek sy mond.

column2: Luke 6:46 And why call ye me, Lord, Lord, and do not the things which I say?
column3: Lukas 6:46 En wat noem julle My: Here, Here! en doen nie wat Ek sê nie?

column2: Luke 6:47 Whosoever cometh to me, and heareth my sayings, and doeth them, I will shew you to whom he is like:
column3: Lukas 6:47 Elkeen wat na My toe kom en na my woorde luister en dit doen — Ek sal julle wys soos wie hy is.

column2: Luke 6:48 He is like a man which built an house, and digged deep, and laid the foundation on a rock: and when the flood arose, the stream beat vehemently upon that house, and could not shake it: for it was founded upon a rock.
column3: Lukas 6:48 Hy is soos ’n man wat ’n huis bou, wat gegrawe en diep ingegaan en die fondament op die rots gelê het; en toe die vloedwater kom en die stroom teen daardie huis losbreek, kon hy dit nie beweeg nie, omdat sy fondament op die rots was.

column2: Luke 6:49 But he that heareth, and doeth not, is like a man that without a foundation built an house upon the earth; against which the stream did beat vehemently, and immediately it fell; and the ruin of that house was great.
column3: Lukas 6:49 Maar wie dit hoor en dit nie doen nie, is soos ’n man wat ’n huis sonder fondament op die grond bou, en die stroom het daarteen losgebreek en dit het dadelik geval, en die instorting van daardie huis was groot.

column2: Luke 7:1 Now when he had ended all his sayings in the audience of the people, he entered into Capernaum.
column3: Lukas 7:1 EN nadat Hy voor die ore van die volk al sy woorde beëindig het, het Hy in Kapérnaüm ingegaan.

column2: Luke 7:2 And a certain centurion's servant, who was dear unto him, was sick, and ready to die.
column3: Lukas 7:2 En die dienskneg van ’n sekere hoofman oor honderd, wat vir hom baie werd was, was ongesteld en het op sterwe gelê.

column2: Luke 7:3 And when he heard of Jesus, he sent unto him the elders of the Jews, beseeching him that he would come and heal his servant.
column3: Lukas 7:3 Toe hy dan van Jesus hoor, het hy ouderlinge van die Jode na Hom gestuur met die versoek aan Hom dat Hy moes kom en sy dienskneg gesond maak.

column2: Luke 7:4 And when they came to Jesus, they besought him instantly, saying, That he was worthy for whom he should do this:
column3: Lukas 7:4 En toe hulle by Jesus kom, het hulle Hom dringend gesmeek en gesê: Hy is dit werd dat U dit vir hom doen;

column2: Luke 7:5 For he loveth our nation, and he hath built us a synagogue.
column3: Lukas 7:5 want hy het ons volk lief en het self die sinagoge vir ons gebou.

column2: Luke 7:6 Then Jesus went with them. And when he was now not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to him, saying unto him, Lord, trouble not thyself: for I am not worthy that thou shouldest enter under my roof:
column3: Lukas 7:6 En Jesus het saam met hulle gegaan; maar toe Hy nie meer ver van die huis af was nie, stuur die hoofman oor honderd vriende na Hom om vir Hom te sê: Here, moenie moeite doen nie, want ek is nie werd dat U onder my dak inkom nie.

column2: Luke 7:7 Wherefore neither thought I myself worthy to come unto thee: but say in a word, and my servant shall be healed.
column3: Lukas 7:7 Daarom het ek my ook nie waardig geag om na U te gaan nie; sê dit maar met ’n woord, en my kneg sal gesond word.

column2: Luke 7:8 For I also am a man set under authority, having under me soldiers, and I say unto one, Go, and he goeth; and to another, Come, and he cometh; and to my servant, Do this, and he doeth [it].
column3: Lukas 7:8 Want ek is ook ’n man wat aan gesag onderworpe is, en ek het soldate onder my; en vir hierdie een sê ek: Gaan! en hy gaan; en vir ’n ander een: Kom! en hy kom; en vir my dienskneg: Doen dit! en hy doen dit.

column2: Luke 7:9 When Jesus heard these things, he marvelled at him, and turned him about, and said unto the people that followed him, I say unto you, I have not found so great faith, no, not in Israel.
column3: Lukas 7:9 Toe Jesus dit hoor, was Hy oor hom verwonderd, en Hy draai Hom om en sê vir die skare wat Hom volg: Ek sê vir julle, selfs in Israel het Ek so ’n groot geloof nie gevind nie.

column2: Luke 7:10 And they that were sent, returning to the house, found the servant whole that had been sick.
column3: Lukas 7:10 En toe die wat gestuur was, teruggaan na die huis, vind hulle die siek dienskneg gesond.

column2: Luke 7:11 And it came to pass the day after, that he went into a city called Nain; and many of his disciples went with him, and much people.
column3: Lukas 7:11 EN die dag daarna was Hy op weg na ’n stad met die naam van Nain; en baie van sy dissipels en ’n groot menigte het saam met Hom gegaan.

column2: Luke 7:12 Now when he came nigh to the gate of the city, behold, there was a dead man carried out, the only son of his mother, and she was a widow: and much people of the city was with her.
column3: Lukas 7:12 En toe Hy naby die poort van die stad kom, word daar net ’n dooie uitgedra, die enigste seun van sy moeder, en sy was ’n weduwee; en ’n groot menigte van die stad was by haar.

column2: Luke 7:13 And when the Lord saw her, he had compassion on her, and said unto her, Weep not.
column3: Lukas 7:13 En toe die Here haar sien, het Hy innig jammer vir haar gevoel en vir haar gesê: Moenie ween nie!

column2: Luke 7:14 And he came and touched the bier: and they that bare [him] stood still. And he said, Young man, I say unto thee, Arise.
column3: Lukas 7:14 En Hy het nader gegaan en die baar aangeraak. Daarop staan die draers stil. En Hy sê: Jongman, Ek sê vir jou, staan op!

column2: Luke 7:15 And he that was dead sat up, and began to speak. And he delivered him to his mother.
column3: Lukas 7:15 En die dooie het regop gaan sit en begin praat; en Hy het hom aan sy moeder teruggegee.

column2: Luke 7:16 And there came a fear on all: and they glorified God, saying, That a great prophet is risen up among us; and, That God hath visited his people.
column3: Lukas 7:16 En vrees het almal aangegryp terwyl hulle God verheerlik en sê: ’n Groot profeet het onder ons opgestaan; en: God het sy volk besoek.

column2: Luke 7:17 And this rumour of him went forth throughout all Judaea, and throughout all the region round about.
column3: Lukas 7:17 En hierdie woord aangaande Hom het uitgegaan in die hele Judéa en in die hele omtrek.

column2: Luke 7:18 And the disciples of John shewed him of all these things.
column3: Lukas 7:18 EN die dissipels van Johannes het hom van al hierdie dinge berig gebring.

column2: Luke 7:19 And John calling [unto him] two of his disciples sent [them] to Jesus, saying, Art thou he that should come? or look we for another?
column3: Lukas 7:19 En Johannes het sekere twee van sy dissipels na hom geroep en hulle na Jesus gestuur en gesê: Is U die Een wat sou kom, of moet ons ’n ander een verwag?

column2: Luke 7:20 When the men were come unto him, they said, John Baptist hath sent us unto thee, saying, Art thou he that should come? or look we for another?
column3: Lukas 7:20 En toe die manne by Hom kom, sê hulle: Johannes die Doper het ons na U gestuur en gesê: Is U die Een wat sou kom, of moet ons ’n ander een verwag?

column2: Luke 7:21 And in that same hour he cured many of [their] infirmities and plagues, and of evil spirits; and unto many [that were] blind he gave sight.
column3: Lukas 7:21 En in dieselfde uur het Hy baie mense genees van siektes en kwale en bose geeste, en aan baie blindes die gesig geskenk.

column2: Luke 7:22 Then Jesus answering said unto them, Go your way, and tell John what things ye have seen and heard; how that the blind see, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, to the poor the gospel is preached.
column3: Lukas 7:22 En Jesus antwoord en sê vir hulle: Gaan vertel aan Johannes wat julle sien en hoor: blindes sien weer, kreupeles loop, melaatses word gereinig, dowes hoor, dooies word opgewek, aan armes word die evangelie verkondig.

column2: Luke 7:23 And blessed is [he], whosoever shall not be offended in me.
column3: Lukas 7:23 En salig is elkeen wat aan My nie aanstoot neem nie.

column2: Luke 7:24 And when the messengers of John were departed, he began to speak unto the people concerning John, What went ye out into the wilderness for to see? A reed shaken with the wind?
column3: Lukas 7:24 En nadat die boodskappers van Johannes weggegaan het, begin Hy vir die skare aangaande Johannes te sê: Wat het julle uitgegaan in die woestyn om te aanskou? ’n Riet wat deur die wind beweeg word?

column2: Luke 7:25 But what went ye out for to see? A man clothed in soft raiment? Behold, they which are gorgeously apparelled, and live delicately, are in kings' courts.
column3: Lukas 7:25 Maar wat het julle uitgegaan om te sien? ’n Man met sagte klere aan? Kyk, die wat pragtige klere dra en in weelde lewe, is in die paleise.

column2: Luke 7:26 But what went ye out for to see? A prophet? Yea, I say unto you, and much more than a prophet.
column3: Lukas 7:26 Maar wat het julle uitgegaan om te sien? ’n Profeet? Ja, Ek sê vir julle, nog baie meer as ’n profeet!

column2: Luke 7:27 This is [he], of whom it is written, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, which shall prepare thy way before thee.
column3: Lukas 7:27 Dit is hy van wie daar geskrywe is: Kyk, Ek stuur my boodskapper voor u aangesig, wat u weg voor U uit sal regmaak.

column2: Luke 7:28 For I say unto you, Among those that are born of women there is not a greater prophet than John the Baptist: but he that is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he.
column3: Lukas 7:28 Want Ek sê vir julle, onder die wat uit vroue gebore is, is daar geen profeet groter as Johannes die Doper nie; maar die kleinste in die koninkryk van God is groter as hy.

column2: Luke 7:29 And all the people that heard [him], and the publicans, justified God, being baptized with the baptism of John.
column3: Lukas 7:29 En toe die hele volk en die tollenaars dit hoor, het hulle God geregverdig deur hulle te laat doop met die doop van Johannes.

column2: Luke 7:30 But the Pharisees and lawyers rejected the counsel of God against themselves, being not baptized of him.
column3: Lukas 7:30 Maar die Fariseërs en die wetgeleerdes het die raad van God aangaande hulle verwerp deur hulle nie deur hom te laat doop nie.

column2: Luke 7:31 And the Lord said, Whereunto then shall I liken the men of this generation? and to what are they like?
column3: Lukas 7:31 Toe sê die Here: Waarmee sal Ek dan die mense van hierdie geslag vergelyk, en waaraan is hulle gelyk?

column2: Luke 7:32 They are like unto children sitting in the marketplace, and calling one to another, and saying, We have piped unto you, and ye have not danced; we have mourned to you, and ye have not wept.
column3: Lukas 7:32 Hulle is net soos kinders wat op die mark sit en na mekaar roep en sê: Ons het vir julle op die fluit gespeel, en julle het nie gedans nie; ons het vir julle ’n klaaglied gesing, en julle het nie gehuil nie.

column2: Luke 7:33 For John the Baptist came neither eating bread nor drinking wine; and ye say, He hath a devil.
column3: Lukas 7:33 Want Johannes die Doper het gekom en het nie brood geëet of wyn gedrink nie, en julle sê: Hy het ’n duiwel.

column2: Luke 7:34 The Son of man is come eating and drinking; and ye say, Behold a gluttonous man, and a winebibber, a friend of publicans and sinners!
column3: Lukas 7:34 Die Seun van die mens het gekom en Hy eet en drink, en julle sê: Daar is ’n mens wat ’n vraat en ’n wynsuiper is, ’n vriend van tollenaars en sondaars.

column2: Luke 7:35 But wisdom is justified of all her children.
column3: Lukas 7:35 Maar die wysheid is geregverdig deur al sy kinders.

column2: Luke 7:36 And one of the Pharisees desired him that he would eat with him. And he went into the Pharisee's house, and sat down to meat.
column3: Lukas 7:36 EN een van die Fariseërs het Hom genooi om by hom te eet; en Hy het in die huis van die Fariseër gekom en aan tafel gegaan.

column2: Luke 7:37 And, behold, a woman in the city, which was a sinner, when she knew that [Jesus] sat at meat in the Pharisee's house, brought an alabaster box of ointment,
column3: Lukas 7:37 En toe ’n vrou in die stad, wat ’n sondares was, verneem dat Hy in die Fariseër se huis aan tafel was, het sy ’n albaste fles met salf gebring

column2: Luke 7:38 And stood at his feet behind [him] weeping, and began to wash his feet with tears, and did wipe [them] with the hairs of her head, and kissed his feet, and anointed [them] with the ointment.
column3: Lukas 7:38 en agter by sy voete gaan staan en geween; en sy het sy voete begin natmaak met haar trane en hulle afgedroog met die hare van haar hoof; en sy het sy voete gesoen en met salf gesalf.

column2: Luke 7:39 Now when the Pharisee which had bidden him saw [it], he spake within himself, saying, This man, if he were a prophet, would have known who and what manner of woman [this is] that toucheth him: for she is a sinner.
column3: Lukas 7:39 Toe die Fariseër wat Hom genooi het, dit sien, sê hy by homself: Hy, as Hy ’n profeet was, sou geweet het wie en watter soort vrou dit is wat Hom aanraak; want sy is ’n sondares.

column2: Luke 7:40 And Jesus answering said unto him, Simon, I have somewhat to say unto thee. And he saith, Master, say on.
column3: Lukas 7:40 En Jesus antwoord en sê vir hom: Simon, Ek het iets om aan jou te sê. En hy antwoord: Meester, spreek.

column2: Luke 7:41 There was a certain creditor which had two debtors: the one owed five hundred pence, and the other fifty.
column3: Lukas 7:41 Hy sê toe: ’n Sekere geldskieter het twee skuldenaars gehad; die een het vyfhonderd pennings geskuld en die ander een vyftig;

column2: Luke 7:42 And when they had nothing to pay, he frankly forgave them both. Tell me therefore, which of them will love him most?
column3: Lukas 7:42 en omdat hulle niks gehad het om te betaal nie, het hy dit aan altwee geskenk. Sê nou, wie van hulle sal hom die meeste liefhê?

column2: Luke 7:43 Simon answered and said, I suppose that [he], to whom he forgave most. And he said unto him, Thou hast rightly judged.
column3: Lukas 7:43 En Simon antwoord en sê: Ek veronderstel dié een aan wie hy die meeste geskenk het. En Hy antwoord hom: Jy het reg geoordeel.

column2: Luke 7:44 And he turned to the woman, and said unto Simon, Seest thou this woman? I entered into thine house, thou gavest me no water for my feet: but she hath washed my feet with tears, and wiped [them] with the hairs of her head.
column3: Lukas 7:44 Daarop draai Hy om na die vrou en sê vir Simon: Sien jy hierdie vrou? Ek het in jou huis gekom — water het jy nie vir my voete gegee nie; maar sy het met haar trane my voete natgemaak en met die hare van haar hoof afgedroog.

column2: Luke 7:45 Thou gavest me no kiss: but this woman since the time I came in hath not ceased to kiss my feet.
column3: Lukas 7:45 ’n Soen het jy My nie gegee nie; maar sy het, vandat sy ingekom het, nie opgehou om my voete te soen nie.

column2: Luke 7:46 My head with oil thou didst not anoint: but this woman hath anointed my feet with ointment.
column3: Lukas 7:46 Met olie het jy my hoof nie gesalf nie; maar sy het my voete met salf gesalf.

column2: Luke 7:47 Wherefore I say unto thee, Her sins, which are many, are forgiven; for she loved much: but to whom little is forgiven, [the same] loveth little.
column3: Lukas 7:47 Daarom sê Ek vir jou: Haar sondes wat baie is, is vergewe, want sy het baie liefgehad; maar hy vir wie weinig vergewe is, het weinig lief.

column2: Luke 7:48 And he said unto her, Thy sins are forgiven.
column3: Lukas 7:48 En Hy sê vir haar: Jou sondes is vergewe.

column2: Luke 7:49 And they that sat at meat with him began to say within themselves, Who is this that forgiveth sins also?
column3: Lukas 7:49 Toe begin die wat aan tafel was, by hulleself te sê: Wie is hierdie man wat selfs die sondes vergewe?

column2: Luke 7:50 And he said to the woman, Thy faith hath saved thee; go in peace.
column3: Lukas 7:50 En Hy sê vir die vrou: Jou geloof het jou gered; gaan in vrede.

column2: Luke 8:1 And it came to pass afterward, that he went throughout every city and village, preaching and shewing the glad tidings of the kingdom of God: and the twelve [were] with him,
column3: Lukas 8:1 EN daarna het Hy die een stad en dorp ná die ander deurgereis en gepreek en die evangelie van die koninkryk van God verkondig; en die twaalf was saam met Hom,

column2: Luke 8:2 And certain women, which had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities, Mary called Magdalene, out of whom went seven devils,
column3: Lukas 8:2 ook sekere vroue wat genees was van bose geeste en siektes: Maria wat Magdaléna genoem word, uit wie sewe duiwels uitgegaan het,

column2: Luke 8:3 And Joanna the wife of Chuza Herod's steward, and Susanna, and many others, which ministered unto him of their substance.
column3: Lukas 8:3 en Johanna, die vrou van Gusa, ’n bestuurder van Herodes, en Susanna en baie ander wat Hom almal met hulle besittings gedien het.

column2: Luke 8:4 And when much people were gathered together, and were come to him out of every city, he spake by a parable:
column3: Lukas 8:4 EN toe daar ’n groot menigte vergader, en die wat uit die verskillende stede by Hom aangesluit het, sê Hy aan hulle deur ’n gelykenis:

column2: Luke 8:5 A sower went out to sow his seed: and as he sowed, some fell by the way side; and it was trodden down, and the fowls of the air devoured it.
column3: Lukas 8:5 ’n Saaier het uitgegaan om sy saad te saai; en toe hy saai, val ’n deel langs die pad en is vertrap, en die voëls van die hemel het dit opgeëet.

column2: Luke 8:6 And some fell upon a rock; and as soon as it was sprung up, it withered away, because it lacked moisture.
column3: Lukas 8:6 En ’n ander deel het op die rots geval; en nadat dit opgeskiet het, het dit verdroog, omdat dit geen vogtigheid gehad het nie.

column2: Luke 8:7 And some fell among thorns; and the thorns sprang up with it, and choked it.
column3: Lukas 8:7 En ’n ander deel het tussen die dorings in geval; en die dorings het daarmee saamgegroei en dit verstik.

column2: Luke 8:8 And other fell on good ground, and sprang up, and bare fruit an hundredfold. And when he had said these things, he cried, He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
column3: Lukas 8:8 En ’n ander deel het in die goeie grond geval en gegroei en honderdvoudige vrug opgelewer. Toe Hy dit gesê het, roep Hy uit: Wie ore het om te hoor, laat hom hoor!

column2: Luke 8:9 And his disciples asked him, saying, What might this parable be?
column3: Lukas 8:9 En sy dissipels het Hom gevra en gesê: Wat beteken hierdie gelykenis tog?

column2: Luke 8:10 And he said, Unto you it is given to know the mysteries of the kingdom of God: but to others in parables; that seeing they might not see, and hearing they might not understand.
column3: Lukas 8:10 En Hy antwoord: Aan julle is dit gegee om die verborgenhede van die koninkryk van God te ken; maar aan die ander deur gelykenisse, sodat hulle, terwyl hulle sien, nie sien nie, en terwyl hulle hoor, nie verstaan nie.

column2: Luke 8:11 Now the parable is this: The seed is the word of God.
column3: Lukas 8:11 Dit is dan die gelykenis: Die saad is die woord van God.

column2: Luke 8:12 Those by the way side are they that hear; then cometh the devil, and taketh away the word out of their hearts, lest they should believe and be saved.
column3: Lukas 8:12 Dié langs die pad is die hoorders. Daarna kom die duiwel en neem die woord uit hul harte weg, sodat hulle nie sou glo en gered word nie.

column2: Luke 8:13 They on the rock [are they], which, when they hear, receive the word with joy; and these have no root, which for a while believe, and in time of temptation fall away.
column3: Lukas 8:13 En dié op die rots is hulle wat die woord met blydskap ontvang wanneer hulle dit hoor; en hulle het geen wortel nie, aangesien hulle net vir ’n tyd glo, en in die tyd van versoeking val hulle af.

column2: Luke 8:14 And that which fell among thorns are they, which, when they have heard, go forth, and are choked with cares and riches and pleasures of [this] life, and bring no fruit to perfection.
column3: Lukas 8:14 En wat in die dorings geval het — dit is die wat gehoor het, en hulle gaan weg en word verstik deur die sorge en rykdom en genietinge van die lewe en dra geen ryp vrug nie.

column2: Luke 8:15 But that on the good ground are they, which in an honest and good heart, having heard the word, keep [it], and bring forth fruit with patience.
column3: Lukas 8:15 En wat in die goeie grond val — dit is die wat, nadat hulle gehoor het, die woord in ’n edele en goeie hart hou en met volharding vrug dra.

column2: Luke 8:16 No man, when he hath lighted a candle, covereth it with a vessel, or putteth [it] under a bed; but setteth [it] on a candlestick, that they which enter in may see the light.
column3: Lukas 8:16 EN niemand steek ’n lamp op en maak dit met iets toe of sit dit onder ’n bed nie; maar hy sit dit op ’n staander, sodat die wat inkom, die lig kan sien.

column2: Luke 8:17 For nothing is secret, that shall not be made manifest; neither [any thing] hid, that shall not be known and come abroad.
column3: Lukas 8:17 Want daar is niks verborge wat nie openbaar sal word nie, of weggesteek wat nie bekend sal word en in die lig sal kom nie.

column2: Luke 8:18 Take heed therefore how ye hear: for whosoever hath, to him shall be given; and whosoever hath not, from him shall be taken even that which he seemeth to have.
column3: Lukas 8:18 Pas dan op hoe julle hoor; want elkeen wat het, aan hom sal gegee word; en elkeen wat nie het nie, van hom sal weggeneem word ook wat hy dink dat hy het.

column2: Luke 8:19 Then came to him [his] mother and his brethren, and could not come at him for the press.
column3: Lukas 8:19 EN sy moeder en broers het na Hom gekom, en weens die skare kon hulle Hom nie bereik nie.

column2: Luke 8:20 And it was told him [by certain] which said, Thy mother and thy brethren stand without, desiring to see thee.
column3: Lukas 8:20 Toe bring hulle Hom die boodskap en sê: U moeder en u broers staan buite en wil U sien.

column2: Luke 8:21 And he answered and said unto them, My mother and my brethren are these which hear the word of God, and do it.
column3: Lukas 8:21 Maar Hy antwoord en sê vir hulle: My moeder en my broers is die wat die woord van God hoor en dit doen.

column2: Luke 8:22 Now it came to pass on a certain day, that he went into a ship with his disciples: and he said unto them, Let us go over unto the other side of the lake. And they launched forth.
column3: Lukas 8:22 EN op een van daardie dae het Hy en sy dissipels in ’n skuit gegaan; en Hy het vir hulle gesê: Laat ons oorvaar na die oorkant van die see. En hulle het weggevaar

column2: Luke 8:23 But as they sailed he fell asleep: and there came down a storm of wind on the lake; and they were filled [with water], and were in jeopardy.
column3: Lukas 8:23 En terwyl hulle seil, raak Hy aan die slaap. Toe kom daar ’n stormwind op die see af en die skuit het begin vol word, en hulle was in gevaar.

column2: Luke 8:24 And they came to him, and awoke him, saying, Master, master, we perish. Then he arose, and rebuked the wind and the raging of the water: and they ceased, and there was a calm.
column3: Lukas 8:24 En hulle het na Hom gegaan en Hom wakker gemaak en gesê: Meester, Meester, ons vergaan! Hy staan toe op en bestraf die wind en die watergolwe, en hulle het bedaar en daar het ’n stilte gekom.

column2: Luke 8:25 And he said unto them, Where is your faith? And they being afraid wondered, saying one to another, What manner of man is this! for he commandeth even the winds and water, and they obey him.
column3: Lukas 8:25 En Hy sê vir hulle: Waar is julle geloof? Maar hulle was bang en verwonderd en het vir mekaar gesê: Wie is Hy tog, dat Hy selfs die winde en die water gebied en hulle Hom gehoorsaam is!

column2: Luke 8:26 And they arrived at the country of the Gadarenes, which is over against Galilee.
column3: Lukas 8:26 EN hulle het geseil na die land van die Gadaréners, wat reg anderkant Galiléa is.

column2: Luke 8:27 And when he went forth to land, there met him out of the city a certain man, which had devils long time, and ware no clothes, neither abode in [any] house, but in the tombs.
column3: Lukas 8:27 En toe Hy aan wal uitklim, kom ’n sekere man uit die stad Hom tegemoet, wat vir ’n geruime tyd van duiwels besete was en geen klere gedra het nie; hy het ook nie in ’n huis gewoon nie, maar in die grafte.

column2: Luke 8:28 When he saw Jesus, he cried out, and fell down before him, and with a loud voice said, What have I to do with thee, Jesus, [thou] Son of God most high? I beseech thee, torment me not.
column3: Lukas 8:28 En toe hy Jesus sien, skreeu hy uit en val voor Hom neer en sê met ’n groot stem: Wat het ons met U te doen, Jesus, Seun van die allerhoogste God? Ek bid U, moet my nie pynig nie —

column2: Luke 8:29 (For he had commanded the unclean spirit to come out of the man. For oftentimes it had caught him: and he was kept bound with chains and in fetters; and he brake the bands, and was driven of the devil into the wilderness.)
column3: Lukas 8:29 want Hy het aan die onreine gees bevel gegee om uit die man uit te gaan. Want baiekeer het hy hom saamgesleep; en hulle het hom gebind met kettings en voetboeie om oor hom wag te hou; maar hy het die boeie uitmekaar geruk, en die duiwel het hom in die woestyne gedrywe.

column2: Luke 8:30 And Jesus asked him, saying, What is thy name? And he said, Legion: because many devils were entered into him.
column3: Lukas 8:30 Daarop vra Jesus hom en sê: Wat is jou naam? En hy antwoord: Legio — want baie duiwels het in hom ingevaar.

column2: Luke 8:31 And they besought him that he would not command them to go out into the deep.
column3: Lukas 8:31 En hulle het Hom gesmeek dat Hy hulle nie sou beveel om in die onderwêreld af te vaar nie.

column2: Luke 8:32 And there was there an herd of many swine feeding on the mountain: and they besought him that he would suffer them to enter into them. And he suffered them.
column3: Lukas 8:32 En daar het ’n groot trop varke op die berg gewei. Toe smeek hulle Hom dat Hy hulle sou toelaat om in dié varke in te vaar. En Hy het hulle toegelaat.

column2: Luke 8:33 Then went the devils out of the man, and entered into the swine: and the herd ran violently down a steep place into the lake, and were choked.
column3: Lukas 8:33 Daarop gaan die duiwels uit die man uit en vaar in die varke in, en die trop het van die krans af in die see gestorm en verdrink.

column2: Luke 8:34 When they that fed [them] saw what was done, they fled, and went and told [it] in the city and in the country.
column3: Lukas 8:34 En toe die wagters sien wat gebeur het, het hulle gevlug en dit in die stad en in die buitewyke gaan vertel.

column2: Luke 8:35 Then they went out to see what was done; and came to Jesus, and found the man, out of whom the devils were departed, sitting at the feet of Jesus, clothed, and in his right mind: and they were afraid.
column3: Lukas 8:35 Daarop het hulle uitgegaan om te sien wat gebeur het; en hulle het by Jesus gekom en die man gevind uit wie die duiwels uitgevaar het, terwyl hy aan die voete van Jesus sit, gekleed en by sy verstand. En hulle het gevrees.

column2: Luke 8:36 They also which saw [it] told them by what means he that was possessed of the devils was healed.
column3: Lukas 8:36 En die wat ooggetuies was, het ook aan hulle vertel hoe die besetene genees is.

column2: Luke 8:37 Then the whole multitude of the country of the Gadarenes round about besought him to depart from them; for they were taken with great fear: and he went up into the ship, and returned back again.
column3: Lukas 8:37 En die hele menigte van die omtrek van die Gadaréners het Hom gevra om van hulle weg te gaan, omdat hulle deur ’n groot vrees bevang was. Toe het Hy in die skuit geklim en teruggegaan.

column2: Luke 8:38 Now the man out of whom the devils were departed besought him that he might be with him: but Jesus sent him away, saying,
column3: Lukas 8:38 En die man uit wie die duiwels uitgevaar het, het Hom gebid om by Hom te kan bly. Maar Jesus het hom laat gaan en gesê:

column2: Luke 8:39 Return to thine own house, and shew how great things God hath done unto thee. And he went his way, and published throughout the whole city how great things Jesus had done unto him.
column3: Lukas 8:39 Gaan terug na jou huis en vertel watter groot dinge God aan jou gedoen het. En hy het gegaan en deur die hele stad verkondig watter groot dinge Jesus aan hom gedoen het.

column2: Luke 8:40 And it came to pass, that, when Jesus was returned, the people [gladly] received him: for they were all waiting for him.
column3: Lukas 8:40 EN toe Jesus terugkom, het die skare Hom verwelkom; want almal was Hom te wagte.

column2: Luke 8:41 And, behold, there came a man named Jairus, and he was a ruler of the synagogue: and he fell down at Jesus' feet, and besought him that he would come into his house:
column3: Lukas 8:41 En daar kom ’n man wie se naam Jaïrus was, en hy was ’n owerste van die sinagoge; en hy val voor die voete van Jesus neer en smeek Hom om na sy huis te kom;

column2: Luke 8:42 For he had one only daughter, about twelve years of age, and she lay a dying. But as he went the people thronged him.
column3: Lukas 8:42 want sy enigste dogter van omtrent twaalf jaar het op sterwe gelê. En terwyl Hy gaan, het die skare Hom verdring.

column2: Luke 8:43 And a woman having an issue of blood twelve years, which had spent all her living upon physicians, neither could be healed of any,
column3: Lukas 8:43 En ’n vrou wat twaalf jaar lank aan bloedvloeiing gely het, en wat haar hele vermoë aan geneeshere uitgegee het en deur niemand gesond gemaak kon word nie,

column2: Luke 8:44 Came behind [him], and touched the border of his garment: and immediately her issue of blood stanched.
column3: Lukas 8:44 het van agter af gekom en die soom van sy kleed aangeraak, en haar bloedvloeiing het onmiddellik opgehou.

column2: Luke 8:45 And Jesus said, Who touched me? When all denied, Peter and they that were with him said, Master, the multitude throng thee and press [thee], and sayest thou, Who touched me?
column3: Lukas 8:45 Daarop sê Jesus: Wie is dit wat My aangeraak het? En toe almal dit ontken, sê Petrus en die wat by hom was: Meester, die skare druk en verdring U, en U sê: Wie is dit wat My aangeraak het?

column2: Luke 8:46 And Jesus said, Somebody hath touched me: for I perceive that virtue is gone out of me.
column3: Lukas 8:46 Maar Jesus antwoord: Iemand het My aangeraak, want Ek het gemerk dat krag van My uitgegaan het.

column2: Luke 8:47 And when the woman saw that she was not hid, she came trembling, and falling down before him, she declared unto him before all the people for what cause she had touched him, and how she was healed immediately.
column3: Lukas 8:47 En toe die vrou sien dat sy nie verborge gebly het nie, kom sy bewende en val voor Hom neer en vertel Hom voor die hele volk om watter rede sy Hom aangeraak het en hoe sy onmiddellik gesond geword het.

column2: Luke 8:48 And he said unto her, Daughter, be of good comfort: thy faith hath made thee whole; go in peace.
column3: Lukas 8:48 En Hy sê vir haar: Hou goeie moed, dogter, jou geloof het jou gered. Gaan in vrede.

column2: Luke 8:49 While he yet spake, there cometh one from the ruler of the synagogue's [house], saying to him, Thy daughter is dead; trouble not the Master.
column3: Lukas 8:49 Terwyl Hy nog spreek, kom daar iemand van die owerste van die sinagoge se huis en sê vir hom: U dogter is dood, moenie die Meester lastig val nie.

column2: Luke 8:50 But when Jesus heard [it], he answered him, saying, Fear not: believe only, and she shall be made whole.
column3: Lukas 8:50 Maar toe Jesus dit hoor, antwoord Hy hom en sê: Moenie vrees nie. Glo net, en sy sal gered word.

column2: Luke 8:51 And when he came into the house, he suffered no man to go in, save Peter, and James, and John, and the father and the mother of the maiden.
column3: Lukas 8:51 En toe Hy in die huis kom, het Hy niemand toegelaat om in te gaan nie, behalwe Petrus en Jakobus en Johannes en die vader en die moeder van die meisie.

column2: Luke 8:52 And all wept, and bewailed her: but he said, Weep not; she is not dead, but sleepeth.
column3: Lukas 8:52 En almal het gehuil en oor haar rou bedryf. Maar Hy sê: Moenie huil nie; sy is nie dood nie, maar slaap.

column2: Luke 8:53 And they laughed him to scorn, knowing that she was dead.
column3: Lukas 8:53 En hulle het Hom uitgelag, want hulle het geweet dat sy dood was.

column2: Luke 8:54 And he put them all out, and took her by the hand, and called, saying, Maid, arise.
column3: Lukas 8:54 En toe Hy almal na buite uitgejaag het, gryp Hy haar hand en roep uit en sê: Dogtertjie, staan op!

column2: Luke 8:55 And her spirit came again, and she arose straightway: and he commanded to give her meat.
column3: Lukas 8:55 En haar gees het teruggekom, en sy het onmiddellik opgestaan; en Hy het beveel dat hulle haar iets te ete moes gee.

column2: Luke 8:56 And her parents were astonished: but he charged them that they should tell no man what was done.
column3: Lukas 8:56 En haar ouers was verbaas, maar Hy het hulle bevel gegee om aan niemand te sê wat gebeur het nie.

column2: Luke 9:1 Then he called his twelve disciples together, and gave them power and authority over all devils, and to cure diseases.
column3: Lukas 9:1 EN Hy het sy twaalf dissipels saamgeroep en aan hulle mag en gesag gegee oor al die duiwels en om siektes te genees.

column2: Luke 9:2 And he sent them to preach the kingdom of God, and to heal the sick.
column3: Lukas 9:2 En Hy het hulle uitgestuur om die koninkryk van God te verkondig en die siekes gesond te maak

column2: Luke 9:3 And he said unto them, Take nothing for [your] journey, neither staves, nor scrip, neither bread, neither money; neither have two coats apiece.
column3: Lukas 9:3 en vir hulle gesê: Neem niks vir die pad nie, geen stokke of reissak of brood of geld nie, en geeneen van julle moet twee kledingstukke hê nie.

column2: Luke 9:4 And whatsoever house ye enter into, there abide, and thence depart.
column3: Lukas 9:4 En in watter huis julle ook mag ingaan, bly dáár en gaan dáárvandaan verder.

column2: Luke 9:5 And whosoever will not receive you, when ye go out of that city, shake off the very dust from your feet for a testimony against them.
column3: Lukas 9:5 En almal wat julle nie ontvang nie — as julle van daardie stad weggaan, skud selfs die stof van julle voete af, tot ’n getuienis teen hulle.

column2: Luke 9:6 And they departed, and went through the towns, preaching the gospel, and healing every where.
column3: Lukas 9:6 En hulle het uitgegaan en dorp vir dorp deurgegaan en oral die evangelie verkondig en siekes gesond gemaak.

column2: Luke 9:7 Now Herod the tetrarch heard of all that was done by him: and he was perplexed, because that it was said of some, that John was risen from the dead;
column3: Lukas 9:7 HERODES, die viervors, hoor toe van al die dinge wat deur Hom gedoen is; en hy was met die saak verleë, omdat deur sommige gesê is: Johannes is uit die dode opgewek;

column2: Luke 9:8 And of some, that Elias had appeared; and of others, that one of the old prophets was risen again.
column3: Lukas 9:8 en deur ander: Elía het verskyn; en deur ander: Een van die ou profete het opgestaan.

column2: Luke 9:9 And Herod said, John have I beheaded: but who is this, of whom I hear such things? And he desired to see him.
column3: Lukas 9:9 En Herodes het gesê: Johannes het ek onthoof; maar wie is hierdie man van wie ek sulke dinge hoor? En hy het probeer om Hom te sien.

column2: Luke 9:10 And the apostles, when they were returned, told him all that they had done. And he took them, and went aside privately into a desert place belonging to the city called Bethsaida.
column3: Lukas 9:10 EN toe die apostels terugkom en Hom alles vertel wat hulle gedoen het, het Hy hulle saamgeneem en in die eensaamheid gegaan na ’n verlate plek van ’n stad met die naam van Betsáida.

column2: Luke 9:11 And the people, when they knew [it], followed him: and he received them, and spake unto them of the kingdom of God, and healed them that had need of healing.
column3: Lukas 9:11 Maar die skare het dit te wete gekom en Hom gevolg; en Hy het hulle ontvang en met hulle gespreek oor die koninkryk van God, en die wat genesing nodig gehad het, gesond gemaak.

column2: Luke 9:12 And when the day began to wear away, then came the twelve, and said unto him, Send the multitude away, that they may go into the towns and country round about, and lodge, and get victuals: for we are here in a desert place.
column3: Lukas 9:12 Toe die dag begin daal, kom die twaalf na Hom en sê vir Hom: Stuur die skare weg, sodat hulle na die dorpe en buitewyke in die omtrek kan gaan en herberg en voedsel kry; want ons is hier in ’n verlate plek.

column2: Luke 9:13 But he said unto them, Give ye them to eat. And they said, We have no more but five loaves and two fishes; except we should go and buy meat for all this people.
column3: Lukas 9:13 Maar Hy sê vir hulle: Gee julle vir hulle iets om te eet. Maar hulle antwoord: Ons het nie meer as vyf brode en twee visse nie, tensy ons voedsel gaan koop vir al hierdie mense.

column2: Luke 9:14 For they were about five thousand men. And he said to his disciples, Make them sit down by fifties in a company.
column3: Lukas 9:14 Want daar was omtrent vyfduisend manne. Maar Hy sê vir sy dissipels: Laat hulle in groepe van vyftig sit.

column2: Luke 9:15 And they did so, and made them all sit down.
column3: Lukas 9:15 En hulle het dit gedoen en almal laat sit.

column2: Luke 9:16 Then he took the five loaves and the two fishes, and looking up to heaven, he blessed them, and brake, and gave to the disciples to set before the multitude.
column3: Lukas 9:16 Toe neem Hy die vyf brode en die twee visse, en nadat Hy opgekyk het na die hemel, seën Hy dit en breek dit en gee dit aan die dissipels om dit aan die skare voor te sit.

column2: Luke 9:17 And they did eat, and were all filled: and there was taken up of fragments that remained to them twelve baskets.
column3: Lukas 9:17 En hulle het geëet en is almal versadig, en van wat vir hulle van die brokstukke oorgebly het, is daar twaalf mandjies vol opgetel.

column2: Luke 9:18 And it came to pass, as he was alone praying, his disciples were with him: and he asked them, saying, Whom say the people that I am?
column3: Lukas 9:18 EN toe Hy besig was om alleen te bid, was die dissipels by Hom, en Hy vra hulle en sê: Wie sê die skare is Ek?

column2: Luke 9:19 They answering said, John the Baptist; but some [say], Elias; and others [say], that one of the old prophets is risen again.
column3: Lukas 9:19 En hulle antwoord en sê: Johannes die Doper, en ander: Elía, en ander dat een van die ou profete opgestaan het.

column2: Luke 9:20 He said unto them, But whom say ye that I am? Peter answering said, The Christ of God.
column3: Lukas 9:20 En Hy sê vir hulle: Maar julle, wie sê julle is Ek? En Petrus antwoord en sê: Die Christus van God!

column2: Luke 9:21 And he straitly charged them, and commanded [them] to tell no man that thing;
column3: Lukas 9:21 Toe gee Hy hulle ’n streng bevel en gebied hulle om dit aan niemand te vertel nie.

column2: Luke 9:22 Saying, The Son of man must suffer many things, and be rejected of the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be slain, and be raised the third day.
column3: Lukas 9:22 En Hy sê: Die Seun van die mens moet baie ly en verwerp word deur die ouderlinge en owerpriesters en skrifgeleerdes en gedood word en op die derde dag opstaan.

column2: Luke 9:23 And he said to [them] all, If any [man] will come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross daily, and follow me.
column3: Lukas 9:23 EN Hy sê vir almal: As iemand agter My aan wil kom, moet hy homself verloën en sy kruis elke dag opneem en My volg.

column2: Luke 9:24 For whosoever will save his life shall lose it: but whosoever will lose his life for my sake, the same shall save it.
column3: Lukas 9:24 Want elkeen wat sy lewe wil red, sal dit verloor; maar elkeen wat sy lewe om My ontwil verloor, hy sal dit red.

column2: Luke 9:25 For what is a man advantaged, if he gain the whole world, and lose himself, or be cast away?
column3: Lukas 9:25 Wat baat dit ’n mens tog as hy die hele wêreld win, maar homself verloor of skade aandoen?

column2: Luke 9:26 For whosoever shall be ashamed of me and of my words, of him shall the Son of man be ashamed, when he shall come in his own glory, and [in his] Father's, and of the holy angels.
column3: Lukas 9:26 Want elkeen wat hom skaam vir My en my woorde, vir hom sal die Seun van die mens Hom skaam wanneer Hy kom in sy heerlikheid en dié van die Vader en van die heilige engele.

column2: Luke 9:27 But I tell you of a truth, there be some standing here, which shall not taste of death, till they see the kingdom of God.
column3: Lukas 9:27 Ek sê vir julle met waarheid: Daar is sommige van die wat hier staan, wat die dood sekerlik nie sal smaak voordat hulle die koninkryk van God gesien het nie.

column2: Luke 9:28 And it came to pass about an eight days after these sayings, he took Peter and John and James, and went up into a mountain to pray.
column3: Lukas 9:28 EN omtrent agt dae ná hierdie woorde het Hy Petrus en Johannes en Jakobus saamgeneem en op die berg geklim om te bid.

column2: Luke 9:29 And as he prayed, the fashion of his countenance was altered, and his raiment [was] white [and] glistering.
column3: Lukas 9:29 En terwyl Hy bid, het die voorkoms van sy aangesig anders geword en sy klere skitterend wit.

column2: Luke 9:30 And, behold, there talked with him two men, which were Moses and Elias:
column3: Lukas 9:30 En daar was twee manne in gesprek met Hom; dit was Moses en Elía.

column2: Luke 9:31 Who appeared in glory, and spake of his decease which he should accomplish at Jerusalem.
column3: Lukas 9:31 Hulle het in heerlikheid verskyn en van sy uitgang gespreek wat Hy in Jerusalem sou volbring.

column2: Luke 9:32 But Peter and they that were with him were heavy with sleep: and when they were awake, they saw his glory, and the two men that stood with him.
column3: Lukas 9:32 En Petrus en die wat saam met hom was, was deur die slaap oorweldig. Maar toe hulle wakker word, sien hulle sy heerlikheid en die twee manne wat by Hom staan.

column2: Luke 9:33 And it came to pass, as they departed from him, Peter said unto Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here: and let us make three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias: not knowing what he said.
column3: Lukas 9:33 En toe hulle van Hom weggaan, sê Petrus vir Jesus: Meester, dit is goed dat ons hier is; laat ons dan drie hutte maak, een vir U en vir Moses een en een vir Elía — hy het nie geweet wat hy sê nie.

column2: Luke 9:34 While he thus spake, there came a cloud, and overshadowed them: and they feared as they entered into the cloud.
column3: Lukas 9:34 Maar toe hy dit sê, kom daar ’n wolk en oordek hulle, en hulle het bang geword toe daardie manne in die wolk ingaan.

column2: Luke 9:35 And there came a voice out of the cloud, saying, This is my beloved Son: hear him.
column3: Lukas 9:35 En daar kom ’n stem uit die wolk wat sê: Dit is my geliefde Seun; luister na Hom!

column2: Luke 9:36 And when the voice was past, Jesus was found alone. And they kept [it] close, and told no man in those days any of those things which they had seen.
column3: Lukas 9:36 En nadat die stem gekom het, was Jesus daar alleen. En hulle het geswyg en aan niemand in daardie dae iets vertel van wat hulle gesien het nie.

column2: Luke 9:37 And it came to pass, that on the next day, when they were come down from the hill, much people met him.
column3: Lukas 9:37 EN op die volgende dag toe hulle van die berg afklim, kom ’n groot skare Hom tegemoet.

column2: Luke 9:38 And, behold, a man of the company cried out, saying, Master, I beseech thee, look upon my son: for he is mine only child.
column3: Lukas 9:38 En daar roep ’n man uit die skare en sê: Meester, ek bid U, kyk tog na my seun, want hy is my enigste.

column2: Luke 9:39 And, lo, a spirit taketh him, and he suddenly crieth out; and it teareth him that he foameth again, and bruising him hardly departeth from him.
column3: Lukas 9:39 En kyk, ’n gees gryp hom, en meteens skreeu hy, en hy laat hom stuiptrekkings kry met skuim in die mond en gaan amper nie van hom weg nie en verniel hom.

column2: Luke 9:40 And I besought thy disciples to cast him out; and they could not.
column3: Lukas 9:40 En ek het u dissipels gebid om hom uit te drywe, en hulle kon nie.

column2: Luke 9:41 And Jesus answering said, O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you, and suffer you? Bring thy son hither.
column3: Lukas 9:41 Toe antwoord Jesus en sê: O Ongelowige en verdraaide geslag, hoe lank sal Ek by julle wees en julle verdra? Bring jou seun hier.

column2: Luke 9:42 And as he was yet a coming, the devil threw him down, and tare [him]. And Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, and healed the child, and delivered him again to his father.
column3: Lukas 9:42 En toe hy nog aankom, skeur die duiwel hom en laat hom stuiptrekkings kry. Maar Jesus het die onreine gees bestraf en die seun genees en hom aan sy vader teruggegee.

column2: Luke 9:43 And they were all amazed at the mighty power of God. But while they wondered every one at all things which Jesus did, he said unto his disciples,
column3: Lukas 9:43 En almal was verslae oor die majesteit van God. En toe almal verwonderd was oor alles wat Jesus gedoen het, sê Hy vir sy dissipels:

column2: Luke 9:44 Let these sayings sink down into your ears: for the Son of man shall be delivered into the hands of men.
column3: Lukas 9:44 Bewaar hierdie woorde in julle ore; want die Seun van die mens sal oorgelewer word in die hande van die mense.

column2: Luke 9:45 But they understood not this saying, and it was hid from them, that they perceived it not: and they feared to ask him of that saying.
column3: Lukas 9:45 Maar hulle het hierdie woord nie verstaan nie, en dit was vir hulle bedek, sodat hulle dit nie sou begryp nie; en hulle was bang om Hom iets te vra oor hierdie woord.

column2: Luke 9:46 Then there arose a reasoning among them, which of them should be greatest.
column3: Lukas 9:46 EN daar het ’n redenering onder hulle ontstaan oor wie van hulle dan tog die grootste was.

column2: Luke 9:47 And Jesus, perceiving the thought of their heart, took a child, and set him by him,
column3: Lukas 9:47 En toe Jesus die redenering van hulle hart opmerk, neem Hy ’n kindjie en laat dié by Hom staan

column2: Luke 9:48 And said unto them, Whosoever shall receive this child in my name receiveth me: and whosoever shall receive me receiveth him that sent me: for he that is least among you all, the same shall be great.
column3: Lukas 9:48 en sê vir hulle: Elkeen wat hierdie kindjie ontvang in my Naam, ontvang My; en elkeen wat My ontvang, ontvang Hom wat My gestuur het; want wie die kleinste onder julle almal is, hy sal groot wees.

column2: Luke 9:49 And John answered and said, Master, we saw one casting out devils in thy name; and we forbad him, because he followeth not with us.
column3: Lukas 9:49 EN Johannes het geantwoord en gesê: Meester, ons het iemand gesien wat in u Naam die duiwels uitdryf; en ons het hom belet, omdat hy U nie saam met ons volg nie.

column2: Luke 9:50 And Jesus said unto him, Forbid [him] not: for he that is not against us is for us.
column3: Lukas 9:50 Maar Jesus sê vir hom: Moet hom nie belet nie, want wie nie teen ons is nie, is vír ons.

column2: Luke 9:51 And it came to pass, when the time was come that he should be received up, he stedfastly set his face to go to Jerusalem,
column3: Lukas 9:51 EN toe die dae van sy opneming nader kom, het Hy sy aangesig gerig om na Jerusalem te reis,

column2: Luke 9:52 And sent messengers before his face: and they went, and entered into a village of the Samaritans, to make ready for him.
column3: Lukas 9:52 en boodskappers voor Hom uit gestuur; en hulle het vertrek en in ’n dorp van die Samaritane gekom om vir Hom klarigheid te maak.

column2: Luke 9:53 And they did not receive him, because his face was as though he would go to Jerusalem.
column3: Lukas 9:53 En hulle het Hom nie ontvang nie, omdat Hy na Jerusalem op reis was.

column2: Luke 9:54 And when his disciples James and John saw [this], they said, Lord, wilt thou that we command fire to come down from heaven, and consume them, even as Elias did?
column3: Lukas 9:54 En toe sy dissipels, Jakobus en Johannes, dit sien, sê hulle: Here, wil U hê ons moet sê dat vuur van die hemel afdaal en hulle verteer, soos Elía ook gedoen het?

column2: Luke 9:55 But he turned, and rebuked them, and said, Ye know not what manner of spirit ye are of.
column3: Lukas 9:55 Maar Hy draai Hom om en bestraf hulle en sê: Julle weet nie van hoedanige gees julle is nie;

column2: Luke 9:56 For the Son of man is not come to destroy men's lives, but to save [them]. And they went to another village.
column3: Lukas 9:56 want die Seun van die mens het nie gekom om die mense se lewe te verderf nie, maar te red. En hulle het na ’n ander dorp vertrek.

column2: Luke 9:57 And it came to pass, that, as they went in the way, a certain [man] said unto him, Lord, I will follow thee whithersoever thou goest.
column3: Lukas 9:57 EN terwyl hulle op reis was, sê iemand op die pad vir Hom: Here, ek sal U volg, waar U ook mag gaan!

column2: Luke 9:58 And Jesus said unto him, Foxes have holes, and birds of the air [have] nests; but the Son of man hath not where to lay [his] head.
column3: Lukas 9:58 Toe sê Jesus vir hom: Die jakkalse het gate en die voëls van die hemel neste, maar die Seun van die mens het geen plek waar Hy sy hoof kan neerlê nie.

column2: Luke 9:59 And he said unto another, Follow me. But he said, Lord, suffer me first to go and bury my father.
column3: Lukas 9:59 En Hy sê aan ’n ander een: Volg My. Maar hy antwoord: Here, laat my toe om eers my vader te gaan begrawe.

column2: Luke 9:60 Jesus said unto him, Let the dead bury their dead: but go thou and preach the kingdom of God.
column3: Lukas 9:60 En Jesus sê vir hom: Laat die dooies hul eie dooies begrawe; maar gaan jy en verkondig die koninkryk van God.

column2: Luke 9:61 And another also said, Lord, I will follow thee; but let me first go bid them farewell, which are at home at my house.
column3: Lukas 9:61 En ’n ander een het ook gesê: Here, ek sal U volg, maar laat my eers toe om afskeid te neem van die wat in my huis is.

column2: Luke 9:62 And Jesus said unto him, No man, having put his hand to the plough, and looking back, is fit for the kingdom of God.
column3: Lukas 9:62 En Jesus antwoord hom: Niemand wat sy hand aan die ploeg slaan en agtertoe kyk, is geskik vir die koninkryk van God nie.

column2: Luke 10:1 After these things the Lord appointed other seventy also, and sent them two and two before his face into every city and place, whither he himself would come.
column3: Lukas 10:1 EN ná hierdie dinge het die Here weer sewentig ander aangestel, en hulle twee-twee voor Hom uit gestuur na elke stad en plek waar Hy sou kom.

column2: Luke 10:2 Therefore said he unto them, The harvest truly [is] great, but the labourers [are] few: pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest, that he would send forth labourers into his harvest.
column3: Lukas 10:2 Hy sê toe vir hulle: Die oes is wel groot, maar die arbeiders min. Bid dan die Here van die oes dat Hy arbeiders in sy oes uitstuur.

column2: Luke 10:3 Go your ways: behold, I send you forth as lambs among wolves.
column3: Lukas 10:3 Gaan dan; kyk, Ek stuur julle soos lammers onder wolwe.

column2: Luke 10:4 Carry neither purse, nor scrip, nor shoes: and salute no man by the way.
column3: Lukas 10:4 Moenie ’n beurs of ’n reissak of skoene dra nie, en groet niemand op die pad nie.

column2: Luke 10:5 And into whatsoever house ye enter, first say, Peace [be] to this house.
column3: Lukas 10:5 En in watter huis julle ook al mag ingaan, sê eers: Vrede vir hierdie huis!

column2: Luke 10:6 And if the son of peace be there, your peace shall rest upon it: if not, it shall turn to you again.
column3: Lukas 10:6 En as dáár ’n man van vrede is, sal julle vrede op hom rus; anders sal dit tot julle terugkeer.

column2: Luke 10:7 And in the same house remain, eating and drinking such things as they give: for the labourer is worthy of his hire. Go not from house to house.
column3: Lukas 10:7 Bly dan in daardie selfde huis en eet en drink wat hulle het, want die arbeider is sy loon werd. Moenie van huis tot huis gaan nie.

column2: Luke 10:8 And into whatsoever city ye enter, and they receive you, eat such things as are set before you:
column3: Lukas 10:8 En in watter stad julle ook al mag ingaan en hulle jul ontvang, eet wat aan julle voorgesit word.

column2: Luke 10:9 And heal the sick that are therein, and say unto them, The kingdom of God is come nigh unto you.
column3: Lukas 10:9 En maak die siekes gesond wat daarin is, en sê vir hulle: Die koninkryk van God het naby julle gekom.

column2: Luke 10:10 But into whatsoever city ye enter, and they receive you not, go your ways out into the streets of the same, and say,
column3: Lukas 10:10 Maar in watter stad julle ook al mag ingaan en hulle jul nie ontvang nie, gaan uit op sy strate en sê:

column2: Luke 10:11 Even the very dust of your city, which cleaveth on us, we do wipe off against you: notwithstanding be ye sure of this, that the kingdom of God is come nigh unto you.
column3: Lukas 10:11 Selfs die stof wat uit julle stad aan ons kleef, vee ons vir julle af; maar tog moet julle dit weet dat die koninkryk van God naby julle gekom het.

column2: Luke 10:12 But I say unto you, that it shall be more tolerable in that day for Sodom, than for that city.
column3: Lukas 10:12 En Ek sê vir julle: Vir Sodom sal dit verdraagliker wees in dié dag as vir daardie stad.

column2: Luke 10:13 Woe unto thee, Chorazin! woe unto thee, Bethsaida! for if the mighty works had been done in Tyre and Sidon, which have been done in you, they had a great while ago repented, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.
column3: Lukas 10:13 Wee jou, Górasin, wee jou, Betsáida! want as in Tirus en Sidon die kragtige dade plaasgevind het wat in julle plaasgevind het, sou hulle lankal in sak en as gesit en hulle bekeer het.

column2: Luke 10:14 But it shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the judgment, than for you.
column3: Lukas 10:14 Maar vir Tirus en Sidon sal dit in die oordeel verdraagliker wees as vir julle.

column2: Luke 10:15 And thou, Capernaum, which art exalted to heaven, shalt be thrust down to hell.
column3: Lukas 10:15 En jy, Kapérnaüm, wat tot die hemel toe verhoog is, jy sal tot die doderyk toe neergestoot word.

column2: Luke 10:16 He that heareth you heareth me; and he that despiseth you despiseth me; and he that despiseth me despiseth him that sent me.
column3: Lukas 10:16 Wie na julle luister, luister na My; en wie julle verwerp, verwerp My; en wie My verwerp, verwerp Hom wat My gestuur het.

column2: Luke 10:17 And the seventy returned again with joy, saying, Lord, even the devils are subject unto us through thy name.
column3: Lukas 10:17 En die sewentig het met blydskap teruggekom en gesê: Here, ook die duiwels onderwerp hulle aan ons in u Naam.

column2: Luke 10:18 And he said unto them, I beheld Satan as lightning fall from heaven.
column3: Lukas 10:18 Toe sê Hy vir hulle: Ek het die Satan soos ’n bliksem uit die hemel sien val.

column2: Luke 10:19 Behold, I give unto you power to tread on serpents and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy: and nothing shall by any means hurt you.
column3: Lukas 10:19 Kyk, Ek gee aan julle die mag om op slange en skerpioene te trap, en oor al die krag van die vyand; en niks sal julle ooit skade doen nie.

column2: Luke 10:20 Notwithstanding in this rejoice not, that the spirits are subject unto you; but rather rejoice, because your names are written in heaven.
column3: Lukas 10:20 Maar julle moenie daaroor bly wees dat die geeste aan julle onderworpe is nie, maar wees liewer bly dat julle name in die hemele opgeskrywe is.

column2: Luke 10:21 In that hour Jesus rejoiced in spirit, and said, I thank thee, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that thou hast hid these things from the wise and prudent, and hast revealed them unto babes: even so, Father; for so it seemed good in thy sight.
column3: Lukas 10:21 In dieselfde uur het Jesus Hom in die gees verheug en gesê: Ek loof U, Vader, Here van die hemel en die aarde, dat U hierdie dinge verberg het vir wyse en verstandige mense en dit aan kindertjies geopenbaar het. Ja, Vader, want so was dit u welbehae.

column2: Luke 10:22 All things are delivered to me of my Father: and no man knoweth who the Son is, but the Father; and who the Father is, but the Son, and [he] to whom the Son will reveal [him].
column3: Lukas 10:22 Alles is aan My oorgegee deur my Vader; en niemand weet wie die Seun is nie, behalwe die Vader, en wie die Vader is nie, behalwe die Seun en hy aan wie die Seun dit wil openbaar.

column2: Luke 10:23 And he turned him unto [his] disciples, and said privately, Blessed [are] the eyes which see the things that ye see:
column3: Lukas 10:23 En Hy het Hom omgedraai na sy dissipels en afsonderlik aan hulle gesê: Salig is die oë wat sien wat julle sien;

column2: Luke 10:24 For I tell you, that many prophets and kings have desired to see those things which ye see, and have not seen [them]; and to hear those things which ye hear, and have not heard [them].
column3: Lukas 10:24 want Ek sê vir julle, baie profete en konings het gewens om te sien wat julle sien, en het dit nie gesien nie, en om te hoor wat julle hoor, en het dit nie gehoor nie.

column2: Luke 10:25 And, behold, a certain lawyer stood up, and tempted him, saying, Master, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?
column3: Lukas 10:25 EN daar het ’n sekere wetgeleerde opgestaan wat Hom versoek het deur te sê: Meester, wat moet ek doen om die ewige lewe te beërwe?

column2: Luke 10:26 He said unto him, What is written in the law? how readest thou?
column3: Lukas 10:26 En Hy antwoord hom: Wat is in die wet geskrywe? Hoe lees jy?

column2: Luke 10:27 And he answering said, Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy strength, and with all thy mind; and thy neighbour as thyself.
column3: Lukas 10:27 En hy antwoord en sê: Jy moet die Here jou God liefhê uit jou hele hart en uit jou hele siel en uit jou hele krag en uit jou hele verstand; en jou naaste soos jouself.

column2: Luke 10:28 And he said unto him, Thou hast answered right: this do, and thou shalt live.
column3: Lukas 10:28 Toe sê Hy vir hom: Jy het reg geantwoord; doen dit, en jy sal lewe.

column2: Luke 10:29 But he, willing to justify himself, said unto Jesus, And who is my neighbour?
column3: Lukas 10:29 Maar hy wou homself regverdig, en sê vir Jesus: En wie is my naaste?

column2: Luke 10:30 And Jesus answering said, A certain [man] went down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and fell among thieves, which stripped him of his raiment, and wounded [him], and departed, leaving [him] half dead.
column3: Lukas 10:30 En Jesus antwoord en sê: ’n Sekere man het afgegaan van Jerusalem na Jérigo en onder rowers verval, en nadat hulle hom uitgetrek en geslaan het, gaan hulle weg en laat hom half dood lê.

column2: Luke 10:31 And by chance there came down a certain priest that way: and when he saw him, he passed by on the other side.
column3: Lukas 10:31 En bygeval het ’n priester met daardie pad afgekom, en toe hy hom sien, gaan hy anderkant verby.

column2: Luke 10:32 And likewise a Levite, when he was at the place, came and looked [on him], and passed by on the other side.
column3: Lukas 10:32 En net so het ook ’n Leviet by dié plek gekom en hom gesien en anderkant verbygegaan.

column2: Luke 10:33 But a certain Samaritan, as he journeyed, came where he was: and when he saw him, he had compassion [on him],
column3: Lukas 10:33 Maar ’n sekere Samaritaan wat op reis was, het op hom afgekom; en toe hy hom sien, het hy innig jammer gevoel,

column2: Luke 10:34 And went to [him], and bound up his wounds, pouring in oil and wine, and set him on his own beast, and brought him to an inn, and took care of him.
column3: Lukas 10:34 en na hom gegaan, sy wonde verbind en olie en wyn daarop gegooi. Hy het hom toe op sy eie pakdier gehelp en hom na ’n herberg geneem en vir hom gesorg.

column2: Luke 10:35 And on the morrow when he departed, he took out two pence, and gave [them] to the host, and said unto him, Take care of him; and whatsoever thou spendest more, when I come again, I will repay thee.
column3: Lukas 10:35 En toe hy die volgende môre weggaan, haal hy twee pennings uit en gee dit aan die eienaar van die herberg en sê vir hom: Sorg vir hom, en enige onkoste wat jy nog meer mag hê, sal ek jou betaal as ek terugkom.

column2: Luke 10:36 Which now of these three, thinkest thou, was neighbour unto him that fell among the thieves?
column3: Lukas 10:36 Wie dan van hierdie drie, dink jy, was die naaste van hom wat onder die rowers verval het?

column2: Luke 10:37 And he said, He that shewed mercy on him. Then said Jesus unto him, Go, and do thou likewise.
column3: Lukas 10:37 En hy antwoord: Hy wat barmhartigheid aan hom bewys het. Toe sê Jesus vir hom: Gaan en doen jy net so.

column2: Luke 10:38 Now it came to pass, as they went, that he entered into a certain village: and a certain woman named Martha received him into her house.
column3: Lukas 10:38 EN op hulle reis het Hy in ’n sekere dorp gekom, en ’n vrou met die naam van Martha het Hom in haar huis ontvang.

column2: Luke 10:39 And she had a sister called Mary, which also sat at Jesus' feet, and heard his word.
column3: Lukas 10:39 En sy het ’n suster gehad met die naam van Maria; dié het aan die voete van Jesus gesit en na sy woord geluister.

column2: Luke 10:40 But Martha was cumbered about much serving, and came to him, and said, Lord, dost thou not care that my sister hath left me to serve alone? bid her therefore that she help me.
column3: Lukas 10:40 Maar Martha was baie besig om alles klaar te maak. Sy kom toe daar staan en sê: Here, gee U nie om dat my suster my alleen laat bedien nie? Sê dan vir haar dat sy my moet help.

column2: Luke 10:41 And Jesus answered and said unto her, Martha, Martha, thou art careful and troubled about many things:
column3: Lukas 10:41 Maar Jesus antwoord en sê vir haar: Martha, Martha, jy is besorg en verontrus oor baie dinge;

column2: Luke 10:42 But one thing is needful: and Mary hath chosen that good part, which shall not be taken away from her.
column3: Lukas 10:42 maar een ding is nodig; en Maria het die goeie deel uitgekies wat van haar nie weggeneem sal word nie.

column2: Luke 11:1 And it came to pass, that, as he was praying in a certain place, when he ceased, one of his disciples said unto him, Lord, teach us to pray, as John also taught his disciples.
column3: Lukas 11:1 EN toe Hy op ’n sekere plek besig was om te bid, sê een van sy dissipels vir Hom nadat Hy opgehou het: Here, leer ons bid, soos Johannes ook sy dissipels geleer het.

column2: Luke 11:2 And he said unto them, When ye pray, say, Our Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy name. Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done, as in heaven, so in earth.
column3: Lukas 11:2 En Hy sê vir hulle: Wanneer julle bid, sê: Onse Vader wat in die hemele is, laat u Naam geheilig word; laat u koninkryk kom; laat u wil geskied, soos in die hemel net so ook op die aarde;

column2: Luke 11:3 Give us day by day our daily bread.
column3: Lukas 11:3 gee ons elke dag ons daaglikse brood;

column2: Luke 11:4 And forgive us our sins; for we also forgive every one that is indebted to us. And lead us not into temptation; but deliver us from evil.
column3: Lukas 11:4 en vergeef ons ons sondes, want ons vergewe ook elkeen wat aan ons skuldig is; en lei ons nie in versoeking nie, maar verlos ons van die Bose.

column2: Luke 11:5 And he said unto them, Which of you shall have a friend, and shall go unto him at midnight, and say unto him, Friend, lend me three loaves;
column3: Lukas 11:5 EN Hy het vir hulle gesê: Wie van julle sal ’n vriend hê en sal middernag na hom gaan en vir hom sê: Vriend, leen my drie brode,

column2: Luke 11:6 For a friend of mine in his journey is come to me, and I have nothing to set before him?
column3: Lukas 11:6 want ’n vriend van my het van ’n reis by my aangekom, en ek het niks om aan hom voor te sit nie —

column2: Luke 11:7 And he from within shall answer and say, Trouble me not: the door is now shut, and my children are with me in bed; I cannot rise and give thee.
column3: Lukas 11:7 en dié van binnekant sal antwoord en sê: Moenie my lastig val nie; die deur is al gesluit, en my kinders is saam met my al in die bed; ek kan nie opstaan om vir jou te gee nie.

column2: Luke 11:8 I say unto you, Though he will not rise and give him, because he is his friend, yet because of his importunity he will rise and give him as many as he needeth.
column3: Lukas 11:8 Ek sê vir julle, al sou hy ook nie opstaan en vir hom gee omdat hy sy vriend is nie, sal hy tog ter wille van sy onbeskaamdheid opstaan en hom gee soveel as hy nodig het.

column2: Luke 11:9 And I say unto you, Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you.
column3: Lukas 11:9 En Ek sê vir julle: Bid, en vir julle sal gegee word; soek, en julle sal vind; klop, en vir julle sal oopgemaak word.

column2: Luke 11:10 For every one that asketh receiveth; and he that seeketh findeth; and to him that knocketh it shall be opened.
column3: Lukas 11:10 Want elkeen wat bid, ontvang; en hy wat soek, vind; en vir hom wat klop, sal oopgemaak word.

column2: Luke 11:11 If a son shall ask bread of any of you that is a father, will he give him a stone? or if [he ask] a fish, will he for a fish give him a serpent?
column3: Lukas 11:11 En vir watter vader onder julle sal sy seun brood vra, en hy sal hom ’n klip gee; of ook ’n vis, en hy sal hom in plaas van ’n vis ’n slang gee;

column2: Luke 11:12 Or if he shall ask an egg, will he offer him a scorpion?
column3: Lukas 11:12 of ook as hy ’n eier vra, hom ’n skerpioen gee?

column2: Luke 11:13 If ye then, being evil, know how to give good gifts unto your children: how much more shall [your] heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to them that ask him?
column3: Lukas 11:13 As julle dan wat sleg is, weet om goeie gawes aan julle kinders te gee, hoeveel te meer sal die hemelse Vader die Heilige Gees gee aan die wat Hom bid?

column2: Luke 11:14 And he was casting out a devil, and it was dumb. And it came to pass, when the devil was gone out, the dumb spake; and the people wondered.
column3: Lukas 11:14 EN Hy het ’n duiwel uitgedryf, en dié was stom. En toe die duiwel uitgaan, het die stom man gepraat; en die skare het hulle verwonder.

column2: Luke 11:15 But some of them said, He casteth out devils through Beelzebub the chief of the devils.
column3: Lukas 11:15 Maar sommige van hulle sê: Deur Beëlsebul, die owerste van die duiwels, dryf Hy die duiwels uit.

column2: Luke 11:16 And others, tempting [him], sought of him a sign from heaven.
column3: Lukas 11:16 En ander het Hom versoek en van Hom ’n teken uit die hemel begeer.

column2: Luke 11:17 But he, knowing their thoughts, said unto them, Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation; and a house [divided] against a house falleth.
column3: Lukas 11:17 Maar Hy het hulle gedagtes geken en vir hulle gesê: Elke koninkryk wat teen homself verdeeld is, word verwoes; en ’n huis wat teen homself is, val.
