column2: Luke 11:18 If Satan also be divided against himself, how shall his kingdom stand? because ye say that I cast out devils through Beelzebub.
column3: Lukas 11:18 En as die Satan ook teen homself verdeeld is, hoe sal sy koninkryk bly staan? Want julle sê dat Ek deur Beëlsebul die duiwels uitdryf.

column2: Luke 11:19 And if I by Beelzebub cast out devils, by whom do your sons cast [them] out? therefore shall they be your judges.
column3: Lukas 11:19 En as Ek deur Beëlsebul die duiwels uitdryf, deur wie dryf julle seuns hulle uit? Daarom sal hulle jul regters wees.

column2: Luke 11:20 But if I with the finger of God cast out devils, no doubt the kingdom of God is come upon you.
column3: Lukas 11:20 Maar as Ek deur die vinger van God die duiwels uitdryf, dan het die koninkryk van God waarlik by julle gekom.

column2: Luke 11:21 When a strong man armed keepeth his palace, his goods are in peace:
column3: Lukas 11:21 Wanneer ’n sterk man wat goed gewapend is, sy huis bewaak, is sy besittings in veiligheid.

column2: Luke 11:22 But when a stronger than he shall come upon him, and overcome him, he taketh from him all his armour wherein he trusted, and divideth his spoils.
column3: Lukas 11:22 Maar as een hom oorval wat sterker is as hy en hom oorwin, neem hy sy volle wapenrusting weg waar hy op vertrou het, en deel sy buit uit.

column2: Luke 11:23 He that is not with me is against me: and he that gathereth not with me scattereth.
column3: Lukas 11:23 Hy wat nie met My is nie, is teen My; en hy wat nie saam met My versamel nie, verstrooi.

column2: Luke 11:24 When the unclean spirit is gone out of a man, he walketh through dry places, seeking rest; and finding none, he saith, I will return unto my house whence I came out.
column3: Lukas 11:24 Wanneer die onreine gees uit die mens uitgegaan het, gaan hy deur waterlose plekke en soek rus; en as hy dit nie vind nie, sê hy: Ek sal teruggaan na my huis waar ek uitgegaan het.

column2: Luke 11:25 And when he cometh, he findeth [it] swept and garnished.
column3: Lukas 11:25 En hy kom en vind dit uitgevee en versierd.

column2: Luke 11:26 Then goeth he, and taketh [to him] seven other spirits more wicked than himself; and they enter in, and dwell there: and the last [state] of that man is worse than the first.
column3: Lukas 11:26 Dan gaan hy en neem sewe ander geeste, slegter as hy self, en hulle kom in en woon daar; en die laaste van daardie mens word erger as die eerste.

column2: Luke 11:27 And it came to pass, as he spake these things, a certain woman of the company lifted up her voice, and said unto him, Blessed [is] the womb that bare thee, and the paps which thou hast sucked.
column3: Lukas 11:27 En terwyl Hy dit spreek, het ’n vrou uit die skare haar stem verhef en vir Hom gesê: Salig is die skoot wat U gedra het, en die borste wat U gesoog het.

column2: Luke 11:28 But he said, Yea rather, blessed [are] they that hear the word of God, and keep it.
column3: Lukas 11:28 En Hy sê: Ja, maar salig is hulle wat die woord van God hoor en dit bewaar.

column2: Luke 11:29 And when the people were gathered thick together, he began to say, This is an evil generation: they seek a sign; and there shall no sign be given it, but the sign of Jonas the prophet.
column3: Lukas 11:29 EN toe die skare saamstroom, begin Hy te sê: Hierdie geslag is boos; dit soek na ’n teken, en geen teken sal aan hom gegee word nie, behalwe die teken van die profeet Jona.

column2: Luke 11:30 For as Jonas was a sign unto the Ninevites, so shall also the Son of man be to this generation.
column3: Lukas 11:30 Want soos Jona ’n teken was vir die Nineviete, so sal die Seun van die mens ook wees vir hierdie geslag.

column2: Luke 11:31 The queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation, and condemn them: for she came from the utmost parts of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and, behold, a greater than Solomon [is] here.
column3: Lukas 11:31 Die koningin van die Suide sal in die oordeel opstaan saam met die manne van hierdie geslag en hulle veroordeel; want sy het gekom van die eindes van die aarde af om die wysheid van Salomo te hoor, en — meer as Salomo is hier!

column2: Luke 11:32 The men of Nineve shall rise up in the judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: for they repented at the preaching of Jonas; and, behold, a greater than Jonas [is] here.
column3: Lukas 11:32 Die manne van Ninevé sal in die oordeel opstaan saam met hierdie geslag en dit veroordeel; want hulle het hul op die prediking van Jona bekeer, en — meer as Jona is hier!

column2: Luke 11:33 No man, when he hath lighted a candle, putteth [it] in a secret place, neither under a bushel, but on a candlestick, that they which come in may see the light.
column3: Lukas 11:33 EN niemand steek ’n lamp op en sit dit in ’n verborge plek of onder die maatemmer nie, maar op die staander, sodat die wat binnekom, die lig kan sien.

column2: Luke 11:34 The light of the body is the eye: therefore when thine eye is single, thy whole body also is full of light; but when [thine eye] is evil, thy body also [is] full of darkness.
column3: Lukas 11:34 Die lamp van die liggaam is die oog. As jou oog dan reg is, is jou hele liggaam ook verlig; maar as dit verkeerd is, is jou liggaam ook donker.

column2: Luke 11:35 Take heed therefore that the light which is in thee be not darkness.
column3: Lukas 11:35 Pas dan op dat die lig in jou nie duisternis is nie.

column2: Luke 11:36 If thy whole body therefore [be] full of light, having no part dark, the whole shall be full of light, as when the bright shining of a candle doth give thee light.
column3: Lukas 11:36 As jou hele liggaam dan verlig is en nie enige deel het wat donker is nie, sal dit heeltemal verlig wees, net soos wanneer die lamp met sy skynsel jou verlig.

column2: Luke 11:37 And as he spake, a certain Pharisee besought him to dine with him: and he went in, and sat down to meat.
column3: Lukas 11:37 EN onderwyl Hy besig was om te spreek, het ’n sekere Fariseër Hom uitgenooi om by hom te kom eet; en Hy het ingekom en aan tafel gegaan.

column2: Luke 11:38 And when the Pharisee saw [it], he marvelled that he had not first washed before dinner.
column3: Lukas 11:38 En toe die Fariseër dit sien, het hy hom verwonder dat Hy nie voor die maaltyd eers gewas het nie.

column2: Luke 11:39 And the Lord said unto him, Now do ye Pharisees make clean the outside of the cup and the platter; but your inward part is full of ravening and wickedness.
column3: Lukas 11:39 Maar die Here sê vir hom: Ja, julle Fariseërs, julle maak die buitekant van die beker en die bord skoon, maar van binne is julle vol roof en boosheid.

column2: Luke 11:40 [Ye] fools, did not he that made that which is without make that which is within also?
column3: Lukas 11:40 Onverstandiges, het Hy wat die buitekant gemaak het, nie die binnekant ook gemaak nie?

column2: Luke 11:41 But rather give alms of such things as ye have; and, behold, all things are clean unto you.
column3: Lukas 11:41 Maar gee wat daarin is, as aalmoes, en dan is alles vir julle rein.

column2: Luke 11:42 But woe unto you, Pharisees! for ye tithe mint and rue and all manner of herbs, and pass over judgment and the love of God: these ought ye to have done, and not to leave the other undone.
column3: Lukas 11:42 Maar wee julle, Fariseërs, want julle gee tiendes van die kruisement en die wynruit en elke groentesoort, en julle verwaarloos die reg en die liefde tot God. Hierdie dinge behoort julle te doen sonder om die ander na te laat.

column2: Luke 11:43 Woe unto you, Pharisees! for ye love the uppermost seats in the synagogues, and greetings in the markets.
column3: Lukas 11:43 Wee julle, Fariseërs, want julle hou van die voorste banke in die sinagoges en die begroetinge op die markte.

column2: Luke 11:44 Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye are as graves which appear not, and the men that walk over [them] are not aware [of them].
column3: Lukas 11:44 Wee julle, skrifgeleerdes en Fariseërs, geveinsdes, want julle is soos grafte wat onherkenbaar is, en die mense wat daaroor loop, weet dit nie.

column2: Luke 11:45 Then answered one of the lawyers, and said unto him, Master, thus saying thou reproachest us also.
column3: Lukas 11:45 Toe antwoord een van die wetgeleerdes en sê vir Hom: Meester, as U só spreek, beledig U ons ook.

column2: Luke 11:46 And he said, Woe unto you also, [ye] lawyers! for ye lade men with burdens grievous to be borne, and ye yourselves touch not the burdens with one of your fingers.
column3: Lukas 11:46 En Hy sê: Wee julle ook, wetgeleerdes, want julle lê laste op die mense wat swaar is om te dra, en self roer julle die laste nie met een van julle vingers aan nie.

column2: Luke 11:47 Woe unto you! for ye build the sepulchres of the prophets, and your fathers killed them.
column3: Lukas 11:47 Wee julle, want julle bou die grafte van die profete, en julle vaders het hulle gedood.

column2: Luke 11:48 Truly ye bear witness that ye allow the deeds of your fathers: for they indeed killed them, and ye build their sepulchres.
column3: Lukas 11:48 Julle gee dus getuienis vir die werke van julle vaders en het saam welbehae daarin, want hulle het hul gedood en julle bou hul grafte.

column2: Luke 11:49 Therefore also said the wisdom of God, I will send them prophets and apostles, and [some] of them they shall slay and persecute:
column3: Lukas 11:49 Daarom het die wysheid van God ook gesê: Ek sal profete en apostels na hulle stuur, en van dié sal hulle doodmaak en vervolg,

column2: Luke 11:50 That the blood of all the prophets, which was shed from the foundation of the world, may be required of this generation;
column3: Lukas 11:50 sodat van hierdie geslag afgeëis kan word die bloed van al die profete wat vergiet is van die grondlegging van die wêreld af,

column2: Luke 11:51 From the blood of Abel unto the blood of Zacharias, which perished between the altar and the temple: verily I say unto you, It shall be required of this generation.
column3: Lukas 11:51 van die bloed van Abel af tot op die bloed van Sagaría wat omgekom het tussen die reukaltaar en die huis van God. Ja, Ek sê vir julle, dit sal afgeëis word van hierdie geslag.

column2: Luke 11:52 Woe unto you, lawyers! for ye have taken away the key of knowledge: ye entered not in yourselves, and them that were entering in ye hindered.
column3: Lukas 11:52 Wee julle, wetgeleerdes, want julle het die sleutel van die kennis weggeneem; self het julle nie ingegaan nie, en vir die wat wou ingaan, het julle verhinder.

column2: Luke 11:53 And as he said these things unto them, the scribes and the Pharisees began to urge [him] vehemently, and to provoke him to speak of many things:
column3: Lukas 11:53 En toe Hy dit aan hulle sê, begin die skrifgeleerdes en die Fariseërs Hom skerp in die oog te hou en Hom uit te vra oor baie dinge,

column2: Luke 11:54 Laying wait for him, and seeking to catch something out of his mouth, that they might accuse him.
column3: Lukas 11:54 om vir Hom ’n strik te stel en te probeer om iets uit sy mond op te vang, sodat hulle Hom kon beskuldig.

column2: Luke 12:1 In the mean time, when there were gathered together an innumerable multitude of people, insomuch that they trode one upon another, he began to say unto his disciples first of all, Beware ye of the leaven of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.
column3: Lukas 12:1 TOE duisende van die skare ondertussen saamkom, sodat hulle mekaar vertrap het, begin Hy aan sy dissipels te sê: Pas veral op vir die suurdeeg van die Fariseërs, dit is geveinsdheid.

column2: Luke 12:2 For there is nothing covered, that shall not be revealed; neither hid, that shall not be known.
column3: Lukas 12:2 En daar is niks bedek wat nie geopenbaar sal word nie, en verborge wat nie bekend sal word nie.

column2: Luke 12:3 Therefore whatsoever ye have spoken in darkness shall be heard in the light; and that which ye have spoken in the ear in closets shall be proclaimed upon the housetops.
column3: Lukas 12:3 Daarom, alles wat julle in die donker gesê het, sal in die lig gehoor word; en wat julle in die oor gepraat het in die binnekamers, sal op die dakke verkondig word.

column2: Luke 12:4 And I say unto you my friends, Be not afraid of them that kill the body, and after that have no more that they can do.
column3: Lukas 12:4 EN Ek sê vir julle, my vriende: Moenie vrees vir die wat die liggaam doodmaak en daarna niks meer kan doen nie;

column2: Luke 12:5 But I will forewarn you whom ye shall fear: Fear him, which after he hath killed hath power to cast into hell; yea, I say unto you, Fear him.
column3: Lukas 12:5 maar Ek sal julle wys wie julle moet vrees: vrees Hom wat, nadat Hy doodgemaak het, by magte is om in die hel te werp; ja, Ek sê vir julle, vrees Hom!

column2: Luke 12:6 Are not five sparrows sold for two farthings, and not one of them is forgotten before God?
column3: Lukas 12:6 Word vyf mossies nie vir twee stuiwers verkoop nie? En nie een van hulle is voor God vergeet nie.

column2: Luke 12:7 But even the very hairs of your head are all numbered. Fear not therefore: ye are of more value than many sparrows.
column3: Lukas 12:7 Maar selfs die hare van julle hoof is almal getel. Wees dan nie bevrees nie: julle is meer werd as baie mossies.

column2: Luke 12:8 Also I say unto you, Whosoever shall confess me before men, him shall the Son of man also confess before the angels of God:
column3: Lukas 12:8 En Ek sê vir julle: Elkeen wat My sal bely voor die mense, hom sal die Seun van die mens ook bely voor die engele van God.

column2: Luke 12:9 But he that denieth me before men shall be denied before the angels of God.
column3: Lukas 12:9 Maar hy wat My verloën voor die mense, sal verloën word voor die engele van God.

column2: Luke 12:10 And whosoever shall speak a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven him: but unto him that blasphemeth against the Holy Ghost it shall not be forgiven.
column3: Lukas 12:10 En elkeen wat ’n woord teen die Seun van die mens sal spreek, dit sal hom vergewe word; maar vir hom wat gelaster het teen die Heilige Gees, sal dit nie vergewe word nie.

column2: Luke 12:11 And when they bring you unto the synagogues, and [unto] magistrates, and powers, take ye no thought how or what thing ye shall answer, or what ye shall say:
column3: Lukas 12:11 En wanneer hulle jul sal bring voor die sinagoges en die owerhede en die gesaghebbers, moet julle jul nie kwel oor hoe of waarmee julle jul sal verdedig, of wat julle sal sê nie;

column2: Luke 12:12 For the Holy Ghost shall teach you in the same hour what ye ought to say.
column3: Lukas 12:12 want die Heilige Gees sal julle in dieselfde uur leer wat julle moet sê.

column2: Luke 12:13 And one of the company said unto him, Master, speak to my brother, that he divide the inheritance with me.
column3: Lukas 12:13 EN een van die skare sê vir Hom: Meester, sê vir my broer dat hy die erfenis met my moet deel.

column2: Luke 12:14 And he said unto him, Man, who made me a judge or a divider over you?
column3: Lukas 12:14 Maar Hy antwoord hom: Mens, wie het My as ’n regter of deler oor julle aangestel?

column2: Luke 12:15 And he said unto them, Take heed, and beware of covetousness: for a man's life consisteth not in the abundance of the things which he possesseth.
column3: Lukas 12:15 En Hy sê vir hulle: Pas op en wees op julle hoede vir die hebsug, want iemand se lewe bestaan nie uit die oorvloed van sy besittings nie.

column2: Luke 12:16 And he spake a parable unto them, saying, The ground of a certain rich man brought forth plentifully:
column3: Lukas 12:16 Toe vertel Hy hulle hierdie gelykenis: ’n Ryk man se grond het goed gedra.

column2: Luke 12:17 And he thought within himself, saying, What shall I do, because I have no room where to bestow my fruits?
column3: Lukas 12:17 En hy het by homself geredeneer en gesê: Wat sal ek doen, want ek het geen plek waar ek my oes kan insamel nie?

column2: Luke 12:18 And he said, This will I do: I will pull down my barns, and build greater; and there will I bestow all my fruits and my goods.
column3: Lukas 12:18 Toe sê hy: Dit sal ek doen: ek sal my skure afbreek en groter bou, en ek sal daar al my opbrengste en my goed insamel.

column2: Luke 12:19 And I will say to my soul, Soul, thou hast much goods laid up for many years; take thine ease, eat, drink, [and] be merry.
column3: Lukas 12:19 En ek sal vir my siel sê: Siel, jy het baie goed wat weggesit is vir baie jare; neem rus, eet, drink, wees vrolik.

column2: Luke 12:20 But God said unto him, [Thou] fool, this night thy soul shall be required of thee: then whose shall those things be, which thou hast provided?
column3: Lukas 12:20 Maar God het aan hom gesê: Jou dwaas, in hierdie nag sal hulle jou siel van jou afeis; en wat jy gereedgemaak het, wie s’n sal dit wees?

column2: Luke 12:21 So [is] he that layeth up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God.
column3: Lukas 12:21 So gaan dit met hom wat vir homself skatte vergader en nie ryk is in God nie.

column2: Luke 12:22 And he said unto his disciples, Therefore I say unto you, Take no thought for your life, what ye shall eat; neither for the body, what ye shall put on.
column3: Lukas 12:22 EN Hy het aan sy dissipels gesê: Daarom sê Ek vir julle: Moenie julle kwel oor jul lewe, wat julle sal eet, of oor jul liggaam, wat julle sal aantrek nie.

column2: Luke 12:23 The life is more than meat, and the body [is more] than raiment.
column3: Lukas 12:23 Die lewe is meer as die voedsel en die liggaam as die klere.

column2: Luke 12:24 Consider the ravens: for they neither sow nor reap; which neither have storehouse nor barn; and God feedeth them: how much more are ye better than the fowls?
column3: Lukas 12:24 Kyk na die kraaie, want hulle saai nie en hulle maai nie; hulle het geen voorraadkamer of skuur nie, en tog voed God hulle Hoeveel meer is julle nie werd as die voëls nie!

column2: Luke 12:25 And which of you with taking thought can add to his stature one cubit?
column3: Lukas 12:25 En wie onder julle kan, deur hom te kwel, een el by sy lengte voeg?

column2: Luke 12:26 If ye then be not able to do that thing which is least, why take ye thought for the rest?
column3: Lukas 12:26 As julle dan selfs nie die geringste kan doen nie, waarom kwel julle jul oor die ander dinge?

column2: Luke 12:27 Consider the lilies how they grow: they toil not, they spin not; and yet I say unto you, that Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.
column3: Lukas 12:27 Kyk na die lelies, hoe hulle groei: hulle arbei nie en hulle spin nie; en Ek sê vir julle, selfs Salomo in al sy heerlikheid was nie bekleed soos een van hulle nie.

column2: Luke 12:28 If then God so clothe the grass, which is to day in the field, and to morrow is cast into the oven; how much more [will he clothe] you, O ye of little faith?
column3: Lukas 12:28 As God dan die gras van die veld wat vandag daar is en môre in ’n oond gegooi word, so beklee, hoeveel meer vir julle, kleingelowiges!

column2: Luke 12:29 And seek not ye what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink, neither be ye of doubtful mind.
column3: Lukas 12:29 Julle moet ook nie soek wat julle sal eet of wat julle sal drink nie, en julle nie ongerus maak nie;

column2: Luke 12:30 For all these things do the nations of the world seek after: and your Father knoweth that ye have need of these things.
column3: Lukas 12:30 want al hierdie dinge soek die nasies van die wêreld, en julle Vader weet dat julle hierdie dinge nodig het.

column2: Luke 12:31 But rather seek ye the kingdom of God; and all these things shall be added unto you.
column3: Lukas 12:31 Maar soek die koninkryk van God, en al hierdie dinge sal vir julle bygevoeg word.

column2: Luke 12:32 Fear not, little flock; for it is your Father's good pleasure to give you the kingdom.
column3: Lukas 12:32 Moenie vrees nie, klein kuddetjie, want julle Vader het ’n welbehae daarin gehad om aan julle die koninkryk te gee.

column2: Luke 12:33 Sell that ye have, and give alms; provide yourselves bags which wax not old, a treasure in the heavens that faileth not, where no thief approacheth, neither moth corrupteth.
column3: Lukas 12:33 Verkoop julle besittings en gee aalmoese; maak vir julle beurse wat nie oud word nie, ’n skat in die hemel wat onuitputlik is, waar geen dief by kom of mot verteer nie.

column2: Luke 12:34 For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.
column3: Lukas 12:34 Want waar julle skat is, daar sal julle hart ook wees.

column2: Luke 12:35 Let your loins be girded about, and [your] lights burning;
column3: Lukas 12:35 LAAT julle heupe omgord wees en julle lampe aan die brand.

column2: Luke 12:36 And ye yourselves like unto men that wait for their lord, when he will return from the wedding; that when he cometh and knocketh, they may open unto him immediately.
column3: Lukas 12:36 En julle moet wees soos mense wat op hulle heer wag wanneer hy van die bruilof terugkom, sodat hulle dadelik vir hom kan oopmaak as hy kom en aanklop.

column2: Luke 12:37 Blessed [are] those servants, whom the lord when he cometh shall find watching: verily I say unto you, that he shall gird himself, and make them to sit down to meat, and will come forth and serve them.
column3: Lukas 12:37 Gelukkig is daardie diensknegte vir wie die heer wakker sal vind as hy kom. Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, hy sal hom omgord en hulle aan tafel laat gaan en hulle kom bedien.

column2: Luke 12:38 And if he shall come in the second watch, or come in the third watch, and find [them] so, blessed are those servants.
column3: Lukas 12:38 En as hy in die tweede of in die derde nagwaak kom, en dit so vind — gelukkig is daardie diensknegte.

column2: Luke 12:39 And this know, that if the goodman of the house had known what hour the thief would come, he would have watched, and not have suffered his house to be broken through.
column3: Lukas 12:39 Maar weet dit: as die huisheer geweet het in watter uur die dief sou kom, sou hy gewaak het en nie in sy huis laat inbreek het nie.

column2: Luke 12:40 Be ye therefore ready also: for the Son of man cometh at an hour when ye think not.
column3: Lukas 12:40 Julle moet dan ook gereed wees, omdat die Seun van die mens kom op ’n uur dat julle dit nie verwag nie.

column2: Luke 12:41 Then Peter said unto him, Lord, speakest thou this parable unto us, or even to all?
column3: Lukas 12:41 Toe sê Petrus vir Hom: Here, vertel U hierdie gelykenis vir ons of ook vir almal?

column2: Luke 12:42 And the Lord said, Who then is that faithful and wise steward, whom [his] lord shall make ruler over his household, to give [them their] portion of meat in due season?
column3: Lukas 12:42 En die Here antwoord: Wie is dan die getroue en verstandige bestuurder wat die heer oor sy diensvolk sal aanstel om hulle rantsoen op tyd te gee?

column2: Luke 12:43 Blessed [is] that servant, whom his lord when he cometh shall find so doing.
column3: Lukas 12:43 Gelukkig is daardie dienskneg vir wie sy heer, as hy kom, só besig sal vind.

column2: Luke 12:44 Of a truth I say unto you, that he will make him ruler over all that he hath.
column3: Lukas 12:44 Waarlik, Ek sê vir julle, hy sal hom oor al sy besittings aanstel.

column2: Luke 12:45 But and if that servant say in his heart, My lord delayeth his coming; and shall begin to beat the menservants and maidens, and to eat and drink, and to be drunken;
column3: Lukas 12:45 Maar as daardie dienskneg in sy hart sê: My heer talm om te kom, en hy die diensknegte en diensmaagde begin slaan, en begin eet en drink en dronk word,

column2: Luke 12:46 The lord of that servant will come in a day when he looketh not for [him], and at an hour when he is not aware, and will cut him in sunder, and will appoint him his portion with the unbelievers.
column3: Lukas 12:46 dan sal die heer van daardie dienskneg kom op ’n dag dat hy dit nie verwag nie, en op ’n uur dat hy dit nie weet nie, en sal hom pynig en hom ’n deelgenoot maak van die ontroues.

column2: Luke 12:47 And that servant, which knew his lord's will, and prepared not [himself], neither did according to his will, shall be beaten with many [stripes].
column3: Lukas 12:47 En daardie dienskneg wat die wil van sy heer geken het en nie klaargemaak of volgens sy wil gedoen het nie, sal met baie slae geslaan word;

column2: Luke 12:48 But he that knew not, and did commit things worthy of stripes, shall be beaten with few [stripes]. For unto whomsoever much is given, of him shall be much required: and to whom men have committed much, of him they will ask the more.
column3: Lukas 12:48 maar hy wat nie geweet het nie en gedoen het wat slae verdien, sal met min slae geslaan word. En elkeen aan wie veel gegee is, van hom sal veel gevorder word; en aan wie hulle veel toevertrou het, van hom sal hulle oorvloediger eis.

column2: Luke 12:49 I am come to send fire on the earth; and what will I, if it be already kindled?
column3: Lukas 12:49 EK het gekom om vuur op die aarde te werp, en hoe wens Ek dat dit al aangesteek was!

column2: Luke 12:50 But I have a baptism to be baptized with; and how am I straitened till it be accomplished!
column3: Lukas 12:50 Maar Ek het ’n doop om mee gedoop te word, en hoe benoud word Ek totdat dit volbring is!

column2: Luke 12:51 Suppose ye that I am come to give peace on earth? I tell you, Nay; but rather division:
column3: Lukas 12:51 Dink julle dat Ek gekom het om vrede op die aarde te gee? Nee, sê Ek vir julle, maar eerder verdeeldheid.

column2: Luke 12:52 For from henceforth there shall be five in one house divided, three against two, and two against three.
column3: Lukas 12:52 Want van nou af sal daar vyf in een huis verdeeld wees, drie teen twee en twee teen drie.

column2: Luke 12:53 The father shall be divided against the son, and the son against the father; the mother against the daughter, and the daughter against the mother; the mother in law against her daughter in law, and the daughter in law against her mother in law.
column3: Lukas 12:53 Die vader sal verdeeld wees teen die seun en die seun teen die vader, die moeder teen die dogter en die dogter teen die moeder, die skoonmoeder teen haar skoondogter en die skoondogter teen haar skoonmoeder.

column2: Luke 12:54 And he said also to the people, When ye see a cloud rise out of the west, straightway ye say, There cometh a shower; and so it is.
column3: Lukas 12:54 EN Hy het ook aan die skare gesê: Wanneer julle ’n wolk in die weste sien opkom, sê julle dadelik: Daar kom reën! en dit gebeur ook.

column2: Luke 12:55 And when [ye see] the south wind blow, ye say, There will be heat; and it cometh to pass.
column3: Lukas 12:55 En wanneer julle die suidewind sien waai, sê julle: Dit sal gloeiend warm wees! en dit gebeur.

column2: Luke 12:56 [Ye] hypocrites, ye can discern the face of the sky and of the earth; but how is it that ye do not discern this time?
column3: Lukas 12:56 Geveinsdes, die voorkoms van die aarde en die lug weet julle te beoordeel, maar hoe is dit dat julle hierdie tyd nie kan beoordeel nie?

column2: Luke 12:57 Yea, and why even of yourselves judge ye not what is right?
column3: Lukas 12:57 En waarom oordeel julle ook nie uit julleself wat reg is nie?

column2: Luke 12:58 When thou goest with thine adversary to the magistrate, [as thou art] in the way, give diligence that thou mayest be delivered from him; lest he hale thee to the judge, and the judge deliver thee to the officer, and the officer cast thee into prison.
column3: Lukas 12:58 Want terwyl jy met jou teëstander na die owerheid gaan, doen moeite op die pad om van hom los te kom; sodat hy jou nie miskien voor die regter sleep en die regter jou oorgee aan die geregsdienaar en die geregsdienaar jou in die gevangenis werp nie.

column2: Luke 12:59 I tell thee, thou shalt not depart thence, till thou hast paid the very last mite.
column3: Lukas 12:59 Ek sê vir jou, jy sal daar sekerlik nie uitkom voordat jy ook die laaste oortjie betaal het nie.

column2: Luke 13:1 There were present at that season some that told him of the Galilaeans, whose blood Pilate had mingled with their sacrifices.
column3: Lukas 13:1 EN in dieselfde tyd was daar mense teenwoordig wat Hom berig gebring het van die Galiléërs wie se bloed Pilatus met hulle offers gemeng het.

column2: Luke 13:2 And Jesus answering said unto them, Suppose ye that these Galilaeans were sinners above all the Galilaeans, because they suffered such things?
column3: Lukas 13:2 En Jesus antwoord en sê vir hulle: Dink julle dat hierdie Galiléërs groter sondaars was as al die Galiléërs, omdat hulle sulke dinge gely het?

column2: Luke 13:3 I tell you, Nay: but, except ye repent, ye shall all likewise perish.
column3: Lukas 13:3 Nee, sê Ek vir julle; maar as julle jul nie bekeer nie, sal julle almal net so omkom.

column2: Luke 13:4 Or those eighteen, upon whom the tower in Siloam fell, and slew them, think ye that they were sinners above all men that dwelt in Jerusalem?
column3: Lukas 13:4 Of daardie agttien op wie die toring van Silóam geval en hulle gedood het — dink julle dat hulle meer skuldig was as al die mense wat in Jerusalem woon?

column2: Luke 13:5 I tell you, Nay: but, except ye repent, ye shall all likewise perish.
column3: Lukas 13:5 Nee, sê Ek vir julle; maar as julle jul nie bekeer nie, sal julle almal net so omkom.

column2: Luke 13:6 He spake also this parable; A certain [man] had a fig tree planted in his vineyard; and he came and sought fruit thereon, and found none.
column3: Lukas 13:6 EN Hy het hierdie gelykenis uitgespreek: ’n Man het ’n vyeboom gehad wat in sy wingerd geplant was, en hy het gekom en vrugte daaraan gesoek en niks gekry nie.

column2: Luke 13:7 Then said he unto the dresser of his vineyard, Behold, these three years I come seeking fruit on this fig tree, and find none: cut it down; why cumbereth it the ground?
column3: Lukas 13:7 Toe sê hy vir die tuinier: Kyk, drie jaar kom ek om vrugte aan hierdie vyeboom te soek en ek kry niks nie; kap hom uit. Waarvoor maak hy die grond nog onvrugbaar?

column2: Luke 13:8 And he answering said unto him, Lord, let it alone this year also, till I shall dig about it, and dung [it]:
column3: Lukas 13:8 Maar hy antwoord en sê vir hom: Meneer, laat hom nog hierdie jaar staan totdat ek om hom gespit en mis gegooi het.

column2: Luke 13:9 And if it bear fruit, [well]: and if not, [then] after that thou shalt cut it down.
column3: Lukas 13:9 As hy dan vrugte dra, goed; maar so nie, dan kan u hom anderjaar uitkap.

column2: Luke 13:10 And he was teaching in one of the synagogues on the sabbath.
column3: Lukas 13:10 EN Hy was besig om op die sabbat in een van die sinagoges te leer.

column2: Luke 13:11 And, behold, there was a woman which had a spirit of infirmity eighteen years, and was bowed together, and could in no wise lift up [herself].
column3: Lukas 13:11 En daar was ’n vrou wat ’n gees van krankheid agttien jaar lank gehad het, en sy was inmekaargetrek en glad nie in staat om regop te kom nie.

column2: Luke 13:12 And when Jesus saw her, he called [her to him], and said unto her, Woman, thou art loosed from thine infirmity.
column3: Lukas 13:12 En toe Jesus haar sien, roep Hy haar en sê: Vrou, jy is van jou krankheid verlos.

column2: Luke 13:13 And he laid [his] hands on her: and immediately she was made straight, and glorified God.
column3: Lukas 13:13 En Hy het haar die hande opgelê, en onmiddellik het sy regop gestaan en God verheerlik.

column2: Luke 13:14 And the ruler of the synagogue answered with indignation, because that Jesus had healed on the sabbath day, and said unto the people, There are six days in which men ought to work: in them therefore come and be healed, and not on the sabbath day.
column3: Lukas 13:14 Maar die owerste van die sinagoge, wat verontwaardig was dat Jesus op die sabbat genees het, antwoord en sê vir die skare: Daar is ses dae waarop ’n mens behoort te werk; kom dan op dié dae en laat julle genees en nie op die sabbatdag nie.

column2: Luke 13:15 The Lord then answered him, and said, [Thou] hypocrite, doth not each one of you on the sabbath loose his ox or [his] ass from the stall, and lead [him] away to watering?
column3: Lukas 13:15 Toe antwoord die Here hom en sê: Jou geveinsde, maak elkeen van julle nie op die sabbat sy os of esel van die krip los en lei hom weg om hom te laat drink nie?

column2: Luke 13:16 And ought not this woman, being a daughter of Abraham, whom Satan hath bound, lo, these eighteen years, be loosed from this bond on the sabbath day?
column3: Lukas 13:16 Maar hierdie vrou wat ’n dogter van Abraham is, wat die Satan — dink daaraan! — agttien jaar lank gebind het, moes sy nie van hierdie band op die sabbatdag verlos word nie?

column2: Luke 13:17 And when he had said these things, all his adversaries were ashamed: and all the people rejoiced for all the glorious things that were done by him.
column3: Lukas 13:17 En toe Hy dit sê, het al sy teëstanders beskaamd geword; en die hele skare was bly oor al die heerlike dinge wat deur Hom gebeur het.

column2: Luke 13:18 Then said he, Unto what is the kingdom of God like? and whereunto shall I resemble it?
column3: Lukas 13:18 EN Hy het gesê: Hoedanig is die koninkryk van God en waarmee sal Ek dit vergelyk?

column2: Luke 13:19 It is like a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and cast into his garden; and it grew, and waxed a great tree; and the fowls of the air lodged in the branches of it.
column3: Lukas 13:19 Dit is soos ’n mosterdsaad wat ’n man geneem en in sy tuin gesaai het; en dit het gegroei en ’n groot boom geword, en die voëls van die hemel het nes gemaak in sy takke.

column2: Luke 13:20 And again he said, Whereunto shall I liken the kingdom of God?
column3: Lukas 13:20 En weer het Hy gesê: Waarmee sal Ek die koninkryk van God vergelyk?

column2: Luke 13:21 It is like leaven, which a woman took and hid in three measures of meal, till the whole was leavened.
column3: Lukas 13:21 Dit is soos suurdeeg wat ’n vrou neem en in drie mate meel inwerk totdat dit heeltemal ingesuur is.

column2: Luke 13:22 And he went through the cities and villages, teaching, and journeying toward Jerusalem.
column3: Lukas 13:22 EN onderwyl Hy geleer het en op reis was na Jerusalem, het Hy stede en dorpe deurgegaan.

column2: Luke 13:23 Then said one unto him, Lord, are there few that be saved? And he said unto them,
column3: Lukas 13:23 Toe sê iemand vir Hom: Here, is die wat gered word, min? En Hy antwoord hulle:

column2: Luke 13:24 Strive to enter in at the strait gate: for many, I say unto you, will seek to enter in, and shall not be able.
column3: Lukas 13:24 Stry hard om in te gaan deur die nou poort, want baie, sê Ek vir julle, sal probeer om in te gaan en sal nie in staat wees nie.

column2: Luke 13:25 When once the master of the house is risen up, and hath shut to the door, and ye begin to stand without, and to knock at the door, saying, Lord, Lord, open unto us; and he shall answer and say unto you, I know you not whence ye are:
column3: Lukas 13:25 Wanneer die eienaar van die huis opgestaan en die deur gesluit het, en julle begin buitekant te staan en aan die deur te klop en te sê: Here, Here, maak vir ons oop — sal Hy antwoord en vir julle sê: Ek ken julle nie waar julle vandaan is nie.

column2: Luke 13:26 Then shall ye begin to say, We have eaten and drunk in thy presence, and thou hast taught in our streets.
column3: Lukas 13:26 Dan sal julle begin sê: Ons het in u teenwoordigheid geëet en gedrink, en U het op ons strate geleer.

column2: Luke 13:27 But he shall say, I tell you, I know you not whence ye are; depart from me, all [ye] workers of iniquity.
column3: Lukas 13:27 En Hy sal sê: Ek sê vir julle, Ek ken julle nie waar julle vandaan is nie. Gaan weg van My, al julle werkers van die ongeregtigheid!

column2: Luke 13:28 There shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth, when ye shall see Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, and all the prophets, in the kingdom of God, and you [yourselves] thrust out.
column3: Lukas 13:28 Daar sal geween wees en gekners van die tande, wanneer julle Abraham en Isak en Jakob en al die profete in die koninkryk van God sal sien, maar julle self uitgedryf buitentoe.

column2: Luke 13:29 And they shall come from the east, and [from] the west, and from the north, and [from] the south, and shall sit down in the kingdom of God.
column3: Lukas 13:29 En hulle sal kom van oos en wes en van noord en suid en aansit in die koninkryk van God.

column2: Luke 13:30 And, behold, there are last which shall be first, and there are first which shall be last.
column3: Lukas 13:30 En daar is laastes wat eerste sal wees, en daar is eerstes wat laaste sal wees.

column2: Luke 13:31 The same day there came certain of the Pharisees, saying unto him, Get thee out, and depart hence: for Herod will kill thee.
column3: Lukas 13:31 EN op dieselfde dag het sommige van die Fariseërs na Hom gekom en vir Hom gesê: Gaan weg en vertrek hiervandaan, want Herodes wil U om die lewe bring.

column2: Luke 13:32 And he said unto them, Go ye, and tell that fox, Behold, I cast out devils, and I do cures to day and to morrow, and the third [day] I shall be perfected.
column3: Lukas 13:32 En Hy het vir hulle gesê: Gaan vertel daardie jakkals: Kyk, Ek dryf duiwels uit en maak gesond, vandag en môre, en op die derde dag is Ek klaar.

column2: Luke 13:33 Nevertheless I must walk to day, and to morrow, and the [day] following: for it cannot be that a prophet perish out of Jerusalem.
column3: Lukas 13:33 Maar Ek moet vandag en môre en die volgende dag verder gaan, want dit kan nie gebeur dat ’n profeet buitekant Jerusalem omkom nie.

column2: Luke 13:34 O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, which killest the prophets, and stonest them that are sent unto thee; how often would I have gathered thy children together, as a hen [doth gather] her brood under [her] wings, and ye would not!
column3: Lukas 13:34 Jerusalem, Jerusalem, jy wat die profete doodmaak en die wat na jou gestuur is, stenig, hoe dikwels wou Ek jou kinders bymekaarmaak, soos ’n hen haar kuikens onder die vlerke, en julle wou nie.

column2: Luke 13:35 Behold, your house is left unto you desolate: and verily I say unto you, Ye shall not see me, until [the time] come when ye shall say, Blessed [is] he that cometh in the name of the Lord.
column3: Lukas 13:35 Kyk, julle huis word vir julle woes gelaat. Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle dat julle My sekerlik nie sal sien nie totdat die dag kom wanneer julle sal sê: Geseënd is Hy wat kom in die Naam van die Here!

column2: Luke 14:1 And it came to pass, as he went into the house of one of the chief Pharisees to eat bread on the sabbath day, that they watched him.
column3: Lukas 14:1 EN toe Hy in die huis van een van die owerstes van die Fariseërs gegaan het om brood te eet op die sabbat, het hulle Hom in die oog gehou.

column2: Luke 14:2 And, behold, there was a certain man before him which had the dropsy.
column3: Lukas 14:2 En daar was voor Hom ’n man wat die water gehad het.

column2: Luke 14:3 And Jesus answering spake unto the lawyers and Pharisees, saying, Is it lawful to heal on the sabbath day?
column3: Lukas 14:3 En Jesus het gespreek en aan die wetgeleerdes en Fariseërs gesê: Is dit geoorloof om op die sabbat te genees?

column2: Luke 14:4 And they held their peace. And he took [him], and healed him, and let him go;
column3: Lukas 14:4 Maar hulle het stilgebly. Toe neem Hy hom en maak hom gesond en laat hom gaan.

column2: Luke 14:5 And answered them, saying, Which of you shall have an ass or an ox fallen into a pit, and will not straightway pull him out on the sabbath day?
column3: Lukas 14:5 En Hy antwoord en sê vir hulle: Wie van julle se esel of os sal in ’n put val, wat dit nie dadelik op die sabbatdag sal uittrek nie?

column2: Luke 14:6 And they could not answer him again to these things.
column3: Lukas 14:6 En hulle kon Hom daarop nie antwoord nie.

column2: Luke 14:7 And he put forth a parable to those which were bidden, when he marked how they chose out the chief rooms; saying unto them,
column3: Lukas 14:7 EN toe Hy merk hoe hulle die voorste plekke uitkies, vertel Hy aan die genooides ’n gelykenis en sê vir hulle:

column2: Luke 14:8 When thou art bidden of any [man] to a wedding, sit not down in the highest room; lest a more honourable man than thou be bidden of him;
column3: Lukas 14:8 Wanneer jy deur iemand na ’n bruilof uitgenooi is, moenie die voorste plek inneem nie, ingeval daar nie miskien een wat waardiger is as jy deur hom uitgenooi is nie,

column2: Luke 14:9 And he that bade thee and him come and say to thee, Give this man place; and thou begin with shame to take the lowest room.
column3: Lukas 14:9 en hy wat jou en hom genooi het, kom en vir jou sê: Maak plek vir hierdie man. En dan sal jy met skaamte die agterste plek begin inneem.

column2: Luke 14:10 But when thou art bidden, go and sit down in the lowest room; that when he that bade thee cometh, he may say unto thee, Friend, go up higher: then shalt thou have worship in the presence of them that sit at meat with thee.
column3: Lukas 14:10 Maar wanneer jy genooi is, gaan en neem die agterste plek in; sodat wanneer hy kom wat jou genooi het, hy vir jou kan sê: Vriend, gaan hoër op! Dan sal jy eer hê voor die wat saam met jou aan tafel is.

column2: Luke 14:11 For whosoever exalteth himself shall be abased; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted.
column3: Lukas 14:11 Want elkeen wat homself verhoog, sal verneder word, en wat homself verneder, sal verhoog word.

column2: Luke 14:12 Then said he also to him that bade him, When thou makest a dinner or a supper, call not thy friends, nor thy brethren, neither thy kinsmen, nor [thy] rich neighbours; lest they also bid thee again, and a recompence be made thee.
column3: Lukas 14:12 En Hy sê ook vir die man wat Hom genooi het: Wanneer jy ’n môre- of middagete gee, moenie jou vriende nooi, of jou broers of bloedverwante of ryk bure nie, sodat hulle jou nie miskien ook eendag weer uitnooi en jy vergelding ontvang nie.

column2: Luke 14:13 But when thou makest a feast, call the poor, the maimed, the lame, the blind:
column3: Lukas 14:13 Maar wanneer jy ’n feesmaal gee, nooi armes, verminktes, kreupeles, blindes,

column2: Luke 14:14 And thou shalt be blessed; for they cannot recompense thee: for thou shalt be recompensed at the resurrection of the just.
column3: Lukas 14:14 en jy sal gelukkig wees, omdat hulle niks het om jou te vergeld nie; want dit sal jou vergeld word in die opstanding van die regverdiges.

column2: Luke 14:15 And when one of them that sat at meat with him heard these things, he said unto him, Blessed [is] he that shall eat bread in the kingdom of God.
column3: Lukas 14:15 EN toe een van die wat saam aan tafel was, dit hoor, sê hy vir Hom: Salig is hy wat brood eet in die koninkryk van God.

column2: Luke 14:16 Then said he unto him, A certain man made a great supper, and bade many:
column3: Lukas 14:16 Maar Hy antwoord hom: ’n Sekere man het ’n groot maaltyd gegee en baie mense uitgenooi.

column2: Luke 14:17 And sent his servant at supper time to say to them that were bidden, Come; for all things are now ready.
column3: Lukas 14:17 En op die uur van die maaltyd het hy sy dienskneg uitgestuur om vir die genooides te sê: Kom, want alles is nou gereed.

column2: Luke 14:18 And they all with one [consent] began to make excuse. The first said unto him, I have bought a piece of ground, and I must needs go and see it: I pray thee have me excused.
column3: Lukas 14:18 En hulle het hul almal eenparig begin verontskuldig. Die eerste het vir hom gesê: Ek het ’n stuk grond gekoop en ek moet noodsaaklik uitgaan om daarna te kyk Ek vra u, verskoon my tog.

column2: Luke 14:19 And another said, I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I go to prove them: I pray thee have me excused.
column3: Lukas 14:19 En ’n ander een het gesê: Ek het vyf paar osse gekoop en gaan hulle probeer. Ek vra u, verskoon my tog.

column2: Luke 14:20 And another said, I have married a wife, and therefore I cannot come.
column3: Lukas 14:20 En ’n ander een het gesê: Ek het ’n vrou getrou en daarom kan ek nie kom nie.

column2: Luke 14:21 So that servant came, and shewed his lord these things. Then the master of the house being angry said to his servant, Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city, and bring in hither the poor, and the maimed, and the halt, and the blind.
column3: Lukas 14:21 En daardie dienskneg het gekom en dié dinge aan sy heer vertel. Toe het die eienaar van die huis kwaad geword en vir sy dienskneg gesê: Gaan gou uit in die strate en die gangetjies van die stad en bring die armes en verminktes en kreupeles en blindes hier in.

column2: Luke 14:22 And the servant said, Lord, it is done as thou hast commanded, and yet there is room.
column3: Lukas 14:22 En die dienskneg het gesê: Meneer, wat u beveel het, is gedoen, en daar is nog plek.

column2: Luke 14:23 And the lord said unto the servant, Go out into the highways and hedges, and compel [them] to come in, that my house may be filled.
column3: Lukas 14:23 Toe sê die heer vir die dienskneg: Gaan uit op die paaie en na die lanings en dwing hulle om in te kom, sodat my huis vol kan word.

column2: Luke 14:24 For I say unto you, That none of those men which were bidden shall taste of my supper.
column3: Lukas 14:24 Want ek sê vir julle dat nie een van daardie manne wat genooi is, my maaltyd sal smaak nie.

column2: Luke 14:25 And there went great multitudes with him: and he turned, and said unto them,
column3: Lukas 14:25 EN groot menigtes het saam met Hom gegaan, en Hy het Hom omgedraai en vir hulle gesê:

column2: Luke 14:26 If any [man] come to me, and hate not his father, and mother, and wife, and children, and brethren, and sisters, yea, and his own life also, he cannot be my disciple.
column3: Lukas 14:26 As iemand na My toe kom en hy haat nie sy vader en moeder en vrou en kinders en broers en susters, ja, selfs ook sy eie lewe nie, kan hy my dissipel nie wees nie.

column2: Luke 14:27 And whosoever doth not bear his cross, and come after me, cannot be my disciple.
column3: Lukas 14:27 En elkeen wat sy kruis nie dra en agter My aan kom nie, kan my dissipel nie wees nie.

column2: Luke 14:28 For which of you, intending to build a tower, sitteth not down first, and counteth the cost, whether he have [sufficient] to finish [it]?
column3: Lukas 14:28 Want wie van julle wat ’n toring wil bou, gaan nie eers sit en die koste bereken, of hy die middele het om dit uit te voer nie? —

column2: Luke 14:29 Lest haply, after he hath laid the foundation, and is not able to finish [it], all that behold [it] begin to mock him,
column3: Lukas 14:29 sodat as hy die fondament gelê het en nie in staat is om dit te voltooi nie, almal wat dit sien, nie miskien met hom sal begin spot

column2: Luke 14:30 Saying, This man began to build, and was not able to finish.
column3: Lukas 14:30 en sê: Hierdie man het begin bou en kon nie klaarkry nie.

column2: Luke 14:31 Or what king, going to make war against another king, sitteth not down first, and consulteth whether he be able with ten thousand to meet him that cometh against him with twenty thousand?
column3: Lukas 14:31 Of watter koning wat optrek om teen ’n ander koning slag te lewer, gaan nie eers sit en beraadslaag of hy in staat is om met tienduisend die een te ontmoet wat met twintigduisend teen hom kom nie?

column2: Luke 14:32 Or else, while the other is yet a great way off, he sendeth an ambassage, and desireth conditions of peace.
column3: Lukas 14:32 Anders stuur hy ’n gesantskap as die ander een nog ver is, en vra vredesvoorwaardes.

column2: Luke 14:33 So likewise, whosoever he be of you that forsaketh not all that he hath, he cannot be my disciple.
column3: Lukas 14:33 So kan dan ook niemand van julle wat nie afsien van al sy besittings, my dissipel wees nie.

column2: Luke 14:34 Salt [is] good: but if the salt have lost his savour, wherewith shall it be seasoned?
column3: Lukas 14:34 Die sout is goed, maar as die sout laf geword het, waarmee sal dit smaaklik gemaak word?

column2: Luke 14:35 It is neither fit for the land, nor yet for the dunghill; [but] men cast it out. He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
column3: Lukas 14:35 Dit is nie bruikbaar vir die grond of vir die ashoop nie. Hulle gooi dit buitekant weg. Wie ore het om te hoor, laat hom hoor.

column2: Luke 15:1 Then drew near unto him all the publicans and sinners for to hear him.
column3: Lukas 15:1 EN al die tollenaars en sondaars het die gewoonte gehad om na Hom te kom en na Hom te luister.

column2: Luke 15:2 And the Pharisees and scribes murmured, saying, This man receiveth sinners, and eateth with them.
column3: Lukas 15:2 En die Fariseërs en die skrifgeleerdes het baie gemurmureer en gesê: Hierdie man ontvang sondaars en eet saam met hulle.

column2: Luke 15:3 And he spake this parable unto them, saying,
column3: Lukas 15:3 Toe vertel Hy aan hulle hierdie gelykenis en sê:

column2: Luke 15:4 What man of you, having an hundred sheep, if he lose one of them, doth not leave the ninety and nine in the wilderness, and go after that which is lost, until he find it?
column3: Lukas 15:4 Watter man onder julle wat honderd skape het en een van hulle verloor, laat nie die negen-en-negentig in die woestyn staan en gaan agter die een aan wat verlore is totdat hy dit kry nie?

column2: Luke 15:5 And when he hath found [it], he layeth [it] on his shoulders, rejoicing.
column3: Lukas 15:5 En as hy dit kry, sit hy dit met blydskap op sy skouers.

column2: Luke 15:6 And when he cometh home, he calleth together [his] friends and neighbours, saying unto them, Rejoice with me; for I have found my sheep which was lost.
column3: Lukas 15:6 En as hy by die huis kom, roep hy sy vriende en bure bymekaar en sê vir hulle: Wees saam met my bly, want ek het my skaap gekry wat verlore was.

column2: Luke 15:7 I say unto you, that likewise joy shall be in heaven over one sinner that repenteth, more than over ninety and nine just persons, which need no repentance.
column3: Lukas 15:7 Ek sê vir julle dat daar net so blydskap sal wees in die hemel oor een sondaar wat hom bekeer, meer as oor negen-en-negentig regverdiges wat die bekering nie nodig het nie.

column2: Luke 15:8 Either what woman having ten pieces of silver, if she lose one piece, doth not light a candle, and sweep the house, and seek diligently till she find [it]?
column3: Lukas 15:8 Of watter vrou wat tien pennings het, as sy een penning verloor, steek nie ’n lamp op en vee die huis uit en soek sorgvuldig totdat sy dit kry nie?

column2: Luke 15:9 And when she hath found [it], she calleth [her] friends and [her] neighbours together, saying, Rejoice with me; for I have found the piece which I had lost.
column3: Lukas 15:9 En as sy dit kry, roep sy haar vriendinne en buurvroue bymekaar en sê: Wees saam met my bly, want ek het die penning gekry wat ek verloor het.

column2: Luke 15:10 Likewise, I say unto you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner that repenteth.
column3: Lukas 15:10 So, sê Ek vir julle, is daar blydskap voor die engele van God oor een sondaar wat hom bekeer.

column2: Luke 15:11 And he said, A certain man had two sons:
column3: Lukas 15:11 HY het ook gesê: ’n Man het twee seuns gehad.

column2: Luke 15:12 And the younger of them said to [his] father, Father, give me the portion of goods that falleth [to me]. And he divided unto them [his] living.
column3: Lukas 15:12 En die jongste van hulle het vir sy vader gesê: Vader, gee my die deel van die eiendom wat my toekom. En hy het die goed tussen hulle verdeel.

column2: Luke 15:13 And not many days after the younger son gathered all together, and took his journey into a far country, and there wasted his substance with riotous living.
column3: Lukas 15:13 En nie baie dae daarna nie het die jongste seun alles bymekaargemaak en weggereis na ’n ver land. En daar het hy sy eiendom verkwis deur losbandig te lewe.

column2: Luke 15:14 And when he had spent all, there arose a mighty famine in that land; and he began to be in want.
column3: Lukas 15:14 En toe hy alles deurgebring het, kom daar ’n swaar hongersnood in daardie land, en hy het begin gebrek ly.

column2: Luke 15:15 And he went and joined himself to a citizen of that country; and he sent him into his fields to feed swine.
column3: Lukas 15:15 Toe het hy hom by een van die burgers van daardie land gaan voeg. En dié het hom in sy veld gestuur om varke op te pas.

column2: Luke 15:16 And he would fain have filled his belly with the husks that the swine did eat: and no man gave unto him.
column3: Lukas 15:16 En hy het verlang om sy maag te vul met die peule wat die varke eet, en niemand het dit aan hom gegee nie.

column2: Luke 15:17 And when he came to himself, he said, How many hired servants of my father's have bread enough and to spare, and I perish with hunger!
column3: Lukas 15:17 Maar hy het tot homself gekom en gesê: Hoe baie huurlinge van my vader het oorvloed van brood, en ek vergaan van honger!

column2: Luke 15:18 I will arise and go to my father, and will say unto him, Father, I have sinned against heaven, and before thee,
column3: Lukas 15:18 Ek sal opstaan en na my vader gaan, en ek sal vir hom sê: Vader, ek het gesondig teen die hemel en voor u,

column2: Luke 15:19 And am no more worthy to be called thy son: make me as one of thy hired servants.
column3: Lukas 15:19 en ek is nie meer werd om u seun genoem te word nie; maak my soos een van u huurlinge.

column2: Luke 15:20 And he arose, and came to his father. But when he was yet a great way off, his father saw him, and had compassion, and ran, and fell on his neck, and kissed him.
column3: Lukas 15:20 En hy het opgestaan en na sy vader gegaan. En toe hy nog ver was, het sy vader hom gesien en innig jammer vir hom gevoel en gehardloop en hom omhels en hartlik gesoen.

column2: Luke 15:21 And the son said unto him, Father, I have sinned against heaven, and in thy sight, and am no more worthy to be called thy son.
column3: Lukas 15:21 En die seun sê vir hom: Vader, ek het gesondig teen die hemel en voor u en ek is nie meer werd om u seun genoem te word nie.

column2: Luke 15:22 But the father said to his servants, Bring forth the best robe, and put [it] on him; and put a ring on his hand, and shoes on [his] feet:
column3: Lukas 15:22 Maar die vader sê vir sy diensknegte: Bring die beste kleed en trek hom dit aan, en gee ’n ring vir sy hand en skoene vir sy voete.

column2: Luke 15:23 And bring hither the fatted calf, and kill [it]; and let us eat, and be merry:
column3: Lukas 15:23 En bring die vetgemaakte kalf en slag dit, en laat ons eet en vrolik wees.

column2: Luke 15:24 For this my son was dead, and is alive again; he was lost, and is found. And they began to be merry.
column3: Lukas 15:24 Want hierdie seun van my was dood en het weer lewendig geword; en hy was verlore en is gevind. En hulle het begin vrolik word.

column2: Luke 15:25 Now his elder son was in the field: and as he came and drew nigh to the house, he heard musick and dancing.
column3: Lukas 15:25 En sy oudste seun was in die veld, en terwyl hy al nader na die huis kom, hoor hy musiek en beurtsange.

column2: Luke 15:26 And he called one of the servants, and asked what these things meant.
column3: Lukas 15:26 En hy roep een van die diensknegte na hom toe en vra wat dit beteken.

column2: Luke 15:27 And he said unto him, Thy brother is come; and thy father hath killed the fatted calf, because he hath received him safe and sound.
column3: Lukas 15:27 Dié sê toe vir hom: U broer het gekom, en u vader het die vetgemaakte kalf geslag, omdat hy hom gesond teruggekry het.

column2: Luke 15:28 And he was angry, and would not go in: therefore came his father out, and intreated him.
column3: Lukas 15:28 En hy het kwaad geword en wou nie binnegaan nie. Sy vader gaan toe uit en smeek hom.

column2: Luke 15:29 And he answering said to [his] father, Lo, these many years do I serve thee, neither transgressed I at any time thy commandment: and yet thou never gavest me a kid, that I might make merry with my friends:
column3: Lukas 15:29 Maar hy antwoord en sê vir sy vader: Kyk, ek dien u so baie jare en ek het nooit u gebod oortree nie, en vir my het u nooit ’n bokkie gegee, sodat ek saam met my vriende vrolik kon wees nie.

column2: Luke 15:30 But as soon as this thy son was come, which hath devoured thy living with harlots, thou hast killed for him the fatted calf.
column3: Lukas 15:30 Maar toe hierdie seun van u kom, wat u goed met hoere deurgebring het, het u vir hom die vetgemaakte kalf geslag.

column2: Luke 15:31 And he said unto him, Son, thou art ever with me, and all that I have is thine.
column3: Lukas 15:31 Toe sê hy vir hom: Kind, jy is altyd by my, en al wat myne is, is joue.

column2: Luke 15:32 It was meet that we should make merry, and be glad: for this thy brother was dead, and is alive again; and was lost, and is found.
column3: Lukas 15:32 Ons moet tog vrolik en bly wees, want hierdie broer van jou was dood en het weer lewendig geword, en hy was verlore en is gevind.

column2: Luke 16:1 And he said also unto his disciples, There was a certain rich man, which had a steward; and the same was accused unto him that he had wasted his goods.
column3: Lukas 16:1 EN Hy het ook aan sy dissipels gesê: Daar was ’n ryk man wat ’n bestuurder gehad het; en hy is by hom aangeklaag as een wat sy besittings verkwis.

column2: Luke 16:2 And he called him, and said unto him, How is it that I hear this of thee? give an account of thy stewardship; for thou mayest be no longer steward.
column3: Lukas 16:2 En hy het hom geroep en vir hom gesê: Wat is dit wat ek van jou hoor? Gee verslag van jou bestuur van sake; want jy sal nie meer bestuurder kan wees nie.

column2: Luke 16:3 Then the steward said within himself, What shall I do? for my lord taketh away from me the stewardship: I cannot dig; to beg I am ashamed.
column3: Lukas 16:3 Toe sê die bestuurder by homself: Wat sal ek doen? Want my heer neem die bestuurderskap van my weg. Spit kan ek nie; om te bedel, skaam ek my.

column2: Luke 16:4 I am resolved what to do, that, when I am put out of the stewardship, they may receive me into their houses.
column3: Lukas 16:4 Ek weet wat ek sal doen, sodat wanneer ek van die bestuurderskap afgesit is, hulle my in hulle huise kan ontvang.

column2: Luke 16:5 So he called every one of his lord's debtors [unto him], and said unto the first, How much owest thou unto my lord?
column3: Lukas 16:5 Toe roep hy die skuldenaars van sy heer, een vir een, en sê vir die eerste: Hoeveel skuld jy aan my heer?

column2: Luke 16:6 And he said, An hundred measures of oil. And he said unto him, Take thy bill, and sit down quickly, and write fifty.
column3: Lukas 16:6 En hy antwoord: Honderd vat olie. En hy sê vir hom: Neem jou skuldbewys, gaan sit en skryf gou vyftig.

column2: Luke 16:7 Then said he to another, And how much owest thou? And he said, An hundred measures of wheat. And he said unto him, Take thy bill, and write fourscore.
column3: Lukas 16:7 Daarna sê hy vir ’n ander een: En jy, hoeveel skuld jy? En hy antwoord: Honderd mud koring. Toe sê hy vir hom: Neem jou skuldbewys en skryf tagtig.

column2: Luke 16:8 And the lord commended the unjust steward, because he had done wisely: for the children of this world are in their generation wiser than the children of light.
column3: Lukas 16:8 En die heer het die onregverdige bestuurder geprys, omdat hy verstandig gehandel het; want die kinders van hierdie wêreld is verstandiger teenoor hulle geslag as die kinders van die lig.

column2: Luke 16:9 And I say unto you, Make to yourselves friends of the mammon of unrighteousness; that, when ye fail, they may receive you into everlasting habitations.
column3: Lukas 16:9 En Ek sê vir julle: Maak vir julle vriende deur die onregverdige Mammon, sodat wanneer julle die lewe verlaat, hulle jul in die ewige tente kan ontvang.

column2: Luke 16:10 He that is faithful in that which is least is faithful also in much: and he that is unjust in the least is unjust also in much.
column3: Lukas 16:10 Hy wat getrou is in die minste, is ook in die grote getrou; en hy wat onregverdig is in die minste, is ook in die grote onregverdig.

column2: Luke 16:11 If therefore ye have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon, who will commit to your trust the true [riches]?
column3: Lukas 16:11 As julle dan nie getrou was in die onregverdige Mammon nie, wie sal julle die ware goed toevertrou?

column2: Luke 16:12 And if ye have not been faithful in that which is another man's, who shall give you that which is your own?
column3: Lukas 16:12 En as julle nie getrou was in ’n ander se goed nie, wie sal aan julle jul eie gee?

column2: Luke 16:13 No servant can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.
column3: Lukas 16:13 Geen huiskneg kan twee here dien nie; want hy sal òf die een haat en die ander een liefhê, òf die een aanhang en die ander een verag. Julle kan nie God én Mammon dien nie.

column2: Luke 16:14 And the Pharisees also, who were covetous, heard all these things: and they derided him.
column3: Lukas 16:14 EN die Fariseërs, wat geldgierig was, het ook al hierdie dinge gehoor en Hom beskimp.

column2: Luke 16:15 And he said unto them, Ye are they which justify yourselves before men; but God knoweth your hearts: for that which is highly esteemed among men is abomination in the sight of God.
column3: Lukas 16:15 En Hy het vir hulle gesê: Dit is julle wat julself regverdig voor die mense, maar God ken julle harte; want wat by die mens hoog geag word, is ’n gruwel voor God.

column2: Luke 16:16 The law and the prophets [were] until John: since that time the kingdom of God is preached, and every man presseth into it.
column3: Lukas 16:16 Die wet en die profete was tot op Johannes; van toe af word die evangelie van die koninkryk van God verkondig, en elkeen dring met geweld daarin.

column2: Luke 16:17 And it is easier for heaven and earth to pass, than one tittle of the law to fail.
column3: Lukas 16:17 Maar dit is makliker dat die hemel en die aarde verbygaan as dat een tittel van die wet sou val.

column2: Luke 16:18 Whosoever putteth away his wife, and marrieth another, committeth adultery: and whosoever marrieth her that is put away from [her] husband committeth adultery.
column3: Lukas 16:18 Elkeen wat van sy vrou skei en ’n ander een trou, pleeg egbreuk; en elkeen wat trou met die vrou wat van haar man geskei is, pleeg egbreuk.

column2: Luke 16:19 There was a certain rich man, which was clothed in purple and fine linen, and fared sumptuously every day:
column3: Lukas 16:19 EN daar was ’n ryk man, en hy het purper en fyn linne gedra en elke dag vrolik en weelderig gelewe.

column2: Luke 16:20 And there was a certain beggar named Lazarus, which was laid at his gate, full of sores,
column3: Lukas 16:20 En daar was ’n bedelaar met die naam van Lasarus wat vol swere voor sy poort gelê het.

column2: Luke 16:21 And desiring to be fed with the crumbs which fell from the rich man's table: moreover the dogs came and licked his sores.
column3: Lukas 16:21 En hy het verlang om hom te versadig met die krummels wat van die ryk man se tafel val. Ja, selfs die honde het gekom en sy swere gelek.

column2: Luke 16:22 And it came to pass, that the beggar died, and was carried by the angels into Abraham's bosom: the rich man also died, and was buried;
column3: Lukas 16:22 En toe die bedelaar sterf, is hy deur die engele weggedra na die boesem van Abraham.

column2: Luke 16:23 And in hell he lift up his eyes, being in torments, and seeth Abraham afar off, and Lazarus in his bosom.
column3: Lukas 16:23 En die ryk man het ook gesterwe en is begrawe. En toe hy in die doderyk sy oë ophef, terwyl hy in smarte was, sien hy Abraham van ver af en Lasarus aan sy boesem.

column2: Luke 16:24 And he cried and said, Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus, that he may dip the tip of his finger in water, and cool my tongue; for I am tormented in this flame.
column3: Lukas 16:24 En hy roep en sê: Vader Abraham, wees my barmhartig en stuur Lasarus, dat hy die punt van sy vinger in water kan insteek en my tong verkoel; want ek ly smarte in hierdie vlam.

column2: Luke 16:25 But Abraham said, Son, remember that thou in thy lifetime receivedst thy good things, and likewise Lazarus evil things: but now he is comforted, and thou art tormented.
column3: Lukas 16:25 Maar Abraham antwoord: Kind, onthou dat jy jou goeie dinge in jou lewe ontvang het, en so ook Lasarus die slegte. En nou word hy getroos, maar jy ly smarte.

column2: Luke 16:26 And beside all this, between us and you there is a great gulf fixed: so that they which would pass from hence to you cannot; neither can they pass to us, that [would come] from thence.
column3: Lukas 16:26 En by dit alles is daar tussen ons en julle ’n groot kloof gevestig, sodat die wat hiervandaan wil oorgaan na julle, nie kan nie; en die wat dáár is, nie na ons kan oorkom nie.

column2: Luke 16:27 Then he said, I pray thee therefore, father, that thou wouldest send him to my father's house:
column3: Lukas 16:27 En hy sê: Ek bid u dan, vader, om hom na my vader se huis te stuur —

column2: Luke 16:28 For I have five brethren; that he may testify unto them, lest they also come into this place of torment.
column3: Lukas 16:28 want ek het vyf broers — om hulle dringend te waarsku, sodat hulle nie ook in hierdie plek van pyniging kom nie.

column2: Luke 16:29 Abraham saith unto him, They have Moses and the prophets; let them hear them.
column3: Lukas 16:29 Toe sê Abraham vir hom: Hulle het Moses en die Profete; laat hulle na dié luister.

column2: Luke 16:30 And he said, Nay, father Abraham: but if one went unto them from the dead, they will repent.
column3: Lukas 16:30 Maar hy antwoord: Nee, vader Abraham, maar as iemand uit die dode na hulle gaan, sal hulle hul bekeer.

column2: Luke 16:31 And he said unto him, If they hear not Moses and the prophets, neither will they be persuaded, though one rose from the dead.
column3: Lukas 16:31 Maar hy sê vir hom: As hulle na Moses en die Profete nie luister nie, sal hulle nie oortuig word nie, al sou iemand ook uit die dode opstaan.

column2: Luke 17:1 Then said he unto the disciples, It is impossible but that offences will come: but woe [unto him], through whom they come!
column3: Lukas 17:1 EN Hy het vir sy dissipels gesê: Dit is onvermydelik dat die struikelblokke kom, maar wee hom deur wie hulle kom.

column2: Luke 17:2 It were better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck, and he cast into the sea, than that he should offend one of these little ones.
column3: Lukas 17:2 Dit is beter vir hom as ’n meulsteen aan sy nek gehang en hy in die see gegooi word, as dat hy een van hierdie kleintjies sou laat struikel.

column2: Luke 17:3 Take heed to yourselves: If thy brother trespass against thee, rebuke him; and if he repent, forgive him.
column3: Lukas 17:3 Pas op vir julleself. En as jou broeder teen jou sondig, bestraf hom; en as hy berou kry, vergewe hom.

column2: Luke 17:4 And if he trespass against thee seven times in a day, and seven times in a day turn again to thee, saying, I repent; thou shalt forgive him.
column3: Lukas 17:4 En as hy sewe maal op ’n dag teen jou sondig en sewe maal op ’n dag na jou terugkom en sê: Ek het berou — moet jy hom vergewe.

column2: Luke 17:5 And the apostles said unto the Lord, Increase our faith.
column3: Lukas 17:5 Toe het die apostels aan die Here gesê: Gee ons meer geloof.

column2: Luke 17:6 And the Lord said, If ye had faith as a grain of mustard seed, ye might say unto this sycamine tree, Be thou plucked up by the root, and be thou planted in the sea; and it should obey you.
column3: Lukas 17:6 En die Here sê: As julle geloof gehad het soos ’n mosterdsaad, sou julle vir hierdie moerbeiboom sê: Word ontwortel en in die see geplant — en hy sou julle gehoorsaam wees.

column2: Luke 17:7 But which of you, having a servant plowing or feeding cattle, will say unto him by and by, when he is come from the field, Go and sit down to meat?
column3: Lukas 17:7 En wie is daar van julle wat ’n dienskneg het wat ploeg of vee oppas, en as hy inkom van die veld vir hom sal sê: Kom dadelik hier aan tafel?

column2: Luke 17:8 And will not rather say unto him, Make ready wherewith I may sup, and gird thyself, and serve me, till I have eaten and drunken; and afterward thou shalt eat and drink?
column3: Lukas 17:8 Sal hy nie eerder vir hom sê nie: Maak vir my die aandete klaar en omgord jou en bedien my totdat ek geëet en gedrink het; en daarna kan jy eet en drink?

column2: Luke 17:9 Doth he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded him? I trow not.
column3: Lukas 17:9 Bedank hy daardie dienskneg, omdat hy gedoen het wat hom beveel is? Ek glo nie.

column2: Luke 17:10 So likewise ye, when ye shall have done all those things which are commanded you, say, We are unprofitable servants: we have done that which was our duty to do.
column3: Lukas 17:10 So ook julle, wanneer julle alles gedoen het wat julle beveel is, sê dan: Ons is onverdienstelike diensknegte, want ons het gedoen wat ons verplig was om te doen.

column2: Luke 17:11 And it came to pass, as he went to Jerusalem, that he passed through the midst of Samaria and Galilee.
column3: Lukas 17:11 EN op sy reis na Jerusalem het Hy deur Samaría en Galiléa gegaan.

column2: Luke 17:12 And as he entered into a certain village, there met him ten men that were lepers, which stood afar off:
column3: Lukas 17:12 En toe Hy in ’n sekere dorp ingaan, kom tien melaatse manne Hom tegemoet, wat op ’n afstand bly staan het.

column2: Luke 17:13 And they lifted up [their] voices, and said, Jesus, Master, have mercy on us.
column3: Lukas 17:13 En hulle het hul stem verhef en gesê: Jesus, Meester, wees ons barmhartig!

column2: Luke 17:14 And when he saw [them], he said unto them, Go shew yourselves unto the priests. And it came to pass, that, as they went, they were cleansed.
column3: Lukas 17:14 En toe Hy hulle sien, sê Hy vir hulle: Gaan vertoon julle aan die priesters. En onderwyl hulle weggaan, het hulle rein geword.

column2: Luke 17:15 And one of them, when he saw that he was healed, turned back, and with a loud voice glorified God,
column3: Lukas 17:15 En een van hulle, toe hy sien dat hy gesond was, het omgedraai en God met ’n groot stem verheerlik.

column2: Luke 17:16 And fell down on [his] face at his feet, giving him thanks: and he was a Samaritan.
column3: Lukas 17:16 En hy het op sy aangesig neergeval by sy voete en Hom gedank. En hy was ’n Samaritaan.

column2: Luke 17:17 And Jesus answering said, Were there not ten cleansed? but where [are] the nine?
column3: Lukas 17:17 Toe antwoord Jesus en sê: Het tien nie rein geword nie? En waar is die nege?

column2: Luke 17:18 There are not found that returned to give glory to God, save this stranger.
column3: Lukas 17:18 Was daar niemand onder hulle te vinde wat omgedraai het om God te verheerlik behalwe hierdie vreemdeling nie?

column2: Luke 17:19 And he said unto him, Arise, go thy way: thy faith hath made thee whole.
column3: Lukas 17:19 En Hy sê vir hom: Staan op en gaan; jou geloof het jou gered.

column2: Luke 17:20 And when he was demanded of the Pharisees, when the kingdom of God should come, he answered them and said, The kingdom of God cometh not with observation:
column3: Lukas 17:20 EN toe Hy deur die Fariseërs gevra is wanneer die koninkryk van God sal kom, het Hy hulle geantwoord en gesê: Die koninkryk van God kom nie met sigbare tekens nie.

column2: Luke 17:21 Neither shall they say, Lo here! or, lo there! for, behold, the kingdom of God is within you.
column3: Lukas 17:21 En hulle sal nie sê: Kyk hier! of: Kyk daar! nie; want die koninkryk van God is binne-in julle.

column2: Luke 17:22 And he said unto the disciples, The days will come, when ye shall desire to see one of the days of the Son of man, and ye shall not see [it].
column3: Lukas 17:22 En Hy sê vir sy dissipels: Daar sal dae kom wanneer julle sal begeer om een van die dae van die Seun van die mens te sien, en julle sal dit nie sien nie.

column2: Luke 17:23 And they shall say to you, See here; or, see there: go not after [them], nor follow [them].
column3: Lukas 17:23 En hulle sal vir julle sê: Kyk hier! of: Kyk daar! Moenie gaan nie en moenie agterna loop nie.

column2: Luke 17:24 For as the lightning, that lighteneth out of the one [part] under heaven, shineth unto the other [part] under heaven; so shall also the Son of man be in his day.
column3: Lukas 17:24 Want soos die weerlig wat van die een kant onder die hemel blits en tot by die ander kant onder die hemel skyn, so sal die Seun van die mens ook in sy dag wees.

column2: Luke 17:25 But first must he suffer many things, and be rejected of this generation.
column3: Lukas 17:25 Maar eers moet Hy baie ly en deur hierdie geslag verwerp word.

column2: Luke 17:26 And as it was in the days of Noe, so shall it be also in the days of the Son of man.
column3: Lukas 17:26 En soos dit gebeur het in die dae van Noag, so sal dit ook wees in die dae van die Seun van die mens:

column2: Luke 17:27 They did eat, they drank, they married wives, they were given in marriage, until the day that Noe entered into the ark, and the flood came, and destroyed them all.
column3: Lukas 17:27 hulle het geëet en gedrink, hulle het getrou en is in die huwelik gegee tot op die dag dat Noag in die ark ingegaan het, en die sondvloed gekom en almal vernietig het.

column2: Luke 17:28 Likewise also as it was in the days of Lot; they did eat, they drank, they bought, they sold, they planted, they builded;
column3: Lukas 17:28 Net soos dit ook gebeur het in die dae van Lot: hulle het geëet en gedrink, gekoop en verkoop, hulle het geplant en gebou.

column2: Luke 17:29 But the same day that Lot went out of Sodom it rained fire and brimstone from heaven, and destroyed [them] all.
column3: Lukas 17:29 Maar op die dag toe Lot van Sodom uitgaan, het vuur en swawel van die hemel af gereën en almal vernietig.

column2: Luke 17:30 Even thus shall it be in the day when the Son of man is revealed.
column3: Lukas 17:30 Net so sal dit wees in die dag wanneer die Seun van die mens geopenbaar word.

column2: Luke 17:31 In that day, he which shall be upon the housetop, and his stuff in the house, let him not come down to take it away: and he that is in the field, let him likewise not return back.
column3: Lukas 17:31 In daardie dag moet hy wat op die dak sal wees, terwyl sy huisraad in die huis is, nie afkom om dit weg te neem nie; en so ook moet hy wat op die land sal wees, nie omdraai na wat agter is nie.

column2: Luke 17:32 Remember Lot's wife.
column3: Lukas 17:32 Dink aan die vrou van Lot!

column2: Luke 17:33 Whosoever shall seek to save his life shall lose it; and whosoever shall lose his life shall preserve it.
column3: Lukas 17:33 Elkeen wat probeer om sy lewe te red, sal dit verloor; en elkeen wat dit verloor, sal dit behou.

column2: Luke 17:34 I tell you, in that night there shall be two [men] in one bed; the one shall be taken, and the other shall be left.
column3: Lukas 17:34 Ek sê vir julle: In daardie nag sal daar twee op een bed wees; die een sal aangeneem en die ander verlaat word.

column2: Luke 17:35 Two [women] shall be grinding together; the one shall be taken, and the other left.
column3: Lukas 17:35 Twee vroue sal saam maal; die een sal aangeneem en die ander verlaat word.

column2: Luke 17:36 Two [men] shall be in the field; the one shall be taken, and the other left.
column3: Lukas 17:36 Twee sal op die land wees; die een sal aangeneem en die ander verlaat word.

column2: Luke 17:37 And they answered and said unto him, Where, Lord? And he said unto them, Wheresoever the body [is], thither will the eagles be gathered together.
column3: Lukas 17:37 En hulle antwoord en sê vir Hom: Waar, Here? En Hy sê vir hulle: Waar die liggaam lê, daar sal die aasvoëls saamkom.

column2: Luke 18:1 And he spake a parable unto them [to this end], that men ought always to pray, and not to faint;
column3: Lukas 18:1 EN Hy het ook aan hulle ’n gelykenis vertel met die oog daarop dat ’n mens gedurig moet bid en nie moedeloos word nie,

column2: Luke 18:2 Saying, There was in a city a judge, which feared not God, neither regarded man:
column3: Lukas 18:2 en gesê: Daar was ’n regter in ’n stad wat God nie gevrees en geen mens ontsien het nie.

column2: Luke 18:3 And there was a widow in that city; and she came unto him, saying, Avenge me of mine adversary.
column3: Lukas 18:3 En daar was in daardie stad ’n weduwee, en sy het gedurig na hom gekom en gesê: Doen reg aan my teenoor my teëparty.

column2: Luke 18:4 And he would not for a while: but afterward he said within himself, Though I fear not God, nor regard man;
column3: Lukas 18:4 En ’n tyd lank wou hy nie; maar daarna het hy by homself gesê: Al vrees ek God ook nie en al ontsien ek geen mens nie,

column2: Luke 18:5 Yet because this widow troubleth me, I will avenge her, lest by her continual coming she weary me.
column3: Lukas 18:5 tog sal ek, omdat hierdie weduwee my moeite gee, aan haar reg doen, sodat sy nie eindelik kom en my in die gesig slaan nie.

column2: Luke 18:6 And the Lord said, Hear what the unjust judge saith.
column3: Lukas 18:6 Toe sê die Here: Hoor wat die onregverdige regter sê.

column2: Luke 18:7 And shall not God avenge his own elect, which cry day and night unto him, though he bear long with them?
column3: Lukas 18:7 Sal God dan nie reg doen aan sy uitverkorenes wat dag en nag tot Hom roep nie, al is Hy ook lankmoedig in hulle geval?

column2: Luke 18:8 I tell you that he will avenge them speedily. Nevertheless when the Son of man cometh, shall he find faith on the earth?
column3: Lukas 18:8 Ek sê vir julle dat Hy gou aan hulle reg sal doen; maar as die Seun van die mens kom, sal Hy wel die geloof op die aarde vind?

column2: Luke 18:9 And he spake this parable unto certain which trusted in themselves that they were righteous, and despised others:
column3: Lukas 18:9 EN Hy het ook met die oog op sommige wat op hulleself vertrou dat hulle regverdig is en die ander verag, hierdie gelykenis vertel.

column2: Luke 18:10 Two men went up into the temple to pray; the one a Pharisee, and the other a publican.
column3: Lukas 18:10 Twee manne het na die tempel opgegaan om te bid, die een ’n Fariseër en die ander ’n tollenaar.

column2: Luke 18:11 The Pharisee stood and prayed thus with himself, God, I thank thee, that I am not as other men [are], extortioners, unjust, adulterers, or even as this publican.
column3: Lukas 18:11 En die Fariseër het gaan staan en by homself so gebid: O God, ek dank U dat ek nie soos die ander mense is nie — rowers, onregverdiges, egbrekers, of ook soos hierdie tollenaar nie.

column2: Luke 18:12 I fast twice in the week, I give tithes of all that I possess.
column3: Lukas 18:12 Ek vas twee keer in die week, ek gee tiendes van alles wat ek verkry.

column2: Luke 18:13 And the publican, standing afar off, would not lift up so much as [his] eyes unto heaven, but smote upon his breast, saying, God be merciful to me a sinner.
column3: Lukas 18:13 En die tollenaar het ver weg gestaan en wou selfs nie sy oë na die hemel ophef nie, maar het op sy bors geslaan en gesê: O God, wees my, sondaar, genadig!

column2: Luke 18:14 I tell you, this man went down to his house justified [rather] than the other: for every one that exalteth himself shall be abased; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted.
