column3: Lukas 18:14 Ek sê vir julle, hierdie laaste een het geregverdig na sy huis gegaan eerder as die eerste een; want elkeen wat homself verhoog, sal verneder word, en hy wat homself verneder, sal verhoog word.

column2: Luke 18:15 And they brought unto him also infants, that he would touch them: but when [his] disciples saw [it], they rebuked them.
column3: Lukas 18:15 EN hulle het ook die klein kindertjies na Hom gebring, sodat Hy hulle kon aanraak; en toe die dissipels dit sien, het hulle hul bestraf.

column2: Luke 18:16 But Jesus called them [unto him], and said, Suffer little children to come unto me, and forbid them not: for of such is the kingdom of God.
column3: Lukas 18:16 Maar Jesus het hulle na Hom geroep en gesê: Laat die kindertjies na My toe kom en verhinder hulle nie, want aan sulkes behoort die koninkryk van God.

column2: Luke 18:17 Verily I say unto you, Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child shall in no wise enter therein.
column3: Lukas 18:17 Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, elkeen wat die koninkryk van God nie soos ’n kindjie ontvang nie, sal daar nooit ingaan nie.

column2: Luke 18:18 And a certain ruler asked him, saying, Good Master, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?
column3: Lukas 18:18 EN ’n sekere owerste vra Hom en sê: Goeie Meester, wat moet ek doen om die ewige lewe te beërwe?

column2: Luke 18:19 And Jesus said unto him, Why callest thou me good? none [is] good, save one, [that is], God.
column3: Lukas 18:19 En Jesus antwoord hom: Waarom noem jy My goed? Niemand is goed nie behalwe een, naamlik God.

column2: Luke 18:20 Thou knowest the commandments, Do not commit adultery, Do not kill, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Honour thy father and thy mother.
column3: Lukas 18:20 Jy ken die gebooie: Jy mag nie egbreek nie; jy mag nie doodslaan nie; jy mag nie steel nie; jy mag geen valse getuienis gee nie; eer jou vader en jou moeder.

column2: Luke 18:21 And he said, All these have I kept from my youth up.
column3: Lukas 18:21 En hy sê: Al hierdie dinge het ek onderhou van my jeug af.

column2: Luke 18:22 Now when Jesus heard these things, he said unto him, Yet lackest thou one thing: sell all that thou hast, and distribute unto the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven: and come, follow me.
column3: Lukas 18:22 En toe Jesus dit hoor, antwoord Hy hom: Nog een ding ontbreek jou — verkoop alles wat jy het, en verdeel dit onder die armes, en jy sal ’n skat in die hemel hê; kom dan hier, volg My.

column2: Luke 18:23 And when he heard this, he was very sorrowful: for he was very rich.
column3: Lukas 18:23 Toe hy dit hoor, het hy diep bedroef geword, want hy was baie ryk.

column2: Luke 18:24 And when Jesus saw that he was very sorrowful, he said, How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God!
column3: Lukas 18:24 En toe Jesus sien dat hy diep bedroef geword het, sê Hy: Hoe beswaarlik sal hulle wat goed besit, in die koninkryk van God ingaan.

column2: Luke 18:25 For it is easier for a camel to go through a needle's eye, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.
column3: Lukas 18:25 Want dit is makliker vir ’n kameel om deur die oog van ’n naald te gaan as vir ’n ryk man om in die koninkryk van God in te gaan.

column2: Luke 18:26 And they that heard [it] said, Who then can be saved?
column3: Lukas 18:26 Daarop sê die wat dit gehoor het: Wie kan dan gered word?

column2: Luke 18:27 And he said, The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.
column3: Lukas 18:27 Maar Hy antwoord: Die dinge wat by mense onmoontlik is, is by God moontlik.

column2: Luke 18:28 Then Peter said, Lo, we have left all, and followed thee.
column3: Lukas 18:28 Toe sê Petrus: Kyk, ons het alles verlaat en U gevolg.

column2: Luke 18:29 And he said unto them, Verily I say unto you, There is no man that hath left house, or parents, or brethren, or wife, or children, for the kingdom of God's sake,
column3: Lukas 18:29 En Hy sê vir hulle: Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, daar is niemand wat huis of ouers of broers of vrou of kinders verlaat het ter wille van die koninkryk van God,

column2: Luke 18:30 Who shall not receive manifold more in this present time, and in the world to come life everlasting.
column3: Lukas 18:30 wat nie baiemaal soveel in hierdie tyd sal ontvang nie en die ewige lewe in die eeu wat kom.

column2: Luke 18:31 Then he took [unto him] the twelve, and said unto them, Behold, we go up to Jerusalem, and all things that are written by the prophets concerning the Son of man shall be accomplished.
column3: Lukas 18:31 EN Hy het die twaalf by Hom geneem en vir hulle gesê: Kyk, ons gaan op na Jerusalem, en alles wat deur die profete geskrywe is, sal aan die Seun van die mens vervul word.

column2: Luke 18:32 For he shall be delivered unto the Gentiles, and shall be mocked, and spitefully entreated, and spitted on:
column3: Lukas 18:32 Want Hy sal oorgelewer word aan die heidene en bespot en mishandel word, en op Hom sal gespuug word;

column2: Luke 18:33 And they shall scourge [him], and put him to death: and the third day he shall rise again.
column3: Lukas 18:33 en nadat hulle Hom gegésel het, sal hulle Hom doodmaak; en op die derde dag sal Hy opstaan.

column2: Luke 18:34 And they understood none of these things: and this saying was hid from them, neither knew they the things which were spoken.
column3: Lukas 18:34 Maar hulle het niks hiervan begryp nie, en hierdie woord was vir hulle bedek, en hulle het nie verstaan wat gesê is nie.

column2: Luke 18:35 And it came to pass, that as he was come nigh unto Jericho, a certain blind man sat by the way side begging:
column3: Lukas 18:35 EN terwyl Hy naby Jérigo kom, sit daar ’n blinde man langs die pad en bedel;

column2: Luke 18:36 And hearing the multitude pass by, he asked what it meant.
column3: Lukas 18:36 en toe hy ’n skare hoor verbygaan, vra hy wat dit is.

column2: Luke 18:37 And they told him, that Jesus of Nazareth passeth by.
column3: Lukas 18:37 En hulle vertel hom: Jesus die Nasaréner gaan verby.

column2: Luke 18:38 And he cried, saying, Jesus, [thou] Son of David, have mercy on me.
column3: Lukas 18:38 Toe roep hy uit en sê: Jesus, Seun van Dawid, wees my barmhartig!

column2: Luke 18:39 And they which went before rebuked him, that he should hold his peace: but he cried so much the more, [Thou] Son of David, have mercy on me.
column3: Lukas 18:39 En die wat voor loop, bestraf hom dat hy moet stilbly. Maar hy het al harder uitgeroep: Seun van Dawid, wees my barmhartig!

column2: Luke 18:40 And Jesus stood, and commanded him to be brought unto him: and when he was come near, he asked him,
column3: Lukas 18:40 En Jesus het gaan staan en bevel gegee dat hy na Hom gebring moes word; en toe hy naby kom, vra Hy hom

column2: Luke 18:41 Saying, What wilt thou that I shall do unto thee? And he said, Lord, that I may receive my sight.
column3: Lukas 18:41 en sê: Wat wil jy hê moet Ek vir jou doen? En hy antwoord: Here, dat ek kan sien.

column2: Luke 18:42 And Jesus said unto him, Receive thy sight: thy faith hath saved thee.
column3: Lukas 18:42 En Jesus sê vir hom: Sien! Jou geloof het jou gered.

column2: Luke 18:43 And immediately he received his sight, and followed him, glorifying God: and all the people, when they saw [it], gave praise unto God.
column3: Lukas 18:43 En onmiddellik het hy gesien en Hom gevolg, terwyl hy God verheerlik. En toe die hele volk dit sien, het hulle aan God die lof gegee.

column2: Luke 19:1 And [Jesus] entered and passed through Jericho.
column3: Lukas 19:1 EN Hy het in Jérigo gekom en daar deurgegaan.

column2: Luke 19:2 And, behold, [there was] a man named Zacchaeus, which was the chief among the publicans, and he was rich.
column3: Lukas 19:2 En daar was ’n man met die naam van Saggéüs, ’n hoof van die tollenaars en ’n ryk man.

column2: Luke 19:3 And he sought to see Jesus who he was; and could not for the press, because he was little of stature.
column3: Lukas 19:3 En hy het probeer om Jesus te sien, wie Hy was; maar vanweë die skare kon hy nie, omdat hy klein van persoon was.

column2: Luke 19:4 And he ran before, and climbed up into a sycomore tree to see him: for he was to pass that [way].
column3: Lukas 19:4 En hy het vooruit gehardloop en in ’n wildevyeboom geklim, sodat hy Hom kon sien, want Hy sou daarlangs verbygaan.

column2: Luke 19:5 And when Jesus came to the place, he looked up, and saw him, and said unto him, Zacchaeus, make haste, and come down; for to day I must abide at thy house.
column3: Lukas 19:5 En toe Jesus by die plek kom, kyk Hy op en sien hom en sê vir hom: Saggéüs, maak gou en klim af, want Ek moet vandag in jou huis bly.

column2: Luke 19:6 And he made haste, and came down, and received him joyfully.
column3: Lukas 19:6 Hy maak toe gou en klim af en het Hom met blydskap ontvang.

column2: Luke 19:7 And when they saw [it], they all murmured, saying, That he was gone to be guest with a man that is a sinner.
column3: Lukas 19:7 En toe almal dit sien, het hulle gemurmureer en gesê: Hy het by ’n sondige man tuisgegaan.

column2: Luke 19:8 And Zacchaeus stood, and said unto the Lord; Behold, Lord, the half of my goods I give to the poor; and if I have taken any thing from any man by false accusation, I restore [him] fourfold.
column3: Lukas 19:8 Maar Saggéüs het gaan staan en aan die Here gesê: Here, kyk, die helfte van my goed gee ek vir die armes; en as ek van iemand iets afgepers het, gee ek dit vierdubbel terug.

column2: Luke 19:9 And Jesus said unto him, This day is salvation come to this house, forsomuch as he also is a son of Abraham.
column3: Lukas 19:9 Toe sê Jesus aan hom: Vandag het daar redding vir hierdie huis gekom, aangesien hierdie man ook ’n seun van Abraham is.

column2: Luke 19:10 For the Son of man is come to seek and to save that which was lost.
column3: Lukas 19:10 Want die Seun van die mens het gekom om te soek en te red wat verlore was.

column2: Luke 19:11 And as they heard these things, he added and spake a parable, because he was nigh to Jerusalem, and because they thought that the kingdom of God should immediately appear.
column3: Lukas 19:11 EN terwyl hulle na hierdie dinge luister, vertel Hy daar nog ’n gelykenis by, omdat Hy naby Jerusalem was en hulle gedink het dat die koninkryk van God onmiddellik sou verskyn.

column2: Luke 19:12 He said therefore, A certain nobleman went into a far country to receive for himself a kingdom, and to return.
column3: Lukas 19:12 Hy het dan gesê: ’n Man van hoë geboorte het na ’n ver land gereis om vir homself ’n koningskap te ontvang en dan terug te kom.

column2: Luke 19:13 And he called his ten servants, and delivered them ten pounds, and said unto them, Occupy till I come.
column3: Lukas 19:13 En nadat hy tien van sy diensknegte geroep het, gee hy hulle tien ponde en sê vir hulle: Dryf handel daarmee totdat ek kom.

column2: Luke 19:14 But his citizens hated him, and sent a message after him, saying, We will not have this [man] to reign over us.
column3: Lukas 19:14 Maar sy medeburgers het hom gehaat en ’n gesantskap agter hom aan gestuur om te sê: Ons wil nie hê dat hierdie man koning oor ons moet wees nie.

column2: Luke 19:15 And it came to pass, that when he was returned, having received the kingdom, then he commanded these servants to be called unto him, to whom he had given the money, that he might know how much every man had gained by trading.
column3: Lukas 19:15 En toe hy terugkom, nadat hy die koningskap ontvang het, sê hy dat daardie diensknegte aan wie hy die geld gegee het, by hom geroep moes word, sodat hy kon weet wat elkeen met handel verdien het.

column2: Luke 19:16 Then came the first, saying, Lord, thy pound hath gained ten pounds.
column3: Lukas 19:16 En die eerste het verskyn en gesê: Meneer, u pond het tien ponde wins gemaak.

column2: Luke 19:17 And he said unto him, Well, thou good servant: because thou hast been faithful in a very little, have thou authority over ten cities.
column3: Lukas 19:17 En hy sê vir hom: Mooi so, goeie dienskneg; omdat jy in die minste getrou gewees het, moet jy gesag hê oor tien stede.

column2: Luke 19:18 And the second came, saying, Lord, thy pound hath gained five pounds.
column3: Lukas 19:18 En die tweede kom en sê: Meneer, u pond het vyf ponde verdien.

column2: Luke 19:19 And he said likewise to him, Be thou also over five cities.
column3: Lukas 19:19 En hy sê ook vir hierdie een: En jy moet wees oor vyf stede.

column2: Luke 19:20 And another came, saying, Lord, behold, [here is] thy pound, which I have kept laid up in a napkin:
column3: Lukas 19:20 En ’n ander een kom en sê: Meneer, hier is u pond wat ek in ’n doek weggesit het;

column2: Luke 19:21 For I feared thee, because thou art an austere man: thou takest up that thou layedst not down, and reapest that thou didst not sow.
column3: Lukas 19:21 want ek was bang vir u, omdat u ’n strawwe man is; u neem weg wat u nie uitgesit het nie, en maai wat u nie gesaai het nie.

column2: Luke 19:22 And he saith unto him, Out of thine own mouth will I judge thee, [thou] wicked servant. Thou knewest that I was an austere man, taking up that I laid not down, and reaping that I did not sow:
column3: Lukas 19:22 Toe sê hy vir hom: Uit jou mond sal ek jou oordeel, slegte dienskneg! Jy het geweet dat ek ’n strawwe man is wat wegneem wat ek nie uitgesit het nie, en maai wat ek nie gesaai het nie.

column2: Luke 19:23 Wherefore then gavest not thou my money into the bank, that at my coming I might have required mine own with usury?
column3: Lukas 19:23 Waarom het jy dan nie my geld aan die wisselaars gegee nie? Dan kon ek dit by my koms met rente ingevorder het.

column2: Luke 19:24 And he said unto them that stood by, Take from him the pound, and give [it] to him that hath ten pounds.
column3: Lukas 19:24 En aan die wat daarby staan, sê hy: Neem die pond van hom weg en gee dit aan hom wat die tien ponde het —

column2: Luke 19:25 (And they said unto him, Lord, he hath ten pounds.)
column3: Lukas 19:25 en hulle sê vir hom: Meneer, hy het tien ponde —

column2: Luke 19:26 For I say unto you, That unto every one which hath shall be given; and from him that hath not, even that he hath shall be taken away from him.
column3: Lukas 19:26 want ek sê vir julle: Aan elkeen wat het, sal gegee word, maar van hom wat nie het nie, sal weggeneem word ook wat hy het.

column2: Luke 19:27 But those mine enemies, which would not that I should reign over them, bring hither, and slay [them] before me.
column3: Lukas 19:27 Maar daardie vyande van my wat nie wou hê dat ek koning oor hulle sou wees nie, bring hulle hier en slaan hulle voor my dood.

column2: Luke 19:28 And when he had thus spoken, he went before, ascending up to Jerusalem.
column3: Lukas 19:28 En toe Hy dit gesê het, gaan Hy vooruit op weg na Jerusalem.

column2: Luke 19:29 And it came to pass, when he was come nigh to Bethphage and Bethany, at the mount called [the mount] of Olives, he sent two of his disciples,
column3: Lukas 19:29 EN toe Hy naby Bétfagé en Betánië kom, by die berg wat die Olyfberg genoem word, het Hy twee van sy dissipels uitgestuur

column2: Luke 19:30 Saying, Go ye into the village over against [you]; in the which at your entering ye shall find a colt tied, whereon yet never man sat: loose him, and bring [him hither].
column3: Lukas 19:30 en gesê: Gaan in die dorp reg voor julle; en as julle daar inkom, sal julle ’n eselsvul vind wat vasgemaak is, waar geen mens ooit op gesit het nie. Maak hom los en bring hom.

column2: Luke 19:31 And if any man ask you, Why do ye loose [him]? thus shall ye say unto him, Because the Lord hath need of him.
column3: Lukas 19:31 En as iemand julle vra: Waarom maak julle hom los? — moet julle so vir hom sê: Die Here het hom nodig.

column2: Luke 19:32 And they that were sent went their way, and found even as he had said unto them.
column3: Lukas 19:32 En die wat gestuur was, gaan toe en vind dit soos Hy aan hulle gesê het.

column2: Luke 19:33 And as they were loosing the colt, the owners thereof said unto them, Why loose ye the colt?
column3: Lukas 19:33 En terwyl hulle die vul losmaak, sê die eienaars aan hulle: Waarom maak julle die vul los?

column2: Luke 19:34 And they said, The Lord hath need of him.
column3: Lukas 19:34 En hulle antwoord: Die Here het hom nodig.

column2: Luke 19:35 And they brought him to Jesus: and they cast their garments upon the colt, and they set Jesus thereon.
column3: Lukas 19:35 Toe bring hulle hom na Jesus toe, en hulle lê hul klere op die vul en laat Jesus daarop sit.

column2: Luke 19:36 And as he went, they spread their clothes in the way.
column3: Lukas 19:36 En terwyl Hy voortgaan, gooi hulle hul klere oop op die pad.

column2: Luke 19:37 And when he was come nigh, even now at the descent of the mount of Olives, the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works that they had seen;
column3: Lukas 19:37 En toe Hy al naby die afdraand van die Olyfberg kom, begin die hele menigte dissipels God met blydskap te prys met ’n groot stem oor al die kragtige dade wat hulle gesien het,

column2: Luke 19:38 Saying, Blessed [be] the King that cometh in the name of the Lord: peace in heaven, and glory in the highest.
column3: Lukas 19:38 terwyl hulle sê: Geseënd is die Koning wat kom in die Naam van die Here, vrede in die hemel en heerlikheid in die hoogste hemele!

column2: Luke 19:39 And some of the Pharisees from among the multitude said unto him, Master, rebuke thy disciples.
column3: Lukas 19:39 En sommige van die Fariseërs uit die skare sê vir Hom: Meester, bestraf u dissipels!

column2: Luke 19:40 And he answered and said unto them, I tell you that, if these should hold their peace, the stones would immediately cry out.
column3: Lukas 19:40 En Hy antwoord en sê vir hulle: Ek sê vir julle, as hulle swyg, sal die klippe uitroep.

column2: Luke 19:41 And when he was come near, he beheld the city, and wept over it,
column3: Lukas 19:41 En toe Hy naby kom en die stad sien, het Hy daaroor geween

column2: Luke 19:42 Saying, If thou hadst known, even thou, at least in this thy day, the things [which belong] unto thy peace! but now they are hid from thine eyes.
column3: Lukas 19:42 en gesê: As jy tog maar geweet het, ja, ook in hierdie dag van jou, die dinge wat tot jou vrede dien! Maar nou is dit vir jou oë bedek.

column2: Luke 19:43 For the days shall come upon thee, that thine enemies shall cast a trench about thee, and compass thee round, and keep thee in on every side,
column3: Lukas 19:43 Want daar sal dae oor jou kom dat jou vyande ’n skans rondom jou sal opwerp en jou omsingel en jou van alle kante insluit.

column2: Luke 19:44 And shall lay thee even with the ground, and thy children within thee; and they shall not leave in thee one stone upon another; because thou knewest not the time of thy visitation.
column3: Lukas 19:44 En hulle sal jou en jou kinders in jou teen die grond verpletter; en hulle sal in jou nie een klip op die ander laat bly nie, omdat jy die gunstige tyd toe God jou besoek het, nie opgemerk het nie.

column2: Luke 19:45 And he went into the temple, and began to cast out them that sold therein, and them that bought;
column3: Lukas 19:45 EN toe Hy in die tempel ingegaan het, begin Hy die wat daarin verkoop en koop, uit te jaag.

column2: Luke 19:46 Saying unto them, It is written, My house is the house of prayer: but ye have made it a den of thieves.
column3: Lukas 19:46 En Hy sê vir hulle: Daar is geskrywe: My huis is ’n huis van gebed. Maar julle het dit ’n rowerspelonk gemaak.

column2: Luke 19:47 And he taught daily in the temple. But the chief priests and the scribes and the chief of the people sought to destroy him,
column3: Lukas 19:47 En elke dag was Hy besig om in die tempel te leer; en die owerpriesters en die skrifgeleerdes en die vernaamstes van die volk het probeer om Hom om te bring;

column2: Luke 19:48 And could not find what they might do: for all the people were very attentive to hear him.
column3: Lukas 19:48 en hulle het niks gevind wat hulle kon doen nie, want die hele volk het Hom aangehang en na Hom geluister.

column2: Luke 20:1 And it came to pass, [that] on one of those days, as he taught the people in the temple, and preached the gospel, the chief priests and the scribes came upon [him] with the elders,
column3: Lukas 20:1 EN op een van dié dae, terwyl Hy besig was om die volk in die tempel te leer en die evangelie te verkondig, kom die owerpriesters en die skrifgeleerdes saam met die ouderlinge by Hom staan,

column2: Luke 20:2 And spake unto him, saying, Tell us, by what authority doest thou these things? or who is he that gave thee this authority?
column3: Lukas 20:2 en hulle spreek met Hom en sê: Vertel ons deur watter gesag U hierdie dinge doen, of wie dit is wat U hierdie gesag gegee het?

column2: Luke 20:3 And he answered and said unto them, I will also ask you one thing; and answer me:
column3: Lukas 20:3 En Hy antwoord en sê vir hulle: Ek sal julle ook een ding vra — sê vir My:

column2: Luke 20:4 The baptism of John, was it from heaven, or of men?
column3: Lukas 20:4 die doop van Johannes, was dit uit die hemel of uit mense?

column2: Luke 20:5 And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say, Why then believed ye him not?
column3: Lukas 20:5 Toe het hulle onder mekaar geredeneer en gesê: As ons sê: Uit die hemel — sal Hy sê: Waarom het julle hom dan nie geglo nie?

column2: Luke 20:6 But and if we say, Of men; all the people will stone us: for they be persuaded that John was a prophet.
column3: Lukas 20:6 En as ons sê: Uit mense — sal die hele volk ons stenig, want hulle is daarvan oortuig dat Johannes ’n profeet is.

column2: Luke 20:7 And they answered, that they could not tell whence [it was].
column3: Lukas 20:7 Toe antwoord hulle dat hulle nie weet waarvandaan nie.

column2: Luke 20:8 And Jesus said unto them, Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things.
column3: Lukas 20:8 En Jesus sê vir hulle: Dan vertel Ek julle ook nie deur watter gesag Ek hierdie dinge doen nie.

column2: Luke 20:9 Then began he to speak to the people this parable; A certain man planted a vineyard, and let it forth to husbandmen, and went into a far country for a long time.
column3: Lukas 20:9 TOE begin Hy aan die volk hierdie gelykenis te vertel: ’n Sekere man het ’n wingerd geplant en dit aan landbouers verhuur en vir ’n geruime tyd op reis gegaan.

column2: Luke 20:10 And at the season he sent a servant to the husbandmen, that they should give him of the fruit of the vineyard: but the husbandmen beat him, and sent [him] away empty.
column3: Lukas 20:10 En op die regte tyd het hy ’n dienskneg na die landbouers gestuur, dat hulle hom van die vrug van die wingerd sou gee. Maar die landbouers het hom geslaan en met leë hande weggestuur.

column2: Luke 20:11 And again he sent another servant: and they beat him also, and entreated [him] shamefully, and sent [him] away empty.
column3: Lukas 20:11 En hy het weer ’n ander dienskneg gestuur, en hulle het hom ook geslaan en skandelik behandel en met leë hande weggestuur.

column2: Luke 20:12 And again he sent a third: and they wounded him also, and cast [him] out.
column3: Lukas 20:12 En hy het weer ’n derde gestuur, en hulle het ook hierdie een gewond en uitgedryf.

column2: Luke 20:13 Then said the lord of the vineyard, What shall I do? I will send my beloved son: it may be they will reverence [him] when they see him.
column3: Lukas 20:13 Toe sê die eienaar van die wingerd: Wat sal ek doen? Ek sal my geliefde seun stuur; miskien sal hulle ontsag hê as hulle hom sien.

column2: Luke 20:14 But when the husbandmen saw him, they reasoned among themselves, saying, This is the heir: come, let us kill him, that the inheritance may be ours.
column3: Lukas 20:14 Maar toe die landbouers hom sien, het hulle onder mekaar geredeneer en gesê: Dit is die erfgenaam; kom laat ons hom doodmaak, sodat die erfdeel ons s’n kan wees.

column2: Luke 20:15 So they cast him out of the vineyard, and killed [him]. What therefore shall the lord of the vineyard do unto them?
column3: Lukas 20:15 En hulle het hom uit die wingerd gewerp en hom doodgemaak. Wat sal die eienaar van die wingerd dan aan hulle doen?

column2: Luke 20:16 He shall come and destroy these husbandmen, and shall give the vineyard to others. And when they heard [it], they said, God forbid.
column3: Lukas 20:16 Hy sal kom en daardie landbouers ombring en die wingerd aan ander gee. En toe hulle dit hoor, sê hulle: Nee, stellig nie!

column2: Luke 20:17 And he beheld them, and said, What is this then that is written, The stone which the builders rejected, the same is become the head of the corner?
column3: Lukas 20:17 Maar Hy het hulle aangekyk en gesê: Wat beteken dan hierdie Skrifwoord: die steen wat die bouers verwerp het, dit het ’n hoeksteen geword?

column2: Luke 20:18 Whosoever shall fall upon that stone shall be broken; but on whomsoever it shall fall, it will grind him to powder.
column3: Lukas 20:18 Elkeen wat op dié steen val, sal verpletter word; maar elkeen op wie hy val, dié sal hy vermorsel.

column2: Luke 20:19 And the chief priests and the scribes the same hour sought to lay hands on him; and they feared the people: for they perceived that he had spoken this parable against them.
column3: Lukas 20:19 TOE probeer die owerpriesters en die skrifgeleerdes in daardie selfde uur om die hande aan Hom te slaan, maar hulle het die volk gevrees; want hulle het geweet dat Hy hierdie gelykenis met die oog op hulle self uitgespreek het.

column2: Luke 20:20 And they watched [him], and sent forth spies, which should feign themselves just men, that they might take hold of his words, that so they might deliver him unto the power and authority of the governor.
column3: Lukas 20:20 En hulle het Hom in die oog gehou en spioene gestuur wat geveins het dat hulle regverdig was, sodat hulle Hom op ’n woord kon betrap, om Hom oor te lewer aan die owerheid en aan die gesag van die goewerneur.

column2: Luke 20:21 And they asked him, saying, Master, we know that thou sayest and teachest rightly, neither acceptest thou the person [of any], but teachest the way of God truly:
column3: Lukas 20:21 En hulle het Hom gevra en gesê: Meester, ons weet dat U reguit praat en leer en die persoon nie aanneem nie, maar die weg van God in waarheid leer —

column2: Luke 20:22 Is it lawful for us to give tribute unto Caesar, or no?
column3: Lukas 20:22 is dit ons geoorloof om aan die keiser belasting te betaal of nie?

column2: Luke 20:23 But he perceived their craftiness, and said unto them, Why tempt ye me?
column3: Lukas 20:23 Maar Hy het hulle listigheid bemerk en vir hulle gesê: Waarom versoek julle My?

column2: Luke 20:24 Shew me a penny. Whose image and superscription hath it? They answered and said, Caesar's.
column3: Lukas 20:24 Wys My ’n penning. Wie se beeld en opskrif het dit? Hulle antwoord en sê: Die keiser s’n.

column2: Luke 20:25 And he said unto them, Render therefore unto Caesar the things which be Caesar's, and unto God the things which be God's.
column3: Lukas 20:25 Toe sê Hy vir hulle: Betaal dan aan die keiser wat die keiser toekom, en aan God wat God toekom.

column2: Luke 20:26 And they could not take hold of his words before the people: and they marvelled at his answer, and held their peace.
column3: Lukas 20:26 En hulle kon Hom nie voor die volk op ’n woord betrap nie, en verwonderd oor sy antwoord het hulle geswyg.

column2: Luke 20:27 Then came to [him] certain of the Sadducees, which deny that there is any resurrection; and they asked him,
column3: Lukas 20:27 EN sommige van die Sadduseërs het gekom — hulle wat ontken dat daar ’n opstanding is — en Hom gevra

column2: Luke 20:28 Saying, Master, Moses wrote unto us, If any man's brother die, having a wife, and he die without children, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.
column3: Lukas 20:28 en gesê: Meester, Moses het ons voorgeskrywe: As iemand se getroude broer sterwe en hy sterf sonder kinders, dan moet sy broer die vrou neem en vir sy broer kinders verwek.

column2: Luke 20:29 There were therefore seven brethren: and the first took a wife, and died without children.
column3: Lukas 20:29 Nou was daar sewe broers, en die eerste het ’n vrou geneem en kinderloos gesterwe.

column2: Luke 20:30 And the second took her to wife, and he died childless.
column3: Lukas 20:30 En die tweede het die vrou geneem, en hy het ook kinderloos gesterwe.

column2: Luke 20:31 And the third took her; and in like manner the seven also: and they left no children, and died.
column3: Lukas 20:31 En die derde het haar geneem; en net so al sewe. En hulle het geen kinders nagelaat nie en het gesterwe.

column2: Luke 20:32 Last of all the woman died also.
column3: Lukas 20:32 En ten laaste het die vrou ook gesterwe.

column2: Luke 20:33 Therefore in the resurrection whose wife of them is she? for seven had her to wife.
column3: Lukas 20:33 In die opstanding dan, wie van hulle se vrou sal sy wees? — want al sewe het haar as vrou gehad.

column2: Luke 20:34 And Jesus answering said unto them, The children of this world marry, and are given in marriage:
column3: Lukas 20:34 Toe antwoord Jesus en sê vir hulle: Die kinders van hierdie eeu trou en word in die huwelik uitgegee;

column2: Luke 20:35 But they which shall be accounted worthy to obtain that world, and the resurrection from the dead, neither marry, nor are given in marriage:
column3: Lukas 20:35 maar die wat waardig geag word om daardie eeu en die opstanding uit die dode te verkry, trou nie en word nie in die huwelik uitgegee nie.

column2: Luke 20:36 Neither can they die any more: for they are equal unto the angels; and are the children of God, being the children of the resurrection.
column3: Lukas 20:36 Want hulle kan ook nie meer sterwe nie, want hulle is soos die engele en is kinders van God, omdat hulle kinders van die opstanding is.

column2: Luke 20:37 Now that the dead are raised, even Moses shewed at the bush, when he calleth the Lord the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.
column3: Lukas 20:37 En dat die dode opgewek word, het Moses ook in die gedeelte oor die doringbos aangedui, waar hy die Here noem die God van Abraham en die God van Isak en die God van Jakob.

column2: Luke 20:38 For he is not a God of the dead, but of the living: for all live unto him.
column3: Lukas 20:38 Hy is tog nie ’n God van dooies nie, maar van lewendes, want almal leef vir Hom.

column2: Luke 20:39 Then certain of the scribes answering said, Master, thou hast well said.
column3: Lukas 20:39 En sommige van die skrifgeleerdes antwoord en sê: Meester, U het goed gespreek.

column2: Luke 20:40 And after that they durst not ask him any [question at all].
column3: Lukas 20:40 En hulle het Hom nie meer iets durf vra nie.

column2: Luke 20:41 And he said unto them, How say they that Christ is David's son?
column3: Lukas 20:41 TOE sê Hy vir hulle: Hoe is dit dat hulle sê dat die Christus die seun van Dawid is?

column2: Luke 20:42 And David himself saith in the book of Psalms, The LORD said unto my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand,
column3: Lukas 20:42 En Dawid self sê in die boek van die Psalms: Die Here het tot my Here gespreek: Sit aan my regterhand

column2: Luke 20:43 Till I make thine enemies thy footstool.
column3: Lukas 20:43 totdat Ek u vyande gemaak het ’n voetbank van u voete.

column2: Luke 20:44 David therefore calleth him Lord, how is he then his son?
column3: Lukas 20:44 Dawid noem Hom dan Here, en hoe is Hy sy seun?

column2: Luke 20:45 Then in the audience of all the people he said unto his disciples,
column3: Lukas 20:45 EN terwyl die hele volk luister, sê Hy vir sy dissipels:

column2: Luke 20:46 Beware of the scribes, which desire to walk in long robes, and love greetings in the markets, and the highest seats in the synagogues, and the chief rooms at feasts;
column3: Lukas 20:46 Pas op vir die skrifgeleerdes wat graag in lang klere rondloop en van die begroetinge op die markte hou en van die voorste banke in die sinagoges en die voorste plekke by die maaltye.

column2: Luke 20:47 Which devour widows' houses, and for a shew make long prayers: the same shall receive greater damnation.
column3: Lukas 20:47 Hulle eet die huise van die weduwees op en doen vir die skyn lang gebede. Hulle sal ’n swaarder oordeel ontvang.

column2: Luke 21:1 And he looked up, and saw the rich men casting their gifts into the treasury.
column3: Lukas 21:1 EN toe Hy opkyk, sien Hy die rykes wat hulle gawes in die skatkis gooi.

column2: Luke 21:2 And he saw also a certain poor widow casting in thither two mites.
column3: Lukas 21:2 En Hy het ook ’n arm weduwee daar twee geldstukkies sien ingooi.

column2: Luke 21:3 And he said, Of a truth I say unto you, that this poor widow hath cast in more than they all:
column3: Lukas 21:3 En Hy sê: Waarlik, Ek sê vir julle dat hierdie arm weduwee meer as almal ingegooi het.

column2: Luke 21:4 For all these have of their abundance cast in unto the offerings of God: but she of her penury hath cast in all the living that she had.
column3: Lukas 21:4 Want hulle almal het uit hul oorvloed by die gawes van God ingegooi, maar sy het uit haar gebrek ingegooi alles wat sy gehad het om van te lewe.

column2: Luke 21:5 And as some spake of the temple, how it was adorned with goodly stones and gifts, he said,
column3: Lukas 21:5 EN toe sommige oor die tempel praat, dat dit met mooi klippe en gewyde geskenke versierd was, sê Hy:

column2: Luke 21:6 [As for] these things which ye behold, the days will come, in the which there shall not be left one stone upon another, that shall not be thrown down.
column3: Lukas 21:6 Hierdie dinge wat julle sien — daar sal dae kom wanneer daar nie een klip op die ander gelaat sal word wat nie afgebreek sal word nie.

column2: Luke 21:7 And they asked him, saying, Master, but when shall these things be? and what sign [will there be] when these things shall come to pass?
column3: Lukas 21:7 En hulle vra Hom en sê: Meester, wanneer sal dit dan wees, en wat is die teken wanneer dit gaan gebeur?

column2: Luke 21:8 And he said, Take heed that ye be not deceived: for many shall come in my name, saying, I am [Christ]; and the time draweth near: go ye not therefore after them.
column3: Lukas 21:8 En Hy antwoord: Pas op dat julle nie mislei word nie; want baie sal onder my Naam kom en sê: Dit is ek! en: Die tyd is naby! Gaan dan nie agter hulle aan nie.

column2: Luke 21:9 But when ye shall hear of wars and commotions, be not terrified: for these things must first come to pass; but the end [is] not by and by.
column3: Lukas 21:9 En wanneer julle hoor van oorloë en opstande, moenie skrik nie; want dié dinge moet eers plaasvind, maar dit is nie dadelik die einde nie.

column2: Luke 21:10 Then said he unto them, Nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom:
column3: Lukas 21:10 Toe sê Hy vir hulle: Die een nasie sal teen die ander opstaan en die een koninkryk teen die ander.

column2: Luke 21:11 And great earthquakes shall be in divers places, and famines, and pestilences; and fearful sights and great signs shall there be from heaven.
column3: Lukas 21:11 En daar sal groot aardbewings op verskillende plekke wees en hongersnode en pessiektes; en daar sal verskriklike dinge en groot tekens van die hemel kom.

column2: Luke 21:12 But before all these, they shall lay their hands on you, and persecute [you], delivering [you] up to the synagogues, and into prisons, being brought before kings and rulers for my name's sake.
column3: Lukas 21:12 Maar voor al hierdie dinge sal hulle die hande aan julle slaan en julle vervolg en oorlewer in sinagoges en gevangenisse en julle voor konings en goewerneurs bring ter wille van my Naam.

column2: Luke 21:13 And it shall turn to you for a testimony.
column3: Lukas 21:13 En dit sal vir julle uitloop op ’n getuienis.

column2: Luke 21:14 Settle [it] therefore in your hearts, not to meditate before what ye shall answer:
column3: Lukas 21:14 Neem julle dan in jul harte voor om nie vooraf oor julle verdediging te dink nie.

column2: Luke 21:15 For I will give you a mouth and wisdom, which all your adversaries shall not be able to gainsay nor resist.
column3: Lukas 21:15 Want Ek sal aan julle woorde en wysheid gee wat al julle teëstanders nie sal kan teëspreek of weerstaan nie.

column2: Luke 21:16 And ye shall be betrayed both by parents, and brethren, and kinsfolks, and friends; and [some] of you shall they cause to be put to death.
column3: Lukas 21:16 Maar julle sal oorgelewer word ook deur ouers en broers en bloedverwante en vriende, en hulle sal van julle doodmaak.

column2: Luke 21:17 And ye shall be hated of all [men] for my name's sake.
column3: Lukas 21:17 En julle sal gehaat wees deur almal ter wille van my Naam.

column2: Luke 21:18 But there shall not an hair of your head perish.
column3: Lukas 21:18 En geen haar van julle hoof sal ooit verlore gaan nie.

column2: Luke 21:19 In your patience possess ye your souls.
column3: Lukas 21:19 Deur julle volharding moet julle jul lewe in besit kry.

column2: Luke 21:20 And when ye shall see Jerusalem compassed with armies, then know that the desolation thereof is nigh.
column3: Lukas 21:20 EN wanneer julle Jerusalem deur leërs omsingeld sien, dan moet julle weet dat sy verwoesting naby is.

column2: Luke 21:21 Then let them which are in Judaea flee to the mountains; and let them which are in the midst of it depart out; and let not them that are in the countries enter thereinto.
column3: Lukas 21:21 Dan moet die wat in Judéa is, na die berge vlug; en die wat in die stad is, moet uitgaan; en die wat in die buitewyke is, moet nie daar inkom nie.

column2: Luke 21:22 For these be the days of vengeance, that all things which are written may be fulfilled.
column3: Lukas 21:22 Want dit sal dae van wraak wees, sodat alles wat geskrywe is, vervul kan word.

column2: Luke 21:23 But woe unto them that are with child, and to them that give suck, in those days! for there shall be great distress in the land, and wrath upon this people.
column3: Lukas 21:23 Maar wee die vroue wat swanger is en die wat nog soog in daardie dae; want daar sal ’n groot nood in die land wees en toorn oor hierdie volk.

column2: Luke 21:24 And they shall fall by the edge of the sword, and shall be led away captive into all nations: and Jerusalem shall be trodden down of the Gentiles, until the times of the Gentiles be fulfilled.
column3: Lukas 21:24 En hulle sal deur die skerpte van die swaard val en as krygsgevangenes geneem word na al die nasies, en Jerusalem sal vertrap word deur die nasies totdat die tye van die nasies vervul is.

column2: Luke 21:25 And there shall be signs in the sun, and in the moon, and in the stars; and upon the earth distress of nations, with perplexity; the sea and the waves roaring;
column3: Lukas 21:25 EN daar sal tekens wees aan son en maan en sterre, en op die aarde benoudheid van nasies in hulle radeloosheid, wanneer see en branders dreun,

column2: Luke 21:26 Men's hearts failing them for fear, and for looking after those things which are coming on the earth: for the powers of heaven shall be shaken.
column3: Lukas 21:26 en mense se harte beswyk van vrees en verwagting van die dinge wat oor die wêreld kom. Want die kragte van die hemele sal geskud word.

column2: Luke 21:27 And then shall they see the Son of man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.
column3: Lukas 21:27 En dan sal hulle die Seun van die mens sien kom in ’n wolk, met groot krag en heerlikheid.

column2: Luke 21:28 And when these things begin to come to pass, then look up, and lift up your heads; for your redemption draweth nigh.
column3: Lukas 21:28 En as hierdie dinge begin gebeur, kyk dan na bo en hef julle hoofde op, omdat julle verlossing naby is.

column2: Luke 21:29 And he spake to them a parable; Behold the fig tree, and all the trees;
column3: Lukas 21:29 Toe vertel Hy hulle ’n gelykenis: Let op die vyeboom en al die bome.

column2: Luke 21:30 When they now shoot forth, ye see and know of your own selves that summer is now nigh at hand.
column3: Lukas 21:30 Net soos hulle bot, weet julle vanself, as julle dit sien, dat die somer al naby is.

column2: Luke 21:31 So likewise ye, when ye see these things come to pass, know ye that the kingdom of God is nigh at hand.
column3: Lukas 21:31 So moet julle ook weet dat die koninkryk van God naby is wanneer julle hierdie dinge sien gebeur.

column2: Luke 21:32 Verily I say unto you, This generation shall not pass away, till all be fulfilled.
column3: Lukas 21:32 Voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, hierdie geslag sal sekerlik nie verbygaan voordat alles gebeur het nie.

column2: Luke 21:33 Heaven and earth shall pass away: but my words shall not pass away.
column3: Lukas 21:33 Die hemel en die aarde sal verbygaan, maar my woorde sal nooit verbygaan nie.

column2: Luke 21:34 And take heed to yourselves, lest at any time your hearts be overcharged with surfeiting, and drunkenness, and cares of this life, and [so] that day come upon you unawares.
column3: Lukas 21:34 MAAR pas op vir julleself, dat julle harte nie miskien beswaar word deur swelgery en dronkenskap en sorge van die lewe nie, en dié dag julle nie skielik oorval nie.

column2: Luke 21:35 For as a snare shall it come on all them that dwell on the face of the whole earth.
column3: Lukas 21:35 Want soos ’n strik sal hy kom oor almal wat op die hele aarde woon.

column2: Luke 21:36 Watch ye therefore, and pray always, that ye may be accounted worthy to escape all these things that shall come to pass, and to stand before the Son of man.
column3: Lukas 21:36 Waak dan en bid altyddeur, sodat julle waardig geag mag word om al hierdie dinge wat kom, te ontvlug en voor die Seun van die mens te staan.

column2: Luke 21:37 And in the day time he was teaching in the temple; and at night he went out, and abode in the mount that is called [the mount] of Olives.
column3: Lukas 21:37 EN Hy was oordag in die tempel besig om te leer, en snags het Hy uitgegaan en vernag op die berg wat die Olyfberg genoem word.

column2: Luke 21:38 And all the people came early in the morning to him in the temple, for to hear him.
column3: Lukas 21:38 En die hele volk het vroeg in die môre na Hom in die tempel gekom om na Hom te luister.

column2: Luke 22:1 Now the feast of unleavened bread drew nigh, which is called the Passover.
column3: Lukas 22:1 EN die fees van die ongesuurde brode, wat pasga genoem word, was naby.

column2: Luke 22:2 And the chief priests and scribes sought how they might kill him; for they feared the people.
column3: Lukas 22:2 En die owerpriesters en die skrifgeleerdes het gesoek hoe hulle Hom kon ombring, want hulle het die volk gevrees.

column2: Luke 22:3 Then entered Satan into Judas surnamed Iscariot, being of the number of the twelve.
column3: Lukas 22:3 En die Satan het in Judas gevaar, wat Iskáriot genoem word en wat uit die getal van die twaalf was.

column2: Luke 22:4 And he went his way, and communed with the chief priests and captains, how he might betray him unto them.
column3: Lukas 22:4 Toe het hy gegaan en met die owerpriesters en hoofde beraadslaag hoe hy Hom aan hulle kon oorlewer.

column2: Luke 22:5 And they were glad, and covenanted to give him money.
column3: Lukas 22:5 En hulle was bly en het met hom ooreengekom om hom geld te gee.

column2: Luke 22:6 And he promised, and sought opportunity to betray him unto them in the absence of the multitude.
column3: Lukas 22:6 En hy het toegestem en na ’n goeie geleentheid gesoek om Hom sonder oproer aan hulle oor te lewer.

column2: Luke 22:7 Then came the day of unleavened bread, when the passover must be killed.
column3: Lukas 22:7 EN die dag van die ongesuurde brode het gekom waarop die pasga geslag moes word.

column2: Luke 22:8 And he sent Peter and John, saying, Go and prepare us the passover, that we may eat.
column3: Lukas 22:8 Toe stuur Hy Petrus en Johannes en sê: Gaan berei die pasga vir ons, dat ons dit kan eet.

column2: Luke 22:9 And they said unto him, Where wilt thou that we prepare?
column3: Lukas 22:9 En hulle sê vir Hom: Waar wil U hê moet ons dit berei?

column2: Luke 22:10 And he said unto them, Behold, when ye are entered into the city, there shall a man meet you, bearing a pitcher of water; follow him into the house where he entereth in.
column3: Lukas 22:10 En Hy antwoord hulle: Kyk, as julle in die stad ingaan, sal ’n man julle ontmoet wat ’n kruik water dra; volg hom na die huis waar hy ingaan.

column2: Luke 22:11 And ye shall say unto the goodman of the house, The Master saith unto thee, Where is the guestchamber, where I shall eat the passover with my disciples?
column3: Lukas 22:11 En julle moet vir die eienaar van die huis sê: Die Meester vra u — waar is die kamer waar Ek die pasga met my dissipels kan eet?

column2: Luke 22:12 And he shall shew you a large upper room furnished: there make ready.
column3: Lukas 22:12 En hy sal julle ’n groot bovertrek wys wat reggemaak is; daar moet julle dit berei.

column2: Luke 22:13 And they went, and found as he had said unto them: and they made ready the passover.
column3: Lukas 22:13 En hulle het gegaan en dit gevind soos Hy vir hulle gesê het, en die pasga berei.

column2: Luke 22:14 And when the hour was come, he sat down, and the twelve apostles with him.
column3: Lukas 22:14 En toe die uur kom, het Hy aan tafel gegaan en die twaalf apostels saam met Hom.

column2: Luke 22:15 And he said unto them, With desire I have desired to eat this passover with you before I suffer:
column3: Lukas 22:15 En Hy sê vir hulle: Ek het baie sterk daarna verlang om hierdie pasga met julle te eet voordat Ek ly.

column2: Luke 22:16 For I say unto you, I will not any more eat thereof, until it be fulfilled in the kingdom of God.
column3: Lukas 22:16 Want Ek sê vir julle: Ek sal sekerlik nie meer daarvan eet voordat dit in die koninkryk van God vervul is nie.

column2: Luke 22:17 And he took the cup, and gave thanks, and said, Take this, and divide [it] among yourselves:
column3: Lukas 22:17 En toe Hy ’n beker geneem het, dank Hy en sê: Neem dit en deel dit onder julle.

column2: Luke 22:18 For I say unto you, I will not drink of the fruit of the vine, until the kingdom of God shall come.
column3: Lukas 22:18 Want Ek sê vir julle: Ek sal sekerlik nie drink van die vrug van die wynstok voordat die koninkryk van God gekom het nie.

column2: Luke 22:19 And he took bread, and gave thanks, and brake [it], and gave unto them, saying, This is my body which is given for you: this do in remembrance of me.
column3: Lukas 22:19 Daarop neem Hy brood, en nadat Hy gedank het, breek Hy dit en gee dit aan hulle en sê: Dit is my liggaam wat vir julle gegee word; doen dit tot my gedagtenis.

column2: Luke 22:20 Likewise also the cup after supper, saying, This cup [is] the new testament in my blood, which is shed for you.
column3: Lukas 22:20 Net so neem Hy ook die beker ná die maaltyd en sê: Hierdie beker is die nuwe testament in my bloed wat vir julle uitgestort word.

column2: Luke 22:21 But, behold, the hand of him that betrayeth me [is] with me on the table.
column3: Lukas 22:21 Maar kyk, die hand van hom wat My verraai, is by My aan tafel.

column2: Luke 22:22 And truly the Son of man goeth, as it was determined: but woe unto that man by whom he is betrayed!
column3: Lukas 22:22 Die Seun van die mens gaan wel heen volgens wat bepaal is, maar wee daardie man deur wie Hy verraai word!

column2: Luke 22:23 And they began to enquire among themselves, which of them it was that should do this thing.
column3: Lukas 22:23 Toe begin hulle onder mekaar te vra wie van hulle dit tog kon wees wat dit sou doen.

column2: Luke 22:24 And there was also a strife among them, which of them should be accounted the greatest.
column3: Lukas 22:24 EN daar het ook twis onder hulle ontstaan oor wie van hulle die grootste geag moet wees.

column2: Luke 22:25 And he said unto them, The kings of the Gentiles exercise lordship over them; and they that exercise authority upon them are called benefactors.
column3: Lukas 22:25 En Hy het vir hulle gesê: Die konings van die nasies heers oor hulle, en die wat gesag voer oor hulle, word weldoeners genoem.

column2: Luke 22:26 But ye [shall] not [be] so: but he that is greatest among you, let him be as the younger; and he that is chief, as he that doth serve.
column3: Lukas 22:26 Maar so moet julle nie wees nie; maar die oudste onder julle moet word soos die jongste, en wie ’n leier is, soos een wat dien.

column2: Luke 22:27 For whether [is] greater, he that sitteth at meat, or he that serveth? [is] not he that sitteth at meat? but I am among you as he that serveth.
column3: Lukas 22:27 Want wie is groter: die een wat aan tafel is, of die een wat dien? Is dit nie hy wat aan tafel is nie? Maar Ek is onder julle soos een wat dien.

column2: Luke 22:28 Ye are they which have continued with me in my temptations.
column3: Lukas 22:28 En dit is julle wat altyddeur by My gebly het in my versoekinge.

column2: Luke 22:29 And I appoint unto you a kingdom, as my Father hath appointed unto me;
column3: Lukas 22:29 En Ek beskik vir julle ’n koninkryk soos my Vader dit vir My beskik het,

column2: Luke 22:30 That ye may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom, and sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
column3: Lukas 22:30 sodat julle kan eet en drink aan my tafel in my koninkryk en op trone sit om die twaalf stamme van Israel te oordeel.

column2: Luke 22:31 And the Lord said, Simon, Simon, behold, Satan hath desired [to have] you, that he may sift [you] as wheat:
column3: Lukas 22:31 EN die Here sê: Simon, Simon, kyk, die Satan het vurig begeer om julle soos koring te sif.

column2: Luke 22:32 But I have prayed for thee, that thy faith fail not: and when thou art converted, strengthen thy brethren.
column3: Lukas 22:32 Maar Ek het vir jou gebid, dat jou geloof nie ophou nie; en as jy eendag bekeerd is, moet jy jou broeders versterk.

column2: Luke 22:33 And he said unto him, Lord, I am ready to go with thee, both into prison, and to death.
column3: Lukas 22:33 En hy het vir Hom gesê: Here, ek is gereed om saam met U selfs in die gevangenis en in die dood te gaan.

column2: Luke 22:34 And he said, I tell thee, Peter, the cock shall not crow this day, before that thou shalt thrice deny that thou knowest me.
column3: Lukas 22:34 Maar Hy antwoord: Ek sê vir jou, Petrus, die haan sal vannag nie kraai voordat jy drie maal geloën het dat jy My ken nie.

column2: Luke 22:35 And he said unto them, When I sent you without purse, and scrip, and shoes, lacked ye any thing? And they said, Nothing.
column3: Lukas 22:35 EN Hy sê vir hulle: Toe Ek julle uitgestuur het sonder beurs en reissak en skoene, het julle iets kortgekom? En hulle antwoord: Niks nie.

column2: Luke 22:36 Then said he unto them, But now, he that hath a purse, let him take [it], and likewise [his] scrip: and he that hath no sword, let him sell his garment, and buy one.
column3: Lukas 22:36 Toe sê Hy vir hulle: Maar nou, wie ’n beurs het, laat hom dit neem en so ook die reissak; en wie dit nie het nie, moet sy kleed verkoop en ’n swaard koop.

column2: Luke 22:37 For I say unto you, that this that is written must yet be accomplished in me, And he was reckoned among the transgressors: for the things concerning me have an end.
column3: Lukas 22:37 Want Ek sê vir julle dat dit wat geskrywe is, nog aan My vervul moet word: En Hy is saam met misdadigers gereken. Want ook aan die dinge wat betrekking het op My, kom daar ’n einde.

column2: Luke 22:38 And they said, Lord, behold, here [are] two swords. And he said unto them, It is enough.
column3: Lukas 22:38 Hulle sê vir Hom: Here, kyk hier is twee swaarde. En Hy antwoord hulle: Dit is genoeg.

column2: Luke 22:39 And he came out, and went, as he was wont, to the mount of Olives; and his disciples also followed him.
column3: Lukas 22:39 EN Hy het vertrek en volgens gewoonte na die Olyfberg gegaan. En ook sy dissipels het Hom gevolg.

column2: Luke 22:40 And when he was at the place, he said unto them, Pray that ye enter not into temptation.
column3: Lukas 22:40 En toe Hy op die plek kom, sê Hy vir hulle: Bid dat julle nie in versoeking kom nie.

column2: Luke 22:41 And he was withdrawn from them about a stone's cast, and kneeled down, and prayed,
column3: Lukas 22:41 En Hy het Hom van hulle afgesonder omtrent so ver as ’n mens met ’n klip kan gooi, en neergekniel en gebid

column2: Luke 22:42 Saying, Father, if thou be willing, remove this cup from me: nevertheless not my will, but thine, be done.
column3: Lukas 22:42 en gesê: Vader, as U tog maar hierdie beker van My wil wegneem! Laat nogtans nie my wil nie, maar u wil geskied!

column2: Luke 22:43 And there appeared an angel unto him from heaven, strengthening him.
column3: Lukas 22:43 En ’n engel uit die hemel het aan Hom verskyn en Hom versterk.

column2: Luke 22:44 And being in an agony he prayed more earnestly: and his sweat was as it were great drops of blood falling down to the ground.
column3: Lukas 22:44 En toe Hy in ’n sware stryd kom, het Hy met groter inspanning gebid, en sy sweet het geword soos bloeddruppels wat op die grond val.

column2: Luke 22:45 And when he rose up from prayer, and was come to his disciples, he found them sleeping for sorrow,
column3: Lukas 22:45 Toe staan Hy van die gebed op en kom by sy dissipels en vind hulle aan die slaap van droefheid.

column2: Luke 22:46 And said unto them, Why sleep ye? rise and pray, lest ye enter into temptation.
column3: Lukas 22:46 En Hy sê vir hulle: Wat slaap julle? Staan op en bid, dat julle nie in versoeking kom nie.

column2: Luke 22:47 And while he yet spake, behold a multitude, and he that was called Judas, one of the twelve, went before them, and drew near unto Jesus to kiss him.
column3: Lukas 22:47 EN terwyl Hy nog spreek, kom daar ’n skare; en hy wat Judas genoem word, een van die twaalf, het voor hulle uit geloop en nader gekom na Jesus om Hom te soen.

column2: Luke 22:48 But Jesus said unto him, Judas, betrayest thou the Son of man with a kiss?
column3: Lukas 22:48 En Jesus sê vir hom: Judas, verraai jy die Seun van die mens met ’n kus?

column2: Luke 22:49 When they which were about him saw what would follow, they said unto him, Lord, shall we smite with the sword?
column3: Lukas 22:49 En toe die wat rondom Hom was, sien wat gaan gebeur, sê hulle vir Hom: Here, moet ons met die swaard slaan?

column2: Luke 22:50 And one of them smote the servant of the high priest, and cut off his right ear.
column3: Lukas 22:50 En een van hulle het die dienskneg van die hoëpriester getref en sy regteroor afgekap.

column2: Luke 22:51 And Jesus answered and said, Suffer ye thus far. And he touched his ear, and healed him.
column3: Lukas 22:51 Maar Jesus het geantwoord en gesê: Hou op, dit is genoeg! En Hy het sy oor aangeraak en hom gesond gemaak.

column2: Luke 22:52 Then Jesus said unto the chief priests, and captains of the temple, and the elders, which were come to him, Be ye come out, as against a thief, with swords and staves?
column3: Lukas 22:52 Toe sê Jesus vir die owerpriesters en hoofde van die tempel en ouderlinge wat teen Hom gekom het: Het julle uitgetrek soos teen ’n rower met swaarde en stokke?

column2: Luke 22:53 When I was daily with you in the temple, ye stretched forth no hands against me: but this is your hour, and the power of darkness.
column3: Lukas 22:53 Dag vir dag was Ek saam met julle in die tempel, en julle het nie die hande teen My uitgesteek nie. Maar dit is julle uur en die mag van die duisternis.

column2: Luke 22:54 Then took they him, and led [him], and brought him into the high priest's house. And Peter followed afar off.
column3: Lukas 22:54 EN hulle het Hom gevange geneem en weggelei en Hom gebring in die huis van die hoëpriester. En Petrus het van ver af gevolg.

column2: Luke 22:55 And when they had kindled a fire in the midst of the hall, and were set down together, Peter sat down among them.
column3: Lukas 22:55 En toe hulle ’n vuur in die middel van die binneplaas van die paleis gemaak en bymekaar gaan sit het, het Petrus onder hulle gesit.

column2: Luke 22:56 But a certain maid beheld him as he sat by the fire, and earnestly looked upon him, and said, This man was also with him.
column3: Lukas 22:56 En ’n diensmeisie het hom daar by die vuur sien sit; en nadat sy hom vas aangekyk het, sê sy: Hierdie man was ook saam met Hom.

column2: Luke 22:57 And he denied him, saying, Woman, I know him not.
column3: Lukas 22:57 Maar hy het Hom verloën en gesê: Vrou, ek ken Hom nie.

column2: Luke 22:58 And after a little while another saw him, and said, Thou art also of them. And Peter said, Man, I am not.
column3: Lukas 22:58 En kort daarna sien iemand anders hom en sê: Jy is ook een van hulle. Maar Petrus sê: Man, ek is nie.

column2: Luke 22:59 And about the space of one hour after another confidently affirmed, saying, Of a truth this [fellow] also was with him: for he is a Galilaean.
column3: Lukas 22:59 En ná verloop van omtrent een uur het ’n ander een dit verseker en gesê: Sowaar, hierdie man was ook saam met Hom, want hy is ook ’n Galiléër.

column2: Luke 22:60 And Peter said, Man, I know not what thou sayest. And immediately, while he yet spake, the cock crew.
column3: Lukas 22:60 Maar Petrus antwoord: Man, ek weet nie wat jy sê nie. En onmiddellik, terwyl hy nog praat, het die haan gekraai.

column2: Luke 22:61 And the Lord turned, and looked upon Peter. And Peter remembered the word of the Lord, how he had said unto him, Before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice.
column3: Lukas 22:61 En die Here het Hom omgedraai en Petrus aangekyk, en Petrus het die woord van die Here onthou wat Hy vir hom gesê het: Voordat die haan kraai, sal jy My drie maal verloën.

column2: Luke 22:62 And Peter went out, and wept bitterly.
column3: Lukas 22:62 En Petrus het buitentoe gegaan en bitterlik geween.

column2: Luke 22:63 And the men that held Jesus mocked him, and smote [him].
column3: Lukas 22:63 EN die manne wat Jesus gevange gehou het, het Hom bespot en geslaan.

column2: Luke 22:64 And when they had blindfolded him, they struck him on the face, and asked him, saying, Prophesy, who is it that smote thee?
column3: Lukas 22:64 En hulle het Hom geblinddoek en Hom in die aangesig geslaan en Hom gevra en gesê: Profeteer wie dit is wat U geslaan het.

column2: Luke 22:65 And many other things blasphemously spake they against him.
column3: Lukas 22:65 En baie ander dinge het hulle lasterlik teen Hom gespreek.

column2: Luke 22:66 And as soon as it was day, the elders of the people and the chief priests and the scribes came together, and led him into their council, saying,
column3: Lukas 22:66 En toe dit dag word, het die oudstes van die volk — die owerpriesters en skrifgeleerdes — vergader en Hom voor hulle Raad gebring

column2: Luke 22:67 Art thou the Christ? tell us. And he said unto them, If I tell you, ye will not believe:
column3: Lukas 22:67 en gesê: As U die Christus is, sê vir ons. En Hy antwoord hulle: As Ek vir u sê, sal u tog nie glo nie.

column2: Luke 22:68 And if I also ask [you], ye will not answer me, nor let [me] go.
column3: Lukas 22:68 En as Ek vra, sal u My tog nie antwoord of loslaat nie.

column2: Luke 22:69 Hereafter shall the Son of man sit on the right hand of the power of God.
column3: Lukas 22:69 Van nou af sal die Seun van die mens sit aan die regterhand van die krag van God.

column2: Luke 22:70 Then said they all, Art thou then the Son of God? And he said unto them, Ye say that I am.
column3: Lukas 22:70 En hulle sê almal: Is U dan die Seun van God? En Hy antwoord hulle: U sê dat Ek dit is.

column2: Luke 22:71 And they said, What need we any further witness? for we ourselves have heard of his own mouth.
column3: Lukas 22:71 Daarop sê hulle: Wat het ons nog getuienis nodig! Want ons het dit self uit sy mond gehoor.

column2: Luke 23:1 And the whole multitude of them arose, and led him unto Pilate.
column3: Lukas 23:1 EN die hele menigte van hulle het opgestaan en Hom na Pilatus gelei.

column2: Luke 23:2 And they began to accuse him, saying, We found this [fellow] perverting the nation, and forbidding to give tribute to Caesar, saying that he himself is Christ a King.
column3: Lukas 23:2 En hulle het Hom begin beskuldig en sê: Ons het gevind dat hierdie man die volk verlei en verbied om aan die keiser belasting te betaal, terwyl Hy sê dat Hy self Christus, die Koning, is.

column2: Luke 23:3 And Pilate asked him, saying, Art thou the King of the Jews? And he answered him and said, Thou sayest [it].
column3: Lukas 23:3 Toe vra Pilatus Hom en sê: Is U die Koning van die Jode? En Hy antwoord hom en sê: U sê dit.

column2: Luke 23:4 Then said Pilate to the chief priests and [to] the people, I find no fault in this man.
column3: Lukas 23:4 En Pilatus sê vir die owerpriesters en die skare: Ek vind geen skuld in hierdie man nie.

column2: Luke 23:5 And they were the more fierce, saying, He stirreth up the people, teaching throughout all Jewry, beginning from Galilee to this place.
column3: Lukas 23:5 Maar hulle het aangehou en gesê: Hy maak die volk oproerig met sy leer die hele Judéa deur, vandat Hy in Galiléa begin het tot hiertoe.

column2: Luke 23:6 When Pilate heard of Galilee, he asked whether the man were a Galilaean.
column3: Lukas 23:6 En toe Pilatus van Galiléa hoor, vra hy of die man ’n Galiléër is.

column2: Luke 23:7 And as soon as he knew that he belonged unto Herod's jurisdiction, he sent him to Herod, who himself also was at Jerusalem at that time.
column3: Lukas 23:7 En nadat hy verneem het dat Hy uit die magsgebied van Herodes was, stuur hy Hom na Herodes wat self ook in daardie dae in Jerusalem was.

column2: Luke 23:8 And when Herod saw Jesus, he was exceeding glad: for he was desirous to see him of a long [season], because he had heard many things of him; and he hoped to have seen some miracle done by him.
column3: Lukas 23:8 En toe Herodes Jesus sien, was hy baie bly, want hy was al geruime tyd begerig om Hom te sien, omdat hy veel van Hom gehoor het; en hy het gehoop om een of ander teken te sien wat deur Hom gedoen sou word.

column2: Luke 23:9 Then he questioned with him in many words; but he answered him nothing.
column3: Lukas 23:9 En hy het Hom met baie woorde uitgevra, maar Hy het hom niks geantwoord nie.

column2: Luke 23:10 And the chief priests and scribes stood and vehemently accused him.
column3: Lukas 23:10 En die owerpriesters en die skrifgeleerdes het Hom heftig staan en beskuldig.

column2: Luke 23:11 And Herod with his men of war set him at nought, and mocked [him], and arrayed him in a gorgeous robe, and sent him again to Pilate.
column3: Lukas 23:11 En nadat Herodes saam met sy soldate Hom met veragting behandel en bespot het, werp hy Hom ’n blink kleed om en stuur Hom terug na Pilatus.

column2: Luke 23:12 And the same day Pilate and Herod were made friends together: for before they were at enmity between themselves.
column3: Lukas 23:12 En Pilatus en Herodes het op daardie dag goeie vriende geword, want hulle was vantevore in vyandskap teenoor mekaar.

column2: Luke 23:13 And Pilate, when he had called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people,
column3: Lukas 23:13 Toe roep Pilatus die owerpriesters en die owerstes en die volk bymekaar en sê vir hulle:

column2: Luke 23:14 Said unto them, Ye have brought this man unto me, as one that perverteth the people: and, behold, I, having examined [him] before you, have found no fault in this man touching those things whereof ye accuse him:
column3: Lukas 23:14 Julle het hierdie man na my gebring as een wat die volk afvallig maak. En nou het ek in julle teenwoordigheid ondersoek ingestel en in hierdie man geen skuld gevind aan die dinge waarvan julle Hom beskuldig nie;

column2: Luke 23:15 No, nor yet Herod: for I sent you to him; and, lo, nothing worthy of death is done unto him.
column3: Lukas 23:15 ja, ook Herodes nie, want ek het julle na hom gestuur; en daar is deur Hom niks gedoen wat die dood verdien nie.

column2: Luke 23:16 I will therefore chastise him, and release [him].
column3: Lukas 23:16 Nadat ek Hom dan gekasty het, sal ek Hom loslaat.

column2: Luke 23:17 (For of necessity he must release one unto them at the feast.)
column3: Lukas 23:17 En hy was verplig om vir hulle op die fees een los te laat.

column2: Luke 23:18 And they cried out all at once, saying, Away with this [man], and release unto us Barabbas:
column3: Lukas 23:18 Maar die hele menigte skreeu en sê: Weg met Hom, en laat vir ons Barábbas los!

column2: Luke 23:19 (Who for a certain sedition made in the city, and for murder, was cast into prison.)
column3: Lukas 23:19 Dié was oor ’n sekere opstand wat in die stad plaasgevind het, en oor ’n moord in die gevangenis gewerp.

column2: Luke 23:20 Pilate therefore, willing to release Jesus, spake again to them.
column3: Lukas 23:20 Daarop spreek Pilatus hulle weer toe, omdat hy Jesus wou loslaat;

column2: Luke 23:21 But they cried, saying, Crucify [him], crucify him.
column3: Lukas 23:21 maar hulle het aangehou roep en sê: Kruisig, kruisig Hom!

column2: Luke 23:22 And he said unto them the third time, Why, what evil hath he done? I have found no cause of death in him: I will therefore chastise him, and let [him] go.
column3: Lukas 23:22 En vir die derde keer sê hy vir hulle: Watter kwaad het Hy dan gedoen? Ek het in Hom niks gevind wat die dood verdien nie. Ek sal Hom dan kasty en loslaat.

column2: Luke 23:23 And they were instant with loud voices, requiring that he might be crucified. And the voices of them and of the chief priests prevailed.
column3: Lukas 23:23 Maar hulle het aangehou met ’n harde geroep en geëis dat Hy gekruisig moes word; en hulle geroep en dié van die owerpriesters het die oorhand gekry.

column2: Luke 23:24 And Pilate gave sentence that it should be as they required.
column3: Lukas 23:24 Toe gee Pilatus uitspraak dat aan hulle eis voldoen moet word.

column2: Luke 23:25 And he released unto them him that for sedition and murder was cast into prison, whom they had desired; but he delivered Jesus to their will.
column3: Lukas 23:25 En hy het die een vir hulle losgelaat wat oor opstand en moord in die gevangenis gewerp was, die een wat hulle geëis het. Maar Jesus het hy aan hulle wil oorgelewer.

column2: Luke 23:26 And as they led him away, they laid hold upon one Simon, a Cyrenian, coming out of the country, and on him they laid the cross, that he might bear [it] after Jesus.
column3: Lukas 23:26 EN toe hulle Hom weglei, neem hulle ’n sekere Simon van Ciréne wat van die veld af gekom het, en sit die kruis op hom om dit agter Jesus aan te dra.

column2: Luke 23:27 And there followed him a great company of people, and of women, which also bewailed and lamented him.
column3: Lukas 23:27 En ’n groot menigte van die volk het Hom gevolg, en vroue wat rou bedryf en Hom beklaag het.

column2: Luke 23:28 But Jesus turning unto them said, Daughters of Jerusalem, weep not for me, but weep for yourselves, and for your children.
column3: Lukas 23:28 Maar Jesus het Hom omgedraai en vir hulle gesê: Dogters van Jerusalem, moenie oor My ween nie, maar ween oor julleself en oor julle kinders;

column2: Luke 23:29 For, behold, the days are coming, in the which they shall say, Blessed [are] the barren, and the wombs that never bare, and the paps which never gave suck.
column3: Lukas 23:29 want daar kom dae waarin hulle sal sê: Gelukkig is die onvrugbares en die moederskote wat nie gebaar en die borste wat nie gesoog het nie.

column2: Luke 23:30 Then shall they begin to say to the mountains, Fall on us; and to the hills, Cover us.
column3: Lukas 23:30 Dan sal hulle vir die berge begin sê: Val op ons! en vir die heuwels: Bedek ons!

column2: Luke 23:31 For if they do these things in a green tree, what shall be done in the dry?
column3: Lukas 23:31 Want as hulle dit doen aan die groen hout, wat sal met die droë gebeur!

column2: Luke 23:32 And there were also two other, malefactors, led with him to be put to death.
column3: Lukas 23:32 En daar is nog twee ander, kwaaddoeners, weggelei om saam met Hom tereggestel te word.

column2: Luke 23:33 And when they were come to the place, which is called Calvary, there they crucified him, and the malefactors, one on the right hand, and the other on the left.
column3: Lukas 23:33 EN toe hulle op die plek kom wat Hoofskedel genoem word, het hulle Hom daar gekruisig, en die kwaaddoeners, een aan die regter- en een aan die linkerkant.

column2: Luke 23:34 Then said Jesus, Father, forgive them; for they know not what they do. And they parted his raiment, and cast lots.
column3: Lukas 23:34 En Jesus sê: Vader, vergeef hulle, want hulle weet nie wat hulle doen nie. En hulle het sy klere verdeel en die lot daaroor gewerp.

column2: Luke 23:35 And the people stood beholding. And the rulers also with them derided [him], saying, He saved others; let him save himself, if he be Christ, the chosen of God.
column3: Lukas 23:35 En die volk het dit staan en aanskou. En die owerstes het saam met hulle ook geskimp en gesê: Ander het Hy verlos; laat Hy Homself verlos as Hy die Christus, die uitverkorene van God, is.

column2: Luke 23:36 And the soldiers also mocked him, coming to him, and offering him vinegar,
column3: Lukas 23:36 En die soldate het Hom ook bespot en gekom en vir Hom asyn gebring

column2: Luke 23:37 And saying, If thou be the king of the Jews, save thyself.
column3: Lukas 23:37 en gesê: As U die Koning van die Jode is, verlos Uself.

column2: Luke 23:38 And a superscription also was written over him in letters of Greek, and Latin, and Hebrew, THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.
column3: Lukas 23:38 En daar was ook ’n opskrif bokant Hom geskrywe in Griekse en Romeinse en Hebreeuse letters: HY IS DIE KONING VAN DIE JODE.

column2: Luke 23:39 And one of the malefactors which were hanged railed on him, saying, If thou be Christ, save thyself and us.
column3: Lukas 23:39 En een van die kwaaddoeners wat opgehang is, het Hom gesmaad en gesê: As U die Christus is, verlos Uself en ons.

column2: Luke 23:40 But the other answering rebuked him, saying, Dost not thou fear God, seeing thou art in the same condemnation?
column3: Lukas 23:40 Maar die ander een antwoord en bestraf hom en sê: Vrees jý ook God nie, terwyl jy in dieselfde oordeel is? —

column2: Luke 23:41 And we indeed justly; for we receive the due reward of our deeds: but this man hath done nothing amiss.
column3: Lukas 23:41 ons tog regverdiglik, want ons ontvang die verdiende loon vir ons dade, maar Hy het niks verkeerds gedoen nie.

column2: Luke 23:42 And he said unto Jesus, Lord, remember me when thou comest into thy kingdom.
column3: Lukas 23:42 En hy sê vir Jesus: Dink aan my, Here, wanneer U in u koninkryk kom.

column2: Luke 23:43 And Jesus said unto him, Verily I say unto thee, To day shalt thou be with me in paradise.
column3: Lukas 23:43 En Jesus antwoord hom: Voorwaar Ek sê vir jou, vandag sal jy saam met My in die Paradys wees.

column2: Luke 23:44 And it was about the sixth hour, and there was a darkness over all the earth until the ninth hour.
column3: Lukas 23:44 En dit was omtrent die sesde uur, en daar het duisternis oor die hele aarde gekom tot die negende uur toe;

column2: Luke 23:45 And the sun was darkened, and the veil of the temple was rent in the midst.
column3: Lukas 23:45 en die son is verduister; en die voorhangsel van die tempel het middeldeur geskeur.

column2: Luke 23:46 And when Jesus had cried with a loud voice, he said, Father, into thy hands I commend my spirit: and having said thus, he gave up the ghost.
column3: Lukas 23:46 En Jesus het met ’n groot stem uitgeroep en gesê: Vader, in u hande gee Ek my gees oor! En toe Hy dit gesê het, blaas Hy die laaste asem uit.

column2: Luke 23:47 Now when the centurion saw what was done, he glorified God, saying, Certainly this was a righteous man.
column3: Lukas 23:47 En toe die hoofman oor honderd sien wat daar gebeur, het hy God verheerlik en gesê: Waarlik, hierdie man was regverdig.

column2: Luke 23:48 And all the people that came together to that sight, beholding the things which were done, smote their breasts, and returned.
column3: Lukas 23:48 En die hele skare wat vir hierdie skouspel bymekaar was, het op hulle borste geslaan toe hulle sien wat gebeur het, en hulle het teruggegaan.

column2: Luke 23:49 And all his acquaintance, and the women that followed him from Galilee, stood afar off, beholding these things.
column3: Lukas 23:49 En al sy bekendes het ver weg gestaan; ook die vroue wat Hom van Galiléa gevolg het, het hierdie dinge gesien.

column2: Luke 23:50 And, behold, [there was] a man named Joseph, a counsellor; [and he was] a good man, and a just:
column3: Lukas 23:50 EN daar was ’n man met die naam van Josef, ’n lid van die Raad, ’n goeie en regverdige man

column2: Luke 23:51 (The same had not consented to the counsel and deed of them;) [he was] of Arimathaea, a city of the Jews: who also himself waited for the kingdom of God.
column3: Lukas 23:51 — hy het nie met hulle raad en handelwyse saamgestem nie — van Arimathéa, ’n stad van die Jode, wat ook self die koninkryk van God verwag het.

column2: Luke 23:52 This [man] went unto Pilate, and begged the body of Jesus.
column3: Lukas 23:52 Hy het na Pilatus gegaan en die liggaam van Jesus gevra

column2: Luke 23:53 And he took it down, and wrapped it in linen, and laid it in a sepulchre that was hewn in stone, wherein never man before was laid.
column3: Lukas 23:53 en dit afgehaal en in linne toegedraai en dit neergelê in ’n graf wat uit ’n rots gekap was, waar nog nooit iemand in gelê het nie.

column2: Luke 23:54 And that day was the preparation, and the sabbath drew on.
column3: Lukas 23:54 En dit was die dag van voorbereiding, en die sabbat wou aanbreek.

column2: Luke 23:55 And the women also, which came with him from Galilee, followed after, and beheld the sepulchre, and how his body was laid.
column3: Lukas 23:55 En die vroue wat saam met Hom van Galiléa gekom het, het ook gevolg en die graf gesien en hoe sy liggaam neergelê was.

column2: Luke 23:56 And they returned, and prepared spices and ointments; and rested the sabbath day according to the commandment.
column3: Lukas 23:56 Daarop het hulle teruggegaan en speserye en salf berei en op die sabbat gerus volgens die gebod.

column2: Luke 24:1 Now upon the first [day] of the week, very early in the morning, they came unto the sepulchre, bringing the spices which they had prepared, and certain [others] with them.
column3: Lukas 24:1 EN baie vroeg in die môre, op die eerste dag van die week, het hulle en ander saam met hulle by die graf gekom en die speserye gebring wat deur hulle toeberei was.

column2: Luke 24:2 And they found the stone rolled away from the sepulchre.
column3: Lukas 24:2 En hulle het die steen van die graf afgerol gevind.

column2: Luke 24:3 And they entered in, and found not the body of the Lord Jesus.
column3: Lukas 24:3 En toe hulle ingaan, het hulle nie die liggaam van die Here Jesus gekry nie.

column2: Luke 24:4 And it came to pass, as they were much perplexed thereabout, behold, two men stood by them in shining garments:
column3: Lukas 24:4 En terwyl hulle hieroor in verleentheid was, staan daar twee manne by hulle in blink klere.

column2: Luke 24:5 And as they were afraid, and bowed down [their] faces to the earth, they said unto them, Why seek ye the living among the dead?
column3: Lukas 24:5 En toe hulle baie bevrees word en met hulle aangesigte na die aarde buig, sê die manne vir hulle: Waarom soek julle die Lewende by die dooies?

column2: Luke 24:6 He is not here, but is risen: remember how he spake unto you when he was yet in Galilee,
column3: Lukas 24:6 Hy is nie hier nie, maar Hy het opgestaan. Onthou hoe Hy vir julle gesê het toe Hy nog in Galiléa was:

column2: Luke 24:7 Saying, The Son of man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again.
column3: Lukas 24:7 Die Seun van die mens moet oorgelewer word in die hande van sondige mense en gekruisig word en op die derde dag opstaan.

column2: Luke 24:8 And they remembered his words,
column3: Lukas 24:8 En hulle het sy woorde onthou.

column2: Luke 24:9 And returned from the sepulchre, and told all these things unto the eleven, and to all the rest.
column3: Lukas 24:9 Hulle gaan toe terug van die graf en vertel dit alles aan die elf en aan al die ander.

column2: Luke 24:10 It was Mary Magdalene, and Joanna, and Mary [the mother] of James, and other [women that were] with them, which told these things unto the apostles.
column3: Lukas 24:10 En dit was Maria Magdaléna en Johanna en Maria, die moeder van Jakobus, en die ander vroue saam met hulle wat dit aan die apostels vertel het.

column2: Luke 24:11 And their words seemed to them as idle tales, and they believed them not.
column3: Lukas 24:11 En hul woorde het vir hulle na onsinnige praatjies gelyk, en hulle het hul nie geglo nie.

column2: Luke 24:12 Then arose Peter, and ran unto the sepulchre; and stooping down, he beheld the linen clothes laid by themselves, and departed, wondering in himself at that which was come to pass.
column3: Lukas 24:12 Maar Petrus het opgestaan en na die graf gehardloop; en toe hy neerbuk, sien hy die doeke alleen lê. En hy het weggegaan huis toe, vol verwondering oor wat gebeur het.

column2: Luke 24:13 And, behold, two of them went that same day to a village called Emmaus, which was from Jerusalem [about] threescore furlongs.
column3: Lukas 24:13 EN twee van hulle was dieselfde dag op pad na ’n dorp wat agt myl van Jerusalem af was, met die naam van Émmaüs.

column2: Luke 24:14 And they talked together of all these things which had happened.
column3: Lukas 24:14 En hulle was in gesprek met mekaar oor al hierdie dinge wat voorgeval het.

column2: Luke 24:15 And it came to pass, that, while they communed [together] and reasoned, Jesus himself drew near, and went with them.
column3: Lukas 24:15 En terwyl hulle praat en mekaar ondervra, kom Jesus self nader en loop met hulle saam.

column2: Luke 24:16 But their eyes were holden that they should not know him.
column3: Lukas 24:16 Maar hulle oë is weerhou, sodat hulle Hom nie kon herken nie.

column2: Luke 24:17 And he said unto them, What manner of communications [are] these that ye have one to another, as ye walk, and are sad?
column3: Lukas 24:17 En Hy sê vir hulle: Watter woorde is dit wat julle met mekaar loop en wissel, en waarom is julle bedroef?

column2: Luke 24:18 And the one of them, whose name was Cleopas, answering said unto him, Art thou only a stranger in Jerusalem, and hast not known the things which are come to pass there in these days?
column3: Lukas 24:18 En die een wie se naam Kléopas was, antwoord en sê vir Hom: Is U alleen ’n vreemdeling in Jerusalem en weet U nie van die dinge wat in hierdie dae daarin gebeur het nie?

column2: Luke 24:19 And he said unto them, What things? And they said unto him, Concerning Jesus of Nazareth, which was a prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people:
column3: Lukas 24:19 En Hy sê vir hulle: Watter dinge? En hulle antwoord Hom: Die dinge aangaande Jesus, die Nasaréner, wat ’n profeet was, kragtig in werk en woord voor God en die hele volk;

column2: Luke 24:20 And how the chief priests and our rulers delivered him to be condemned to death, and have crucified him.
column3: Lukas 24:20 en hoe ons owerpriesters en owerstes Hom oorgelewer het tot die doodstraf en Hom gekruisig het.

column2: Luke 24:21 But we trusted that it had been he which should have redeemed Israel: and beside all this, to day is the third day since these things were done.
