column3: Lukas 24:21 En ons het gehoop dat dit Hy was wat Israel sou verlos; maar nou is dit vandag, met dit alles, die derde dag vandat dit plaasgevind het.

column2: Luke 24:22 Yea, and certain women also of our company made us astonished, which were early at the sepulchre;
column3: Lukas 24:22 Maar sommige vroue uit ons het ons ook ontstel nadat hulle vroeg by die graf was;

column2: Luke 24:23 And when they found not his body, they came, saying, that they had also seen a vision of angels, which said that he was alive.
column3: Lukas 24:23 en toe hulle sy liggaam nie kry nie, het hulle gekom en gesê dat hulle ook ’n gesig gesien het van engele wat sê dat Hy lewe.

column2: Luke 24:24 And certain of them which were with us went to the sepulchre, and found [it] even so as the women had said: but him they saw not.
column3: Lukas 24:24 En sommige van die wat saam met ons was, het na die graf gegaan en dit net so gevind soos die vroue ook gesê het; maar Hom het hulle nie gesien nie.

column2: Luke 24:25 Then he said unto them, O fools, and slow of heart to believe all that the prophets have spoken:
column3: Lukas 24:25 En Hy sê vir hulle: O Onverstandiges, met harte wat traag is om te glo alles wat die profete gespreek het!

column2: Luke 24:26 Ought not Christ to have suffered these things, and to enter into his glory?
column3: Lukas 24:26 Moes die Christus nie hierdie dinge ly en in sy heerlikheid ingaan nie?

column2: Luke 24:27 And beginning at Moses and all the prophets, he expounded unto them in all the scriptures the things concerning himself.
column3: Lukas 24:27 En Hy het begin van Moses en al die profete af en vir hulle uitgelê in al die Skrifte die dinge wat op Hom betrekking het.

column2: Luke 24:28 And they drew nigh unto the village, whither they went: and he made as though he would have gone further.
column3: Lukas 24:28 Daarop kom hulle naby die dorp waarheen hulle op reis was, en Hy het gemaak of Hy verder wou gaan;

column2: Luke 24:29 But they constrained him, saying, Abide with us: for it is toward evening, and the day is far spent. And he went in to tarry with them.
column3: Lukas 24:29 maar hulle het by Hom aangedring en gesê: Bly by ons, want dit is amper aand en die dag het gedaal; en Hy het ingegaan om by hulle te bly.

column2: Luke 24:30 And it came to pass, as he sat at meat with them, he took bread, and blessed [it], and brake, and gave to them.
column3: Lukas 24:30 En toe Hy met hulle aan tafel was, neem Hy die brood en dank; en Hy breek dit en gee dit aan hulle.

column2: Luke 24:31 And their eyes were opened, and they knew him; and he vanished out of their sight.
column3: Lukas 24:31 Toe is hulle oë geopen en hulle het Hom herken, en Hy het uit hulle gesig verdwyn.

column2: Luke 24:32 And they said one to another, Did not our heart burn within us, while he talked with us by the way, and while he opened to us the scriptures?
column3: Lukas 24:32 En hulle sê vir mekaar: Was ons hart nie brandende in ons toe Hy met ons op die pad gepraat en vir ons die Skrifte uitgelê het nie?

column2: Luke 24:33 And they rose up the same hour, and returned to Jerusalem, and found the eleven gathered together, and them that were with them,
column3: Lukas 24:33 Toe staan hulle in dieselfde uur op en gaan na Jerusalem terug en vind die elf en die wat saam met hulle bymekaar was,

column2: Luke 24:34 Saying, The Lord is risen indeed, and hath appeared to Simon.
column3: Lukas 24:34 wat sê: Die Here het waarlik opgestaan en het aan Simon verskyn.

column2: Luke 24:35 And they told what things [were done] in the way, and how he was known of them in breaking of bread.
column3: Lukas 24:35 Toe vertel hulle wat op die pad gebeur het en hoe Hy aan hulle bekend geword het by die breking van die brood.

column2: Luke 24:36 And as they thus spake, Jesus himself stood in the midst of them, and saith unto them, Peace [be] unto you.
column3: Lukas 24:36 EN terwyl hulle hieroor praat, staan Jesus self in hul midde en sê vir hulle: Vrede vir julle!

column2: Luke 24:37 But they were terrified and affrighted, and supposed that they had seen a spirit.
column3: Lukas 24:37 Toe het hulle verskrik en baie bang geword en gemeen dat hulle ’n gees sien.

column2: Luke 24:38 And he said unto them, Why are ye troubled? and why do thoughts arise in your hearts?
column3: Lukas 24:38 En Hy sê vir hulle: Waarom is julle ontsteld en waarom kom daar twyfel in julle hart op?

column2: Luke 24:39 Behold my hands and my feet, that it is I myself: handle me, and see; for a spirit hath not flesh and bones, as ye see me have.
column3: Lukas 24:39 Kyk na my hande en my voete, want dit is Ek self. Voel aan My en kyk; want ’n gees het nie vlees en bene soos julle sien dat Ek het nie.

column2: Luke 24:40 And when he had thus spoken, he shewed them [his] hands and [his] feet.
column3: Lukas 24:40 En terwyl Hy dit sê, wys Hy hulle sy hande en sy voete.

column2: Luke 24:41 And while they yet believed not for joy, and wondered, he said unto them, Have ye here any meat?
column3: Lukas 24:41 En toe hulle van blydskap nog nie kon glo nie en hulle verwonder, sê Hy vir hulle: Het julle hier iets om te eet?

column2: Luke 24:42 And they gave him a piece of a broiled fish, and of an honeycomb.
column3: Lukas 24:42 Daarop gee hulle Hom ’n stuk gebraaide vis en ’n stuk heuningkoek.

column2: Luke 24:43 And he took [it], and did eat before them.
column3: Lukas 24:43 En Hy het dit geneem en voor hulle oë geëet.

column2: Luke 24:44 And he said unto them, These [are] the words which I spake unto you, while I was yet with you, that all things must be fulfilled, which were written in the law of Moses, and [in] the prophets, and [in] the psalms, concerning me.
column3: Lukas 24:44 En Hy sê vir hulle: Dit is die woorde wat Ek met julle gespreek het toe Ek nog by julle was, dat alles wat oor My geskrywe is in die wet van Moses en die profete en die psalms, vervul moet word.

column2: Luke 24:45 Then opened he their understanding, that they might understand the scriptures,
column3: Lukas 24:45 Toe open Hy hulle verstand om die Skrifte te verstaan.

column2: Luke 24:46 And said unto them, Thus it is written, and thus it behoved Christ to suffer, and to rise from the dead the third day:
column3: Lukas 24:46 En Hy sê vir hulle: So is dit geskrywe, en so moes die Christus ly en op die derde dag uit die dode opstaan,

column2: Luke 24:47 And that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in his name among all nations, beginning at Jerusalem.
column3: Lukas 24:47 en bekering en vergewing van sondes in sy Naam verkondig word aan al die nasies, van Jerusalem af en verder.

column2: Luke 24:48 And ye are witnesses of these things.
column3: Lukas 24:48 En julle is getuies van hierdie dinge.

column2: Luke 24:49 And, behold, I send the promise of my Father upon you: but tarry ye in the city of Jerusalem, until ye be endued with power from on high.
column3: Lukas 24:49 En kyk, Ek stuur die belofte van my Vader op julle. Maar julle moet in die stad Jerusalem bly totdat julle toegerus is met krag uit die hoogte.

column2: Luke 24:50 And he led them out as far as to Bethany, and he lifted up his hands, and blessed them.
column3: Lukas 24:50 EN Hy het hulle uitgelei tot by Betánië. En Hy het sy hande opgehef en hulle geseën.

column2: Luke 24:51 And it came to pass, while he blessed them, he was parted from them, and carried up into heaven.
column3: Lukas 24:51 En terwyl Hy hulle seën, het Hy van hulle geskei en is in die hemel opgeneem.

column2: Luke 24:52 And they worshipped him, and returned to Jerusalem with great joy:
column3: Lukas 24:52 En hulle het Hom aanbid en na Jerusalem teruggegaan met groot blydskap.

column2: Luke 24:53 And were continually in the temple, praising and blessing God. Amen.
column3: Lukas 24:53 En hulle was gedurig in die tempel en het God geprys en gedank. Amen.

column2: John 1:1 In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
column3: Johannes 1:1 IN die begin was die Woord, en die Woord was by God, en die Woord was God.

column2: John 1:2 The same was in the beginning with God.
column3: Johannes 1:2 Hy was in die begin by God.

column2: John 1:3 All things were made by him; and without him was not any thing made that was made.
column3: Johannes 1:3 Alle dinge het deur Hom ontstaan, en sonder Hom het nie een ding ontstaan wat ontstaan het nie.

column2: John 1:4 In him was life; and the life was the light of men.
column3: Johannes 1:4 In Hom was lewe, en die lewe was die lig van die mense.

column2: John 1:5 And the light shineth in darkness; and the darkness comprehended it not.
column3: Johannes 1:5 En die lig skyn in die duisternis, en die duisternis het dit nie oorweldig nie.

column2: John 1:6 There was a man sent from God, whose name [was] John.
column3: Johannes 1:6 Daar was ’n man van God gestuur, wie se naam Johannes was.

column2: John 1:7 The same came for a witness, to bear witness of the Light, that all [men] through him might believe.
column3: Johannes 1:7 Hy het tot ’n getuienis gekom om van die lig te getuig, sodat almal deur hom sou glo.

column2: John 1:8 He was not that Light, but [was sent] to bear witness of that Light.
column3: Johannes 1:8 Hy was nie die lig nie, maar hy moes van die lig getuig.

column2: John 1:9 [That] was the true Light, which lighteth every man that cometh into the world.
column3: Johannes 1:9 Die waaragtige lig wat elke mens verlig, was aan kom in die wêreld.

column2: John 1:10 He was in the world, and the world was made by him, and the world knew him not.
column3: Johannes 1:10 Hy was in die wêreld, en die wêreld het deur Hom ontstaan, en die wêreld het Hom nie geken nie.

column2: John 1:11 He came unto his own, and his own received him not.
column3: Johannes 1:11 Hy het na sy eiendom gekom, en sy eie mense het Hom nie aangeneem nie.

column2: John 1:12 But as many as received him, to them gave he power to become the sons of God, [even] to them that believe on his name:
column3: Johannes 1:12 Maar almal wat Hom aangeneem het, aan hulle het Hy mag gegee om kinders van God te word, aan hulle wat in sy Naam glo;

column2: John 1:13 Which were born, not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.
column3: Johannes 1:13 wat nie uit die bloed of uit die wil van die vlees of uit die wil van ’n man nie, maar uit God gebore is.

column2: John 1:14 And the Word was made flesh, and dwelt among us, (and we beheld his glory, the glory as of the only begotten of the Father,) full of grace and truth.
column3: Johannes 1:14 En die Woord het vlees geword en het onder ons gewoon — en ons het sy heerlikheid aanskou, ’n heerlikheid soos van die Eniggeborene wat van die Vader kom — vol van genade en waarheid.

column2: John 1:15 John bare witness of him, and cried, saying, This was he of whom I spake, He that cometh after me is preferred before me: for he was before me.
column3: Johannes 1:15 JOHANNES getuig van Hom en roep en sê: Dit was Hy van wie ek gesê het: Hy wat ná my kom, het voor my geword, want Hy was eerder as ek.

column2: John 1:16 And of his fulness have all we received, and grace for grace.
column3: Johannes 1:16 En uit sy volheid het ons almal ontvang, ja, genade op genade.

column2: John 1:17 For the law was given by Moses, [but] grace and truth came by Jesus Christ.
column3: Johannes 1:17 Want die wet is deur Moses gegee; die genade en die waarheid het deur Jesus Christus gekom.

column2: John 1:18 No man hath seen God at any time; the only begotten Son, which is in the bosom of the Father, he hath declared [him].
column3: Johannes 1:18 Niemand het ooit God gesien nie; die eniggebore Seun wat in die boesem van die Vader is, dié het Hom verklaar.

column2: John 1:19 And this is the record of John, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, Who art thou?
column3: Johannes 1:19 En dit is die getuienis van Johannes, toe die Jode uit Jerusalem priesters en Leviete gestuur het om hom te vra: Wie is u?

column2: John 1:20 And he confessed, and denied not; but confessed, I am not the Christ.
column3: Johannes 1:20 En hy het erken en nie ontken nie, maar het erken: Ek is nie die Christus nie.

column2: John 1:21 And they asked him, What then? Art thou Elias? And he saith, I am not. Art thou that prophet? And he answered, No.
column3: Johannes 1:21 Toe vra hulle hom: Wat dan? Is u Elía? En hy sê: Ek is nie. Is u die profeet? En hy antwoord: Nee.

column2: John 1:22 Then said they unto him, Who art thou? that we may give an answer to them that sent us. What sayest thou of thyself?
column3: Johannes 1:22 Toe sê hulle vir hom: Wie is u? — dat ons antwoord kan gee aan die wat ons gestuur het. Wat sê u van uself?

column2: John 1:23 He said, I [am] the voice of one crying in the wilderness, Make straight the way of the Lord, as said the prophet Esaias.
column3: Johannes 1:23 Hy antwoord: Ek is die stem van een wat roep in die woestyn: Maak die pad van die Here reguit! soos Jesaja, die profeet, gesê het.

column2: John 1:24 And they which were sent were of the Pharisees.
column3: Johannes 1:24 En die wat gestuur was, was uit die Fariseërs.

column2: John 1:25 And they asked him, and said unto him, Why baptizest thou then, if thou be not that Christ, nor Elias, neither that prophet?
column3: Johannes 1:25 En hulle vra hom en sê vir hom: Waarom doop u dan as u nie die Christus of Elía of die profeet is nie?

column2: John 1:26 John answered them, saying, I baptize with water: but there standeth one among you, whom ye know not;
column3: Johannes 1:26 Johannes antwoord hulle en sê: Ek doop met water, maar onder julle staan Hy vir wie julle nie ken nie —

column2: John 1:27 He it is, who coming after me is preferred before me, whose shoe's latchet I am not worthy to unloose.
column3: Johannes 1:27 dit is Hy wat ná my kom, wat voor my geword het, wie se skoenriem ek nie waardig is om los te maak nie.

column2: John 1:28 These things were done in Bethabara beyond Jordan, where John was baptizing.
column3: Johannes 1:28 Dit het gebeur in Betábara, oorkant die Jordaan, waar Johannes besig was om te doop.

column2: John 1:29 The next day John seeth Jesus coming unto him, and saith, Behold the Lamb of God, which taketh away the sin of the world.
column3: Johannes 1:29 Die volgende dag sien Johannes Jesus na hom toe kom, en hy sê: Dáár is die Lam van God wat die sonde van die wêreld wegneem!

column2: John 1:30 This is he of whom I said, After me cometh a man which is preferred before me: for he was before me.
column3: Johannes 1:30 Dit is Hy van wie ek gesê het: Ná my kom ’n man wat voor my geword het, want Hy was eerder as ek.

column2: John 1:31 And I knew him not: but that he should be made manifest to Israel, therefore am I come baptizing with water.
column3: Johannes 1:31 En ek het Hom nie geken nie; maar dat Hy aan Israel openbaar sou word, daarom het ek gekom en met water gedoop.

column2: John 1:32 And John bare record, saying, I saw the Spirit descending from heaven like a dove, and it abode upon him.
column3: Johannes 1:32 En Johannes het getuig en gesê: Ek het die Gees soos ’n duif uit die hemel sien neerdaal, en Hy het op Hom gebly.

column2: John 1:33 And I knew him not: but he that sent me to baptize with water, the same said unto me, Upon whom thou shalt see the Spirit descending, and remaining on him, the same is he which baptizeth with the Holy Ghost.
column3: Johannes 1:33 En ek het Hom nie geken nie; maar Hy wat my gestuur het om met water te doop, Hy het aan my gesê: Op wie jy die Gees sien neerdaal en op Hom bly, dit is Hy wat met die Heilige Gees doop.

column2: John 1:34 And I saw, and bare record that this is the Son of God.
column3: Johannes 1:34 En ek het gesien en getuig dat Hy die Seun van God is.

column2: John 1:35 Again the next day after John stood, and two of his disciples;
column3: Johannes 1:35 DIE volgende dag het Johannes weer daar gestaan en twee van sy dissipels;

column2: John 1:36 And looking upon Jesus as he walked, he saith, Behold the Lamb of God!
column3: Johannes 1:36 en toe hy Jesus sien wandel, sê hy: Dáár is die Lam van God!

column2: John 1:37 And the two disciples heard him speak, and they followed Jesus.
column3: Johannes 1:37 En die twee dissipels het hom dit hoor sê en Jesus gevolg.

column2: John 1:38 Then Jesus turned, and saw them following, and saith unto them, What seek ye? They said unto him, Rabbi, (which is to say, being interpreted, Master,) where dwellest thou?
column3: Johannes 1:38 En toe Jesus Hom omdraai en hulle sien volg, sê Hy vir hulle:
Johannes 1:39 Wat soek julle? En hulle antwoord Hom: Rabbi — dit wil sê, as dit vertaal word, Meester — waar is U tuis?

column2: John 1:39 He saith unto them, Come and see. They came and saw where he dwelt, and abode with him that day: for it was about the tenth hour.
column3: Johannes 1:40 Hy sê vir hulle: Kom kyk. Hulle het gegaan en gesien waar Hy tuis was en dié dag by Hom gebly. En dit was omtrent die tiende uur.

column2: John 1:40 One of the two which heard John [speak], and followed him, was Andrew, Simon Peter's brother.
column3: Johannes 1:41 Andréas, die broer van Simon Petrus, was een van die twee wat dit van Johannes gehoor en Hom gevolg het.

column2: John 1:41 He first findeth his own brother Simon, and saith unto him, We have found the Messias, which is, being interpreted, the Christ.
column3: Johannes 1:42 Hy het eers sy eie broer Simon gekry en vir hom gesê: Ons het die Messías gevind — dit is, as dit vertaal word, die Christus.

column2: John 1:42 And he brought him to Jesus. And when Jesus beheld him, he said, Thou art Simon the son of Jona: thou shalt be called Cephas, which is by interpretation, A stone.
column3: Johannes 1:43 En hy het hom na Jesus gelei. Toe kyk Jesus hom aan en sê: Jy is Simon, die seun van Jona; jy sal genoem word Céfas, wat vertaal word Petrus.

column2: John 1:43 The day following Jesus would go forth into Galilee, and findeth Philip, and saith unto him, Follow me.
column3: Johannes 1:44 Die volgende dag wou Jesus na Galiléa vertrek; en Hy het Filippus gekry en vir hom gesê: Volg My.

column2: John 1:44 Now Philip was of Bethsaida, the city of Andrew and Peter.
column3: Johannes 1:45 En Filippus was van Betsáida, uit die stad van Andréas en Petrus.

column2: John 1:45 Philip findeth Nathanael, and saith unto him, We have found him, of whom Moses in the law, and the prophets, did write, Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.
column3: Johannes 1:46 Filippus het Natánael gekry en vir hom gesê: Ons het Hom gevind van wie Moses in die wet en ook die profete geskrywe het: Jesus, die seun van Josef van Násaret.

column2: John 1:46 And Nathanael said unto him, Can there any good thing come out of Nazareth? Philip saith unto him, Come and see.
column3: Johannes 1:47 En Natánael sê vir hom: Kan daar uit Násaret iets goeds wees? Filippus antwoord hom: Kom kyk.

column2: John 1:47 Jesus saw Nathanael coming to him, and saith of him, Behold an Israelite indeed, in whom is no guile!
column3: Johannes 1:48 Daarop sien Jesus Natánael na Hom toe kom en sê van hom: Hier is waarlik ’n Israeliet in wie daar geen bedrog is nie.

column2: John 1:48 Nathanael saith unto him, Whence knowest thou me? Jesus answered and said unto him, Before that Philip called thee, when thou wast under the fig tree, I saw thee.
column3: Johannes 1:49 Natánael sê vir Hom: Waarvandaan ken U my? Jesus antwoord en sê vir hom: Voordat Filippus jou geroep het toe jy onder die vyeboom was, het Ek jou gesien.

column2: John 1:49 Nathanael answered and saith unto him, Rabbi, thou art the Son of God; thou art the King of Israel.
column3: Johannes 1:50 Natánael antwoord en sê vir Hom: Rabbi, U is die Seun van God, U is die Koning van Israel!

column2: John 1:50 Jesus answered and said unto him, Because I said unto thee, I saw thee under the fig tree, believest thou? thou shalt see greater things than these.
column3: Johannes 1:51 Jesus antwoord en sê vir hom: Glo jy omdat Ek vir jou gesê het: Ek het jou onder die vyeboom gesien? Jy sal groter dinge sien as dit.

column2: John 1:51 And he saith unto him, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Hereafter ye shall see heaven open, and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of man.
column3: Johannes 1:52 En Hy sê vir hom: Voorwaar, voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, van nou af sal julle die hemel geopend sien en die engele van God opklim en neerdaal op die Seun van die mens.

column2: John 2:1 And the third day there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee; and the mother of Jesus was there:
column3: Johannes 2:1 EN op die derde dag was daar ’n bruilof te Kana in Galiléa, en die moeder van Jesus was daar.

column2: John 2:2 And both Jesus was called, and his disciples, to the marriage.
column3: Johannes 2:2 En Jesus en sy dissipels was ook na die bruilof genooi.

column2: John 2:3 And when they wanted wine, the mother of Jesus saith unto him, They have no wine.
column3: Johannes 2:3 En toe daar wyn kortkom, sê die moeder van Jesus vir Hom: Hulle het geen wyn nie.

column2: John 2:4 Jesus saith unto her, Woman, what have I to do with thee? mine hour is not yet come.
column3: Johannes 2:4 Jesus sê vir haar: Vrou, wat het Ek met u te doen? My uur het nog nie gekom nie.

column2: John 2:5 His mother saith unto the servants, Whatsoever he saith unto you, do [it].
column3: Johannes 2:5 Sy moeder sê vir die dienaars: Net wat Hy vir julle sê, moet julle doen.

column2: John 2:6 And there were set there six waterpots of stone, after the manner of the purifying of the Jews, containing two or three firkins apiece.
column3: Johannes 2:6 En daar het volgens die reinigingsgebruike van die Jode ses klipkanne gestaan, wat elkeen twee of drie ankers hou.

column2: John 2:7 Jesus saith unto them, Fill the waterpots with water. And they filled them up to the brim.
column3: Johannes 2:7 Jesus sê vir hulle: Maak die kanne vol water En hulle het hul tot bo toe volgemaak.

column2: John 2:8 And he saith unto them, Draw out now, and bear unto the governor of the feast. And they bare [it].
column3: Johannes 2:8 En Hy sê aan hulle: Skep nou uit en bring dit vir die hoofdienaar En hulle het dit gebring.

column2: John 2:9 When the ruler of the feast had tasted the water that was made wine, and knew not whence it was: (but the servants which drew the water knew;) the governor of the feast called the bridegroom,
column3: Johannes 2:9 En toe die hoofdienaar die water proe wat wyn geword het — en hy het nie geweet waarvandaan dit was nie, maar die dienaars wat die water geskep het, het geweet — roep die hoofdienaar die bruidegom

column2: John 2:10 And saith unto him, Every man at the beginning doth set forth good wine; and when men have well drunk, then that which is worse: [but] thou hast kept the good wine until now.
column3: Johannes 2:10 en sê vir hom: Elke mens sit eers die goeie wyn op en, wanneer hulle goed gedrink het, dan die slegste; maar u het die goeie wyn tot nou toe bewaar.

column2: John 2:11 This beginning of miracles did Jesus in Cana of Galilee, and manifested forth his glory; and his disciples believed on him.
column3: Johannes 2:11 Hierdie eerste een van sy tekens het Jesus te Kana in Galiléa gedoen; en Hy het sy heerlikheid geopenbaar, en sy dissipels het in Hom geglo.

column2: John 2:12 After this he went down to Capernaum, he, and his mother, and his brethren, and his disciples: and they continued there not many days.
column3: Johannes 2:12 Daarna het Hy na Kapérnaüm afgegaan, Hy en sy moeder en sy broers en sy dissipels, en hulle het daar nie baie dae gebly nie.

column2: John 2:13 And the Jews' passover was at hand, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem,
column3: Johannes 2:13 EN die pasga van die Jode was naby, en Jesus het opgegaan na Jerusalem.

column2: John 2:14 And found in the temple those that sold oxen and sheep and doves, and the changers of money sitting:
column3: Johannes 2:14 En Hy het in die tempel gevind die wat beeste en skape en duiwe verkoop, en die geldwisselaars wat daar sit.

column2: John 2:15 And when he had made a scourge of small cords, he drove them all out of the temple, and the sheep, and the oxen; and poured out the changers' money, and overthrew the tables;
column3: Johannes 2:15 En Hy het ’n sweep van toutjies gemaak en almal uit die tempel uitgedrywe, ook die skape en die beeste, en die kleingeld van die wisselaars het Hy uitgegooi en hulle tafels omgekeer.

column2: John 2:16 And said unto them that sold doves, Take these things hence; make not my Father's house an house of merchandise.
column3: Johannes 2:16 En vir die duiweverkopers het Hy gesê: Neem daardie dinge hier weg; moenie die huis van my Vader ’n handelshuis maak nie.

column2: John 2:17 And his disciples remembered that it was written, The zeal of thine house hath eaten me up.
column3: Johannes 2:17 En sy dissipels het onthou dat daar geskrywe is: Die ywer vir u huis het my verteer.

column2: John 2:18 Then answered the Jews and said unto him, What sign shewest thou unto us, seeing that thou doest these things?
column3: Johannes 2:18 Toe antwoord die Jode en sê vir Hom: Watter teken toon U aan ons, dat U hierdie dinge doen?

column2: John 2:19 Jesus answered and said unto them, Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.
column3: Johannes 2:19 Jesus antwoord en sê vir hulle: Breek hierdie tempel af, en in drie dae sal Ek dit oprig.

column2: John 2:20 Then said the Jews, Forty and six years was this temple in building, and wilt thou rear it up in three days?
column3: Johannes 2:20 En die Jode sê: Ses-en-veertig jaar lank is aan hierdie tempel gebou, en U, sal U dit in drie dae oprig?

column2: John 2:21 But he spake of the temple of his body.
column3: Johannes 2:21 Maar Hy het oor die tempel van sy liggaam gespreek.

column2: John 2:22 When therefore he was risen from the dead, his disciples remembered that he had said this unto them; and they believed the scripture, and the word which Jesus had said.
column3: Johannes 2:22 En toe Hy opgestaan het uit die dode, het sy dissipels onthou dat Hy dit vir hulle gesê het; en hulle het die Skrif geglo en die woord wat Jesus gespreek het.

column2: John 2:23 Now when he was in Jerusalem at the passover, in the feast [day], many believed in his name, when they saw the miracles which he did.
column3: Johannes 2:23 En toe Hy in Jerusalem was op die pasga gedurende die fees, het baie in sy Naam geglo, omdat hulle die tekens gesien het wat Hy doen.

column2: John 2:24 But Jesus did not commit himself unto them, because he knew all [men],
column3: Johannes 2:24 Maar Jesus self het Hom aan hulle nie toevertrou nie, omdat Hy almal geken het

column2: John 2:25 And needed not that any should testify of man: for he knew what was in man.
column3: Johannes 2:25 en omdat Hy nie nodig gehad het dat iemand van die mens sou getuig nie; want Hy self het geweet wat in die mens is.

column2: John 3:1 There was a man of the Pharisees, named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews:
column3: Johannes 3:1 EN daar was ’n man uit die Fariseërs met die naam van Nikodémus, ’n owerste van die Jode.

column2: John 3:2 The same came to Jesus by night, and said unto him, Rabbi, we know that thou art a teacher come from God: for no man can do these miracles that thou doest, except God be with him.
column3: Johannes 3:2 Hy het in die nag na Jesus gekom en vir Hom gesê: Rabbi, ons weet dat U ’n leraar is wat van God gekom het, want niemand kan hierdie tekens doen wat U doen as God nie met hom is nie.

column2: John 3:3 Jesus answered and said unto him, Verily, verily, I say unto thee, Except a man be born again, he cannot see the kingdom of God.
column3: Johannes 3:3 Jesus antwoord en sê vir hom: Voorwaar, voorwaar Ek sê vir jou, as iemand nie weer gebore word nie, kan hy die koninkryk van God nie sien nie.

column2: John 3:4 Nicodemus saith unto him, How can a man be born when he is old? can he enter the second time into his mother's womb, and be born?
column3: Johannes 3:4 Nikodémus sê vir Hom: Hoe kan ’n mens as hy oud is, gebore word? Hy kan tog nie ’n tweede keer in die skoot van sy moeder ingaan en gebore word nie?

column2: John 3:5 Jesus answered, Verily, verily, I say unto thee, Except a man be born of water and [of] the Spirit, he cannot enter into the kingdom of God.
column3: Johannes 3:5 Jesus antwoord: Voorwaar, voorwaar Ek sê vir jou, as iemand nie gebore word uit water en Gees nie, kan hy in die koninkryk van God nie ingaan nie.

column2: John 3:6 That which is born of the flesh is flesh; and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit.
column3: Johannes 3:6 Wat uit die vlees gebore is, is vlees; en wat uit die Gees gebore is, is gees.

column2: John 3:7 Marvel not that I said unto thee, Ye must be born again.
column3: Johannes 3:7 Moenie jou verwonder dat Ek vir jou gesê het, julle moet weer gebore word nie.

column2: John 3:8 The wind bloweth where it listeth, and thou hearest the sound thereof, but canst not tell whence it cometh, and whither it goeth: so is every one that is born of the Spirit.
column3: Johannes 3:8 Die wind waai waar hy wil, en jy hoor sy geluid, maar jy weet nie vanwaar hy kom en waarheen hy gaan nie. So is elkeen wat uit die Gees gebore is.

column2: John 3:9 Nicodemus answered and said unto him, How can these things be?
column3: Johannes 3:9 Nikodémus antwoord en sê vir Hom: Hoe kan hierdie dinge gebeur?

column2: John 3:10 Jesus answered and said unto him, Art thou a master of Israel, and knowest not these things?
column3: Johannes 3:10 Jesus antwoord en sê vir hom: Jy is die leraar van Israel en jy weet hierdie dinge nie?

column2: John 3:11 Verily, verily, I say unto thee, We speak that we do know, and testify that we have seen; and ye receive not our witness.
column3: Johannes 3:11 Voorwaar, voorwaar Ek sê vir jou, ons spreek wat ons weet en ons getuig van wat ons gesien het, en julle neem ons getuienis nie aan nie.

column2: John 3:12 If I have told you earthly things, and ye believe not, how shall ye believe, if I tell you [of] heavenly things?
column3: Johannes 3:12 As Ek julle van die aardse dinge vertel en julle nie glo nie, hoe sal julle glo as Ek julle van die hemelse vertel?

column2: John 3:13 And no man hath ascended up to heaven, but he that came down from heaven, [even] the Son of man which is in heaven.
column3: Johannes 3:13 En niemand het opgevaar in die hemel nie, behalwe Hy wat uit die hemel neergedaal het, naamlik die Seun van die mens wat in die hemel is.

column2: John 3:14 And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, even so must the Son of man be lifted up:
column3: Johannes 3:14 En soos Moses die slang in die woestyn verhoog het, so moet die Seun van die mens verhoog word,

column2: John 3:15 That whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have eternal life.
column3: Johannes 3:15 sodat elkeen wat in Hom glo, nie verlore mag gaan nie, maar die ewige lewe kan hê.

column2: John 3:16 For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life.
column3: Johannes 3:16 Want so lief het God die wêreld gehad, dat Hy sy eniggebore Seun gegee het, sodat elkeen wat in Hom glo, nie verlore mag gaan nie, maar die ewige lewe kan hê.

column2: John 3:17 For God sent not his Son into the world to condemn the world; but that the world through him might be saved.
column3: Johannes 3:17 Want God het sy Seun in die wêreld gestuur nie om die wêreld te veroordeel nie, maar dat die wêreld deur Hom gered kan word.

column2: John 3:18 He that believeth on him is not condemned: but he that believeth not is condemned already, because he hath not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God.
column3: Johannes 3:18 Hy wat in Hom glo, word nie veroordeel nie; maar hy wat nie glo nie, is alreeds veroordeel omdat hy nie geglo het in die Naam van die eniggebore Seun van God nie.

column2: John 3:19 And this is the condemnation, that light is come into the world, and men loved darkness rather than light, because their deeds were evil.
column3: Johannes 3:19 En dit is die oordeel: dat die lig in die wêreld gekom het, en die mense het die duisternis liewer gehad as die lig; want hulle werke was boos.

column2: John 3:20 For every one that doeth evil hateth the light, neither cometh to the light, lest his deeds should be reproved.
column3: Johannes 3:20 Want elkeen wat kwaad doen, haat die lig en kom nie na die lig nie, dat sy werke nie bestraf mag word nie.

column2: John 3:21 But he that doeth truth cometh to the light, that his deeds may be made manifest, that they are wrought in God.
column3: Johannes 3:21 Maar hy wat die waarheid doen, kom na die lig, sodat sy werke openbaar kan word, dat hulle in God gedoen is.

column2: John 3:22 After these things came Jesus and his disciples into the land of Judaea; and there he tarried with them, and baptized.
column3: Johannes 3:22 HIERNA het Jesus en sy dissipels na die land van Judéa gegaan, en Hy het daar met hulle vertoef en gedoop.

column2: John 3:23 And John also was baptizing in Aenon near to Salim, because there was much water there: and they came, and were baptized.
column3: Johannes 3:23 En Johannes was ook besig om te doop in Enon naby Salim, omdat daar baie water was. En die mense het daar gekom en is gedoop.

column2: John 3:24 For John was not yet cast into prison.
column3: Johannes 3:24 Want Johannes was nog nie in die gevangenis gewerp nie.

column2: John 3:25 Then there arose a question between [some] of John's disciples and the Jews about purifying.
column3: Johannes 3:25 Daar het toe van die kant van die dissipels van Johannes ’n redenasie met die Jode ontstaan oor die reiniging.

column2: John 3:26 And they came unto John, and said unto him, Rabbi, he that was with thee beyond Jordan, to whom thou barest witness, behold, the same baptizeth, and all [men] come to him.
column3: Johannes 3:26 En hulle het na Johannes gekom en vir hom gesê: Rabbi, Hy wat saam met u oorkant die Jordaan was, van wie u getuig het, kyk, Hy doop, en almal gaan na Hom toe.

column2: John 3:27 John answered and said, A man can receive nothing, except it be given him from heaven.
column3: Johannes 3:27 Johannes antwoord en sê: ’n Mens kan niks aanneem as dit hom nie uit die hemel gegee is nie.

column2: John 3:28 Ye yourselves bear me witness, that I said, I am not the Christ, but that I am sent before him.
column3: Johannes 3:28 Julle is self my getuies dat ek gesê het: Ek is nie die Christus nie; maar dat ek voor Hom uitgestuur is.

column2: John 3:29 He that hath the bride is the bridegroom: but the friend of the bridegroom, which standeth and heareth him, rejoiceth greatly because of the bridegroom's voice: this my joy therefore is fulfilled.
column3: Johannes 3:29 Hy wat die bruid het, is die bruidegom; maar die vriend van die bruidegom wat na hom staan en luister, verbly hom baie oor die stem van die bruidegom. So is dan hierdie blydskap van my volkome.

column2: John 3:30 He must increase, but I [must] decrease.
column3: Johannes 3:30 Hy moet meer word, maar ek minder.

column2: John 3:31 He that cometh from above is above all: he that is of the earth is earthly, and speaketh of the earth: he that cometh from heaven is above all.
column3: Johannes 3:31 Hy wat van bo kom, is bo almal; hy wat uit die aarde is, is uit die aarde en praat uit die aarde. Hy wat uit die hemel kom, is bo almal.

column2: John 3:32 And what he hath seen and heard, that he testifieth; and no man receiveth his testimony.
column3: Johannes 3:32 En wat Hy gesien en gehoor het, dit getuig Hy; en niemand neem sy getuienis aan nie.

column2: John 3:33 He that hath received his testimony hath set to his seal that God is true.
column3: Johannes 3:33 Wie sy getuienis aangeneem het, het sy seël daarop gesit dat God waaragtig is.

column2: John 3:34 For he whom God hath sent speaketh the words of God: for God giveth not the Spirit by measure [unto him].
column3: Johannes 3:34 Want Hy wat God gestuur het, spreek die woorde van God; want God gee Hom die Gees nie met mate nie.

column2: John 3:35 The Father loveth the Son, and hath given all things into his hand.
column3: Johannes 3:35 Die Vader het die Seun lief en het alles in sy hand gegee.

column2: John 3:36 He that believeth on the Son hath everlasting life: and he that believeth not the Son shall not see life; but the wrath of God abideth on him.
column3: Johannes 3:36 Hy wat in die Seun glo, het die ewige lewe; maar hy wat die Seun ongehoorsaam is, sal die lewe nie sien nie, maar die toorn van God bly op hom.

column2: John 4:1 When therefore the Lord knew how the Pharisees had heard that Jesus made and baptized more disciples than John,
column3: Johannes 4:1 TOE die Here dan verneem dat die Fariseërs gehoor het dat Jesus meer dissipels maak en doop as Johannes —

column2: John 4:2 (Though Jesus himself baptized not, but his disciples,)
column3: Johannes 4:2 alhoewel Jesus self nie gedoop het nie, maar sy dissipels —

column2: John 4:3 He left Judaea, and departed again into Galilee.
column3: Johannes 4:3 het Hy Judéa verlaat en weer na Galiléa gegaan.

column2: John 4:4 And he must needs go through Samaria.
column3: Johannes 4:4 En Hy moes deur Samaría gaan.

column2: John 4:5 Then cometh he to a city of Samaria, which is called Sychar, near to the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph.
column3: Johannes 4:5 Hy kom toe by ’n stad van Samaría wat Sígar genoem word, naby die stuk grond wat Jakob aan sy seun Josef gegee het.

column2: John 4:6 Now Jacob's well was there. Jesus therefore, being wearied with [his] journey, sat thus on the well: [and] it was about the sixth hour.
column3: Johannes 4:6 En die fontein van Jakob was daar Jesus het toe, omdat Hy moeg was van die reis, somaar by die fontein gaan sit. Dit was omtrent die sesde uur.

column2: John 4:7 There cometh a woman of Samaria to draw water: Jesus saith unto her, Give me to drink.
column3: Johannes 4:7 Daar kom ’n vrou uit Samaría om water te skep Jesus sê vir haar: Gee vir My water om te drink —

column2: John 4:8 (For his disciples were gone away unto the city to buy meat.)
column3: Johannes 4:8 want sy dissipels het na die stad gegaan om voedsel te koop.

column2: John 4:9 Then saith the woman of Samaria unto him, How is it that thou, being a Jew, askest drink of me, which am a woman of Samaria? for the Jews have no dealings with the Samaritans.
column3: Johannes 4:9 En die Samaritaanse vrou sê vir Hom: Hoe is dit dat U wat ’n Jood is, van my vra om te drink terwyl ek ’n Samaritaanse vrou is? Want die Jode hou geen gemeenskap met die Samaritane nie.

column2: John 4:10 Jesus answered and said unto her, If thou knewest the gift of God, and who it is that saith to thee, Give me to drink; thou wouldest have asked of him, and he would have given thee living water.
column3: Johannes 4:10 Jesus antwoord en sê vir haar: As jy die gawe van God geken het en geweet het wie Hy is wat vir jou sê: Gee vir My water om te drink, sou jy Hom gevra het en Hy sou vir jou lewende water gegee het.

column2: John 4:11 The woman saith unto him, Sir, thou hast nothing to draw with, and the well is deep: from whence then hast thou that living water?
column3: Johannes 4:11 Die vrou sê vir Hom: Here, U het nie eens ’n skepding nie, en die put is diep; waarvandaan kry U dan die lewende water?

column2: John 4:12 Art thou greater than our father Jacob, which gave us the well, and drank thereof himself, and his children, and his cattle?
column3: Johannes 4:12 U is tog nie groter as ons vader Jakob nie, wat die put aan ons gegee het en self daaruit gedrink het, en sy seuns en sy vee?

column2: John 4:13 Jesus answered and said unto her, Whosoever drinketh of this water shall thirst again:
column3: Johannes 4:13 Jesus antwoord en sê vir haar: Elkeen wat van hierdie water drink, sal weer dors kry;

column2: John 4:14 But whosoever drinketh of the water that I shall give him shall never thirst; but the water that I shall give him shall be in him a well of water springing up into everlasting life.
column3: Johannes 4:14 maar elkeen wat drink van die water wat Ek hom sal gee, sal in ewigheid nooit dors kry nie, maar die water wat Ek hom sal gee, sal in hom word ’n fontein van water wat opspring tot in die ewige lewe.

column2: John 4:15 The woman saith unto him, Sir, give me this water, that I thirst not, neither come hither to draw.
column3: Johannes 4:15 Die vrou sê vir Hom: Here, gee my daardie water, sodat ek nie dors kry en hier hoef te kom skep nie.

column2: John 4:16 Jesus saith unto her, Go, call thy husband, and come hither.
column3: Johannes 4:16 Jesus sê vir haar: Gaan roep jou man en kom hier.

column2: John 4:17 The woman answered and said, I have no husband. Jesus said unto her, Thou hast well said, I have no husband:
column3: Johannes 4:17 Die vrou antwoord en sê: Ek het nie ’n man nie. Jesus sê vir haar: Jy het reg gesê: Ek het nie ’n man nie;

column2: John 4:18 For thou hast had five husbands; and he whom thou now hast is not thy husband: in that saidst thou truly.
column3: Johannes 4:18 want jy het vyf mans gehad; en die een wat jy nou het, is nie jou man nie. Dit het jy met waarheid gesê.

column2: John 4:19 The woman saith unto him, Sir, I perceive that thou art a prophet.
column3: Johannes 4:19 Die vrou sê vir Hom: Here, ek sien dat U ’n profeet is.

column2: John 4:20 Our fathers worshipped in this mountain; and ye say, that in Jerusalem is the place where men ought to worship.
column3: Johannes 4:20 Ons vaders het op hierdie berg aanbid, en julle sê dat die plek waar ons behoort te aanbid, in Jerusalem is.

column2: John 4:21 Jesus saith unto her, Woman, believe me, the hour cometh, when ye shall neither in this mountain, nor yet at Jerusalem, worship the Father.
column3: Johannes 4:21 Jesus sê vir haar: Vrou, glo My, daar kom ’n uur wanneer julle nie op hierdie berg en ook nie in Jerusalem die Vader sal aanbid nie.

column2: John 4:22 Ye worship ye know not what: we know what we worship: for salvation is of the Jews.
column3: Johannes 4:22 Julle aanbid wat julle nie weet nie; ons aanbid wat ons weet, want die saligheid is uit die Jode.

column2: John 4:23 But the hour cometh, and now is, when the true worshippers shall worship the Father in spirit and in truth: for the Father seeketh such to worship him.
column3: Johannes 4:23 Maar daar kom ’n uur, en dit is nou, wanneer die ware aanbidders die Vader in gees en waarheid sal aanbid; want die Vader soek ook mense wat Hom só aanbid.

column2: John 4:24 God [is] a Spirit: and they that worship him must worship [him] in spirit and in truth.
column3: Johannes 4:24 God is Gees; en die wat Hom aanbid, moet in gees en waarheid aanbid.

column2: John 4:25 The woman saith unto him, I know that Messias cometh, which is called Christ: when he is come, he will tell us all things.
column3: Johannes 4:25 Die vrou sê vir Hom: Ek weet dat die Messías kom, Hy wat Christus genoem word. Wanneer Hy kom, sal Hy ons alles verkondig.

column2: John 4:26 Jesus saith unto her, I that speak unto thee am [he].
column3: Johannes 4:26 Jesus sê vir haar: Dit is Ek wat met jou spreek!

column2: John 4:27 And upon this came his disciples, and marvelled that he talked with the woman: yet no man said, What seekest thou? or, Why talkest thou with her?
column3: Johannes 4:27 En op dié oomblik het sy dissipels gekom en hulle verwonder dat Hy met ’n vrou in gesprek was. Tog het niemand gesê: Wat verlang U nie? of: Waarom spreek U met haar?

column2: John 4:28 The woman then left her waterpot, and went her way into the city, and saith to the men,
column3: Johannes 4:28 Die vrou het toe haar waterkan laat staan en na die stad gegaan en vir die mense gesê:

column2: John 4:29 Come, see a man, which told me all things that ever I did: is not this the Christ?
column3: Johannes 4:29 Kom kyk ’n man wat my alles vertel het wat ek gedoen het. Is Hy nie miskien die Christus nie?

column2: John 4:30 Then they went out of the city, and came unto him.
column3: Johannes 4:30 Hulle het toe uit die stad gegaan en na Hom gekom.

column2: John 4:31 In the mean while his disciples prayed him, saying, Master, eat.
column3: Johannes 4:31 EN intussen het sy dissipels by Hom aangedring en gesê: Rabbi, eet.

column2: John 4:32 But he said unto them, I have meat to eat that ye know not of.
column3: Johannes 4:32 Maar Hy sê vir hulle: Ek het voedsel om te eet waar julle nie van weet nie.

column2: John 4:33 Therefore said the disciples one to another, Hath any man brought him [ought] to eat?
column3: Johannes 4:33 Die dissipels sê toe vir mekaar: Het iemand dan vir Hom ete gebring?

column2: John 4:34 Jesus saith unto them, My meat is to do the will of him that sent me, and to finish his work.
column3: Johannes 4:34 Jesus sê vir hulle: My voedsel is om die wil te doen van Hom wat My gestuur het en om sy werk te volbring.

column2: John 4:35 Say not ye, There are yet four months, and [then] cometh harvest? behold, I say unto you, Lift up your eyes, and look on the fields; for they are white already to harvest.
column3: Johannes 4:35 Sê julle nie: Dit is nog vier maande, dan kom die oes nie? Kyk, Ek sê vir julle, slaan julle oë op en aanskou die lande dat hulle al wit is vir die oes.

column2: John 4:36 And he that reapeth receiveth wages, and gathereth fruit unto life eternal: that both he that soweth and he that reapeth may rejoice together.
column3: Johannes 4:36 En hy wat maai, ontvang loon en vergader vrug vir die ewige lewe, sodat die saaier en die maaier saam bly kan wees.

column2: John 4:37 And herein is that saying true, One soweth, and another reapeth.
column3: Johannes 4:37 Want hierin is die woord waar: Dit is een wat saai, en ’n ander wat maai.

column2: John 4:38 I sent you to reap that whereon ye bestowed no labour: other men laboured, and ye are entered into their labours.
column3: Johannes 4:38 Ek het julle gestuur om te maai waar julle nie aan gewerk het nie. Ander het gewerk, en julle het in hulle arbeid ingegaan.

column2: John 4:39 And many of the Samaritans of that city believed on him for the saying of the woman, which testified, He told me all that ever I did.
column3: Johannes 4:39 En baie van die Samaritane uit daardie stad het in Hom geglo oor die woord van die vrou wat getuig het: Hy het my alles vertel wat ek gedoen het.

column2: John 4:40 So when the Samaritans were come unto him, they besought him that he would tarry with them: and he abode there two days.
column3: Johannes 4:40 Toe die Samaritane dan by Hom kom, het hulle by Hom aangedring om by hulle te bly; en Hy het daar twee dae gebly.

column2: John 4:41 And many more believed because of his own word;
column3: Johannes 4:41 En baie meer het op grond van sy woord geglo

column2: John 4:42 And said unto the woman, Now we believe, not because of thy saying: for we have heard [him] ourselves, and know that this is indeed the Christ, the Saviour of the world.
column3: Johannes 4:42 en aan die vrou gesê: Ons glo nie meer op grond van wat jy gesê het nie, want ons het self gehoor en ons weet dat Hy waarlik die Christus, die Saligmaker van die wêreld, is.

column2: John 4:43 Now after two days he departed thence, and went into Galilee.
column3: Johannes 4:43 EN ná die twee dae het Hy daarvandaan weggegaan en na Galiléa vertrek.

column2: John 4:44 For Jesus himself testified, that a prophet hath no honour in his own country.
column3: Johannes 4:44 Want Jesus self het getuig dat ’n profeet in sy eie vaderland geen eer ontvang nie.

column2: John 4:45 Then when he was come into Galilee, the Galilaeans received him, having seen all the things that he did at Jerusalem at the feast: for they also went unto the feast.
column3: Johannes 4:45 Toe Hy dan in Galiléa kom, het die Galiléërs Hom ontvang, omdat hulle alles gesien het wat Hy in Jerusalem op die fees gedoen het; want hulle het ook na die fees gegaan.

column2: John 4:46 So Jesus came again into Cana of Galilee, where he made the water wine. And there was a certain nobleman, whose son was sick at Capernaum.
column3: Johannes 4:46 Jesus het dan weer gekom te Kana in Galiléa, waar Hy die water wyn gemaak het. En daar was ’n sekere koninklike beampte wie se seun in Kapérnaüm siek was.

column2: John 4:47 When he heard that Jesus was come out of Judaea into Galilee, he went unto him, and besought him that he would come down, and heal his son: for he was at the point of death.
column3: Johannes 4:47 Toe hy hoor dat Jesus uit Judéa in Galiléa gekom het, gaan hy na Hom en vra Hom om af te kom en sy seun gesond te maak, want hy het op sterwe gelê.

column2: John 4:48 Then said Jesus unto him, Except ye see signs and wonders, ye will not believe.
column3: Johannes 4:48 Jesus sê toe vir hom: As julle nie tekens en wonders sien nie, sal julle nooit glo nie.

column2: John 4:49 The nobleman saith unto him, Sir, come down ere my child die.
column3: Johannes 4:49 Die koninklike beampte sê vir Hom: Here, kom af voordat my kind sterwe.

column2: John 4:50 Jesus saith unto him, Go thy way; thy son liveth. And the man believed the word that Jesus had spoken unto him, and he went his way.
column3: Johannes 4:50 Jesus antwoord hom: Gaan, jou seun lewe! En die man het die woord geglo wat Jesus vir hom gesê het, en hy het gegaan.

column2: John 4:51 And as he was now going down, his servants met him, and told [him], saying, Thy son liveth.
column3: Johannes 4:51 En toe hy al op pad was huis toe, kom sy diensknegte hom tegemoet en bring die berig en sê: U kind lewe!

column2: John 4:52 Then enquired he of them the hour when he began to amend. And they said unto him, Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.
column3: Johannes 4:52 Hy verneem toe van hulle die uur waarop hy beter geword het. En hulle sê vir hom: Gister, die sewende uur, het die koors hom verlaat.

column2: John 4:53 So the father knew that [it was] at the same hour, in the which Jesus said unto him, Thy son liveth: and himself believed, and his whole house.
column3: Johannes 4:53 Die vader merk toe dat dit daardie uur was waarop Jesus vir hom gesê het: Jou seun lewe! En hy het self geglo en sy hele huis.

column2: John 4:54 This [is] again the second miracle [that] Jesus did, when he was come out of Judaea into Galilee.
column3: Johannes 4:54 Hierdie tweede teken weer het Jesus gedoen toe Hy uit Judéa in Galiléa gekom het.

column2: John 5:1 After this there was a feast of the Jews; and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
column3: Johannes 5:1 HIERNA was daar ’n fees van die Jode, en Jesus het opgegaan na Jerusalem.

column2: John 5:2 Now there is at Jerusalem by the sheep [market] a pool, which is called in the Hebrew tongue Bethesda, having five porches.
column3: Johannes 5:2 En daar is in Jerusalem by die Skaapspoort ’n bad met vyf pilaargange wat in Hebreeus Betésda genoem word.

column2: John 5:3 In these lay a great multitude of impotent folk, of blind, halt, withered, waiting for the moving of the water.
column3: Johannes 5:3 Daarin het ’n groot menigte siekes gelê, blindes en kreupeles en lammes, wat op die roering van die water gewag het.

column2: John 5:4 For an angel went down at a certain season into the pool, and troubled the water: whosoever then first after the troubling of the water stepped in was made whole of whatsoever disease he had.
column3: Johannes 5:4 Want ’n engel het op bepaalde tye in die bad neergedaal en die water geroer. Die een wat dan die eerste ingaan ná die roering van die water, het gesond geword, aan watter siekte hy ook al gely het.

column2: John 5:5 And a certain man was there, which had an infirmity thirty and eight years.
column3: Johannes 5:5 En ’n sekere man was daar, wat agt-en-dertig jaar aan sy siekte gely het.

column2: John 5:6 When Jesus saw him lie, and knew that he had been now a long time [in that case], he saith unto him, Wilt thou be made whole?
column3: Johannes 5:6 Toe Jesus hom sien lê, terwyl Hy geweet het dat hy al ’n lang tyd siek was, sê Hy vir hom: Wil jy gesond word?

column2: John 5:7 The impotent man answered him, Sir, I have no man, when the water is troubled, to put me into the pool: but while I am coming, another steppeth down before me.
column3: Johannes 5:7 Die sieke antwoord Hom: Here, ek het niemand om my in die bad te sit as die water geroer word nie; en onderwyl ek kom, gaan ’n ander een voor my in.

column2: John 5:8 Jesus saith unto him, Rise, take up thy bed, and walk.
column3: Johannes 5:8 Jesus sê vir hom: Staan op, neem jou bed op en loop.

column2: John 5:9 And immediately the man was made whole, and took up his bed, and walked: and on the same day was the sabbath.
column3: Johannes 5:9 En dadelik het die man gesond geword en sy bed opgeneem en geloop. En daardie dag was dit sabbat.

column2: John 5:10 The Jews therefore said unto him that was cured, It is the sabbath day: it is not lawful for thee to carry [thy] bed.
column3: Johannes 5:10 Die Jode sê toe vir hom wat genees was: Dit is sabbat; dit is jou nie geoorloof om jou bed te dra nie.

column2: John 5:11 He answered them, He that made me whole, the same said unto me, Take up thy bed, and walk.
column3: Johannes 5:11 Hy antwoord hulle: Hy wat my gesond gemaak het, Hy het vir my gesê: Neem jou bed op en loop.

column2: John 5:12 Then asked they him, What man is that which said unto thee, Take up thy bed, and walk?
column3: Johannes 5:12 Toe vra hulle hom: Wie is die man wat vir jou gesê het: Neem jou bed op en loop?

column2: John 5:13 And he that was healed wist not who it was: for Jesus had conveyed himself away, a multitude being in [that] place.
column3: Johannes 5:13 Maar hy wat gesond geword het, het nie geweet wie dit was nie; want Jesus het Hom verwyder, omdat daar ’n skare op die plek was.

column2: John 5:14 Afterward Jesus findeth him in the temple, and said unto him, Behold, thou art made whole: sin no more, lest a worse thing come unto thee.
column3: Johannes 5:14 Daarna het Jesus hom in die tempel gekry en vir hom gesê: Kyk, jy het gesond geword; moenie meer sondig nie, sodat daar nie iets ergers met jou gebeur nie.

column2: John 5:15 The man departed, and told the Jews that it was Jesus, which had made him whole.
column3: Johannes 5:15 Die man het gegaan en aan die Jode vertel dat dit Jesus was wat hom gesond gemaak het.

column2: John 5:16 And therefore did the Jews persecute Jesus, and sought to slay him, because he had done these things on the sabbath day.
column3: Johannes 5:16 EN hieroor het die Jode Jesus vervolg en probeer om Hom dood te maak, omdat Hy dit op die sabbat gedoen het.

column2: John 5:17 But Jesus answered them, My Father worketh hitherto, and I work.
column3: Johannes 5:17 En Jesus het hulle geantwoord: My Vader werk tot nou toe, en Ek werk ook.

column2: John 5:18 Therefore the Jews sought the more to kill him, because he not only had broken the sabbath, but said also that God was his Father, making himself equal with God.
column3: Johannes 5:18 Hieroor het die Jode toe nog meer probeer om Hom dood te maak, omdat Hy nie alleen die sabbat gebreek het nie, maar ook God sy eie Vader genoem het en Hom met God gelykgestel het.

column2: John 5:19 Then answered Jesus and said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, The Son can do nothing of himself, but what he seeth the Father do: for what things soever he doeth, these also doeth the Son likewise.
column3: Johannes 5:19 Jesus het toe geantwoord en vir hulle gesê: Voorwaar, voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, die Seun kan niks uit Homself doen tensy Hy die Vader dit sien doen nie. Want alles wat Hý doen, dit doen die Seun ook net so.

column2: John 5:20 For the Father loveth the Son, and sheweth him all things that himself doeth: and he will shew him greater works than these, that ye may marvel.
column3: Johannes 5:20 Want die Vader het die Seun lief en toon Hom alles wat Hy self doen. En groter werke as hierdie sal Hy Hom toon, sodat julle verwonderd kan wees.

column2: John 5:21 For as the Father raiseth up the dead, and quickeneth [them]; even so the Son quickeneth whom he will.
column3: Johannes 5:21 Want soos die Vader die dode opwek en lewend maak, so maak ook die Seun lewend wie Hy wil.

column2: John 5:22 For the Father judgeth no man, but hath committed all judgment unto the Son:
column3: Johannes 5:22 Want die Vader oordeel ook niemand nie, maar het die hele oordeel aan die Seun gegee,

column2: John 5:23 That all [men] should honour the Son, even as they honour the Father. He that honoureth not the Son honoureth not the Father which hath sent him.
column3: Johannes 5:23 sodat almal die Seun kan eer net soos hulle die Vader eer. Wie die Seun nie eer nie, eer nie die Vader wat Hom gestuur het nie.

column2: John 5:24 Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that heareth my word, and believeth on him that sent me, hath everlasting life, and shall not come into condemnation; but is passed from death unto life.
column3: Johannes 5:24 Voorwaar, voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, wie my woord hoor en Hom glo wat My gestuur het, het die ewige lewe en kom nie in die oordeel nie, maar het oorgegaan uit die dood in die lewe.

column2: John 5:25 Verily, verily, I say unto you, The hour is coming, and now is, when the dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God: and they that hear shall live.
column3: Johannes 5:25 Voorwaar, voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, daar kom ’n uur, en dit is nou, wanneer die dode die stem van die Seun van God sal hoor; en die wat dit gehoor het, sal lewe.

column2: John 5:26 For as the Father hath life in himself; so hath he given to the Son to have life in himself;
column3: Johannes 5:26 Want soos die Vader lewe het in Homself, so het Hy aan die Seun ook gegee om lewe in Homself te hê.

column2: John 5:27 And hath given him authority to execute judgment also, because he is the Son of man.
column3: Johannes 5:27 En Hy het Hom mag gegee om ook te oordeel, omdat Hy die Seun van die mens is.

column2: John 5:28 Marvel not at this: for the hour is coming, in the which all that are in the graves shall hear his voice,
column3: Johannes 5:28 Moenie julle hieroor verwonder nie. Want daar kom ’n uur wanneer almal wat in die grafte is, sy stem sal hoor

column2: John 5:29 And shall come forth; they that have done good, unto the resurrection of life; and they that have done evil, unto the resurrection of damnation.
column3: Johannes 5:29 en sal uitgaan, die wat goed gedoen het, tot die opstanding van die lewe, en die wat kwaad gedoen het, tot die opstanding van die veroordeling.

column2: John 5:30 I can of mine own self do nothing: as I hear, I judge: and my judgment is just; because I seek not mine own will, but the will of the Father which hath sent me.
column3: Johannes 5:30 Ek kan uit Myself niks doen nie. Soos Ek hoor, oordeel Ek; en my oordeel is regverdig, omdat Ek nie my wil soek nie, maar die wil van die Vader wat My gestuur het.

column2: John 5:31 If I bear witness of myself, my witness is not true.
column3: Johannes 5:31 As Ek van Myself getuig, is my getuienis nie waar nie.

column2: John 5:32 There is another that beareth witness of me; and I know that the witness which he witnesseth of me is true.
column3: Johannes 5:32 Daar is ’n ander Een wat van My getuig, en Ek weet dat die getuienis wat Hy van My getuig, waar is.

column2: John 5:33 Ye sent unto John, and he bare witness unto the truth.
column3: Johannes 5:33 Julle het na Johannes gestuur, en hy het vir die waarheid getuig.

column2: John 5:34 But I receive not testimony from man: but these things I say, that ye might be saved.
column3: Johannes 5:34 Maar Ek neem die getuienis van ’n mens nie aan nie; maar Ek sê dit, dat julle gered kan word.

column2: John 5:35 He was a burning and a shining light: and ye were willing for a season to rejoice in his light.
column3: Johannes 5:35 Hy was die lamp wat brand en skyn, en julle was gewillig om julle vir ’n tyd in sy lig te verbly.

column2: John 5:36 But I have greater witness than [that] of John: for the works which the Father hath given me to finish, the same works that I do, bear witness of me, that the Father hath sent me.
column3: Johannes 5:36 Maar Ek het ’n groter getuienis as dié van Johannes, want die werke wat die Vader My gegee het om te volbring, die werke self wat Ek doen, getuig van My dat die Vader My gestuur het.

column2: John 5:37 And the Father himself, which hath sent me, hath borne witness of me. Ye have neither heard his voice at any time, nor seen his shape.
column3: Johannes 5:37 En die Vader wat My gestuur het, Hy het van My getuig. Julle het nog nooit sy stem gehoor of sy gedaante gesien nie.

column2: John 5:38 And ye have not his word abiding in you: for whom he hath sent, him ye believe not.
column3: Johannes 5:38 En julle het sy woord nie as iets blywends in julle nie, omdat julle Hom wat Hy gestuur het, nie glo nie.

column2: John 5:39 Search the scriptures; for in them ye think ye have eternal life: and they are they which testify of me.
column3: Johannes 5:39 Julle ondersoek die Skrifte, omdat julle meen dat julle daarin die ewige lewe het; en dit is dié wat van My getuig.

column2: John 5:40 And ye will not come to me, that ye might have life.
column3: Johannes 5:40 En julle wil nie na My kom om die lewe te hê nie.

column2: John 5:41 I receive not honour from men.
column3: Johannes 5:41 Eer neem Ek van die mense nie aan nie.

column2: John 5:42 But I know you, that ye have not the love of God in you.
column3: Johannes 5:42 Maar Ek ken julle, dat julle die liefde van God in julle nie het nie.

column2: John 5:43 I am come in my Father's name, and ye receive me not: if another shall come in his own name, him ye will receive.
column3: Johannes 5:43 Ek het gekom in die Naam van my Vader, en julle neem My nie aan nie. As ’n ander een in sy eie naam kom, hóm sal julle aanneem.

column2: John 5:44 How can ye believe, which receive honour one of another, and seek not the honour that [cometh] from God only?
column3: Johannes 5:44 Hoe kan julle glo wat van mekaar eer aanneem, en die eer wat van die enige God kom, soek julle nie?

column2: John 5:45 Do not think that I will accuse you to the Father: there is [one] that accuseth you, [even] Moses, in whom ye trust.
column3: Johannes 5:45 Moenie dink dat Ek julle by die Vader sal beskuldig nie. Daar is een wat julle beskuldig — Moses op wie julle gehoop het.

column2: John 5:46 For had ye believed Moses, ye would have believed me: for he wrote of me.
column3: Johannes 5:46 Maar as julle Moses geglo het, sou julle My glo, want hy het van My geskrywe.

column2: John 5:47 But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?
column3: Johannes 5:47 En as julle sy geskrifte nie glo nie, hoe sal julle my woorde glo?

column2: John 6:1 After these things Jesus went over the sea of Galilee, which is [the sea] of Tiberias.
column3: Johannes 6:1 DAARNA het Jesus na die oorkant van die see van Galiléa, dit is, van Tibérias, gegaan;

column2: John 6:2 And a great multitude followed him, because they saw his miracles which he did on them that were diseased.
column3: Johannes 6:2 en ’n groot menigte het Hom gevolg, omdat hulle sy tekens gesien het wat Hy aan die siekes doen.

column2: John 6:3 And Jesus went up into a mountain, and there he sat with his disciples.
column3: Johannes 6:3 En Jesus het op die berg geklim en daar met sy dissipels gaan sit.

column2: John 6:4 And the passover, a feast of the Jews, was nigh.
column3: Johannes 6:4 En die pasga, die fees van die Jode, was naby.

column2: John 6:5 When Jesus then lifted up [his] eyes, and saw a great company come unto him, he saith unto Philip, Whence shall we buy bread, that these may eat?
column3: Johannes 6:5 Toe Jesus dan sy oë opslaan en sien dat ’n groot menigte na Hom kom, sê Hy vir Filippus: Waarvandaan sal ons brood koop, sodat hierdie mense kan eet?

column2: John 6:6 And this he said to prove him: for he himself knew what he would do.
column3: Johannes 6:6 Maar Hy het dit gesê om hom op die proef te stel, want Hy het self geweet wat Hy wou doen.

column2: John 6:7 Philip answered him, Two hundred pennyworth of bread is not sufficient for them, that every one of them may take a little.
column3: Johannes 6:7 Filippus antwoord Hom: Brood vir tweehonderd pennings sal nie genoeg wees vir hulle, sodat elkeen van hulle ’n stukkie kan kry nie.

column2: John 6:8 One of his disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter's brother, saith unto him,
column3: Johannes 6:8 Een van sy dissipels, Andréas, Simon Petrus se broer, sê vir Hom:

column2: John 6:9 There is a lad here, which hath five barley loaves, and two small fishes: but what are they among so many?
column3: Johannes 6:9 Hier is ’n seuntjie wat vyf garsbrode en twee vissies het, maar wat is dit vir so baie mense?

column2: John 6:10 And Jesus said, Make the men sit down. Now there was much grass in the place. So the men sat down, in number about five thousand.
column3: Johannes 6:10 En Jesus sê: Laat die mense gaan sit. En daar was baie gras op dié plek. Die manne het toe gaan sit, omtrent vyfduisend in getal.

column2: John 6:11 And Jesus took the loaves; and when he had given thanks, he distributed to the disciples, and the disciples to them that were set down; and likewise of the fishes as much as they would.
column3: Johannes 6:11 En Jesus het die brode geneem, en nadat Hy gedank het, deel Hy dit uit aan die dissipels en die dissipels aan die wat daar sit; so ook van die vissies, soveel as hulle wou hê.

column2: John 6:12 When they were filled, he said unto his disciples, Gather up the fragments that remain, that nothing be lost.
column3: Johannes 6:12 En nadat hulle versadig was, sê Hy vir sy dissipels: Maak die brokstukke bymekaar wat oorgeskiet het, sodat niks verlore gaan nie.

column2: John 6:13 Therefore they gathered [them] together, and filled twelve baskets with the fragments of the five barley loaves, which remained over and above unto them that had eaten.
column3: Johannes 6:13 Hulle maak toe bymekaar en het twaalf mandjies gevul met brokstukke van die vyf garsbrode wat oorgeskiet het by die wat geëet het.

column2: John 6:14 Then those men, when they had seen the miracle that Jesus did, said, This is of a truth that prophet that should come into the world.
column3: Johannes 6:14 Toe die mense dan die teken sien wat Jesus gedoen het, sê hulle: Hy is waarlik die profeet wat in die wêreld sou kom.

column2: John 6:15 When Jesus therefore perceived that they would come and take him by force, to make him a king, he departed again into a mountain himself alone.
column3: Johannes 6:15 En toe Jesus merk dat hulle wou kom en Hom met geweld neem om Hom koning te maak, het Hy weer weggegaan na die berg, Hy alleen.

column2: John 6:16 And when even was [now] come, his disciples went down unto the sea,
column3: Johannes 6:16 EN toe dit aand geword het, het sy dissipels afgegaan na die see toe.

column2: John 6:17 And entered into a ship, and went over the sea toward Capernaum. And it was now dark, and Jesus was not come to them.
column3: Johannes 6:17 En nadat hulle in die skuit geklim het, het hulle oor die see gevaar na Kapérnaüm; en dit was al donker, en Jesus het nog nie by hulle gekom nie.

column2: John 6:18 And the sea arose by reason of a great wind that blew.
column3: Johannes 6:18 En die see was onstuimig, omdat ’n sterk wind gewaai het.

column2: John 6:19 So when they had rowed about five and twenty or thirty furlongs, they see Jesus walking on the sea, and drawing nigh unto the ship: and they were afraid.
column3: Johannes 6:19 En toe hulle omtrent drie of vier myl geroei het, sien hulle Jesus op die see loop en naby die skuit kom; en hulle het bang geword.

column2: John 6:20 But he saith unto them, It is I; be not afraid.
column3: Johannes 6:20 Maar Hy sê vir hulle: Dit is Ek, moenie vrees nie.

column2: John 6:21 Then they willingly received him into the ship: and immediately the ship was at the land whither they went.
column3: Johannes 6:21 Toe was hulle gewillig om Hom in die skuit te neem, en dadelik het die skuit by die land aangekom waar hulle na toe gegaan het.

column2: John 6:22 The day following, when the people which stood on the other side of the sea saw that there was none other boat there, save that one whereinto his disciples were entered, and that Jesus went not with his disciples into the boat, but [that] his disciples were gone away alone;
column3: Johannes 6:22 DIE volgende dag sien die skare wat oorkant die see gestaan het, dat daar geen ander skuit was nie, behalwe daardie een waarin sy dissipels gegaan het; en dat Jesus nie saam met sy dissipels in die skuit gegaan het nie, maar dat sy dissipels alleen weggevaar het.

column2: John 6:23 (Howbeit there came other boats from Tiberias nigh unto the place where they did eat bread, after that the Lord had given thanks:)
column3: Johannes 6:23 Maar ander skuite het van Tibérias aangekom naby die plek waar hulle die brood geëet het, nadat die Here gedank het.

column2: John 6:24 When the people therefore saw that Jesus was not there, neither his disciples, they also took shipping, and came to Capernaum, seeking for Jesus.
column3: Johannes 6:24 Toe die skare dan sien dat Jesus nie daar was nie en sy dissipels ook nie, het hulle self ook in die skuite geklim en na Kapérnaüm gegaan om Jesus te soek.

column2: John 6:25 And when they had found him on the other side of the sea, they said unto him, Rabbi, when camest thou hither?
column3: Johannes 6:25 En toe hulle Hom oorkant die see gevind het, sê hulle vir Hom: Rabbi, wanneer het U hier gekom?

column2: John 6:26 Jesus answered them and said, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Ye seek me, not because ye saw the miracles, but because ye did eat of the loaves, and were filled.
column3: Johannes 6:26 Jesus antwoord hulle en sê: Voorwaar, voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, julle soek My nie omdat julle tekens gesien het nie, maar omdat julle van die brode geëet en versadig geword het.

column2: John 6:27 Labour not for the meat which perisheth, but for that meat which endureth unto everlasting life, which the Son of man shall give unto you: for him hath God the Father sealed.
column3: Johannes 6:27 Moenie werk om die spys wat vergaan nie, maar om die spys wat bly tot in die ewige lewe, wat die Seun van die mens julle sal gee; want Hom het God, die Vader, verseël.

column2: John 6:28 Then said they unto him, What shall we do, that we might work the works of God?
column3: Johannes 6:28 Toe vra hulle Hom: Wat moet ons doen om die werke van God te volbring?

column2: John 6:29 Jesus answered and said unto them, This is the work of God, that ye believe on him whom he hath sent.
column3: Johannes 6:29 Jesus antwoord en sê vir hulle: Dít is die werk van God, dat julle in Hom glo wat Hy gestuur het.

column2: John 6:30 They said therefore unto him, What sign shewest thou then, that we may see, and believe thee? what dost thou work?
column3: Johannes 6:30 En hulle sê vir Hom: Watter teken doen U dan, sodat ons kan sien en U glo? Wat werk U?

column2: John 6:31 Our fathers did eat manna in the desert; as it is written, He gave them bread from heaven to eat.
column3: Johannes 6:31 Ons vaders het die manna in die woestyn geëet, soos geskrywe is: Hy het brood uit die hemel aan hulle gegee om te eet.

column2: John 6:32 Then Jesus said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Moses gave you not that bread from heaven; but my Father giveth you the true bread from heaven.
column3: Johannes 6:32 En Jesus sê vir hulle: Voorwaar, voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, dit is nie Moses wat die brood uit die hemel aan julle gegee het nie, maar my Vader gee julle die ware brood uit die hemel.

column2: John 6:33 For the bread of God is he which cometh down from heaven, and giveth life unto the world.
column3: Johannes 6:33 Want die brood van God is Hy wat uit die hemel neerdaal en aan die wêreld die lewe gee.

column2: John 6:34 Then said they unto him, Lord, evermore give us this bread.
column3: Johannes 6:34 Toe sê hulle vir Hom: Here, gee ons altyd hierdie brood.

column2: John 6:35 And Jesus said unto them, I am the bread of life: he that cometh to me shall never hunger; and he that believeth on me shall never thirst.
column3: Johannes 6:35 En Jesus sê vir hulle: Ek is die brood van die lewe; wie na My toe kom, sal nooit honger kry nie; en wie in My glo, sal nooit dors kry nie.

column2: John 6:36 But I said unto you, That ye also have seen me, and believe not.
column3: Johannes 6:36 Maar Ek het vir julle gesê dat julle My gesien het, en tog glo julle nie.

column2: John 6:37 All that the Father giveth me shall come to me; and him that cometh to me I will in no wise cast out.
column3: Johannes 6:37 Al wat die Vader My gee, sal na My toe kom; en Ek sal hom wat na My toe kom, nooit uitwerp nie.

column2: John 6:38 For I came down from heaven, not to do mine own will, but the will of him that sent me.
column3: Johannes 6:38 Want Ek het uit die hemel neergedaal, nie om my wil te doen nie, maar die wil van Hom wat My gestuur het.

column2: John 6:39 And this is the Father's will which hath sent me, that of all which he hath given me I should lose nothing, but should raise it up again at the last day.
column3: Johannes 6:39 En dit is die wil van die Vader wat My gestuur het, dat al wat Hy My gegee het, Ek daarvan nie sal verloor nie, maar dit opwek in die laaste dag.

column2: John 6:40 And this is the will of him that sent me, that every one which seeth the Son, and believeth on him, may have everlasting life: and I will raise him up at the last day.
column3: Johannes 6:40 En dit is die wil van Hom wat My gestuur het, dat elkeen wat die Seun aanskou en in Hom glo, die ewige lewe mag hê; en Ek sal hom opwek in die laaste dag.

column2: John 6:41 The Jews then murmured at him, because he said, I am the bread which came down from heaven.
column3: Johannes 6:41 Toe murmureer die Jode oor Hom, omdat Hy gesê het: Ek is die brood wat uit die hemel neergedaal het.

column2: John 6:42 And they said, Is not this Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? how is it then that he saith, I came down from heaven?
column3: Johannes 6:42 En hulle sê: Is Hy nie Jesus, die seun van Josef, wie se vader en moeder ons ken nie? Hoe sê Hy dan: Ek het uit die hemel neergedaal?

column2: John 6:43 Jesus therefore answered and said unto them, Murmur not among yourselves.
column3: Johannes 6:43 En Jesus antwoord en sê vir hulle: Moenie onder mekaar murmureer nie.

column2: John 6:44 No man can come to me, except the Father which hath sent me draw him: and I will raise him up at the last day.
column3: Johannes 6:44 Niemand kan na My toe kom as die Vader wat My gestuur het, hom nie trek nie; en Ek sal hom opwek in die laaste dag.

column2: John 6:45 It is written in the prophets, And they shall be all taught of God. Every man therefore that hath heard, and hath learned of the Father, cometh unto me.
column3: Johannes 6:45 Dit is geskrywe in die profete: En hulle sal almal deur God geleer wees. Elkeen dan wat dit van die Vader gehoor en geleer het, kom na My toe.

column2: John 6:46 Not that any man hath seen the Father, save he which is of God, he hath seen the Father.
column3: Johannes 6:46 Nie dat iemand die Vader gesien het nie, behalwe Hy wat van God kom: Hy het die Vader gesien.

column2: John 6:47 Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that believeth on me hath everlasting life.
column3: Johannes 6:47 Voorwaar, voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, wie in My glo, het die ewige lewe.

column2: John 6:48 I am that bread of life.
column3: Johannes 6:48 Ek is die brood van die lewe.

column2: John 6:49 Your fathers did eat manna in the wilderness, and are dead.
column3: Johannes 6:49 Julle vaders het die manna in die woestyn geëet en het gesterwe.

column2: John 6:50 This is the bread which cometh down from heaven, that a man may eat thereof, and not die.
column3: Johannes 6:50 Dít is die brood wat uit die hemel neerdaal, sodat iemand daarvan kan eet en nie sterwe nie.

column2: John 6:51 I am the living bread which came down from heaven: if any man eat of this bread, he shall live for ever: and the bread that I will give is my flesh, which I will give for the life of the world.
column3: Johannes 6:51 Ek is die lewende brood wat uit die hemel neergedaal het. As iemand van hierdie brood eet, sal hy lewe tot in ewigheid. En die brood wat Ek sal gee, is my vlees wat Ek vir die lewe van die wêreld sal gee.

column2: John 6:52 The Jews therefore strove among themselves, saying, How can this man give us [his] flesh to eat?
column3: Johannes 6:52 Die Jode het toe met mekaar gestry en gesê: Hoe kan Hy ons sy vlees gee om te eet?

column2: John 6:53 Then Jesus said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Except ye eat the flesh of the Son of man, and drink his blood, ye have no life in you.
column3: Johannes 6:53 En Jesus sê vir hulle: Voorwaar, voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, as julle nie die vlees van die Seun van die mens eet en sy bloed drink nie, het julle geen lewe in julleself nie.

column2: John 6:54 Whoso eateth my flesh, and drinketh my blood, hath eternal life; and I will raise him up at the last day.
column3: Johannes 6:54 Hy wat my vlees eet en my bloed drink, het die ewige lewe, en Ek sal hom opwek in die laaste dag.

column2: John 6:55 For my flesh is meat indeed, and my blood is drink indeed.
column3: Johannes 6:55 Want my vlees is waarlik spys, en my bloed is waarlik drank.

column2: John 6:56 He that eateth my flesh, and drinketh my blood, dwelleth in me, and I in him.
column3: Johannes 6:56 Wie my vlees eet en my bloed drink, bly in My en Ek in hom.

column2: John 6:57 As the living Father hath sent me, and I live by the Father: so he that eateth me, even he shall live by me.
column3: Johannes 6:57 Soos die lewende Vader My gestuur het, en Ek deur die Vader lewe, so sal hy wat My eet, ook deur My lewe.

column2: John 6:58 This is that bread which came down from heaven: not as your fathers did eat manna, and are dead: he that eateth of this bread shall live for ever.
column3: Johannes 6:58 Dít is die brood wat uit die hemel neergedaal het — nie soos julle vaders die manna geëet en gesterwe het nie; wie hierdie brood eet, sal tot in ewigheid lewe.

column2: John 6:59 These things said he in the synagogue, as he taught in Capernaum.
column3: Johannes 6:59 Hierdie dinge het Hy gesê in die sinagoge toe Hy in Kapérnaüm onderrig gegee het.

column2: John 6:60 Many therefore of his disciples, when they had heard [this], said, This is an hard saying; who can hear it?
column3: Johannes 6:60 EN baie van sy dissipels het gesê toe hulle dit hoor: Hierdie woord is hard, wie kan daarna luister?

column2: John 6:61 When Jesus knew in himself that his disciples murmured at it, he said unto them, Doth this offend you?
column3: Johannes 6:61 En Jesus het in Homself geweet dat sy dissipels hieroor murmureer, en Hy sê vir hulle: Is dit julle tot ’n aanstoot?

column2: John 6:62 [What] and if ye shall see the Son of man ascend up where he was before?
column3: Johannes 6:62 Hoe dan as julle die Seun van die mens daarheen sien opvaar waar Hy tevore was?

column2: John 6:63 It is the spirit that quickeneth; the flesh profiteth nothing: the words that I speak unto you, [they] are spirit, and [they] are life.
column3: Johannes 6:63 Dit is die Gees wat lewend maak, die vlees is van geen nut nie; die woorde wat Ek tot julle spreek, is gees en is lewe.

column2: John 6:64 But there are some of you that believe not. For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were that believed not, and who should betray him.
column3: Johannes 6:64 Maar daar is sommige van julle wat nie glo nie. Want Jesus het van die begin af geweet wie hulle was wat nie glo nie, en wie hy was wat Hom sou verraai.

column2: John 6:65 And he said, Therefore said I unto you, that no man can come unto me, except it were given unto him of my Father.
