column3: Johannes 6:65 En Hy sê: Om hierdie rede het Ek vir julle gesê dat niemand na My toe kan kom as dit hom nie deur my Vader gegee is nie.

column2: John 6:66 From that [time] many of his disciples went back, and walked no more with him.
column3: Johannes 6:66 Hieroor het baie van sy dissipels teruggegaan en nie meer saam met Hom gewandel nie.

column2: John 6:67 Then said Jesus unto the twelve, Will ye also go away?
column3: Johannes 6:67 Toe sê Jesus vir die twaalf: Wil julle nie ook weggaan nie?

column2: John 6:68 Then Simon Peter answered him, Lord, to whom shall we go? thou hast the words of eternal life.
column3: Johannes 6:68 En Simon Petrus antwoord Hom: Here, na wie toe sal ons gaan? U het die woorde van die ewige lewe.

column2: John 6:69 And we believe and are sure that thou art that Christ, the Son of the living God.
column3: Johannes 6:69 En ons het geglo en erken dat U die Christus is, die Seun van die lewende God.

column2: John 6:70 Jesus answered them, Have not I chosen you twelve, and one of you is a devil?
column3: Johannes 6:70 Jesus antwoord hulle: Het Ek nie julle twaalf uitverkies nie? En een van julle is ’n duiwel!

column2: John 6:71 He spake of Judas Iscariot [the son] of Simon: for he it was that should betray him, being one of the twelve.
column3: Johannes 6:71 En Hy het bedoel Judas Iskáriot, die seun van Simon; want hy sou Hom verraai, hy wat een van die twaalf was.

column2: John 7:1 After these things Jesus walked in Galilee: for he would not walk in Jewry, because the Jews sought to kill him.
column3: Johannes 7:1 EN daarna het Jesus in Galiléa rondgegaan, want Hy wou nie in Judéa rondgaan nie, omdat die Jode probeer het om Hom dood te maak.

column2: John 7:2 Now the Jews' feast of tabernacles was at hand.
column3: Johannes 7:2 En die fees van die Jode, die huttefees, was naby.

column2: John 7:3 His brethren therefore said unto him, Depart hence, and go into Judaea, that thy disciples also may see the works that thou doest.
column3: Johannes 7:3 Sy broers het toe vir Hom gesê: Vertrek hiervandaan en gaan na Judéa, sodat u dissipels ook u werke kan sien wat U doen.

column2: John 7:4 For [there is] no man [that] doeth any thing in secret, and he himself seeketh to be known openly. If thou do these things, shew thyself to the world.
column3: Johannes 7:4 Want niemand doen iets in die geheim en soek tegelykertyd om in iedereen se mond te wees nie As U hierdie dinge doen, vertoon Uself aan die wêreld.

column2: John 7:5 For neither did his brethren believe in him.
column3: Johannes 7:5 Want ook sy broers het nie in Hom geglo nie.

column2: John 7:6 Then Jesus said unto them, My time is not yet come: but your time is alway ready.
column3: Johannes 7:6 Toe sê Jesus vir hulle: My tyd is nog nie daar nie Maar julle tyd is altyd daar.

column2: John 7:7 The world cannot hate you; but me it hateth, because I testify of it, that the works thereof are evil.
column3: Johannes 7:7 Die wêreld kan julle nie haat nie; maar My haat hy, omdat Ek van hom getuig dat sy werke boos is.

column2: John 7:8 Go ye up unto this feast: I go not up yet unto this feast; for my time is not yet full come.
column3: Johannes 7:8 Gaan julle op na hierdie fees. Ek gaan nog nie op na hierdie fees nie, omdat my tyd nog nie daar is nie.

column2: John 7:9 When he had said these words unto them, he abode [still] in Galilee.
column3: Johannes 7:9 En nadat Hy dit aan hulle gesê het, het Hy in Galiléa gebly.

column2: John 7:10 But when his brethren were gone up, then went he also up unto the feast, not openly, but as it were in secret.
column3: Johannes 7:10 MAAR nadat sy broers opgegaan het, toe het Hy ook opgegaan na die fees, nie openlik nie, maar in die geheim.

column2: John 7:11 Then the Jews sought him at the feast, and said, Where is he?
column3: Johannes 7:11 En die Jode het Hom op die fees gesoek en gesê: Waar is Hy?

column2: John 7:12 And there was much murmuring among the people concerning him: for some said, He is a good man: others said, Nay; but he deceiveth the people.
column3: Johannes 7:12 En daar is baie oor Hom gemompel onder die skare. Sommige het gesê: Hy is goed. Ander weer het gesê: Nee, maar Hy mislei die skare.

column2: John 7:13 Howbeit no man spake openly of him for fear of the Jews.
column3: Johannes 7:13 Tog het niemand openlik oor Hom gepraat nie, uit vrees vir die Jode.

column2: John 7:14 Now about the midst of the feast Jesus went up into the temple, and taught.
column3: Johannes 7:14 En toe dit al in die middel van die fees was, het Jesus opgegaan na die tempel en geleer.

column2: John 7:15 And the Jews marvelled, saying, How knoweth this man letters, having never learned?
column3: Johannes 7:15 En die Jode het hulle verwonder en gesê: Hoe kom Hy aan die geleerdheid terwyl Hy geen onderwys ontvang het nie?

column2: John 7:16 Jesus answered them, and said, My doctrine is not mine, but his that sent me.
column3: Johannes 7:16 Jesus antwoord hulle en sê: My leer is nie myne nie, maar van Hom wat My gestuur het.

column2: John 7:17 If any man will do his will, he shall know of the doctrine, whether it be of God, or [whether] I speak of myself.
column3: Johannes 7:17 As iemand gewillig is om sy wil te doen, sal hy aangaande die leer weet of dit uit God is, en of Ek uit Myself spreek.

column2: John 7:18 He that speaketh of himself seeketh his own glory: but he that seeketh his glory that sent him, the same is true, and no unrighteousness is in him.
column3: Johannes 7:18 Hy wat uit homself spreek, soek sy eie eer; maar Hy wat die eer soek van dié Een wat Hom gestuur het, Hy is waaragtig en daar is geen ongeregtigheid in Hom nie.

column2: John 7:19 Did not Moses give you the law, and [yet] none of you keepeth the law? Why go ye about to kill me?
column3: Johannes 7:19 Het Moses julle nie die wet gegee nie? En niemand van julle hou die wet nie. Waarom wil julle My om die lewe bring?

column2: John 7:20 The people answered and said, Thou hast a devil: who goeth about to kill thee?
column3: Johannes 7:20 Die skare antwoord en sê: U is van die duiwel besete; wie wil U om die lewe bring?

column2: John 7:21 Jesus answered and said unto them, I have done one work, and ye all marvel.
column3: Johannes 7:21 Jesus antwoord en sê vir hulle: Een werk het Ek gedoen, en julle verwonder julle almal.

column2: John 7:22 Moses therefore gave unto you circumcision; (not because it is of Moses, but of the fathers;) and ye on the sabbath day circumcise a man.
column3: Johannes 7:22 Daarom het Moses julle die besnydenis gegee — nie dat dit van Moses is nie, maar van die vaders — en op die sabbat besny julle ’n mens.

column2: John 7:23 If a man on the sabbath day receive circumcision, that the law of Moses should not be broken; are ye angry at me, because I have made a man every whit whole on the sabbath day?
column3: Johannes 7:23 As ’n mens die besnydenis op die sabbat ontvang, sodat die wet van Moses nie verbreek mag word nie, is julle kwaad vir My, omdat Ek ’n mens op die sabbat heeltemal gesond gemaak het?

column2: John 7:24 Judge not according to the appearance, but judge righteous judgment.
column3: Johannes 7:24 Moenie oordeel volgens wat julle sien nie, maar oordeel ’n regverdige oordeel.

column2: John 7:25 Then said some of them of Jerusalem, Is not this he, whom they seek to kill?
column3: Johannes 7:25 Daarop sê sommige van die inwoners van Jerusalem: Is dit nie Hy wat hulle soek om dood te maak nie?

column2: John 7:26 But, lo, he speaketh boldly, and they say nothing unto him. Do the rulers know indeed that this is the very Christ?
column3: Johannes 7:26 En kyk, Hy spreek openlik en hulle sê vir Hom niks nie! Sou die owerstes dan waarlik weet dat Hy werklik die Christus is?

column2: John 7:27 Howbeit we know this man whence he is: but when Christ cometh, no man knoweth whence he is.
column3: Johannes 7:27 En hierdie man — ons weet van waar Hy is; maar die Christus, wanneer Hy kom, weet niemand van waar Hy is nie.

column2: John 7:28 Then cried Jesus in the temple as he taught, saying, Ye both know me, and ye know whence I am: and I am not come of myself, but he that sent me is true, whom ye know not.
column3: Johannes 7:28 Jesus roep toe uit, terwyl Hy in die tempel leer, en sê: Julle ken My en julle weet ook van waar Ek is; tog het Ek nie uit Myself gekom nie; maar Hy wat My gestuur het, is waaragtig, vir wie julle nie ken nie.

column2: John 7:29 But I know him: for I am from him, and he hath sent me.
column3: Johannes 7:29 Maar Ek ken Hom, omdat Ek van Hom kom en Hy My gestuur het.

column2: John 7:30 Then they sought to take him: but no man laid hands on him, because his hour was not yet come.
column3: Johannes 7:30 Toe probeer hulle om Hom gevange te neem; en niemand het die hand aan Hom geslaan nie, omdat sy uur nog nie gekom het nie.

column2: John 7:31 And many of the people believed on him, and said, When Christ cometh, will he do more miracles than these which this [man] hath done?
column3: Johannes 7:31 Maar baie van die skare het in Hom geglo en gesê: Wanneer die Christus kom, sal Hy meer tekens doen as wat hierdie man gedoen het?

column2: John 7:32 The Pharisees heard that the people murmured such things concerning him; and the Pharisees and the chief priests sent officers to take him.
column3: Johannes 7:32 Die Fariseërs het gehoor dat die skare dit van Hom mompel, en die Fariseërs en die owerpriesters het dienaars gestuur om Hom gevange te neem.

column2: John 7:33 Then said Jesus unto them, Yet a little while am I with you, and [then] I go unto him that sent me.
column3: Johannes 7:33 Toe sê Jesus vir hulle: Nog ’n klein tydjie is Ek by julle, en Ek gaan na Hom wat My gestuur het.

column2: John 7:34 Ye shall seek me, and shall not find [me]: and where I am, [thither] ye cannot come.
column3: Johannes 7:34 Julle sal My soek en nie vind nie; en waar Ek is, kan julle nie kom nie.

column2: John 7:35 Then said the Jews among themselves, Whither will he go, that we shall not find him? will he go unto the dispersed among the Gentiles, and teach the Gentiles?
column3: Johannes 7:35 En die Jode sê onder mekaar: Waar wil Hy heengaan, dat ons Hom nie sal vind nie? Hy wil tog nie na die verstrooides onder die Grieke gaan en die Grieke leer nie?

column2: John 7:36 What [manner of] saying is this that he said, Ye shall seek me, and shall not find [me]: and where I am, [thither] ye cannot come?
column3: Johannes 7:36 Wat beteken hierdie woord wat Hy gesê het: Julle sal My soek en nie vind nie; en waar Ek is, kan julle nie kom nie?

column2: John 7:37 In the last day, that great [day] of the feast, Jesus stood and cried, saying, If any man thirst, let him come unto me, and drink.
column3: Johannes 7:37 En op die laaste dag, die groot dag van die fees, het Jesus gestaan en uitgeroep en gesê: As iemand dors het, laat hom na My toe kom en drink!

column2: John 7:38 He that believeth on me, as the scripture hath said, out of his belly shall flow rivers of living water.
column3: Johannes 7:38 Hy wat in My glo, soos die Skrif sê: strome van lewende water sal uit sy binneste vloei.

column2: John 7:39 (But this spake he of the Spirit, which they that believe on him should receive: for the Holy Ghost was not yet [given]; because that Jesus was not yet glorified.)
column3: Johannes 7:39 En dit het Hy gesê van die Gees wat dié sou ontvang wat in Hom glo; want die Heilige Gees was daar nog nie, omdat Jesus nog nie verheerlik was nie.

column2: John 7:40 Many of the people therefore, when they heard this saying, said, Of a truth this is the Prophet.
column3: Johannes 7:40 Baie van die skare het, toe hulle die woord hoor, gesê: Hy is waarlik die profeet.

column2: John 7:41 Others said, This is the Christ. But some said, Shall Christ come out of Galilee?
column3: Johannes 7:41 Ander het gesê: Hy is die Christus. En ander het gesê: Kom die Christus dan uit Galiléa?

column2: John 7:42 Hath not the scripture said, That Christ cometh of the seed of David, and out of the town of Bethlehem, where David was?
column3: Johannes 7:42 Het die Skrif nie gesê dat die Christus uit die geslag van Dawid kom en uit Betlehem, die dorp waar Dawid was nie?

column2: John 7:43 So there was a division among the people because of him.
column3: Johannes 7:43 Daar het toe verdeeldheid onder die skare gekom oor Hom.

column2: John 7:44 And some of them would have taken him; but no man laid hands on him.
column3: Johannes 7:44 En sommige van hulle wou Hom gevange neem, maar niemand het die hand aan Hom geslaan nie.

column2: John 7:45 Then came the officers to the chief priests and Pharisees; and they said unto them, Why have ye not brought him?
column3: Johannes 7:45 Die dienaars kom toe by die owerpriesters en die Fariseërs, en dié sê vir hulle: Waarom het julle Hom nie gebring nie?

column2: John 7:46 The officers answered, Never man spake like this man.
column3: Johannes 7:46 Die dienaars antwoord: Nooit het ’n mens so gespreek soos hierdie mens nie.

column2: John 7:47 Then answered them the Pharisees, Are ye also deceived?
column3: Johannes 7:47 En die Fariseërs antwoord hulle: Julle is tog nie ook mislei nie?

column2: John 7:48 Have any of the rulers or of the Pharisees believed on him?
column3: Johannes 7:48 Het iemand uit die owerstes in Hom geglo, of uit die Fariseërs?

column2: John 7:49 But this people who knoweth not the law are cursed.
column3: Johannes 7:49 Maar hierdie skare wat die wet nie ken nie, is vervloek!

column2: John 7:50 Nicodemus saith unto them, (he that came to Jesus by night, being one of them,)
column3: Johannes 7:50 Nikodémus — hy wat in die nag na Hom gegaan het, wat een van hulle was — sê vir hulle:

column2: John 7:51 Doth our law judge [any] man, before it hear him, and know what he doeth?
column3: Johannes 7:51 Oordeel ons wet die mens sonder om hom eers te hoor en te weet wat hy doen?

column2: John 7:52 They answered and said unto him, Art thou also of Galilee? Search, and look: for out of Galilee ariseth no prophet.
column3: Johannes 7:52 Hulle antwoord en sê vir hom: Jy is tog nie ook uit Galiléa nie? Ondersoek en sien dat daar geen profeet uit Galiléa opgestaan het nie.

column2: John 7:53 And every man went unto his own house.
column3: Johannes 7:53 En elkeen het huis toe gegaan.

column2: John 8:1 Jesus went unto the mount of Olives.
column3: Johannes 8:1 MAAR Jesus het na die Olyfberg gegaan.

column2: John 8:2 And early in the morning he came again into the temple, and all the people came unto him; and he sat down, and taught them.
column3: Johannes 8:2 En vroeg in die môre het Hy weer in die tempel gegaan, en al die mense het na Hom gekom, en Hy het gaan sit en hulle geleer.

column2: John 8:3 And the scribes and Pharisees brought unto him a woman taken in adultery; and when they had set her in the midst,
column3: Johannes 8:3 En die skrifgeleerdes en die Fariseërs het ’n vrou wat in egbreuk betrap was, na Hom gebring.

column2: John 8:4 They say unto him, Master, this woman was taken in adultery, in the very act.
column3: Johannes 8:4 En toe hulle haar tussen hulle in laat staan het, sê hulle vir Hom: Meester, hierdie vrou is op ’n daad van egbreuk betrap;

column2: John 8:5 Now Moses in the law commanded us, that such should be stoned: but what sayest thou?
column3: Johannes 8:5 en Moses het ons in die wet bevel gegee om sulke vroue te stenig; maar U, wat sê U?

column2: John 8:6 This they said, tempting him, that they might have to accuse him. But Jesus stooped down, and with [his] finger wrote on the ground, [as though he heard them not].
column3: Johannes 8:6 En dit het hulle gesê om Hom te versoek, sodat hulle iets kon hê om Hom te beskuldig; maar Jesus het neergebuk en met die vinger op die grond geskrywe.

column2: John 8:7 So when they continued asking him, he lifted up himself, and said unto them, He that is without sin among you, let him first cast a stone at her.
column3: Johannes 8:7 Maar toe hulle aanhou om Hom te vra, het Hy Hom opgerig en vir hulle gesê: Laat dié een van julle wat sonder sonde is, die eerste ’n klip op haar gooi.

column2: John 8:8 And again he stooped down, and wrote on the ground.
column3: Johannes 8:8 En weer het Hy neergebuk en op die grond geskrywe.

column2: John 8:9 And they which heard [it], being convicted by [their own] conscience, went out one by one, beginning at the eldest, [even] unto the last: and Jesus was left alone, and the woman standing in the midst.
column3: Johannes 8:9 En toe hulle dit hoor, het hulle, deur hul gewete bestraf, een vir een weggegaan, van die oudste af tot die laaste toe; en Jesus het alleen agtergebly, en die vrou wat daar tussen hulle in gestaan het.

column2: John 8:10 When Jesus had lifted up himself, and saw none but the woman, he said unto her, Woman, where are those thine accusers? hath no man condemned thee?
column3: Johannes 8:10 En toe Jesus Hom oprig en niemand sien behalwe die vrou nie, sê Hy vir haar: Vrou, waar is daardie beskuldigers van jou? Het niemand jou veroordeel nie?

column2: John 8:11 She said, No man, Lord. And Jesus said unto her, Neither do I condemn thee: go, and sin no more.
column3: Johannes 8:11 En sy antwoord: Niemand nie, Here. En Jesus sê vir haar: Ek veroordeel jou ook nie. Gaan heen en sondig nie meer nie.

column2: John 8:12 Then spake Jesus again unto them, saying, I am the light of the world: he that followeth me shall not walk in darkness, but shall have the light of life.
column3: Johannes 8:12 EN Jesus het weer met hulle gespreek en gesê: Ek is die lig van die wêreld; wie My volg, sal sekerlik nie in die duisternis wandel nie, maar sal die lig van die lewe hê.

column2: John 8:13 The Pharisees therefore said unto him, Thou bearest record of thyself; thy record is not true.
column3: Johannes 8:13 Toe sê die Fariseërs vir Hom: U getuig van Uself; u getuienis is nie waar nie.

column2: John 8:14 Jesus answered and said unto them, Though I bear record of myself, [yet] my record is true: for I know whence I came, and whither I go; but ye cannot tell whence I come, and whither I go.
column3: Johannes 8:14 Jesus antwoord en sê vir hulle: Al getuig Ek ook van Myself, my getuienis is waar, omdat Ek weet van waar Ek gekom het en waarheen Ek gaan. Maar julle weet nie van waar Ek kom en waarheen Ek gaan nie.

column2: John 8:15 Ye judge after the flesh; I judge no man.
column3: Johannes 8:15 Julle oordeel volgens die vlees. Ek oordeel niemand nie.

column2: John 8:16 And yet if I judge, my judgment is true: for I am not alone, but I and the Father that sent me.
column3: Johannes 8:16 En al oordeel Ek, my oordeel is waar, omdat Ek nie alleen is nie, maar Ek en die Vader wat My gestuur het.

column2: John 8:17 It is also written in your law, that the testimony of two men is true.
column3: Johannes 8:17 En dit is ook in julle wet geskrywe dat die getuienis van twee mense waar is.

column2: John 8:18 I am one that bear witness of myself, and the Father that sent me beareth witness of me.
column3: Johannes 8:18 Dit is Ek wat van Myself getuig; en die Vader wat My gestuur het, getuig van My.

column2: John 8:19 Then said they unto him, Where is thy Father? Jesus answered, Ye neither know me, nor my Father: if ye had known me, ye should have known my Father also.
column3: Johannes 8:19 Hulle sê toe vir Hom: Waar is u Vader? Jesus antwoord: Julle ken My nie en ook nie my Vader nie; as julle My geken het, sou julle ook my Vader geken het.

column2: John 8:20 These words spake Jesus in the treasury, as he taught in the temple: and no man laid hands on him; for his hour was not yet come.
column3: Johannes 8:20 Hierdie woorde het Jesus gespreek by die skatkis terwyl Hy in die tempel geleer het. En niemand het Hom gevange geneem nie, omdat sy uur nog nie gekom het nie.

column2: John 8:21 Then said Jesus again unto them, I go my way, and ye shall seek me, and shall die in your sins: whither I go, ye cannot come.
column3: Johannes 8:21 En Jesus het weer vir hulle gesê: Ek gaan weg, en julle sal My soek en in julle sonde sterwe. Waar Ek gaan, kan julle nie kom nie.

column2: John 8:22 Then said the Jews, Will he kill himself? because he saith, Whither I go, ye cannot come.
column3: Johannes 8:22 Toe sê die Jode: Hy sal Homself tog nie om die lewe bring nie, omdat Hy sê: Waar Ek gaan, kan julle nie kom nie?

column2: John 8:23 And he said unto them, Ye are from beneath; I am from above: ye are of this world; I am not of this world.
column3: Johannes 8:23 En Hy sê vir hulle: Julle is van benede, Ek is van bo; julle is uit hierdie wêreld, Ek is nie uit hierdie wêreld nie.

column2: John 8:24 I said therefore unto you, that ye shall die in your sins: for if ye believe not that I am [he], ye shall die in your sins.
column3: Johannes 8:24 Ek het dan vir julle gesê dat julle in jul sondes sal sterwe; want as julle nie glo dat dit Ek is nie, sal julle in jul sondes sterwe.

column2: John 8:25 Then said they unto him, Who art thou? And Jesus saith unto them, Even [the same] that I said unto you from the beginning.
column3: Johannes 8:25 Toe sê hulle vir Hom: Wie is U dan? En Jesus antwoord hulle: Net dit wat Ek vir julle sê.

column2: John 8:26 I have many things to say and to judge of you: but he that sent me is true; and I speak to the world those things which I have heard of him.
column3: Johannes 8:26 Ek het baie dinge om van julle te sê en te oordeel; maar Hy wat My gestuur het, is waaragtig; en Ek, wat Ek van Hom gehoor het, dit spreek Ek tot die wêreld.

column2: John 8:27 They understood not that he spake to them of the Father.
column3: Johannes 8:27 Hulle het nie verstaan dat Hy met hulle van die Vader gespreek het nie.

column2: John 8:28 Then said Jesus unto them, When ye have lifted up the Son of man, then shall ye know that I am [he], and [that] I do nothing of myself; but as my Father hath taught me, I speak these things.
column3: Johannes 8:28 En Jesus sê vir hulle: Wanneer julle die Seun van die mens verhoog het, dan sal julle weet dat dit Ek is; en uit Myself doen Ek niks nie; maar net wat my Vader My geleer het, dit spreek Ek.

column2: John 8:29 And he that sent me is with me: the Father hath not left me alone; for I do always those things that please him.
column3: Johannes 8:29 En Hy wat My gestuur het, is met My; die Vader het My nie alleen gelaat nie, omdat Ek altyd doen wat Hom welgevallig is.

column2: John 8:30 As he spake these words, many believed on him.
column3: Johannes 8:30 Terwyl Hy hierdie dinge spreek, het baie in Hom geglo.

column2: John 8:31 Then said Jesus to those Jews which believed on him, If ye continue in my word, [then] are ye my disciples indeed;
column3: Johannes 8:31 En Jesus sê vir die Jode wat in Hom geglo het: As julle in my woord bly, is julle waarlik my dissipels.

column2: John 8:32 And ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free.
column3: Johannes 8:32 En julle sal die waarheid ken, en die waarheid sal julle vrymaak.

column2: John 8:33 They answered him, We be Abraham's seed, and were never in bondage to any man: how sayest thou, Ye shall be made free?
column3: Johannes 8:33 Hulle antwoord Hom: Ons is die geslag van Abraham en het nog nooit vir iemand slawediens verrig nie; hoe sê U dan: Julle sal vry word?

column2: John 8:34 Jesus answered them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Whosoever committeth sin is the servant of sin.
column3: Johannes 8:34 Jesus antwoord hulle: Voorwaar, voorwaar Ek sê vir julle dat elkeen wat die sonde doen, ’n dienskneg van die sonde is.

column2: John 8:35 And the servant abideth not in the house for ever: [but] the Son abideth ever.
column3: Johannes 8:35 En die dienskneg bly nie vir altyd in die huis nie; die seun bly vir altyd.

column2: John 8:36 If the Son therefore shall make you free, ye shall be free indeed.
column3: Johannes 8:36 As die Seun julle dan vrygemaak het, sal julle waarlik vry wees.

column2: John 8:37 I know that ye are Abraham's seed; but ye seek to kill me, because my word hath no place in you.
column3: Johannes 8:37 Ek weet dat julle die geslag van Abraham is; maar julle probeer om My om die lewe te bring, omdat my woord geen ingang in julle vind nie.

column2: John 8:38 I speak that which I have seen with my Father: and ye do that which ye have seen with your father.
column3: Johannes 8:38 Ek spreek van wat Ek by my Vader gesien het, en julle doen ook wat julle by jul vader gesien het.

column2: John 8:39 They answered and said unto him, Abraham is our father. Jesus saith unto them, If ye were Abraham's children, ye would do the works of Abraham.
column3: Johannes 8:39 Hulle antwoord en sê vir Hom: Ons vader is Abraham. Jesus sê vir hulle: As julle die kinders van Abraham was, sou julle die werke van Abraham doen;

column2: John 8:40 But now ye seek to kill me, a man that hath told you the truth, which I have heard of God: this did not Abraham.
column3: Johannes 8:40 maar nou probeer julle om My om die lewe te bring, iemand wat aan julle die waarheid vertel het, wat Ek van God gehoor het. Dit het Abraham nie gedoen nie.

column2: John 8:41 Ye do the deeds of your father. Then said they to him, We be not born of fornication; we have one Father, [even] God.
column3: Johannes 8:41 Julle doen die werke van jul vader. Toe sê hulle vir Hom: Ons is nie uit ontug gebore nie; ons het een Vader, naamlik God.

column2: John 8:42 Jesus said unto them, If God were your Father, ye would love me: for I proceeded forth and came from God; neither came I of myself, but he sent me.
column3: Johannes 8:42 En Jesus sê vir hulle: As God julle Vader was, sou julle My liefhê, want Ek het uit God uitgegaan en gekom; want Ek het ook nie uit Myself gekom nie, maar Hy het My gestuur.

column2: John 8:43 Why do ye not understand my speech? [even] because ye cannot hear my word.
column3: Johannes 8:43 Waarom ken julle my spraak nie? Omdat julle na my woord nie kan luister nie.

column2: John 8:44 Ye are of [your] father the devil, and the lusts of your father ye will do. He was a murderer from the beginning, and abode not in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaketh a lie, he speaketh of his own: for he is a liar, and the father of it.
column3: Johannes 8:44 Julle het die duiwel as vader, en die begeertes van julle vader wil julle doen. Hy was ’n mensemoordenaar van die begin af en staan nie in die waarheid nie, omdat daar in hom geen waarheid is nie. Wanneer hy leuentaal praat, praat hy uit sy eie, omdat hy ’n leuenaar is en die vader daarvan.

column2: John 8:45 And because I tell [you] the truth, ye believe me not.
column3: Johannes 8:45 Maar omdat Ek die waarheid spreek, glo julle My nie.

column2: John 8:46 Which of you convinceth me of sin? And if I say the truth, why do ye not believe me?
column3: Johannes 8:46 Wie van julle oortuig My van sonde? En as Ek die waarheid spreek, waarom glo julle My nie?

column2: John 8:47 He that is of God heareth God's words: ye therefore hear [them] not, because ye are not of God.
column3: Johannes 8:47 Die wat uit God is, luister na die woorde van God. Daarom luister julle nie, omdat julle nie uit God is nie.

column2: John 8:48 Then answered the Jews, and said unto him, Say we not well that thou art a Samaritan, and hast a devil?
column3: Johannes 8:48 Die Jode antwoord toe en sê vir Hom: Sê ons nie met reg dat U ’n Samaritaan is en van die duiwel besete is nie?

column2: John 8:49 Jesus answered, I have not a devil; but I honour my Father, and ye do dishonour me.
column3: Johannes 8:49 Jesus antwoord: Ek is nie van die duiwel besete nie; maar Ek eer my Vader, en julle doen My oneer aan.

column2: John 8:50 And I seek not mine own glory: there is one that seeketh and judgeth.
column3: Johannes 8:50 En Ek soek nie my eer nie; daar is Een wat dit soek en wat oordeel.

column2: John 8:51 Verily, verily, I say unto you, If a man keep my saying, he shall never see death.
column3: Johannes 8:51 Voorwaar, voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, as iemand my woord bewaar, sal hy die dood in der ewigheid nie sien nie.

column2: John 8:52 Then said the Jews unto him, Now we know that thou hast a devil. Abraham is dead, and the prophets; and thou sayest, If a man keep my saying, he shall never taste of death.
column3: Johannes 8:52 Toe sê die Jode vir Hom: Nou weet ons dat U van die duiwel besete is. Abraham het gesterwe en die profete, en U sê: As iemand my woord bewaar, sal hy die dood in der ewigheid nie smaak nie.

column2: John 8:53 Art thou greater than our father Abraham, which is dead? and the prophets are dead: whom makest thou thyself?
column3: Johannes 8:53 Is U dan groter as ons vader Abraham wat gesterf het? En die profete het gesterwe. Vir wie gee U Uself uit?

column2: John 8:54 Jesus answered, If I honour myself, my honour is nothing: it is my Father that honoureth me; of whom ye say, that he is your God:
column3: Johannes 8:54 Jesus antwoord: As Ek Myself verheerlik, is my heerlikheid niks nie. Dit is my Vader wat My verheerlik, van wie julle sê dat Hy julle God is.

column2: John 8:55 Yet ye have not known him; but I know him: and if I should say, I know him not, I shall be a liar like unto you: but I know him, and keep his saying.
column3: Johannes 8:55 En julle ken Hom nie, maar Ek ken Hom; en as Ek sê dat Ek Hom nie ken nie, sal Ek soos julle ’n leuenaar wees. Maar Ek ken Hom en bewaar sy woord.

column2: John 8:56 Your father Abraham rejoiced to see my day: and he saw [it], and was glad.
column3: Johannes 8:56 Abraham, julle vader, het hom verheug dat hy my dag sou sien; en hy het dit gesien en het hom verbly.

column2: John 8:57 Then said the Jews unto him, Thou art not yet fifty years old, and hast thou seen Abraham?
column3: Johannes 8:57 Toe sê die Jode vir Hom: U is nog nie vyftig jaar oud nie, en het U Abraham gesien?

column2: John 8:58 Jesus said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Before Abraham was, I am.
column3: Johannes 8:58 Jesus sê vir hulle: Voorwaar, voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, voordat Abraham was, is Ek.

column2: John 8:59 Then took they up stones to cast at him: but Jesus hid himself, and went out of the temple, going through the midst of them, and so passed by.
column3: Johannes 8:59 Hulle het toe klippe opgetel om Hom te stenig; maar Jesus het stilletjies uit die tempel gegaan en tussen hulle deurgeloop; en so het Hy vertrek.

column2: John 9:1 And as [Jesus] passed by, he saw a man which was blind from [his] birth.
column3: Johannes 9:1 EN toe Hy verbygaan, sien Hy ’n man wat blind was van sy geboorte af.

column2: John 9:2 And his disciples asked him, saying, Master, who did sin, this man, or his parents, that he was born blind?
column3: Johannes 9:2 En sy dissipels vra Hom en sê: Rabbi, wie het gesondig, hierdie man of sy ouers, dat hy blind gebore is?

column2: John 9:3 Jesus answered, Neither hath this man sinned, nor his parents: but that the works of God should be made manifest in him.
column3: Johannes 9:3 Jesus antwoord: Hy het nie gesondig nie, en sy ouers ook nie; maar die werke van God moet in hom openbaar word.

column2: John 9:4 I must work the works of him that sent me, while it is day: the night cometh, when no man can work.
column3: Johannes 9:4 Ek moet die werke doen van Hom wat My gestuur het, so lank as dit dag is; die nag kom wanneer niemand kan werk nie.

column2: John 9:5 As long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world.
column3: Johannes 9:5 So lank as Ek in die wêreld is, is Ek die lig van die wêreld.

column2: John 9:6 When he had thus spoken, he spat on the ground, and made clay of the spittle, and he anointed the eyes of the blind man with the clay,
column3: Johannes 9:6 En toe Hy dit gesê het, spuug Hy op die grond en maak klei van die spuug en smeer die klei aan die oë van die blinde man

column2: John 9:7 And said unto him, Go, wash in the pool of Siloam, (which is by interpretation, Sent.) He went his way therefore, and washed, and came seeing.
column3: Johannes 9:7 en sê vir hom: Gaan was jou in die badwater Silóam, wat vertaal word: Uitgestuur. En hy het gegaan en hom gewas; en hy het siende teruggekom.

column2: John 9:8 The neighbours therefore, and they which before had seen him that he was blind, said, Is not this he that sat and begged?
column3: Johannes 9:8 Die bure dan en die wat hom vroeër gesien het dat hy blind was, sê toe: Is hy nie die een wat gesit en bedel het nie?

column2: John 9:9 Some said, This is he: others [said], He is like him: [but] he said, I am [he].
column3: Johannes 9:9 Ander sê: Dit is hy. Ander weer: Hy lyk na hom. Hy antwoord: Dit is ek.

column2: John 9:10 Therefore said they unto him, How were thine eyes opened?
column3: Johannes 9:10 Hulle sê vir hom: Hoe is jou oë geopen?

column2: John 9:11 He answered and said, A man that is called Jesus made clay, and anointed mine eyes, and said unto me, Go to the pool of Siloam, and wash: and I went and washed, and I received sight.
column3: Johannes 9:11 Hy antwoord en sê: Die man wat Jesus genoem word, het klei gemaak en op my oë gesmeer en vir my gesê: Gaan na die badwater Silóam en was jou. En ek het gegaan en my gewas en ek sien.

column2: John 9:12 Then said they unto him, Where is he? He said, I know not.
column3: Johannes 9:12 En hulle sê vir hom: Waar is Hy? Hy antwoord: Ek weet nie.

column2: John 9:13 They brought to the Pharisees him that aforetime was blind.
column3: Johannes 9:13 Hulle bring hom na die Fariseërs — die man wat vroeër blind was.

column2: John 9:14 And it was the sabbath day when Jesus made the clay, and opened his eyes.
column3: Johannes 9:14 En dit was sabbat toe Jesus die klei gemaak en sy oë geopen het.

column2: John 9:15 Then again the Pharisees also asked him how he had received his sight. He said unto them, He put clay upon mine eyes, and I washed, and do see.
column3: Johannes 9:15 Die Fariseërs vra hom toe weer hoe hy siende geword het. En hy antwoord hulle: Hy het klei op my oë gesit, en ek het my gewas en ek sien.

column2: John 9:16 Therefore said some of the Pharisees, This man is not of God, because he keepeth not the sabbath day. Others said, How can a man that is a sinner do such miracles? And there was a division among them.
column3: Johannes 9:16 En sommige van die Fariseërs sê: Hierdie man kom nie van God nie, omdat Hy die sabbat nie hou nie. Ander sê: Hoe kan ’n sondige mens sulke tekens doen? En daar was verdeeldheid onder hulle.

column2: John 9:17 They say unto the blind man again, What sayest thou of him, that he hath opened thine eyes? He said, He is a prophet.
column3: Johannes 9:17 Weer sê hulle vir die blinde man: Jy, wat sê jy van Hom, aangesien Hy jou oë geopen het? En hy antwoord: Hy is ’n profeet.

column2: John 9:18 But the Jews did not believe concerning him, that he had been blind, and received his sight, until they called the parents of him that had received his sight.
column3: Johannes 9:18 En die Jode het dit nie van hom geglo dat hy blind was en siende geword het nie, totdat hulle die ouers geroep het van hom wat siende geword het.

column2: John 9:19 And they asked them, saying, Is this your son, who ye say was born blind? how then doth he now see?
column3: Johannes 9:19 En hulle vra hul en sê: Is dit julle seun van wie julle sê dat hy blind gebore is? Hoe sien hy dan nou?

column2: John 9:20 His parents answered them and said, We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind:
column3: Johannes 9:20 Sy ouers antwoord hulle en sê: Ons weet dat hy ons seun is en dat hy blind gebore is;

column2: John 9:21 But by what means he now seeth, we know not; or who hath opened his eyes, we know not: he is of age; ask him: he shall speak for himself.
column3: Johannes 9:21 maar hoe hy nou sien, weet ons nie; of wie sy oë geopen het, weet ons nie. Hy is self oud genoeg, vra hom; hy sal vir homself praat.

column2: John 9:22 These [words] spake his parents, because they feared the Jews: for the Jews had agreed already, that if any man did confess that he was Christ, he should be put out of the synagogue.
column3: Johannes 9:22 Dit het sy ouers gesê omdat hulle bang was vir die Jode; want die Jode het al ooreengekom dat as iemand Hom as die Christus bely, hy uit die sinagoge geban sou word.

column2: John 9:23 Therefore said his parents, He is of age; ask him.
column3: Johannes 9:23 Daarom het sy ouers gesê: Hy is oud genoeg, vra hom.

column2: John 9:24 Then again called they the man that was blind, and said unto him, Give God the praise: we know that this man is a sinner.
column3: Johannes 9:24 Hulle roep toe vir die tweede keer die man wat blind was, en sê vir hom: Gee aan God die eer; ons weet dat hierdie man ’n sondaar is.

column2: John 9:25 He answered and said, Whether he be a sinner [or no], I know not: one thing I know, that, whereas I was blind, now I see.
column3: Johannes 9:25 En hy antwoord en sê: Of Hy ’n sondaar is, weet ek nie. Een ding weet ek: dat ek blind was en nou sien.

column2: John 9:26 Then said they to him again, What did he to thee? how opened he thine eyes?
column3: Johannes 9:26 En hulle sê weer vir hom: Wat het Hy vir jou gedoen? Hoe het Hy jou oë geopen?

column2: John 9:27 He answered them, I have told you already, and ye did not hear: wherefore would ye hear [it] again? will ye also be his disciples?
column3: Johannes 9:27 Hy antwoord hulle: Ek het julle dit alreeds gesê, en julle het nie geluister nie. Waarom wil julle dit weer hoor? Julle wil tog nie ook sy dissipels word nie?

column2: John 9:28 Then they reviled him, and said, Thou art his disciple; but we are Moses' disciples.
column3: Johannes 9:28 Hulle skel hom toe uit en sê: Jý is ’n dissipel van daardie man, maar ons is dissipels van Moses.

column2: John 9:29 We know that God spake unto Moses: [as for] this [fellow], we know not from whence he is.
column3: Johannes 9:29 Ons weet dat God met Moses gespreek het; maar wat Hom betref, ons weet nie van waar Hy is nie.

column2: John 9:30 The man answered and said unto them, Why herein is a marvellous thing, that ye know not from whence he is, and [yet] he hath opened mine eyes.
column3: Johannes 9:30 Die man antwoord en sê vir hulle: Hierin is tog iets wonderliks dat julle nie weet van waar Hy is nie, en Hy het my oë geopen!

column2: John 9:31 Now we know that God heareth not sinners: but if any man be a worshipper of God, and doeth his will, him he heareth.
column3: Johannes 9:31 En ons weet dat God nie sondaars verhoor nie; maar as iemand godvresend is en sy wil doen, dié verhoor Hy.

column2: John 9:32 Since the world began was it not heard that any man opened the eyes of one that was born blind.
column3: Johannes 9:32 Van ouds af is dit nie gehoor dat iemand die oë van ’n blindgebore mens geopen het nie.

column2: John 9:33 If this man were not of God, he could do nothing.
column3: Johannes 9:33 As Hy nie van God was nie, sou Hy niks kan doen nie.

column2: John 9:34 They answered and said unto him, Thou wast altogether born in sins, and dost thou teach us? And they cast him out.
column3: Johannes 9:34 Hulle antwoord en sê vir hom: Jy is heeltemal in sondes gebore, en leer jy ons? En hulle het hom uitgeban.

column2: John 9:35 Jesus heard that they had cast him out; and when he had found him, he said unto him, Dost thou believe on the Son of God?
column3: Johannes 9:35 Jesus het gehoor dat hulle hom uitgeban het; en toe Hy hom kry, sê Hy vir hom: Glo jy in die Seun van God?

column2: John 9:36 He answered and said, Who is he, Lord, that I might believe on him?
column3: Johannes 9:36 Hy antwoord en sê: Wie is Hy, Here, dat ek in Hom kan glo?

column2: John 9:37 And Jesus said unto him, Thou hast both seen him, and it is he that talketh with thee.
column3: Johannes 9:37 En Jesus sê vir hom: Jy het Hom gesien; en Hy wat met jou spreek, dit is Hy.

column2: John 9:38 And he said, Lord, I believe. And he worshipped him.
column3: Johannes 9:38 Toe sê hy: Ek glo, Here! En hy het Hom aanbid.

column2: John 9:39 And Jesus said, For judgment I am come into this world, that they which see not might see; and that they which see might be made blind.
column3: Johannes 9:39 En Jesus sê: Tot ’n oordeel het Ek in hierdie wêreld gekom, sodat die wat nie sien nie, mag sien, en die wat sien, blind mag word.

column2: John 9:40 And [some] of the Pharisees which were with him heard these words, and said unto him, Are we blind also?
column3: Johannes 9:40 En dié van die Fariseërs wat by Hom was, het dit gehoor en vir Hom gesê: Is ons dan ook blind?

column2: John 9:41 Jesus said unto them, If ye were blind, ye should have no sin: but now ye say, We see; therefore your sin remaineth.
column3: Johannes 9:41 Jesus antwoord hulle: As julle blind was, sou julle geen sonde hê nie; maar nou sê julle: Ons sien! Daarom bly julle sonde.

column2: John 10:1 Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that entereth not by the door into the sheepfold, but climbeth up some other way, the same is a thief and a robber.
column3: Johannes 10:1 VOORWAAR, voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, wie nie by die deur in die skaapstal ingaan nie, maar van ’n ander kant af inklim, hy is ’n dief en ’n rower.

column2: John 10:2 But he that entereth in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.
column3: Johannes 10:2 Maar hy wat by die deur ingaan, is ’n herder van die skape.

column2: John 10:3 To him the porter openeth; and the sheep hear his voice: and he calleth his own sheep by name, and leadeth them out.
column3: Johannes 10:3 Vir hom maak die deurwagter oop, en die skape luister na sy stem; en hy roep sy eie skape by hulle naam en lei hulle uit.

column2: John 10:4 And when he putteth forth his own sheep, he goeth before them, and the sheep follow him: for they know his voice.
column3: Johannes 10:4 En wanneer hy sy eie skape uitgebring het, loop hy voor hulle uit; en die skape volg hom, omdat hulle sy stem ken.

column2: John 10:5 And a stranger will they not follow, but will flee from him: for they know not the voice of strangers.
column3: Johannes 10:5 Hulle sal ’n vreemde nooit volg nie, maar van hom wegvlug, omdat hulle die stem van die vreemdes nie ken nie.

column2: John 10:6 This parable spake Jesus unto them: but they understood not what things they were which he spake unto them.
column3: Johannes 10:6 Hierdie gelykenis het Jesus aan hulle vertel; maar hulle het nie verstaan wat dit was wat Hy tot hulle gespreek het nie.

column2: John 10:7 Then said Jesus unto them again, Verily, verily, I say unto you, I am the door of the sheep.
column3: Johannes 10:7 Jesus het toe weer vir hulle gesê: Voorwaar, voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, Ek is die deur van die skape.

column2: John 10:8 All that ever came before me are thieves and robbers: but the sheep did not hear them.
column3: Johannes 10:8 Almal wat voor My gekom het, is diewe en rowers; maar die skape het nie na hulle geluister nie.

column2: John 10:9 I am the door: by me if any man enter in, he shall be saved, and shall go in and out, and find pasture.
column3: Johannes 10:9 Ek is die deur; as iemand deur My ingaan, sal hy gered word, en hy sal ingaan en uitgaan en weiding vind.

column2: John 10:10 The thief cometh not, but for to steal, and to kill, and to destroy: I am come that they might have life, and that they might have [it] more abundantly.
column3: Johannes 10:10 Die dief kom net om te steel en te slag en te verwoes. Ek het gekom, dat hulle lewe en oorvloed kan hê.

column2: John 10:11 I am the good shepherd: the good shepherd giveth his life for the sheep.
column3: Johannes 10:11 Ek is die goeie herder. Die goeie herder lê sy lewe af vir die skape.

column2: John 10:12 But he that is an hireling, and not the shepherd, whose own the sheep are not, seeth the wolf coming, and leaveth the sheep, and fleeth: and the wolf catcheth them, and scattereth the sheep.
column3: Johannes 10:12 Maar die huurling en hy wat nie ’n herder is nie, van wie die skape nie die eiendom is nie, sien die wolf kom en laat die skape staan en vlug, en die wolf vang hulle en jaag die skape uitmekaar.

column2: John 10:13 The hireling fleeth, because he is an hireling, and careth not for the sheep.
column3: Johannes 10:13 En die huurling vlug, omdat hy ’n huurling is en niks vir die skape omgee nie.

column2: John 10:14 I am the good shepherd, and know my [sheep], and am known of mine.
column3: Johannes 10:14 Ek is die goeie herder, en Ek ken my eie en word deur my eie geken.

column2: John 10:15 As the Father knoweth me, even so know I the Father: and I lay down my life for the sheep.
column3: Johannes 10:15 Net soos die Vader My ken, ken Ek ook die Vader; en Ek lê my lewe af vir die skape.

column2: John 10:16 And other sheep I have, which are not of this fold: them also I must bring, and they shall hear my voice; and there shall be one fold, [and] one shepherd.
column3: Johannes 10:16 Ek het nog ander skape wat nie aan hierdie stal behoort nie. Ek moet hulle ook lei, en hulle sal na my stem luister, en dit sal wees een kudde, een herder.

column2: John 10:17 Therefore doth my Father love me, because I lay down my life, that I might take it again.
column3: Johannes 10:17 Daarom het die Vader My lief, omdat Ek my lewe aflê om dit weer te neem.

column2: John 10:18 No man taketh it from me, but I lay it down of myself. I have power to lay it down, and I have power to take it again. This commandment have I received of my Father.
column3: Johannes 10:18 Niemand neem dit van My af nie, maar Ek lê dit uit Myself af. Ek het mag om dit af te lê en Ek het mag om dit weer te neem. Hierdie gebod het Ek van my Vader ontvang.

column2: John 10:19 There was a division therefore again among the Jews for these sayings.
column3: Johannes 10:19 Daar het toe weer verdeeldheid onder die Jode gekom oor hierdie woorde.

column2: John 10:20 And many of them said, He hath a devil, and is mad; why hear ye him?
column3: Johannes 10:20 En baie van hulle het gesê: Hy is van die duiwel besete en is kranksinnig; wat luister julle na Hom?

column2: John 10:21 Others said, These are not the words of him that hath a devil. Can a devil open the eyes of the blind?
column3: Johannes 10:21 Ander het gesê: Hierdie woorde is nie van ’n besetene nie; ’n duiwel kan tog nie die oë van blindes open nie.

column2: John 10:22 And it was at Jerusalem the feast of the dedication, and it was winter.
column3: Johannes 10:22 EN dit was die fees van die tempelwyding in Jerusalem, en dit was winter.

column2: John 10:23 And Jesus walked in the temple in Solomon's porch.
column3: Johannes 10:23 En Jesus het in die tempel gewandel in die pilaargang van Salomo.

column2: John 10:24 Then came the Jews round about him, and said unto him, How long dost thou make us to doubt? If thou be the Christ, tell us plainly.
column3: Johannes 10:24 En die Jode het Hom omring en vir Hom gesê: Hoe lank hou U ons in onsekerheid? As U die Christus is, sê dit vir ons ronduit.

column2: John 10:25 Jesus answered them, I told you, and ye believed not: the works that I do in my Father's name, they bear witness of me.
column3: Johannes 10:25 Jesus antwoord hulle: Ek het dit vir julle gesê, en julle glo nie. Die werke wat Ek doen in die Naam van my Vader, dié getuig van My.

column2: John 10:26 But ye believe not, because ye are not of my sheep, as I said unto you.
column3: Johannes 10:26 Maar julle glo nie, want julle is nie van my skape nie, soos Ek vir julle gesê het.

column2: John 10:27 My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me:
column3: Johannes 10:27 My skape luister na my stem, en Ek ken hulle, en hulle volg My.

column2: John 10:28 And I give unto them eternal life; and they shall never perish, neither shall any [man] pluck them out of my hand.
column3: Johannes 10:28 En Ek gee hulle die ewige lewe, en hulle sal nooit verlore gaan tot in ewigheid nie, en niemand sal hulle uit my hand ruk nie.

column2: John 10:29 My Father, which gave [them] me, is greater than all; and no [man] is able to pluck [them] out of my Father's hand.
column3: Johannes 10:29 My vader wat hulle aan My gegee het, is groter as almal; en niemand kan hulle uit die hand van my Vader ruk nie.

column2: John 10:30 I and [my] Father are one.
column3: Johannes 10:30 Ek en die Vader is een.

column2: John 10:31 Then the Jews took up stones again to stone him.
column3: Johannes 10:31 Die Jode het toe weer klippe opgetel om Hom te stenig.

column2: John 10:32 Jesus answered them, Many good works have I shewed you from my Father; for which of those works do ye stone me?
column3: Johannes 10:32 Jesus antwoord hulle: Baie goeie werke het Ek julle getoon van my Vader. Oor watter een van dié werke stenig julle My?

column2: John 10:33 The Jews answered him, saying, For a good work we stone thee not; but for blasphemy; and because that thou, being a man, makest thyself God.
column3: Johannes 10:33 Die Jode antwoord Hom en sê: Dit is nie oor ’n goeie werk dat ons U stenig nie, maar oor godslastering, en omdat U wat ’n mens is, Uself God maak.

column2: John 10:34 Jesus answered them, Is it not written in your law, I said, Ye are gods?
column3: Johannes 10:34 Jesus antwoord hulle: Is daar nie in julle wet geskrywe: Ek het gesê, julle is gode nie?

column2: John 10:35 If he called them gods, unto whom the word of God came, and the scripture cannot be broken;
column3: Johannes 10:35 As dit húlle gode noem tot wie die woord van God gekom het, en die Skrif nie gebreek kan word nie,

column2: John 10:36 Say ye of him, whom the Father hath sanctified, and sent into the world, Thou blasphemest; because I said, I am the Son of God?
column3: Johannes 10:36 sê julle vir Hom wat die Vader geheilig en in die wêreld gestuur het: U spreek godslasterlik — omdat Ek gesê het: Ek is die Seun van God?

column2: John 10:37 If I do not the works of my Father, believe me not.
column3: Johannes 10:37 As Ek nie die werke van my Vader doen nie, moet julle My nie glo nie;

column2: John 10:38 But if I do, though ye believe not me, believe the works: that ye may know, and believe, that the Father [is] in me, and I in him.
column3: Johannes 10:38 maar as Ek dit doen, al glo julle My nie, glo die werke, dat julle kan erken en glo dat die Vader in My is, en Ek in Hom.

column2: John 10:39 Therefore they sought again to take him: but he escaped out of their hand,
column3: Johannes 10:39 Toe het hulle weer probeer om Hom gevange te neem, en Hy het uit hulle hand ontkom.

column2: John 10:40 And went away again beyond Jordan into the place where John at first baptized; and there he abode.
column3: Johannes 10:40 En Hy het weer oor die Jordaan gegaan na die plek waar Johannes eers gedoop het; en Hy het daar gebly.

column2: John 10:41 And many resorted unto him, and said, John did no miracle: but all things that John spake of this man were true.
column3: Johannes 10:41 En baie het na Hom gekom en gesê: Johannes het wel geen teken gedoen nie, maar alles wat Johannes van Hom gesê het, was waar.

column2: John 10:42 And many believed on him there.
column3: Johannes 10:42 En baie het daar in Hom geglo.

column2: John 11:1 Now a certain [man] was sick, [named] Lazarus, of Bethany, the town of Mary and her sister Martha.
column3: Johannes 11:1 EN daar was ’n man siek, Lasarus van Betánië, die dorp van Maria en haar suster Martha.

column2: John 11:2 (It was [that] Mary which anointed the Lord with ointment, and wiped his feet with her hair, whose brother Lazarus was sick.)
column3: Johannes 11:2 En dit was Maria wat die Here gesalf het met salf en sy voete afgedroog het met haar hare, wie se broer, Lasarus, siek was.

column2: John 11:3 Therefore his sisters sent unto him, saying, Lord, behold, he whom thou lovest is sick.
column3: Johannes 11:3 Die susters het toe na Hom gestuur en gesê: Here, hy vir wie U liefhet, is siek.

column2: John 11:4 When Jesus heard [that], he said, This sickness is not unto death, but for the glory of God, that the Son of God might be glorified thereby.
column3: Johannes 11:4 En toe Jesus dit hoor, sê Hy: Hierdie siekte is nie tot die dood toe nie, maar tot die heerlikheid van God, sodat die Seun van God daardeur verheerlik kan word.

column2: John 11:5 Now Jesus loved Martha, and her sister, and Lazarus.
column3: Johannes 11:5 En Jesus het Martha en haar suster en Lasarus liefgehad.

column2: John 11:6 When he had heard therefore that he was sick, he abode two days still in the same place where he was.
column3: Johannes 11:6 En toe Hy hoor dat hy siek is, het Hy twee dae vertoef in die plek waar Hy was.

column2: John 11:7 Then after that saith he to [his] disciples, Let us go into Judaea again.
column3: Johannes 11:7 Eers daarna sê Hy aan die dissipels: Laat ons weer na Judéa gaan.

column2: John 11:8 [His] disciples say unto him, Master, the Jews of late sought to stone thee; and goest thou thither again?
column3: Johannes 11:8 Die dissipels sê vir Hom: Rabbi, die Jode het onlangs probeer om U te stenig, en gaan U weer daarnatoe?

column2: John 11:9 Jesus answered, Are there not twelve hours in the day? If any man walk in the day, he stumbleth not, because he seeth the light of this world.
column3: Johannes 11:9 Jesus antwoord: Is daar nie twaalf ure in die dag nie? As iemand in die dag wandel, stamp hy hom nie, omdat hy die lig van hierdie wêreld sien.

column2: John 11:10 But if a man walk in the night, he stumbleth, because there is no light in him.
column3: Johannes 11:10 Maar as iemand in die nag wandel, stamp hy hom, omdat die lig nie in hom is nie.

column2: John 11:11 These things said he: and after that he saith unto them, Our friend Lazarus sleepeth; but I go, that I may awake him out of sleep.
column3: Johannes 11:11 Dit het Hy gespreek; en daarna sê Hy vir hulle: Lasarus, ons vriend, slaap; maar Ek gaan om hom wakker te maak.

column2: John 11:12 Then said his disciples, Lord, if he sleep, he shall do well.
column3: Johannes 11:12 Sy dissipels sê toe: Here, as hy slaap, sal hy gesond word.

column2: John 11:13 Howbeit Jesus spake of his death: but they thought that he had spoken of taking of rest in sleep.
column3: Johannes 11:13 Maar Jesus het gespreek van sy dood, terwyl hulle gedink het dat Hy van die rus van die slaap spreek.

column2: John 11:14 Then said Jesus unto them plainly, Lazarus is dead.
column3: Johannes 11:14 En toe sê Jesus vir hulle ronduit: Lasarus is dood.

column2: John 11:15 And I am glad for your sakes that I was not there, to the intent ye may believe; nevertheless let us go unto him.
column3: Johannes 11:15 En Ek is bly om julle ontwil dat Ek nie daar was nie, sodat julle kan glo. Maar laat ons na hom toe gaan.

column2: John 11:16 Then said Thomas, which is called Didymus, unto his fellowdisciples, Let us also go, that we may die with him.
column3: Johannes 11:16 En Thomas, wat Dídimus genoem word, sê vir sy mededissipels: Laat ons ook gaan om saam met Hom te sterwe.

column2: John 11:17 Then when Jesus came, he found that he had [lain] in the grave four days already.
column3: Johannes 11:17 Toe Jesus dan gekom het, het Hy gevind dat hy al vier dae in die graf was.

column2: John 11:18 Now Bethany was nigh unto Jerusalem, about fifteen furlongs off:
column3: Johannes 11:18 En Betánië was naby Jerusalem, omtrent twee myl daarvandaan.

column2: John 11:19 And many of the Jews came to Martha and Mary, to comfort them concerning their brother.
column3: Johannes 11:19 En baie van die Jode het al by Martha en Maria gekom om hulle oor hul broer te troos.

column2: John 11:20 Then Martha, as soon as she heard that Jesus was coming, went and met him: but Mary sat [still] in the house.
column3: Johannes 11:20 En toe Martha hoor dat Jesus kom, het sy Hom tegemoetgegaan. Maar Maria het in die huis bly sit.

column2: John 11:21 Then said Martha unto Jesus, Lord, if thou hadst been here, my brother had not died.
column3: Johannes 11:21 En Martha sê vir Jesus: Here, as U hier gewees het, sou my broer nie gesterf het nie.

column2: John 11:22 But I know, that even now, whatsoever thou wilt ask of God, God will give [it] thee.
column3: Johannes 11:22 Maar selfs nou weet ek dat alles wat U van God vra, God U sal gee.

column2: John 11:23 Jesus saith unto her, Thy brother shall rise again.
column3: Johannes 11:23 Jesus sê vir haar: Jou broer sal opstaan.

column2: John 11:24 Martha saith unto him, I know that he shall rise again in the resurrection at the last day.
column3: Johannes 11:24 Martha antwoord Hom: Ek weet dat hy sal opstaan in die opstanding in die laaste dag.

column2: John 11:25 Jesus said unto her, I am the resurrection, and the life: he that believeth in me, though he were dead, yet shall he live:
column3: Johannes 11:25 Jesus sê vir haar: Ek is die opstanding en die lewe; wie in My glo, sal lewe al het hy ook gesterwe;

column2: John 11:26 And whosoever liveth and believeth in me shall never die. Believest thou this?
column3: Johannes 11:26 en elkeen wat lewe en in My glo, sal nooit sterwe tot in ewigheid nie. Glo jy dit?

column2: John 11:27 She saith unto him, Yea, Lord: I believe that thou art the Christ, the Son of God, which should come into the world.
column3: Johannes 11:27 Sy antwoord Hom: Ja, Here, ek glo dat U die Christus is, die Seun van God, wat in die wêreld sou kom.

column2: John 11:28 And when she had so said, she went her way, and called Mary her sister secretly, saying, The Master is come, and calleth for thee.
column3: Johannes 11:28 En nadat sy dit gesê het, gaan sy en roep Maria, haar suster, stilletjies en sê: Die Meester is hier en Hy roep jou.

column2: John 11:29 As soon as she heard [that], she arose quickly, and came unto him.
column3: Johannes 11:29 Sy het, toe sy dit hoor, vinnig opgestaan en na Hom toe gegaan.

column2: John 11:30 Now Jesus was not yet come into the town, but was in that place where Martha met him.
column3: Johannes 11:30 En Jesus het nog nie in die dorp gekom nie, maar was op die plek waar Martha Hom tegemoetgegaan het.

column2: John 11:31 The Jews then which were with her in the house, and comforted her, when they saw Mary, that she rose up hastily and went out, followed her, saying, She goeth unto the grave to weep there.
column3: Johannes 11:31 En toe die Jode wat by haar in die huis was en haar getroos het, sien dat Maria vinnig opstaan en uitgaan, het hulle haar gevolg en gesê: Sy gaan na die graf om daar te ween.

column2: John 11:32 Then when Mary was come where Jesus was, and saw him, she fell down at his feet, saying unto him, Lord, if thou hadst been here, my brother had not died.
column3: Johannes 11:32 En toe Maria kom waar Jesus was en Hom sien, val sy aan sy voete neer en sê vir Hom: Here, as U hier gewees het, sou my broer nie gesterf het nie.

column2: John 11:33 When Jesus therefore saw her weeping, and the Jews also weeping which came with her, he groaned in the spirit, and was troubled,
column3: Johannes 11:33 Toe Jesus haar dan sien ween en die Jode wat saam met haar gekom het, ook sien ween, het Hy geweldig bewoë geword in sy gees en Hom ontstel

column2: John 11:34 And said, Where have ye laid him? They said unto him, Lord, come and see.
column3: Johannes 11:34 en gesê: Waar het julle hom neergelê? Hulle sê vir Hom: Here, kom kyk.

column2: John 11:35 Jesus wept.
column3: Johannes 11:35 Jesus het geween.

column2: John 11:36 Then said the Jews, Behold how he loved him!
column3: Johannes 11:36 Die Jode sê toe: Kyk, hoe lief Hy hom gehad het!

column2: John 11:37 And some of them said, Could not this man, which opened the eyes of the blind, have caused that even this man should not have died?
column3: Johannes 11:37 En sommige van hulle sê: Kon Hy wat die oë van die blinde man geopen het, nie maak dat hierdie man ook nie gesterf het nie?

column2: John 11:38 Jesus therefore again groaning in himself cometh to the grave. It was a cave, and a stone lay upon it.
column3: Johannes 11:38 En Jesus het weer in Homself geweldig bewoë geword en by die graf gekom. En dit was ’n spelonk, en ’n steen het daarteen gelê.

column2: John 11:39 Jesus said, Take ye away the stone. Martha, the sister of him that was dead, saith unto him, Lord, by this time he stinketh: for he hath been [dead] four days.
column3: Johannes 11:39 Jesus sê: Neem die steen weg. Martha, die suster van die oorledene, sê vir Hom: Here, hy ruik al, want hy is al vier dae dood.

column2: John 11:40 Jesus saith unto her, Said I not unto thee, that, if thou wouldest believe, thou shouldest see the glory of God?
column3: Johannes 11:40 Jesus sê vir haar: Het Ek nie vir jou gesê, as jy glo, sal jy die heerlikheid van God sien nie?

column2: John 11:41 Then they took away the stone [from the place] where the dead was laid. And Jesus lifted up [his] eyes, and said, Father, I thank thee that thou hast heard me.
column3: Johannes 11:41 Hulle neem toe die steen weg waar die oorledene lê. En Jesus het sy oë opgeslaan en gesê: Vader, Ek dank U dat U My verhoor het;

column2: John 11:42 And I knew that thou hearest me always: but because of the people which stand by I said [it], that they may believe that thou hast sent me.
column3: Johannes 11:42 en Ek het geweet dat U My altyd verhoor, maar ter wille van die skare wat rondom staan, het Ek dit gesê, sodat hulle kan glo dat U My gestuur het.

column2: John 11:43 And when he thus had spoken, he cried with a loud voice, Lazarus, come forth.
column3: Johannes 11:43 En nadat Hy dit gesê het, het Hy met ’n groot stem geroep: Lasarus, kom uit!

column2: John 11:44 And he that was dead came forth, bound hand and foot with graveclothes: and his face was bound about with a napkin. Jesus saith unto them, Loose him, and let him go.
column3: Johannes 11:44 En die oorledene het uitgekom, aan hande en voete met grafdoeke gebind, en sy gesig was toegedraai met ’n doek. Jesus sê vir hulle: Maak hom los en laat hom gaan.

column2: John 11:45 Then many of the Jews which came to Mary, and had seen the things which Jesus did, believed on him.
column3: Johannes 11:45 EN baie van die Jode wat na Maria gekom het en aanskouers was van wat Jesus gedoen het, het in Hom geglo.

column2: John 11:46 But some of them went their ways to the Pharisees, and told them what things Jesus had done.
column3: Johannes 11:46 Maar sommige van hulle het na die Fariseërs gegaan en hulle vertel wat Jesus gedoen het.

column2: John 11:47 Then gathered the chief priests and the Pharisees a council, and said, What do we? for this man doeth many miracles.
column3: Johannes 11:47 En die owerpriesters en die Fariseërs het die Raad byeengeroep en gesê: Wat sal ons doen? — want hierdie man doen baie tekens.

column2: John 11:48 If we let him thus alone, all [men] will believe on him: and the Romans shall come and take away both our place and nation.
column3: Johannes 11:48 As ons Hom so laat begaan, sal almal in Hom glo; en die Romeine sal kom en ons land en ons nasie albei afneem.

column2: John 11:49 And one of them, [named] Caiaphas, being the high priest that same year, said unto them, Ye know nothing at all,
column3: Johannes 11:49 En een van hulle, Kájafas, wat daardie jaar hoëpriester was, sê vir hulle: Julle weet niks nie

column2: John 11:50 Nor consider that it is expedient for us, that one man should die for the people, and that the whole nation perish not.
column3: Johannes 11:50 en dink nie daaraan dat dit vir ons voordelig is dat een man vir die volk sterwe en nie die hele nasie omkom nie.

column2: John 11:51 And this spake he not of himself: but being high priest that year, he prophesied that Jesus should die for that nation;
column3: Johannes 11:51 En dit het hy nie uit homself gesê nie; maar omdat hy daardie jaar hoëpriester was, het hy geprofeteer dat Jesus vir die volk sou sterwe.

column2: John 11:52 And not for that nation only, but that also he should gather together in one the children of God that were scattered abroad.
column3: Johannes 11:52 En nie alleen vir die volk nie, maar ook om die verstrooide kinders van God tot ’n eenheid saam te voeg.

column2: John 11:53 Then from that day forth they took counsel together for to put him to death.
column3: Johannes 11:53 Van dié dag af het hulle toe saam beraadslaag om Hom om die lewe te bring.

column2: John 11:54 Jesus therefore walked no more openly among the Jews; but went thence unto a country near to the wilderness, into a city called Ephraim, and there continued with his disciples.
column3: Johannes 11:54 Daarom het Jesus nie meer in die openbaar onder die Jode gewandel nie, maar daarvandaan weggegaan na die streek naby die woestyn, na ’n stad met die naam van Efraim. En daar het Hy vertoef met sy dissipels.

column2: John 11:55 And the Jews' passover was nigh at hand: and many went out of the country up to Jerusalem before the passover, to purify themselves.
column3: Johannes 11:55 En die pasga van die Jode was naby; en baie het uit dié landstreek na Jerusalem opgegaan voor die pasga om hulle te reinig.

column2: John 11:56 Then sought they for Jesus, and spake among themselves, as they stood in the temple, What think ye, that he will not come to the feast?
column3: Johannes 11:56 En hulle het Jesus gesoek; en terwyl hulle in die tempel staan, sê hulle vir mekaar: Wat dink julle, sal Hy nie na die fees kom nie?

column2: John 11:57 Now both the chief priests and the Pharisees had given a commandment, that, if any man knew where he were, he should shew [it], that they might take him.
column3: Johannes 11:57 En die owerpriesters en die Fariseërs het ook ’n bevel gegee dat as iemand wis waar Hy was, hy dit moes bekend maak, sodat hulle Hom gevange kon neem.

column2: John 12:1 Then Jesus six days before the passover came to Bethany, where Lazarus was which had been dead, whom he raised from the dead.
column3: Johannes 12:1 EN Jesus het ses dae voor die pasga na Betánië gekom waar Lasarus was, wat dood gewees het en wat Hy uit die dode opgewek het.

column2: John 12:2 There they made him a supper; and Martha served: but Lazarus was one of them that sat at the table with him.
column3: Johannes 12:2 Hulle het toe vir Hom daar ’n maaltyd berei, en Martha het bedien; en Lasarus was een van die wat saam met Hom aan tafel was.

column2: John 12:3 Then took Mary a pound of ointment of spikenard, very costly, and anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped his feet with her hair: and the house was filled with the odour of the ointment.
column3: Johannes 12:3 En Maria het ’n pond egte, baie kosbare nardussalf geneem en die voete van Jesus gesalf en sy voete afgedroog met haar hare. En die huis is vervul met die reuk van die salf.

column2: John 12:4 Then saith one of his disciples, Judas Iscariot, Simon's [son], which should betray him,
column3: Johannes 12:4 Toe sê een van sy dissipels, Judas Iskáriot, die seun van Simon, wat Hom sou verraai:

column2: John 12:5 Why was not this ointment sold for three hundred pence, and given to the poor?
column3: Johannes 12:5 Waarom is hierdie salf nie vir driehonderd pennings verkoop en die geld aan die armes gegee nie?

column2: John 12:6 This he said, not that he cared for the poor; but because he was a thief, and had the bag, and bare what was put therein.
column3: Johannes 12:6 En dit het hy gesê, nie omdat hy oor die armes besorg was nie, maar omdat hy ’n dief was en die beurs gehad het en die bydraes geneem het.

column2: John 12:7 Then said Jesus, Let her alone: against the day of my burying hath she kept this.
column3: Johannes 12:7 Toe sê Jesus: Laat haar staan; sy het dit bewaar vir die dag van my begrafnis.

column2: John 12:8 For the poor always ye have with you; but me ye have not always.
column3: Johannes 12:8 Want die armes het julle altyd by julle, maar My het julle nie altyd nie.

column2: John 12:9 Much people of the Jews therefore knew that he was there: and they came not for Jesus' sake only, but that they might see Lazarus also, whom he had raised from the dead.
column3: Johannes 12:9 En ’n groot menigte uit die Jode het verneem dat Hy daar was, en het gekom, nie alleen ter wille van Jesus nie, maar ook om Lasarus te sien, wat Hy uit die dode opgewek het.

column2: John 12:10 But the chief priests consulted that they might put Lazarus also to death;
column3: Johannes 12:10 En die owerpriesters het besluit om Lasarus ook om die lewe te bring,

column2: John 12:11 Because that by reason of him many of the Jews went away, and believed on Jesus.
column3: Johannes 12:11 omdat baie van die Jode deur hom weggegaan en in Jesus geglo het.

column2: John 12:12 On the next day much people that were come to the feast, when they heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem,
column3: Johannes 12:12 DIE volgende dag het ’n groot menigte feesgangers, toe hulle hoor dat Jesus na Jerusalem kom,

column2: John 12:13 Took branches of palm trees, and went forth to meet him, and cried, Hosanna: Blessed [is] the King of Israel that cometh in the name of the Lord.
column3: Johannes 12:13 palmtakke geneem en uitgegaan Hom tegemoet en geroep: Hosanna! Geseënd is Hy wat kom in die Naam van die Here, die Koning van Israel.

column2: John 12:14 And Jesus, when he had found a young ass, sat thereon; as it is written,
column3: Johannes 12:14 En Jesus het ’n jong esel gevind en daarop gaan sit, soos geskrywe is:

column2: John 12:15 Fear not, daughter of Sion: behold, thy King cometh, sitting on an ass's colt.
column3: Johannes 12:15 Moenie vrees nie, dogter van Sion! Kyk, jou Koning kom en Hy sit op die vul van ’n esel.

column2: John 12:16 These things understood not his disciples at the first: but when Jesus was glorified, then remembered they that these things were written of him, and [that] they had done these things unto him.
column3: Johannes 12:16 Dit het sy dissipels egter eers nie verstaan nie; maar nadat Jesus verheerlik is, toe het dit hulle bygeval dat hierdie dinge van Hom geskrywe was en dat hulle dit aan Hom gedoen het.

column2: John 12:17 The people therefore that was with him when he called Lazarus out of his grave, and raised him from the dead, bare record.
column3: Johannes 12:17 En die skare wat by Hom was toe Hy Lasarus uit die graf geroep en hom uit die dode opgewek het, het daarvan getuig.

column2: John 12:18 For this cause the people also met him, for that they heard that he had done this miracle.
column3: Johannes 12:18 Daarom het die skare Hom ook tegemoetgegaan, omdat hulle gehoor het dat Hy hierdie teken gedoen het.

column2: John 12:19 The Pharisees therefore said among themselves, Perceive ye how ye prevail nothing? behold, the world is gone after him.
column3: Johannes 12:19 En die Fariseërs het vir mekaar gesê: Sien julle dat julle niks vorder nie? Kyk, die hele wêreld loop agter Hom aan.

column2: John 12:20 And there were certain Greeks among them that came up to worship at the feast:
column3: Johannes 12:20 EN daar was sommige Grieke onder die wat opgekom het om op die fees te aanbid;

column2: John 12:21 The same came therefore to Philip, which was of Bethsaida of Galilee, and desired him, saying, Sir, we would see Jesus.
column3: Johannes 12:21 hulle het na Filippus gegaan wat van Betsáida in Galiléa was, en hom gevra en gesê: My heer, ons wil Jesus graag sien.

column2: John 12:22 Philip cometh and telleth Andrew: and again Andrew and Philip tell Jesus.
column3: Johannes 12:22 Filippus kom en sê dit vir Andréas, en Andréas en Filippus vertel dit weer aan Jesus.

column2: John 12:23 And Jesus answered them, saying, The hour is come, that the Son of man should be glorified.
column3: Johannes 12:23 Maar Jesus antwoord hulle en sê: Die uur het gekom dat die Seun van die mens verheerlik moet word.

column2: John 12:24 Verily, verily, I say unto you, Except a corn of wheat fall into the ground and die, it abideth alone: but if it die, it bringeth forth much fruit.
column3: Johannes 12:24 Voorwaar, voorwaar Ek sê vir julle, as die koringkorrel nie in die grond val en sterf nie, bly dit alleen; maar as dit sterf, dra dit veel vrug.

column2: John 12:25 He that loveth his life shall lose it; and he that hateth his life in this world shall keep it unto life eternal.
column3: Johannes 12:25 Wie sy lewe liefhet, sal dit verloor; maar wie sy lewe haat in hierdie wêreld, sal dit bewaar vir die ewige lewe.

column2: John 12:26 If any man serve me, let him follow me; and where I am, there shall also my servant be: if any man serve me, him will [my] Father honour.
column3: Johannes 12:26 As iemand My dien, laat hom My volg; en waar Ek is, daar sal my dienaar ook wees; en as iemand My dien, sal die Vader hom eer.

column2: John 12:27 Now is my soul troubled; and what shall I say? Father, save me from this hour: but for this cause came I unto this hour.
column3: Johannes 12:27 Nou is my siel ontsteld, en wat sal Ek sê? Vader, red My uit hierdie uur? Maar hierom het Ek in hierdie uur gekom.

column2: John 12:28 Father, glorify thy name. Then came there a voice from heaven, [saying], I have both glorified [it], and will glorify [it] again.
column3: Johannes 12:28 Vader, verheerlik u Naam! Daar het toe ’n stem uit die hemel gekom: Ek hét dit verheerlik, en Ek sal dit weer verheerlik.

column2: John 12:29 The people therefore, that stood by, and heard [it], said that it thundered: others said, An angel spake to him.
column3: Johannes 12:29 En die skare wat daar gestaan en dit gehoor het, het gesê dat daar ’n donderslag gewees het. Ander het gesê: ’n Engel het met Hom gespreek.

column2: John 12:30 Jesus answered and said, This voice came not because of me, but for your sakes.
column3: Johannes 12:30 Jesus antwoord en sê: Hierdie stem het nie om My ontwil gekom nie, maar om julle ontwil.

column2: John 12:31 Now is the judgment of this world: now shall the prince of this world be cast out.
column3: Johannes 12:31 Nou is dit die oordeel van hierdie wêreld, nou sal die owerste van hierdie wêreld buitentoe gedryf word.

column2: John 12:32 And I, if I be lifted up from the earth, will draw all [men] unto me.
column3: Johannes 12:32 En Ek, as Ek van die aarde verhoog word, sal almal na My toe trek.

column2: John 12:33 This he said, signifying what death he should die.
column3: Johannes 12:33 En dit het Hy gesê om aan te dui hoedanige dood Hy sou sterwe.

column2: John 12:34 The people answered him, We have heard out of the law that Christ abideth for ever: and how sayest thou, The Son of man must be lifted up? who is this Son of man?
column3: Johannes 12:34 Die skare antwoord Hom: Ons het uit die wet gehoor dat die Christus tot in ewigheid bly; en hoe sê U dat die Seun van die mens verhoog moet word? Wie is hierdie Seun van die mens?

column2: John 12:35 Then Jesus said unto them, Yet a little while is the light with you. Walk while ye have the light, lest darkness come upon you: for he that walketh in darkness knoweth not whither he goeth.
column3: Johannes 12:35 En Jesus sê vir hulle: Nog ’n klein tydjie is die lig by julle. Wandel so lank as julle die lig het, sodat die duisternis julle nie oorval nie. En wie in die duisternis wandel, weet nie waar hy gaan nie.

column2: John 12:36 While ye have light, believe in the light, that ye may be the children of light. These things spake Jesus, and departed, and did hide himself from them.
column3: Johannes 12:36 So lank as julle die lig het, glo in die lig, sodat julle kinders van die lig kan word. Dit het Jesus gespreek, en Hy het weggegaan en Hom vir hulle verberg.

column2: John 12:37 But though he had done so many miracles before them, yet they believed not on him:
column3: Johannes 12:37 En alhoewel Hy so baie tekens voor hulle gedoen het, het hulle nie in Hom geglo nie;

column2: John 12:38 That the saying of Esaias the prophet might be fulfilled, which he spake, Lord, who hath believed our report? and to whom hath the arm of the Lord been revealed?
column3: Johannes 12:38 sodat die woord van die profeet Jesaja vervul sou word wat hy gesê het: Here, wie het ons prediking geglo, en aan wie is die arm van die Here geopenbaar?

column2: John 12:39 Therefore they could not believe, because that Esaias said again,
column3: Johannes 12:39 Daarom kon hulle nie glo nie, omdat Jesaja óók gesê het:

column2: John 12:40 He hath blinded their eyes, and hardened their heart; that they should not see with [their] eyes, nor understand with [their] heart, and be converted, and I should heal them.
column3: Johannes 12:40 Hy het hulle oë verblind en hulle hart verhard, sodat hulle nie met die oë sou sien en met die hart verstaan en hulle bekeer en Ek hulle genees nie.

column2: John 12:41 These things said Esaias, when he saw his glory, and spake of him.
column3: Johannes 12:41 Dit het Jesaja gesê toe hy sy heerlikheid gesien en van Hom gespreek het.

column2: John 12:42 Nevertheless among the chief rulers also many believed on him; but because of the Pharisees they did not confess [him], lest they should be put out of the synagogue:
column3: Johannes 12:42 Maar tog het selfs baie van die owerstes in Hom geglo; maar ter wille van die Fariseërs het hulle dit nie bely nie, om nie uit die sinagoge geban te word nie.

column2: John 12:43 For they loved the praise of men more than the praise of God.
column3: Johannes 12:43 Want hulle het die eer van die mense meer liefgehad as die eer van God.

column2: John 12:44 Jesus cried and said, He that believeth on me, believeth not on me, but on him that sent me.
column3: Johannes 12:44 En Jesus het uitgeroep en gesê: Wie in My glo, glo nie in My nie, maar in Hom wat My gestuur het.

column2: John 12:45 And he that seeth me seeth him that sent me.
column3: Johannes 12:45 En wie My aanskou, aanskou Hom wat My gestuur het.

column2: John 12:46 I am come a light into the world, that whosoever believeth on me should not abide in darkness.
column3: Johannes 12:46 Ek het as ’n lig in die wêreld gekom, sodat elkeen wat in My glo, nie in die duisternis sou bly nie.

column2: John 12:47 And if any man hear my words, and believe not, I judge him not: for I came not to judge the world, but to save the world.
column3: Johannes 12:47 En as iemand na my woorde luister en nie glo nie, Ek oordeel hom nie; want Ek het nie gekom om die wêreld te oordeel nie, maar om die wêreld te red.

column2: John 12:48 He that rejecteth me, and receiveth not my words, hath one that judgeth him: the word that I have spoken, the same shall judge him in the last day.
column3: Johannes 12:48 Wie My verwerp en my woorde nie aanneem nie, het een wat hom oordeel: die woord wat Ek gespreek het, dit sal hom oordeel in die laaste dag.

column2: John 12:49 For I have not spoken of myself; but the Father which sent me, he gave me a commandment, what I should say, and what I should speak.
column3: Johannes 12:49 Want Ek het nie uit Myself gespreek nie; maar die Vader wat My gestuur het, Hy het My ’n gebod gegee wat Ek moet sê en wat Ek moet spreek.

column2: John 12:50 And I know that his commandment is life everlasting: whatsoever I speak therefore, even as the Father said unto me, so I speak.
column3: Johannes 12:50 En Ek weet dat sy gebod die ewige lewe is. Wat Ek dan spreek — net soos die Vader vir My gesê het, so spreek Ek.

column2: John 13:1 Now before the feast of the passover, when Jesus knew that his hour was come that he should depart out of this world unto the Father, having loved his own which were in the world, he loved them unto the end.
column3: Johannes 13:1 EN voor die fees van die pasga het Jesus, omdat Hy wis dat sy uur gekom het dat Hy uit hierdie wêreld sou oorgaan na die Vader, en omdat Hy sy eie mense in die wêreld liefgehad het, hulle liefgehad tot die einde toe.

column2: John 13:2 And supper being ended, the devil having now put into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon's [son], to betray him;
column3: Johannes 13:2 En gedurende die maaltyd — die duiwel het dit al in die hart van Judas Iskáriot, die seun van Simon, ingegee om Hom te verraai —

column2: John 13:3 Jesus knowing that the Father had given all things into his hands, and that he was come from God, and went to God;
column3: Johannes 13:3 het Jesus, omdat Hy wis dat die Vader alles in sy hande gegee het en dat Hy van God uitgegaan het en na God heengaan,
