column2: Acts 7:60 And he kneeled down, and cried with a loud voice, Lord, lay not this sin to their charge. And when he had said this, he fell asleep.
column3: Handelinge 7:60 En hy het op sy knieë neergeval en met ’n groot stem uitgeroep: Here, reken hulle hierdie sonde nie toe nie! En met dié woorde het hy ontslaap.

column2: Acts 8:1 And Saul was consenting unto his death. And at that time there was a great persecution against the church which was at Jerusalem; and they were all scattered abroad throughout the regions of Judaea and Samaria, except the apostles.
column3: Handelinge 8:1 EN Saulus het ook sy vermoording goedgekeur. En daar het in dié tyd ’n groot vervolging teen die gemeente in Jerusalem ontstaan, en almal is verstrooi oor die streke van Judéa en Samaría, behalwe die apostels.

column2: Acts 8:2 And devout men carried Stephen [to his burial], and made great lamentation over him.
column3: Handelinge 8:2 En godvresende manne het Stéfanus begrawe en ’n groot rou oor hom bedrywe.

column2: Acts 8:3 As for Saul, he made havock of the church, entering into every house, and haling men and women committed [them] to prison.
column3: Handelinge 8:3 Maar Saulus het die gemeente verwoes en in die huise gegaan en manne en vroue uitgesleep en in die gevangenis oorgelewer.

column2: Acts 8:4 Therefore they that were scattered abroad went every where preaching the word.
column3: Handelinge 8:4 En die wat verstrooi was, het die land deurgegaan en die woord van die evangelie verkondig.

column2: Acts 8:5 Then Philip went down to the city of Samaria, and preached Christ unto them.
column3: Handelinge 8:5 En Filippus het afgekom in ’n stad van Samaría en Christus aan hulle verkondig.

column2: Acts 8:6 And the people with one accord gave heed unto those things which Philip spake, hearing and seeing the miracles which he did.
column3: Handelinge 8:6 En die skare het eendragtig ag gegee op die woorde van Filippus toe hulle dit hoor en die tekens sien wat hy doen.

column2: Acts 8:7 For unclean spirits, crying with loud voice, came out of many that were possessed [with them]: and many taken with palsies, and that were lame, were healed.
column3: Handelinge 8:7 Want uit baie van die wat onreine geeste gehad het, het die geeste uitgegaan terwyl hulle met ’n groot stem skreeu; en baie wat lam en kreupel was, het gesond geword.

column2: Acts 8:8 And there was great joy in that city.
column3: Handelinge 8:8 En daar was groot blydskap in daardie stad.

column2: Acts 8:9 But there was a certain man, called Simon, which beforetime in the same city used sorcery, and bewitched the people of Samaria, giving out that himself was some great one:
column3: Handelinge 8:9 En ’n sekere man met die naam van Simon het vantevore in die stad met towery omgegaan en die bevolking van Samaría verbyster deur te sê dat hy iets besonders was.

column2: Acts 8:10 To whom they all gave heed, from the least to the greatest, saying, This man is the great power of God.
column3: Handelinge 8:10 En almal, klein en groot, het hom aangehang en gesê: Hy is die groot krag van God.

column2: Acts 8:11 And to him they had regard, because that of long time he had bewitched them with sorceries.
column3: Handelinge 8:11 En hulle het hom aangehang, omdat hy hulle ’n geruime tyd deur sy towerye verbyster het.

column2: Acts 8:12 But when they believed Philip preaching the things concerning the kingdom of God, and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.
column3: Handelinge 8:12 Maar toe hulle Filippus geglo het, wat die evangelie aangaande die koninkryk van God en die Naam van Jesus Christus verkondig het, is hulle gedoop, manne sowel as vroue.

column2: Acts 8:13 Then Simon himself believed also: and when he was baptized, he continued with Philip, and wondered, beholding the miracles and signs which were done.
column3: Handelinge 8:13 En Simon het ook self gelowig geword, en nadat hy gedoop was, gedurig by Filippus gebly; en hy was verbaas toe hy die tekens en groot kragte sien gebeur.

column2: Acts 8:14 Now when the apostles which were at Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent unto them Peter and John:
column3: Handelinge 8:14 En toe die apostels in Jerusalem hoor dat Samaría die woord van God aangeneem het, het hulle Petrus en Johannes na hulle gestuur.

column2: Acts 8:15 Who, when they were come down, prayed for them, that they might receive the Holy Ghost:
column3: Handelinge 8:15 Húlle het afgekom en vir hulle gebid, dat hulle die Heilige Gees mag ontvang,

column2: Acts 8:16 (For as yet he was fallen upon none of them: only they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.)
column3: Handelinge 8:16 want Hy het toe nog op niemand van hulle geval nie, maar hulle was net gedoop in die Naam van die Here Jesus.

column2: Acts 8:17 Then laid they [their] hands on them, and they received the Holy Ghost.
column3: Handelinge 8:17 Hulle het hul toe die hande opgelê, en hulle het die Heilige Gees ontvang.

column2: Acts 8:18 And when Simon saw that through laying on of the apostles' hands the Holy Ghost was given, he offered them money,
column3: Handelinge 8:18 En toe Simon sien dat deur die handoplegging van die apostels die Heilige Gees gegee word, het hy hulle geld aangebied

column2: Acts 8:19 Saying, Give me also this power, that on whomsoever I lay hands, he may receive the Holy Ghost.
column3: Handelinge 8:19 en gesê: Gee aan my ook hierdie mag, sodat elkeen wat ek die hande oplê, die Heilige Gees kan ontvang.

column2: Acts 8:20 But Peter said unto him, Thy money perish with thee, because thou hast thought that the gift of God may be purchased with money.
column3: Handelinge 8:20 Maar Petrus sê vir hom: Mag jou geld saam met jou vergaan, omdat jy gedink het om die gawe van God deur geld te verkry.

column2: Acts 8:21 Thou hast neither part nor lot in this matter: for thy heart is not right in the sight of God.
column3: Handelinge 8:21 Jy het geen deel of lot in hierdie saak nie, want jou hart is nie reg voor God nie.

column2: Acts 8:22 Repent therefore of this thy wickedness, and pray God, if perhaps the thought of thine heart may be forgiven thee.
column3: Handelinge 8:22 Bekeer jou dan van hierdie boosheid van jou, en bid God of die gedagte van jou hart jou miskien vergewe mag word.

column2: Acts 8:23 For I perceive that thou art in the gall of bitterness, and [in] the bond of iniquity.
column3: Handelinge 8:23 Want ek sien dat jy in ’n gal van bitterheid en bande van ongeregtigheid is.

column2: Acts 8:24 Then answered Simon, and said, Pray ye to the Lord for me, that none of these things which ye have spoken come upon me.
column3: Handelinge 8:24 Maar Simon het geantwoord en gesê: Bid julle tot die Here vir my, sodat niks van wat julle gesê het, oor my mag kom nie.

column2: Acts 8:25 And they, when they had testified and preached the word of the Lord, returned to Jerusalem, and preached the gospel in many villages of the Samaritans.
column3: Handelinge 8:25 Nadat hulle dan kragtig getuig en die woord van die Here gespreek het, het hulle na Jerusalem teruggegaan en die evangelie aan baie dorpe van die Samaritane verkondig.

column2: Acts 8:26 And the angel of the Lord spake unto Philip, saying, Arise, and go toward the south unto the way that goeth down from Jerusalem unto Gaza, which is desert.
column3: Handelinge 8:26 EN ’n engel van die Here het met Filippus gespreek en gesê: Staan op en gaan na die suide op die pad wat afloop van Jerusalem na Gasa. Dit is ’n eensame pad.

column2: Acts 8:27 And he arose and went: and, behold, a man of Ethiopia, an eunuch of great authority under Candace queen of the Ethiopians, who had the charge of all her treasure, and had come to Jerusalem for to worship,
column3: Handelinge 8:27 Toe het hy opgestaan en gegaan. En daar was ’n man van Ethiópië, ’n hofdienaar, ’n staatsamptenaar van Kandacé, die koningin van die Ethiópiërs, wat oor al haar skatte was en na Jerusalem gekom het om te aanbid.

column2: Acts 8:28 Was returning, and sitting in his chariot read Esaias the prophet.
column3: Handelinge 8:28 En hy was op die terugreis en het op sy wa gesit en die profeet Jesaja gelees.

column2: Acts 8:29 Then the Spirit said unto Philip, Go near, and join thyself to this chariot.
column3: Handelinge 8:29 Toe sê die Gees vir Filippus: Gaan daarheen en bly by daardie wa.

column2: Acts 8:30 And Philip ran thither to [him], and heard him read the prophet Esaias, and said, Understandest thou what thou readest?
column3: Handelinge 8:30 En Filippus het daarheen gehardloop en hom die profeet Jesaja hoor lees; en hy sê: Verstaan u wel wat u lees?

column2: Acts 8:31 And he said, How can I, except some man should guide me? And he desired Philip that he would come up and sit with him.
column3: Handelinge 8:31 En hy antwoord: Hoe kan ek tog as niemand my die weg wys nie? Toe vra hy Filippus om op te klim en by hom te kom sit.

column2: Acts 8:32 The place of the scripture which he read was this, He was led as a sheep to the slaughter; and like a lamb dumb before his shearer, so opened he not his mouth:
column3: Handelinge 8:32 En die gedeelte van die Skrif wat hy besig was om te lees, was dít: Soos ’n skaap is Hy gelei om geslag te word, en soos ’n lam wat stom is voor die een wat hom skeer, so maak Hy sy mond nie oop nie.

column2: Acts 8:33 In his humiliation his judgment was taken away: and who shall declare his generation? for his life is taken from the earth.
column3: Handelinge 8:33 In sy vernedering is sy oordeel weggeneem, en wie sal sy geslag beskrywe? Want sy lewe word van die aarde weggeneem.

column2: Acts 8:34 And the eunuch answered Philip, and said, I pray thee, of whom speaketh the prophet this? of himself, or of some other man?
column3: Handelinge 8:34 En die hofdienaar antwoord en sê vir Filippus: Ek bid u, van wie sê die profeet dit, van homself of van iemand anders?

column2: Acts 8:35 Then Philip opened his mouth, and began at the same scripture, and preached unto him Jesus.
column3: Handelinge 8:35 En Filippus het sy mond geopen en van hierdie Skrif af begin en die evangelie van Jesus aan hom verkondig.

column2: Acts 8:36 And as they went on [their] way, they came unto a certain water: and the eunuch said, See, [here is] water; what doth hinder me to be baptized?
column3: Handelinge 8:36 En terwyl hulle voortreis op die pad, kom hulle by water; en die hofdienaar sê vir hom: Daar is water; wat verhinder my om gedoop te word?

column2: Acts 8:37 And Philip said, If thou believest with all thine heart, thou mayest. And he answered and said, I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God.
column3: Handelinge 8:37 Toe sê Filippus: As u glo met u hele hart, is dit geoorloof. En hy antwoord en sê: Ek glo dat Jesus Christus die Seun van God is.

column2: Acts 8:38 And he commanded the chariot to stand still: and they went down both into the water, both Philip and the eunuch; and he baptized him.
column3: Handelinge 8:38 En hy het beveel dat die wa moes stilhou; en hulle het altwee in die water afgeklim, Filippus en die hofdienaar; en hy het hom gedoop.

column2: Acts 8:39 And when they were come up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord caught away Philip, that the eunuch saw him no more: and he went on his way rejoicing.
column3: Handelinge 8:39 En toe hulle uit die water opklim, het die Gees van die Here Filippus skielik weggevoer, en die hofdienaar het hom nie meer gesien nie, want hy het sy weg met blydskap gereis.

column2: Acts 8:40 But Philip was found at Azotus: and passing through he preached in all the cities, till he came to Caesarea.
column3: Handelinge 8:40 Maar Filippus is in Asdod gevind. En hy het die land deurgegaan en die evangelie verkondig in al die stede, totdat hy in Cesaréa gekom het.

column2: Acts 9:1 And Saul, yet breathing out threatenings and slaughter against the disciples of the Lord, went unto the high priest,
column3: Handelinge 9:1 MAAR Saulus, wat nog dreiging en moord geblaas het teen die dissipels van die Here, het na die hoëpriester gegaan

column2: Acts 9:2 And desired of him letters to Damascus to the synagogues, that if he found any of this way, whether they were men or women, he might bring them bound unto Jerusalem.
column3: Handelinge 9:2 en van hom briewe gevra aan die sinagoges in Damaskus, sodat as hy mense sou vind wat van die Weg was, manne sowel as vroue, hy hulle geboeid na Jerusalem kon bring.

column2: Acts 9:3 And as he journeyed, he came near Damascus: and suddenly there shined round about him a light from heaven:
column3: Handelinge 9:3 En toe hy op sy reis naby Damaskus kom, omstraal hom skielik ’n lig van die hemel af;

column2: Acts 9:4 And he fell to the earth, and heard a voice saying unto him, Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me?
column3: Handelinge 9:4 en hy val op die grond en hoor ’n stem vir hom sê: Saul, Saul, waarom vervolg jy My?

column2: Acts 9:5 And he said, Who art thou, Lord? And the Lord said, I am Jesus whom thou persecutest: [it is] hard for thee to kick against the pricks.
column3: Handelinge 9:5 En hy sê: Wie is U, Here? En die Here antwoord: Ek is Jesus wat jy vervolg. Dit is hard vir jou om teen die prikkels te skop.

column2: Acts 9:6 And he trembling and astonished said, Lord, what wilt thou have me to do? And the Lord [said] unto him, Arise, and go into the city, and it shall be told thee what thou must do.
column3: Handelinge 9:6 En terwyl hy bewe en verbaas was, sê hy: Here, wat wil U hê moet ek doen? En die Here antwoord hom: Staan op en gaan na die stad, en dit sal jou gesê word wat jy moet doen.

column2: Acts 9:7 And the men which journeyed with him stood speechless, hearing a voice, but seeing no man.
column3: Handelinge 9:7 En die manne wat saam met hom op pad was, het sprakeloos gestaan terwyl hulle wel die stem hoor, maar niemand sien nie.

column2: Acts 9:8 And Saul arose from the earth; and when his eyes were opened, he saw no man: but they led him by the hand, and brought [him] into Damascus.
column3: Handelinge 9:8 Toe staan Saulus van die grond af op, en alhoewel sy oë oop was, het hy niemand gesien nie; en hulle het hom aan die hand gelei en in Damaskus ingebring.

column2: Acts 9:9 And he was three days without sight, and neither did eat nor drink.
column3: Handelinge 9:9 En drie dae lank het hy niks gesien nie, en niks geëet of gedrink nie.

column2: Acts 9:10 And there was a certain disciple at Damascus, named Ananias; and to him said the Lord in a vision, Ananias. And he said, Behold, I [am here], Lord.
column3: Handelinge 9:10 En daar was ’n dissipel in Damaskus met die naam van Ananías; en die Here het vir hom in ’n gesig gesê: Ananías! En hy antwoord: Hier is ek, Here.

column2: Acts 9:11 And the Lord [said] unto him, Arise, and go into the street which is called Straight, and enquire in the house of Judas for [one] called Saul, of Tarsus: for, behold, he prayeth,
column3: Handelinge 9:11 Toe sê die Here vir hom: Staan op en gaan na die straat wat genoem word Reguitstraat, en vra in die huis van Judas na ’n man met die naam van Saulus van Tarsus, want kyk, hy bid;

column2: Acts 9:12 And hath seen in a vision a man named Ananias coming in, and putting [his] hand on him, that he might receive his sight.
column3: Handelinge 9:12 en hy het in ’n gesig ’n man met die naam van Ananías sien inkom en hom die hande oplê, sodat hy weer kon sien.

column2: Acts 9:13 Then Ananias answered, Lord, I have heard by many of this man, how much evil he hath done to thy saints at Jerusalem:
column3: Handelinge 9:13 Maar Ananías antwoord: Here, ek het van baie mense aangaande hierdie man gehoor hoeveel kwaad hy u heiliges in Jerusalem aangedoen het;

column2: Acts 9:14 And here he hath authority from the chief priests to bind all that call on thy name.
column3: Handelinge 9:14 en hy het hier volmag van die owerpriesters om almal te boei wat u Naam aanroep.

column2: Acts 9:15 But the Lord said unto him, Go thy way: for he is a chosen vessel unto me, to bear my name before the Gentiles, and kings, and the children of Israel:
column3: Handelinge 9:15 Maar die Here sê vir hom: Gaan, want hy is vir My ’n uitverkore werktuig om my Naam te dra voor nasies en konings en die kinders van Israel.

column2: Acts 9:16 For I will shew him how great things he must suffer for my name's sake.
column3: Handelinge 9:16 Want Ek sal hom toon hoeveel hy vir my Naam moet ly.

column2: Acts 9:17 And Ananias went his way, and entered into the house; and putting his hands on him said, Brother Saul, the Lord, [even] Jesus, that appeared unto thee in the way as thou camest, hath sent me, that thou mightest receive thy sight, and be filled with the Holy Ghost.
column3: Handelinge 9:17 En Ananías het gegaan en in die huis gekom en hom die hande opgelê en gesê: Saul, broeder, die Here het my gestuur, naamlik Jesus wat aan jou verskyn het op die pad waarmee jy gekom het, sodat jy weer kan sien en met die Heilige Gees vervul word.

column2: Acts 9:18 And immediately there fell from his eyes as it had been scales: and he received sight forthwith, and arose, and was baptized.
column3: Handelinge 9:18 En dadelik het daar iets soos skille van sy oë afgeval, en hy kon onmiddellik weer sien; en hy het opgestaan en is gedoop.

column2: Acts 9:19 And when he had received meat, he was strengthened. Then was Saul certain days with the disciples which were at Damascus.
column3: Handelinge 9:19 En nadat hy voedsel gebruik het, het hy weer sterk geword. En Saulus was ’n paar dae saam met die dissipels in Damaskus.

column2: Acts 9:20 And straightway he preached Christ in the synagogues, that he is the Son of God.
column3: Handelinge 9:20 EN hy het dadelik Christus in die sinagoges verkondig, dat Hy die Seun van God is.

column2: Acts 9:21 But all that heard [him] were amazed, and said; Is not this he that destroyed them which called on this name in Jerusalem, and came hither for that intent, that he might bring them bound unto the chief priests?
column3: Handelinge 9:21 En almal wat hom gehoor het, was verbaas en het gesê: Is hý nie die man wat in Jerusalem uitgeroei het die wat hierdie Naam aanroep, en hier gekom het met die doel om hulle geboeid na die owerpriesters te bring nie?

column2: Acts 9:22 But Saul increased the more in strength, and confounded the Jews which dwelt at Damascus, proving that this is very Christ.
column3: Handelinge 9:22 Maar Saulus het al meer krag ontvang en die Jode wat in Damaskus woon, in die war gebring deur te bewys dat Hy, Jesus, die Christus is.

column2: Acts 9:23 And after that many days were fulfilled, the Jews took counsel to kill him:
column3: Handelinge 9:23 En ná geruime tyd het die Jode beraadslaag om hom om te bring.

column2: Acts 9:24 But their laying await was known of Saul. And they watched the gates day and night to kill him.
column3: Handelinge 9:24 En hulle plan het aan Saulus bekend geword. En hulle het die poorte dag en nag bewaak, dat hulle hom kon ombring;

column2: Acts 9:25 Then the disciples took him by night, and let [him] down by the wall in a basket.
column3: Handelinge 9:25 maar die dissipels het hom geneem en in die nag deur die muur neergelaat deur hom in ’n mandjie te laat afsak.

column2: Acts 9:26 And when Saul was come to Jerusalem, he assayed to join himself to the disciples: but they were all afraid of him, and believed not that he was a disciple.
column3: Handelinge 9:26 En toe Saulus in Jerusalem aankom, het hy probeer om by die dissipels aan te sluit; maar almal was vir hom bang, omdat hulle nie geglo het dat hy ’n dissipel was nie.

column2: Acts 9:27 But Barnabas took him, and brought [him] to the apostles, and declared unto them how he had seen the Lord in the way, and that he had spoken to him, and how he had preached boldly at Damascus in the name of Jesus.
column3: Handelinge 9:27 Maar Bárnabas het hom geneem en na die apostels gebring en hulle vertel hoe hy op die pad die Here gesien het en dat Hy met hom gespreek het, en hoe hy in Damaskus vrymoediglik in die Naam van Jesus gespreek het.

column2: Acts 9:28 And he was with them coming in and going out at Jerusalem.
column3: Handelinge 9:28 En hy het saam met hulle in- en uitgegaan in Jerusalem

column2: Acts 9:29 And he spake boldly in the name of the Lord Jesus, and disputed against the Grecians: but they went about to slay him.
column3: Handelinge 9:29 en vrymoediglik gespreek in die Naam van die Here Jesus, en ook met die Griekssprekende Jode gepraat en geredetwis, maar hulle het probeer om hom dood te maak.

column2: Acts 9:30 [Which] when the brethren knew, they brought him down to Caesarea, and sent him forth to Tarsus.
column3: Handelinge 9:30 En toe die broeders dit agterkom, het hulle hom na Cesaréa afgebring en hom na Tarsus weggestuur.

column2: Acts 9:31 Then had the churches rest throughout all Judaea and Galilee and Samaria, and were edified; and walking in the fear of the Lord, and in the comfort of the Holy Ghost, were multiplied.
column3: Handelinge 9:31 En die gemeentes deur die hele Judéa en Galiléa en Samaría het vrede gehad; en terwyl hulle opgebou is en gewandel het in die vrees van die Here en die vertroosting van die Heilige Gees, het hulle vermeerder.

column2: Acts 9:32 And it came to pass, as Peter passed throughout all [quarters], he came down also to the saints which dwelt at Lydda.
column3: Handelinge 9:32 EN onderwyl Petrus oral rondgaan, het hy ook gekom by die heiliges wat in Lidda woon;

column2: Acts 9:33 And there he found a certain man named Aeneas, which had kept his bed eight years, and was sick of the palsy.
column3: Handelinge 9:33 en hy het daar ’n man gevind met die naam van Enéas, wat al agt jaar bedlêend en verlam was.

column2: Acts 9:34 And Peter said unto him, Aeneas, Jesus Christ maketh thee whole: arise, and make thy bed. And he arose immediately.
column3: Handelinge 9:34 En Petrus sê vir hom: Enéas, Jesus Christus maak jou gesond; staan op en maak jou bed op! En hy het dadelik opgestaan.

column2: Acts 9:35 And all that dwelt at Lydda and Saron saw him, and turned to the Lord.
column3: Handelinge 9:35 En al die inwoners van Lidda en Saron het hom gesien en hulle tot die Here bekeer.

column2: Acts 9:36 Now there was at Joppa a certain disciple named Tabitha, which by interpretation is called Dorcas: this woman was full of good works and almsdeeds which she did.
column3: Handelinge 9:36 En in Joppe was daar ’n sekere dissipelin met die naam van Tabíta, wat, as dit vertaal word, beteken Dorkas. Sy was oorvloedig in goeie werke en aalmoese wat sy gedoen het.

column2: Acts 9:37 And it came to pass in those days, that she was sick, and died: whom when they had washed, they laid [her] in an upper chamber.
column3: Handelinge 9:37 En in dié dae het sy siek geword en gesterwe, en hulle het haar gewas en in ’n bovertrek neergelê.

column2: Acts 9:38 And forasmuch as Lydda was nigh to Joppa, and the disciples had heard that Peter was there, they sent unto him two men, desiring [him] that he would not delay to come to them.
column3: Handelinge 9:38 En omdat Lidda naby Joppe was en die dissipels gehoor het dat Petrus daar was, het hulle twee manne na hom gestuur wat hom moes smeek dat hy sonder uitstel na hulle moet oorkom.

column2: Acts 9:39 Then Peter arose and went with them. When he was come, they brought him into the upper chamber: and all the widows stood by him weeping, and shewing the coats and garments which Dorcas made, while she was with them.
column3: Handelinge 9:39 En Petrus het opgestaan en saam met hulle gegaan. En toe hy daar kom, bring hulle hom in die bovertrek; en al die weduwees kom by hom staan en ween en wys hom die onder- en bo-klere wat Dorkas alles gemaak het toe sy nog by hulle was.

column2: Acts 9:40 But Peter put them all forth, and kneeled down, and prayed; and turning [him] to the body said, Tabitha, arise. And she opened her eyes: and when she saw Peter, she sat up.
column3: Handelinge 9:40 En Petrus het almal buitentoe gestuur en neergekniel en gebid. En hy het hom na die liggaam gedraai en gesê: Tabíta, staan op! En sy het haar oë oopgemaak; en toe sy Petrus sien, het sy regop gesit.

column2: Acts 9:41 And he gave her [his] hand, and lifted her up, and when he had called the saints and widows, presented her alive.
column3: Handelinge 9:41 En hy gee haar sy hand en laat haar opstaan. Daarop roep hy die heiliges en die weduwees en stel haar lewendig voor hulle.

column2: Acts 9:42 And it was known throughout all Joppa; and many believed in the Lord.
column3: Handelinge 9:42 En dit het bekend geword in die hele Joppe, en baie het in die Here geglo.

column2: Acts 9:43 And it came to pass, that he tarried many days in Joppa with one Simon a tanner.
column3: Handelinge 9:43 En hy het ’n geruime tyd in Joppe gebly by ’n sekere Simon, ’n leerlooier.

column2: Acts 10:1 There was a certain man in Caesarea called Cornelius, a centurion of the band called the Italian [band],
column3: Handelinge 10:1 EN daar was in Cesaréa ’n man met die naam van Cornelius, ’n hoofman oor honderd van die sogenaamde Italiaanse leërafdeling.

column2: Acts 10:2 [A] devout [man], and one that feared God with all his house, which gave much alms to the people, and prayed to God alway.
column3: Handelinge 10:2 Hy met sy hele huis was vroom en godvresend en het baie aalmoese aan die volk gegee en was altyddeur in die gebed tot God.

column2: Acts 10:3 He saw in a vision evidently about the ninth hour of the day an angel of God coming in to him, and saying unto him, Cornelius.
column3: Handelinge 10:3 Hy het duidelik in ’n gesig omtrent die negende uur van die dag ’n engel van God na hom sien inkom en vir hom sê: Cornelius!

column2: Acts 10:4 And when he looked on him, he was afraid, and said, What is it, Lord? And he said unto him, Thy prayers and thine alms are come up for a memorial before God.
column3: Handelinge 10:4 En hy het die oë op hom gehou en vol vrees gesê: Wat is dit, my heer? Toe antwoord hy hom: Jou gebede en jou aalmoese het voor God in gedagtenis gekom.

column2: Acts 10:5 And now send men to Joppa, and call for [one] Simon, whose surname is Peter:
column3: Handelinge 10:5 Stuur dan nou manne na Joppe en laat vir Simon haal wat ook Petrus genoem word.

column2: Acts 10:6 He lodgeth with one Simon a tanner, whose house is by the sea side: he shall tell thee what thou oughtest to do.
column3: Handelinge 10:6 Hy is tuis by ’n sekere Simon, ’n leerlooier, wie se huis by die see is. Hy sal jou sê wat jy moet doen.

column2: Acts 10:7 And when the angel which spake unto Cornelius was departed, he called two of his household servants, and a devout soldier of them that waited on him continually;
column3: Handelinge 10:7 En toe die engel wat met Cornelius gespreek het, weg was, roep hy twee van sy huisbediendes en ’n vroom soldaat van die wat altyd by hom was,

column2: Acts 10:8 And when he had declared all [these] things unto them, he sent them to Joppa.
column3: Handelinge 10:8 en vertel hulle alles en stuur hulle na Joppe.

column2: Acts 10:9 On the morrow, as they went on their journey, and drew nigh unto the city, Peter went up upon the housetop to pray about the sixth hour:
column3: Handelinge 10:9 En die volgende dag, terwyl hulle op pad was en naby die stad kom, het Petrus omtrent die sesde uur op die dak geklim om te bid;

column2: Acts 10:10 And he became very hungry, and would have eaten: but while they made ready, he fell into a trance,
column3: Handelinge 10:10 en hy het baie honger geword en wou eet; en terwyl hulle besig was om klaar te maak, het daar ’n verrukking van sinne oor hom gekom:

column2: Acts 10:11 And saw heaven opened, and a certain vessel descending unto him, as it had been a great sheet knit at the four corners, and let down to the earth:
column3: Handelinge 10:11 hy sien die hemel geopend en ’n voorwerp soos ’n groot laken na hom afdaal, wat aan die vier hoeke vasgebind is en op die aarde neergelaat word.

column2: Acts 10:12 Wherein were all manner of fourfooted beasts of the earth, and wild beasts, and creeping things, and fowls of the air.
column3: Handelinge 10:12 Daarin was al die viervoetige diere van die aarde en die wilde en kruipende diere en die voëls van die hemel.

column2: Acts 10:13 And there came a voice to him, Rise, Peter; kill, and eat.
column3: Handelinge 10:13 Toe kom daar ’n stem na hom: Staan op, Petrus, slag en eet!

column2: Acts 10:14 But Peter said, Not so, Lord; for I have never eaten any thing that is common or unclean.
column3: Handelinge 10:14 En Petrus sê: Nooit nie, Here, want ek het nooit iets onheiligs of onreins geëet nie.

column2: Acts 10:15 And the voice [spake] unto him again the second time, What God hath cleansed, [that] call not thou common.
column3: Handelinge 10:15 En weer het die stem vir die tweede keer na hom gekom: Wat God rein gemaak het, mag jy nie onheilig ag nie.

column2: Acts 10:16 This was done thrice: and the vessel was received up again into heaven.
column3: Handelinge 10:16 En dit het drie maal gebeur, en die voorwerp is weer in die hemel opgeneem.

column2: Acts 10:17 Now while Peter doubted in himself what this vision which he had seen should mean, behold, the men which were sent from Cornelius had made enquiry for Simon's house, and stood before the gate,
column3: Handelinge 10:17 En terwyl Petrus by homself daaroor verleë was wat die gesig tog kon beteken wat hy gesien het, staan die manne wat deur Cornelius gestuur was, daar by die poort en verneem na die huis van Simon.

column2: Acts 10:18 And called, and asked whether Simon, which was surnamed Peter, were lodged there.
column3: Handelinge 10:18 En hulle roep en vra of Simon, wat ook Petrus genoem word, daar tuis is.

column2: Acts 10:19 While Peter thought on the vision, the Spirit said unto him, Behold, three men seek thee.
column3: Handelinge 10:19 En terwyl Petrus nadink oor die gesig, sê die Gees vir hom: Daar is drie manne wat jou soek.

column2: Acts 10:20 Arise therefore, and get thee down, and go with them, doubting nothing: for I have sent them.
column3: Handelinge 10:20 Staan dan op, klim af en gaan saam met hulle sonder om te twyfel, want Ek het hulle gestuur.

column2: Acts 10:21 Then Peter went down to the men which were sent unto him from Cornelius; and said, Behold, I am he whom ye seek: what [is] the cause wherefore ye are come?
column3: Handelinge 10:21 En Petrus het afgeklim na die manne wat deur Cornelius na hom gestuur was, en gesê: Kyk, dit is ek wat julle soek. Wat is die rede waarom julle hier is?

column2: Acts 10:22 And they said, Cornelius the centurion, a just man, and one that feareth God, and of good report among all the nation of the Jews, was warned from God by an holy angel to send for thee into his house, and to hear words of thee.
column3: Handelinge 10:22 En hulle sê: Cornelius, ’n hoofman oor honderd, ’n regverdige en godvresende man, wat ’n goeie naam het by die hele Joodse nasie, het ’n goddelike openbaring ontvang deur ’n heilige engel, om u te laat haal na sy huis om te hoor wat u sal sê.

column2: Acts 10:23 Then called he them in, and lodged [them]. And on the morrow Peter went away with them, and certain brethren from Joppa accompanied him.
column3: Handelinge 10:23 En hy het hulle binnegenooi en geherberg. En die volgende dag het Petrus saam met hulle afgereis, en enkele van die broeders uit Joppe het met hom saamgegaan.

column2: Acts 10:24 And the morrow after they entered into Caesarea. And Cornelius waited for them, and had called together his kinsmen and near friends.
column3: Handelinge 10:24 Die dag daarop het hulle in Cesaréa aangekom. En Cornelius was hulle te wagte, en hy het alreeds sy familie en besondere vriende bymekaargeroep.

column2: Acts 10:25 And as Peter was coming in, Cornelius met him, and fell down at his feet, and worshipped [him].
column3: Handelinge 10:25 Toe Petrus dan binnekom, het Cornelius hom tegemoetgegaan en aan sy voete neergeval en hom hulde bewys.

column2: Acts 10:26 But Peter took him up, saying, Stand up; I myself also am a man.
column3: Handelinge 10:26 Maar Petrus het hom opgerig en gesê: Staan op, ek is self ook maar ’n mens.

column2: Acts 10:27 And as he talked with him, he went in, and found many that were come together.
column3: Handelinge 10:27 En onderwyl hy met hom spreek, gaan hy binne en vind baie wat vergader het;

column2: Acts 10:28 And he said unto them, Ye know how that it is an unlawful thing for a man that is a Jew to keep company, or come unto one of another nation; but God hath shewed me that I should not call any man common or unclean.
column3: Handelinge 10:28 en hy sê vir hulle: Julle weet dat dit ongeoorloof is vir ’n Joodse man om met iemand van ’n ander volk omgang te hê of hom te besoek; maar God het my getoon dat ek geen mens onheilig of onrein mag noem nie.

column2: Acts 10:29 Therefore came I [unto you] without gainsaying, as soon as I was sent for: I ask therefore for what intent ye have sent for me?
column3: Handelinge 10:29 Daarom het ek, toe ek gehaal is, gekom sonder om teë te spreek. Ek vra dan om watter rede julle my laat haal het.

column2: Acts 10:30 And Cornelius said, Four days ago I was fasting until this hour; and at the ninth hour I prayed in my house, and, behold, a man stood before me in bright clothing,
column3: Handelinge 10:30 En Cornelius sê: Vier dae gelede was ek besig om te vas tot op hierdie uur, en die negende uur het ek in my huis gebid,

column2: Acts 10:31 And said, Cornelius, thy prayer is heard, and thine alms are had in remembrance in the sight of God.
column3: Handelinge 10:31 en meteens staan daar ’n man voor my in ’n blink kleed en sê: Cornelius, jou gebed is verhoor en jou aalmoese is voor God in herinnering gebring.

column2: Acts 10:32 Send therefore to Joppa, and call hither Simon, whose surname is Peter; he is lodged in the house of [one] Simon a tanner by the sea side: who, when he cometh, shall speak unto thee.
column3: Handelinge 10:32 Stuur dan na Joppe en laat Simon haal wat ook Petrus genoem word. Hy vertoef in die huis van Simon, ’n leerlooier, by die see; as hy kom, sal hy met jou spreek.

column2: Acts 10:33 Immediately therefore I sent to thee; and thou hast well done that thou art come. Now therefore are we all here present before God, to hear all things that are commanded thee of God.
column3: Handelinge 10:33 Ek het toe op die daad na u gestuur, en u het goed gedoen om te kom. Ons is dan nou almal voor die aangesig van God aanwesig om alles te hoor wat deur God aan u opgedra is.

column2: Acts 10:34 Then Peter opened [his] mouth, and said, Of a truth I perceive that God is no respecter of persons:
column3: Handelinge 10:34 En Petrus het sy mond geopen en gesê: Ek sien waarlik dat God geen aannemer van die persoon is nie,

column2: Acts 10:35 But in every nation he that feareth him, and worketh righteousness, is accepted with him.
column3: Handelinge 10:35 maar dat in elke nasie die een wat Hom vrees en geregtigheid doen, Hom welgevallig is.

column2: Acts 10:36 The word which [God] sent unto the children of Israel, preaching peace by Jesus Christ: (he is Lord of all:)
column3: Handelinge 10:36 Dit is die woord wat Hy gestuur het aan die kinders van Israel toe Hy die evangelie van vrede verkondig het deur Jesus Christus — Hy is die Here van almal.

column2: Acts 10:37 That word, [I say], ye know, which was published throughout all Judaea, and began from Galilee, after the baptism which John preached;
column3: Handelinge 10:37 Julle weet van die saak wat deur die hele Judéa gebeur het en van Galiléa af begin het, ná die doop wat Johannes gepreek het,

column2: Acts 10:38 How God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Ghost and with power: who went about doing good, and healing all that were oppressed of the devil; for God was with him.
column3: Handelinge 10:38 met betrekking tot Jesus van Násaret, hoe God Hom gesalf het met die Heilige Gees en met krag. Hy het die land deurgegaan, goed gedoen en almal genees wat onder die mag van die duiwel was, omdat God met Hom was.

column2: Acts 10:39 And we are witnesses of all things which he did both in the land of the Jews, and in Jerusalem; whom they slew and hanged on a tree:
column3: Handelinge 10:39 En ons is getuies van alles wat Hy gedoen het in die Joodse land en in Jerusalem. En hulle het Hom omgebring deur Hom aan ’n kruishout op te hang.

column2: Acts 10:40 Him God raised up the third day, and shewed him openly;
column3: Handelinge 10:40 Hom het God op die derde dag opgewek en beskik dat Hy sou verskyn

column2: Acts 10:41 Not to all the people, but unto witnesses chosen before of God, [even] to us, who did eat and drink with him after he rose from the dead.
column3: Handelinge 10:41 nie aan die hele volk nie, maar aan getuies wat deur God vantevore verkies was, aan ons wat met Hom saam geëet en gedrink het nadat Hy uit die dode opgestaan het.

column2: Acts 10:42 And he commanded us to preach unto the people, and to testify that it is he which was ordained of God [to be] the Judge of quick and dead.
column3: Handelinge 10:42 En Hy het ons bevel gegee om aan die volk te verkondig en met krag te betuig dat dit Hy is wat deur God bestem is as Regter van lewende en dode.

column2: Acts 10:43 To him give all the prophets witness, that through his name whosoever believeth in him shall receive remission of sins.
column3: Handelinge 10:43 Aangaande Hom getuig al die profete dat elkeen wat in Hom glo, vergifnis van sondes deur sy Naam ontvang.

column2: Acts 10:44 While Peter yet spake these words, the Holy Ghost fell on all them which heard the word.
column3: Handelinge 10:44 En toe Petrus nog besig was om hierdie woorde te spreek, het die Heilige Gees op almal geval wat die woord gehoor het.

column2: Acts 10:45 And they of the circumcision which believed were astonished, as many as came with Peter, because that on the Gentiles also was poured out the gift of the Holy Ghost.
column3: Handelinge 10:45 En die gelowiges uit die besnydenis, almal wat saam met Petrus gekom het, was verbaas dat die gawe van die Heilige Gees ook op die heidene uitgestort is.

column2: Acts 10:46 For they heard them speak with tongues, and magnify God. Then answered Peter,
column3: Handelinge 10:46 Want hulle het gehoor hoe hulle in tale spreek en God groot maak. Toe het Petrus begin spreek:

column2: Acts 10:47 Can any man forbid water, that these should not be baptized, which have received the Holy Ghost as well as we?
column3: Handelinge 10:47 Niemand kan tog die water weer, dat hierdie mense, wat net soos ons die Heilige Gees ontvang het, nie gedoop word nie?

column2: Acts 10:48 And he commanded them to be baptized in the name of the Lord. Then prayed they him to tarry certain days.
column3: Handelinge 10:48 En hy het beveel dat hulle gedoop moet word in die Naam van die Here. Toe het hulle hom gevra om nog ’n paar dae te bly.

column2: Acts 11:1 And the apostles and brethren that were in Judaea heard that the Gentiles had also received the word of God.
column3: Handelinge 11:1 EN die apostels en die broeders wat in Judéa was, het gehoor dat die heidene ook die woord van God aangeneem het.

column2: Acts 11:2 And when Peter was come up to Jerusalem, they that were of the circumcision contended with him,
column3: Handelinge 11:2 En toe Petrus opgaan na Jerusalem, het die wat uit die besnydenis was, met hom getwis

column2: Acts 11:3 Saying, Thou wentest in to men uncircumcised, and didst eat with them.
column3: Handelinge 11:3 en gesê: By onbesnede manne het jy in die huis gegaan en saam met hulle geëet.

column2: Acts 11:4 But Peter rehearsed [the matter] from the beginning, and expounded [it] by order unto them, saying,
column3: Handelinge 11:4 En Petrus het begin en vir hulle die loop van die saak uiteengesit en gesê:

column2: Acts 11:5 I was in the city of Joppa praying: and in a trance I saw a vision, A certain vessel descend, as it had been a great sheet, let down from heaven by four corners; and it came even to me:
column3: Handelinge 11:5 Ek was in die stad Joppe in die gebed, en in ’n verrukking van sinne het ek ’n gesig gesien: ’n voorwerp het uit die hemel neergedaal soos ’n groot laken wat aan die vier hoeke uit die hemel neergelaat word, en dit het tot by my gekom.

column2: Acts 11:6 Upon the which when I had fastened mine eyes, I considered, and saw fourfooted beasts of the earth, and wild beasts, and creeping things, and fowls of the air.
column3: Handelinge 11:6 En toe ek die oë daarop hou en dit waarneem, sien ek die viervoetige diere van die aarde en die wilde en die kruipende diere en die voëls van die hemel.

column2: Acts 11:7 And I heard a voice saying unto me, Arise, Peter; slay and eat.
column3: Handelinge 11:7 En ek hoor ’n stem vir my sê: Staan op, Petrus, slag en eet!

column2: Acts 11:8 But I said, Not so, Lord: for nothing common or unclean hath at any time entered into my mouth.
column3: Handelinge 11:8 Maar ek antwoord: Nooit nie, Here, want niks onheiligs of onreins het ooit in my mond ingegaan nie.

column2: Acts 11:9 But the voice answered me again from heaven, What God hath cleansed, [that] call not thou common.
column3: Handelinge 11:9 En die stem het die tweede keer my uit die hemel geantwoord: Wat God rein gemaak het, mag jy nie onheilig ag nie.

column2: Acts 11:10 And this was done three times: and all were drawn up again into heaven.
column3: Handelinge 11:10 En dit het drie maal gebeur en alles is weer opgetrek in die hemel.

column2: Acts 11:11 And, behold, immediately there were three men already come unto the house where I was, sent from Caesarea unto me.
column3: Handelinge 11:11 En dadelik staan daar drie manne voor die huis waar ek in was, wat van Cesaréa na my gestuur was.

column2: Acts 11:12 And the Spirit bade me go with them, nothing doubting. Moreover these six brethren accompanied me, and we entered into the man's house:
column3: Handelinge 11:12 En die Gees het vir my gesê dat ek saam met hulle moes gaan sonder om te twyfel. En saam met my het ook hierdie ses broeders gegaan, en ons het in die huis van die man ingegaan.

column2: Acts 11:13 And he shewed us how he had seen an angel in his house, which stood and said unto him, Send men to Joppa, and call for Simon, whose surname is Peter;
column3: Handelinge 11:13 En hy het ons vertel hoe hy die engel in sy huis sien staan het en vir hom sê: Stuur manne na Joppe en laat vir Simon haal wat ook Petrus genoem word;

column2: Acts 11:14 Who shall tell thee words, whereby thou and all thy house shall be saved.
column3: Handelinge 11:14 hy sal woorde tot jou spreek waardeur jy en jou hele huis gered sal word.

column2: Acts 11:15 And as I began to speak, the Holy Ghost fell on them, as on us at the beginning.
column3: Handelinge 11:15 En toe ek begin spreek, het die Heilige Gees op hulle geval soos ook op ons in die begin.

column2: Acts 11:16 Then remembered I the word of the Lord, how that he said, John indeed baptized with water; but ye shall be baptized with the Holy Ghost.
column3: Handelinge 11:16 En ek het die woord van die Here onthou, hoe Hy gesê het: Johannes het met water gedoop, maar julle sal met die Heilige Gees gedoop word.

column2: Acts 11:17 Forasmuch then as God gave them the like gift as [he did] unto us, who believed on the Lord Jesus Christ; what was I, that I could withstand God?
column3: Handelinge 11:17 As God dan aan hulle dieselfde gawe gegee het soos aan ons wat in die Here Jesus Christus geglo het, wie was ek dan, dat ek God kon verhinder?

column2: Acts 11:18 When they heard these things, they held their peace, and glorified God, saying, Then hath God also to the Gentiles granted repentance unto life.
column3: Handelinge 11:18 En toe hulle dit hoor, het hulle geswyg en God verheerlik en gesê: So het God dan ook aan die heidene die bekering tot die lewe geskenk.

column2: Acts 11:19 Now they which were scattered abroad upon the persecution that arose about Stephen travelled as far as Phenice, and Cyprus, and Antioch, preaching the word to none but unto the Jews only.
column3: Handelinge 11:19 DIE wat dan verstrooi was deur die verdrukking wat oor Stéfanus ontstaan het, het die land deurgegaan tot by Fenícië en Ciprus en Antiochíë sonder om tot iemand die woord te spreek, behalwe tot die Jode alleen.

column2: Acts 11:20 And some of them were men of Cyprus and Cyrene, which, when they were come to Antioch, spake unto the Grecians, preaching the Lord Jesus.
column3: Handelinge 11:20 En daar was sommige van hulle, Cipriese en Cirenése manne, wat in Antiochíë gekom het en met die Griekssprekende Jode gepraat en die evangelie van die Here Jesus verkondig het.

column2: Acts 11:21 And the hand of the Lord was with them: and a great number believed, and turned unto the Lord.
column3: Handelinge 11:21 En die hand van die Here was met hulle, en ’n groot getal het gelowig geword en hulle tot die Here bekeer.

column2: Acts 11:22 Then tidings of these things came unto the ears of the church which was in Jerusalem: and they sent forth Barnabas, that he should go as far as Antioch.
column3: Handelinge 11:22 En die berig hiervan het die gemeente wat in Jerusalem was, ter ore gekom en hulle het Bárnabas afgestuur om die land deur te gaan tot by Antiochíë.

column2: Acts 11:23 Who, when he came, and had seen the grace of God, was glad, and exhorted them all, that with purpose of heart they would cleave unto the Lord.
column3: Handelinge 11:23 Toe hy daar kom en die genade van God sien, was hy bly en het almal vermaan om met hartlike voorneme aan die Here getrou te bly;

column2: Acts 11:24 For he was a good man, and full of the Holy Ghost and of faith: and much people was added unto the Lord.
column3: Handelinge 11:24 want hy was ’n goeie man en vol van die Heilige Gees en geloof; en ’n aansienlike skare is aan die Here toegebring.

column2: Acts 11:25 Then departed Barnabas to Tarsus, for to seek Saul:
column3: Handelinge 11:25 Toe vertrek Bárnabas na Tarsus om Saulus te soek, en toe hy hom kry, het hy hom na Antiochíë gebring.

column2: Acts 11:26 And when he had found him, he brought him unto Antioch. And it came to pass, that a whole year they assembled themselves with the church, and taught much people. And the disciples were called Christians first in Antioch.
column3: Handelinge 11:26 En hulle het ’n hele jaar lank in die gemeente saam vergader en aan ’n aansienlike skare onderwys gegee; en die dissipels is in Antiochíë vir die eerste keer Christene genoem.

column2: Acts 11:27 And in these days came prophets from Jerusalem unto Antioch.
column3: Handelinge 11:27 En in dié dae het daar profete van Jerusalem na Antiochíë afgekom.

column2: Acts 11:28 And there stood up one of them named Agabus, and signified by the Spirit that there should be great dearth throughout all the world: which came to pass in the days of Claudius Caesar.
column3: Handelinge 11:28 En een van hulle met die naam van Ágabus het opgestaan en deur die Heilige Gees te kenne gegee dat daar ’n groot hongersnood oor die hele wêreld sou kom, wat ook gekom het onder keiser Claudius.

column2: Acts 11:29 Then the disciples, every man according to his ability, determined to send relief unto the brethren which dwelt in Judaea:
column3: Handelinge 11:29 En die dissipels het besluit dat iedereen van hulle na sy vermoë iets sou stuur tot versorging van die broeders wat in Judéa woon.

column2: Acts 11:30 Which also they did, and sent it to the elders by the hands of Barnabas and Saul.
column3: Handelinge 11:30 En dit het hulle ook gedoen en dit deur Bárnabas en Saulus aan die ouderlinge gestuur.

column2: Acts 12:1 Now about that time Herod the king stretched forth [his] hands to vex certain of the church.
column3: Handelinge 12:1 EN omtrent daardie tyd het koning Herodes sy hande geslaan aan sommige uit die gemeente om hulle kwaad aan te doen.

column2: Acts 12:2 And he killed James the brother of John with the sword.
column3: Handelinge 12:2 En hy het Jakobus, die broer van Johannes, met die swaard omgebring.

column2: Acts 12:3 And because he saw it pleased the Jews, he proceeded further to take Peter also. (Then were the days of unleavened bread.)
column3: Handelinge 12:3 En toe hy sien dat dit die Jode welgevallig was, het hy verder ook Petrus in hegtenis geneem. En dit was die dae van die ongesuurde brode.

column2: Acts 12:4 And when he had apprehended him, he put [him] in prison, and delivered [him] to four quaternions of soldiers to keep him; intending after Easter to bring him forth to the people.
column3: Handelinge 12:4 Toe hy hom dan gegryp het, het hy hom in die gevangenis gesit en oorgegee aan vier wagte, elkeen van vier soldate, om hom te bewaak, met die bedoeling om hom ná die paasfees voor die volk te bring.

column2: Acts 12:5 Peter therefore was kept in prison: but prayer was made without ceasing of the church unto God for him.
column3: Handelinge 12:5 So is Petrus dan in die gevangenis bewaak; maar daar het ’n aanhoudende gebed tot God deur die gemeente vir hom opgegaan.

column2: Acts 12:6 And when Herod would have brought him forth, the same night Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains: and the keepers before the door kept the prison.
column3: Handelinge 12:6 En toe Herodes hom wou voorbring, het Petrus in daardie nag tussen twee soldate geslaap, met twee kettings geboei, en wagte voor die deur het die gevangenis bewaak.

column2: Acts 12:7 And, behold, the angel of the Lord came upon [him], and a light shined in the prison: and he smote Peter on the side, and raised him up, saying, Arise up quickly. And his chains fell off from [his] hands.
column3: Handelinge 12:7 En meteens staan daar ’n engel van die Here by hom, en ’n lig skyn in die gevangenis. Toe slaan hy Petrus op die sy, maak hom wakker en sê: Staan gou op! En die boeie het van sy hande afgeval.

column2: Acts 12:8 And the angel said unto him, Gird thyself, and bind on thy sandals. And so he did. And he saith unto him, Cast thy garment about thee, and follow me.
column3: Handelinge 12:8 En die engel sê vir hom: Omgord jou en trek jou skoene aan! En hy het dit gedoen. Verder sê hy vir hom: Gooi jou bo-kleed om en volg my!

column2: Acts 12:9 And he went out, and followed him; and wist not that it was true which was done by the angel; but thought he saw a vision.
column3: Handelinge 12:9 En hy het uitgegaan en hom gevolg; en hy het nie geweet dat wat deur die engel plaasgevind het, werklikheid was nie, maar hy het gemeen dat hy ’n gesig sien.

column2: Acts 12:10 When they were past the first and the second ward, they came unto the iron gate that leadeth unto the city; which opened to them of his own accord: and they went out, and passed on through one street; and forthwith the angel departed from him.
column3: Handelinge 12:10 En toe hulle by die eerste en die tweede wag verbygegaan het, kom hulle by die ysterpoort wat na die stad lei, en dit het vanself vir hulle oopgegaan. En hulle het buitekant gekom en een straat ver gegaan, en dadelik het die engel hom verlaat.

column2: Acts 12:11 And when Peter was come to himself, he said, Now I know of a surety, that the Lord hath sent his angel, and hath delivered me out of the hand of Herod, and [from] all the expectation of the people of the Jews.
column3: Handelinge 12:11 Toe kom Petrus tot homself en sê: Nou weet ek waarlik dat die Here sy engel gestuur en my gered het uit die hand van Herodes en uit al die verwagtinge van die Joodse volk.

column2: Acts 12:12 And when he had considered [the thing], he came to the house of Mary the mother of John, whose surname was Mark; where many were gathered together praying.
column3: Handelinge 12:12 En nadat dit vir hom duidelik geword het, kom hy by die huis van Maria, die moeder van Johannes wat ook Markus genoem word, waar baie in die gebed bymekaar was.

column2: Acts 12:13 And as Peter knocked at the door of the gate, a damsel came to hearken, named Rhoda.
column3: Handelinge 12:13 En toe Petrus aan die deur van die poort klop, het ’n diensmeisie met die naam van Rhodé gegaan om te hoor wie daar was.

column2: Acts 12:14 And when she knew Peter's voice, she opened not the gate for gladness, but ran in, and told how Peter stood before the gate.
column3: Handelinge 12:14 En sy het die stem van Petrus herken en van blydskap die poort nie oopgemaak nie, maar na binne gehardloop en vertel dat Petrus voor die poort staan.

column2: Acts 12:15 And they said unto her, Thou art mad. But she constantly affirmed that it was even so. Then said they, It is his angel.
column3: Handelinge 12:15 Maar hulle sê vir haar: Jy is van jou verstand af. Maar sy het volgehou dat dit so is. Daarop sê hulle: Dit is sy engel.

column2: Acts 12:16 But Peter continued knocking: and when they had opened [the door], and saw him, they were astonished.
column3: Handelinge 12:16 En Petrus het aangehou met klop; en toe hulle oopmaak, sien hulle hom en was verbaas.

column2: Acts 12:17 But he, beckoning unto them with the hand to hold their peace, declared unto them how the Lord had brought him out of the prison. And he said, Go shew these things unto James, and to the brethren. And he departed, and went into another place.
column3: Handelinge 12:17 Maar hy het vir hulle met die hand gewink om stil te bly en aan hulle vertel hoe die Here hom uit die gevangenis uitgelei het. En hy sê: Vertel dit aan Jakobus en die broeders. En hy het uitgegaan en na ’n ander plek vertrek.

column2: Acts 12:18 Now as soon as it was day, there was no small stir among the soldiers, what was become of Peter.
column3: Handelinge 12:18 En toe dit dag geword het, was daar onder die soldate geen kleine opskudding oor wat van Petrus geword het nie.

column2: Acts 12:19 And when Herod had sought for him, and found him not, he examined the keepers, and commanded that [they] should be put to death. And he went down from Judaea to Caesarea, and [there] abode.
column3: Handelinge 12:19 Daarop het Herodes hom gesoek en nie gekry nie, en die wagte onder verhoor geneem en bevel gegee dat hulle tereggestel moes word. En hy het van Judéa weggegaan na Cesaréa en daar gebly.

column2: Acts 12:20 And Herod was highly displeased with them of Tyre and Sidon: but they came with one accord to him, and, having made Blastus the king's chamberlain their friend, desired peace; because their country was nourished by the king's [country].
column3: Handelinge 12:20 En Herodes was verbitterd teen die Tiriërs en Sidoniërs. En hulle het eenparig na hom gekom, en nadat hulle Blastus, die koning se hofdienaar, omgepraat het, vrede gevra, omdat hulle land onderhoud uit die koning s’n ontvang het.

column2: Acts 12:21 And upon a set day Herod, arrayed in royal apparel, sat upon his throne, and made an oration unto them.
column3: Handelinge 12:21 En op ’n bepaalde dag het Herodes ’n koninklike kleed aangetrek en op die troon gaan sit en hulle toegespreek.

column2: Acts 12:22 And the people gave a shout, [saying, It is] the voice of a god, and not of a man.
column3: Handelinge 12:22 Daarop het die volk hom toegeroep: ’n Stem van ’n god en nie van ’n mens nie!

column2: Acts 12:23 And immediately the angel of the Lord smote him, because he gave not God the glory: and he was eaten of worms, and gave up the ghost.
column3: Handelinge 12:23 En onmiddellik het ’n engel van die Here hom getref, omdat hy die eer nie aan God gegee het nie; en hy is deur wurms verteer en het gesterwe.

column2: Acts 12:24 But the word of God grew and multiplied.
column3: Handelinge 12:24 Maar die woord van God het gegroei en toegeneem.

column2: Acts 12:25 And Barnabas and Saul returned from Jerusalem, when they had fulfilled [their] ministry, and took with them John, whose surname was Mark.
column3: Handelinge 12:25 En Bárnabas en Saulus het van Jerusalem teruggekeer, nadat hulle hul diens vervul het, en hulle het Johannes saamgeneem, wat ook Markus genoem word.

column2: Acts 13:1 Now there were in the church that was at Antioch certain prophets and teachers; as Barnabas, and Simeon that was called Niger, and Lucius of Cyrene, and Manaen, which had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.
column3: Handelinge 13:1 EN daar was in die plaaslike gemeente in Antiochíë sekere profete en leraars, naamlik Bárnabas en Símeon wat Niger genoem word, en Lúcius, die Cirenéër, en Manáen, wat saam met Herodes, die viervors, grootgeword het, en Saulus.

column2: Acts 13:2 As they ministered to the Lord, and fasted, the Holy Ghost said, Separate me Barnabas and Saul for the work whereunto I have called them.
column3: Handelinge 13:2 En terwyl hulle besig was om die Here te dien en te vas, het die Heilige Gees gesê: Sonder nou Bárnabas en Saulus vir My af vir die werk waarvoor Ek hulle geroep het.

column2: Acts 13:3 And when they had fasted and prayed, and laid [their] hands on them, they sent [them] away.
column3: Handelinge 13:3 En toe hulle gevas en gebid het en hulle die hande opgelê het, laat hulle hul gaan.

column2: Acts 13:4 So they, being sent forth by the Holy Ghost, departed unto Seleucia; and from thence they sailed to Cyprus.
column3: Handelinge 13:4 So het hulle dan, deur die Heilige Gees uitgestuur, afgegaan na Seleúcië en daarvandaan weggevaar na Ciprus.

column2: Acts 13:5 And when they were at Salamis, they preached the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews: and they had also John to [their] minister.
column3: Handelinge 13:5 En toe hulle in Sálamis kom, het hulle die woord van God in die sinagoges van die Jode verkondig; en hulle het ook Johannes as helper gehad.

column2: Acts 13:6 And when they had gone through the isle unto Paphos, they found a certain sorcerer, a false prophet, a Jew, whose name [was] Barjesus:
column3: Handelinge 13:6 En hulle het die eiland deurgegaan tot by Pafos en ’n towenaar gevind, ’n valse profeet, ’n Jood met die naam van Bar-Jesus.

column2: Acts 13:7 Which was with the deputy of the country, Sergius Paulus, a prudent man; who called for Barnabas and Saul, and desired to hear the word of God.
column3: Handelinge 13:7 Hy was by die goewerneur Sérgius Paulus, ’n verstandige man. Dié het Bárnabas en Saulus laat roep en het versoek om die woord van God te hoor.

column2: Acts 13:8 But Elymas the sorcerer (for so is his name by interpretation) withstood them, seeking to turn away the deputy from the faith.
column3: Handelinge 13:8 Maar Élimas die towenaar — want so word sy naam vertaal — het hulle teëgestaan en het probeer om die goewerneur afkerig te maak van die geloof.

column2: Acts 13:9 Then Saul, (who also [is called] Paul,) filled with the Holy Ghost, set his eyes on him,
column3: Handelinge 13:9 Maar Saulus, dit is Paulus, vervul met die Heilige Gees, het die oë op hom gehou en gesê:

column2: Acts 13:10 And said, O full of all subtilty and all mischief, [thou] child of the devil, [thou] enemy of all righteousness, wilt thou not cease to pervert the right ways of the Lord?
column3: Handelinge 13:10 Kind van die duiwel, vol van alle bedrog en alle listigheid, vyand van alle geregtigheid, sal jy nie ophou om die reguit weë van die Here te verdraai nie?

column2: Acts 13:11 And now, behold, the hand of the Lord [is] upon thee, and thou shalt be blind, not seeing the sun for a season. And immediately there fell on him a mist and a darkness; and he went about seeking some to lead him by the hand.
column3: Handelinge 13:11 En nou, kyk, die hand van die Here is op jou, en jy sal blind wees en die son ’n tyd lank nie sien nie. En onmiddellik het daar donkerheid en duisternis op hom geval, en hy het rondgegaan en gesoek na mense wat hom by die hand kon lei.

column2: Acts 13:12 Then the deputy, when he saw what was done, believed, being astonished at the doctrine of the Lord.
column3: Handelinge 13:12 Toe die goewerneur dan sien wat daar gebeur het, was hy verslae oor die leer van die Here en het geglo.

column2: Acts 13:13 Now when Paul and his company loosed from Paphos, they came to Perga in Pamphylia: and John departing from them returned to Jerusalem.
column3: Handelinge 13:13 EN Paulus en sy metgeselle het afgevaar van Pafos en by Perge in Pamfílië gekom. En Johannes het hulle verlaat en na Jerusalem teruggekeer.

column2: Acts 13:14 But when they departed from Perga, they came to Antioch in Pisidia, and went into the synagogue on the sabbath day, and sat down.
column3: Handelinge 13:14 Maar hulle het van Perge af verder gegaan en in Antiochíë in Pisídië aangekom, en hulle het op die sabbatdag in die sinagoge gegaan en gaan sit.

column2: Acts 13:15 And after the reading of the law and the prophets the rulers of the synagogue sent unto them, saying, [Ye] men [and] brethren, if ye have any word of exhortation for the people, say on.
column3: Handelinge 13:15 En ná die lesing van die wet en die profete het die hoofde van die sinagoge na hulle gestuur en gesê: Broeders, as julle ’n woord van opwekking vir die volk het, spreek dan!

column2: Acts 13:16 Then Paul stood up, and beckoning with [his] hand said, Men of Israel, and ye that fear God, give audience.
column3: Handelinge 13:16 Toe staan Paulus op, wink met die hand en sê: Israeliete en julle wat God vrees, luister!

column2: Acts 13:17 The God of this people of Israel chose our fathers, and exalted the people when they dwelt as strangers in the land of Egypt, and with an high arm brought he them out of it.
column3: Handelinge 13:17 Die God van hierdie volk Israel het ons vaders uitverkies en die volk verhoog toe hulle bywoners in Egipteland was, en met ’n hoë arm hulle daaruit gelei.

column2: Acts 13:18 And about the time of forty years suffered he their manners in the wilderness.
column3: Handelinge 13:18 En omtrent veertig jaar lank het Hy hulle in die woestyn verdra.

column2: Acts 13:19 And when he had destroyed seven nations in the land of Chanaan, he divided their land to them by lot.
column3: Handelinge 13:19 En sewe nasies het Hy in die land Kanaän uitgeroei en hulle land deur die lot aan hulle uitgedeel.

column2: Acts 13:20 And after that he gave [unto them] judges about the space of four hundred and fifty years, until Samuel the prophet.
column3: Handelinge 13:20 En daarna omtrent vierhonderd-en-vyftig jaar lank het Hy rigters gegee tot op Samuel, die profeet.

column2: Acts 13:21 And afterward they desired a king: and God gave unto them Saul the son of Cis, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, by the space of forty years.
column3: Handelinge 13:21 En van toe af het hulle ’n koning begeer, en God het aan hulle gegee Saul, die seun van Kis, ’n man uit die stam van Benjamin, veertig jaar lank.

column2: Acts 13:22 And when he had removed him, he raised up unto them David to be their king; to whom also he gave testimony, and said, I have found David the [son] of Jesse, a man after mine own heart, which shall fulfil all my will.
column3: Handelinge 13:22 En nadat Hy hom afgesit het, het Hy Dawid vir hulle verhef as koning, van wie Hy ook gesê en getuig het: Ek het Dawid, die seun van Ísai, gevind, ’n man na my hart, wat al my welbehae sal doen.

column2: Acts 13:23 Of this man's seed hath God according to [his] promise raised unto Israel a Saviour, Jesus:
column3: Handelinge 13:23 Uit die nageslag van hierdie man het God vir Israel, volgens die belofte, Jesus as Verlosser verwek,

column2: Acts 13:24 When John had first preached before his coming the baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.
column3: Handelinge 13:24 nadat Johannes voor sy koms eers die doop van bekering aan die hele volk van Israel verkondig het.

column2: Acts 13:25 And as John fulfilled his course, he said, Whom think ye that I am? I am not [he]. But, behold, there cometh one after me, whose shoes of [his] feet I am not worthy to loose.
column3: Handelinge 13:25 En toe Johannes aan die einde van sy loopbaan gekom het, het hy gesê: Wie dink julle is ek? Ek is dit nie; maar kyk, Hy kom ná my, wie se skoen ek nie waardig is om van sy voete los te maak nie.

column2: Acts 13:26 Men [and] brethren, children of the stock of Abraham, and whosoever among you feareth God, to you is the word of this salvation sent.
column3: Handelinge 13:26 Broeders, kinders van die geslag van Abraham, en die onder julle wat God vrees, vir julle is hierdie woord van verlossing gestuur.

column2: Acts 13:27 For they that dwell at Jerusalem, and their rulers, because they knew him not, nor yet the voices of the prophets which are read every sabbath day, they have fulfilled [them] in condemning [him].
column3: Handelinge 13:27 Want die inwoners van Jerusalem en hulle owerstes het Hom nie geken nie, en deur Hom te veroordeel, het hulle die woorde van die profete vervul wat elke sabbat gelees word.

column2: Acts 13:28 And though they found no cause of death [in him], yet desired they Pilate that he should be slain.
column3: Handelinge 13:28 En al het hulle niks gevind wat die dood verdien nie, tog het hulle van Pilatus gevra dat Hy omgebring moes word.

column2: Acts 13:29 And when they had fulfilled all that was written of him, they took [him] down from the tree, and laid [him] in a sepulchre.
column3: Handelinge 13:29 En toe hulle alles volbring het wat oor Hom geskrywe is, het hulle Hom van die kruishout afgehaal en in ’n graf neergelê.

column2: Acts 13:30 But God raised him from the dead:
column3: Handelinge 13:30 Maar God het Hom uit die dode opgewek.

column2: Acts 13:31 And he was seen many days of them which came up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who are his witnesses unto the people.
column3: Handelinge 13:31 En gedurende baie dae het Hy verskyn aan die wat saam met Hom opgegaan het van Galiléa na Jerusalem, en hulle is sy getuies by die volk.

column2: Acts 13:32 And we declare unto you glad tidings, how that the promise which was made unto the fathers,
column3: Handelinge 13:32 En ons bring julle die goeie tyding van die belofte wat aan die vaders gedoen is, dat God dit aan ons, hulle kinders, vervul het deur Jesus op te wek,

column2: Acts 13:33 God hath fulfilled the same unto us their children, in that he hath raised up Jesus again; as it is also written in the second psalm, Thou art my Son, this day have I begotten thee.
column3: Handelinge 13:33 soos daar ook in die tweede psalm geskrywe is: U is my Seun, vandag het Ek U gegenereer.

column2: Acts 13:34 And as concerning that he raised him up from the dead, [now] no more to return to corruption, he said on this wise, I will give you the sure mercies of David.
column3: Handelinge 13:34 En dat Hy Hom opgewek het uit die dode, sodat Hy nie meer tot verderwing sou terugkeer nie, het Hy só gespreek: Ek sal aan julle gee die heilige weldade van Dawid wat betroubaar is.

column2: Acts 13:35 Wherefore he saith also in another [psalm], Thou shalt not suffer thine Holy One to see corruption.
column3: Handelinge 13:35 Daarom sê Hy ook op ’n ander plek: U sal u Heilige nie oorgee om verderwing te sien nie.

column2: Acts 13:36 For David, after he had served his own generation by the will of God, fell on sleep, and was laid unto his fathers, and saw corruption:
column3: Handelinge 13:36 Want Dawid het ontslaap, nadat hy sy eie geslag volgens die raad van God gedien het, en is by sy vaders weggelê en het verderwing gesien,

column2: Acts 13:37 But he, whom God raised again, saw no corruption.
column3: Handelinge 13:37 maar Hy wat deur God opgewek is, het geen verderwing gesien nie.

column2: Acts 13:38 Be it known unto you therefore, men [and] brethren, that through this man is preached unto you the forgiveness of sins:
column3: Handelinge 13:38 Laat dit dan aan julle bekend wees, broeders, dat deur Hom vergifnis van sondes aan julle verkondig word,

column2: Acts 13:39 And by him all that believe are justified from all things, from which ye could not be justified by the law of Moses.
column3: Handelinge 13:39 en dat elkeen wat glo, deur Hom geregverdig word van alles waarvan julle deur die wet van Moses nie geregverdig kon word nie.

column2: Acts 13:40 Beware therefore, lest that come upon you, which is spoken of in the prophets;
column3: Handelinge 13:40 Pas dan op dat daar nie oor julle kom wat deur die profete gesê is nie:

column2: Acts 13:41 Behold, ye despisers, and wonder, and perish: for I work a work in your days, a work which ye shall in no wise believe, though a man declare it unto you.
column3: Handelinge 13:41 Kyk dan, julle veragters, en wees verwonderd en verdwyn! Want Ek gaan iets in julle dae doen, iets wat julle sekerlik nie sal glo as iemand julle dit vertel nie.

column2: Acts 13:42 And when the Jews were gone out of the synagogue, the Gentiles besought that these words might be preached to them the next sabbath.
column3: Handelinge 13:42 En toe die Jode uit die sinagoge gaan, het die heidene versoek dat daardie woorde op die volgende sabbat tot hulle gespreek sou word.

column2: Acts 13:43 Now when the congregation was broken up, many of the Jews and religious proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas: who, speaking to them, persuaded them to continue in the grace of God.
column3: Handelinge 13:43 En toe die sinagoge uit was, het baie van die Jode en die godsdienstige Jodegenote Paulus en Bárnabas gevolg. Dié het hulle toegespreek en hulle probeer beweeg om in die genade van God te bly.

column2: Acts 13:44 And the next sabbath day came almost the whole city together to hear the word of God.
column3: Handelinge 13:44 En op die volgende sabbat het byna die hele stad saamgekom om die woord van God te hoor.

column2: Acts 13:45 But when the Jews saw the multitudes, they were filled with envy, and spake against those things which were spoken by Paul, contradicting and blaspheming.
column3: Handelinge 13:45 Maar toe die Jode die skare sien, is hulle met nydigheid vervul en het met lasterlike woorde weerspreek wat deur Paulus gesê is.

column2: Acts 13:46 Then Paul and Barnabas waxed bold, and said, It was necessary that the word of God should first have been spoken to you: but seeing ye put it from you, and judge yourselves unworthy of everlasting life, lo, we turn to the Gentiles.
column3: Handelinge 13:46 Maar Paulus en Bárnabas het vry-uit gespreek en gesê: Dit was noodsaaklik dat die woord van God aan julle eers verkondig moes word. Aangesien julle dit egter verwerp en julleself die ewige lewe nie waardig ag nie — kyk, ons wend ons tot die heidene.

column2: Acts 13:47 For so hath the Lord commanded us, [saying], I have set thee to be a light of the Gentiles, that thou shouldest be for salvation unto the ends of the earth.
column3: Handelinge 13:47 Want so het die Here aan ons bevel gegee: Ek het U ’n lig van die nasies gemaak, sodat U tot redding sal wees tot aan die einde van die aarde.

column2: Acts 13:48 And when the Gentiles heard this, they were glad, and glorified the word of the Lord: and as many as were ordained to eternal life believed.
column3: Handelinge 13:48 En toe die heidene dit hoor, was hulle bly; en hulle het die woord van die Here geprys; en daar het gelowig geword almal wat verordineer was tot die ewige lewe.

column2: Acts 13:49 And the word of the Lord was published throughout all the region.
column3: Handelinge 13:49 En die woord van die Here is deur die hele land verbrei.

column2: Acts 13:50 But the Jews stirred up the devout and honourable women, and the chief men of the city, and raised persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and expelled them out of their coasts.
column3: Handelinge 13:50 Maar die Jode het die godsdienstige en aansienlike vroue en die vernaamste mense van die stad opgehits en teen Paulus en Bárnabas ’n vervolging in die lewe geroep en hulle buite hul gebied verdryf.

column2: Acts 13:51 But they shook off the dust of their feet against them, and came unto Iconium.
column3: Handelinge 13:51 Toe het hulle die stof van hul voete teen hulle afgeskud en na Ikónium gegaan.

column2: Acts 13:52 And the disciples were filled with joy, and with the Holy Ghost.
column3: Handelinge 13:52 En die dissipels is vervul met blydskap en met die Heilige Gees.

column2: Acts 14:1 And it came to pass in Iconium, that they went both together into the synagogue of the Jews, and so spake, that a great multitude both of the Jews and also of the Greeks believed.
column3: Handelinge 14:1 EN op dieselfde wyse het hulle in Ikónium in die sinagoge van die Jode ingegaan en so gespreek dat ’n groot menigte Jode sowel as Grieke gelowig geword het.

column2: Acts 14:2 But the unbelieving Jews stirred up the Gentiles, and made their minds evil affected against the brethren.
column3: Handelinge 14:2 Maar die ongehoorsame Jode het die gemoedere van die heidene teen die broeders opgehits en verbitter.

column2: Acts 14:3 Long time therefore abode they speaking boldly in the Lord, which gave testimony unto the word of his grace, and granted signs and wonders to be done by their hands.
column3: Handelinge 14:3 Hulle het toe ’n geruime tyd daar deurgebring en vrymoediglik gespreek in die Here, wat aan die woord van sy genade getuienis gegee het deur te beskik dat tekens en wonders deur hulle hande plaasvind.

column2: Acts 14:4 But the multitude of the city was divided: and part held with the Jews, and part with the apostles.
column3: Handelinge 14:4 En die menigte van die stad was verdeeld, en sommige het met die Jode en ander met die apostels saamgegaan.

column2: Acts 14:5 And when there was an assault made both of the Gentiles, and also of the Jews with their rulers, to use [them] despitefully, and to stone them,
column3: Handelinge 14:5 Maar toe daar onder die heidene en ook onder die Jode, saam met hulle owerstes, ’n beweging ontstaan het om hulle te mishandel en te stenig,

column2: Acts 14:6 They were ware of [it], and fled unto Lystra and Derbe, cities of Lycaonia, and unto the region that lieth round about:
column3: Handelinge 14:6 het hulle dit gewaargeword en gevlug na die stede van Likaónië, Listre en Derbe en die omstreke.

column2: Acts 14:7 And there they preached the gospel.
column3: Handelinge 14:7 En daar het hulle die evangelie verkondig.

column2: Acts 14:8 And there sat a certain man at Lystra, impotent in his feet, being a cripple from his mother's womb, who never had walked:
column3: Handelinge 14:8 En in Listre het daar ’n man gesit wat magteloos was aan sy voete, kreupel van sy geboorte af, en hy het nooit geloop nie.

column2: Acts 14:9 The same heard Paul speak: who stedfastly beholding him, and perceiving that he had faith to be healed,
column3: Handelinge 14:9 Hy het geluister terwyl Paulus spreek; en Paulus het die oë op hom gehou, en, toe hy sien dat hy geloof het om gesond te word,

column2: Acts 14:10 Said with a loud voice, Stand upright on thy feet. And he leaped and walked.
column3: Handelinge 14:10 met ’n groot stem gesê: Staan regop op jou voete! En hy het opgespring en begin rondloop.

column2: Acts 14:11 And when the people saw what Paul had done, they lifted up their voices, saying in the speech of Lycaonia, The gods are come down to us in the likeness of men.
column3: Handelinge 14:11 En toe die skare sien wat Paulus gedoen het, verhef hulle hul stem en sê in Likaónies: Die gode het soos mense geword en neergedaal na ons toe.

column2: Acts 14:12 And they called Barnabas, Jupiter; and Paul, Mercurius, because he was the chief speaker.
column3: Handelinge 14:12 En hulle het vir Bárnabas Júpiter genoem, en vir Paulus Mercurius, omdat hy die woordvoerder was.

column2: Acts 14:13 Then the priest of Jupiter, which was before their city, brought oxen and garlands unto the gates, and would have done sacrifice with the people.
column3: Handelinge 14:13 En die priester van Júpiter wie se tempel voor hulle stad was, het stiere en kranse na die poorte gebring en wou saam met die skare offer.

column2: Acts 14:14 [Which] when the apostles, Barnabas and Paul, heard [of], they rent their clothes, and ran in among the people, crying out,
column3: Handelinge 14:14 Maar toe die apostels, Bárnabas en Paulus, dit hoor, het hulle hul klere geskeur en onder die skare ingespring en geroep

column2: Acts 14:15 And saying, Sirs, why do ye these things? We also are men of like passions with you, and preach unto you that ye should turn from these vanities unto the living God, which made heaven, and earth, and the sea, and all things that are therein:
column3: Handelinge 14:15 en gesê: Manne, waarom doen julle hierdie dinge? Ons is net sulke mense soos julle, en ons verkondig die evangelie dat julle jul van hierdie nietige dinge moet bekeer tot die lewende God wat die hemel en die aarde en die see en alles wat daarin is, gemaak het.

column2: Acts 14:16 Who in times past suffered all nations to walk in their own ways.
column3: Handelinge 14:16 Hy het in die tye wat verby is, toegelaat dat al die nasies in hulle eie weë sou wandel,

column2: Acts 14:17 Nevertheless he left not himself without witness, in that he did good, and gave us rain from heaven, and fruitful seasons, filling our hearts with food and gladness.
column3: Handelinge 14:17 al het Hy Homself nie onbetuig gelaat nie, deur goed te doen, van die hemel vir ons reën en vrugbare tye te gee en ons harte met voedsel en vrolikheid te vervul.

column2: Acts 14:18 And with these sayings scarce restrained they the people, that they had not done sacrifice unto them.
column3: Handelinge 14:18 Selfs met hierdie woorde het hulle met moeite die skare verhinder om aan hulle te offer.

column2: Acts 14:19 And there came thither [certain] Jews from Antioch and Iconium, who persuaded the people, and, having stoned Paul, drew [him] out of the city, supposing he had been dead.
column3: Handelinge 14:19 Maar daar het Jode van Antiochíë en Ikónium aangekom, en hulle het, nadat hulle die skare omgepraat het, Paulus gestenig en hom buitekant die stad gesleep, met die gedagte dat hy dood was.

column2: Acts 14:20 Howbeit, as the disciples stood round about him, he rose up, and came into the city: and the next day he departed with Barnabas to Derbe.
column3: Handelinge 14:20 Maar toe die dissipels hom omring, het hy opgestaan en in die stad gekom en die volgende dag saam met Bárnabas na Derbe vertrek.

column2: Acts 14:21 And when they had preached the gospel to that city, and had taught many, they returned again to Lystra, and [to] Iconium, and Antioch,
column3: Handelinge 14:21 En nadat hulle aan daardie stad die evangelie verkondig en ’n aantal dissipels gemaak het, het hulle teruggegaan na Listre en Ikónium en Antiochíë,

column2: Acts 14:22 Confirming the souls of the disciples, [and] exhorting them to continue in the faith, and that we must through much tribulation enter into the kingdom of God.
column3: Handelinge 14:22 en die siele van die dissipels versterk en hulle vermaan om in die geloof te bly deur te sê: Ons moet deur baie verdrukkinge in die koninkryk van God ingaan.

column2: Acts 14:23 And when they had ordained them elders in every church, and had prayed with fasting, they commended them to the Lord, on whom they believed.
column3: Handelinge 14:23 En hulle het in elke gemeente vir hulle ouderlinge gekies, en hulle, ná gebed en vas, opgedra aan die Here in wie hulle geglo het.

column2: Acts 14:24 And after they had passed throughout Pisidia, they came to Pamphylia.
column3: Handelinge 14:24 Toe gaan hulle deur Pisídië en kom in Pamfílië;

column2: Acts 14:25 And when they had preached the word in Perga, they went down into Attalia:
column3: Handelinge 14:25 en nadat hulle die woord in Perge verkondig het, het hulle afgegaan na Attálië.

column2: Acts 14:26 And thence sailed to Antioch, from whence they had been recommended to the grace of God for the work which they fulfilled.
column3: Handelinge 14:26 En daarvandaan het hulle weggevaar na Antiochíë, waar hulle aan die genade van God opgedra was vir die werk wat hulle volbring het.

column2: Acts 14:27 And when they were come, and had gathered the church together, they rehearsed all that God had done with them, and how he had opened the door of faith unto the Gentiles.
