column3: Handelinge 14:27 En toe hulle daar kom en die gemeente saamgeroep het, het hulle verslag gedoen van al die dinge wat God met hulle gedoen het, en dat Hy ’n deur van geloof vir die heidene geopen het.

column2: Acts 14:28 And there they abode long time with the disciples.
column3: Handelinge 14:28 En hulle het daar by die dissipels ’n geruime tyd deurgebring.

column2: Acts 15:1 And certain men which came down from Judaea taught the brethren, [and said], Except ye be circumcised after the manner of Moses, ye cannot be saved.
column3: Handelinge 15:1 EN sekere persone wat van Judéa afgekom het, het die broeders geleer: As julle nie besny word volgens die gebruik van Moses nie, kan julle nie gered word nie.

column2: Acts 15:2 When therefore Paul and Barnabas had no small dissension and disputation with them, they determined that Paul and Barnabas, and certain other of them, should go up to Jerusalem unto the apostles and elders about this question.
column3: Handelinge 15:2 Toe daar nou geen klein stryd en woordewisseling van die kant van Paulus en Bárnabas teen hulle ontstaan het nie, het hulle besluit dat Paulus en Bárnabas en nog ’n paar ander van hulle sou opgaan na die apostels en ouderlinge in Jerusalem in verband met hierdie vraagstuk.

column2: Acts 15:3 And being brought on their way by the church, they passed through Phenice and Samaria, declaring the conversion of the Gentiles: and they caused great joy unto all the brethren.
column3: Handelinge 15:3 En hulle is deur die gemeente uitgelei en het Fenícië en Samaría deurgegaan en vertel van die bekering van die heidene, en aan al die broeders groot blydskap verskaf.

column2: Acts 15:4 And when they were come to Jerusalem, they were received of the church, and [of] the apostles and elders, and they declared all things that God had done with them.
column3: Handelinge 15:4 En by hulle aankoms in Jerusalem is hulle ontvang deur die gemeente en die apostels en die ouderlinge; en hulle het verslag gedoen van al die dinge wat God met hulle gedoen het.

column2: Acts 15:5 But there rose up certain of the sect of the Pharisees which believed, saying, That it was needful to circumcise them, and to command [them] to keep the law of Moses.
column3: Handelinge 15:5 Maar sommige gelowiges uit die party van die Fariseërs het opgestaan en gesê: Dit is noodsaaklik dat hulle besny word en bevel ontvang om die wet van Moses te onderhou.

column2: Acts 15:6 And the apostles and elders came together for to consider of this matter.
column3: Handelinge 15:6 En die apostels en die ouderlinge het vergader om hierdie saak te ondersoek.

column2: Acts 15:7 And when there had been much disputing, Peter rose up, and said unto them, Men [and] brethren, ye know how that a good while ago God made choice among us, that the Gentiles by my mouth should hear the word of the gospel, and believe.
column3: Handelinge 15:7 En toe daar ’n groot woordewisseling plaasvind, het Petrus opgestaan en vir hulle gesê: Broeders, julle weet dat God lank gelede onder ons verkies het dat die heidene deur my mond die woord van die evangelie sal hoor en gelowig word.

column2: Acts 15:8 And God, which knoweth the hearts, bare them witness, giving them the Holy Ghost, even as [he did] unto us;
column3: Handelinge 15:8 En God wat die harte ken, het vir hulle getuienis gegee deur aan hulle die Heilige Gees te skenk net soos aan ons.

column2: Acts 15:9 And put no difference between us and them, purifying their hearts by faith.
column3: Handelinge 15:9 En Hy het geen onderskeid tussen ons en hulle gemaak nie, aangesien Hy hulle harte gereinig het deur die geloof.

column2: Acts 15:10 Now therefore why tempt ye God, to put a yoke upon the neck of the disciples, which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear?
column3: Handelinge 15:10 Nou dan, waarom versoek julle God deur op die nek van die dissipels ’n juk te lê wat ons vaders en ook ons nie in staat was om te dra nie?

column2: Acts 15:11 But we believe that through the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ we shall be saved, even as they.
column3: Handelinge 15:11 Maar ons glo dat ons deur die genade van die Here Jesus Christus gered word op dieselfde manier as hulle ook.

column2: Acts 15:12 Then all the multitude kept silence, and gave audience to Barnabas and Paul, declaring what miracles and wonders God had wrought among the Gentiles by them.
column3: Handelinge 15:12 En die hele menigte het geswyg en na Bárnabas en Paulus geluister, terwyl hulle van al die tekens en wonders vertel wat God deur hulle onder die heidene gedoen het.

column2: Acts 15:13 And after they had held their peace, James answered, saying, Men [and] brethren, hearken unto me:
column3: Handelinge 15:13 En nadat hulle geswyg het, antwoord Jakobus en sê: Broeders, luister na my!

column2: Acts 15:14 Simeon hath declared how God at the first did visit the Gentiles, to take out of them a people for his name.
column3: Handelinge 15:14 Símeon het vertel hoe God in die begin uitgesien het om ’n volk uit die heidene vir sy Naam aan te neem.

column2: Acts 15:15 And to this agree the words of the prophets; as it is written,
column3: Handelinge 15:15 En hiermee stem die woorde van die profete ooreen, soos geskrywe is:

column2: Acts 15:16 After this I will return, and will build again the tabernacle of David, which is fallen down; and I will build again the ruins thereof, and I will set it up:
column3: Handelinge 15:16 Daarna sal Ek terugkom en die vervalle hut van Dawid weer oprig, en wat daarvan verwoes is, sal Ek weer oprig en dit herstel,

column2: Acts 15:17 That the residue of men might seek after the Lord, and all the Gentiles, upon whom my name is called, saith the Lord, who doeth all these things.
column3: Handelinge 15:17 sodat die oorblyfsel van die mense die Here kan soek, en al die nasies oor wie my Naam uitgeroep is, spreek die Here wat al hierdie dinge doen.

column2: Acts 15:18 Known unto God are all his works from the beginning of the world.
column3: Handelinge 15:18 Aan God is al sy werke van ewigheid af bekend.

column2: Acts 15:19 Wherefore my sentence is, that we trouble not them, which from among the Gentiles are turned to God:
column3: Handelinge 15:19 Daarom oordeel ek dat ons die wat uit die heidene hulle tot God bekeer, nie moet bemoeilik nie,

column2: Acts 15:20 But that we write unto them, that they abstain from pollutions of idols, and [from] fornication, and [from] things strangled, and [from] blood.
column3: Handelinge 15:20 maar aan hulle skrywe dat hulle hul moet onthou van die dinge wat deur die afgode besoedel is en van hoerery en van wat verwurg is en van bloed.

column2: Acts 15:21 For Moses of old time hath in every city them that preach him, being read in the synagogues every sabbath day.
column3: Handelinge 15:21 Want van die ou tyd af het Moses in elke stad diegene wat hom verkondig, terwyl hy elke sabbat in die sinagoges gelees word.

column2: Acts 15:22 Then pleased it the apostles and elders, with the whole church, to send chosen men of their own company to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas; [namely], Judas surnamed Barsabas, and Silas, chief men among the brethren:
column3: Handelinge 15:22 Toe het die apostels en die ouderlinge saam met die hele gemeente besluit om manne uit hulle te kies en na Antiochíë te stuur saam met Paulus en Bárnabas, naamlik Judas, met die bynaam van Bársabas, en Silas, manne wat voorgangers onder die broeders was.

column2: Acts 15:23 And they wrote [letters] by them after this manner; The apostles and elders and brethren [send] greeting unto the brethren which are of the Gentiles in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia:
column3: Handelinge 15:23 En hulle het deur hul bemiddeling dít geskrywe: Die apostels en die ouderlinge en die broeders aan die broeders uit die heidene in Antiochíë en Sírië en Cilícië: Groete!

column2: Acts 15:24 Forasmuch as we have heard, that certain which went out from us have troubled you with words, subverting your souls, saying, [Ye must] be circumcised, and keep the law: to whom we gave no [such] commandment:
column3: Handelinge 15:24 Aangesien ons gehoor het dat sommige wat van ons uitgegaan het, aan wie ons geen opdrag gegee het nie, julle met woorde ontstel en julle gemoedere verontrus deur te sê dat julle besny moet word en die wet moet onderhou,

column2: Acts 15:25 It seemed good unto us, being assembled with one accord, to send chosen men unto you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul,
column3: Handelinge 15:25 het ons eenparig besluit om manne te kies en na julle te stuur saam met ons geliefde Bárnabas en Paulus —

column2: Acts 15:26 Men that have hazarded their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.
column3: Handelinge 15:26 manne wat hulle lewe oorgegee het vir die Naam van onse Here Jesus Christus.

column2: Acts 15:27 We have sent therefore Judas and Silas, who shall also tell [you] the same things by mouth.
column3: Handelinge 15:27 Ons het dan Judas en Silas afgevaardig om ook mondeling dieselfde berig te bring.

column2: Acts 15:28 For it seemed good to the Holy Ghost, and to us, to lay upon you no greater burden than these necessary things;
column3: Handelinge 15:28 Want die Heilige Gees en ons het besluit om verder geen las op julle te lê nie as hierdie noodsaaklike dinge:

column2: Acts 15:29 That ye abstain from meats offered to idols, and from blood, and from things strangled, and from fornication: from which if ye keep yourselves, ye shall do well. Fare ye well.
column3: Handelinge 15:29 dat julle jul onthou van afgodsoffers en van bloed en van wat verwurg is en van hoerery. As julle jul hiervan onthou, sal julle goed doen. Vaarwel!

column2: Acts 15:30 So when they were dismissed, they came to Antioch: and when they had gathered the multitude together, they delivered the epistle:
column3: Handelinge 15:30 So is hulle dan weggestuur en het in Antiochíë gekom, en hulle het die menigte bymekaargeroep en die brief afgelewer.

column2: Acts 15:31 [Which] when they had read, they rejoiced for the consolation.
column3: Handelinge 15:31 En toe hulle dit gelees het, was hulle bly oor die bemoediging.

column2: Acts 15:32 And Judas and Silas, being prophets also themselves, exhorted the brethren with many words, and confirmed [them].
column3: Handelinge 15:32 En Judas en Silas, wat self ook profete was, het die broeders met baie woorde bemoedig en versterk.

column2: Acts 15:33 And after they had tarried [there] a space, they were let go in peace from the brethren unto the apostles.
column3: Handelinge 15:33 En nadat hulle ’n tyd daar deurgebring het, het die broeders hulle met vrede na die apostels laat gaan.

column2: Acts 15:34 Notwithstanding it pleased Silas to abide there still.
column3: Handelinge 15:34 Maar Silas het besluit om daar te bly.

column2: Acts 15:35 Paul also and Barnabas continued in Antioch, teaching and preaching the word of the Lord, with many others also.
column3: Handelinge 15:35 EN Paulus en Bárnabas het in Antiochíë gebly en, saam met nog baie ander, onderrig gegee en die blye boodskap van die woord van die Here verkondig.

column2: Acts 15:36 And some days after Paul said unto Barnabas, Let us go again and visit our brethren in every city where we have preached the word of the Lord, [and see] how they do.
column3: Handelinge 15:36 En ’n paar dae daarna het Paulus vir Bárnabas gesê: Laat ons teruggaan en ons broeders besoek in al die stede waarin ons die woord van die Here verkondig het, om te sien hoe dit met hulle gaan.

column2: Acts 15:37 And Barnabas determined to take with them John, whose surname was Mark.
column3: Handelinge 15:37 En Bárnabas wou Johannes, wat Markus genoem word, saamneem.

column2: Acts 15:38 But Paul thought not good to take him with them, who departed from them from Pamphylia, and went not with them to the work.
column3: Handelinge 15:38 Maar Paulus het dit nie reg geag om hóm saam te neem wat van Pamfílië af hulle verlaat het en nie saam met hulle na die werk gegaan het nie.

column2: Acts 15:39 And the contention was so sharp between them, that they departed asunder one from the other: and so Barnabas took Mark, and sailed unto Cyprus;
column3: Handelinge 15:39 Daar het toe ’n verbittering ontstaan, sodat hulle van mekaar geskei het; en Bárnabas het Markus saamgeneem en na Ciprus uitgeseil.

column2: Acts 15:40 And Paul chose Silas, and departed, being recommended by the brethren unto the grace of God.
column3: Handelinge 15:40 MAAR Paulus het Silas gekies en afgereis nadat hy deur die broeders aan die genade van God opgedra was.

column2: Acts 15:41 And he went through Syria and Cilicia, confirming the churches.
column3: Handelinge 15:41 En hy het Sírië en Cilícië deurgegaan en die gemeentes versterk.

column2: Acts 16:1 Then came he to Derbe and Lystra: and, behold, a certain disciple was there, named Timotheus, the son of a certain woman, which was a Jewess, and believed; but his father [was] a Greek:
column3: Handelinge 16:1 EN hy het in Derbe en Listre aangekom; en daar was ’n dissipel met die naam van Timótheüs, seun van ’n gelowige Joodse vrou, maar van ’n Griekse vader.

column2: Acts 16:2 Which was well reported of by the brethren that were at Lystra and Iconium.
column3: Handelinge 16:2 Hy het goeie getuienis gehad van die broeders in Listre en Ikónium.

column2: Acts 16:3 Him would Paul have to go forth with him; and took and circumcised him because of the Jews which were in those quarters: for they knew all that his father was a Greek.
column3: Handelinge 16:3 Paulus wou hê dat hy saam met hom op reis sou gaan, en hy het hom geneem en besny ter wille van die Jode wat in daardie streke was; want hulle het almal geweet dat sy vader ’n Griek was.

column2: Acts 16:4 And as they went through the cities, they delivered them the decrees for to keep, that were ordained of the apostles and elders which were at Jerusalem.
column3: Handelinge 16:4 En op hulle reis deur die stede het hulle die verordeninge wat deur die apostels en die ouderlinge in Jerusalem vasgestel was, aan hulle oorgegee om te onderhou.

column2: Acts 16:5 And so were the churches established in the faith, and increased in number daily.
column3: Handelinge 16:5 En die gemeentes is versterk in die geloof en het elke dag vermeerder in getal.

column2: Acts 16:6 Now when they had gone throughout Phrygia and the region of Galatia, and were forbidden of the Holy Ghost to preach the word in Asia,
column3: Handelinge 16:6 En hulle het deur die land Frígië en Galásië gegaan, omdat die Heilige Gees hulle verhinder het om in Asië die woord te verkondig.

column2: Acts 16:7 After they were come to Mysia, they assayed to go into Bithynia: but the Spirit suffered them not.
column3: Handelinge 16:7 En toe hulle by Mísië kom, het hulle probeer om na Bithínië te gaan, maar die Gees het hulle dit nie toegelaat nie.

column2: Acts 16:8 And they passing by Mysia came down to Troas.
column3: Handelinge 16:8 So het hulle dan Mísië verbygegaan en na Troas afgekom.

column2: Acts 16:9 And a vision appeared to Paul in the night; There stood a man of Macedonia, and prayed him, saying, Come over into Macedonia, and help us.
column3: Handelinge 16:9 EN Paulus het ’n gesig in die nag gesien — daar staan ’n Macedóniër wat hom smeek en sê: Kom oor na Macedónië en help ons!

column2: Acts 16:10 And after he had seen the vision, immediately we endeavoured to go into Macedonia, assuredly gathering that the Lord had called us for to preach the gospel unto them.
column3: Handelinge 16:10 En toe hy die gesig gesien het, het ons dadelik probeer om na Macedónië te gaan, omdat ons versekerd was dat die Here ons geroep het om die evangelie aan hulle te verkondig.

column2: Acts 16:11 Therefore loosing from Troas, we came with a straight course to Samothracia, and the next [day] to Neapolis;
column3: Handelinge 16:11 Ons het dan afgevaar van Troas en reguit koers gehou na Samothráce, en die volgende dag na Neápolis,

column2: Acts 16:12 And from thence to Philippi, which is the chief city of that part of Macedonia, [and] a colony: and we were in that city abiding certain days.
column3: Handelinge 16:12 en daarvandaan na Filíppi, wat die eerste stad is van daardie deel van Macedónië, ’n kolonie. En ons het in hierdie stad ’n paar dae deurgebring.

column2: Acts 16:13 And on the sabbath we went out of the city by a river side, where prayer was wont to be made; and we sat down, and spake unto the women which resorted [thither].
column3: Handelinge 16:13 En op die sabbatdag het ons uitgegaan buitekant die stad langs ’n rivier waar die gebruiklike bidplek was, en ons het gaan sit en met die vroue gespreek wat daar bymekaargekom het.

column2: Acts 16:14 And a certain woman named Lydia, a seller of purple, of the city of Thyatira, which worshipped God, heard [us]: whose heart the Lord opened, that she attended unto the things which were spoken of Paul.
column3: Handelinge 16:14 En ’n vrou met die naam van Lídia, ’n purperverkoopster van die stad Thiatíre, ’n godsdienstige vrou, het geluister; die Here het haar hart geopen om ag te gee op wat deur Paulus gesê is.

column2: Acts 16:15 And when she was baptized, and her household, she besought [us], saying, If ye have judged me to be faithful to the Lord, come into my house, and abide [there]. And she constrained us.
column3: Handelinge 16:15 En toe sy en haar huisgesin gedoop is, het sy by ons aangedring en gesê: As u oordeel dat ek in die Here glo, kom dan in my huis en bly daar. En sy het ons gedwing.

column2: Acts 16:16 And it came to pass, as we went to prayer, a certain damsel possessed with a spirit of divination met us, which brought her masters much gain by soothsaying:
column3: Handelinge 16:16 En terwyl ons op pad was na die bidplek, kom ’n slavin met ’n waarsêende gees ons teë, wat vir haar eienaars deur waarsêery groot wins ingebring het.

column2: Acts 16:17 The same followed Paul and us, and cried, saying, These men are the servants of the most high God, which shew unto us the way of salvation.
column3: Handelinge 16:17 Sy het Paulus en ons gevolg en geskreeu en gesê: Hierdie manne is dienaars van God, die Allerhoogste, en hulle verkondig aan julle die weg van verlossing.

column2: Acts 16:18 And this did she many days. But Paul, being grieved, turned and said to the spirit, I command thee in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her. And he came out the same hour.
column3: Handelinge 16:18 En dit het sy baie dae lank gedoen; maar baie ontevrede daaroor, het Paulus hom omgedraai en vir die gees gesê: Ek beveel jou in die Naam van Jesus Christus om uit haar uit te gaan. En hy het op dieselfde oomblik uitgegaan.

column2: Acts 16:19 And when her masters saw that the hope of their gains was gone, they caught Paul and Silas, and drew [them] into the marketplace unto the rulers,
column3: Handelinge 16:19 En toe haar eienaars sien dat die hoop van hulle wins weg was, het hulle Paulus en Silas gegryp en hulle na die mark voor die owerheid gesleep

column2: Acts 16:20 And brought them to the magistrates, saying, These men, being Jews, do exceedingly trouble our city,
column3: Handelinge 16:20 en hulle voor die regters gebring en gesê: Hierdie manne bring ons stad in opskudding, omdat hulle Jode is,

column2: Acts 16:21 And teach customs, which are not lawful for us to receive, neither to observe, being Romans.
column3: Handelinge 16:21 en hulle verkondig sedes wat vir ons nie geoorloof is om aan te neem of na te volg nie, omdat ons Romeine is.

column2: Acts 16:22 And the multitude rose up together against them: and the magistrates rent off their clothes, and commanded to beat [them].
column3: Handelinge 16:22 En die skare het saam teen hulle opgestaan, en die regters het hulle klere laat afskeur en bevel gegee om hulle met stokke te slaan.

column2: Acts 16:23 And when they had laid many stripes upon them, they cast [them] into prison, charging the jailor to keep them safely:
column3: Handelinge 16:23 En toe hulle hul baie slae gegee het, het hulle hul in die gevangenis gewerp en die tronkbewaarder bevel gegee om hulle sorgvuldig te bewaak.

column2: Acts 16:24 Who, having received such a charge, thrust them into the inner prison, and made their feet fast in the stocks.
column3: Handelinge 16:24 Hy het toe, omdat hy so ’n bevel ontvang het, hulle in die binneste gevangenis gewerp en hulle voete in die blok vasgemaak.

column2: Acts 16:25 And at midnight Paul and Silas prayed, and sang praises unto God: and the prisoners heard them.
column3: Handelinge 16:25 En omtrent middernag het Paulus en Silas gebid en lofliedere tot eer van God gesing; en die gevangenes het na hulle geluister.

column2: Acts 16:26 And suddenly there was a great earthquake, so that the foundations of the prison were shaken: and immediately all the doors were opened, and every one's bands were loosed.
column3: Handelinge 16:26 En skielik kom daar ’n groot aardbewing, sodat die fondamente van die gevangenis geskud het. En onmiddellik het al die deure oopgegaan en die boeie van almal het losgeraak.

column2: Acts 16:27 And the keeper of the prison awaking out of his sleep, and seeing the prison doors open, he drew out his sword, and would have killed himself, supposing that the prisoners had been fled.
column3: Handelinge 16:27 En die tronkbewaarder het wakker geword; en toe hy sien dat die deure van die gevangenis oop was, het hy ’n swaard getrek en wou homself om die lewe bring, in die mening dat die gevangenes ontvlug het.

column2: Acts 16:28 But Paul cried with a loud voice, saying, Do thyself no harm: for we are all here.
column3: Handelinge 16:28 Maar Paulus het met ’n groot stem geroep en gesê: Moenie jouself kwaad aandoen nie, want ons is almal hier.

column2: Acts 16:29 Then he called for a light, and sprang in, and came trembling, and fell down before Paul and Silas,
column3: Handelinge 16:29 En toe hy lig gevra het, spring hy na binne en val bewende voor Paulus en Silas neer.

column2: Acts 16:30 And brought them out, and said, Sirs, what must I do to be saved?
column3: Handelinge 16:30 En hy het hulle na buite gebring en gesê: Menere, wat moet ek doen om gered te word?

column2: Acts 16:31 And they said, Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ, and thou shalt be saved, and thy house.
column3: Handelinge 16:31 Toe sê hulle: Glo in die Here Jesus Christus en jy sal gered word, jy en jou huisgesin.

column2: Acts 16:32 And they spake unto him the word of the Lord, and to all that were in his house.
column3: Handelinge 16:32 En hulle het aan hom die woord van die Here verkondig en aan almal wat in sy huis was.

column2: Acts 16:33 And he took them the same hour of the night, and washed [their] stripes; and was baptized, he and all his, straightway.
column3: Handelinge 16:33 En in dieselfde uur van die nag het hy hulle geneem en hulle wonde gewas, en hy is onmiddellik gedoop, hy en al sy mense.

column2: Acts 16:34 And when he had brought them into his house, he set meat before them, and rejoiced, believing in God with all his house.
column3: Handelinge 16:34 Toe bring hy hulle in sy huis en sit hulle ’n maaltyd voor; en hy het hom verheug met sy hele huisgesin dat hy tot geloof in God gekom het.

column2: Acts 16:35 And when it was day, the magistrates sent the serjeants, saying, Let those men go.
column3: Handelinge 16:35 En toe dit dag word, stuur die regters die geregsdienaars en sê: Laat daardie manne los.

column2: Acts 16:36 And the keeper of the prison told this saying to Paul, The magistrates have sent to let you go: now therefore depart, and go in peace.
column3: Handelinge 16:36 En die tronkbewaarder het hierdie woorde aan Paulus oorgebring: Die regters het laat weet dat julle losgelaat moet word; gaan dan nou uit en reis in vrede!

column2: Acts 16:37 But Paul said unto them, They have beaten us openly uncondemned, being Romans, and have cast [us] into prison; and now do they thrust us out privily? nay verily; but let them come themselves and fetch us out.
column3: Handelinge 16:37 Maar Paulus sê vir hulle: Hulle het ons in die openbaar onveroordeeld geslaan, ons wat Romeinse burgers is, en ons in die gevangenis gewerp, en wil hulle ons nou in die geheim uitwerp? Volstrek nie! Laat hulle self kom en ons uitlei.

column2: Acts 16:38 And the serjeants told these words unto the magistrates: and they feared, when they heard that they were Romans.
column3: Handelinge 16:38 En die geregsdienaars het hierdie woorde aan die regters oorgebring, en dié het bang geword toe hulle hoor dat hulle Romeine was.

column2: Acts 16:39 And they came and besought them, and brought [them] out, and desired [them] to depart out of the city.
column3: Handelinge 16:39 Daarop het hulle gekom en hulle gesmeek en uitgelei met die versoek om uit die stad te vertrek.

column2: Acts 16:40 And they went out of the prison, and entered into [the house of] Lydia: and when they had seen the brethren, they comforted them, and departed.
column3: Handelinge 16:40 En nadat hulle die gevangenis verlaat het, het hulle na die huis van Lídia gegaan; en hulle het die broeders gesien, hulle bemoedig en weggegaan.

column2: Acts 17:1 Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where was a synagogue of the Jews:
column3: Handelinge 17:1 TOE het hulle deur Amfípolis en Apollónië gereis en in Thessaloníka gekom, waar ’n sinagoge van die Jode was.

column2: Acts 17:2 And Paul, as his manner was, went in unto them, and three sabbath days reasoned with them out of the scriptures,
column3: Handelinge 17:2 En volgens sy gewoonte het Paulus na hulle gegaan en drie sabbatte lank met hulle gespreek uit die Skrifte

column2: Acts 17:3 Opening and alleging, that Christ must needs have suffered, and risen again from the dead; and that this Jesus, whom I preach unto you, is Christ.
column3: Handelinge 17:3 en dit uitgelê en aangetoon dat die Christus moes ly en uit die dode opstaan, en gesê: Hierdie Jesus wat ek aan julle verkondig, is die Christus.

column2: Acts 17:4 And some of them believed, and consorted with Paul and Silas; and of the devout Greeks a great multitude, and of the chief women not a few.
column3: Handelinge 17:4 En sommige van hulle is oortuig en het hulle by Paulus en Silas aangesluit, ook ’n groot menigte van die godsdienstige Grieke en ’n groot aantal van die aansienlikste vroue.

column2: Acts 17:5 But the Jews which believed not, moved with envy, took unto them certain lewd fellows of the baser sort, and gathered a company, and set all the city on an uproar, and assaulted the house of Jason, and sought to bring them out to the people.
column3: Handelinge 17:5 Maar die ongelowige Jode was afgunstig en het slegte manne van die leeglopers saamgeneem en die stad in opskudding gebring deur ’n volksoploop te bewerk. En hulle het die huis van Jason aangeval en probeer om hulle voor die volk te bring.

column2: Acts 17:6 And when they found them not, they drew Jason and certain brethren unto the rulers of the city, crying, These that have turned the world upside down are come hither also;
column3: Handelinge 17:6 Maar toe hulle hul nie kry nie, het hulle Jason en ’n paar broeders na die stadsowerhede gesleep en geskreeu: Die mense wat die wêreld in opstand bring, hulle het hier ook gekom,

column2: Acts 17:7 Whom Jason hath received: and these all do contrary to the decrees of Caesar, saying that there is another king, [one] Jesus.
column3: Handelinge 17:7 en Jason het hulle ontvang. En hulle almal handel teen die bevele van die keiser en sê dat daar ’n ander koning is, naamlik Jesus.

column2: Acts 17:8 And they troubled the people and the rulers of the city, when they heard these things.
column3: Handelinge 17:8 En hulle het die skare in opskudding gebring en ook die stadsowerhede wat dit gehoor het.

column2: Acts 17:9 And when they had taken security of Jason, and of the other, they let them go.
column3: Handelinge 17:9 Maar toe hulle van Jason en die ander genoegsame waarborg ontvang het, het hulle hul losgelaat.

column2: Acts 17:10 And the brethren immediately sent away Paul and Silas by night unto Berea: who coming [thither] went into the synagogue of the Jews.
column3: Handelinge 17:10 Daarop het die broeders dadelik in die nag Paulus en Silas na Beréa weggestuur. En toe hulle daar kom, het hulle na die sinagoge van die Jode gegaan.

column2: Acts 17:11 These were more noble than those in Thessalonica, in that they received the word with all readiness of mind, and searched the scriptures daily, whether those things were so.
column3: Handelinge 17:11 En hierdie mense was edelmoediger as dié in Thessaloníka; hulle het die woord met alle welwillendheid ontvang en elke dag die Skrifte ondersoek of hierdie dinge so was.

column2: Acts 17:12 Therefore many of them believed; also of honourable women which were Greeks, and of men, not a few.
column3: Handelinge 17:12 Baie van hulle het dan ook gelowig geword, en van die aansienlike Grieke ’n groot aantal, vroue en manne.

column2: Acts 17:13 But when the Jews of Thessalonica had knowledge that the word of God was preached of Paul at Berea, they came thither also, and stirred up the people.
column3: Handelinge 17:13 Maar toe die Jode van Thessaloníka verneem het dat die woord van God ook in Beréa deur Paulus verkondig was, het hulle gekom en die skare ook daar opgesweep.

column2: Acts 17:14 And then immediately the brethren sent away Paul to go as it were to the sea: but Silas and Timotheus abode there still.
column3: Handelinge 17:14 Die broeders het Paulus toe dadelik weggestuur om in die rigting van die see te gaan, maar Silas en Timótheüs het daar gebly.

column2: Acts 17:15 And they that conducted Paul brought him unto Athens: and receiving a commandment unto Silas and Timotheus for to come to him with all speed, they departed.
column3: Handelinge 17:15 EN die wat Paulus begelei het, het hom tot by Athéne gebring, en nadat hulle opdrag ontvang het aan Silas en Timótheüs om so gou moontlik na hom te kom, het hulle vertrek.

column2: Acts 17:16 Now while Paul waited for them at Athens, his spirit was stirred in him, when he saw the city wholly given to idolatry.
column3: Handelinge 17:16 En terwyl Paulus in Athéne vir hulle wag, het sy gees in hom opstandig geword toe hy sien dat die stad vol afgodsbeelde was.

column2: Acts 17:17 Therefore disputed he in the synagogue with the Jews, and with the devout persons, and in the market daily with them that met with him.
column3: Handelinge 17:17 Hy het toe in die sinagoge met die Jode gespreek en met die godsdienstige mense, en elke dag op die mark met die wat hom teëkom.

column2: Acts 17:18 Then certain philosophers of the Epicureans, and of the Stoicks, encountered him. And some said, What will this babbler say? other some, He seemeth to be a setter forth of strange gods: because he preached unto them Jesus, and the resurrection.
column3: Handelinge 17:18 En sommige van die Epikuréïese en die Stoïsynse wysgere het met hom gestry, en sommige het gesê: Wat sou hierdie praatjiesmaker tog wil sê? Ander weer: Dit lyk of hy ’n verkondiger is van vreemde gode — omdat hy aan hulle die evangelie van Jesus en die opstanding verkondig het.

column2: Acts 17:19 And they took him, and brought him unto Areopagus, saying, May we know what this new doctrine, whereof thou speakest, [is]?
column3: Handelinge 17:19 En hulle het hom geneem en op die Areópagus gebring en gesê: Kan ons verneem wat hierdie nuwe leer is wat deur u verkondig word?

column2: Acts 17:20 For thou bringest certain strange things to our ears: we would know therefore what these things mean.
column3: Handelinge 17:20 Want u bring sekere vreemde dinge in ons ore. Ons wil dan weet wat dit tog kan wees.

column2: Acts 17:21 (For all the Athenians and strangers which were there spent their time in nothing else, but either to tell, or to hear some new thing.)
column3: Handelinge 17:21 Nou het al die Atheners en die uitlanders wat by hulle gewoon het, vir niks anders tyd gehad as om iets nuuts te sê en te hoor nie.

column2: Acts 17:22 Then Paul stood in the midst of Mars' hill, and said, [Ye] men of Athens, I perceive that in all things ye are too superstitious.
column3: Handelinge 17:22 Paulus gaan toe in die middel van die Areópagus staan en sê: Atheners, ek sien dat julle in elke opsig baie godsdienstig is.

column2: Acts 17:23 For as I passed by, and beheld your devotions, I found an altar with this inscription, TO THE UNKNOWN GOD. Whom therefore ye ignorantly worship, him declare I unto you.
column3: Handelinge 17:23 Want terwyl ek rondgegaan en julle heiligdomme aanskou het, het ek ook ’n altaar gevind waarop geskrywe is: Aan ’n onbekende God. Hom dan wat julle vereer sonder om Hom te ken, verkondig ek aan julle.

column2: Acts 17:24 God that made the world and all things therein, seeing that he is Lord of heaven and earth, dwelleth not in temples made with hands;
column3: Handelinge 17:24 Die God wat die wêreld gemaak het en alles wat daarin is, Hy wat Here van hemel en aarde is, woon nie in tempels met hande gemaak nie.

column2: Acts 17:25 Neither is worshipped with men's hands, as though he needed any thing, seeing he giveth to all life, and breath, and all things;
column3: Handelinge 17:25 Ook word Hy nie deur mensehande gedien asof Hy aan iets behoefte het nie, omdat Hy self aan almal lewe en asem en alles gee.

column2: Acts 17:26 And hath made of one blood all nations of men for to dwell on all the face of the earth, and hath determined the times before appointed, and the bounds of their habitation;
column3: Handelinge 17:26 En Hy het uit een bloed al die nasies van die mensdom gemaak om oor die hele aarde te woon, terwyl Hy vooraf bepaalde tye en die grense van hulle woonplek vasgestel het,

column2: Acts 17:27 That they should seek the Lord, if haply they might feel after him, and find him, though he be not far from every one of us:
column3: Handelinge 17:27 sodat hulle die Here kon soek, of hulle Hom miskien kon aanraak en vind, al is Hy nie ver van elkeen van ons nie;

column2: Acts 17:28 For in him we live, and move, and have our being; as certain also of your own poets have said, For we are also his offspring.
column3: Handelinge 17:28 want in Hom lewe ons, beweeg ons en is ons, soos sommige van julle digters ook gesê het: Want ons is ook sy geslag.

column2: Acts 17:29 Forasmuch then as we are the offspring of God, we ought not to think that the Godhead is like unto gold, or silver, or stone, graven by art and man's device.
column3: Handelinge 17:29 As ons dan die geslag van God is, moet ons nie dink dat die godheid aan goud of silwer of steen, die beeldwerk van menslike kuns en uitvinding, gelyk is nie.

column2: Acts 17:30 And the times of this ignorance God winked at; but now commandeth all men every where to repent:
column3: Handelinge 17:30 God het dan die tye van onkunde oorgesien en verkondig nou aan al die mense oral dat hulle hul moet bekeer,

column2: Acts 17:31 Because he hath appointed a day, in the which he will judge the world in righteousness by [that] man whom he hath ordained; [whereof] he hath given assurance unto all [men], in that he hath raised him from the dead.
column3: Handelinge 17:31 omdat Hy ’n dag bepaal het waarop Hy die wêreld in geregtigheid sal oordeel deur ’n Man wat Hy aangestel het, en Hy het hiervan aan almal sekerheid gegee deur Hom uit die dode op te wek.

column2: Acts 17:32 And when they heard of the resurrection of the dead, some mocked: and others said, We will hear thee again of this [matter].
column3: Handelinge 17:32 Maar toe hulle van die opstanding van die dode hoor, het sommige begin spot, en ander het gesê: Ons sal u weer hieromtrent hoor.

column2: Acts 17:33 So Paul departed from among them.
column3: Handelinge 17:33 En so het Paulus van hulle weggegaan.

column2: Acts 17:34 Howbeit certain men clave unto him, and believed: among the which [was] Dionysius the Areopagite, and a woman named Damaris, and others with them.
column3: Handelinge 17:34 Maar sommige manne het by hom aangesluit en gelowig geword, onder wie ook Dionísius, die Areopagiet, was, en ’n vrou met die naam van Dámaris en ander saam met hulle.

column2: Acts 18:1 After these things Paul departed from Athens, and came to Corinth;
column3: Handelinge 18:1 EN daarna het Paulus uit Athéne vertrek en in Korinthe gekom.

column2: Acts 18:2 And found a certain Jew named Aquila, born in Pontus, lately come from Italy, with his wife Priscilla; (because that Claudius had commanded all Jews to depart from Rome:) and came unto them.
column3: Handelinge 18:2 En hy het ’n Jood gevind met die naam van Áquila, afkomstig uit Pontus, wat onlangs met sy vrou Priscílla van Italië gekom het, omdat Claudius beveel het dat al die Jode uit Rome moes vertrek. Na hulle toe het hy gegaan;

column2: Acts 18:3 And because he was of the same craft, he abode with them, and wrought: for by their occupation they were tentmakers.
column3: Handelinge 18:3 en omdat hy van dieselfde ambag was, het hy by hulle gebly en gewerk, want hulle was tentmakers van ambag.

column2: Acts 18:4 And he reasoned in the synagogue every sabbath, and persuaded the Jews and the Greeks.
column3: Handelinge 18:4 En hy het elke sabbat in die sinagoge gespreek en Jode sowel as Grieke oortuig.

column2: Acts 18:5 And when Silas and Timotheus were come from Macedonia, Paul was pressed in the spirit, and testified to the Jews [that] Jesus [was] Christ.
column3: Handelinge 18:5 En toe Silas en Timótheüs van Macedónië afgekom het, was Paulus ywerig besig om aan die Jode kragtig te betuig dat Jesus die Christus is.

column2: Acts 18:6 And when they opposed themselves, and blasphemed, he shook [his] raiment, and said unto them, Your blood [be] upon your own heads; I [am] clean: from henceforth I will go unto the Gentiles.
column3: Handelinge 18:6 Maar toe hulle aanhou om teëstand te bied en godslasterlike dinge te spreek, het hy sy klere uitgeskud en vir hulle gesê: Julle bloed is op julle hoof. Ek is rein. Van nou af sal ek na die heidene gaan.

column2: Acts 18:7 And he departed thence, and entered into a certain [man's] house, named Justus, [one] that worshipped God, whose house joined hard to the synagogue.
column3: Handelinge 18:7 En hy het daarvandaan weggegaan en in die huis gekom van iemand met die naam van Justus, wat ’n godvresende man was, wie se huis naasaan die sinagoge gestaan het.

column2: Acts 18:8 And Crispus, the chief ruler of the synagogue, believed on the Lord with all his house; and many of the Corinthians hearing believed, and were baptized.
column3: Handelinge 18:8 En Crispus, die hoof van die sinagoge, het met sy hele huisgesin in die Here geglo; en ook baie van die Korinthiërs het, toe hulle hom hoor, gelowig geword en is gedoop.

column2: Acts 18:9 Then spake the Lord to Paul in the night by a vision, Be not afraid, but speak, and hold not thy peace:
column3: Handelinge 18:9 En die Here het deur ’n gesig in die nag aan Paulus gesê: Wees nie bevrees nie, maar spreek en moenie swyg nie;

column2: Acts 18:10 For I am with thee, and no man shall set on thee to hurt thee: for I have much people in this city.
column3: Handelinge 18:10 want Ek is met jou, en niemand sal die hand aan jou slaan om jou kwaad aan te doen nie, want Ek het baie mense in hierdie stad.

column2: Acts 18:11 And he continued [there] a year and six months, teaching the word of God among them.
column3: Handelinge 18:11 En hy het daar gebly ’n jaar en ses maande lank en die woord van God onder hulle geleer.

column2: Acts 18:12 And when Gallio was the deputy of Achaia, the Jews made insurrection with one accord against Paul, and brought him to the judgment seat,
column3: Handelinge 18:12 En toe Gállio goewerneur van Acháje was, het die Jode eenparig teen Paulus opgestaan en hom voor die regterstoel gebring

column2: Acts 18:13 Saying, This [fellow] persuadeth men to worship God contrary to the law.
column3: Handelinge 18:13 en gesê: Hierdie man haal die mense oor om God op onwettige wyse te vereer.

column2: Acts 18:14 And when Paul was now about to open [his] mouth, Gallio said unto the Jews, If it were a matter of wrong or wicked lewdness, O [ye] Jews, reason would that I should bear with you:
column3: Handelinge 18:14 En toe Paulus sy mond wou oopmaak, sê Gállio vir die Jode: As daar nou enige oortreding of kwaadwillige skelmstuk was, dan sou ek rede hê om julle te verdra, o Jode;

column2: Acts 18:15 But if it be a question of words and names, and [of] your law, look ye [to it]; for I will be no judge of such [matters].
column3: Handelinge 18:15 maar as dit ’n geskil is oor ’n woord en oor name en oor ’n wet wat vir julle geld, moet julle toesien, want daaroor wil ek geen regter wees nie.

column2: Acts 18:16 And he drave them from the judgment seat.
column3: Handelinge 18:16 En hy het hulle van die regterstoel weggedryf.

column2: Acts 18:17 Then all the Greeks took Sosthenes, the chief ruler of the synagogue, and beat [him] before the judgment seat. And Gallio cared for none of those things.
column3: Handelinge 18:17 En al die Grieke het Sósthenes, die hoof van die sinagoge, gegryp en hom voor die regterstoel geslaan; en Gállio het hom aan niks van hierdie dinge gesteur nie.

column2: Acts 18:18 And Paul [after this] tarried [there] yet a good while, and then took his leave of the brethren, and sailed thence into Syria, and with him Priscilla and Aquila; having shorn [his] head in Cenchrea: for he had a vow.
column3: Handelinge 18:18 En nadat Paulus nog verskeie dae daar gebly het, het hy van die broeders afskeid geneem en na Sírië uitgeseil, en saam met hom Priscílla en Áquila. En in Kenchréë het hy sy hoof geskeer, want hy het ’n gelofte gedoen.

column2: Acts 18:19 And he came to Ephesus, and left them there: but he himself entered into the synagogue, and reasoned with the Jews.
column3: Handelinge 18:19 En hy het in Éfese aangekom en hulle daar laat bly, maar self in die sinagoge gegaan en met die Jode gespreek.

column2: Acts 18:20 When they desired [him] to tarry longer time with them, he consented not;
column3: Handelinge 18:20 En toe hulle versoek dat hy langer by hulle moes vertoef, het hy nie toegestem nie,

column2: Acts 18:21 But bade them farewell, saying, I must by all means keep this feast that cometh in Jerusalem: but I will return again unto you, if God will. And he sailed from Ephesus.
column3: Handelinge 18:21 maar van hulle afskeid geneem en gesê: Ek moet sekerlik die komende fees in Jerusalem vier, maar ek sal weer na julle terugkom as God wil. En hy het van Éfese afgevaar.

column2: Acts 18:22 And when he had landed at Caesarea, and gone up, and saluted the church, he went down to Antioch.
column3: Handelinge 18:22 En toe hy in Cesaréa gekom het en opgegaan en die gemeente gegroet het, het hy afgereis na Antiochíë.

column2: Acts 18:23 And after he had spent some time [there], he departed, and went over [all] the country of Galatia and Phrygia in order, strengthening all the disciples.
column3: Handelinge 18:23 En nadat hy ’n tyd lank vertoef het, het hy vertrek en agtereenvolgens die land Galásië en Frígië deurgereis en al die dissipels versterk.

column2: Acts 18:24 And a certain Jew named Apollos, born at Alexandria, an eloquent man, [and] mighty in the scriptures, came to Ephesus.
column3: Handelinge 18:24 EN ’n sekere Jood met die naam van Apollos, wat in Alexandríë gebore was, ’n welsprekende man, het in Éfese aangekom; en hy was magtig in die Skrifte.

column2: Acts 18:25 This man was instructed in the way of the Lord; and being fervent in the spirit, he spake and taught diligently the things of the Lord, knowing only the baptism of John.
column3: Handelinge 18:25 Hy het onderrig ontvang in die weg van die Here; en vurig van gees, het hy gespreek en die dinge aangaande die Here noukeurig geleer, alhoewel hy net van die doop van Johannes geweet het.

column2: Acts 18:26 And he began to speak boldly in the synagogue: whom when Aquila and Priscilla had heard, they took him unto [them], and expounded unto him the way of God more perfectly.
column3: Handelinge 18:26 En hy het vrymoediglik in die sinagoge begin spreek; maar nadat Áquila en Priscílla hom gehoor het, het hulle hom by hulle geneem en hom noukeuriger die weg van God uitgelê.

column2: Acts 18:27 And when he was disposed to pass into Achaia, the brethren wrote, exhorting the disciples to receive him: who, when he was come, helped them much which had believed through grace:
column3: Handelinge 18:27 En toe hy wou deurgaan na Acháje, het die broeders hom aangemoedig en aan die dissipels geskrywe om hom te ontvang. En daar aangekom, was hy deur die genade die gelowiges tot veel nut;

column2: Acts 18:28 For he mightily convinced the Jews, [and that] publickly, shewing by the scriptures that Jesus was Christ.
column3: Handelinge 18:28 want hy het die Jode kragtig in die openbaar weerlê en deur die Skrifte bewys dat Jesus die Christus is.

column2: Acts 19:1 And it came to pass, that, while Apollos was at Corinth, Paul having passed through the upper coasts came to Ephesus: and finding certain disciples,
column3: Handelinge 19:1 EN terwyl Apollos in Korinthe was, het Paulus die boonste landstreke deurgereis en in Éfese gekom; en daar het hy sommige dissipels gevind

column2: Acts 19:2 He said unto them, Have ye received the Holy Ghost since ye believed? And they said unto him, We have not so much as heard whether there be any Holy Ghost.
column3: Handelinge 19:2 en hulle gevra: Het julle die Heilige Gees ontvang toe julle gelowig geword het? En hulle antwoord hom: Ons het nie eens gehoor dat daar ’n Heilige Gees is nie.

column2: Acts 19:3 And he said unto them, Unto what then were ye baptized? And they said, Unto John's baptism.
column3: Handelinge 19:3 En hy vra hulle: Met watter doop is julle dan gedoop? En hulle antwoord: Met die doop van Johannes.

column2: Acts 19:4 Then said Paul, John verily baptized with the baptism of repentance, saying unto the people, that they should believe on him which should come after him, that is, on Christ Jesus.
column3: Handelinge 19:4 Daarop sê Paulus: Johannes het met die doop van bekering gedoop en aan die volk gesê dat hulle moes glo in die Een wat ná hom kom, dit is in Christus Jesus.

column2: Acts 19:5 When they heard [this], they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.
column3: Handelinge 19:5 En toe hulle dit hoor, is hulle gedoop in die Naam van die Here Jesus.

column2: Acts 19:6 And when Paul had laid [his] hands upon them, the Holy Ghost came on them; and they spake with tongues, and prophesied.
column3: Handelinge 19:6 En Paulus het hulle die hande opgelê, en die Heilige Gees het op hulle gekom, en hulle het met tale gespreek en geprofeteer.

column2: Acts 19:7 And all the men were about twelve.
column3: Handelinge 19:7 En altesaam was hulle omtrent twaalf manne.

column2: Acts 19:8 And he went into the synagogue, and spake boldly for the space of three months, disputing and persuading the things concerning the kingdom of God.
column3: Handelinge 19:8 En hy het in die sinagoge ingegaan en vrymoediglik drie maande lank met hulle geredeneer en hulle probeer oortuig van die dinge wat die koninkryk van God aangaan.

column2: Acts 19:9 But when divers were hardened, and believed not, but spake evil of that way before the multitude, he departed from them, and separated the disciples, disputing daily in the school of one Tyrannus.
column3: Handelinge 19:9 Maar toe sommige hulle verhard en ongehoorsaam was en voor die menigte aanhou kwaadspreek van die Weg, het hy van hulle weggegaan en die dissipels afsonderlik geneem en elke dag in die skool van ’n sekere Tiránnus samesprekinge gehou.

column2: Acts 19:10 And this continued by the space of two years; so that all they which dwelt in Asia heard the word of the Lord Jesus, both Jews and Greeks.
column3: Handelinge 19:10 En dit het twee jaar lank geduur, sodat al die inwoners van Asië die woord van die Here Jesus gehoor het, Jode sowel as Grieke.

column2: Acts 19:11 And God wrought special miracles by the hands of Paul:
column3: Handelinge 19:11 En God het buitengewone kragte deur die hande van Paulus gedoen,

column2: Acts 19:12 So that from his body were brought unto the sick handkerchiefs or aprons, and the diseases departed from them, and the evil spirits went out of them.
column3: Handelinge 19:12 sodat selfs wanneer doeke of voorskote wat aan sy lyf was, op die siekes gelê is, die siektes van hulle gewyk en die bose geeste van hulle uitgegaan het.

column2: Acts 19:13 Then certain of the vagabond Jews, exorcists, took upon them to call over them which had evil spirits the name of the Lord Jesus, saying, We adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preacheth.
column3: Handelinge 19:13 En sommige van die rondtrekkende Jode, duiwelbesweerders, het dit gewaag om die Naam van die Here Jesus te noem oor die wat bose geeste gehad het, en te sê: Ons besweer julle by die Jesus wat Paulus verkondig!

column2: Acts 19:14 And there were seven sons of [one] Sceva, a Jew, [and] chief of the priests, which did so.
column3: Handelinge 19:14 Dit was sekere sewe seuns van Skeva, ’n Joodse owerpriester, wat dit gedoen het.

column2: Acts 19:15 And the evil spirit answered and said, Jesus I know, and Paul I know; but who are ye?
column3: Handelinge 19:15 Maar die bose gees het geantwoord en gesê: Jesus ken ek, en van Paulus weet ek, maar julle, wie is julle?

column2: Acts 19:16 And the man in whom the evil spirit was leaped on them, and overcame them, and prevailed against them, so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded.
column3: Handelinge 19:16 Toe spring die man in wie die bose gees was, op hulle en oormeester en oorweldig hulle, sodat hulle naak en gewond uit daardie huis gevlug het.

column2: Acts 19:17 And this was known to all the Jews and Greeks also dwelling at Ephesus; and fear fell on them all, and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified.
column3: Handelinge 19:17 En dit het bekend geword aan al die Jode en Grieke wat in Éfese woon, en vrees het op hulle almal geval, en die Naam van die Here Jesus is groot gemaak.

column2: Acts 19:18 And many that believed came, and confessed, and shewed their deeds.
column3: Handelinge 19:18 En baie van die wat gelowig geword het, het belydenis kom doen en hulle dade bekend gemaak;

column2: Acts 19:19 Many of them also which used curious arts brought their books together, and burned them before all [men]: and they counted the price of them, and found [it] fifty thousand [pieces] of silver.
column3: Handelinge 19:19 en verskeie van die wat met towery omgegaan het, het die boeke bymekaargebring en voor almal verbrand; en hulle het die waarde daarvan bereken en gevind dat dit vyftigduisend silwerstukke was.

column2: Acts 19:20 So mightily grew the word of God and prevailed.
column3: Handelinge 19:20 So het die woord van die Here met krag gegroei en sterk geword.

column2: Acts 19:21 After these things were ended, Paul purposed in the spirit, when he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia, to go to Jerusalem, saying, After I have been there, I must also see Rome.
column3: Handelinge 19:21 En toe hierdie dinge verby was, het Paulus hom voorgeneem om deur Macedónië en Acháje te gaan en na Jerusalem te reis. Hy het gesê: Nadat ek daar gewees het, moet ek Rome ook sien.

column2: Acts 19:22 So he sent into Macedonia two of them that ministered unto him, Timotheus and Erastus; but he himself stayed in Asia for a season.
column3: Handelinge 19:22 Daarop stuur hy twee van sy helpers, Timótheüs en Erástus, na Macedónië, terwyl hy self nog ’n tyd lank in Asië gebly het.

column2: Acts 19:23 And the same time there arose no small stir about that way.
column3: Handelinge 19:23 En omtrent hierdie tyd het daar geen klein opskudding met betrekking tot die Weg ontstaan nie.

column2: Acts 19:24 For a certain [man] named Demetrius, a silversmith, which made silver shrines for Diana, brought no small gain unto the craftsmen;
column3: Handelinge 19:24 Want iemand met die naam van Demétrius, ’n silwersmid, maker van silwertempeltjies van Diana, het ’n aansienlike verdienste aan die ambagsmanne verskaf.

column2: Acts 19:25 Whom he called together with the workmen of like occupation, and said, Sirs, ye know that by this craft we have our wealth.
column3: Handelinge 19:25 En toe hy hulle en die werkers in daardie soort bedrywe bymekaargeroep het, sê hy: Manne, julle weet dat ons welvaart uit hierdie verdienste is,

column2: Acts 19:26 Moreover ye see and hear, that not alone at Ephesus, but almost throughout all Asia, this Paul hath persuaded and turned away much people, saying that they be no gods, which are made with hands:
column3: Handelinge 19:26 en julle sien en hoor dat nie alleen in Éfese nie, maar byna in die hele Asië, hierdie Paulus ’n aansienlike skare oorgehaal en afvallig gemaak het deur te sê dat dit geen gode is wat met hande gemaak word nie.

column2: Acts 19:27 So that not only this our craft is in danger to be set at nought; but also that the temple of the great goddess Diana should be despised, and her magnificence should be destroyed, whom all Asia and the world worshippeth.
column3: Handelinge 19:27 Nou is daar nie alleen gevaar dat hierdie vak van ons in veragting kom nie, maar ook dat die tempel van die groot godin Diana as niks gereken word, en dat haar majesteit wat die hele Asië, ja, die wêreld, vereer, ook tot niet sal gaan.

column2: Acts 19:28 And when they heard [these sayings], they were full of wrath, and cried out, saying, Great [is] Diana of the Ephesians.
column3: Handelinge 19:28 En toe hulle dit hoor, is hulle met woede vervul en het geskreeu en gesê: Groot is die Diana van die Efésiërs!

column2: Acts 19:29 And the whole city was filled with confusion: and having caught Gaius and Aristarchus, men of Macedonia, Paul's companions in travel, they rushed with one accord into the theatre.
column3: Handelinge 19:29 Daarop raak die hele stad heeltemal in verwarring, en hulle storm soos een man na die skouburg en sleep Gajus en Aristárchus saam, Macedóniërs wat reisgenote van Paulus was.

column2: Acts 19:30 And when Paul would have entered in unto the people, the disciples suffered him not.
column3: Handelinge 19:30 En toe Paulus onder die volk wou ingaan, het die dissipels hom dit nie toegelaat nie.

column2: Acts 19:31 And certain of the chief of Asia, which were his friends, sent unto him, desiring [him] that he would not adventure himself into the theatre.
column3: Handelinge 19:31 En sommige van die owerstes van Asië wat sy vriende was, het ook na hom gestuur en hom gesmeek dat hy hom nie in die skouburg moes begeef nie.

column2: Acts 19:32 Some therefore cried one thing, and some another: for the assembly was confused; and the more part knew not wherefore they were come together.
column3: Handelinge 19:32 Hulle het dan aangehou skreeu, sommige dit en ander dat; want die vergadering was in die war, en die meeste het nie geweet waarvoor hulle bymekaargekom het nie.

column2: Acts 19:33 And they drew Alexander out of the multitude, the Jews putting him forward. And Alexander beckoned with the hand, and would have made his defence unto the people.
column3: Handelinge 19:33 En hulle het Alexander uit die skare vorentoe laat kom, omdat die Jode hom vorentoe gestoot het; en Alexander het met die hand gewink en wou hom by die volk verdedig.

column2: Acts 19:34 But when they knew that he was a Jew, all with one voice about the space of two hours cried out, Great [is] Diana of the Ephesians.
column3: Handelinge 19:34 Maar toe hulle verstaan dat hy ’n Jood is, gaan daar een geroep van almal op terwyl hulle omtrent twee uur lank skreeu: Groot is die Diana van die Efésiërs!

column2: Acts 19:35 And when the townclerk had appeased the people, he said, [Ye] men of Ephesus, what man is there that knoweth not how that the city of the Ephesians is a worshipper of the great goddess Diana, and of the [image] which fell down from Jupiter?
column3: Handelinge 19:35 Maar die stadsklerk het die skare tot bedaring gebring en gesê: Efésiërs, watter mens is daar tog wat nie weet dat die stad van die Efésiërs die tempelbewaarder is van die groot godin Diana en van die beeld wat uit die hemel geval het nie?

column2: Acts 19:36 Seeing then that these things cannot be spoken against, ye ought to be quiet, and to do nothing rashly.
column3: Handelinge 19:36 Terwyl dit dan nie weerspreek kan word nie, behoort julle rustig te wees en niks onbedags te doen nie.

column2: Acts 19:37 For ye have brought hither these men, which are neither robbers of churches, nor yet blasphemers of your goddess.
column3: Handelinge 19:37 Want julle het hierdie manne gebring, wat geen tempelrowers is nie en ook nie julle godin laster nie.

column2: Acts 19:38 Wherefore if Demetrius, and the craftsmen which are with him, have a matter against any man, the law is open, and there are deputies: let them implead one another.
column3: Handelinge 19:38 As Demétrius en sy ambagsmanne dan ’n saak teen iemand het, die hofsittings word gehou, en daar is regters: laat hulle mekaar aanklaag.

column2: Acts 19:39 But if ye enquire any thing concerning other matters, it shall be determined in a lawful assembly.
column3: Handelinge 19:39 Maar as julle nog iets anders verlang, dit sal in die wettige vergadering beslis word.

column2: Acts 19:40 For we are in danger to be called in question for this day's uproar, there being no cause whereby we may give an account of this concourse.
column3: Handelinge 19:40 Want ons loop gevaar om oor die oproer van vandag aangeklaag te word, aangesien daar geen grond is waarop ons sal kan rekenskap gee van hierdie oploop nie. En met hierdie woorde het hy die vergadering ontbind.

column2: Acts 19:41 And when he had thus spoken, he dismissed the assembly.
Acts 20:1 And after the uproar was ceased, Paul called unto [him] the disciples, and embraced [them], and departed for to go into Macedonia.
column3: Handelinge 20:1 EN nadat die oproer verby was, het Paulus die dissipels na hom geroep en gegroet en het vertrek om na Macedónië te reis.

column2: Acts 20:2 And when he had gone over those parts, and had given them much exhortation, he came into Greece,
column3: Handelinge 20:2 En hy het daardie streke deurgegaan, en nadat hy hulle met baie woorde bemoedig het, in Griekeland gekom.

column2: Acts 20:3 And [there] abode three months. And when the Jews laid wait for him, as he was about to sail into Syria, he purposed to return through Macedonia.
column3: Handelinge 20:3 En daar het hy drie maande gebly; maar toe die Jode teen hom saamgespan het, terwyl hy juis na Sírië sou afvaar, het hy besluit om deur Macedónië terug te gaan.

column2: Acts 20:4 And there accompanied him into Asia Sopater of Berea; and of the Thessalonians, Aristarchus and Secundus; and Gaius of Derbe, and Timotheus; and of Asia, Tychicus and Trophimus.
column3: Handelinge 20:4 En tot in Asië het Sópater van Beréa hom vergesel, en van die Thessalonicense, Aristárchus en Secúndus, en Gajus van Derbe en Timótheüs, en uit Asië Tíchikus en Trófimus.

column2: Acts 20:5 These going before tarried for us at Troas.
column3: Handelinge 20:5 Hulle het vooruitgegaan en in Troas op ons gewag.

column2: Acts 20:6 And we sailed away from Philippi after the days of unleavened bread, and came unto them to Troas in five days; where we abode seven days.
column3: Handelinge 20:6 Maar ná die dae van die ongesuurde brode het ons van Filíppi uitgeseil en binne vyf dae by hulle in Troas gekom waar ons sewe dae deurgebring het.

column2: Acts 20:7 And upon the first [day] of the week, when the disciples came together to break bread, Paul preached unto them, ready to depart on the morrow; and continued his speech until midnight.
column3: Handelinge 20:7 En op die eerste dag van die week, toe die dissipels vergader het om brood te breek, het Paulus hulle toegespreek, omdat hy die volgende dag sou vertrek en hy het sy rede gerek tot middernag toe.

column2: Acts 20:8 And there were many lights in the upper chamber, where they were gathered together.
column3: Handelinge 20:8 En daar was baie lampe in die bovertrek waar hulle vergader het.

column2: Acts 20:9 And there sat in a window a certain young man named Eutychus, being fallen into a deep sleep: and as Paul was long preaching, he sunk down with sleep, and fell down from the third loft, and was taken up dead.
column3: Handelinge 20:9 En ’n sekere jongman met die naam van Eútichus het in die venster gesit en weggesink in ’n diepe slaap; en toe Paulus nog lank gespreek het, is hy oorweldig deur die slaap en het van die derde verdieping afgeval en is dood opgetel.

column2: Acts 20:10 And Paul went down, and fell on him, and embracing [him] said, Trouble not yourselves; for his life is in him.
column3: Handelinge 20:10 Toe gaan Paulus ondertoe en val op hom en slaan sy arms om hom en sê: Moenie so te kere gaan nie, want sy lewe is in hom.

column2: Acts 20:11 When he therefore was come up again, and had broken bread, and eaten, and talked a long while, even till break of day, so he departed.
column3: Handelinge 20:11 En hy het boontoe gegaan en brood gebreek en geëet; en nadat hy nog ’n geruime tyd gespreek het tot dagbreek toe, het hy vertrek.

column2: Acts 20:12 And they brought the young man alive, and were not a little comforted.
column3: Handelinge 20:12 En hulle het die seun lewendig huis toe weggebring en was uitermate getroos.

column2: Acts 20:13 And we went before to ship, and sailed unto Assos, there intending to take in Paul: for so had he appointed, minding himself to go afoot.
column3: Handelinge 20:13 Maar ons het vooruit op die skip gegaan en afgevaar na Assus, waar ons van plan was om Paulus aan boord te neem; want so het hy dit bestel, omdat hy self te voet wou gaan.

column2: Acts 20:14 And when he met with us at Assos, we took him in, and came to Mitylene.
column3: Handelinge 20:14 Toe hy ons dan in Assus ontmoet, het ons hom aan boord geneem en by Mitiléne gekom.

column2: Acts 20:15 And we sailed thence, and came the next [day] over against Chios; and the next [day] we arrived at Samos, and tarried at Trogyllium; and the next [day] we came to Miletus.
column3: Handelinge 20:15 En daarvandaan het ons weggevaar en die volgende dag teenoor Chios gekom, en die ander dag na Samos oorgevaar en in Trogíllion oorgebly en die dag daarop by Miléte gekom.

column2: Acts 20:16 For Paul had determined to sail by Ephesus, because he would not spend the time in Asia: for he hasted, if it were possible for him, to be at Jerusalem the day of Pentecost.
column3: Handelinge 20:16 Want Paulus het besluit om by Éfese verby te vaar, sodat hy nie in Asië tyd sou verloor nie; want hy het hom gehaas om, as dit vir hom moontlik was, op die pinksterdag in Jerusalem te wees.

column2: Acts 20:17 And from Miletus he sent to Ephesus, and called the elders of the church.
column3: Handelinge 20:17 EN van Miléte het hy gestuur na Éfese en die ouderlinge van die gemeente laat roep.

column2: Acts 20:18 And when they were come to him, he said unto them, Ye know, from the first day that I came into Asia, after what manner I have been with you at all seasons,
column3: Handelinge 20:18 En toe hulle by hom kom, sê hy vir hulle: Julle weet hoe ek, van die eerste dag af dat ek in Asië aangekom het, die hele tyd by julle gewees het

column2: Acts 20:19 Serving the Lord with all humility of mind, and with many tears, and temptations, which befell me by the lying in wait of the Jews:
column3: Handelinge 20:19 en die Here gedien het met alle nederigheid en baie trane en beproewinge wat oor my gekom het deur die komplotte van die Jode;

column2: Acts 20:20 [And] how I kept back nothing that was profitable [unto you], but have shewed you, and have taught you publickly, and from house to house,
column3: Handelinge 20:20 hoe ek niks agtergehou het van wat nuttig is nie, om dit aan julle te verkondig en julle te onderrig in die openbaar en in julle huise,

column2: Acts 20:21 Testifying both to the Jews, and also to the Greeks, repentance toward God, and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ.
column3: Handelinge 20:21 terwyl ek kragtig by die Jode sowel as die Grieke aangedring het op die bekering tot God en die geloof in onse Here Jesus Christus.

column2: Acts 20:22 And now, behold, I go bound in the spirit unto Jerusalem, not knowing the things that shall befall me there:
column3: Handelinge 20:22 En kyk, ek gaan nou gebind deur die Gees na Jerusalem; en watter dinge my daar sal oorkom, weet ek nie,

column2: Acts 20:23 Save that the Holy Ghost witnesseth in every city, saying that bonds and afflictions abide me.
column3: Handelinge 20:23 behalwe dat die Heilige Gees in elke stad kragtig getuig en sê dat boeie en verdrukkinge my wag.

column2: Acts 20:24 But none of these things move me, neither count I my life dear unto myself, so that I might finish my course with joy, and the ministry, which I have received of the Lord Jesus, to testify the gospel of the grace of God.
column3: Handelinge 20:24 Maar ek bekommer my glad nie en ek ag ook my lewe vir myself nie dierbaar nie, sodat ek met blydskap my loopbaan kan volbring en die bediening wat ek van die Here Jesus ontvang het, om kragtig te getuig vir die evangelie van die genade van God.

column2: Acts 20:25 And now, behold, I know that ye all, among whom I have gone preaching the kingdom of God, shall see my face no more.
column3: Handelinge 20:25 En nou weet ek dat julle almal onder wie ek rondgegaan en die koninkryk van God verkondig het, my aangesig nie meer sal sien nie.

column2: Acts 20:26 Wherefore I take you to record this day, that I [am] pure from the blood of all [men].
column3: Handelinge 20:26 Daarom betuig ek aan julle op hierdie dag dat ek rein is van die bloed van almal.

column2: Acts 20:27 For I have not shunned to declare unto you all the counsel of God.
column3: Handelinge 20:27 Want ek het nie nagelaat om aan julle die hele raad van God te verkondig nie.

column2: Acts 20:28 Take heed therefore unto yourselves, and to all the flock, over the which the Holy Ghost hath made you overseers, to feed the church of God, which he hath purchased with his own blood.
column3: Handelinge 20:28 Gee dan ag op julleself en op die hele kudde waaroor die Heilige Gees julle as opsieners aangestel het om as herders die gemeente van God te versorg, wat Hy deur sy eie bloed verkry het.

column2: Acts 20:29 For I know this, that after my departing shall grievous wolves enter in among you, not sparing the flock.
column3: Handelinge 20:29 Want ek weet dit, dat ná my vertrek wrede wolwe onder julle sal inkom en die kudde nie sal spaar nie.

column2: Acts 20:30 Also of your own selves shall men arise, speaking perverse things, to draw away disciples after them.
column3: Handelinge 20:30 Ja, uit julle self sal daar manne opstaan wat verkeerde dinge praat om die dissipels weg te trek agter hulle aan.

column2: Acts 20:31 Therefore watch, and remember, that by the space of three years I ceased not to warn every one night and day with tears.
column3: Handelinge 20:31 Daarom moet julle waak en onthou dat ek drie jaar lank nag en dag nie opgehou het om elkeen met trane te vermaan nie.

column2: Acts 20:32 And now, brethren, I commend you to God, and to the word of his grace, which is able to build you up, and to give you an inheritance among all them which are sanctified.
column3: Handelinge 20:32 En nou, broeders, dra ek julle op aan God en aan die woord van sy genade, wat magtig is om julle op te bou en julle ’n erfdeel te gee onder al die geheiligdes.

column2: Acts 20:33 I have coveted no man's silver, or gold, or apparel.
column3: Handelinge 20:33 Niemand se silwer of goud of klere het ek begeer nie;

column2: Acts 20:34 Yea, ye yourselves know, that these hands have ministered unto my necessities, and to them that were with me.
column3: Handelinge 20:34 maar julle weet self dat hierdie hande voorsien het in die behoeftes van my en die wat by my was.

column2: Acts 20:35 I have shewed you all things, how that so labouring ye ought to support the weak, and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus, how he said, It is more blessed to give than to receive.
column3: Handelinge 20:35 Ek het julle in alles getoon dat ons deur so te arbei die swakkes moet help en die woorde van die Here Jesus moet onthou, dat Hy gesê het: Dit is saliger om te gee as om te ontvang.

column2: Acts 20:36 And when he had thus spoken, he kneeled down, and prayed with them all.
column3: Handelinge 20:36 En ná hierdie woorde het hy neergekniel en met hulle almal saam gebid.

column2: Acts 20:37 And they all wept sore, and fell on Paul's neck, and kissed him,
column3: Handelinge 20:37 En daar het ’n groot geween ontstaan van almal, en hulle het Paulus om die hals geval en hom gesoen,

column2: Acts 20:38 Sorrowing most of all for the words which he spake, that they should see his face no more. And they accompanied him unto the ship.
column3: Handelinge 20:38 veral bedroef oor die woord wat hy gesê het, dat hulle sy aangesig nie meer sou sien nie. En hulle het hom na die skip begelei.

column2: Acts 21:1 And it came to pass, that after we were gotten from them, and had launched, we came with a straight course unto Coos, and the [day] following unto Rhodes, and from thence unto Patara:
column3: Handelinge 21:1 EN nadat ons ons van hulle losgeskeur het, het ons afgevaar en reguit koers gehou en by Kos aangekom, en die volgende dag by Rhodus en daarvandaan by Pátara.

column2: Acts 21:2 And finding a ship sailing over unto Phenicia, we went aboard, and set forth.
column3: Handelinge 21:2 En ons het ’n skip gevind wat na Fenícië sou oorseil, en daarop gegaan en afgevaar.

column2: Acts 21:3 Now when we had discovered Cyprus, we left it on the left hand, and sailed into Syria, and landed at Tyre: for there the ship was to unlade her burden.
column3: Handelinge 21:3 En toe ons Ciprus in die gesig gekry het en dit aan die linkerhand laat lê het, het ons na Sírië gevaar en by Tirus aangekom, want daar sou die skip sy vrag aflaai.

column2: Acts 21:4 And finding disciples, we tarried there seven days: who said to Paul through the Spirit, that he should not go up to Jerusalem.
column3: Handelinge 21:4 En nadat ons die dissipels gevind het, het ons daar sewe dae gebly; en hulle het vir Paulus deur die Gees gesê om nie op te gaan na Jerusalem nie.

column2: Acts 21:5 And when we had accomplished those days, we departed and went our way; and they all brought us on our way, with wives and children, till [we were] out of the city: and we kneeled down on the shore, and prayed.
column3: Handelinge 21:5 Maar toe ons die dae uitgebly het, het ons vertrek en op reis gegaan, terwyl almal, met vroue en kinders, ons tot buitekant die stad begelei; en ons het op die strand neergekniel en gebid.

column2: Acts 21:6 And when we had taken our leave one of another, we took ship; and they returned home again.
column3: Handelinge 21:6 En nadat ons mekaar gegroet het, het ons aan boord gegaan, en hulle het teruggegaan huis toe.

column2: Acts 21:7 And when we had finished [our] course from Tyre, we came to Ptolemais, and saluted the brethren, and abode with them one day.
column3: Handelinge 21:7 Maar ons het die seereis van Tirus af voltooi en by Ptolemáis gekom; en ons het die broeders gegroet en een dag by hulle gebly.

column2: Acts 21:8 And the next [day] we that were of Paul's company departed, and came unto Caesarea: and we entered into the house of Philip the evangelist, which was [one] of the seven; and abode with him.
column3: Handelinge 21:8 En die volgende dag het ons, die geselskap van Paulus, vertrek en in Cesaréa aangekom; en ons het ons intrek geneem in die huis van Filippus, die evangelis, wat een van die sewe diakens was, en by hom gebly.

column2: Acts 21:9 And the same man had four daughters, virgins, which did prophesy.
column3: Handelinge 21:9 En hy het vier ongetroude dogters gehad wat die profetiese gawe besit het.

column2: Acts 21:10 And as we tarried [there] many days, there came down from Judaea a certain prophet, named Agabus.
column3: Handelinge 21:10 En onderwyl ons baie dae daar oorgebly het, het ’n sekere profeet met die naam van Ágabus van Judéa afgekom.

column2: Acts 21:11 And when he was come unto us, he took Paul's girdle, and bound his own hands and feet, and said, Thus saith the Holy Ghost, So shall the Jews at Jerusalem bind the man that owneth this girdle, and shall deliver [him] into the hands of the Gentiles.
column3: Handelinge 21:11 En toe hy by ons kom, neem hy die gordel van Paulus en bind sy eie hande en voete en sê: Dít spreek die Heilige Gees: So sal die Jode die man wie se gordel dit is, in Jerusalem bind en in die hande van heidene oorlewer.

column2: Acts 21:12 And when we heard these things, both we, and they of that place, besought him not to go up to Jerusalem.
column3: Handelinge 21:12 En toe ons dit hoor, het ons saam met die broeders van die plek hom gesmeek om nie op te gaan na Jerusalem nie.

column2: Acts 21:13 Then Paul answered, What mean ye to weep and to break mine heart? for I am ready not to be bound only, but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus.
column3: Handelinge 21:13 Maar Paulus het geantwoord: Wat doen julle dat julle ween en my hart week maak? Want ek is bereid nie alleen om gebind te word nie, maar ook om in Jerusalem te sterwe vir die Naam van die Here Jesus.

column2: Acts 21:14 And when he would not be persuaded, we ceased, saying, The will of the Lord be done.
column3: Handelinge 21:14 Toe hy dan nie oor te haal was nie, was ons tevrede en het gesê: Laat die wil van die Here geskied!

column2: Acts 21:15 And after those days we took up our carriages, and went up to Jerusalem.
column3: Handelinge 21:15 En ná hierdie dae het ons vir die reis klaargemaak en na Jerusalem opgegaan.

column2: Acts 21:16 There went with us also [certain] of the disciples of Caesarea, and brought with them one Mnason of Cyprus, an old disciple, with whom we should lodge.
column3: Handelinge 21:16 En sommige van die dissipels van Cesaréa het ook saam met ons gegaan en ons by ’n sekere Mnason van Ciprus gebring, ’n ou dissipel, by wie ons sou tuis gaan.

column2: Acts 21:17 And when we were come to Jerusalem, the brethren received us gladly.
column3: Handelinge 21:17 En toe ons in Jerusalem aankom, het die broeders ons met blydskap ontvang.

column2: Acts 21:18 And the [day] following Paul went in with us unto James; and all the elders were present.
column3: Handelinge 21:18 En op die volgende dag het Paulus saam met ons na Jakobus se huis gegaan, en al die ouderlinge was daar teenwoordig.

column2: Acts 21:19 And when he had saluted them, he declared particularly what things God had wrought among the Gentiles by his ministry.
column3: Handelinge 21:19 En nadat hy hulle gegroet het, het hy van stuk tot stuk vertel wat God onder die heidene deur sy diens gedoen het.

column2: Acts 21:20 And when they heard [it], they glorified the Lord, and said unto him, Thou seest, brother, how many thousands of Jews there are which believe; and they are all zealous of the law:
column3: Handelinge 21:20 En toe hulle dit hoor, het hulle die Here verheerlik en vir hom gesê: U sien, broeder, hoeveel duisende Jode daar is wat gelowig geword het, en almal is yweraars vir die wet.

column2: Acts 21:21 And they are informed of thee, that thou teachest all the Jews which are among the Gentiles to forsake Moses, saying that they ought not to circumcise [their] children, neither to walk after the customs.
column3: Handelinge 21:21 En hulle is aangaande u vertel dat u al die Jode onder die heidene leer om van Moses afvallig te word deur te sê dat hulle die kinders nie moet besny nie en ook nie volgens die sedes moet wandel nie.

column2: Acts 21:22 What is it therefore? the multitude must needs come together: for they will hear that thou art come.
column3: Handelinge 21:22 Wat staan ons dan te doen? Dit is dringend nodig dat die menigte bymekaarkom, want hulle sal hoor dat u gekom het.

column2: Acts 21:23 Do therefore this that we say to thee: We have four men which have a vow on them;
column3: Handelinge 21:23 Doen dan wat ons vir u sê. Ons het vier manne wat ’n gelofte gedoen het;

column2: Acts 21:24 Them take, and purify thyself with them, and be at charges with them, that they may shave [their] heads: and all may know that those things, whereof they were informed concerning thee, are nothing; but [that] thou thyself also walkest orderly, and keepest the law.
column3: Handelinge 21:24 neem hulle en heilig u saam met hulle en betaal die koste vir hulle, sodat hulle hul hoofde kan skeer en almal kan weet dat daar niks is in wat van u vertel word nie, maar dat u self ook wandel as een wat die wet onderhou.

column2: Acts 21:25 As touching the Gentiles which believe, we have written [and] concluded that they observe no such thing, save only that they keep themselves from [things] offered to idols, and from blood, and from strangled, and from fornication.
column3: Handelinge 21:25 Wat egter die gelowiges uit die heidene betref het ons geskrywe en besluit dat hulle niks van dié aard moet onderhou nie, maar hulle net moet onthou van afgodsoffers en bloed en van wat verwurg is, en van hoerery.

column2: Acts 21:26 Then Paul took the men, and the next day purifying himself with them entered into the temple, to signify the accomplishment of the days of purification, until that an offering should be offered for every one of them.
column3: Handelinge 21:26 Toe het Paulus die manne geneem en op die volgende dag hom saam met hulle geheilig en in die tempel gegaan om bekend te maak dat die dae van die heiliging sou voortduur totdat die offer vir elkeen van hulle gebring moes word.

column2: Acts 21:27 And when the seven days were almost ended, the Jews which were of Asia, when they saw him in the temple, stirred up all the people, and laid hands on him,
column3: Handelinge 21:27 Maar toe die sewe dae byna verby was, het die Jode van Asië hom in die tempel gesien en die hele skare oproerig gemaak en die hande aan hom geslaan

column2: Acts 21:28 Crying out, Men of Israel, help: This is the man, that teacheth all [men] every where against the people, and the law, and this place: and further brought Greeks also into the temple, and hath polluted this holy place.
column3: Handelinge 21:28 en geskreeu: Israeliete, help! Dit is die man wat oral aan almal dinge leer teen die volk en die wet en hierdie plek. Hy het ook nog Grieke in die tempel gebring en hierdie heilige plek ontheilig.

column2: Acts 21:29 (For they had seen before with him in the city Trophimus an Ephesian, whom they supposed that Paul had brought into the temple.)
column3: Handelinge 21:29 Want hulle het vantevore Trófimus, die Efésiër, in die stad by hom gesien en gedink dat Paulus hom in die tempel gebring het.

column2: Acts 21:30 And all the city was moved, and the people ran together: and they took Paul, and drew him out of the temple: and forthwith the doors were shut.
column3: Handelinge 21:30 Toe kom die hele stad in beweging, en daar was ’n oploop van die volk; en hulle het Paulus gegryp en hom buitekant die tempel gesleep; en dadelik is die deure gesluit.

column2: Acts 21:31 And as they went about to kill him, tidings came unto the chief captain of the band, that all Jerusalem was in an uproar.
column3: Handelinge 21:31 En onderwyl hulle probeer om hom dood te maak, het ’n berig die owerste oor duisend van die leërafdeling bereik dat die hele Jerusalem in oproer was.

column2: Acts 21:32 Who immediately took soldiers and centurions, and ran down unto them: and when they saw the chief captain and the soldiers, they left beating of Paul.
