column3: 1 Korinthiers 16:12 Met betrekking tot die broeder Apollos, by hom het ek sterk aangedring om saam met die broeders na julle te gaan; maar hy was heeltemal onwillig om nou te gaan; hy sal egter gaan wanneer die tyd vir hom geleë is.

column2: 1 Corinthians 16:13 Watch ye, stand fast in the faith, quit you like men, be strong.
column3: 1 Korinthiers 16:13 Waak, staan in die geloof, wees manlik, wees sterk.

column2: 1 Corinthians 16:14 Let all your things be done with charity.
column3: 1 Korinthiers 16:14 Laat alles by julle in liefde geskied.

column2: 1 Corinthians 16:15 I beseech you, brethren, (ye know the house of Stephanas, that it is the firstfruits of Achaia, and [that] they have addicted themselves to the ministry of the saints,)
column3: 1 Korinthiers 16:15 En ek versoek julle, broeders — julle weet dat die huisgesin van Stéfanas die eersteling van Acháje is en dat hulle hul tot diens van die heiliges gestel het —

column2: 1 Corinthians 16:16 That ye submit yourselves unto such, and to every one that helpeth with [us], and laboureth.
column3: 1 Korinthiers 16:16 dat julle ook onderworpe moet wees aan sulke mense en aan elkeen wat saamwerk en arbei.

column2: 1 Corinthians 16:17 I am glad of the coming of Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus: for that which was lacking on your part they have supplied.
column3: 1 Korinthiers 16:17 En ek verbly my oor die aankoms van Stéfanas en Fortunátus en Acháïcus, omdat hulle my gemis aan julle vergoed het.

column2: 1 Corinthians 16:18 For they have refreshed my spirit and yours: therefore acknowledge ye them that are such.
column3: 1 Korinthiers 16:18 Want hulle het my gees verkwik en julle s’n ook. Erken sulke manne dan.

column2: 1 Corinthians 16:19 The churches of Asia salute you. Aquila and Priscilla salute you much in the Lord, with the church that is in their house.
column3: 1 Korinthiers 16:19 Die gemeentes van Asië groet julle. Áquila en Priscílla saam met die gemeente wat in hulle huis is, laat vir julle baie groete weet in die Here.

column2: 1 Corinthians 16:20 All the brethren greet you. Greet ye one another with an holy kiss.
column3: 1 Korinthiers 16:20 Al die broeders groet julle. Groet mekaar met ’n heilige kus.

column2: 1 Corinthians 16:21 The salutation of [me] Paul with mine own hand.
column3: 1 Korinthiers 16:21 Die groete van Paulus, met my eie hand.

column2: 1 Corinthians 16:22 If any man love not the Lord Jesus Christ, let him be Anathema Maranatha.
column3: 1 Korinthiers 16:22 As iemand die Here Jesus Christus nie liefhet nie, laat hom ’n vervloeking wees! Maranáta!

column2: 1 Corinthians 16:23 The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ [be] with you.
column3: 1 Korinthiers 16:23 Die genade van die Here Jesus Christus sy met julle!

column2: 1 Corinthians 16:24 My love [be] with you all in Christ Jesus. Amen. <<[The first [epistle] to the Corinthians was written from Philippi by Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus and Timotheus.]>>
column3: 1 Korinthiers 16:24 My liefde met julle almal in Christus Jesus! Amen.

column2: 2 Corinthians 1:1 Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothy [our] brother, unto the church of God which is at Corinth, with all the saints which are in all Achaia:
column3: 2 Korinthiers 1:1 PAULUS, ’n apostel van Jesus Christus deur die wil van God, en Timótheüs, die broeder, aan die gemeente van God wat in Korinthe is, saam met al die heiliges wat in die hele Acháje is:

column2: 2 Corinthians 1:2 Grace [be] to you and peace from God our Father, and [from] the Lord Jesus Christ.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 1:2 Genade vir julle en vrede van God, onse Vader, en die Here Jesus Christus.

column2: 2 Corinthians 1:3 Blessed [be] God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies, and the God of all comfort;
column3: 2 Korinthiers 1:3 GESEËND is die God en Vader van onse Here Jesus Christus, die Vader van ontferminge en die God van alle vertroosting,

column2: 2 Corinthians 1:4 Who comforteth us in all our tribulation, that we may be able to comfort them which are in any trouble, by the comfort wherewith we ourselves are comforted of God.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 1:4 wat ons troos in al ons verdrukking, sodat ons die wat in allerhande verdrukking is, kan troos deur die vertroosting waarmee ons self deur God getroos word.

column2: 2 Corinthians 1:5 For as the sufferings of Christ abound in us, so our consolation also aboundeth by Christ.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 1:5 Want soos die lyde van Christus oorvloedig is in ons, so is ons troos ook oorvloedig deur Christus.

column2: 2 Corinthians 1:6 And whether we be afflicted, [it is] for your consolation and salvation, which is effectual in the enduring of the same sufferings which we also suffer: or whether we be comforted, [it is] for your consolation and salvation.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 1:6 Maar of ons verdruk word, dit is julle tot troos en redding; en dit laat sy werking blyk deurdat julle dieselfde lyding verduur wat ons ook ondergaan; en of ons getroos word, dit is julle tot troos en redding.

column2: 2 Corinthians 1:7 And our hope of you [is] stedfast, knowing, that as ye are partakers of the sufferings, so [shall ye be] also of the consolation.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 1:7 En ons hoop vir julle is vas, omdat ons weet dat net soos julle deelgenote is aan die lyding, so ook aan die troos.

column2: 2 Corinthians 1:8 For we would not, brethren, have you ignorant of our trouble which came to us in Asia, that we were pressed out of measure, above strength, insomuch that we despaired even of life:
column3: 2 Korinthiers 1:8 Want ons wil nie hê, broeders, dat julle onbekend moet wees met ons verdrukking wat oor ons in Asië gekom het nie, dat ons dit bo ons krag uitermate swaar gehad het, sodat ons selfs aan ons lewe gewanhoop het.

column2: 2 Corinthians 1:9 But we had the sentence of death in ourselves, that we should not trust in ourselves, but in God which raiseth the dead:
column3: 2 Korinthiers 1:9 Ja, ons het al self by onsself die doodvonnis oor ons gehad, sodat ons nie op onsself sou vertrou nie, maar op God wat die dode opwek;

column2: 2 Corinthians 1:10 Who delivered us from so great a death, and doth deliver: in whom we trust that he will yet deliver [us];
column3: 2 Korinthiers 1:10 wat ons verlos het uit so ’n groot doodsgevaar en nog verlos; op wie ons hoop dat Hy ook nog sal verlos,

column2: 2 Corinthians 1:11 Ye also helping together by prayer for us, that for the gift [bestowed] upon us by the means of many persons thanks may be given by many on our behalf.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 1:11 terwyl julle ook vir ons saamwerk deur die gebed, sodat daar vir die genadegawe aan ons deur baie persone op baie maniere vir ons gedank mag word.

column2: 2 Corinthians 1:12 For our rejoicing is this, the testimony of our conscience, that in simplicity and godly sincerity, not with fleshly wisdom, but by the grace of God, we have had our conversation in the world, and more abundantly to you-ward.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 1:12 WANT ons roem is dit: die getuienis van ons gewete dat ons in eenvoudigheid en reinheid van God, nie in vleeslike wysheid nie, maar in die genade van God in die wêreld verkeer het, en veral by julle.

column2: 2 Corinthians 1:13 For we write none other things unto you, than what ye read or acknowledge; and I trust ye shall acknowledge even to the end;
column3: 2 Korinthiers 1:13 Want ons skryf aan julle niks anders as wat julle lees of ook verstaan nie, en ek hoop dat julle dit ook tot die einde toe sal verstaan,

column2: 2 Corinthians 1:14 As also ye have acknowledged us in part, that we are your rejoicing, even as ye also [are] ours in the day of the Lord Jesus.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 1:14 soos julle ook gedeeltelik van ons verstaan het dat ons julle roem is, net soos julle ook ons roem is in die dag van die Here Jesus.

column2: 2 Corinthians 1:15 And in this confidence I was minded to come unto you before, that ye might have a second benefit;
column3: 2 Korinthiers 1:15 En in hierdie vertroue wou ek vroeër na julle kom, dat julle ’n tweede genade kan ontvang,

column2: 2 Corinthians 1:16 And to pass by you into Macedonia, and to come again out of Macedonia unto you, and of you to be brought on my way toward Judaea.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 1:16 en by julle langs deurgaan na Macedónië, om weer van Macedónië af by julle te kom en deur julle voortgehelp te word na Judéa.

column2: 2 Corinthians 1:17 When I therefore was thus minded, did I use lightness? or the things that I purpose, do I purpose according to the flesh, that with me there should be yea yea, and nay nay?
column3: 2 Korinthiers 1:17 Het ek dan miskien ligsinnig gehandel toe ek my dit voorgeneem het? Of wat ek my voorneem, neem ek my dit voor na die vlees sodat by my tegelyk is: ja ja, en nee nee?

column2: 2 Corinthians 1:18 But [as] God [is] true, our word toward you was not yea and nay.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 1:18 So waar as God getrou is — ons woord tot julle was nie ja en nee nie!

column2: 2 Corinthians 1:19 For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, who was preached among you by us, [even] by me and Silvanus and Timotheus, was not yea and nay, but in him was yea.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 1:19 Want die Seun van God, Jesus Christus, wat deur ons onder julle verkondig is, deur my en Silvánus en Timótheüs, was nie ja en nee nie, maar was ja in Hom.

column2: 2 Corinthians 1:20 For all the promises of God in him [are] yea, and in him Amen, unto the glory of God by us.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 1:20 Want hoeveel beloftes van God daar ook mag wees, in Hom is hulle ja en in Hom amen, tot heerlikheid van God deur ons.

column2: 2 Corinthians 1:21 Now he which stablisheth us with you in Christ, and hath anointed us, [is] God;
column3: 2 Korinthiers 1:21 Maar Hy wat ons saam met julle bevestig in Christus en ons gesalf het, is God,

column2: 2 Corinthians 1:22 Who hath also sealed us, and given the earnest of the Spirit in our hearts.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 1:22 wat ons ook verseël het en die Gees as onderpand in ons harte gegee het.

column2: 2 Corinthians 1:23 Moreover I call God for a record upon my soul, that to spare you I came not as yet unto Corinth.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 1:23 Maar ek roep God as getuie aan oor my siel dat ek om julle te spaar nog nie na Korinthe gekom het nie —

column2: 2 Corinthians 1:24 Not for that we have dominion over your faith, but are helpers of your joy: for by faith ye stand.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 1:24 nie dat ons heers oor julle geloof nie, maar ons is medewerkers aan julle blydskap; want in die geloof staan julle vas.

column2: 2 Corinthians 2:1 But I determined this with myself, that I would not come again to you in heaviness.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 2:1 MAAR dit het ek by myself besluit, om nie weer in droefheid na julle te kom nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 2:2 For if I make you sorry, who is he then that maketh me glad, but the same which is made sorry by me?
column3: 2 Korinthiers 2:2 Want as ek julle bedroef maak, wie is hy dan wat my kan verbly anders as hy wat deur my bedroef gemaak is?

column2: 2 Corinthians 2:3 And I wrote this same unto you, lest, when I came, I should have sorrow from them of whom I ought to rejoice; having confidence in you all, that my joy is [the joy] of you all.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 2:3 En ek het juis dit aan julle geskrywe, dat ek nie by my koms droefheid mag hê deur hulle oor wie ek my moes verbly nie, omdat ek die vertroue in julle almal het dat my blydskap dié van julle almal is.

column2: 2 Corinthians 2:4 For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote unto you with many tears; not that ye should be grieved, but that ye might know the love which I have more abundantly unto you.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 2:4 Want uit groot verdrukking en benoudheid van hart het ek aan julle geskrywe, onder baie trane, nie dat julle bedroef mag word nie, maar dat julle mag weet van die liefde wat ek oorvloedig vir julle het.

column2: 2 Corinthians 2:5 But if any have caused grief, he hath not grieved me, but in part: that I may not overcharge you all.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 2:5 Maar as iemand droefheid veroorsaak het, dan het hy my nie bedroef nie, maar — ek wil nie oordryf nie — min of meer julle almal.

column2: 2 Corinthians 2:6 Sufficient to such a man [is] this punishment, which [was inflicted] of many.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 2:6 Vir so iemand is daardie bestraffing deur die meerderheid genoeg;

column2: 2 Corinthians 2:7 So that contrariwise ye [ought] rather to forgive [him], and comfort [him], lest perhaps such a one should be swallowed up with overmuch sorrow.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 2:7 sodat julle daarenteen hom liewer moet vergewe en vertroos, dat so iemand nie miskien deur al te groot droefheid verteer word nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 2:8 Wherefore I beseech you that ye would confirm [your] love toward him.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 2:8 Daarom vermaan ek julle om die liefde aan hom te bevestig.

column2: 2 Corinthians 2:9 For to this end also did I write, that I might know the proof of you, whether ye be obedient in all things.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 2:9 Want daarom het ek ook geskrywe om julle beproefdheid te weet, of julle in alles gehoorsaam is.

column2: 2 Corinthians 2:10 To whom ye forgive any thing, I [forgive] also: for if I forgave any thing, to whom I forgave [it], for your sakes [forgave I it] in the person of Christ;
column3: 2 Korinthiers 2:10 Aan wie julle iets vergewe, vergeef ek ook; want wie ek ook vergeef het — as ek iets vergeef het — dit was om julle ontwil voor die aangesig van Christus, sodat ons nie deur die Satan bedrieg sou word nie;

column2: 2 Corinthians 2:11 Lest Satan should get an advantage of us: for we are not ignorant of his devices.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 2:11 want ons is met sy planne nie onbekend nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 2:12 Furthermore, when I came to Troas to [preach] Christ's gospel, and a door was opened unto me of the Lord,
column3: 2 Korinthiers 2:12 Maar toe ek in Troas gekom het om die evangelie van Christus te verkondig, hoewel ’n deur vir my in die Here geopen was, het ek geen rus vir my gees gehad nie, omdat ek my broeder Titus nie aangetref het nie;

column2: 2 Corinthians 2:13 I had no rest in my spirit, because I found not Titus my brother: but taking my leave of them, I went from thence into Macedonia.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 2:13 maar ek het van hulle afskeid geneem en na Macedónië vertrek.

column2: 2 Corinthians 2:14 Now thanks [be] unto God, which always causeth us to triumph in Christ, and maketh manifest the savour of his knowledge by us in every place.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 2:14 MAAR God sy dank wat ons altyd laat triomfeer in Christus en wat die reuk van sy kennis deur ons oral versprei.

column2: 2 Corinthians 2:15 For we are unto God a sweet savour of Christ, in them that are saved, and in them that perish:
column3: 2 Korinthiers 2:15 Want ons is ’n aangename geur van Christus tot eer van God onder die wat gered word en onder die wat verlore gaan;

column2: 2 Corinthians 2:16 To the one [we are] the savour of death unto death; and to the other the savour of life unto life. And who [is] sufficient for these things?
column3: 2 Korinthiers 2:16 vir die laaste ’n reuk van die dood tot die dood, maar vir die eerste ’n reuk van die lewe tot die lewe. En wie is tot hierdie dinge bekwaam?

column2: 2 Corinthians 2:17 For we are not as many, which corrupt the word of God: but as of sincerity, but as of God, in the sight of God speak we in Christ.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 2:17 Want ons is nie soos baie wat handel dryf met die woord van God nie; maar as uit opregtheid, maar as uit God, in die teenwoordigheid van God, spreek ons in Christus.

column2: 2 Corinthians 3:1 Do we begin again to commend ourselves? or need we, as some [others], epistles of commendation to you, or [letters] of commendation from you?
column3: 2 Korinthiers 3:1 BEGIN ons weer om onsself aan te beveel? Of het ons miskien, soos sommige, aanbevelingsbriewe nodig aan julle of van julle?

column2: 2 Corinthians 3:2 Ye are our epistle written in our hearts, known and read of all men:
column3: 2 Korinthiers 3:2 Julle is ons brief, geskrywe in ons harte, geken en gelees deur alle mense;

column2: 2 Corinthians 3:3 [Forasmuch as ye are] manifestly declared to be the epistle of Christ ministered by us, written not with ink, but with the Spirit of the living God; not in tables of stone, but in fleshy tables of the heart.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 3:3 omdat julle duidelik ’n brief van Christus is deur ons diens berei, geskrywe nie met ink nie, maar met die Gees van die lewende God; nie op kliptafels nie, maar op die vleestafels van die hart.

column2: 2 Corinthians 3:4 And such trust have we through Christ to God-ward:
column3: 2 Korinthiers 3:4 So ’n vertroue het ons deur Christus by God.

column2: 2 Corinthians 3:5 Not that we are sufficient of ourselves to think any thing as of ourselves; but our sufficiency [is] of God;
column3: 2 Korinthiers 3:5 Nie dat ons uit onsself bekwaam is om iets as uit onsself te bedink nie, maar ons bekwaamheid is uit God,

column2: 2 Corinthians 3:6 Who also hath made us able ministers of the new testament; not of the letter, but of the spirit: for the letter killeth, but the spirit giveth life.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 3:6 wat ons ook bekwaam gemaak het as dienaars van ’n nuwe testament, nie van die letter nie, maar van die gees; want die letter maak dood, maar die gees maak lewend.

column2: 2 Corinthians 3:7 But if the ministration of death, written [and] engraven in stones, was glorious, so that the children of Israel could not stedfastly behold the face of Moses for the glory of his countenance; which [glory] was to be done away:
column3: 2 Korinthiers 3:7 En as die bediening van die dood, met letters op klippe gegraveer, in heerlikheid was, sodat die kinders van Israel nie die oë kon vestig op die aangesig van Moses nie vanweë die heerlikheid van sy aangesig, wat tog moes vergaan,

column2: 2 Corinthians 3:8 How shall not the ministration of the spirit be rather glorious?
column3: 2 Korinthiers 3:8 hoeveel te meer sal die bediening van die Gees dan nie in heerlikheid wees nie?

column2: 2 Corinthians 3:9 For if the ministration of condemnation [be] glory, much more doth the ministration of righteousness exceed in glory.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 3:9 Want as die bediening wat veroordeel, heerlikheid was, veel meer is die bediening wat regverdig maak, oorvloedig in heerlikheid.

column2: 2 Corinthians 3:10 For even that which was made glorious had no glory in this respect, by reason of the glory that excelleth.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 3:10 Want wat verheerlik was, is ook in hierdie geval nie verheerlik nie, vanweë die alles oortreffende heerlikheid.

column2: 2 Corinthians 3:11 For if that which is done away [was] glorious, much more that which remaineth [is] glorious.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 3:11 Want as wat moes vergaan, met heerlikheid was, veel meer is wat moet bly, in heerlikheid.

column2: 2 Corinthians 3:12 Seeing then that we have such hope, we use great plainness of speech:
column3: 2 Korinthiers 3:12 Terwyl ons dan sodanige hoop het, gebruik ons baie vrymoedigheid;

column2: 2 Corinthians 3:13 And not as Moses, [which] put a vail over his face, that the children of Israel could not stedfastly look to the end of that which is abolished:
column3: 2 Korinthiers 3:13 nie soos Moses nie, wat ’n bedekking oor sy aangesig gesit het, sodat die kinders van Israel nie die oë kon vestig op die einde van wat moes vergaan nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 3:14 But their minds were blinded: for until this day remaineth the same vail untaken away in the reading of the old testament; which [vail] is done away in Christ.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 3:14 Maar hulle sinne is verhard. Want tot vandag toe bly by die lesing van die Ou Testament dieselfde bedekking sonder dat dit opgelig word, die bedekking wat in Christus vernietig word.

column2: 2 Corinthians 3:15 But even unto this day, when Moses is read, the vail is upon their heart.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 3:15 Ja, tot vandag toe, wanneer Moses gelees word, lê daar ’n bedekking oor hulle hart;

column2: 2 Corinthians 3:16 Nevertheless when it shall turn to the Lord, the vail shall be taken away.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 3:16 maar wanneer hulle tot die Here bekeer is, word die bedekking weggeneem.

column2: 2 Corinthians 3:17 Now the Lord is that Spirit: and where the Spirit of the Lord [is], there [is] liberty.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 3:17 Die Here is die Gees, en waar die Gees van die Here is, daar is vryheid.

column2: 2 Corinthians 3:18 But we all, with open face beholding as in a glass the glory of the Lord, are changed into the same image from glory to glory, [even] as by the Spirit of the Lord.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 3:18 En terwyl ons almal met onbedekte gesig soos in ’n spieël die heerlikheid van die Here aanskou, word ons van gedaante verander na dieselfde beeld, van heerlikheid tot heerlikheid, as deur die Here wat die Gees is.

column2: 2 Corinthians 4:1 Therefore seeing we have this ministry, as we have received mercy, we faint not;
column3: 2 Korinthiers 4:1 DAAROM, aangesien ons hierdie bediening het volgens die barmhartigheid wat ons ontvang het, gee ons nie moed op nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 4:2 But have renounced the hidden things of dishonesty, not walking in craftiness, nor handling the word of God deceitfully; but by manifestation of the truth commending ourselves to every man's conscience in the sight of God.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 4:2 Maar ons het van die heimlike dinge wat skandelik is, afstand gedoen, en ons wandel nie in listigheid of vervals die woord van God nie; maar deur die waarheid aan die lig te bring, beveel ons ons by elke menslike gewete voor God aan.

column2: 2 Corinthians 4:3 But if our gospel be hid, it is hid to them that are lost:
column3: 2 Korinthiers 4:3 Maar as ons evangelie dan nog bedek is, is dit bedek in die wat verlore gaan,

column2: 2 Corinthians 4:4 In whom the god of this world hath blinded the minds of them which believe not, lest the light of the glorious gospel of Christ, who is the image of God, should shine unto them.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 4:4 naamlik die ongelowiges in wie die god van hierdie wêreld die sinne verblind het, sodat die verligting van die evangelie van die heerlikheid van Christus, wat die beeld van God is, op hulle nie sou skyn nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 4:5 For we preach not ourselves, but Christ Jesus the Lord; and ourselves your servants for Jesus' sake.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 4:5 Want ons verkondig nie onsself nie, maar Christus Jesus as Here, en onsself as julle diensknegte om Jesus wil.

column2: 2 Corinthians 4:6 For God, who commanded the light to shine out of darkness, hath shined in our hearts, to [give] the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 4:6 Want God wat gesê het dat daar uit duisternis lig moet skyn — dit is Hy wat in ons harte geskyn het om die verligting te bring van die kennis van die heerlikheid van God in die aangesig van Jesus Christus.

column2: 2 Corinthians 4:7 But we have this treasure in earthen vessels, that the excellency of the power may be of God, and not of us.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 4:7 Maar ons het hierdie skat in erdekruike, sodat die voortreflikheid van die krag van God mag wees en nie uit ons nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 4:8 [We are] troubled on every side, yet not distressed; [we are] perplexed, but not in despair;
column3: 2 Korinthiers 4:8 In alles word ons verdruk, maar ons is nie terneergedruk nie; ons is verleë, maar nie radeloos nie;

column2: 2 Corinthians 4:9 Persecuted, but not forsaken; cast down, but not destroyed;
column3: 2 Korinthiers 4:9 vervolg, maar nie verlate nie; neergewerp, maar nie vernietig nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 4:10 Always bearing about in the body the dying of the Lord Jesus, that the life also of Jesus might be made manifest in our body.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 4:10 Gedurig dra ons die doding van die Here Jesus in die liggaam om, sodat ook die lewe van Christus in ons liggaam openbaar kan word.

column2: 2 Corinthians 4:11 For we which live are alway delivered unto death for Jesus' sake, that the life also of Jesus might be made manifest in our mortal flesh.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 4:11 Want altyd word ons wat lewe, oorgelewer in die dood om Jesus wil, sodat ook die lewe van Jesus in ons sterflike vlees openbaar kan word.

column2: 2 Corinthians 4:12 So then death worketh in us, but life in you.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 4:12 So werk die dood dan in ons, maar die lewe in julle.

column2: 2 Corinthians 4:13 We having the same spirit of faith, according as it is written, I believed, and therefore have I spoken; we also believe, and therefore speak;
column3: 2 Korinthiers 4:13 En omdat ons dieselfde Gees van die geloof het — soos geskrywe is: Ek het geglo, daarom het ek gespreek — glo ons ook, daarom spreek ons ook.

column2: 2 Corinthians 4:14 Knowing that he which raised up the Lord Jesus shall raise up us also by Jesus, and shall present [us] with you.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 4:14 Want ons weet dat Hy wat die Here Jesus opgewek het, ons ook deur Jesus sal opwek en saam met julle voor Hom sal stel.

column2: 2 Corinthians 4:15 For all things [are] for your sakes, that the abundant grace might through the thanksgiving of many redound to the glory of God.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 4:15 Want dit is alles om julle ontwil, sodat die genade, wat groter geword het deur so baie mense, die danksegging oorvloedig kan maak tot die heerlikheid van God.

column2: 2 Corinthians 4:16 For which cause we faint not; but though our outward man perish, yet the inward [man] is renewed day by day.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 4:16 DAAROM gee ons nie moed op nie, maar al vergaan ons uiterlike mens ook, nogtans word die innerlike mens dag ná dag vernuwe.

column2: 2 Corinthians 4:17 For our light affliction, which is but for a moment, worketh for us a far more exceeding [and] eternal weight of glory;
column3: 2 Korinthiers 4:17 Want ons ligte verdrukking wat vir ’n oomblik is, bewerk vir ons ’n alles oortreffende ewige gewig van heerlikheid;

column2: 2 Corinthians 4:18 While we look not at the things which are seen, but at the things which are not seen: for the things which are seen [are] temporal; but the things which are not seen [are] eternal.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 4:18 omdat ons nie let op die sigbare dinge nie, maar op die onsigbare; want die sigbare dinge is tydelik, maar die onsigbare ewig.

column2: 2 Corinthians 5:1 For we know that if our earthly house of [this] tabernacle were dissolved, we have a building of God, an house not made with hands, eternal in the heavens.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 5:1 WANT ons weet dat as ons aardse tentwoning afgebreek word, ons ’n gebou het van God, ’n huis nie met hande gemaak nie, ewig, in die hemele.

column2: 2 Corinthians 5:2 For in this we groan, earnestly desiring to be clothed upon with our house which is from heaven:
column3: 2 Korinthiers 5:2 Want om hierdie rede sug ons ook en verlang om met ons woning uit die hemel oorklee te word,

column2: 2 Corinthians 5:3 If so be that being clothed we shall not be found naked.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 5:3 as ons ten minste gekleed en nie naak bevind sal word nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 5:4 For we that are in [this] tabernacle do groan, being burdened: not for that we would be unclothed, but clothed upon, that mortality might be swallowed up of life.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 5:4 Want ons wat nog in die tent is, sug en voel beswaard, omdat ons liewer nie ontklee nie, maar oorklee wil word, sodat die sterflike deur die lewe verslind kan word.

column2: 2 Corinthians 5:5 Now he that hath wrought us for the selfsame thing [is] God, who also hath given unto us the earnest of the Spirit.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 5:5 Maar Hy wat ons juis hiervoor toeberei het, is God, wat ons ook die Gees as onderpand gegee het.

column2: 2 Corinthians 5:6 Therefore [we are] always confident, knowing that, whilst we are at home in the body, we are absent from the Lord:
column3: 2 Korinthiers 5:6 Daarom het ons altyd goeie moed en weet dat as ons in die liggaam inwoon, ons van die Here uitwoon.

column2: 2 Corinthians 5:7 (For we walk by faith, not by sight:)
column3: 2 Korinthiers 5:7 Want ons wandel deur geloof en nie deur aanskouing nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 5:8 We are confident, [I say], and willing rather to be absent from the body, and to be present with the Lord.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 5:8 Maar ons het goeie moed en verkies om liewer uit die liggaam uit te woon en by die Here in te woon.

column2: 2 Corinthians 5:9 Wherefore we labour, that, whether present or absent, we may be accepted of him.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 5:9 Daarom lê ons ons ook ywerig daarop toe, of ons inwoon of uitwoon, om Hom welbehaaglik te wees.

column2: 2 Corinthians 5:10 For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ; that every one may receive the things [done] in [his] body, according to that he hath done, whether [it be] good or bad.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 5:10 Want ons moet almal voor die regterstoel van Christus verskyn, sodat elkeen kan ontvang wat hy deur die liggaam verrig het, volgens wat hy gedoen het, of dit goed is of kwaad.

column2: 2 Corinthians 5:11 Knowing therefore the terror of the Lord, we persuade men; but we are made manifest unto God; and I trust also are made manifest in your consciences.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 5:11 OMDAT ons dan die vrees van die Here ken, probeer ons om die mense te oortuig; maar voor God is ons openbaar, en ek hoop om ook in julle gewetens openbaar te wees.

column2: 2 Corinthians 5:12 For we commend not ourselves again unto you, but give you occasion to glory on our behalf, that ye may have somewhat to [answer] them which glory in appearance, and not in heart.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 5:12 Want ons beveel ons nie weer by julle aan nie, maar ons gee julle aanleiding tot roem oor ons, sodat julle iets kan hê teenoor die wat hulle op die uiterlike beroem en nie op die hart nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 5:13 For whether we be beside ourselves, [it is] to God: or whether we be sober, [it is] for your cause.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 5:13 Want as ons uitsinnig is, is dit tot eer van God; en as ons by ons verstand is, is dit om julle ontwil.

column2: 2 Corinthians 5:14 For the love of Christ constraineth us; because we thus judge, that if one died for all, then were all dead:
column3: 2 Korinthiers 5:14 Want die liefde van Christus dring ons,

column2: 2 Corinthians 5:15 And [that] he died for all, that they which live should not henceforth live unto themselves, but unto him which died for them, and rose again.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 5:15 omdat ons van oordeel is, dat as een vir almal gesterf het, hulle dan almal gesterf het; en Hy het vir almal gesterwe, sodat die wat lewe, nie meer vir hulself moet lewe nie, maar vir Hom wat vir hulle gesterf het en opgewek is.

column2: 2 Corinthians 5:16 Wherefore henceforth know we no man after the flesh: yea, though we have known Christ after the flesh, yet now henceforth know we [him] no more.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 5:16 Ons ken dus van nou af niemand meer na die vlees nie; en al het ons ook Christus na die vlees geken, nou ken ons Hom tóg nie meer so nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 5:17 Therefore if any man [be] in Christ, [he is] a new creature: old things are passed away; behold, all things are become new.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 5:17 Daarom, as iemand in Christus is, is hy ’n nuwe skepsel; die ou dinge het verbygegaan, kyk, dit het alles nuut geword.

column2: 2 Corinthians 5:18 And all things [are] of God, who hath reconciled us to himself by Jesus Christ, and hath given to us the ministry of reconciliation;
column3: 2 Korinthiers 5:18 En dit alles is uit God wat ons met Homself versoen het deur Jesus Christus en ons die bediening van die versoening gegee het,

column2: 2 Corinthians 5:19 To wit, that God was in Christ, reconciling the world unto himself, not imputing their trespasses unto them; and hath committed unto us the word of reconciliation.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 5:19 naamlik dat God in Christus die wêreld met Homself versoen het deur hulle hul misdade nie toe te reken nie en die woord van die versoening aan ons toe te vertrou.

column2: 2 Corinthians 5:20 Now then we are ambassadors for Christ, as though God did beseech [you] by us: we pray [you] in Christ's stead, be ye reconciled to God.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 5:20 Ons tree dan op as gesante om Christus wil, asof God deur ons vermaan. Ons bid julle om Christus wil: Laat julle met God versoen.

column2: 2 Corinthians 5:21 For he hath made him [to be] sin for us, who knew no sin; that we might be made the righteousness of God in him.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 5:21 Want Hy het Hom wat geen sonde geken het nie, sonde vir ons gemaak, sodat ons kan word geregtigheid van God in Hom.

column2: 2 Corinthians 6:1 We then, [as] workers together [with him], beseech [you] also that ye receive not the grace of God in vain.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 6:1 EN as medewerkers vermaan ons julle ook dat julle die genade van God nie tevergeefs mag ontvang nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 6:2 (For he saith, I have heard thee in a time accepted, and in the day of salvation have I succoured thee: behold, now [is] the accepted time; behold, now [is] the day of salvation.)
column3: 2 Korinthiers 6:2 Want Hy sê: In die tyd van die welbehae het Ek jou verhoor, en in die dag van heil het Ek jou gehelp. Kyk, nou is dit die tyd van die welbehae; kyk, nou is die dag van heil.

column2: 2 Corinthians 6:3 Giving no offence in any thing, that the ministry be not blamed:
column3: 2 Korinthiers 6:3 Ons lê nie die minste hindernis in die weg nie, sodat die bediening nie beklad mag word nie;

column2: 2 Corinthians 6:4 But in all [things] approving ourselves as the ministers of God, in much patience, in afflictions, in necessities, in distresses,
column3: 2 Korinthiers 6:4 maar in alles beveel ons ons aan as dienaars van God, met baie geduld, in verdrukkinge, in node, in benoudhede;

column2: 2 Corinthians 6:5 In stripes, in imprisonments, in tumults, in labours, in watchings, in fastings;
column3: 2 Korinthiers 6:5 in slae, in gevangenskappe, in oproere, in arbeid, in slapelose nagte, in hongerly;

column2: 2 Corinthians 6:6 By pureness, by knowledge, by longsuffering, by kindness, by the Holy Ghost, by love unfeigned,
column3: 2 Korinthiers 6:6 in reinheid, in kennis, in lankmoedigheid, in vriendelikheid, in die Heilige Gees, in ongeveinsde liefde;

column2: 2 Corinthians 6:7 By the word of truth, by the power of God, by the armour of righteousness on the right hand and on the left,
column3: 2 Korinthiers 6:7 in die woord van waarheid, in die krag van God, deur die wapens van die geregtigheid in die regter- en linkerhand;

column2: 2 Corinthians 6:8 By honour and dishonour, by evil report and good report: as deceivers, and [yet] true;
column3: 2 Korinthiers 6:8 deur eer en oneer, deur slegte en goeie gerug, as verleiers en tog waaragtig;

column2: 2 Corinthians 6:9 As unknown, and [yet] well known; as dying, and, behold, we live; as chastened, and not killed;
column3: 2 Korinthiers 6:9 as onbekendes en tog goed bekend, as sterwendes en kyk, ons lewe, as getugtig en tog nie gedood nie;

column2: 2 Corinthians 6:10 As sorrowful, yet alway rejoicing; as poor, yet making many rich; as having nothing, and [yet] possessing all things.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 6:10 as bedroefdes, maar altyd opgeruimd; as armes, maar wat baie ander ryk maak; as mense wat niks het nie en tog alles besit.

column2: 2 Corinthians 6:11 O [ye] Corinthians, our mouth is open unto you, our heart is enlarged.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 6:11 ONS mond het teenoor julle oopgegaan, Korinthiërs, ons hart het verruim geword.

column2: 2 Corinthians 6:12 Ye are not straitened in us, but ye are straitened in your own bowels.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 6:12 Nie in ons het julle dit te nou nie, maar in jul binneste het julle dit te nou.

column2: 2 Corinthians 6:13 Now for a recompence in the same, (I speak as unto [my] children,) be ye also enlarged.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 6:13 Maar by wyse van vergoeding — ek praat soos met kinders — moet julle ook verruim word.

column2: 2 Corinthians 6:14 Be ye not unequally yoked together with unbelievers: for what fellowship hath righteousness with unrighteousness? and what communion hath light with darkness?
column3: 2 Korinthiers 6:14 Moenie in dieselfde juk trek saam met ongelowiges nie, want watter deelgenootskap het die geregtigheid met die ongeregtigheid, en watter gemeenskap het die lig met die duisternis?

column2: 2 Corinthians 6:15 And what concord hath Christ with Belial? or what part hath he that believeth with an infidel?
column3: 2 Korinthiers 6:15 En watter ooreenstemming het Christus met Bélial, of watter aandeel het die gelowige met die ongelowige?

column2: 2 Corinthians 6:16 And what agreement hath the temple of God with idols? for ye are the temple of the living God; as God hath said, I will dwell in them, and walk in [them]; and I will be their God, and they shall be my people.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 6:16 Of watter ooreenkoms het die tempel van God met die afgode? Want julle is die tempel van die lewende God, soos God gespreek het: Ek sal in hulle woon en onder hulle wandel, en Ek sal hulle God wees, en hulle sal vir My ’n volk wees.

column2: 2 Corinthians 6:17 Wherefore come out from among them, and be ye separate, saith the Lord, and touch not the unclean [thing]; and I will receive you,
column3: 2 Korinthiers 6:17 Daarom, gaan onder hulle uit en sonder julle af, spreek die Here; en raak nie aan wat onrein is nie, en Ek sal julle aanneem;

column2: 2 Corinthians 6:18 And will be a Father unto you, and ye shall be my sons and daughters, saith the Lord Almighty.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 6:18 en Ek sal vir julle ’n Vader wees, en julle sal vir My seuns en dogters wees, spreek die Here, die Almagtige.

column2: 2 Corinthians 7:1 Having therefore these promises, dearly beloved, let us cleanse ourselves from all filthiness of the flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in the fear of God.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 7:1 TERWYL ons dan hierdie beloftes het, geliefdes, laat ons ons van alle besoedeling van die vlees en die gees reinig, en laat ons die heiligmaking in die vrees van God volbring.

column2: 2 Corinthians 7:2 Receive us; we have wronged no man, we have corrupted no man, we have defrauded no man.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 7:2 MAAK vir ons ruimte in julle harte. Ons het niemand onreg aangedoen nie, ons het niemand benadeel nie, ons het op niemand voordeel behaal nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 7:3 I speak not [this] to condemn [you]: for I have said before, that ye are in our hearts to die and live with [you].
column3: 2 Korinthiers 7:3 Ek sê dit nie om te veroordeel nie, want ek het vantevore gesê dat julle in ons harte is om saam te sterwe en saam te lewe.

column2: 2 Corinthians 7:4 Great [is] my boldness of speech toward you, great [is] my glorying of you: I am filled with comfort, I am exceeding joyful in all our tribulation.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 7:4 Ek het groot vrymoedigheid teenoor julle; my roem oor julle is groot; ek is vervul met troos; ek loop oor van blydskap in al ons verdrukking.

column2: 2 Corinthians 7:5 For, when we were come into Macedonia, our flesh had no rest, but we were troubled on every side; without [were] fightings, within [were] fears.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 7:5 Want ook toe ons in Macedónië gekom het, het ons vlees geen rus gehad nie, maar ons is op allerhande maniere verdruk; van buite was daar aanvegtinge, van binne verskrikkinge.

column2: 2 Corinthians 7:6 Nevertheless God, that comforteth those that are cast down, comforted us by the coming of Titus;
column3: 2 Korinthiers 7:6 Maar Hy wat die nederige troos, naamlik God, het ons getroos deur die koms van Titus;

column2: 2 Corinthians 7:7 And not by his coming only, but by the consolation wherewith he was comforted in you, when he told us your earnest desire, your mourning, your fervent mind toward me; so that I rejoiced the more.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 7:7 en nie deur sy koms alleen nie, maar ook deur die troos waarmee hy oor julle getroos is, deurdat hy aan ons berig gebring het van julle verlange, julle verdriet, julle ywer vir my, sodat ek my nog meer verbly het.

column2: 2 Corinthians 7:8 For though I made you sorry with a letter, I do not repent, though I did repent: for I perceive that the same epistle hath made you sorry, though [it were] but for a season.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 7:8 Want, al het ek julle ook deur die brief bedroef gemaak, is ek nie jammer nie, al was ek ook jammer. Want ek sien dat daardie brief, al was dit vir ’n kort tydjie, julle bedroef gemaak het.

column2: 2 Corinthians 7:9 Now I rejoice, not that ye were made sorry, but that ye sorrowed to repentance: for ye were made sorry after a godly manner, that ye might receive damage by us in nothing.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 7:9 Nou is ek bly, nie omdat julle bedroef was nie, maar omdat julle bedroef was tot bekering, want julle was bedroef volgens die wil van God, sodat julle deur ons in niks skade gely het nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 7:10 For godly sorrow worketh repentance to salvation not to be repented of: but the sorrow of the world worketh death.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 7:10 Want die droefheid volgens die wil van God werk ’n onberoulike bekering tot redding, maar die droefheid van die wêreld werk die dood.

column2: 2 Corinthians 7:11 For behold this selfsame thing, that ye sorrowed after a godly sort, what carefulness it wrought in you, yea, [what] clearing of yourselves, yea, [what] indignation, yea, [what] fear, yea, [what] vehement desire, yea, [what] zeal, yea, [what] revenge! In all [things] ye have approved yourselves to be clear in this matter.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 7:11 Want kyk, juis dit, dat julle bedroef geword het volgens die wil van God — wat ’n groot ywer het dit in julle gewerk, ja, verantwoording, verontwaardiging, vrees, verlange, ywer, bestraffing. In alles het julle bewys dat julle in die saak rein is.

column2: 2 Corinthians 7:12 Wherefore, though I wrote unto you, [I did it] not for his cause that had done the wrong, nor for his cause that suffered wrong, but that our care for you in the sight of God might appear unto you.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 7:12 Al het ek ook aan julle geskrywe, dan was dit nie ter wille van hom wat onreg gedoen het nie, of ter wille van hom wat onreg gely het nie, maar dat ons ywer vir julle aan julle duidelik kan word voor God.

column2: 2 Corinthians 7:13 Therefore we were comforted in your comfort: yea, and exceedingly the more joyed we for the joy of Titus, because his spirit was refreshed by you all.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 7:13 Daarom is ons getroos oor julle vertroosting en het veral bly geword oor die blydskap van Titus, omdat sy gees deur julle almal verkwik is.

column2: 2 Corinthians 7:14 For if I have boasted any thing to him of you, I am not ashamed; but as we spake all things to you in truth, even so our boasting, which [I made] before Titus, is found a truth.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 7:14 Want as ek iets by hom oor julle geroem het, is ek nie beskaam nie; maar soos ons alles met waarheid tot julle gespreek het, so het ook ons roem by Titus waarheid geword.

column2: 2 Corinthians 7:15 And his inward affection is more abundant toward you, whilst he remembereth the obedience of you all, how with fear and trembling ye received him.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 7:15 En sy hart is julle veral toegeneë as hy hom die gehoorsaamheid van julle almal herinner, hoe julle hom met vrees en bewing ontvang het.

column2: 2 Corinthians 7:16 I rejoice therefore that I have confidence in you in all [things].
column3: 2 Korinthiers 7:16 Ek verbly my dus dat ek my in alle opsigte op julle kan verlaat.

column2: 2 Corinthians 8:1 Moreover, brethren, we do you to wit of the grace of God bestowed on the churches of Macedonia;
column3: 2 Korinthiers 8:1 EN ons maak julle bekend, broeders, die genade van God wat aan die gemeentes van Macedónië geskenk is,

column2: 2 Corinthians 8:2 How that in a great trial of affliction the abundance of their joy and their deep poverty abounded unto the riches of their liberality.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 8:2 dat onder baie beproewing deur verdrukking hulle oorvloedige blydskap by hulle diepe armoede oorvloedig was in hulle ryke milddadigheid.

column2: 2 Corinthians 8:3 For to [their] power, I bear record, yea, and beyond [their] power [they were] willing of themselves;
column3: 2 Korinthiers 8:3 Want hulle was na vermoë — ek betuig dit — ja, bo vermoë gewillig,

column2: 2 Corinthians 8:4 Praying us with much intreaty that we would receive the gift, and [take upon us] the fellowship of the ministering to the saints.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 8:4 en het ons met groot aandrang gesmeek dat ons hulle gawe en hulle deel in die diensbetoning aan die heiliges moet ontvang;

column2: 2 Corinthians 8:5 And [this they did], not as we hoped, but first gave their own selves to the Lord, and unto us by the will of God.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 8:5 en het nie alleen gedoen soos ons verwag het nie, maar het hulself eers aan die Here gegee, en toe aan ons deur die wil van God,

column2: 2 Corinthians 8:6 Insomuch that we desired Titus, that as he had begun, so he would also finish in you the same grace also.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 8:6 sodat ons Titus versoek het dat hy, net soos hy tevore begin het, so ook by julle nog hierdie liefdedaad moet volbring.

column2: 2 Corinthians 8:7 Therefore, as ye abound in every [thing, in] faith, and utterance, and knowledge, and [in] all diligence, and [in] your love to us, [see] that ye abound in this grace also.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 8:7 Maar soos julle in alles oorvloedig is — in geloof en woord en kennis en alle ywer en in julle liefde vir ons — sorg dat julle ook in hierdie liefdedaad oorvloedig is.

column2: 2 Corinthians 8:8 I speak not by commandment, but by occasion of the forwardness of others, and to prove the sincerity of your love.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 8:8 Ek sê dit nie as ’n bevel nie, maar om deur die ywer van ander ook die egtheid van julle liefde op die proef te stel.

column2: 2 Corinthians 8:9 For ye know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that, though he was rich, yet for your sakes he became poor, that ye through his poverty might be rich.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 8:9 Want julle ken die genade van onse Here Jesus Christus, dat Hy, alhoewel Hy ryk was, ter wille van julle arm geword het, sodat julle deur sy armoede ryk kan word.

column2: 2 Corinthians 8:10 And herein I give [my] advice: for this is expedient for you, who have begun before, not only to do, but also to be forward a year ago.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 8:10 En ek gee in hierdie saak my oordeel, want dit is voordelig vir julle, omdat julle alreeds ’n jaar gelede begin het, nie alleen om te doen nie, maar ook om te wil.

column2: 2 Corinthians 8:11 Now therefore perform the doing [of it]; that as [there was] a readiness to will, so [there may be] a performance also out of that which ye have.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 8:11 Maar voltooi nou die daad ook, sodat, net soos die bereidheid om te wil daar was, so ook die voltooiing kan wees uit wat julle besit.

column2: 2 Corinthians 8:12 For if there be first a willing mind, [it is] accepted according to that a man hath, [and] not according to that he hath not.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 8:12 Want as die bereidwilligheid daar is, is dit welgevallig volgens wat iemand besit, nie volgens wat hy nie besit nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 8:13 For [I mean] not that other men be eased, and ye burdened:
column3: 2 Korinthiers 8:13 Want ek bedoel nie dat daar vir ander verligting moet wees en vir julle verdrukking nie,

column2: 2 Corinthians 8:14 But by an equality, [that] now at this time your abundance [may be a supply] for their want, that their abundance also may be [a supply] for your want: that there may be equality:
column3: 2 Korinthiers 8:14 maar dat volgens gelykheid julle oorvloed in hierdie tyd hulle gebrek kan aanvul, sodat ook hulle oorvloed julle gebrek kan aanvul en daar gelykheid kan wees.

column2: 2 Corinthians 8:15 As it is written, He that [had gathered] much had nothing over; and he that [had gathered] little had no lack.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 8:15 Soos geskrywe is: Hy wat baie gehad het, het nie te veel gehad nie; en hy wat weinig gehad het, het nie te min gehad nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 8:16 But thanks [be] to God, which put the same earnest care into the heart of Titus for you.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 8:16 Maar God sy dank, wat dieselfde ywer vir julle in die hart van Titus gegee het;

column2: 2 Corinthians 8:17 For indeed he accepted the exhortation; but being more forward, of his own accord he went unto you.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 8:17 want hy het my aansporing wel ontvang, maar omdat hy baie ywerig was, het hy uit eie beweging na julle toe vertrek.

column2: 2 Corinthians 8:18 And we have sent with him the brother, whose praise [is] in the gospel throughout all the churches;
column3: 2 Korinthiers 8:18 En ons het ook met hom die broeder saamgestuur wat lof het in die evangelie deur al die gemeentes.

column2: 2 Corinthians 8:19 And not [that] only, but who was also chosen of the churches to travel with us with this grace, which is administered by us to the glory of the same Lord, and [declaration of] your ready mind:
column3: 2 Korinthiers 8:19 En dit nie alleen nie, maar hy is ook deur die gemeentes gekies as ons reisgenoot in verband met hierdie liefdewerk wat deur ons berei word, tot die heerlikheid van die Here self en as bewys van julle bereidwilligheid,

column2: 2 Corinthians 8:20 Avoiding this, that no man should blame us in this abundance which is administered by us:
column3: 2 Korinthiers 8:20 om te voorkom dat iemand ons sou belaster in verband met hierdie groot bydrae wat deur ons berei word.

column2: 2 Corinthians 8:21 Providing for honest things, not only in the sight of the Lord, but also in the sight of men.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 8:21 Want ons bedink wat goed is nie alleen voor die Here nie, maar ook voor die mense.

column2: 2 Corinthians 8:22 And we have sent with them our brother, whom we have oftentimes proved diligent in many things, but now much more diligent, upon the great confidence which [I have] in you.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 8:22 En ons het met hulle saamgestuur ons broeder wat ons dikwels in baie dinge beproef gevind het, dat hy ywerig is en nou baie yweriger deur sy groot vertroue in julle.

column2: 2 Corinthians 8:23 Whether [any do enquire] of Titus, [he is] my partner and fellowhelper concerning you: or our brethren [be enquired of, they are] the messengers of the churches, [and] the glory of Christ.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 8:23 Wat nou Titus betref, hy is my metgesel en medewerker by julle; of ons broeders, hulle is afgesante van die gemeentes, ’n eer vir Christus.

column2: 2 Corinthians 8:24 Wherefore shew ye to them, and before the churches, the proof of your love, and of our boasting on your behalf.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 8:24 Gee dan aan hulle die bewys van julle liefde en van ons roem oor julle, ook voor die gemeentes.

column2: 2 Corinthians 9:1 For as touching the ministering to the saints, it is superfluous for me to write to you:
column3: 2 Korinthiers 9:1 WANT wat die diensbetoning aan die heiliges betref, is dit vir my oorbodig om aan julle te skrywe.

column2: 2 Corinthians 9:2 For I know the forwardness of your mind, for which I boast of you to them of Macedonia, that Achaia was ready a year ago; and your zeal hath provoked very many.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 9:2 Want ek ken julle bereidwilligheid waarop ek oor julle by die Macedóniërs roem, dat Acháje ’n jaar gelede gereed was, en dat die ywer wat van julle uitgegaan het, baie ander aangespoor het.

column2: 2 Corinthians 9:3 Yet have I sent the brethren, lest our boasting of you should be in vain in this behalf; that, as I said, ye may be ready:
column3: 2 Korinthiers 9:3 Maar ek het die broeders gestuur, sodat ons roem oor julle in hierdie geval nie verydel mag word nie, dat, soos ek gesê het, julle gereed kan wees,

column2: 2 Corinthians 9:4 Lest haply if they of Macedonia come with me, and find you unprepared, we (that we say not, ye) should be ashamed in this same confident boasting.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 9:4 sodat nie miskien, as daar Macedóniërs saam met my kom en julle nie gereed vind nie, ons, om nie te sê julle nie, beskaam word in hierdie vertroue van ons roem nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 9:5 Therefore I thought it necessary to exhort the brethren, that they would go before unto you, and make up beforehand your bounty, whereof ye had notice before, that the same might be ready, as [a matter of] bounty, and not as [of] covetousness.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 9:5 Ek het dit dus noodsaaklik geag om die broeders te versoek om vooruit te gaan na julle toe en julle vroeër aangekondigde dankoffer vooraf in orde te bring, sodat dit gereed kan wees as ’n dankoffer en nie as iets wat afgepers is nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 9:6 But this [I say], He which soweth sparingly shall reap also sparingly; and he which soweth bountifully shall reap also bountifully.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 9:6 Maar dink daaraan: Wie spaarsaamlik saai, sal ook spaarsaamlik maai; en wie volop saai, sal ook volop maai.

column2: 2 Corinthians 9:7 Every man according as he purposeth in his heart, [so let him give]; not grudgingly, or of necessity: for God loveth a cheerful giver.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 9:7 Laat elkeen gee soos hy hom in sy hart voorneem, nie met droefheid of uit dwang nie, want God het ’n blymoedige gewer lief.

column2: 2 Corinthians 9:8 And God [is] able to make all grace abound toward you; that ye, always having all sufficiency in all [things], may abound to every good work:
column3: 2 Korinthiers 9:8 En God het mag om alle genade oorvloedig oor julle te laat wees, sodat julle altyd in alle opsigte volop kan hê en oorvloedig kan wees tot elke goeie werk.

column2: 2 Corinthians 9:9 (As it is written, He hath dispersed abroad; he hath given to the poor: his righteousness remaineth for ever.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 9:9 Soos geskrywe is: Hy het uitgestrooi, hy het aan die armes gegee, sy geregtigheid bly tot in ewigheid.

column2: 2 Corinthians 9:10 Now he that ministereth seed to the sower both minister bread for [your] food, and multiply your seed sown, and increase the fruits of your righteousness;)
column3: 2 Korinthiers 9:10 En mag Hy wat saad verskaf aan die saaier, ook brood verskaf om te eet en julle saad vermeerder en die vrug van julle geregtigheid laat toeneem,

column2: 2 Corinthians 9:11 Being enriched in every thing to all bountifulness, which causeth through us thanksgiving to God.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 9:11 sodat julle in alles ryk kan word tot alle milddadigheid, wat danksegging aan God deur ons bewerk.

column2: 2 Corinthians 9:12 For the administration of this service not only supplieth the want of the saints, but is abundant also by many thanksgivings unto God;
column3: 2 Korinthiers 9:12 Want die bediening van hierdie hulpbetoning voorsien nie alleen in die behoeftes van die heiliges nie, maar is ook oorvloedig deur baie danksegginge aan God,

column2: 2 Corinthians 9:13 Whiles by the experiment of this ministration they glorify God for your professed subjection unto the gospel of Christ, and for [your] liberal distribution unto them, and unto all [men];
column3: 2 Korinthiers 9:13 omdat hulle deur die bewys van hierdie diens God verheerlik oor die onderwerping van julle belydenis aan die evangelie van Christus en oor die milddadigheid van die bydrae aan hulle en aan almal,

column2: 2 Corinthians 9:14 And by their prayer for you, which long after you for the exceeding grace of God in you.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 9:14 terwyl hulle ook in die gebed vir julle na julle verlang vanweë die uitnemende genade van God aan julle.

column2: 2 Corinthians 9:15 Thanks [be] unto God for his unspeakable gift.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 9:15 Maar God sy dank vir sy onuitspreeklike gawe.

column2: 2 Corinthians 10:1 Now I Paul myself beseech you by the meekness and gentleness of Christ, who in presence [am] base among you, but being absent am bold toward you:
column3: 2 Korinthiers 10:1 EN ek self, Paulus, bid julle by die sagmoedigheid en vriendelikheid van Christus, ek wat in julle teenwoordigheid wel nederig is onder julle, maar in my afwesigheid moedig teenoor julle —

column2: 2 Corinthians 10:2 But I beseech [you], that I may not be bold when I am present with that confidence, wherewith I think to be bold against some, which think of us as if we walked according to the flesh.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 10:2 ek smeek dan dat as ek teenwoordig is, ek nie moedig hoef te wees met die vertroue waarmee ek meen om dit aan te durf teen sommige wat reken dat ons volgens die vlees wandel nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 10:3 For though we walk in the flesh, we do not war after the flesh:
column3: 2 Korinthiers 10:3 Want hoewel ons in die vlees wandel, voer ons die stryd nie volgens die vlees nie;

column2: 2 Corinthians 10:4 (For the weapons of our warfare [are] not carnal, but mighty through God to the pulling down of strong holds;)
column3: 2 Korinthiers 10:4 want die wapens van ons stryd is nie vleeslik nie, maar kragtig deur God om vestings neer te werp,

column2: 2 Corinthians 10:5 Casting down imaginations, and every high thing that exalteth itself against the knowledge of God, and bringing into captivity every thought to the obedience of Christ;
column3: 2 Korinthiers 10:5 terwyl ons planne verbreek en elke skans wat opgewerp word teen die kennis van God, en elke gedagte gevange neem tot die gehoorsaamheid aan Christus,

column2: 2 Corinthians 10:6 And having in a readiness to revenge all disobedience, when your obedience is fulfilled.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 10:6 en ons gereed hou om elke ongehoorsaamheid te straf wanneer julle gehoorsaamheid volkome is.

column2: 2 Corinthians 10:7 Do ye look on things after the outward appearance? If any man trust to himself that he is Christ's, let him of himself think this again, that, as he [is] Christ's, even so [are] we Christ's.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 10:7 Kyk julle na wat voor oë is? As iemand by homself vertrou dat hy aan Christus behoort, laat hy dit by homself weer oorweeg, dat net soos hy self aan Christus behoort, ons ook so aan Christus behoort;

column2: 2 Corinthians 10:8 For though I should boast somewhat more of our authority, which the Lord hath given us for edification, and not for your destruction, I should not be ashamed:
column3: 2 Korinthiers 10:8 want al sou ek ook nog meer roem oor ons gesag wat die Here ons gegee het om julle op te bou en nie neer te werp nie, sal ek nie beskaamd uitkom nie —

column2: 2 Corinthians 10:9 That I may not seem as if I would terrify you by letters.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 10:9 anders sou dit die skyn hê asof ek julle deur die briewe wil bang maak.

column2: 2 Corinthians 10:10 For [his] letters, say they, [are] weighty and powerful; but [his] bodily presence [is] weak, and [his] speech contemptible.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 10:10 Want die briewe, sê hulle, is wel gewigtig en kragtig, maar die persoonlike teenwoordigheid is swak en die woord niks werd nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 10:11 Let such an one think this, that, such as we are in word by letters when we are absent, such [will we be] also in deed when we are present.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 10:11 Laat so iemand bedink dat soos ons met die woord deur briewe in ons afwesigheid is, ons dit ook met die daad in ons aanwesigheid is.

column2: 2 Corinthians 10:12 For we dare not make ourselves of the number, or compare ourselves with some that commend themselves: but they measuring themselves by themselves, and comparing themselves among themselves, are not wise.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 10:12 Want ons waag dit nie om ons te reken of te vergelyk met sommige van die wat hulleself aanbeveel nie. Maar omdat hulle hul met hulself meet en met hulself vergelyk, is hulle onverstandig.

column2: 2 Corinthians 10:13 But we will not boast of things without [our] measure, but according to the measure of the rule which God hath distributed to us, a measure to reach even unto you.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 10:13 Maar ons sal nie buite die maat roem nie, maar volgens die maat van die werkkring wat God ons as ’n maat toebedeel het om ook julle te bereik.

column2: 2 Corinthians 10:14 For we stretch not ourselves beyond [our measure], as though we reached not unto you: for we are come as far as to you also in [preaching] the gospel of Christ:
column3: 2 Korinthiers 10:14 Want ons strek onsself nie te ver uit asof ons julle nie kan bereik nie, want ons het reeds by julle gekom met die evangelie van Christus.

column2: 2 Corinthians 10:15 Not boasting of things without [our] measure, [that is], of other men's labours; but having hope, when your faith is increased, that we shall be enlarged by you according to our rule abundantly,
column3: 2 Korinthiers 10:15 Ons roem nie buite die maat in die arbeid van ander nie, maar ons het hoop om, wanneer julle geloof toeneem, in hoër mate onder julle toe te neem volgens ons werkkring,

column2: 2 Corinthians 10:16 To preach the gospel in the [regions] beyond you, [and] not to boast in another man's line of things made ready to our hand.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 10:16 om die evangelie te verkondig in plekke anderkant julle, nie om in die werkkring van ’n ander oor wat tot stand gekom het, te roem nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 10:17 But he that glorieth, let him glory in the Lord.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 10:17 Maar wie roem, moet in die Here roem.

column2: 2 Corinthians 10:18 For not he that commendeth himself is approved, but whom the Lord commendeth.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 10:18 Want nie hy wat homself aanbeveel, dié is beproef nie, maar hy wat deur die Here aanbeveel word.

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:1 Would to God ye could bear with me a little in [my] folly: and indeed bear with me.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:1 AG, as julle my net ’n bietjie in my dwaasheid wou verdra! Verdra my tog maar!

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:2 For I am jealous over you with godly jealousy: for I have espoused you to one husband, that I may present [you as] a chaste virgin to Christ.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:2 Want ek is jaloers oor julle met ’n goddelike jaloersheid, want ek het julle aan een man verbind, om julle as ’n reine maagd aan Christus voor te stel.

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:3 But I fear, lest by any means, as the serpent beguiled Eve through his subtilty, so your minds should be corrupted from the simplicity that is in Christ.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:3 Maar ek vrees dat, net soos die slang Eva deur sy listigheid bedrieg het, julle sinne so miskien bedorwe kan raak, vervreemd van die opregtheid teenoor Christus.

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:4 For if he that cometh preacheth another Jesus, whom we have not preached, or [if] ye receive another spirit, which ye have not received, or another gospel, which ye have not accepted, ye might well bear with [him].
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:4 Want as iemand kom en ’n ander Jesus verkondig as wat ons verkondig het, of as julle ’n ander gees ontvang as wat julle ontvang het, of ’n ander evangelie as wat julle aangeneem het, laat julle jul dit goed geval.

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:5 For I suppose I was not a whit behind the very chiefest apostles.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:5 Want ek reken dat ek niks agterstaan by dié uitnemende apostels nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:6 But though [I be] rude in speech, yet not in knowledge; but we have been throughly made manifest among you in all things.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:6 En al is ek ook onbedrewe in woord, dan tog nie in kennis nie; maar ons het ten volle in alle opsigte openbaar geword by julle.

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:7 Have I committed an offence in abasing myself that ye might be exalted, because I have preached to you the gospel of God freely?
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:7 Of het ek sonde gedoen deur my te verneder sodat julle verhoog kan word, omdat ek die evangelie van God kosteloos aan julle verkondig het?

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:8 I robbed other churches, taking wages [of them], to do you service.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:8 Ander gemeentes het ek beroof deur vergoeding te neem om julle te bedien; en toe ek by julle teenwoordig was en gebrek gehad het, het ek niemand lastig geval nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:9 And when I was present with you, and wanted, I was chargeable to no man: for that which was lacking to me the brethren which came from Macedonia supplied: and in all [things] I have kept myself from being burdensome unto you, and [so] will I keep [myself].
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:9 Want in my gebrek het die broeders voorsien wat van Macedónië gekom het. En ek het my in alles in ag geneem om julle nie te beswaar nie, en ek sal my in ag neem.

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:10 As the truth of Christ is in me, no man shall stop me of this boasting in the regions of Achaia.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:10 So seker as die waarheid van Christus in my is, sal hierdie roem in die streke van Acháje my nie ontneem word nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:11 Wherefore? because I love you not? God knoweth.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:11 Waarom? Omdat ek julle nie liefhet nie? God weet dit.

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:12 But what I do, that I will do, that I may cut off occasion from them which desire occasion; that wherein they glory, they may be found even as we.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:12 Maar wat ek doen, sal ek nog doen om die aanleiding af te sny vir die wat ’n aanleiding wil hê, sodat hulle in die saak waar hulle op roem, net soos ons bevind mag word.

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:13 For such [are] false apostles, deceitful workers, transforming themselves into the apostles of Christ.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:13 Want sulke mense is valse apostels, bedrieglike arbeiders wat hulleself verander in apostels van Christus.

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:14 And no marvel; for Satan himself is transformed into an angel of light.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:14 En geen wonder nie! Want die Satan self verander hom in ’n engel van die lig.

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:15 Therefore [it is] no great thing if his ministers also be transformed as the ministers of righteousness; whose end shall be according to their works.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:15 Dit is dus niks besonders wanneer sy dienaars hulle ook voordoen as dienaars van geregtigheid nie. Maar hulle einde sal wees volgens hulle werke.

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:16 I say again, Let no man think me a fool; if otherwise, yet as a fool receive me, that I may boast myself a little.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:16 WEER sê ek dat niemand moet dink dat ek dwaas is nie; of anders, neem my maar aan as ’n dwaas, sodat ek ook ’n bietjie kan roem.

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:17 That which I speak, I speak [it] not after the Lord, but as it were foolishly, in this confidence of boasting.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:17 Wat ek spreek, sê ek nie vanweë die Here nie, maar as in dwaasheid, in hierdie vertroue dat ek mag roem.

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:18 Seeing that many glory after the flesh, I will glory also.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:18 Terwyl baie na die vlees roem, sal ek ook roem.

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:19 For ye suffer fools gladly, seeing ye [yourselves] are wise.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:19 Want julle verdra graag die dwase, omdat julle so verstandig is!

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:20 For ye suffer, if a man bring you into bondage, if a man devour [you], if a man take [of you], if a man exalt himself, if a man smite you on the face.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:20 Julle verdra dit mos as iemand knegte van julle maak, as iemand julle opeet, as iemand julle beetneem, as iemand hom aanstel, as iemand julle in die gesig slaan.

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:21 I speak as concerning reproach, as though we had been weak. Howbeit whereinsoever any is bold, (I speak foolishly,) I am bold also.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:21 Tot my skande moet ek erken dat ons daarvoor te swak was; maar as iemand dit aandurf — ek spreek in dwaasheid — ek durf ook.

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:22 Are they Hebrews? so [am] I. Are they Israelites? so [am] I. Are they the seed of Abraham? so [am] I.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:22 Is hulle Hebreërs? Ek ook. Is hulle Israeliete? Ek ook. Is hulle die nakomelinge van Abraham? Ek ook.

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:23 Are they ministers of Christ? (I speak as a fool) I [am] more; in labours more abundant, in stripes above measure, in prisons more frequent, in deaths oft.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:23 Is hulle dienaars van Christus? — ek praat in uitsinnigheid — ek nog meer: in arbeid oorvloediger, in slae bo die maat, in gevangenskappe baie meer, in doodsgevare dikwels.

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:24 Of the Jews five times received I forty [stripes] save one.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:24 Vyf maal het ek van die Jode ontvang veertig houe op een na.

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:25 Thrice was I beaten with rods, once was I stoned, thrice I suffered shipwreck, a night and a day I have been in the deep;
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:25 Drie maal is ek met stokke geslaan, een maal is ek gestenig, drie maal het ek skipbreuk gely, ’n nag en ’n dag het ek op die diepwater deurgebring —

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:26 [In] journeyings often, [in] perils of waters, [in] perils of robbers, [in] perils by [mine own] countrymen, [in] perils by the heathen, [in] perils in the city, [in] perils in the wilderness, [in] perils in the sea, [in] perils among false brethren;
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:26 dikwels op reis, in gevare van riviere, in gevare van rowers, in gevare van my volk, in gevare van die heidene, in gevare in die stad, in gevare in die woestyn, in gevare op see, in gevare onder valse broeders;

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:27 In weariness and painfulness, in watchings often, in hunger and thirst, in fastings often, in cold and nakedness.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:27 in arbeid en moeite, in slapelose nagte dikwels, in honger en dors, dikwels sonder ete, in koue en naaktheid.

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:28 Beside those things that are without, that which cometh upon me daily, the care of all the churches.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:28 Behalwe dit alles my daaglikse bekommernis, die sorg vir al die gemeentes.

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:29 Who is weak, and I am not weak? who is offended, and I burn not?
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:29 Wie is swak en ek is nie swak nie? Aan wie word ’n struikelblok in die weg gelê en ek is nie aan die brand nie?

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:30 If I must needs glory, I will glory of the things which concern mine infirmities.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:30 As daar geroem moet word, sal ek in my swakhede roem.

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:31 The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, which is blessed for evermore, knoweth that I lie not.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:31 Die God en Vader van onse Here Jesus Christus, geseënd tot in ewigheid, weet dat ek nie lieg nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:32 In Damascus the governor under Aretas the king kept the city of the Damascenes with a garrison, desirous to apprehend me:
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:32 In Damaskus het die goewerneur van koning Arétas die stad van die Damaskéners laat bewaak om my te vang;

column2: 2 Corinthians 11:33 And through a window in a basket was I let down by the wall, and escaped his hands.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 11:33 en ek is in ’n mandjie deur ’n venster in die muur neergelaat en het aan sy hande ontkom.

column2: 2 Corinthians 12:1 It is not expedient for me doubtless to glory. I will come to visions and revelations of the Lord.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 12:1 DIT is waarlik vir my nie nuttig om te roem nie, want ek sal kom tot gesigte en openbaringe van die Here.

column2: 2 Corinthians 12:2 I knew a man in Christ above fourteen years ago, (whether in the body, I cannot tell; or whether out of the body, I cannot tell: God knoweth;) such an one caught up to the third heaven.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 12:2 Ek weet van ’n man in Christus, veertien jaar gelede — of dit in die liggaam was, weet ek nie, of buite die liggaam, weet ek nie, God weet dit — dat so iemand weggeruk is tot in die derde hemel.

column2: 2 Corinthians 12:3 And I knew such a man, (whether in the body, or out of the body, I cannot tell: God knoweth;)
column3: 2 Korinthiers 12:3 En ek weet van so ’n man — of dit in die liggaam of buite die liggaam was, weet ek nie, God weet dit —

column2: 2 Corinthians 12:4 How that he was caught up into paradise, and heard unspeakable words, which it is not lawful for a man to utter.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 12:4 dat hy weggeruk is in die Paradys en onuitspreeklike woorde gehoor het wat ’n mens nie mag uitspreek nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 12:5 Of such an one will I glory: yet of myself I will not glory, but in mine infirmities.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 12:5 Oor so ’n man sal ek roem, maar oor myself sal ek nie roem nie, behalwe in my swakhede.

column2: 2 Corinthians 12:6 For though I would desire to glory, I shall not be a fool; for I will say the truth: but [now] I forbear, lest any man should think of me above that which he seeth me [to be], or [that] he heareth of me.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 12:6 Want as ek sou wil roem, sou ek nie ’n dwaas wees nie, want ek sou die waarheid praat; maar ek laat dit ná, sodat niemand my hoër mag skat as wat hy van my sien of wat hy van my hoor nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 12:7 And lest I should be exalted above measure through the abundance of the revelations, there was given to me a thorn in the flesh, the messenger of Satan to buffet me, lest I should be exalted above measure.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 12:7 En dat ek my oor die voortreflikheid van die openbaringe nie sou verhef nie, is my ’n doring in die vlees gegee, ’n engel van die Satan, om my met die vuis te slaan, dat ek my nie sou verhef nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 12:8 For this thing I besought the Lord thrice, that it might depart from me.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 12:8 Hieroor het ek die Here drie maal gebid, dat hy van my sou wyk.

column2: 2 Corinthians 12:9 And he said unto me, My grace is sufficient for thee: for my strength is made perfect in weakness. Most gladly therefore will I rather glory in my infirmities, that the power of Christ may rest upon me.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 12:9 En Hy het vir my gesê: My genade is vir jou genoeg, want my krag word in swakheid volbring. Baie liewer sal ek dus in my swakhede roem, sodat die krag van Christus in my kan woon.

column2: 2 Corinthians 12:10 Therefore I take pleasure in infirmities, in reproaches, in necessities, in persecutions, in distresses for Christ's sake: for when I am weak, then am I strong.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 12:10 Daarom het ek behae in swakhede, in mishandelinge, in node, in vervolginge, in benoudhede, om Christus wil. Want as ek swak is, dan is ek sterk.

column2: 2 Corinthians 12:11 I am become a fool in glorying; ye have compelled me: for I ought to have been commended of you: for in nothing am I behind the very chiefest apostles, though I be nothing.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 12:11 AL roemende het ek dwaas geword. Julle het my daartoe genoodsaak. Want ek moes deur julle aanbeveel geword het; want ek het niks by dié uitnemende apostels agtergestaan nie, al is ek niks nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 12:12 Truly the signs of an apostle were wrought among you in all patience, in signs, and wonders, and mighty deeds.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 12:12 Die kentekens tog van ’n apostel is onder julle verwerklik met alle volharding deur tekens en wonders en kragtige dade.

column2: 2 Corinthians 12:13 For what is it wherein ye were inferior to other churches, except [it be] that I myself was not burdensome to you? forgive me this wrong.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 12:13 Want wat is daar waarin julle oortref word deur die ander gemeentes, behalwe dat ek persoonlik julle nie lastig geval het nie? Vergeef my hierdie onreg.

column2: 2 Corinthians 12:14 Behold, the third time I am ready to come to you; and I will not be burdensome to you: for I seek not yours, but you: for the children ought not to lay up for the parents, but the parents for the children.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 12:14 Kyk, vir die derde keer is ek gereed om na julle te kom; en ek sal julle nie lastig val nie, want ek soek nie julle goed nie, maar julle self; want dit is nie die kinders wat vir die ouers moet opgaar nie, maar die ouers vir die kinders.

column2: 2 Corinthians 12:15 And I will very gladly spend and be spent for you; though the more abundantly I love you, the less I be loved.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 12:15 En ek sal baie graag uitgee, ja, myself weggee vir julle siele, al word ek, terwyl ek julle oorvloediger liefhet, minder bemin.

column2: 2 Corinthians 12:16 But be it so, I did not burden you: nevertheless, being crafty, I caught you with guile.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 12:16 Maar laat dit so wees! Ek het julle nie beswaar nie, maar omdat ek slim was, het ek julle met lis gevang.

column2: 2 Corinthians 12:17 Did I make a gain of you by any of them whom I sent unto you?
column3: 2 Korinthiers 12:17 Het ek my dan ten koste van julle bevoordeel deur een van die wat ek na julle gestuur het?

column2: 2 Corinthians 12:18 I desired Titus, and with [him] I sent a brother. Did Titus make a gain of you? walked we not in the same spirit? [walked we] not in the same steps?
column3: 2 Korinthiers 12:18 Ek het Titus gevra en die broeder saamgestuur. Het Titus hom dan ten koste van julle bevoordeel? Het ons nie in dieselfde gees, in dieselfde spore gewandel nie?

column2: 2 Corinthians 12:19 Again, think ye that we excuse ourselves unto you? we speak before God in Christ: but [we do] all things, dearly beloved, for your edifying.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 12:19 DINK julle weer dat ons ons by julle verdedig? Ons spreek in die teenwoordigheid van God in Christus, en dit alles, geliefdes, tot julle stigting.

column2: 2 Corinthians 12:20 For I fear, lest, when I come, I shall not find you such as I would, and [that] I shall be found unto you such as ye would not: lest [there be] debates, envyings, wraths, strifes, backbitings, whisperings, swellings, tumults:
column3: 2 Korinthiers 12:20 Want ek vrees dat ek julle by my koms miskien nie sal vind soos ek wens nie, en dat ek deur julle gevind sal word soos julle nie wens nie — dat daar miskien sal wees twis, jaloersheid, toornigheid, verdeeldheid, kwaadsprekery, nuusdraery, verwaandheid, wanordelikheid;

column2: 2 Corinthians 12:21 [And] lest, when I come again, my God will humble me among you, and [that] I shall bewail many which have sinned already, and have not repented of the uncleanness and fornication and lasciviousness which they have committed.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 12:21 dat as ek gekom het, my God my miskien weer by julle sal verneder en ek sal treur oor baie van die wat vroeër gesondig het en hulle nie bekeer het van die onreinheid en hoerery en ongebondenheid wat hulle bedryf het nie.

column2: 2 Corinthians 13:1 This [is] the third [time] I am coming to you. In the mouth of two or three witnesses shall every word be established.
column3: 2 Korinthiers 13:1 DIT is die derde keer dat ek na julle toe kom. In die mond van twee of drie getuies sal elke woord vasstaan.

column2: 2 Corinthians 13:2 I told you before, and foretell you, as if I were present, the second time; and being absent now I write to them which heretofore have sinned, and to all other, that, if I come again, I will not spare:
