column3: 1 Thessalonicense 4:18 Bemoedig mekaar dan met hierdie woorde.

column2: 1 Thessalonians 5:1 But of the times and the seasons, brethren, ye have no need that I write unto you.
column3: 1 Thessalonicense 5:1 MAAR oor die tye en geleenthede, broeders, het julle nie nodig dat aan julle geskryf word nie;

column2: 1 Thessalonians 5:2 For yourselves know perfectly that the day of the Lord so cometh as a thief in the night.
column3: 1 Thessalonicense 5:2 want julle weet self baie goed dat die dag van die Here kom net soos ’n dief in die nag.

column2: 1 Thessalonians 5:3 For when they shall say, Peace and safety; then sudden destruction cometh upon them, as travail upon a woman with child; and they shall not escape.
column3: 1 Thessalonicense 5:3 Want wanneer hulle sê: Vrede en veiligheid — dan oorval ’n skielike verderf hulle soos die barensnood ’n swanger vrou, en hulle sal sekerlik nie ontvlug nie.

column2: 1 Thessalonians 5:4 But ye, brethren, are not in darkness, that that day should overtake you as a thief.
column3: 1 Thessalonicense 5:4 Maar julle, broeders, is nie in duisternis, dat die dag julle soos ’n dief sou oorval nie.

column2: 1 Thessalonians 5:5 Ye are all the children of light, and the children of the day: we are not of the night, nor of darkness.
column3: 1 Thessalonicense 5:5 Julle is almal kinders van die lig en kinders van die dag; ons is nie van die nag of die duisternis nie.

column2: 1 Thessalonians 5:6 Therefore let us not sleep, as [do] others; but let us watch and be sober.
column3: 1 Thessalonicense 5:6 Laat ons dan nie slaap soos die ander nie, maar laat ons waak en nugter wees.

column2: 1 Thessalonians 5:7 For they that sleep sleep in the night; and they that be drunken are drunken in the night.
column3: 1 Thessalonicense 5:7 Want die wat slaap, slaap in die nag; en die wat dronk word, is in die nag dronk.

column2: 1 Thessalonians 5:8 But let us, who are of the day, be sober, putting on the breastplate of faith and love; and for an helmet, the hope of salvation.
column3: 1 Thessalonicense 5:8 Maar laat ons wat van die dag is, nugter wees, met die borswapen van geloof en liefde aan, en as helm die hoop op die saligheid.

column2: 1 Thessalonians 5:9 For God hath not appointed us to wrath, but to obtain salvation by our Lord Jesus Christ,
column3: 1 Thessalonicense 5:9 Want God het ons nie bestem tot toorn nie, maar om die saligheid te verkry deur onse Here Jesus Christus

column2: 1 Thessalonians 5:10 Who died for us, that, whether we wake or sleep, we should live together with him.
column3: 1 Thessalonicense 5:10 wat vir ons gesterf het, sodat ons, of ons waak en of ons slaap, saam met Hom kan lewe.

column2: 1 Thessalonians 5:11 Wherefore comfort yourselves together, and edify one another, even as also ye do.
column3: 1 Thessalonicense 5:11 Daarom, bemoedig mekaar en bou die een die ander op, soos julle ook doen.

column2: 1 Thessalonians 5:12 And we beseech you, brethren, to know them which labour among you, and are over you in the Lord, and admonish you;
column3: 1 Thessalonicense 5:12 MAAR ons vra julle, broeders, erken die wat onder julle arbei en julle voorgangers in die Here is en julle vermaan;

column2: 1 Thessalonians 5:13 And to esteem them very highly in love for their work's sake. [And] be at peace among yourselves.
column3: 1 Thessalonicense 5:13 en bewys hulle in liefde die hoogste agting ter wille van hulle werk. Hou vrede onder mekaar.

column2: 1 Thessalonians 5:14 Now we exhort you, brethren, warn them that are unruly, comfort the feebleminded, support the weak, be patient toward all [men].
column3: 1 Thessalonicense 5:14 En ons versoek julle, broeders, vermaan die onordelikes, bemoedig die kleinmoediges, ondersteun die swakkes, wees lankmoedig teenoor almal.

column2: 1 Thessalonians 5:15 See that none render evil for evil unto any [man]; but ever follow that which is good, both among yourselves, and to all [men].
column3: 1 Thessalonicense 5:15 Sorg dat niemand ’n ander kwaad vir kwaad vergeld nie; maar jaag altyd ná wat goed is, teenoor mekaar sowel as teenoor almal.

column2: 1 Thessalonians 5:16 Rejoice evermore.
column3: 1 Thessalonicense 5:16 Wees altyddeur bly.

column2: 1 Thessalonians 5:17 Pray without ceasing.
column3: 1 Thessalonicense 5:17 Bid sonder ophou.

column2: 1 Thessalonians 5:18 In every thing give thanks: for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus concerning you.
column3: 1 Thessalonicense 5:18 Wees in alles dankbaar, want dit is die wil van God in Christus Jesus oor julle.

column2: 1 Thessalonians 5:19 Quench not the Spirit.
column3: 1 Thessalonicense 5:19 Blus die Gees nie uit nie.

column2: 1 Thessalonians 5:20 Despise not prophesyings.
column3: 1 Thessalonicense 5:20 Verag die profesieë nie.

column2: 1 Thessalonians 5:21 Prove all things; hold fast that which is good.
column3: 1 Thessalonicense 5:21 Beproef alle dinge; behou die goeie.

column2: 1 Thessalonians 5:22 Abstain from all appearance of evil.
column3: 1 Thessalonicense 5:22 Onthou julle van elke vorm van kwaad.

column2: 1 Thessalonians 5:23 And the very God of peace sanctify you wholly; and [I pray God] your whole spirit and soul and body be preserved blameless unto the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.
column3: 1 Thessalonicense 5:23 En mag Hy, die God van die vrede, julle volkome heilig maak, en mag julle gees en siel en liggaam geheel en al onberispelik bewaar word by die wederkoms van onse Here Jesus Christus!

column2: 1 Thessalonians 5:24 Faithful [is] he that calleth you, who also will do [it].
column3: 1 Thessalonicense 5:24 Hy wat julle roep, is getrou; Hy sal dit ook doen.

column2: 1 Thessalonians 5:25 Brethren, pray for us.
column3: 1 Thessalonicense 5:25 Broeders, bid vir ons.

column2: 1 Thessalonians 5:26 Greet all the brethren with an holy kiss.
column3: 1 Thessalonicense 5:26 Groet die broeders almal met ’n heilige kus.

column2: 1 Thessalonians 5:27 I charge you by the Lord that this epistle be read unto all the holy brethren.
column3: 1 Thessalonicense 5:27 Ek besweer julle by die Here dat hierdie brief aan al die heilige broeders voorgelees word.

column2: 1 Thessalonians 5:28 The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ [be] with you. Amen. <<[The first [epistle] to the Thessalonians was written from Athens.]>>
column3: 1 Thessalonicense 5:28 Die genade van onse Here Jesus Christus sy met julle! Amen.

column2: 2 Thessalonians 1:1 Paul, and Silvanus, and Timotheus, unto the church of the Thessalonians in God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ:
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 1:1 PAULUS en Silvánus en Timótheüs aan die gemeente van die Thessalonicense in God onse Vader en die Here Jesus Christus:

column2: 2 Thessalonians 1:2 Grace unto you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 1:2 Genade vir julle en vrede van God onse Vader en die Here Jesus Christus!

column2: 2 Thessalonians 1:3 We are bound to thank God always for you, brethren, as it is meet, because that your faith groweth exceedingly, and the charity of every one of you all toward each other aboundeth;
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 1:3 ONS moet God altyd oor julle dank, broeders, soos dit billik is, omdat julle geloof grootliks toeneem en die wederkerige liefde van elkeen van julle almal groter word,

column2: 2 Thessalonians 1:4 So that we ourselves glory in you in the churches of God for your patience and faith in all your persecutions and tribulations that ye endure:
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 1:4 sodat ons self in die gemeentes van God oor julle roem vanweë jul volharding en geloof onder al julle vervolginge en die verdrukkinge wat julle verduur —

column2: 2 Thessalonians 1:5 [Which is] a manifest token of the righteous judgment of God, that ye may be counted worthy of the kingdom of God, for which ye also suffer:
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 1:5 ’n teken van die regverdige oordeel van God, dat julle die koninkryk van God waardig geag mag word, waarvoor julle ook ly;

column2: 2 Thessalonians 1:6 Seeing [it is] a righteous thing with God to recompense tribulation to them that trouble you;
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 1:6 aangesien dit reg is by God om aan die wat julle verdruk, verdrukking te vergelde,

column2: 2 Thessalonians 1:7 And to you who are troubled rest with us, when the Lord Jesus shall be revealed from heaven with his mighty angels,
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 1:7 en aan julle wat verdruk word, verligting te gee saam met ons in die openbaring van die Here Jesus uit die hemel met sy magtige engele

column2: 2 Thessalonians 1:8 In flaming fire taking vengeance on them that know not God, and that obey not the gospel of our Lord Jesus Christ:
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 1:8 in vuur en vlam, wanneer Hy wraak uitoefen op die wat God nie ken nie en op die wat aan die evangelie van onse Here Jesus nie gehoorsaam is nie.

column2: 2 Thessalonians 1:9 Who shall be punished with everlasting destruction from the presence of the Lord, and from the glory of his power;
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 1:9 Hulle sal as straf ondergaan ’n ewige verderf, weg van die aangesig van die Here en van die heerlikheid van sy sterkte,

column2: 2 Thessalonians 1:10 When he shall come to be glorified in his saints, and to be admired in all them that believe (because our testimony among you was believed) in that day.
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 1:10 wanneer Hy kom om verheerlik te word in sy heiliges en bewonder te word in almal wat glo, in daardie dag; want ons getuienis het by julle geloof gevind.

column2: 2 Thessalonians 1:11 Wherefore also we pray always for you, that our God would count you worthy of [this] calling, and fulfil all the good pleasure of [his] goodness, and the work of faith with power:
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 1:11 Daarom bid ons ook altyd vir julle dat onse God julle die roeping waardig mag ag, en dat Hy alle welgevalle aan wat goed is, en alle werk van die geloof met krag volkome mag maak,

column2: 2 Thessalonians 1:12 That the name of our Lord Jesus Christ may be glorified in you, and ye in him, according to the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ.
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 1:12 sodat die Naam van onse Here Jesus Christus in julle verheerlik kan word en julle in Hom, ooreenkomstig die genade van onse God en die Here Jesus Christus.

column2: 2 Thessalonians 2:1 Now we beseech you, brethren, by the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, and [by] our gathering together unto him,
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 2:1 MAAR ons vra julle, broeders, met die oog op die wederkoms van onse Here Jesus Christus en ons vereniging met Hom,

column2: 2 Thessalonians 2:2 That ye be not soon shaken in mind, or be troubled, neither by spirit, nor by word, nor by letter as from us, as that the day of Christ is at hand.
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 2:2 om nie gou julle verstand te verloor of verskrik te word nie — deur gees of deur woord of deur brief wat van ons afkomstig sou wees — asof die dag van Christus al daar is.

column2: 2 Thessalonians 2:3 Let no man deceive you by any means: for [that day shall not come], except there come a falling away first, and that man of sin be revealed, the son of perdition;
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 2:3 Laat niemand julle op enige manier mislei nie, want eers moet die afval kom en die mens van sonde geopenbaar word, die seun van die verderf,

column2: 2 Thessalonians 2:4 Who opposeth and exalteth himself above all that is called God, or that is worshipped; so that he as God sitteth in the temple of God, shewing himself that he is God.
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 2:4 die teëstander wat hom verhef bo al wat God genoem word of voorwerp van aanbidding is, sodat hy in die tempel van God as God sal sit en voorgee dat hy God is.

column2: 2 Thessalonians 2:5 Remember ye not, that, when I was yet with you, I told you these things?
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 2:5 Onthou julle nie dat ek dit altyd vir julle gesê het toe ek nog by julle was nie?

column2: 2 Thessalonians 2:6 And now ye know what withholdeth that he might be revealed in his time.
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 2:6 En nou, julle weet wat hom teëhou, sodat hy op sy tyd geopenbaar kan word.

column2: 2 Thessalonians 2:7 For the mystery of iniquity doth already work: only he who now letteth [will let], until he be taken out of the way.
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 2:7 Want die verborgenheid van die ongeregtigheid is al aan die werk, net totdat hy wat nou teëhou, uit die weg geruim is;

column2: 2 Thessalonians 2:8 And then shall that Wicked be revealed, whom the Lord shall consume with the spirit of his mouth, and shall destroy with the brightness of his coming:
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 2:8 en dan sal die ongeregtige geopenbaar word, hy wat die Here met die asem van sy mond sal verdelg en deur die verskyning van sy wederkoms tot niet sal maak,

column2: 2 Thessalonians 2:9 [Even him], whose coming is after the working of Satan with all power and signs and lying wonders,
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 2:9 hy wie se koms is volgens die werking van die Satan met allerhande kragtige dade en tekens en wonders van die leuen

column2: 2 Thessalonians 2:10 And with all deceivableness of unrighteousness in them that perish; because they received not the love of the truth, that they might be saved.
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 2:10 en met allerhande verleiding van ongeregtigheid in die wat verlore gaan, omdat hulle die liefde tot die waarheid nie aangeneem het om gered te word nie.

column2: 2 Thessalonians 2:11 And for this cause God shall send them strong delusion, that they should believe a lie:
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 2:11 En daarom sal God hulle die krag van die dwaling stuur, om die leuen te glo,

column2: 2 Thessalonians 2:12 That they all might be damned who believed not the truth, but had pleasure in unrighteousness.
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 2:12 sodat almal geoordeel kan word wat die waarheid nie geglo het nie, maar behae gehad het in die ongeregtigheid.

column2: 2 Thessalonians 2:13 But we are bound to give thanks alway to God for you, brethren beloved of the Lord, because God hath from the beginning chosen you to salvation through sanctification of the Spirit and belief of the truth:
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 2:13 Maar ons moet God altyd oor julle dank, broeders wat deur die Here bemin word, dat God julle van die begin af verkies het tot saligheid in heiligmaking van die Gees en geloof in die waarheid,

column2: 2 Thessalonians 2:14 Whereunto he called you by our gospel, to the obtaining of the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 2:14 waartoe Hy julle geroep het deur ons evangelie om die heerlikheid van onse Here Jesus Christus te verkry.

column2: 2 Thessalonians 2:15 Therefore, brethren, stand fast, and hold the traditions which ye have been taught, whether by word, or our epistle.
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 2:15 So dan, broeders, staan vas en hou julle aan die voorskrifte wat julle geleer is òf deur ’n woord òf deur ’n brief van ons.

column2: 2 Thessalonians 2:16 Now our Lord Jesus Christ himself, and God, even our Father, which hath loved us, and hath given [us] everlasting consolation and good hope through grace,
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 2:16 En mag onse Here Jesus Christus self en onse God en Vader, wat ons liefgehad het en ’n ewige troos en goeie hoop in genade gegee het,

column2: 2 Thessalonians 2:17 Comfort your hearts, and stablish you in every good word and work.
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 2:17 julle harte vertroos en julle versterk in alle goeie woorde en werke!

column2: 2 Thessalonians 3:1 Finally, brethren, pray for us, that the word of the Lord may have [free] course, and be glorified, even as [it is] with you:
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 3:1 VERDER, broeders, bid vir ons dat die woord van die Here sy snelle loop mag hê en verheerlik word net soos by julle;

column2: 2 Thessalonians 3:2 And that we may be delivered from unreasonable and wicked men: for all [men] have not faith.
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 3:2 en dat ons verlos mag word van die verkeerde en slegte mense, want die geloof is nie die deel van almal nie.

column2: 2 Thessalonians 3:3 But the Lord is faithful, who shall stablish you, and keep [you] from evil.
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 3:3 Maar die Here is getrou; Hy sal julle versterk en bewaar van die Bose.

column2: 2 Thessalonians 3:4 And we have confidence in the Lord touching you, that ye both do and will do the things which we command you.
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 3:4 En ons vertrou aangaande julle in die Here dat julle doen en ook sal doen wat ons julle beveel.

column2: 2 Thessalonians 3:5 And the Lord direct your hearts into the love of God, and into the patient waiting for Christ.
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 3:5 Mag die Here julle harte rig tot die liefde van God en die lydsaamheid van Christus!

column2: 2 Thessalonians 3:6 Now we command you, brethren, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that ye withdraw yourselves from every brother that walketh disorderly, and not after the tradition which he received of us.
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 3:6 Ons beveel julle, broeders, in die Naam van onse Here Jesus Christus, dat julle jul onttrek aan elke broeder wat onordelik wandel en nie volgens die oorlewering wat hy van ons ontvang het nie.

column2: 2 Thessalonians 3:7 For yourselves know how ye ought to follow us: for we behaved not ourselves disorderly among you;
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 3:7 Want julle weet self hoe julle ons moet navolg, want ons het ons nie onordelik onder julle gedra nie;

column2: 2 Thessalonians 3:8 Neither did we eat any man's bread for nought; but wrought with labour and travail night and day, that we might not be chargeable to any of you:
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 3:8 ook het ons nie brood by iemand kosteloos geëet nie; maar ons het met arbeid en inspanning nag en dag gewerk om nie iemand van julle tot las te wees nie.

column2: 2 Thessalonians 3:9 Not because we have not power, but to make ourselves an ensample unto you to follow us.
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 3:9 Nie dat ons nie die reg het nie, maar om onsself vir julle as ’n voorbeeld te stel, dat julle ons kan navolg.

column2: 2 Thessalonians 3:10 For even when we were with you, this we commanded you, that if any would not work, neither should he eat.
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 3:10 Want ook toe ons by julle was, het ons julle dit altyd beveel: as iemand nie wil werk nie, moet hy ook nie eet nie.

column2: 2 Thessalonians 3:11 For we hear that there are some which walk among you disorderly, working not at all, but are busybodies.
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 3:11 Want ons hoor dat sommige onder julle onordelik wandel, dat hulle nie werk nie, maar bemoeisiek is.

column2: 2 Thessalonians 3:12 Now them that are such we command and exhort by our Lord Jesus Christ, that with quietness they work, and eat their own bread.
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 3:12 Sulke mense beveel en vermaan ons deur onse Here Jesus Christus, om rustig te werk en hulle eie brood te eet.

column2: 2 Thessalonians 3:13 But ye, brethren, be not weary in well doing.
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 3:13 En julle, broeders, moet nie in goeddoen verflou nie.

column2: 2 Thessalonians 3:14 And if any man obey not our word by this epistle, note that man, and have no company with him, that he may be ashamed.
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 3:14 En as iemand aan ons woord in hierdie brief nie gehoorsaam is nie, teken dié man en hou geen gemeenskap met hom nie, sodat hy skaam kan word.

column2: 2 Thessalonians 3:15 Yet count [him] not as an enemy, but admonish [him] as a brother.
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 3:15 En beskou hom nie as ’n vyand nie, maar vermaan hom as ’n broeder.

column2: 2 Thessalonians 3:16 Now the Lord of peace himself give you peace always by all means. The Lord [be] with you all.
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 3:16 En mag Hy, die Here van die vrede, julle altyd vrede gee op allerlei wyse! Mag die Here met julle almal wees!

column2: 2 Thessalonians 3:17 The salutation of Paul with mine own hand, which is the token in every epistle: so I write.
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 3:17 Die groete van Paulus, met my eie hand, wat ’n teken is in elke brief; so skryf ek.

column2: 2 Thessalonians 3:18 The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ [be] with you all. Amen. <<[The second [epistle] to the Thessalonians was written from Athens.]>>
column3: 2 Thessalonicense 3:18 Die genade van onse Here Jesus Christus sy met julle almal! Amen.

column2: 1 Timothy 1:1 Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the commandment of God our Saviour, and Lord Jesus Christ, [which is] our hope;
column3: 1 Timotheus 1:1 PAULUS, ’n apostel van Jesus Christus, volgens die bevel van God, ons Verlosser, en van die Here Jesus Christus, ons Hoop,

column2: 1 Timothy 1:2 Unto Timothy, [my] own son in the faith: Grace, mercy, [and] peace, from God our Father and Jesus Christ our Lord.
column3: 1 Timotheus 1:2 aan Timótheüs, my ware kind in die geloof: Genade, barmhartigheid, vrede van God onse Vader en Christus Jesus, onse Here!

column2: 1 Timothy 1:3 As I besought thee to abide still at Ephesus, when I went into Macedonia, that thou mightest charge some that they teach no other doctrine,
column3: 1 Timotheus 1:3 SOOS ek jou versoek het toe ek na Macedónië op reis was, moet jy in Éfese wag om sekere persone te beveel dat hulle geen ander leer moet leer nie,

column2: 1 Timothy 1:4 Neither give heed to fables and endless genealogies, which minister questions, rather than godly edifying which is in faith: [so do].
column3: 1 Timotheus 1:4 en hulle nie besig hou met fabels en eindelose geslagsregisters nie, wat net twisvrae bevorder meer as stigting van God wat in die geloof is.

column2: 1 Timothy 1:5 Now the end of the commandment is charity out of a pure heart, and [of] a good conscience, and [of] faith unfeigned:
column3: 1 Timotheus 1:5 Maar die doel van die gebod is liefde uit ’n rein hart en ’n goeie gewete en ’n ongeveinsde geloof

column2: 1 Timothy 1:6 From which some having swerved have turned aside unto vain jangling;
column3: 1 Timotheus 1:6 waarvan sommige mense afgedwaal en hulle afgewend het na onsinnige praatjies;

column2: 1 Timothy 1:7 Desiring to be teachers of the law; understanding neither what they say, nor whereof they affirm.
column3: 1 Timotheus 1:7 hulle wil leraars van die wet wees, alhoewel hulle wat hulle sê, of die dinge wat hulle beslis beweer, nie verstaan nie.

column2: 1 Timothy 1:8 But we know that the law [is] good, if a man use it lawfully;
column3: 1 Timotheus 1:8 Maar ons weet dat die wet goed is as iemand dit wettiglik gebruik

column2: 1 Timothy 1:9 Knowing this, that the law is not made for a righteous man, but for the lawless and disobedient, for the ungodly and for sinners, for unholy and profane, for murderers of fathers and murderers of mothers, for manslayers,
column3: 1 Timotheus 1:9 en as hy weet dat die wet nie gegee is vir die regverdige nie, maar vir die wettelose en tugtelose mense, goddelose en sondaars, onheiliges en ongewydes, vadermoorders en moedermoorders, moordenaars,

column2: 1 Timothy 1:10 For whoremongers, for them that defile themselves with mankind, for menstealers, for liars, for perjured persons, and if there be any other thing that is contrary to sound doctrine;
column3: 1 Timotheus 1:10 hoereerders, sodomiete, mensediewe, leuenaars, meinediges en wat daar anders met die gesonde leer in stryd is,

column2: 1 Timothy 1:11 According to the glorious gospel of the blessed God, which was committed to my trust.
column3: 1 Timotheus 1:11 volgens die evangelie van die heerlikheid van die salige God wat aan my toevertrou is.

column2: 1 Timothy 1:12 And I thank Christ Jesus our Lord, who hath enabled me, for that he counted me faithful, putting me into the ministry;
column3: 1 Timotheus 1:12 En ek dank Hom wat my krag gegee het, Christus Jesus, onse Here, dat Hy my getrou geag en in die bediening gestel het,

column2: 1 Timothy 1:13 Who was before a blasphemer, and a persecutor, and injurious: but I obtained mercy, because I did [it] ignorantly in unbelief.
column3: 1 Timotheus 1:13 my wat vroeër ’n lasteraar en ’n vervolger en ’n geweldenaar was. Maar aan my is barmhartigheid bewys, omdat ek dit onwetend gedoen het in ongeloof.

column2: 1 Timothy 1:14 And the grace of our Lord was exceeding abundant with faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.
column3: 1 Timotheus 1:14 En die genade van onse Here was baie oorvloedig met geloof en liefde wat in Christus Jesus is.

column2: 1 Timothy 1:15 This [is] a faithful saying, and worthy of all acceptation, that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners; of whom I am chief.
column3: 1 Timotheus 1:15 Dit is ’n betroubare woord en werd om ten volle aangeneem te word, dat Christus Jesus in die wêreld gekom het om sondaars te red, van wie ek die vernaamste is.

column2: 1 Timothy 1:16 Howbeit for this cause I obtained mercy, that in me first Jesus Christ might shew forth all longsuffering, for a pattern to them which should hereafter believe on him to life everlasting.
column3: 1 Timotheus 1:16 Maar daarom is aan my barmhartigheid bewys, dat Jesus Christus in my as die vernaamste al sy lankmoedigheid sou betoon, om ’n voorbeeld te wees vir die wat in Hom sal glo tot die ewige lewe.

column2: 1 Timothy 1:17 Now unto the King eternal, immortal, invisible, the only wise God, [be] honour and glory for ever and ever. Amen.
column3: 1 Timotheus 1:17 Aan die Koning van die eeue, die onverderflike, onsienlike, alleenwyse God, kom toe die eer en die heerlikheid tot in alle ewigheid. Amen.

column2: 1 Timothy 1:18 This charge I commit unto thee, son Timothy, according to the prophecies which went before on thee, that thou by them mightest war a good warfare;
column3: 1 Timotheus 1:18 Hierdie boodskap vertrou ek aan jou toe, my kind Timótheüs, ooreenkomstig die profesieë wat vroeër aangaande jou uitgespreek is, sodat jy daardeur die goeie stryd kan stry

column2: 1 Timothy 1:19 Holding faith, and a good conscience; which some having put away concerning faith have made shipwreck:
column3: 1 Timotheus 1:19 en aan die geloof en ’n goeie gewete vashou. Sommige het dit van hulle weggestoot en aan die geloof skipbreuk gely,

column2: 1 Timothy 1:20 Of whom is Hymenaeus and Alexander; whom I have delivered unto Satan, that they may learn not to blaspheme.
column3: 1 Timotheus 1:20 onder wie daar is Himenéüs en Alexander, wat ek aan die Satan oorgegee het, sodat hulle kan leer om nie te laster nie.

column2: 1 Timothy 2:1 I exhort therefore, that, first of all, supplications, prayers, intercessions, [and] giving of thanks, be made for all men;
column3: 1 Timotheus 2:1 IN die eerste plek vermaan ek dan dat smekinge, gebede, voorbedes, danksegginge gedoen moet word vir alle mense;

column2: 1 Timothy 2:2 For kings, and [for] all that are in authority; that we may lead a quiet and peaceable life in all godliness and honesty.
column3: 1 Timotheus 2:2 vir konings en almal wat hooggeplaas is, sodat ons ’n rustige en stil lewe kan lei in alle godsvrug en waardigheid.

column2: 1 Timothy 2:3 For this [is] good and acceptable in the sight of God our Saviour;
column3: 1 Timotheus 2:3 Want dit is goed en aangenaam voor God, ons Verlosser,

column2: 1 Timothy 2:4 Who will have all men to be saved, and to come unto the knowledge of the truth.
column3: 1 Timotheus 2:4 wat wil hê dat alle mense gered word en tot kennis van die waarheid kom.

column2: 1 Timothy 2:5 For [there is] one God, and one mediator between God and men, the man Christ Jesus;
column3: 1 Timotheus 2:5 Want daar is een God en een Middelaar tussen God en die mense, die mens Christus Jesus,

column2: 1 Timothy 2:6 Who gave himself a ransom for all, to be testified in due time.
column3: 1 Timotheus 2:6 wat Homself gegee het as ’n losprys vir almal, as die getuienis op die regte tyd,

column2: 1 Timothy 2:7 Whereunto I am ordained a preacher, and an apostle, (I speak the truth in Christ, [and] lie not;) a teacher of the Gentiles in faith and verity.
column3: 1 Timotheus 2:7 waartoe ek aangestel is as ’n prediker en apostel — ek sê die waarheid in Christus, ek lieg nie — ’n leraar van die heidene in geloof en waarheid.

column2: 1 Timothy 2:8 I will therefore that men pray every where, lifting up holy hands, without wrath and doubting.
column3: 1 Timotheus 2:8 Ek wil dan hê dat die manne op elke plek moet bid en heilige hande ophef sonder toorn en twis.

column2: 1 Timothy 2:9 In like manner also, that women adorn themselves in modest apparel, with shamefacedness and sobriety; not with broided hair, or gold, or pearls, or costly array;
column3: 1 Timotheus 2:9 SO ook moet die vroue hulle versier met behoorlike kleding, gepaard met beskeidenheid en ingetoënheid, nie met vlegsels of goud of pêrels of kosbare klere nie,

column2: 1 Timothy 2:10 But (which becometh women professing godliness) with good works.
column3: 1 Timotheus 2:10 maar, soos dit vroue betaam wat die godsvrug bely, met goeie werke.

column2: 1 Timothy 2:11 Let the woman learn in silence with all subjection.
column3: 1 Timotheus 2:11 Die vrou moet haar in stilte laat leer in alle onderdanigheid.

column2: 1 Timothy 2:12 But I suffer not a woman to teach, nor to usurp authority over the man, but to be in silence.
column3: 1 Timotheus 2:12 Ek laat die vrou egter nie toe om onderrig te gee of oor die man te heers nie, maar sy moet haar stil hou.

column2: 1 Timothy 2:13 For Adam was first formed, then Eve.
column3: 1 Timotheus 2:13 Want Adam is eerste gemaak, daarna Eva.

column2: 1 Timothy 2:14 And Adam was not deceived, but the woman being deceived was in the transgression.
column3: 1 Timotheus 2:14 En Adam is nie verlei nie, maar die vrou het haar laat verlei en het in oortreding gekom.

column2: 1 Timothy 2:15 Notwithstanding she shall be saved in childbearing, if they continue in faith and charity and holiness with sobriety.
column3: 1 Timotheus 2:15 Maar sy sal gered word deur kinders te baar, as hulle bly in geloof en liefde en heiligmaking, met ingetoënheid.

column2: 1 Timothy 3:1 This [is] a true saying, If a man desire the office of a bishop, he desireth a good work.
column3: 1 Timotheus 3:1 DIT is ’n betroubare woord: as iemand na ’n opsienersamp verlang, begeer hy ’n voortreflike werk.

column2: 1 Timothy 3:2 A bishop then must be blameless, the husband of one wife, vigilant, sober, of good behaviour, given to hospitality, apt to teach;
column3: 1 Timotheus 3:2 ’n Opsiener dan moet onberispelik wees, die man van een vrou, nugter, ingetoë, fatsoenlik, gasvry, bekwaam om te onderrig;

column2: 1 Timothy 3:3 Not given to wine, no striker, not greedy of filthy lucre; but patient, not a brawler, not covetous;
column3: 1 Timotheus 3:3 geen drinker, geen vegter, geen vuilgewinsoeker nie, maar vriendelik; geen strydlustige, geen geldgierige nie;

column2: 1 Timothy 3:4 One that ruleth well his own house, having his children in subjection with all gravity;
column3: 1 Timotheus 3:4 een wat sy eie huis goed regeer en sy kinders met alle waardigheid in onderdanigheid hou.

column2: 1 Timothy 3:5 (For if a man know not how to rule his own house, how shall he take care of the church of God?)
column3: 1 Timotheus 3:5 Maar as iemand nie weet om sy eie huis te regeer nie, hoe sal hy vir die gemeente van God sorg dra?

column2: 1 Timothy 3:6 Not a novice, lest being lifted up with pride he fall into the condemnation of the devil.
column3: 1 Timotheus 3:6 Hy moet nie ’n nuweling wees nie, sodat hy nie verwaand word en in dieselfde oordeel as die duiwel val nie.

column2: 1 Timothy 3:7 Moreover he must have a good report of them which are without; lest he fall into reproach and the snare of the devil.
column3: 1 Timotheus 3:7 Maar hy moet ook goeie getuienis hê van die buitestaanders, sodat hy nie in veragting en in die strik van die duiwel val nie.

column2: 1 Timothy 3:8 Likewise [must] the deacons [be] grave, not doubletongued, not given to much wine, not greedy of filthy lucre;
column3: 1 Timotheus 3:8 Net so moet die diakens waardig wees, nie uit twee monde spreek nie, nie verslaaf aan wyn nie, geen vuilgewinsoekers nie,

column2: 1 Timothy 3:9 Holding the mystery of the faith in a pure conscience.
column3: 1 Timotheus 3:9 manne wat die verborgenheid van die geloof in ’n rein gewete hou.

column2: 1 Timothy 3:10 And let these also first be proved; then let them use the office of a deacon, being [found] blameless.
column3: 1 Timotheus 3:10 En hulle moet ook eers ’n proeftyd deurmaak; daarna, as hulle onberispelik is, kan hulle dien.

column2: 1 Timothy 3:11 Even so [must their] wives [be] grave, not slanderers, sober, faithful in all things.
column3: 1 Timotheus 3:11 Net so moet die vroue waardig wees, geen kwaadspreeksters nie, nugter, betroubaar in alles.

column2: 1 Timothy 3:12 Let the deacons be the husbands of one wife, ruling their children and their own houses well.
column3: 1 Timotheus 3:12 Die diakens moet manne van een vrou wees en hulle kinders en eie huis goed regeer.

column2: 1 Timothy 3:13 For they that have used the office of a deacon well purchase to themselves a good degree, and great boldness in the faith which is in Christ Jesus.
column3: 1 Timotheus 3:13 Want die wat goed gedien het, verkry vir hulle ’n eervolle plek en veel vrymoedigheid in die geloof in Christus Jesus.

column2: 1 Timothy 3:14 These things write I unto thee, hoping to come unto thee shortly:
column3: 1 Timotheus 3:14 Ek skryf jou hierdie dinge in die hoop om gou na jou te kom.

column2: 1 Timothy 3:15 But if I tarry long, that thou mayest know how thou oughtest to behave thyself in the house of God, which is the church of the living God, the pillar and ground of the truth.
column3: 1 Timotheus 3:15 Maar as ek vertoef, dan kan jy weet hoe iemand hom moet gedra in die huis van God, wat die gemeente is van die lewende God, ’n pilaar en grondslag van die waarheid.

column2: 1 Timothy 3:16 And without controversy great is the mystery of godliness: God was manifest in the flesh, justified in the Spirit, seen of angels, preached unto the Gentiles, believed on in the world, received up into glory.
column3: 1 Timotheus 3:16 En, onteenseglik, die verborgenheid van die godsaligheid is groot: God is geopenbaar in die vlees, is geregverdig in die Gees, het verskyn aan engele, is verkondig onder die heidene, is geglo in die wêreld, is opgeneem in heerlikheid.

column2: 1 Timothy 4:1 Now the Spirit speaketh expressly, that in the latter times some shall depart from the faith, giving heed to seducing spirits, and doctrines of devils;
column3: 1 Timotheus 4:1 MAAR die Gees sê uitdruklik dat in die laaste tye sommige van die geloof afvallig sal word en verleidende geeste en leringe van duiwels sal aanhang

column2: 1 Timothy 4:2 Speaking lies in hypocrisy; having their conscience seared with a hot iron;
column3: 1 Timotheus 4:2 deur die geveinsdheid van leuenaars wat gebrandmerk is in hulle eie gewete,

column2: 1 Timothy 4:3 Forbidding to marry, [and commanding] to abstain from meats, which God hath created to be received with thanksgiving of them which believe and know the truth.
column3: 1 Timotheus 4:3 wat verbied om te trou en gebied dat die mense hulle moet onthou van voedsel wat God geskape het om met danksegging gebruik te word deur die gelowiges en die wat die waarheid ken.

column2: 1 Timothy 4:4 For every creature of God [is] good, and nothing to be refused, if it be received with thanksgiving:
column3: 1 Timotheus 4:4 Want alles wat deur God geskape is, is goed, en niks is verwerplik as dit met danksegging ontvang word nie;

column2: 1 Timothy 4:5 For it is sanctified by the word of God and prayer.
column3: 1 Timotheus 4:5 want dit word geheilig deur die woord van God en die gebed.

column2: 1 Timothy 4:6 If thou put the brethren in remembrance of these things, thou shalt be a good minister of Jesus Christ, nourished up in the words of faith and of good doctrine, whereunto thou hast attained.
column3: 1 Timotheus 4:6 AS jy hierdie dinge aan die broeders voorhou, sal jy ’n goeie dienaar van Jesus Christus wees terwyl jy jouself voed met die woorde van die geloof en van die goeie leer waarvan jy ’n navolger geword het.

column2: 1 Timothy 4:7 But refuse profane and old wives' fables, and exercise thyself [rather] unto godliness.
column3: 1 Timotheus 4:7 Maar verwerp onheilige en oudwyfse fabels, en oefen jou in die godsaligheid.

column2: 1 Timothy 4:8 For bodily exercise profiteth little: but godliness is profitable unto all things, having promise of the life that now is, and of that which is to come.
column3: 1 Timotheus 4:8 Want die liggaamlike oefening is tot weinig nut, maar die godsaligheid is nuttig vir alles, omdat dit die belofte van die teenwoordige en die toekomende lewe het.

column2: 1 Timothy 4:9 This [is] a faithful saying and worthy of all acceptation.
column3: 1 Timotheus 4:9 Dit is ’n betroubare woord en werd om ten volle aangeneem te word;

column2: 1 Timothy 4:10 For therefore we both labour and suffer reproach, because we trust in the living God, who is the Saviour of all men, specially of those that believe.
column3: 1 Timotheus 4:10 want hiervoor arbei ons ook en word ons gesmaad, omdat ons gehoop het op die lewende God wat ’n behouder is van alle mense, insonderheid van die gelowiges.

column2: 1 Timothy 4:11 These things command and teach.
column3: 1 Timotheus 4:11 Beveel en leer hierdie dinge.

column2: 1 Timothy 4:12 Let no man despise thy youth; but be thou an example of the believers, in word, in conversation, in charity, in spirit, in faith, in purity.
column3: 1 Timotheus 4:12 Laat niemand jou jonkheid verag nie, maar wees ’n voorbeeld vir die gelowiges in woord, in wandel, in liefde, in gees, in geloof, in reinheid.

column2: 1 Timothy 4:13 Till I come, give attendance to reading, to exhortation, to doctrine.
column3: 1 Timotheus 4:13 Totdat ek kom, moet jy aanhou met voorlesing, vermaning en lering.

column2: 1 Timothy 4:14 Neglect not the gift that is in thee, which was given thee by prophecy, with the laying on of the hands of the presbytery.
column3: 1 Timotheus 4:14 Verwaarloos nie die genadegawe wat in jou is nie, wat jou gegee is deur die profesie met die handoplegging van die ouderlinge.

column2: 1 Timothy 4:15 Meditate upon these things; give thyself wholly to them; that thy profiting may appear to all.
column3: 1 Timotheus 4:15 Wees vlytig in hierdie dinge, leef daarin, sodat jou vooruitgang vir almal duidelik kan wees.

column2: 1 Timothy 4:16 Take heed unto thyself, and unto the doctrine; continue in them: for in doing this thou shalt both save thyself, and them that hear thee.
column3: 1 Timotheus 4:16 Let op jouself en op die leer; volhard daarin; want deur dit te doen, sal jy jouself red sowel as die wat jou hoor.

column2: 1 Timothy 5:1 Rebuke not an elder, but intreat [him] as a father; [and] the younger men as brethren;
column3: 1 Timotheus 5:1 ’n BEJAARDE man moet jy nie hard bestraf nie, maar vermaan hom soos ’n vader, jongeres soos broers,

column2: 1 Timothy 5:2 The elder women as mothers; the younger as sisters, with all purity.
column3: 1 Timotheus 5:2 bejaarde vroue soos moeders, jongeres soos susters in alle reinheid.

column2: 1 Timothy 5:3 Honour widows that are widows indeed.
column3: 1 Timotheus 5:3 Eer die weduwees wat waarlik weduwees is.

column2: 1 Timothy 5:4 But if any widow have children or nephews, let them learn first to shew piety at home, and to requite their parents: for that is good and acceptable before God.
column3: 1 Timotheus 5:4 Maar as ’n weduwee kinders of kleinkinders het, laat hulle eers leer om teenoor hulle eie huis eerbied te betoon en vergelding te doen aan hulle ouers; want dit is goed en aangenaam voor God.

column2: 1 Timothy 5:5 Now she that is a widow indeed, and desolate, trusteth in God, and continueth in supplications and prayers night and day.
column3: 1 Timotheus 5:5 En sy wat waarlik weduwee is en alleen gelaat is, hoop op God en bly in smekinge en gebede nag en dag.

column2: 1 Timothy 5:6 But she that liveth in pleasure is dead while she liveth.
column3: 1 Timotheus 5:6 Maar sy wat losbandig is, is lewendig dood.

column2: 1 Timothy 5:7 And these things give in charge, that they may be blameless.
column3: 1 Timotheus 5:7 Beveel ook hierdie dinge, sodat hulle onberispelik kan wees.

column2: 1 Timothy 5:8 But if any provide not for his own, and specially for those of his own house, he hath denied the faith, and is worse than an infidel.
column3: 1 Timotheus 5:8 Maar iemand wat vir sy eie mense, en veral sy huisgenote, nie sorg nie, het die geloof verloën en is slegter as ’n ongelowige.

column2: 1 Timothy 5:9 Let not a widow be taken into the number under threescore years old, having been the wife of one man,
column3: 1 Timotheus 5:9 Laat ’n weduwee gekies word, nie minder as sestig jaar oud nie, wat die vrou van een man gewees het

column2: 1 Timothy 5:10 Well reported of for good works; if she have brought up children, if she have lodged strangers, if she have washed the saints' feet, if she have relieved the afflicted, if she have diligently followed every good work.
column3: 1 Timotheus 5:10 en getuienis het van goeie werke, as sy kinders grootgemaak het, gasvry gewees het, die voete van die heiliges gewas het, verdruktes gehelp en elke goeie werk nagestreef het.

column2: 1 Timothy 5:11 But the younger widows refuse: for when they have begun to wax wanton against Christ, they will marry;
column3: 1 Timotheus 5:11 Maar jy moet die jong weduwees afwys; want wanneer hulle tot oneer van Christus wellustig word, wil hulle trou

column2: 1 Timothy 5:12 Having damnation, because they have cast off their first faith.
column3: 1 Timotheus 5:12 en kom onder ’n oordeel, omdat hulle hul eerste geloof verwerp het.

column2: 1 Timothy 5:13 And withal they learn [to be] idle, wandering about from house to house; and not only idle, but tattlers also and busybodies, speaking things which they ought not.
column3: 1 Timotheus 5:13 En tegelykertyd leer hulle ook om ledig by die huise rond te gaan; en nie alleen is hulle ledig nie, maar ook praatsiek en bemoeisiek, want hulle praat wat nie behoorlik is nie.

column2: 1 Timothy 5:14 I will therefore that the younger women marry, bear children, guide the house, give none occasion to the adversary to speak reproachfully.
column3: 1 Timotheus 5:14 Ek wil dan hê dat die jong weduwees moet trou, kinders baar, hulle huise regeer en die teëparty geen aanleiding gee om kwaad te spreek nie.

column2: 1 Timothy 5:15 For some are already turned aside after Satan.
column3: 1 Timotheus 5:15 Want sommige het al afgewyk agter die Satan aan.

column2: 1 Timothy 5:16 If any man or woman that believeth have widows, let them relieve them, and let not the church be charged; that it may relieve them that are widows indeed.
column3: 1 Timotheus 5:16 As ’n gelowige man of ’n gelowige vrou weduwees by hulle het, moet dié aan hulle hulp verleen; en laat die gemeente nie beswaar word nie, sodat dit die wat waarlik weduwees is, kan help.

column2: 1 Timothy 5:17 Let the elders that rule well be counted worthy of double honour, especially they who labour in the word and doctrine.
column3: 1 Timotheus 5:17 LAAT die ouderlinge wat goed regeer, dubbele eer waardig geag word, veral die wat arbei in woord en leer.

column2: 1 Timothy 5:18 For the scripture saith, Thou shalt not muzzle the ox that treadeth out the corn. And, The labourer [is] worthy of his reward.
column3: 1 Timotheus 5:18 Want die Skrif sê: Jy mag ’n os wat graan dors, nie muilband nie; en: Die arbeider is sy loon werd.

column2: 1 Timothy 5:19 Against an elder receive not an accusation, but before two or three witnesses.
column3: 1 Timotheus 5:19 Moenie ’n beskuldiging teen ’n ouderling aanneem nie, behalwe op die getuienis van twee of drie.

column2: 1 Timothy 5:20 Them that sin rebuke before all, that others also may fear.
column3: 1 Timotheus 5:20 Bestraf die wat sondig, in die teenwoordigheid van almal, sodat ook die ander kan vrees.

column2: 1 Timothy 5:21 I charge [thee] before God, and the Lord Jesus Christ, and the elect angels, that thou observe these things without preferring one before another, doing nothing by partiality.
column3: 1 Timotheus 5:21 Ek besweer jou voor God en die Here Jesus Christus en die uitverkore engele dat jy hierdie dinge sonder vooroordeel in ag neem en niks uit partydigheid doen nie.

column2: 1 Timothy 5:22 Lay hands suddenly on no man, neither be partaker of other men's sins: keep thyself pure.
column3: 1 Timotheus 5:22 Moenie haastig iemand die hande oplê nie, en moet ook nie met die sondes van ander gemeenskap hê nie. Hou jou rein.

column2: 1 Timothy 5:23 Drink no longer water, but use a little wine for thy stomach's sake and thine often infirmities.
column3: 1 Timotheus 5:23 Moenie langer water alleen drink nie, maar gebruik ’n bietjie wyn ter wille van jou maag en jou herhaalde ongesteldhede.

column2: 1 Timothy 5:24 Some men's sins are open beforehand, going before to judgment; and some [men] they follow after.
column3: 1 Timotheus 5:24 Die sondes van sommige mense is baie duidelik en gaan voor hulle uit tot die oordeel, maar volg ander eers agterna.

column2: 1 Timothy 5:25 Likewise also the good works [of some] are manifest beforehand; and they that are otherwise cannot be hid.
column3: 1 Timotheus 5:25 Net so is ook die goeie werke baie duidelik, en ook die wat anders is, kan nie weggesteek word nie.

column2: 1 Timothy 6:1 Let as many servants as are under the yoke count their own masters worthy of all honour, that the name of God and [his] doctrine be not blasphemed.
column3: 1 Timotheus 6:1 ALMAL wat diensknegte is onder ’n juk, moet hulle eie here alle eer waardig ag, sodat die Naam van God en die leer nie belaster mag word nie.

column2: 1 Timothy 6:2 And they that have believing masters, let them not despise [them], because they are brethren; but rather do [them] service, because they are faithful and beloved, partakers of the benefit. These things teach and exhort.
column3: 1 Timotheus 6:2 En die wat gelowige here het, moet hulle nie verag omdat hulle broeders is nie, maar moet hulle des te meer dien, omdat hulle wat die weldade ontvang, gelowiges en geliefdes is. Leer hierdie dinge en wek daartoe op.

column2: 1 Timothy 6:3 If any man teach otherwise, and consent not to wholesome words, [even] the words of our Lord Jesus Christ, and to the doctrine which is according to godliness;
column3: 1 Timotheus 6:3 AS iemand iets anders leer en nie instem met die gesonde woorde van onse Here Jesus Christus en met die leer wat volgens die godsaligheid is nie,

column2: 1 Timothy 6:4 He is proud, knowing nothing, but doting about questions and strifes of words, whereof cometh envy, strife, railings, evil surmisings,
column3: 1 Timotheus 6:4 dié is verwaand en verstaan niks nie, maar het ’n sieklike sug na twisvrae en woordestryd waaruit ontstaan afguns, twis, lasteringe, bose agterdog,

column2: 1 Timothy 6:5 Perverse disputings of men of corrupt minds, and destitute of the truth, supposing that gain is godliness: from such withdraw thyself.
column3: 1 Timotheus 6:5 nuttelose stryery van mense wat verdorwe in hulle verstand en van die waarheid beroof is en dink dat die godsaligheid winsgewend is. Onttrek jou aan sulke mense.

column2: 1 Timothy 6:6 But godliness with contentment is great gain.
column3: 1 Timotheus 6:6 Maar die godsaligheid saam met vergenoegdheid is ’n groot wins.

column2: 1 Timothy 6:7 For we brought nothing into [this] world, [and it is] certain we can carry nothing out.
column3: 1 Timotheus 6:7 Want ons het niks in die wêreld ingebring nie; dit is duidelik dat ons ook niks daaruit kan wegdra nie.

column2: 1 Timothy 6:8 And having food and raiment let us be therewith content.
column3: 1 Timotheus 6:8 Maar as ons voedsel en klere het, moet ons daarmee vergenoeg wees.

column2: 1 Timothy 6:9 But they that will be rich fall into temptation and a snare, and [into] many foolish and hurtful lusts, which drown men in destruction and perdition.
column3: 1 Timotheus 6:9 Maar die wat ryk wil word, val in versoeking en strikke en baie dwase en skadelike begeerlikhede wat die mense laat wegsink in verderf en ondergang.

column2: 1 Timothy 6:10 For the love of money is the root of all evil: which while some coveted after, they have erred from the faith, and pierced themselves through with many sorrows.
column3: 1 Timotheus 6:10 Want die geldgierigheid is ’n wortel van alle euwels; en omdat sommige dit begeer, het hulle afgedwaal van die geloof en hulleself met baie smarte deurboor.

column2: 1 Timothy 6:11 But thou, O man of God, flee these things; and follow after righteousness, godliness, faith, love, patience, meekness.
column3: 1 Timotheus 6:11 Maar jy, man van God, vlug van hierdie dinge weg, en jaag ná die geregtigheid, godsaligheid, geloof, liefde, lydsaamheid, sagmoedigheid.

column2: 1 Timothy 6:12 Fight the good fight of faith, lay hold on eternal life, whereunto thou art also called, and hast professed a good profession before many witnesses.
column3: 1 Timotheus 6:12 Stry die goeie stryd van die geloof, gryp na die ewige lewe, waartoe jy ook geroep is en die goeie belydenis voor baie getuies afgelê het.

column2: 1 Timothy 6:13 I give thee charge in the sight of God, who quickeneth all things, and [before] Christ Jesus, who before Pontius Pilate witnessed a good confession;
column3: 1 Timotheus 6:13 Ek gebied jou voor die aangesig van God wat aan alle dinge die lewe gee, en van Christus Jesus wat voor Pontius Pilatus die goeie belydenis betuig het,

column2: 1 Timothy 6:14 That thou keep [this] commandment without spot, unrebukeable, until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ:
column3: 1 Timotheus 6:14 dat jy die gebod onbevlek, onberispelik bewaar tot by die verskyning van onse Here Jesus Christus

column2: 1 Timothy 6:15 Which in his times he shall shew, [who is] the blessed and only Potentate, the King of kings, and Lord of lords;
column3: 1 Timotheus 6:15 wat op sy eie tyd vertoon sal word deur die salige en enigste Heerser, die Koning van die konings en Here van die here,

column2: 1 Timothy 6:16 Who only hath immortality, dwelling in the light which no man can approach unto; whom no man hath seen, nor can see: to whom [be] honour and power everlasting. Amen.
column3: 1 Timotheus 6:16 wat alleen onsterflikheid besit en ’n ontoeganklike lig bewoon, wat geen mens gesien het of kan sien nie, aan wie toekom eer en ewige krag. Amen.

column2: 1 Timothy 6:17 Charge them that are rich in this world, that they be not highminded, nor trust in uncertain riches, but in the living God, who giveth us richly all things to enjoy;
column3: 1 Timotheus 6:17 Beveel die rykes in die teenwoordige wêreld om nie hoogmoedig te wees nie en ook nie hulle hoop te stel op die onsekerheid van die rykdom nie, maar op die lewende God wat ons alles ryklik verleen om te geniet;

column2: 1 Timothy 6:18 That they do good, that they be rich in good works, ready to distribute, willing to communicate;
column3: 1 Timotheus 6:18 dat hulle goed moet doen en ryk wees in goeie werke, vrygewig, mededeelsaam,

column2: 1 Timothy 6:19 Laying up in store for themselves a good foundation against the time to come, that they may lay hold on eternal life.
column3: 1 Timotheus 6:19 en vir hulle ’n skat weglê, ’n goeie fondament vir die toekoms, sodat hulle die ewige lewe kan verwerf.

column2: 1 Timothy 6:20 O Timothy, keep that which is committed to thy trust, avoiding profane [and] vain babblings, and oppositions of science falsely so called:
column3: 1 Timotheus 6:20 O Timótheüs, bewaar jou pand en vermy die onheilige, onsinnige praatjies en teëwerpinge van die valslik sogenaamde kennis,

column2: 1 Timothy 6:21 Which some professing have erred concerning the faith. Grace [be] with thee. Amen. <<[The first to Timothy was written from Laodicea, which is the chiefest city of Phrygia Pacatiana.]>>
column3: 1 Timotheus 6:21 waarvan sommige belydenis gedoen het en, wat die geloof betref, op ’n dwaalweg geraak het. Mag die genade met jou wees! Amen.

column2: 2 Timothy 1:1 Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, according to the promise of life which is in Christ Jesus,
column3: 2 Timotheus 1:1 PAULUS, ’n apostel van Jesus Christus deur die wil van God, ooreenkomstig die belofte van die lewe wat in Christus Jesus is,

column2: 2 Timothy 1:2 To Timothy, [my] dearly beloved son: Grace, mercy, [and] peace, from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.
column3: 2 Timotheus 1:2 aan Timótheüs, my geliefde kind: Genade, barmhartigheid, vrede van God die Vader en Christus Jesus, onse Here!

column2: 2 Timothy 1:3 I thank God, whom I serve from [my] forefathers with pure conscience, that without ceasing I have remembrance of thee in my prayers night and day;
column3: 2 Timotheus 1:3 EK dank God, wat ek van my voorouers af in ’n rein gewete dien, wanneer ek onophoudelik nag en dag aan jou in my gebede dink,

column2: 2 Timothy 1:4 Greatly desiring to see thee, being mindful of thy tears, that I may be filled with joy;
column3: 2 Timotheus 1:4 terwyl ek verlang om jou te sien as ek aan jou trane dink, sodat ek met blydskap vervul kan word,

column2: 2 Timothy 1:5 When I call to remembrance the unfeigned faith that is in thee, which dwelt first in thy grandmother Lois, and thy mother Eunice; and I am persuaded that in thee also.
column3: 2 Timotheus 1:5 en as ek my herinner die ongeveinsde geloof wat in jou is, wat eers gewoon het in jou grootmoeder Loïs en in jou moeder Eunice, en wat — daarvan is ek oortuig — ook in jou is.

column2: 2 Timothy 1:6 Wherefore I put thee in remembrance that thou stir up the gift of God, which is in thee by the putting on of my hands.
column3: 2 Timotheus 1:6 Om hierdie rede herinner ek jou daaraan om die genadegawe van God aan te wakker wat in jou is deur die oplegging van my hande.

column2: 2 Timothy 1:7 For God hath not given us the spirit of fear; but of power, and of love, and of a sound mind.
column3: 2 Timotheus 1:7 Want God het ons nie ’n gees van vreesagtigheid gegee nie, maar van krag en liefde en selfbeheersing.

column2: 2 Timothy 1:8 Be not thou therefore ashamed of the testimony of our Lord, nor of me his prisoner: but be thou partaker of the afflictions of the gospel according to the power of God;
column3: 2 Timotheus 1:8 Skaam jou dan nie oor die getuienis van onse Here of oor my, sy gevangene nie, maar ly saam verdrukkinge vir die evangelie na die krag van God

column2: 2 Timothy 1:9 Who hath saved us, and called [us] with an holy calling, not according to our works, but according to his own purpose and grace, which was given us in Christ Jesus before the world began,
column3: 2 Timotheus 1:9 wat ons gered en geroep het met ’n heilige roeping, nie volgens ons werke nie, maar volgens sy eie voorneme en genade wat ons van ewigheid af in Christus Jesus geskenk is,

column2: 2 Timothy 1:10 But is now made manifest by the appearing of our Saviour Jesus Christ, who hath abolished death, and hath brought life and immortality to light through the gospel:
column3: 2 Timotheus 1:10 maar wat nou geopenbaar is deur die verskyning van ons Verlosser, Jesus Christus, wat die dood tot niet gemaak het en die lewe en die onverderflikheid aan die lig gebring het deur die evangelie,

column2: 2 Timothy 1:11 Whereunto I am appointed a preacher, and an apostle, and a teacher of the Gentiles.
column3: 2 Timotheus 1:11 waarvoor ek aangestel is as prediker en apostel en leraar van die heidene.

column2: 2 Timothy 1:12 For the which cause I also suffer these things: nevertheless I am not ashamed: for I know whom I have believed, and am persuaded that he is able to keep that which I have committed unto him against that day.
column3: 2 Timotheus 1:12 Om hierdie rede ly ek ook hierdie dinge; maar ek skaam my nie, want ek weet in wie ek geglo het, en ek is oortuig dat Hy mag het om my pand te bewaar tot dié dag toe.

column2: 2 Timothy 1:13 Hold fast the form of sound words, which thou hast heard of me, in faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.
column3: 2 Timotheus 1:13 Hou as voorbeeld van gesonde woorde dié wat jy van my gehoor het, in die geloof en liefde wat in Christus Jesus is.

column2: 2 Timothy 1:14 That good thing which was committed unto thee keep by the Holy Ghost which dwelleth in us.
column3: 2 Timotheus 1:14 Bewaar jou goeie pand deur die Heilige Gees wat in ons woon.

column2: 2 Timothy 1:15 This thou knowest, that all they which are in Asia be turned away from me; of whom are Phygellus and Hermogenes.
column3: 2 Timotheus 1:15 Jy weet dit dat almal wat in Asië is, hulle van my afgekeer het, onder wie Figéllus en Hermógenes is.

column2: 2 Timothy 1:16 The Lord give mercy unto the house of Onesiphorus; for he oft refreshed me, and was not ashamed of my chain:
column3: 2 Timotheus 1:16 Mag die Here aan die huis van Onesíforus barmhartigheid bewys, want hy het my dikwels verkwik en hom oor my kettings nie geskaam nie;

column2: 2 Timothy 1:17 But, when he was in Rome, he sought me out very diligently, and found [me].
column3: 2 Timotheus 1:17 maar toe hy in Rome gekom het, het hy my baie ywerig gesoek en gevind.

column2: 2 Timothy 1:18 The Lord grant unto him that he may find mercy of the Lord in that day: and in how many things he ministered unto me at Ephesus, thou knowest very well.
column3: 2 Timotheus 1:18 Mag die Here hom skenk dat hy barmhartigheid mag verkry van die Here in dié dag! En jy weet baie goed hoeveel dienste hy in Éfese bewys het.

column2: 2 Timothy 2:1 Thou therefore, my son, be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.
column3: 2 Timotheus 2:1 JY dan, my seun, wees sterk deur die genade wat in Christus Jesus is;

column2: 2 Timothy 2:2 And the things that thou hast heard of me among many witnesses, the same commit thou to faithful men, who shall be able to teach others also.
column3: 2 Timotheus 2:2 en wat jy van my gehoor het onder baie getuies, vertrou dit toe aan getroue manne wat bekwaam sal wees om ook ander te leer.

column2: 2 Timothy 2:3 Thou therefore endure hardness, as a good soldier of Jesus Christ.
column3: 2 Timotheus 2:3 Ly dan verdrukking soos ’n goeie krygsman van Jesus Christus.

column2: 2 Timothy 2:4 No man that warreth entangleth himself with the affairs of [this] life; that he may please him who hath chosen him to be a soldier.
column3: 2 Timotheus 2:4 Niemand wat ’n krygsman is, wikkel hom in die werksaamhede van die lewensonderhoud nie, sodat hy die een kan behaag wat hom vir die diens gewerf het.

column2: 2 Timothy 2:5 And if a man also strive for masteries, [yet] is he not crowned, except he strive lawfully.
column3: 2 Timotheus 2:5 En verder, as iemand aan ’n wedstryd deelneem, word hy nie bekroon as hy nie volgens die reëls gewedywer het nie.

column2: 2 Timothy 2:6 The husbandman that laboureth must be first partaker of the fruits.
column3: 2 Timotheus 2:6 Die landbouer wat swaar werk, behoort eerste van die vrugte te geniet.

column2: 2 Timothy 2:7 Consider what I say; and the Lord give thee understanding in all things.
column3: 2 Timotheus 2:7 Dink na oor wat ek sê; en mag die Here jou insig gee in alles!

column2: 2 Timothy 2:8 Remember that Jesus Christ of the seed of David was raised from the dead according to my gospel:
column3: 2 Timotheus 2:8 Onthou dat Jesus Christus, uit die geslag van Dawid, uit die dode opgewek is volgens my evangelie,

column2: 2 Timothy 2:9 Wherein I suffer trouble, as an evil doer, [even] unto bonds; but the word of God is not bound.
column3: 2 Timotheus 2:9 waarin ek verdrukking ly tot die boeie toe soos ’n kwaaddoener; maar die woord van God is nie gebonde nie.

column2: 2 Timothy 2:10 Therefore I endure all things for the elect's sakes, that they may also obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.
column3: 2 Timotheus 2:10 Daarom verdra ek alles ter wille van die uitverkorenes, sodat hulle ook die verlossing wat in Christus Jesus is, kan verkry met die ewige heerlikheid.

column2: 2 Timothy 2:11 [It is] a faithful saying: For if we be dead with [him], we shall also live with [him]:
column3: 2 Timotheus 2:11 Dit is ’n betroubare woord; want as ons met Hom gesterf het, sal ons ook met Hom lewe.

column2: 2 Timothy 2:12 If we suffer, we shall also reign with [him]: if we deny [him], he also will deny us:
column3: 2 Timotheus 2:12 As ons verdra, sal ons met Hom regeer. As ons Hom verloën, sal Hy ons ook verloën.

column2: 2 Timothy 2:13 If we believe not, [yet] he abideth faithful: he cannot deny himself.
column3: 2 Timotheus 2:13 As ons ontrou is, Hy bly getrou; Hy kan Homself nie verloën nie.

column2: 2 Timothy 2:14 Of these things put [them] in remembrance, charging [them] before the Lord that they strive not about words to no profit, [but] to the subverting of the hearers.
column3: 2 Timotheus 2:14 HERINNER aan hierdie dinge en betuig voor die Here dat hulle geen woordestryd moet voer wat tot geen nut is nie, maar net tot ondergang van die hoorders.

column2: 2 Timothy 2:15 Study to shew thyself approved unto God, a workman that needeth not to be ashamed, rightly dividing the word of truth.
column3: 2 Timotheus 2:15 Lê jou daarop toe om jou beproef voor God te stel as ’n werker wat hom nie hoef te skaam nie, wat die woord van die waarheid reg sny.

column2: 2 Timothy 2:16 But shun profane [and] vain babblings: for they will increase unto more ungodliness.
column3: 2 Timotheus 2:16 Maar die onheilige, onsinnige praatjies moet jy vermy; want hulle sal al verder voortgaan in goddeloosheid,

column2: 2 Timothy 2:17 And their word will eat as doth a canker: of whom is Hymenaeus and Philetus;
column3: 2 Timotheus 2:17 en hulle woord sal voortwoeker soos ’n kanker, onder wie daar Himenéüs en Filétus is,

column2: 2 Timothy 2:18 Who concerning the truth have erred, saying that the resurrection is past already; and overthrow the faith of some.
column3: 2 Timotheus 2:18 wat van die waarheid afgedwaal het, omdat hulle sê dat die opstanding al plaasgevind het; en hulle keer die geloof van sommige om.

column2: 2 Timothy 2:19 Nevertheless the foundation of God standeth sure, having this seal, The Lord knoweth them that are his. And, Let every one that nameth the name of Christ depart from iniquity.
column3: 2 Timotheus 2:19 Ewenwel, die fondament van God staan vas met hierdie seël: Die Here ken die wat syne is; en: Laat elkeen wat die Naam van Christus noem, afstand doen van die ongeregtigheid.

column2: 2 Timothy 2:20 But in a great house there are not only vessels of gold and of silver, but also of wood and of earth; and some to honour, and some to dishonour.
column3: 2 Timotheus 2:20 Maar in ’n groot huis is daar nie alleen voorwerpe van goud en silwer nie, maar ook van hout en erdewerk; en sommige tot eer, maar ander tot oneer.

column2: 2 Timothy 2:21 If a man therefore purge himself from these, he shall be a vessel unto honour, sanctified, and meet for the master's use, [and] prepared unto every good work.
column3: 2 Timotheus 2:21 As iemand hom dus hiervan deeglik reinig, sal hy ’n voorwerp tot eer wees, geheilig en bruikbaar vir die Here, toeberei vir elke goeie werk.

column2: 2 Timothy 2:22 Flee also youthful lusts: but follow righteousness, faith, charity, peace, with them that call on the Lord out of a pure heart.
column3: 2 Timotheus 2:22 Maar vlug vir die begeerlikhede van die jonkheid en jaag ná geregtigheid, geloof, liefde, vrede, saam met die wat die Here uit ’n rein hart aanroep.

column2: 2 Timothy 2:23 But foolish and unlearned questions avoid, knowing that they do gender strifes.
column3: 2 Timotheus 2:23 En die dwase en onverstandige strydvrae moet jy afwys, omdat jy weet dat dit twis verwek;

column2: 2 Timothy 2:24 And the servant of the Lord must not strive; but be gentle unto all [men], apt to teach, patient,
column3: 2 Timotheus 2:24 en ’n dienskneg van die Here moet nie twis nie, maar vriendelik wees teenoor almal, bekwaam om te onderrig en een wat kwaad kan verdra.

column2: 2 Timothy 2:25 In meekness instructing those that oppose themselves; if God peradventure will give them repentance to the acknowledging of the truth;
column3: 2 Timotheus 2:25 Hy moet die weerspanniges in sagmoedigheid teregwys, of God hulle nie miskien bekering sal gee tot die kennis van die waarheid nie,

column2: 2 Timothy 2:26 And [that] they may recover themselves out of the snare of the devil, who are taken captive by him at his will.
column3: 2 Timotheus 2:26 en hulle weer nugter kan word, vry van die strik van die duiwel, nadat hulle deur hom gevang was om sy wil te doen.

column2: 2 Timothy 3:1 This know also, that in the last days perilous times shall come.
column3: 2 Timotheus 3:1 MAAR weet dit, dat daar in die laaste dae swaar tye sal kom.

column2: 2 Timothy 3:2 For men shall be lovers of their own selves, covetous, boasters, proud, blasphemers, disobedient to parents, unthankful, unholy,
column3: 2 Timotheus 3:2 Want die mense sal liefhebbers van hulleself wees, geldgieriges, grootpraters, trotsaards, lasteraars, ongehoorsaam aan hulle ouers, ondankbaar, onheilig,

column2: 2 Timothy 3:3 Without natural affection, trucebreakers, false accusers, incontinent, fierce, despisers of those that are good,
column3: 2 Timotheus 3:3 sonder natuurlike liefde, onversoenlik, kwaadsprekers, bandeloos, wreed, sonder liefde vir die goeie,

column2: 2 Timothy 3:4 Traitors, heady, highminded, lovers of pleasures more than lovers of God;
column3: 2 Timotheus 3:4 verraaiers, roekeloos, verwaand, meer liefhebbers van genot as liefhebbers van God;

column2: 2 Timothy 3:5 Having a form of godliness, but denying the power thereof: from such turn away.
column3: 2 Timotheus 3:5 mense wat ’n gedaante van godsaligheid het, maar die krag daarvan verloën het. Keer jou ook van hierdie mense af.

column2: 2 Timothy 3:6 For of this sort are they which creep into houses, and lead captive silly women laden with sins, led away with divers lusts,
column3: 2 Timotheus 3:6 Want uit hulle is die wat in die huise insluip en arme vroue gevange neem wat met sondes belaai is en deur allerhande begeerlikhede gedryf word,

column2: 2 Timothy 3:7 Ever learning, and never able to come to the knowledge of the truth.
column3: 2 Timotheus 3:7 wat altyd leer en nooit tot die kennis van die waarheid kan kom nie.

column2: 2 Timothy 3:8 Now as Jannes and Jambres withstood Moses, so do these also resist the truth: men of corrupt minds, reprobate concerning the faith.
column3: 2 Timotheus 3:8 En net soos Jannes en Jambres Moses teëgestaan het, so staan ook hierdie mense die waarheid teë, mense verdorwe in die verstand, onbetroubaar ten opsigte van die geloof.

column2: 2 Timothy 3:9 But they shall proceed no further: for their folly shall be manifest unto all [men], as theirs also was.
column3: 2 Timotheus 3:9 Maar hulle sal nie verder voortgaan nie, want hulle dwaasheid sal vir almal duidelik wees, soos ook dié van daardie manne geword het.

column2: 2 Timothy 3:10 But thou hast fully known my doctrine, manner of life, purpose, faith, longsuffering, charity, patience,
column3: 2 Timotheus 3:10 MAAR jy het my navolger geword in leer, lewenswandel, planne, geloof, lankmoedigheid, liefde, lydsaamheid,

column2: 2 Timothy 3:11 Persecutions, afflictions, which came unto me at Antioch, at Iconium, at Lystra; what persecutions I endured: but out of [them] all the Lord delivered me.
column3: 2 Timotheus 3:11 vervolginge, lyding, soos my te beurt geval het in Antiochíë, in Ikónium, in Listre. Watter vervolginge het ek nie al verdra nie! En die Here het my uit almal verlos.

column2: 2 Timothy 3:12 Yea, and all that will live godly in Christ Jesus shall suffer persecution.
column3: 2 Timotheus 3:12 En almal wat ook godvrugtig wil lewe in Christus Jesus, sal vervolg word.

column2: 2 Timothy 3:13 But evil men and seducers shall wax worse and worse, deceiving, and being deceived.
column3: 2 Timotheus 3:13 Maar goddelose mense en bedrieërs sal voortgaan van kwaad tot erger, hulle wat verlei en verlei word.

column2: 2 Timothy 3:14 But continue thou in the things which thou hast learned and hast been assured of, knowing of whom thou hast learned [them];
column3: 2 Timotheus 3:14 Maar bly jy in wat jy geleer het en waarvan jy verseker is, omdat jy weet van wie jy dit geleer het,

column2: 2 Timothy 3:15 And that from a child thou hast known the holy scriptures, which are able to make thee wise unto salvation through faith which is in Christ Jesus.
column3: 2 Timotheus 3:15 en dat jy van kleins af die heilige Skrifte ken wat jou wys kan maak tot saligheid deur die geloof in Christus Jesus.

column2: 2 Timothy 3:16 All scripture [is] given by inspiration of God, and [is] profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness:
column3: 2 Timotheus 3:16 Die hele Skrif is deur God ingegee en is nuttig tot lering, tot weerlegging, tot teregwysing, tot onderwysing in die geregtigheid,

column2: 2 Timothy 3:17 That the man of God may be perfect, throughly furnished unto all good works.
column3: 2 Timotheus 3:17 sodat die mens van God volkome kan wees, vir elke goeie werk volkome toegerus.

column2: 2 Timothy 4:1 I charge [thee] therefore before God, and the Lord Jesus Christ, who shall judge the quick and the dead at his appearing and his kingdom;
column3: 2 Timotheus 4:1 EK besweer jou dan voor God en die Here Jesus Christus, wat die lewende en die dode sal oordeel by sy verskyning en sy koninkryk:

column2: 2 Timothy 4:2 Preach the word; be instant in season, out of season; reprove, rebuke, exhort with all longsuffering and doctrine.
column3: 2 Timotheus 4:2 verkondig die woord; hou aan tydig en ontydig; weerlê, bestraf, vermaan in alle lankmoedigheid en lering;

column2: 2 Timothy 4:3 For the time will come when they will not endure sound doctrine; but after their own lusts shall they heap to themselves teachers, having itching ears;
column3: 2 Timotheus 4:3 want daar sal ’n tyd wees wanneer hulle die gesonde leer nie sal verdra nie, maar, omdat hulle in hul gehoor gestreel wil wees, vir hulle ’n menigte leraars sal versamel volgens hulle eie begeerlikhede,

column2: 2 Timothy 4:4 And they shall turn away [their] ears from the truth, and shall be turned unto fables.
column3: 2 Timotheus 4:4 en die oor sal afkeer van die waarheid en hulle sal wend tot fabels.

column2: 2 Timothy 4:5 But watch thou in all things, endure afflictions, do the work of an evangelist, make full proof of thy ministry.
column3: 2 Timotheus 4:5 Maar wees jy in alles nugter; ly verdrukking; doen die werk van ’n evangelis; vervul jou bediening.

column2: 2 Timothy 4:6 For I am now ready to be offered, and the time of my departure is at hand.
column3: 2 Timotheus 4:6 WANT ek word alreeds as ’n drankoffer uitgegiet, en die tyd van my heengaan is naby.

column2: 2 Timothy 4:7 I have fought a good fight, I have finished [my] course, I have kept the faith:
column3: 2 Timotheus 4:7 Ek het die goeie stryd gestry; ek het die wedloop voleindig; ek het die geloof behou.

column2: 2 Timothy 4:8 Henceforth there is laid up for me a crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous judge, shall give me at that day: and not to me only, but unto all them also that love his appearing.
column3: 2 Timotheus 4:8 Verder is vir my weggelê die kroon van die geregtigheid wat die Here, die regverdige Regter, my in dié dag sal gee; en nie aan my alleen nie, maar ook aan almal wat sy verskyning liefgehad het.

column2: 2 Timothy 4:9 Do thy diligence to come shortly unto me:
column3: 2 Timotheus 4:9 Beywer jou om gou na my te kom.

column2: 2 Timothy 4:10 For Demas hath forsaken me, having loved this present world, and is departed unto Thessalonica; Crescens to Galatia, Titus unto Dalmatia.
column3: 2 Timotheus 4:10 Want Demas het my verlaat, omdat hy die teenwoordige wêreld liefgekry het, en het na Thessaloníka vertrek, Crescens na Galásië, Titus na Dalmásië.

column2: 2 Timothy 4:11 Only Luke is with me. Take Mark, and bring him with thee: for he is profitable to me for the ministry.
column3: 2 Timotheus 4:11 Lukas is alleen by my. Markus moet jy gaan haal en saam met jou bring, want hy kan my baie tot diens wees.

column2: 2 Timothy 4:12 And Tychicus have I sent to Ephesus.
column3: 2 Timotheus 4:12 Tíchikus het ek na Éfese gestuur.

column2: 2 Timothy 4:13 The cloke that I left at Troas with Carpus, when thou comest, bring [with thee], and the books, [but] especially the parchments.
column3: 2 Timotheus 4:13 As jy kom, moet jy die reismantel bring wat ek by Carpus in Troas laat bly het, en die boeke, veral die perkamente.

column2: 2 Timothy 4:14 Alexander the coppersmith did me much evil: the Lord reward him according to his works:
column3: 2 Timotheus 4:14 Alexander, die kopersmid, het my baie kwaad aangedoen. Mag die Here hom vergeld na sy werke!

column2: 2 Timothy 4:15 Of whom be thou ware also; for he hath greatly withstood our words.
column3: 2 Timotheus 4:15 Jy moet ook vir hom oppas, want hy het ons woorde sterk teëgestaan.

column2: 2 Timothy 4:16 At my first answer no man stood with me, but all [men] forsook me: [I pray God] that it may not be laid to their charge.
column3: 2 Timotheus 4:16 In my eerste verdediging het niemand my bygestaan nie, maar almal het my verlaat. Mag dit hulle nie toegereken word nie!

column2: 2 Timothy 4:17 Notwithstanding the Lord stood with me, and strengthened me; that by me the preaching might be fully known, and [that] all the Gentiles might hear: and I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion.
column3: 2 Timotheus 4:17 Maar die Here het my bygestaan en my krag gegee, sodat deur my die prediking heeltemal volbring kan word en al die heidene dit kan hoor; en ek is uit die bek van die leeu verlos.

column2: 2 Timothy 4:18 And the Lord shall deliver me from every evil work, and will preserve [me] unto his heavenly kingdom: to whom [be] glory for ever and ever. Amen.
column3: 2 Timotheus 4:18 En die Here sal my verlos van elke bose werk en my red om in sy hemelse koninkryk in te gaan. Aan Hom die heerlikheid tot in alle ewigheid! Amen.

column2: 2 Timothy 4:19 Salute Prisca and Aquila, and the household of Onesiphorus.
column3: 2 Timotheus 4:19 Groet Prisca en Áquila en die huis van Onesíforus.

column2: 2 Timothy 4:20 Erastus abode at Corinth: but Trophimus have I left at Miletum sick.
column3: 2 Timotheus 4:20 Erástus het in Korinthe gebly. Trófimus het ek siek in Miléte agtergelaat.

column2: 2 Timothy 4:21 Do thy diligence to come before winter. Eubulus greeteth thee, and Pudens, and Linus, and Claudia, and all the brethren.
column3: 2 Timotheus 4:21 Beywer jou om voor die winter te kom. Eubúlus en Pudens en Linus en Claudia en al die broeders groet jou.

column2: 2 Timothy 4:22 The Lord Jesus Christ [be] with thy spirit. Grace [be] with you. Amen. <<[The second [epistle] unto Timotheus, ordained the first bishop of the church of the Ephesians, was written from Rome, when Paul was brought before Nero the second time.]>>
column3: 2 Timotheus 4:22 Mag die Here Jesus Christus met jou gees wees! Die genade sy met julle! Amen.

column2: Titus 1:1 Paul, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God's elect, and the acknowledging of the truth which is after godliness;
column3: Titus 1:1 PAULUS, ’n dienskneg van God en ’n apostel van Jesus Christus, volgens die geloof van die uitverkorenes van God en die kennis van die waarheid wat na die godsaligheid is,

column2: Titus 1:2 In hope of eternal life, which God, that cannot lie, promised before the world began;
column3: Titus 1:2 in die hoop van die ewige lewe wat God, wat nie kan lieg nie, van ewigheid af beloof het,

column2: Titus 1:3 But hath in due times manifested his word through preaching, which is committed unto me according to the commandment of God our Saviour;
column3: Titus 1:3 en op die regte tyd sy woord bekend gemaak het deur die prediking wat aan my toevertrou is, ooreenkomstig die gebod van God, ons Verlosser — aan Titus, my ware kind volgens die gemeenskaplike geloof:

column2: Titus 1:4 To Titus, [mine] own son after the common faith: Grace, mercy, [and] peace, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Saviour.
column3: Titus 1:4 Genade, barmhartigheid, vrede van God die Vader en die Here Jesus Christus, ons Verlosser!

column2: Titus 1:5 For this cause left I thee in Crete, that thou shouldest set in order the things that are wanting, and ordain elders in every city, as I had appointed thee:
column3: Titus 1:5 OM hierdie rede het ek jou in Kreta agtergelaat, dat jy nog verder sou regmaak wat oorgebly het, en van stad tot stad ouderlinge sou aanstel soos ek jou beveel het —

column2: Titus 1:6 If any be blameless, the husband of one wife, having faithful children not accused of riot or unruly.
column3: Titus 1:6 as iemand onberispelik is, die man van een vrou, gelowige kinders het wat nie beskuldig word van losbandigheid of tugteloos is nie.

column2: Titus 1:7 For a bishop must be blameless, as the steward of God; not selfwilled, not soon angry, not given to wine, no striker, not given to filthy lucre;
column3: Titus 1:7 Want ’n opsiener moet as ’n rentmeester van God onberispelik wees, nie eiesinnig, nie oplopend, geen drinker, geen vegter, geen vuilgewinsoeker nie;

column2: Titus 1:8 But a lover of hospitality, a lover of good men, sober, just, holy, temperate;
column3: Titus 1:8 maar gasvry, een wat die goeie liefhet, ingetoë, regverdig, heilig, een wat homself beheers;

column2: Titus 1:9 Holding fast the faithful word as he hath been taught, that he may be able by sound doctrine both to exhort and to convince the gainsayers.
column3: Titus 1:9 een wat vashou aan die betroubare woord wat volgens die leer is, sodat hy in staat kan wees om met die gesonde leer te vermaan sowel as om die teësprekers te weerlê.

column2: Titus 1:10 For there are many unruly and vain talkers and deceivers, specially they of the circumcision:
column3: Titus 1:10 Want daar is baie wat tugteloos is, wat onsin praat en verleiers is, veral die wat uit die besnydenis is;

column2: Titus 1:11 Whose mouths must be stopped, who subvert whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for filthy lucre's sake.
column3: Titus 1:11 hulle mond moet gestop word. Hulle keer hele huise onderstebo deur te leer wat nie betaam nie, ter wille van vuil wins.

column2: Titus 1:12 One of themselves, [even] a prophet of their own, said, The Cretians [are] alway liars, evil beasts, slow bellies.
column3: Titus 1:12 Een uit hulle, hul eie profeet, het gesê: Die Kretense is altyd leuenaars, ongediertes, lui buike.

column2: Titus 1:13 This witness is true. Wherefore rebuke them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith;
column3: Titus 1:13 Hierdie getuienis is waar. Daarom moet jy hulle skerp bestraf, sodat hulle gesond in die geloof kan wees,

column2: Titus 1:14 Not giving heed to Jewish fables, and commandments of men, that turn from the truth.
column3: Titus 1:14 en hulle nie besig hou met Joodse fabels en gebooie van mense wat van die waarheid afwyk nie.

column2: Titus 1:15 Unto the pure all things [are] pure: but unto them that are defiled and unbelieving [is] nothing pure; but even their mind and conscience is defiled.
column3: Titus 1:15 Alle dinge is rein vir die reines; vir die besoedeldes en ongelowiges egter is niks rein nie, maar hulle verstand sowel as hulle gewete is besoedel.

column2: Titus 1:16 They profess that they know God; but in works they deny [him], being abominable, and disobedient, and unto every good work reprobate.
column3: Titus 1:16 Hulle bely dat hulle God ken, maar hulle verloën Hom deur die werke, omdat hulle gruwelik en ongehoorsaam is en ongeskik vir elke goeie werk.

column2: Titus 2:1 But speak thou the things which become sound doctrine:
column3: Titus 2:1 MAAR spreek jy wat by die gesonde leer pas.
