column2: Titus 2:2 That the aged men be sober, grave, temperate, sound in faith, in charity, in patience.
column3: Titus 2:2 Die ou manne moet nugter wees, waardig, ingetoë, gesond in die geloof, in die liefde, in die lydsaamheid.

column2: Titus 2:3 The aged women likewise, that [they be] in behaviour as becometh holiness, not false accusers, not given to much wine, teachers of good things;
column3: Titus 2:3 Die ou vroue moet ook in hulle gedrag wees soos dit die heiliges betaam, geen kwaadspreeksters of aan baie wyn verslaaf nie, maar leraresse van wat goed is,

column2: Titus 2:4 That they may teach the young women to be sober, to love their husbands, to love their children,
column3: Titus 2:4 sodat hulle die jong vroue kan leer om versigtig te wees, hulle mans en kinders lief te hê,

column2: Titus 2:5 [To be] discreet, chaste, keepers at home, good, obedient to their own husbands, that the word of God be not blasphemed.
column3: Titus 2:5 ingetoë te wees, kuis, huislik, goed, aan hul eie mans onderdanig, sodat die woord van God nie belaster word nie.

column2: Titus 2:6 Young men likewise exhort to be sober minded.
column3: Titus 2:6 Vermaan die jong manne net so om ingetoë te wees.

column2: Titus 2:7 In all things shewing thyself a pattern of good works: in doctrine [shewing] uncorruptness, gravity, sincerity,
column3: Titus 2:7 Betoon jou in alles ’n voorbeeld van goeie werke, met onvervalstheid in die leer, waardigheid, opregtheid.

column2: Titus 2:8 Sound speech, that cannot be condemned; that he that is of the contrary part may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say of you.
column3: Titus 2:8 Laat die woord gesond en onweerspreeklik wees, sodat die teëstanders beskaam kan word en niks slegs kan hê om van julle te sê nie.

column2: Titus 2:9 [Exhort] servants to be obedient unto their own masters, [and] to please [them] well in all [things]; not answering again;
column3: Titus 2:9 Die diensknegte moet onderdanig wees aan hul eie here, hulle in alles behaag en nie teëpraat nie;

column2: Titus 2:10 Not purloining, but shewing all good fidelity; that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Saviour in all things.
column3: Titus 2:10 hulle moet niks ontvreemd nie, maar alle goeie trou betoon, sodat hulle die leer van God, ons Verlosser, in alles kan versier.

column2: Titus 2:11 For the grace of God that bringeth salvation hath appeared to all men,
column3: Titus 2:11 WANT die reddende genade van God het aan alle mense verskyn

column2: Titus 2:12 Teaching us that, denying ungodliness and worldly lusts, we should live soberly, righteously, and godly, in this present world;
column3: Titus 2:12 en leer ons om die goddeloosheid en wêreldse begeerlikhede te verloën, ingetoë en regverdig en vroom in die teenwoordige wêreld te lewe,

column2: Titus 2:13 Looking for that blessed hope, and the glorious appearing of the great God and our Saviour Jesus Christ;
column3: Titus 2:13 terwyl ons die salige hoop en die verskyning van die heerlikheid verwag van die grote God en ons Verlosser, Jesus Christus,

column2: Titus 2:14 Who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify unto himself a peculiar people, zealous of good works.
column3: Titus 2:14 wat Homself vir ons gegee het om ons te verlos van alle ongeregtigheid en vir Homself ’n volk as sy eiendom te reinig, ywerig in goeie werke.

column2: Titus 2:15 These things speak, and exhort, and rebuke with all authority. Let no man despise thee.
column3: Titus 2:15 Spreek hierdie dinge en vermaan en bestraf in alle erns. Laat niemand jou verag nie.

column2: Titus 3:1 Put them in mind to be subject to principalities and powers, to obey magistrates, to be ready to every good work,
column3: Titus 3:1 HERINNER hulle daaraan om onderdanig te wees aan owerhede en magte, om gehoorsaam te wees, bereid tot elke goeie werk;

column2: Titus 3:2 To speak evil of no man, to be no brawlers, [but] gentle, shewing all meekness unto all men.
column3: Titus 3:2 om niemand te belaster nie, nie strydlustig te wees nie, vriendelik te wees en aan alle mense alle sagmoedigheid te bewys.

column2: Titus 3:3 For we ourselves also were sometimes foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving divers lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, [and] hating one another.
column3: Titus 3:3 Want ons was ook vroeër onverstandig, ongehoorsaam, op ’n dwaalweg, verslaaf aan allerhande begeerlikhede en singenot; ons het in boosheid en afguns gelewe; ons was haatlik en het mekaar gehaat.

column2: Titus 3:4 But after that the kindness and love of God our Saviour toward man appeared,
column3: Titus 3:4 Maar toe die goedertierenheid van God, ons Verlosser, en sy liefde tot die mens verskyn het —

column2: Titus 3:5 Not by works of righteousness which we have done, but according to his mercy he saved us, by the washing of regeneration, and renewing of the Holy Ghost;
column3: Titus 3:5 nie op grond van die werke van geregtigheid wat ons gedoen het nie, maar na sy barmhartigheid het Hy ons gered deur die bad van die wedergeboorte en die vernuwing deur die Heilige Gees

column2: Titus 3:6 Which he shed on us abundantly through Jesus Christ our Saviour;
column3: Titus 3:6 wat Hy ryklik uitgestort het op ons deur Jesus Christus, ons Verlosser;

column2: Titus 3:7 That being justified by his grace, we should be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life.
column3: Titus 3:7 sodat ons, geregverdig deur sy genade, erfgename kan word ooreenkomstig die hoop van die ewige lewe.

column2: Titus 3:8 [This is] a faithful saying, and these things I will that thou affirm constantly, that they which have believed in God might be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable unto men.
column3: Titus 3:8 Dit is ’n betroubare woord, en ek wil hê dat jy hierdie dinge beslis bevestig, sodat die wat in God glo, sorg kan dra om goeie werke voor te staan; dít is wat goed en nuttig is vir die mense.

column2: Titus 3:9 But avoid foolish questions, and genealogies, and contentions, and strivings about the law; for they are unprofitable and vain.
column3: Titus 3:9 Maar vermy dwase strydvrae en geslagsregisters en twis en stryery oor die wet, want dit is nutteloos en doelloos.

column2: Titus 3:10 A man that is an heretick after the first and second admonition reject;
column3: Titus 3:10 Aan ’n man wat partyskap verwek, moet jy jou onttrek ná die eerste en tweede vermaning,

column2: Titus 3:11 Knowing that he that is such is subverted, and sinneth, being condemned of himself.
column3: Titus 3:11 wetende dat so iemand op ’n verkeerde pad is en sonde doen en selfveroordeeld staan.

column2: Titus 3:12 When I shall send Artemas unto thee, or Tychicus, be diligent to come unto me to Nicopolis: for I have determined there to winter.
column3: Titus 3:12 WANNEER ek Ártemas of Tíchikus na jou stuur, doen dan jou bes om na my te kom in Nikópolis, want ek het besluit om daar te oorwinter.

column2: Titus 3:13 Bring Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey diligently, that nothing be wanting unto them.
column3: Titus 3:13 Jy moet Senas, die wetgeleerde, en Apollos ywerig voorthelp, sodat dit hulle aan niks ontbreek nie.

column2: Titus 3:14 And let ours also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses, that they be not unfruitful.
column3: Titus 3:14 Ons mense moet ook leer om vir die noodsaaklike behoeftes goeie werke voor te staan, sodat hulle nie onvrugbaar mag wees nie.

column2: Titus 3:15 All that are with me salute thee. Greet them that love us in the faith. Grace [be] with you all. Amen. <<[It was written to Titus, ordained the first bishop of the church of the Cretians, from Nicopolis of Macedonia.]>>
column3: Titus 3:15 Almal wat saam met my is, groet jou. Groet die wat vir ons liefhet in die geloof. Die genade sy met julle almal! Amen.

column2: Philemon 1:1 Paul, a prisoner of Jesus Christ, and Timothy [our] brother, unto Philemon our dearly beloved, and fellowlabourer,
column3: Filemon 1:1 PAULUS, ’n gevangene van Christus Jesus, en die broeder Timótheüs, aan Filémon, die geliefde en ons mede-arbeider,

column2: Philemon 1:2 And to [our] beloved Apphia, and Archippus our fellowsoldier, and to the church in thy house:
column3: Filemon 1:2 en aan Áppia, die geliefde suster, en aan Archíppus, ons medestryder, en aan die gemeente wat in jou huis is:

column2: Philemon 1:3 Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
column3: Filemon 1:3 Genade vir julle en vrede van God onse Vader en die Here Jesus Christus!

column2: Philemon 1:4 I thank my God, making mention of thee always in my prayers,
column3: Filemon 1:4 Ek dank my God altyd wanneer ek aan jou in my gebede dink,

column2: Philemon 1:5 Hearing of thy love and faith, which thou hast toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all saints;
column3: Filemon 1:5 omdat ek van jou liefde en geloof hoor, wat jy met betrekking tot die Here Jesus en al die heiliges het,

column2: Philemon 1:6 That the communication of thy faith may become effectual by the acknowledging of every good thing which is in you in Christ Jesus.
column3: Filemon 1:6 dat die gemeenskap van jou geloof kragtig mag word deur die kennis van alles wat goed in julle is, tot eer van Christus Jesus.

column2: Philemon 1:7 For we have great joy and consolation in thy love, because the bowels of the saints are refreshed by thee, brother.
column3: Filemon 1:7 Want ons het groot blydskap en troos oor jou liefde, omdat deur jou, broeder, die harte van die heiliges verkwik is.

column2: Philemon 1:8 Wherefore, though I might be much bold in Christ to enjoin thee that which is convenient,
column3: Filemon 1:8 DAAROM, al het ek baie vrymoedigheid in Christus om jou te beveel wat betaamlik is,

column2: Philemon 1:9 Yet for love's sake I rather beseech [thee], being such an one as Paul the aged, and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ.
column3: Filemon 1:9 pleit ek liewer ter wille van die liefde. Ek, Paulus, as ’n ou man en nou ook ’n gevangene van Jesus Christus,

column2: Philemon 1:10 I beseech thee for my son Onesimus, whom I have begotten in my bonds:
column3: Filemon 1:10 pleit by jou vir my kind, Onésimus, wat ek verwek het in my boeie,

column2: Philemon 1:11 Which in time past was to thee unprofitable, but now profitable to thee and to me:
column3: Filemon 1:11 wat vroeër vir jou nutteloos was, maar nou baie nuttig vir jou en vir my. Ek stuur hom terug;

column2: Philemon 1:12 Whom I have sent again: thou therefore receive him, that is, mine own bowels:
column3: Filemon 1:12 maar neem jy hom, dit is my eie hart, aan.

column2: Philemon 1:13 Whom I would have retained with me, that in thy stead he might have ministered unto me in the bonds of the gospel:
column3: Filemon 1:13 Ek wou hom by my hou, sodat hy my in die boeie van die evangelie in jou plek kan dien.

column2: Philemon 1:14 But without thy mind would I do nothing; that thy benefit should not be as it were of necessity, but willingly.
column3: Filemon 1:14 Maar sonder jou goedkeuring wou ek niks doen nie, sodat jou goedheid nie uit dwang sou wees nie, maar uit vrye keuse.

column2: Philemon 1:15 For perhaps he therefore departed for a season, that thou shouldest receive him for ever;
column3: Filemon 1:15 Want miskien is hy om hierdie rede ’n tydjie van jou geskei, dat jy hom vir altyd kan besit,

column2: Philemon 1:16 Not now as a servant, but above a servant, a brother beloved, specially to me, but how much more unto thee, both in the flesh, and in the Lord?
column3: Filemon 1:16 nie meer as ’n slaaf nie, maar méér as ’n slaaf, as ’n geliefde broeder in die vlees sowel as in die Here, veral vir my, hoeveel te meer vir jou.

column2: Philemon 1:17 If thou count me therefore a partner, receive him as myself.
column3: Filemon 1:17 As jy my dan vir ’n metgesel hou, neem hom aan net soos vir my.

column2: Philemon 1:18 If he hath wronged thee, or oweth [thee] ought, put that on mine account;
column3: Filemon 1:18 En as hy jou benadeel het of iets skuld, sit dit op mý rekening —

column2: Philemon 1:19 I Paul have written [it] with mine own hand, I will repay [it]: albeit I do not say to thee how thou owest unto me even thine own self besides.
column3: Filemon 1:19 ek, Paulus, het dit met my eie hand geskrywe: ek sal betaal — om nie te sê jou rekening nie, want jy is daarby jou eie persoon ook aan my verskuldig.

column2: Philemon 1:20 Yea, brother, let me have joy of thee in the Lord: refresh my bowels in the Lord.
column3: Filemon 1:20 Ja, broeder, mag ek tog van jou voordeel trek in die Here! Verkwik my hart in die Here.

column2: Philemon 1:21 Having confidence in thy obedience I wrote unto thee, knowing that thou wilt also do more than I say.
column3: Filemon 1:21 In vertroue op jou gehoorsaamheid het ek aan jou geskrywe, omdat ek weet dat jy nog meer sal doen as wat ek sê.

column2: Philemon 1:22 But withal prepare me also a lodging: for I trust that through your prayers I shall be given unto you.
column3: Filemon 1:22 EN berei tegelykertyd ook herberg vir my, want ek hoop dat ek op julle gebede aan julle sal geskenk word.

column2: Philemon 1:23 There salute thee Epaphras, my fellowprisoner in Christ Jesus;
column3: Filemon 1:23 Épafras, my medegevangene in Christus Jesus, groet jou;

column2: Philemon 1:24 Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas, Lucas, my fellowlabourers.
column3: Filemon 1:24 ook Markus, Aristárchus, Demas en Lukas, my mede-arbeiders.

column2: Philemon 1:25 The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ [be] with your spirit. Amen. <<[Written from Rome to Philemon, by Onesimus a servant.]>>
column3: Filemon 1:25 Die genade van onse Here Jesus Christus sy met julle gees! Amen.

column2: Hebrews 1:1 God, who at sundry times and in divers manners spake in time past unto the fathers by the prophets,
column3: Hebreers 1:1 NADAT God baiekeer en op baie maniere in die ou tyd gespreek het tot die vaders deur die profete, het Hy in hierdie laaste dae tot ons gespreek deur die Seun

column2: Hebrews 1:2 Hath in these last days spoken unto us by [his] Son, whom he hath appointed heir of all things, by whom also he made the worlds;
column3: Hebreers 1:2 wat Hy as erfgenaam van alles aangestel het, deur wie Hy ook die wêreld gemaak het.

column2: Hebrews 1:3 Who being the brightness of [his] glory, and the express image of his person, and upholding all things by the word of his power, when he had by himself purged our sins, sat down on the right hand of the Majesty on high;
column3: Hebreers 1:3 Hy, wat die afskynsel is van sy heerlikheid en die afdruksel van sy wese en alle dinge dra deur die woord van sy krag, nadat Hy deur Homself die reiniging van ons sondes bewerk het, het gaan sit aan die regterhand van die Majesteit in die hoogte,

column2: Hebrews 1:4 Being made so much better than the angels, as he hath by inheritance obtained a more excellent name than they.
column3: Hebreers 1:4 terwyl Hy soveel uitnemender geword het as die engele namate Hy ’n voortrefliker naam geërf het as hulle.

column2: Hebrews 1:5 For unto which of the angels said he at any time, Thou art my Son, this day have I begotten thee? And again, I will be to him a Father, and he shall be to me a Son?
column3: Hebreers 1:5 Want aan wie van die engele het Hy ooit gesê: U is my Seun, vandag het Ek U gegenereer? en weer: Ek sal vir Hom ’n Vader wees, en Hy sal vir My ’n Seun wees?

column2: Hebrews 1:6 And again, when he bringeth in the firstbegotten into the world, he saith, And let all the angels of God worship him.
column3: Hebreers 1:6 En wanneer Hy weer die Eersgeborene in die wêreld inbring, sê Hy: En al die engele van God moet Hom aanbid.

column2: Hebrews 1:7 And of the angels he saith, Who maketh his angels spirits, and his ministers a flame of fire.
column3: Hebreers 1:7 En van die engele sê Hy wel: Hy wat van sy boodskappers winde maak en van sy dienaars vuurvlamme;

column2: Hebrews 1:8 But unto the Son [he saith], Thy throne, O God, [is] for ever and ever: a sceptre of righteousness [is] the sceptre of thy kingdom.
column3: Hebreers 1:8 maar van die Seun: U troon, o God, is tot in alle ewigheid, die septer van u koninkryk is ’n regverdige septer;

column2: Hebrews 1:9 Thou hast loved righteousness, and hated iniquity; therefore God, [even] thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.
column3: Hebreers 1:9 U het geregtigheid liefgehad en ongeregtigheid gehaat; daarom het, o God, u God U gesalf met vreugde-olie bo u metgeselle;

column2: Hebrews 1:10 And, Thou, Lord, in the beginning hast laid the foundation of the earth; and the heavens are the works of thine hands:
column3: Hebreers 1:10 en: U, o Here, het in die begin die aarde gegrondves en die hemele is werke van u hande.

column2: Hebrews 1:11 They shall perish; but thou remainest; and they all shall wax old as doth a garment;
column3: Hebreers 1:11 Hulle sal vergaan, maar U bly; en hulle sal almal soos ’n kleed verslyt,

column2: Hebrews 1:12 And as a vesture shalt thou fold them up, and they shall be changed: but thou art the same, and thy years shall not fail.
column3: Hebreers 1:12 en soos ’n mantel sal U hulle toerol, en hulle sal verander word, maar U is dieselfde, en u jare het geen einde nie.

column2: Hebrews 1:13 But to which of the angels said he at any time, Sit on my right hand, until I make thine enemies thy footstool?
column3: Hebreers 1:13 En aan watter een van die engele het Hy ooit gesê: Sit aan my regterhand totdat Ek u vyande gemaak het ’n voetbank van u voete?

column2: Hebrews 1:14 Are they not all ministering spirits, sent forth to minister for them who shall be heirs of salvation?
column3: Hebreers 1:14 Is hulle nie almal dienende geeste wat vir diens uitgestuur word ter wille van die wat die saligheid sal beërwe nie?

column2: Hebrews 2:1 Therefore we ought to give the more earnest heed to the things which we have heard, lest at any time we should let [them] slip.
column3: Hebreers 2:1 DAAROM moet ons des te meer ag gee op wat ons gehoor het, dat ons nie miskien wegdrywe nie.

column2: Hebrews 2:2 For if the word spoken by angels was stedfast, and every transgression and disobedience received a just recompence of reward;
column3: Hebreers 2:2 Want as die woord deur engele gespreek, onwankelbaar was, en elke oortreding en ongehoorsaamheid regverdige vergelding ontvang het,

column2: Hebrews 2:3 How shall we escape, if we neglect so great salvation; which at the first began to be spoken by the Lord, and was confirmed unto us by them that heard [him];
column3: Hebreers 2:3 hoe sal ons ontvlug as ons so ’n groot saligheid veronagsaam wat, nadat dit eers deur die Here verkondig is, aan ons bevestig is deur die wat dit gehoor het,

column2: Hebrews 2:4 God also bearing [them] witness, both with signs and wonders, and with divers miracles, and gifts of the Holy Ghost, according to his own will?
column3: Hebreers 2:4 terwyl God ook nog saam getuig het deur tekens en wonders en allerhande kragtige dade en bedélinge van die Heilige Gees volgens sy wil?

column2: Hebrews 2:5 For unto the angels hath he not put in subjection the world to come, whereof we speak.
column3: Hebreers 2:5 Want aan die engele het Hy die toekomstige wêreld waarvan ons spreek, nie onderwerp nie;

column2: Hebrews 2:6 But one in a certain place testified, saying, What is man, that thou art mindful of him? or the son of man, that thou visitest him?
column3: Hebreers 2:6 maar iemand het êrens getuig en gesê: Wat is die mens, dat U aan hom dink, of die mensekind, dat U hom besoek?

column2: Hebrews 2:7 Thou madest him a little lower than the angels; thou crownedst him with glory and honour, and didst set him over the works of thy hands:
column3: Hebreers 2:7 U het hom ’n weinig minder as die engele gemaak; met heerlikheid en eer het U hom gekroon en hom oor die werke van u hande aangestel.

column2: Hebrews 2:8 Thou hast put all things in subjection under his feet. For in that he put all in subjection under him, he left nothing [that is] not put under him. But now we see not yet all things put under him.
column3: Hebreers 2:8 Alle dinge het U onder sy voete gestel. Want in die onderwerping van alle dinge aan hom het Hy niks uitgesonder wat aan hom nie onderworpe is nie. Maar nou sien ons nog nie dat alle dinge aan hom onderwerp is nie;

column2: Hebrews 2:9 But we see Jesus, who was made a little lower than the angels for the suffering of death, crowned with glory and honour; that he by the grace of God should taste death for every man.
column3: Hebreers 2:9 maar ons sien Hom, naamlik Jesus, wat vir ’n kort tydjie minder as die engele gemaak is, vanweë die lyde van die dood met heerlikheid en eer gekroon, sodat Hy deur die genade van God vir elkeen die dood sou smaak.

column2: Hebrews 2:10 For it became him, for whom [are] all things, and by whom [are] all things, in bringing many sons unto glory, to make the captain of their salvation perfect through sufferings.
column3: Hebreers 2:10 Want dit het Hom betaam, ter wille van wie alle dinge en deur wie alle dinge is, as Hy baie kinders na die heerlikheid wou bring, om die bewerker van hulle saligheid deur lyde te volmaak.

column2: Hebrews 2:11 For both he that sanctifieth and they who are sanctified [are] all of one: for which cause he is not ashamed to call them brethren,
column3: Hebreers 2:11 Want Hy wat heilig maak, sowel as hulle wat geheilig word, is almal uit Een; om hierdie rede skaam Hy Hom nie om hulle broeders te noem nie,

column2: Hebrews 2:12 Saying, I will declare thy name unto my brethren, in the midst of the church will I sing praise unto thee.
column3: Hebreers 2:12 wanneer Hy sê: Ek sal u Naam aan my broeders verkondig, in die midde van die gemeente sal Ek U prys;

column2: Hebrews 2:13 And again, I will put my trust in him. And again, Behold I and the children which God hath given me.
column3: Hebreers 2:13 en verder: Ek sal my vertroue op Hom stel; en verder: Hier is Ek en die kinders wat God My gegee het.

column2: Hebrews 2:14 Forasmuch then as the children are partakers of flesh and blood, he also himself likewise took part of the same; that through death he might destroy him that had the power of death, that is, the devil;
column3: Hebreers 2:14 Aangesien die kinders dan vlees en bloed deelagtig is, het Hy dit ook op dieselfde manier deelagtig geword, sodat Hy deur die dood hom tot niet kon maak wat mag oor die dood het — dit is die duiwel —

column2: Hebrews 2:15 And deliver them who through fear of death were all their lifetime subject to bondage.
column3: Hebreers 2:15 en almal kon bevry wat hulle hele lewe lank uit vrees vir die dood aan slawerny onderworpe was.

column2: Hebrews 2:16 For verily he took not on [him the nature of] angels; but he took on [him] the seed of Abraham.
column3: Hebreers 2:16 Want waarlik, Hy bekommer Hom nie oor die engele nie, maar oor die geslag van Abraham bekommer Hy Hom.

column2: Hebrews 2:17 Wherefore in all things it behoved him to be made like unto [his] brethren, that he might be a merciful and faithful high priest in things [pertaining] to God, to make reconciliation for the sins of the people.
column3: Hebreers 2:17 Daarom moes Hy in alle opsigte aan sy broeders gelyk word, sodat Hy ’n barmhartige en getroue hoëpriester kon wees in die dinge wat in betrekking tot God staan, om die sondes van die volk te versoen.

column2: Hebrews 2:18 For in that he himself hath suffered being tempted, he is able to succour them that are tempted.
column3: Hebreers 2:18 Want deurdat Hy self onder versoeking gely het, kan Hy dié help wat versoek word.

column2: Hebrews 3:1 Wherefore, holy brethren, partakers of the heavenly calling, consider the Apostle and High Priest of our profession, Christ Jesus;
column3: Hebreers 3:1 DAAROM, heilige broeders, deelgenote van die hemelse roeping, let op die Apostel en Hoëpriester van ons belydenis, Christus Jesus,

column2: Hebrews 3:2 Who was faithful to him that appointed him, as also Moses [was faithful] in all his house.
column3: Hebreers 3:2 wat getrou was aan Hom wat Hom aangestel het, net soos Moses ook in sy hele huis.

column2: Hebrews 3:3 For this [man] was counted worthy of more glory than Moses, inasmuch as he who hath builded the house hath more honour than the house.
column3: Hebreers 3:3 Want Hy is meer heerlikheid waardig geag as Moses, namate hy wat die huis gebou het, meer eer het as die huis;

column2: Hebrews 3:4 For every house is builded by some [man]; but he that built all things [is] God.
column3: Hebreers 3:4 want elke huis word deur iemand gebou, maar Hy wat alle dinge gebou het, is God.

column2: Hebrews 3:5 And Moses verily [was] faithful in all his house, as a servant, for a testimony of those things which were to be spoken after;
column3: Hebreers 3:5 En Moses was wel getrou in sy hele huis as ’n dienaar, om te getuig van wat nog gespreek sou word,

column2: Hebrews 3:6 But Christ as a son over his own house; whose house are we, if we hold fast the confidence and the rejoicing of the hope firm unto the end.
column3: Hebreers 3:6 maar Christus as Seun oor sy huis. En ons is sy huis as ons net die vrymoedigheid en die roem van die hoop tot die einde toe onwrikbaar vashou.

column2: Hebrews 3:7 Wherefore (as the Holy Ghost saith, To day if ye will hear his voice,
column3: Hebreers 3:7 Daarom, soos die Heilige Gees spreek: Vandag as julle sy stem hoor,

column2: Hebrews 3:8 Harden not your hearts, as in the provocation, in the day of temptation in the wilderness:
column3: Hebreers 3:8 verhard julle harte nie soos in die verbittering, in die dag van die versoeking in die woestyn nie,

column2: Hebrews 3:9 When your fathers tempted me, proved me, and saw my works forty years.
column3: Hebreers 3:9 waar julle vaders My versoek, My beproef het en my werke veertig jaar lank gesien het.

column2: Hebrews 3:10 Wherefore I was grieved with that generation, and said, They do alway err in [their] heart; and they have not known my ways.
column3: Hebreers 3:10 Daarom het Ek vertoornd geword op daardie geslag en gesê: Altyd dwaal hulle met die hart. Maar húlle het my weë nie leer ken nie,

column2: Hebrews 3:11 So I sware in my wrath, They shall not enter into my rest.)
column3: Hebreers 3:11 sodat Ek in my toorn gesweer het: Hulle sal in my rus nie ingaan nie.

column2: Hebrews 3:12 Take heed, brethren, lest there be in any of you an evil heart of unbelief, in departing from the living God.
column3: Hebreers 3:12 Sorg daarvoor, broeders, dat daar nie miskien in een van julle ’n bose en ongelowige hart is deurdat hy van die lewende God afvallig word nie.

column2: Hebrews 3:13 But exhort one another daily, while it is called To day; lest any of you be hardened through the deceitfulness of sin.
column3: Hebreers 3:13 Maar vermaan mekaar elke dag so lank as dit vandag genoem word, sodat niemand van julle deur die verleiding van die sonde verhard word nie.

column2: Hebrews 3:14 For we are made partakers of Christ, if we hold the beginning of our confidence stedfast unto the end;
column3: Hebreers 3:14 Want ons het deelgenote van Christus geword, as ons net die begin van ons vertroue tot die einde toe onwrikbaar vashou;

column2: Hebrews 3:15 While it is said, To day if ye will hear his voice, harden not your hearts, as in the provocation.
column3: Hebreers 3:15 omdat daar gesê word: Vandag as julle sy stem hoor, verhard julle harte nie soos in die verbittering nie.

column2: Hebrews 3:16 For some, when they had heard, did provoke: howbeit not all that came out of Egypt by Moses.
column3: Hebreers 3:16 Wie was dit dan wat gehoor het en Hom verbitter het? Was dit nie almal wat onder leiding van Moses uit Egipte gegaan het nie?

column2: Hebrews 3:17 But with whom was he grieved forty years? [was it] not with them that had sinned, whose carcases fell in the wilderness?
column3: Hebreers 3:17 En op wie was Hy veertig jaar lank vertoornd? Was dit nie op die wat gesondig het, wie se lyke in die woestyn geval het nie?

column2: Hebrews 3:18 And to whom sware he that they should not enter into his rest, but to them that believed not?
column3: Hebreers 3:18 En aan wie het Hy gesweer dat hulle in sy rus nie sal ingaan nie, behalwe aan die ongehoorsames?

column2: Hebrews 3:19 So we see that they could not enter in because of unbelief.
column3: Hebreers 3:19 En ons sien dat hulle deur ongeloof nie kon ingaan nie.

column2: Hebrews 4:1 Let us therefore fear, lest, a promise being left [us] of entering into his rest, any of you should seem to come short of it.
column3: Hebreers 4:1 LAAT ons dan vrees dat, terwyl die belofte om in sy rus in te gaan nog standhou, dit nie miskien sal blyk dat iemand van julle agtergebly het nie.

column2: Hebrews 4:2 For unto us was the gospel preached, as well as unto them: but the word preached did not profit them, not being mixed with faith in them that heard [it].
column3: Hebreers 4:2 Want aan ons is die evangelie ook verkondig net soos aan hulle; maar die woord van die prediking het hulle nie gebaat nie, omdat dit by die hoorders nie met die geloof verenig was nie.

column2: Hebrews 4:3 For we which have believed do enter into rest, as he said, As I have sworn in my wrath, if they shall enter into my rest: although the works were finished from the foundation of the world.
column3: Hebreers 4:3 Want ons wat geglo het, gaan die rus in, soos Hy gesê het: Daarom het Ek in my toorn gesweer, hulle sal in my rus nie ingaan nie — alhoewel sy werke van die grondlegging van die wêreld af volbring is.

column2: Hebrews 4:4 For he spake in a certain place of the seventh [day] on this wise, And God did rest the seventh day from all his works.
column3: Hebreers 4:4 Want Hy het êrens van die sewende dag so gespreek: En God het op die sewende dag van al sy werke gerus;

column2: Hebrews 4:5 And in this [place] again, If they shall enter into my rest.
column3: Hebreers 4:5 en nou hier weer: Hulle sal in my rus nie ingaan nie.

column2: Hebrews 4:6 Seeing therefore it remaineth that some must enter therein, and they to whom it was first preached entered not in because of unbelief:
column3: Hebreers 4:6 Terwyl dit dan so is dat sommige daar ingaan, en diegene aan wie die evangelie eers verkondig is, deur ongehoorsaamheid nie ingegaan het nie,

column2: Hebrews 4:7 Again, he limiteth a certain day, saying in David, To day, after so long a time; as it is said, To day if ye will hear his voice, harden not your hearts.
column3: Hebreers 4:7 bepaal Hy weer ’n sekere dag, naamlik vandag, as Hy soveel later deur Dawid spreek, soos gesê is: Vandag as julle sy stem hoor, verhard julle harte nie.

column2: Hebrews 4:8 For if Jesus had given them rest, then would he not afterward have spoken of another day.
column3: Hebreers 4:8 Want as Josua aan hulle rus gegee het, sou Hy nie van ’n ander dag daarná spreek nie.

column2: Hebrews 4:9 There remaineth therefore a rest to the people of God.
column3: Hebreers 4:9 Daar bly dus ’n sabbatsrus oor vir die volk van God;

column2: Hebrews 4:10 For he that is entered into his rest, he also hath ceased from his own works, as God [did] from his.
column3: Hebreers 4:10 want wie in sy rus ingegaan het, rus ook self van sy werke soos God van syne.

column2: Hebrews 4:11 Let us labour therefore to enter into that rest, lest any man fall after the same example of unbelief.
column3: Hebreers 4:11 Laat ons ons dan beywer om in te gaan in dié rus, sodat niemand in dieselfde voorbeeld van ongehoorsaamheid mag val nie.

column2: Hebrews 4:12 For the word of God [is] quick, and powerful, and sharper than any twoedged sword, piercing even to the dividing asunder of soul and spirit, and of the joints and marrow, and [is] a discerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart.
column3: Hebreers 4:12 Want die woord van God is lewend en kragtig en skerper as enige tweesnydende swaard, en dring deur tot die skeiding van siel en gees en van gewrigte en murg, en is ’n beoordelaar van die oorlegginge en gedagtes van die hart.

column2: Hebrews 4:13 Neither is there any creature that is not manifest in his sight: but all things [are] naked and opened unto the eyes of him with whom we have to do.
column3: Hebreers 4:13 En daar is geen skepsel onsigbaar voor Hom nie, maar alles is oop en bloot voor die oë van Hom met wie ons te doen het.

column2: Hebrews 4:14 Seeing then that we have a great high priest, that is passed into the heavens, Jesus the Son of God, let us hold fast [our] profession.
column3: Hebreers 4:14 TERWYL ons dan ’n groot Hoëpriester het wat deur die hemele deurgegaan het, naamlik Jesus, die Seun van God, laat ons die belydenis vashou.

column2: Hebrews 4:15 For we have not an high priest which cannot be touched with the feeling of our infirmities; but was in all points tempted like as [we are, yet] without sin.
column3: Hebreers 4:15 Want ons het nie ’n hoëpriester wat nie met ons swakhede medelye kan hê nie, maar een wat in alle opsigte versoek is net soos ons, maar sonder sonde.

column2: Hebrews 4:16 Let us therefore come boldly unto the throne of grace, that we may obtain mercy, and find grace to help in time of need.
column3: Hebreers 4:16 Laat ons dan met vrymoedigheid na die troon van die genade gaan, sodat ons barmhartigheid kan verkry en genade vind om op die regte tyd gehelp te word.

column2: Hebrews 5:1 For every high priest taken from among men is ordained for men in things [pertaining] to God, that he may offer both gifts and sacrifices for sins:
column3: Hebreers 5:1 WANT elke hoëpriester wat uit die mense geneem word, tree ten behoewe van mense op in die dinge wat in betrekking tot God staan, om gawes en offers vir die sondes te bring

column2: Hebrews 5:2 Who can have compassion on the ignorant, and on them that are out of the way; for that he himself also is compassed with infirmity.
column3: Hebreers 5:2 as een wat kan saamvoel met die onwetendes en dwalendes, omdat hy self ook met swakheid bevange is.

column2: Hebrews 5:3 And by reason hereof he ought, as for the people, so also for himself, to offer for sins.
column3: Hebreers 5:3 En daarom juis moet hy, net soos vir die volk, so ook vir homself vanweë die sondes offer.

column2: Hebrews 5:4 And no man taketh this honour unto himself, but he that is called of God, as [was] Aaron.
column3: Hebreers 5:4 En niemand neem die waardigheid vir homself nie, maar hy wat deur God geroep word, net soos Aäron.

column2: Hebrews 5:5 So also Christ glorified not himself to be made an high priest; but he that said unto him, Thou art my Son, to day have I begotten thee.
column3: Hebreers 5:5 So het Christus ook Homself nie verheerlik om Hoëpriester te word nie, maar Hý het Hom verheerlik wat vir Hom gesê het: U is my Seun, vandag het Ek U gegenereer.

column2: Hebrews 5:6 As he saith also in another [place], Thou [art] a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec.
column3: Hebreers 5:6 Soos Hy ook op ’n ander plek sê: U is priester vir ewig volgens die orde van Melgisédek.

column2: Hebrews 5:7 Who in the days of his flesh, when he had offered up prayers and supplications with strong crying and tears unto him that was able to save him from death, and was heard in that he feared;
column3: Hebreers 5:7 Hy wat in die dae van sy vlees gebede en smekinge met sterk geroep en trane aan Hóm geoffer het wat Hom uit die dood kon red, en ook verhoor is uit die angs —

column2: Hebrews 5:8 Though he were a Son, yet learned he obedience by the things which he suffered;
column3: Hebreers 5:8 Hy, al was Hy die Seun, het gehoorsaamheid geleer uit wat Hy gely het;

column2: Hebrews 5:9 And being made perfect, he became the author of eternal salvation unto all them that obey him;
column3: Hebreers 5:9 en nadat Hy volmaak is, het Hy vir almal wat Hom gehoorsaam is, ’n bewerker van ewige saligheid geword

column2: Hebrews 5:10 Called of God an high priest after the order of Melchisedec.
column3: Hebreers 5:10 en is deur God genoem ’n hoëpriester volgens die orde van Melgisédek;

column2: Hebrews 5:11 Of whom we have many things to say, and hard to be uttered, seeing ye are dull of hearing.
column3: Hebreers 5:11 waaroor ons veel te sê het wat swaar is om te verklaar, omdat julle traag geword het om te hoor.

column2: Hebrews 5:12 For when for the time ye ought to be teachers, ye have need that one teach you again which [be] the first principles of the oracles of God; and are become such as have need of milk, and not of strong meat.
column3: Hebreers 5:12 Want hoewel julle vanweë die tyd leraars behoort te wees, het julle weer nodig dat ’n mens julle die eerste beginsels van die woorde van God moet leer, en julle het weer behoefte aan melk en nie aan vaste spys nie.

column2: Hebrews 5:13 For every one that useth milk [is] unskilful in the word of righteousness: for he is a babe.
column3: Hebreers 5:13 Want elkeen wat melk gebruik, is onervare in die woord van geregtigheid, omdat hy ’n kind is.

column2: Hebrews 5:14 But strong meat belongeth to them that are of full age, [even] those who by reason of use have their senses exercised to discern both good and evil.
column3: Hebreers 5:14 Maar vaste spys is vir volwassenes, vir die wat geestesvermoëns besit deur die gewoonte geoefen, om goed van kwaad te onderskei.

column2: Hebrews 6:1 Therefore leaving the principles of the doctrine of Christ, let us go on unto perfection; not laying again the foundation of repentance from dead works, and of faith toward God,
column3: Hebreers 6:1 DAAROM moet ons nie bly by die begin van die prediking aangaande Christus nie, maar na die volmaaktheid voortgaan sonder om weer die fondament te lê van die bekering uit dooie werke en van die geloof in God,

column2: Hebrews 6:2 Of the doctrine of baptisms, and of laying on of hands, and of resurrection of the dead, and of eternal judgment.
column3: Hebreers 6:2 van die leer van die doop en van die handoplegging en van die opstanding van die dode en van die ewige oordeel.

column2: Hebrews 6:3 And this will we do, if God permit.
column3: Hebreers 6:3 En dit sal ons doen as God dit toelaat.

column2: Hebrews 6:4 For [it is] impossible for those who were once enlightened, and have tasted of the heavenly gift, and were made partakers of the Holy Ghost,
column3: Hebreers 6:4 Want dit is onmoontlik om die wat eenmaal verlig geword het en die hemelse gawe gesmaak en die Heilige Gees deelagtig geword het,

column2: Hebrews 6:5 And have tasted the good word of God, and the powers of the world to come,
column3: Hebreers 6:5 en die goeie woord van God gesmaak het en die kragte van die toekomstige wêreld,

column2: Hebrews 6:6 If they shall fall away, to renew them again unto repentance; seeing they crucify to themselves the Son of God afresh, and put [him] to an open shame.
column3: Hebreers 6:6 en afvallig geword het — om dié weer tot bekering te vernuwe, omdat hulle ten opsigte van hulleself die Seun van God weer kruisig en openlik tot skande maak.

column2: Hebrews 6:7 For the earth which drinketh in the rain that cometh oft upon it, and bringeth forth herbs meet for them by whom it is dressed, receiveth blessing from God:
column3: Hebreers 6:7 Want die grond wat die reën indrink wat dikwels daarop val, en nuttige plante voortbring ter wille van hulle vir wie dit ook bewerk word, het deel aan die seën van God.

column2: Hebrews 6:8 But that which beareth thorns and briers [is] rejected, and [is] nigh unto cursing; whose end [is] to be burned.
column3: Hebreers 6:8 Maar as dit dorings en distels oplewer, deug dit nie en is naby die vervloeking — die einde daarvan is verbranding.

column2: Hebrews 6:9 But, beloved, we are persuaded better things of you, and things that accompany salvation, though we thus speak.
column3: Hebreers 6:9 Maar, geliefdes, ons is aangaande julle van beter dinge oortuig, dinge wat saamhang met die saligheid, al spreek ons ook so.

column2: Hebrews 6:10 For God [is] not unrighteous to forget your work and labour of love, which ye have shewed toward his name, in that ye have ministered to the saints, and do minister.
column3: Hebreers 6:10 Want God is nie onregverdig om julle werk te vergeet nie en die liefde-arbeid wat julle betoon het vir sy Naam, omdat julle die heiliges gedien het en nog dien.

column2: Hebrews 6:11 And we desire that every one of you do shew the same diligence to the full assurance of hope unto the end:
column3: Hebreers 6:11 Maar ons verlang dat elkeen van julle dieselfde ywer mag toon om te kom tot die volkome sekerheid van die hoop tot die einde toe;

column2: Hebrews 6:12 That ye be not slothful, but followers of them who through faith and patience inherit the promises.
column3: Hebreers 6:12 sodat julle nie traag word nie, maar navolgers van hulle wat deur geloof en lankmoedigheid erfgename van die belofte is.

column2: Hebrews 6:13 For when God made promise to Abraham, because he could swear by no greater, he sware by himself,
column3: Hebreers 6:13 Want toe God aan Abraham die belofte gegee het, het Hy, omdat Hy by geen meerdere kon sweer nie, by Homself gesweer

column2: Hebrews 6:14 Saying, Surely blessing I will bless thee, and multiplying I will multiply thee.
column3: Hebreers 6:14 en gesê: Voorwaar, Ek sal jou ryklik seën en jou grootliks vermeerder.

column2: Hebrews 6:15 And so, after he had patiently endured, he obtained the promise.
column3: Hebreers 6:15 En so het hy die belofte verkry nadat hy geduldig gewag het.

column2: Hebrews 6:16 For men verily swear by the greater: and an oath for confirmation [is] to them an end of all strife.
column3: Hebreers 6:16 Want mense sweer by een wat meer is, en die eed van bevestiging is vir hulle die einde van alle teëspraak.

column2: Hebrews 6:17 Wherein God, willing more abundantly to shew unto the heirs of promise the immutability of his counsel, confirmed [it] by an oath:
column3: Hebreers 6:17 Daarom het God, omdat Hy nog kragtiger aan die erfgename van die belofte die onveranderlikheid van sy raad wou toon, dit met ’n eed gewaarborg;

column2: Hebrews 6:18 That by two immutable things, in which [it was] impossible for God to lie, we might have a strong consolation, who have fled for refuge to lay hold upon the hope set before us:
column3: Hebreers 6:18 sodat ons deur twee onveranderlike dinge, waarin dit onmoontlik is dat God sou lieg, kragtige bemoediging kan hê, ons wat ontvlug het, om vas te hou aan die hoop wat voorlê;

column2: Hebrews 6:19 Which [hope] we have as an anchor of the soul, both sure and stedfast, and which entereth into that within the veil;
column3: Hebreers 6:19 en ons het dit as ’n anker van die siel wat veilig en vas is en ingaan tot binnekant die voorhangsel

column2: Hebrews 6:20 Whither the forerunner is for us entered, [even] Jesus, made an high priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec.
column3: Hebreers 6:20 waar Jesus as voorloper vir ons ingegaan het, Hy wat volgens die orde van Melgisédek ’n hoëpriester geword het vir ewig.

column2: Hebrews 7:1 For this Melchisedec, king of Salem, priest of the most high God, who met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings, and blessed him;
column3: Hebreers 7:1 WANT hierdie Melgisédek was koning van Salem, priester van God, die Allerhoogste, wat vir Abraham tegemoetgegaan het by sy terugkeer toe hy die konings verslaan het, en hom geseën het;

column2: Hebrews 7:2 To whom also Abraham gave a tenth part of all; first being by interpretation King of righteousness, and after that also King of Salem, which is, King of peace;
column3: Hebreers 7:2 aan wie Abraham ook ’n tiende deel van alles gegee het — hy was in die eerste plek, volgens uitleg, koning van die geregtigheid en dan ook koning van Salem, dit is koning van vrede;

column2: Hebrews 7:3 Without father, without mother, without descent, having neither beginning of days, nor end of life; but made like unto the Son of God; abideth a priest continually.
column3: Hebreers 7:3 sonder vader, sonder moeder, sonder geslagsregister, sonder begin van dae of lewenseinde, maar gelykgestel aan die Seun van God, bly hy priester altyddeur.

column2: Hebrews 7:4 Now consider how great this man [was], unto whom even the patriarch Abraham gave the tenth of the spoils.
column3: Hebreers 7:4 Let nou op hoe groot hierdie man was, aan wie selfs Abraham, die aartsvader, ’n tiende van die buit gegee het.

column2: Hebrews 7:5 And verily they that are of the sons of Levi, who receive the office of the priesthood, have a commandment to take tithes of the people according to the law, that is, of their brethren, though they come out of the loins of Abraham:
column3: Hebreers 7:5 Nou het hulle wat uit die seuns van Levi die priesterskap ontvang, wel ’n gebod om, volgens die wet, van die volk tiendes te neem, dit is van hulle broers, ofskoon hulle uit die lendene van Abraham voortgekom het;

column2: Hebrews 7:6 But he whose descent is not counted from them received tithes of Abraham, and blessed him that had the promises.
column3: Hebreers 7:6 maar hy wat nie uit húlle sy geslagsregister aflei nie, het van Abraham tiendes geneem en die besitter van die beloftes geseën.

column2: Hebrews 7:7 And without all contradiction the less is blessed of the better.
column3: Hebreers 7:7 Nou word sonder enige teëspraak die mindere deur die meerdere geseën.

column2: Hebrews 7:8 And here men that die receive tithes; but there he [receiveth them], of whom it is witnessed that he liveth.
column3: Hebreers 7:8 En hier neem wel sterflike mense tiendes, maar dáár een van wie getuig word dat hy lewe.

column2: Hebrews 7:9 And as I may so say, Levi also, who receiveth tithes, payed tithes in Abraham.
column3: Hebreers 7:9 En, om so te sê, het ook Levi wat tiendes ontvang, deur Abraham tiendes gegee;

column2: Hebrews 7:10 For he was yet in the loins of his father, when Melchisedec met him.
column3: Hebreers 7:10 want hy was nog in die lendene van sy vader toe Melgisédek hom tegemoetgegaan het.

column2: Hebrews 7:11 If therefore perfection were by the Levitical priesthood, (for under it the people received the law,) what further need [was there] that another priest should rise after the order of Melchisedec, and not be called after the order of Aaron?
column3: Hebreers 7:11 As daar dan volkomenheid deur die Levitiese priesterskap was — want met die oog daarop het die volk die wet ontvang — waarom was dit nog nodig dat ’n ander priester moes opstaan volgens die orde van Melgisédek en dat hy dit nie volgens die orde van Aäron genoem word nie?

column2: Hebrews 7:12 For the priesthood being changed, there is made of necessity a change also of the law.
column3: Hebreers 7:12 Want met verandering van die priesterskap kom daar noodsaaklik ook verandering van wet;

column2: Hebrews 7:13 For he of whom these things are spoken pertaineth to another tribe, of which no man gave attendance at the altar.
column3: Hebreers 7:13 omdat Hy met die oog op wie hierdie dinge gesê word, aan ’n ander stam behoort het waaruit niemand die altaar bedien het nie.

column2: Hebrews 7:14 For [it is] evident that our Lord sprang out of Juda; of which tribe Moses spake nothing concerning priesthood.
column3: Hebreers 7:14 Want dit is volkome duidelik dat onse Here uit Juda voortgespruit het, en met betrekking tot hierdie stam het Moses niks gesê van die priesterskap nie.

column2: Hebrews 7:15 And it is yet far more evident: for that after the similitude of Melchisedec there ariseth another priest,
column3: Hebreers 7:15 En nog baie duideliker is dit as daar ’n ander priester opstaan na die ewebeeld van Melgisédek,

column2: Hebrews 7:16 Who is made, not after the law of a carnal commandment, but after the power of an endless life.
column3: Hebreers 7:16 een wat dit geword het nie kragtens die wet van ’n vleeslike gebod nie, maar uit die krag van die onvernietigbare lewe.

column2: Hebrews 7:17 For he testifieth, Thou [art] a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec.
column3: Hebreers 7:17 Want Hy getuig: U is priester vir ewig volgens die orde van Melgisédek.

column2: Hebrews 7:18 For there is verily a disannulling of the commandment going before for the weakness and unprofitableness thereof.
column3: Hebreers 7:18 Want aan die een kant is daar die opheffing van die voorafgaande gebod weens die swakheid en nutteloosheid daarvan,

column2: Hebrews 7:19 For the law made nothing perfect, but the bringing in of a better hope [did]; by the which we draw nigh unto God.
column3: Hebreers 7:19 omdat die wet niks volkome gemaak het nie; maar aan die ander kant is daar die invoering van ’n beter hoop waardeur ons tot God nader.

column2: Hebrews 7:20 And inasmuch as not without an oath [he was made priest]:
column3: Hebreers 7:20 En vir sover dit nie sonder eedswering was nie — want húlle het sonder eedswering priesters geword,

column2: Hebrews 7:21 (For those priests were made without an oath; but this with an oath by him that said unto him, The Lord sware and will not repent, Thou [art] a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec:)
column3: Hebreers 7:21 maar Hy met eedswering deur die Een wat aan Hom gesê het: Die Here het gesweer en dit sal Hom nie berou nie: U is priester vir ewig volgens die orde van Melgisédek —

column2: Hebrews 7:22 By so much was Jesus made a surety of a better testament.
column3: Hebreers 7:22 in sover het Jesus van ’n beter verbond borg geword.

column2: Hebrews 7:23 And they truly were many priests, because they were not suffered to continue by reason of death:
column3: Hebreers 7:23 En hulle het wel priesters geword in ’n groot aantal, omdat hulle deur die dood verhinder is om aan te bly;

column2: Hebrews 7:24 But this [man], because he continueth ever, hath an unchangeable priesthood.
column3: Hebreers 7:24 maar Hy, omdat Hy vir ewig bly, besit ’n priesterskap wat nie op ander oorgaan nie.

column2: Hebrews 7:25 Wherefore he is able also to save them to the uttermost that come unto God by him, seeing he ever liveth to make intercession for them.
column3: Hebreers 7:25 Daarom kan Hy ook volkome red die wat deur Hom tot God gaan, omdat Hy altyd leef om vir hulle in te tree.

column2: Hebrews 7:26 For such an high priest became us, [who is] holy, harmless, undefiled, separate from sinners, and made higher than the heavens;
column3: Hebreers 7:26 Want so ’n hoëpriester was vir ons gepas, een wat heilig, onskuldig, onbesmet, afgeskeie van die sondaars is, en wat hoër as die hemele geword het;

column2: Hebrews 7:27 Who needeth not daily, as those high priests, to offer up sacrifice, first for his own sins, and then for the people's: for this he did once, when he offered up himself.
column3: Hebreers 7:27 wat nie elke dag nodig het, soos die hoëpriesters, om eers vir sy eie sondes offers te bring en dan vir dié van die volk nie. Want dit het Hy net een maal gedoen toe Hy Homself geoffer het.

column2: Hebrews 7:28 For the law maketh men high priests which have infirmity; but the word of the oath, which was since the law, [maketh] the Son, who is consecrated for evermore.
column3: Hebreers 7:28 Want die wet stel as hoëpriesters aan mense met swakhede, maar die woord van die eedswering wat ná die wet gekom het, stel die Seun aan, wat vir ewig volmaak is.

column2: Hebrews 8:1 Now of the things which we have spoken [this is] the sum: We have such an high priest, who is set on the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens;
column3: Hebreers 8:1 DIE hoofsaak nou van wat ons gesê het, is dít: Ons het so ’n Hoëpriester wat gaan sit het aan die regterhand van die troon van die Majesteit in die hemele,

column2: Hebrews 8:2 A minister of the sanctuary, and of the true tabernacle, which the Lord pitched, and not man.
column3: Hebreers 8:2 ’n Bedienaar van die heilige dinge en van die ware tabernakel wat die Here opgerig het en nie ’n mens nie.

column2: Hebrews 8:3 For every high priest is ordained to offer gifts and sacrifices: wherefore [it is] of necessity that this man have somewhat also to offer.
column3: Hebreers 8:3 Want elke hoëpriester word aangestel om gawes en offers te bring. Daarom moes Hy ook iets hê om te offer.

column2: Hebrews 8:4 For if he were on earth, he should not be a priest, seeing that there are priests that offer gifts according to the law:
column3: Hebreers 8:4 Want as Hy op aarde was, sou Hy selfs geen priester wees nie, omdat daar priesters is wat volgens die wet die gawes offer,

column2: Hebrews 8:5 Who serve unto the example and shadow of heavenly things, as Moses was admonished of God when he was about to make the tabernacle: for, See, saith he, [that] thou make all things according to the pattern shewed to thee in the mount.
column3: Hebreers 8:5 hulle wat ’n afbeeldsel en skaduwee van die hemelse dinge bedien, soos Moses ’n goddelike bevel ontvang het toe hy die tabernakel sou voltooi; want Hy het gesê: Kyk dat jy alles maak volgens die voorbeeld wat jou op die berg getoon is.

column2: Hebrews 8:6 But now hath he obtained a more excellent ministry, by how much also he is the mediator of a better covenant, which was established upon better promises.
column3: Hebreers 8:6 Maar nou het Hy ’n voortrefliker bediening verkry vir sover Hy ook Middelaar is van ’n beter verbond wat op beter beloftes wettelik gegrond is.

column2: Hebrews 8:7 For if that first [covenant] had been faultless, then should no place have been sought for the second.
column3: Hebreers 8:7 Want as daardie eerste een onberispelik was, sou daar nie plek vir ’n tweede gesoek word nie.

column2: Hebrews 8:8 For finding fault with them, he saith, Behold, the days come, saith the Lord, when I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah:
column3: Hebreers 8:8 Want Hy berispe hulle en sê: Kyk, daar kom dae, spreek die Here, dat Ek met die huis van Israel en die huis van Juda ’n nuwe verbond tot stand sal bring,

column2: Hebrews 8:9 Not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers in the day when I took them by the hand to lead them out of the land of Egypt; because they continued not in my covenant, and I regarded them not, saith the Lord.
column3: Hebreers 8:9 nie volgens die verbond wat Ek met hulle vaders gemaak het op die dag toe Ek hulle aan die hand geneem het om hulle uit Egipteland uit te lei nie; want hulle het nie gebly by my verbond nie, en Ek het hulle veronagsaam, spreek die Here.

column2: Hebrews 8:10 For this [is] the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel after those days, saith the Lord; I will put my laws into their mind, and write them in their hearts: and I will be to them a God, and they shall be to me a people:
column3: Hebreers 8:10 Want dit is die verbond wat Ek ná dié dae sal sluit met die huis van Israel, spreek die Here: Ek sal my wette in hulle verstand gee en dit op hulle hart skrywe; en Ek sal vir hulle ’n God wees, en hulle sal vir My ’n volk wees.

column2: Hebrews 8:11 And they shall not teach every man his neighbour, and every man his brother, saying, Know the Lord: for all shall know me, from the least to the greatest.
column3: Hebreers 8:11 En hulle sal nie meer elkeen sy naaste en elkeen sy broer leer en sê: Ken die Here nie; want almal sal My ken, klein en groot onder hulle.

column2: Hebrews 8:12 For I will be merciful to their unrighteousness, and their sins and their iniquities will I remember no more.
column3: Hebreers 8:12 Want Ek sal barmhartig wees oor hulle ongeregtighede en aan hulle sondes en hulle oortredinge nooit meer dink nie.

column2: Hebrews 8:13 In that he saith, A new [covenant], he hath made the first old. Now that which decayeth and waxeth old [is] ready to vanish away.
column3: Hebreers 8:13 As Hy sê ’n nuwe verbond, het Hy die eerste oud gemaak; en wat oud word en verouder, is naby die verdwyning.

column2: Hebrews 9:1 Then verily the first [covenant] had also ordinances of divine service, and a worldly sanctuary.
column3: Hebreers 9:1 SO het dan die eerste verbond sowel verordeninge vir die erediens asook sy aardse heiligdom gehad.

column2: Hebrews 9:2 For there was a tabernacle made; the first, wherein [was] the candlestick, and the table, and the shewbread; which is called the sanctuary.
column3: Hebreers 9:2 Want die tabernakel is so ingerig: die eerste, waarin die kandelaar was en die tafel en die toonbrode, wat die Heilige genoem word;

column2: Hebrews 9:3 And after the second veil, the tabernacle which is called the Holiest of all;
column3: Hebreers 9:3 en agter die tweede voorhangsel die tabernakel wat genoem word die Allerheiligste,

column2: Hebrews 9:4 Which had the golden censer, and the ark of the covenant overlaid round about with gold, wherein [was] the golden pot that had manna, and Aaron's rod that budded, and the tables of the covenant;
column3: Hebreers 9:4 waarin ’n goue wierookbak was en die ark van die verbond, rondom heeltemal met goud oortrek, waarin die goue kruik met die manna was en die staf van Aäron wat gebloei het, en die tafels van die verbond;

column2: Hebrews 9:5 And over it the cherubims of glory shadowing the mercyseat; of which we cannot now speak particularly.
column3: Hebreers 9:5 en daar bo-op die gérubs van die heerlikheid wat die versoendeksel oorskadu het, waaroor nie nou afsonderlik gespreek kan word nie.

column2: Hebrews 9:6 Now when these things were thus ordained, the priests went always into the first tabernacle, accomplishing the service [of God].
column3: Hebreers 9:6 En nadat hierdie dinge so ingerig was, het die priesters wel gedurig in die eerste tabernakel ingegaan om die dienste te vervul,

column2: Hebrews 9:7 But into the second [went] the high priest alone once every year, not without blood, which he offered for himself, and [for] the errors of the people:
column3: Hebreers 9:7 maar in die tweede die hoëpriester alleen, een maal in die jaar, nie sonder bloed nie, wat hy offer vir homself en vir die sondes van die volk uit onwetendheid begaan —

column2: Hebrews 9:8 The Holy Ghost this signifying, that the way into the holiest of all was not yet made manifest, while as the first tabernacle was yet standing:
column3: Hebreers 9:8 waarmee die Heilige Gees dít duidelik maak, dat die weg na die heiligdom nog nie geopen is so lank as die eerste tabernakel nog standhou nie.

column2: Hebrews 9:9 Which [was] a figure for the time then present, in which were offered both gifts and sacrifices, that could not make him that did the service perfect, as pertaining to the conscience;
column3: Hebreers 9:9 Dit was ’n beeld met die oog op die teenwoordige tyd waarin daar gawes en offers gebring word, wat hom wat die diens verrig, na die gewete nie volkome kan maak nie,

column2: Hebrews 9:10 [Which stood] only in meats and drinks, and divers washings, and carnal ordinances, imposed [on them] until the time of reformation.
column3: Hebreers 9:10 omdat dit net bestaan het in spys en drank en verskillende wassinge en vleeslike verordeninge wat opgelê is tot op die tyd van herstelling.

column2: Hebrews 9:11 But Christ being come an high priest of good things to come, by a greater and more perfect tabernacle, not made with hands, that is to say, not of this building;
column3: Hebreers 9:11 Maar Christus, wat opgetree het as Hoëpriester van die toekomstige weldade, het deur die groter en volmaakter tabernakel wat nie met hande gemaak is nie, dit wil sê, wat nie aan hierdie skepping behoort nie,

column2: Hebrews 9:12 Neither by the blood of goats and calves, but by his own blood he entered in once into the holy place, having obtained eternal redemption [for us].
column3: Hebreers 9:12 ook nie met die bloed van bokke en kalwers nie, maar met sy eie bloed, een maal ingegaan in die heiligdom en ’n ewige verlossing teweeggebring.

column2: Hebrews 9:13 For if the blood of bulls and of goats, and the ashes of an heifer sprinkling the unclean, sanctifieth to the purifying of the flesh:
column3: Hebreers 9:13 Want as die bloed van stiere en bokke en die as van ’n vers wat die verontreinigdes besprinkel, heilig maak tot reiniging van die vlees,

column2: Hebrews 9:14 How much more shall the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered himself without spot to God, purge your conscience from dead works to serve the living God?
column3: Hebreers 9:14 hoeveel te meer sal die bloed van Christus, wat Homself deur die ewige Gees aan God sonder smet geoffer het, julle gewete reinig van dooie werke om die lewende God te dien.

column2: Hebrews 9:15 And for this cause he is the mediator of the new testament, that by means of death, for the redemption of the transgressions [that were] under the first testament, they which are called might receive the promise of eternal inheritance.
column3: Hebreers 9:15 En daarom is Hy Middelaar van ’n nuwe testament, sodat, terwyl daar ’n dood plaasgevind het vir die verlossing van die oortredinge onder die eerste testament, die wat geroepe is, die belofte van die ewige erfenis kan ontvang.

column2: Hebrews 9:16 For where a testament [is], there must also of necessity be the death of the testator.
column3: Hebreers 9:16 Want waar ’n testament is, moet noodsaaklik die dood van die testamentmaker aangekondig word;

column2: Hebrews 9:17 For a testament [is] of force after men are dead: otherwise it is of no strength at all while the testator liveth.
column3: Hebreers 9:17 want ’n testament is geldig by sterfgevalle, aangesien dit nooit van krag is so lank as die testamentmaker nog leef nie.

column2: Hebrews 9:18 Whereupon neither the first [testament] was dedicated without blood.
column3: Hebreers 9:18 Daarom is ook die eerste testament nie sonder bloed ingewy nie;

column2: Hebrews 9:19 For when Moses had spoken every precept to all the people according to the law, he took the blood of calves and of goats, with water, and scarlet wool, and hyssop, and sprinkled both the book, and all the people,
column3: Hebreers 9:19 want toe elke gebod volgens die wet deur Moses aan die hele volk aangekondig is, het hy die bloed van die kalwers en bokke saam met water en skarlakenrooi wol en hisop geneem en die boek self en die hele volk besprinkel

column2: Hebrews 9:20 Saying, This [is] the blood of the testament which God hath enjoined unto you.
column3: Hebreers 9:20 en gesê: Dit is die bloed van die testament wat God met die oog op julle verorden het.

column2: Hebrews 9:21 Moreover he sprinkled with blood both the tabernacle, and all the vessels of the ministry.
column3: Hebreers 9:21 En hy het ook die tabernakel en al die gereedskap van die diens net so met die bloed besprinkel.

column2: Hebrews 9:22 And almost all things are by the law purged with blood; and without shedding of blood is no remission.
column3: Hebreers 9:22 En byna alles word met bloed gereinig volgens die wet, en sonder bloedvergieting vind daar geen vergifnis plaas nie.

column2: Hebrews 9:23 [It was] therefore necessary that the patterns of things in the heavens should be purified with these; but the heavenly things themselves with better sacrifices than these.
column3: Hebreers 9:23 Dit was dus nodig dat die afbeeldinge van die dinge in die hemele deur hierdie offers gereinig moes word, maar die hemelse dinge self deur beter offers as hierdie.

column2: Hebrews 9:24 For Christ is not entered into the holy places made with hands, [which are] the figures of the true; but into heaven itself, now to appear in the presence of God for us:
column3: Hebreers 9:24 Want Christus het nie ingegaan in ’n heiligdom met hande gemaak, ’n teëbeeld van die ware nie, maar in die hemel self om nou voor die aangesig van God vir ons te verskyn;

column2: Hebrews 9:25 Nor yet that he should offer himself often, as the high priest entereth into the holy place every year with blood of others;
column3: Hebreers 9:25 ook nie om Homself dikwels te offer, soos die hoëpriester elke jaar in die heiligdom ingaan met bloed wat nie sy eie is nie,

column2: Hebrews 9:26 For then must he often have suffered since the foundation of the world: but now once in the end of the world hath he appeared to put away sin by the sacrifice of himself.
column3: Hebreers 9:26 want dan moes Hy dikwels gely het van die grondlegging van die wêreld af. Maar nou het Hy een maal in die voleinding van die eeue verskyn om die sonde deur sy offer weg te doen.

column2: Hebrews 9:27 And as it is appointed unto men once to die, but after this the judgment:
column3: Hebreers 9:27 En net soos die mense bestem is om een maal te sterwe en daarna die oordeel,

column2: Hebrews 9:28 So Christ was once offered to bear the sins of many; and unto them that look for him shall he appear the second time without sin unto salvation.
column3: Hebreers 9:28 so sal Christus ook, nadat Hy een maal geoffer is om die sondes van baie weg te neem, vir die tweede maal sonder sonde verskyn aan die wat Hom verwag tot saligheid.

column2: Hebrews 10:1 For the law having a shadow of good things to come, [and] not the very image of the things, can never with those sacrifices which they offered year by year continually make the comers thereunto perfect.
column3: Hebreers 10:1 WANT die wet, wat ’n skaduwee het van die toekomstige weldade, nie die beeld self van die dinge nie, kan nooit deur dieselfde offers wat jaar na jaar gedurig gebring word, die wat toetree, tot volmaaktheid lei nie.

column2: Hebrews 10:2 For then would they not have ceased to be offered? because that the worshippers once purged should have had no more conscience of sins.
column3: Hebreers 10:2 Anders sou hulle opgehou het om geoffer te word, omdat die wat die diens verrig, nadat hulle een maal gereinig is, geen bewussyn meer van sondes sou gehad het nie.

column2: Hebrews 10:3 But in those [sacrifices there is] a remembrance again [made] of sins every year.
column3: Hebreers 10:3 Maar in dié offers is daar jaar na jaar ’n herinnering aan die sondes;

column2: Hebrews 10:4 For [it is] not possible that the blood of bulls and of goats should take away sins.
column3: Hebreers 10:4 want die bloed van stiere en bokke kan onmoontlik die sonde wegneem.

column2: Hebrews 10:5 Wherefore when he cometh into the world, he saith, Sacrifice and offering thou wouldest not, but a body hast thou prepared me:
column3: Hebreers 10:5 Daarom sê Hy, as Hy in die wêreld inkom: Slagoffer en spysoffer wou U nie hê nie, maar U het vir My ’n liggaam berei.

column2: Hebrews 10:6 In burnt offerings and [sacrifices] for sin thou hast had no pleasure.
column3: Hebreers 10:6 Brandoffers en sondoffers het U nie behaag nie.

column2: Hebrews 10:7 Then said I, Lo, I come (in the volume of the book it is written of me,) to do thy will, O God.
column3: Hebreers 10:7 Toe het Ek gesê: Kyk, Ek kom — in die boekrol is dit van My geskrywe — om u wil te doen, o God.

column2: Hebrews 10:8 Above when he said, Sacrifice and offering and burnt offerings and [offering] for sin thou wouldest not, neither hadst pleasure [therein]; which are offered by the law;
column3: Hebreers 10:8 Nadat Hy hierbo gespreek het: Slagoffer en spysoffer en brandoffers en sondoffers wou U nie hê en het U nie behaag nie — wat volgens die wet geoffer word —

column2: Hebrews 10:9 Then said he, Lo, I come to do thy will, O God. He taketh away the first, that he may establish the second.
column3: Hebreers 10:9 het Hy daarna gesê: Kyk, Ek kom om u wil te doen, o God. Hy neem die eerste weg om die tweede te stel.

column2: Hebrews 10:10 By the which will we are sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once [for all].
column3: Hebreers 10:10 Deur hierdie wil is ons geheilig deur die offer van die liggaam van Jesus Christus, net een maal.

column2: Hebrews 10:11 And every priest standeth daily ministering and offering oftentimes the same sacrifices, which can never take away sins:
column3: Hebreers 10:11 En elke priester staan wel dag vir dag om die diens waar te neem en dikwels dieselfde slagoffers te bring wat tog nooit die sondes kan wegneem nie;

column2: Hebrews 10:12 But this man, after he had offered one sacrifice for sins for ever, sat down on the right hand of God;
column3: Hebreers 10:12 maar Hy het, nadat Hy een slagoffer vir die sondes gebring het, vir altyd gaan sit aan die regterhand van God

column2: Hebrews 10:13 From henceforth expecting till his enemies be made his footstool.
column3: Hebreers 10:13 en wag nou verder totdat sy vyande gemaak is ’n voetbank van sy voete.

column2: Hebrews 10:14 For by one offering he hath perfected for ever them that are sanctified.
column3: Hebreers 10:14 Want deur een offer het Hy vir altyd volmaak die wat geheilig word.

column2: Hebrews 10:15 [Whereof] the Holy Ghost also is a witness to us: for after that he had said before,
column3: Hebreers 10:15 En ook die Heilige Gees gee aan ons getuienis;

column2: Hebrews 10:16 This [is] the covenant that I will make with them after those days, saith the Lord, I will put my laws into their hearts, and in their minds will I write them;
column3: Hebreers 10:16 want nadat Hy tevore gesê het: Dit is die verbond wat Ek met hulle sal sluit ná dié dae, spreek die Here verder: Ek sal my wette gee in hulle hart, en in hulle verstand sal Ek dit inskrywe,

column2: Hebrews 10:17 And their sins and iniquities will I remember no more.
column3: Hebreers 10:17 en aan hulle sondes en hulle ongeregtighede sal Ek nooit meer dink nie.

column2: Hebrews 10:18 Now where remission of these [is, there is] no more offering for sin.
column3: Hebreers 10:18 Waar daar nou vergifnis van hierdie dinge is, is daar geen offer meer vir die sonde nie.

column2: Hebrews 10:19 Having therefore, brethren, boldness to enter into the holiest by the blood of Jesus,
column3: Hebreers 10:19 TERWYL ons dan, broeders, vrymoedigheid het om in die heiligdom in te gaan deur die bloed van Jesus

column2: Hebrews 10:20 By a new and living way, which he hath consecrated for us, through the veil, that is to say, his flesh;
column3: Hebreers 10:20 op die nuwe en lewende weg wat Hy vir ons ingewy het deur die voorhangsel heen, dit is sy vlees,

column2: Hebrews 10:21 And [having] an high priest over the house of God;
column3: Hebreers 10:21 en ons ’n groot Priester oor die huis van God het,

column2: Hebrews 10:22 Let us draw near with a true heart in full assurance of faith, having our hearts sprinkled from an evil conscience, and our bodies washed with pure water.
column3: Hebreers 10:22 laat ons toetree met ’n waaragtige hart in volle geloofsversekerdheid, die harte deur besprenkeling gereinig van ’n slegte gewete en die liggaam gewas met rein water.

column2: Hebrews 10:23 Let us hold fast the profession of [our] faith without wavering; (for he [is] faithful that promised;)
column3: Hebreers 10:23 Laat ons die belydenis van die hoop onwankelbaar vashou, want Hy wat dit beloof het, is getrou;

column2: Hebrews 10:24 And let us consider one another to provoke unto love and to good works:
column3: Hebreers 10:24 en laat ons op mekaar ag gee om tot liefde en goeie werke aan te spoor;

column2: Hebrews 10:25 Not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together, as the manner of some [is]; but exhorting [one another]: and so much the more, as ye see the day approaching.
column3: Hebreers 10:25 en laat ons ons onderlinge byeenkoms nie versuim soos sommige die gewoonte het nie, maar laat ons mekaar vermaan, en dit des te meer namate julle die dag sien nader kom.

column2: Hebrews 10:26 For if we sin wilfully after that we have received the knowledge of the truth, there remaineth no more sacrifice for sins,
column3: Hebreers 10:26 Want as ons opsetlik sondig, nadat ons die kennis van die waarheid ontvang het, bly daar geen offer vir die sondes meer oor nie,

column2: Hebrews 10:27 But a certain fearful looking for of judgment and fiery indignation, which shall devour the adversaries.
column3: Hebreers 10:27 maar ’n verskriklike verwagting van oordeel en ’n vuurgloed wat die teëstanders sal verteer.

column2: Hebrews 10:28 He that despised Moses' law died without mercy under two or three witnesses:
column3: Hebreers 10:28 As iemand die wet van Moses verwerp het, sterf hy sonder ontferming op die getuienis van twee of drie;

column2: Hebrews 10:29 Of how much sorer punishment, suppose ye, shall he be thought worthy, who hath trodden under foot the Son of God, and hath counted the blood of the covenant, wherewith he was sanctified, an unholy thing, and hath done despite unto the Spirit of grace?
column3: Hebreers 10:29 hoeveel swaarder straf, dink julle, sal hy verdien wat die Seun van God vertrap het en die bloed van die testament waardeur hy geheilig is, onrein geag en die Gees van genade gesmaad het?

column2: Hebrews 10:30 For we know him that hath said, Vengeance [belongeth] unto me, I will recompense, saith the Lord. And again, The Lord shall judge his people.
column3: Hebreers 10:30 Want ons ken Hom wat gesê het: My kom die wraak toe, Ek sal vergelde, spreek die Here; en weer: Die Here sal sy volk oordeel.

column2: Hebrews 10:31 [It is] a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God.
column3: Hebreers 10:31 Vreeslik is dit om te val in die hande van die lewende God.

column2: Hebrews 10:32 But call to remembrance the former days, in which, after ye were illuminated, ye endured a great fight of afflictions;
column3: Hebreers 10:32 Maar onthou die vorige dae waarin julle, toe julle verlig geword het, ’n groot lydensworsteling deurstaan het,

column2: Hebrews 10:33 Partly, whilst ye were made a gazingstock both by reproaches and afflictions; and partly, whilst ye became companions of them that were so used.
column3: Hebreers 10:33 gedeeltelik omdat julle deur smaad en verdrukkinge ’n skouspel geword het, gedeeltelik omdat julle deelgenote geword het van die wat in so ’n toestand verkeer het.

column2: Hebrews 10:34 For ye had compassion of me in my bonds, and took joyfully the spoiling of your goods, knowing in yourselves that ye have in heaven a better and an enduring substance.
column3: Hebreers 10:34 Want julle het ook saam met my gevoel in my boeie, en julle het die berowing van julle goed met blydskap aanvaar, omdat julle geweet het dat julle in julself ’n beter en blywende besitting in die hemele het.

column2: Hebrews 10:35 Cast not away therefore your confidence, which hath great recompence of reward.
column3: Hebreers 10:35 Werp dan julle vrymoedigheid, wat ’n groot beloning het, nie weg nie.

column2: Hebrews 10:36 For ye have need of patience, that, after ye have done the will of God, ye might receive the promise.
column3: Hebreers 10:36 Want julle het lydsaamheid nodig, om, nadat julle die wil van God gedoen het, die belofte te verkry.

column2: Hebrews 10:37 For yet a little while, and he that shall come will come, and will not tarry.
column3: Hebreers 10:37 Want nog ’n klein tydjie, en Hy wat kom, sal kom en nie versuim nie.

column2: Hebrews 10:38 Now the just shall live by faith: but if [any man] draw back, my soul shall have no pleasure in him.
column3: Hebreers 10:38 Maar die regverdige sal uit die geloof lewe; en as hy hom onttrek, het my siel geen welbehae in hom nie.

column2: Hebrews 10:39 But we are not of them who draw back unto perdition; but of them that believe to the saving of the soul.
column3: Hebreers 10:39 Maar by ons is daar geen onttrekking tot verderf nie, maar geloof tot behoud van die lewe.

column2: Hebrews 11:1 Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen.
column3: Hebreers 11:1 DIE geloof dan is ’n vaste vertroue op die dinge wat ons hoop, ’n bewys van die dinge wat ons nie sien nie.

column2: Hebrews 11:2 For by it the elders obtained a good report.
column3: Hebreers 11:2 Want daardeur het die mense van die ou tyd getuienis ontvang.

column2: Hebrews 11:3 Through faith we understand that the worlds were framed by the word of God, so that things which are seen were not made of things which do appear.
column3: Hebreers 11:3 Deur die geloof verstaan ons dat die wêreld deur die woord van God toeberei is, sodat die dinge wat gesien word, nie ontstaan het uit sienlike dinge nie.

column2: Hebrews 11:4 By faith Abel offered unto God a more excellent sacrifice than Cain, by which he obtained witness that he was righteous, God testifying of his gifts: and by it he being dead yet speaketh.
column3: Hebreers 11:4 Deur die geloof het Abel ’n beter offer aan God gebring as Kain, waardeur hy getuienis ontvang het dat hy regverdig was, omdat God oor sy gawes getuienis gegee het; en deur dieselfde geloof spreek hy nog nadat hy dood is.

column2: Hebrews 11:5 By faith Enoch was translated that he should not see death; and was not found, because God had translated him: for before his translation he had this testimony, that he pleased God.
column3: Hebreers 11:5 Deur die geloof is Henog weggeneem om die dood nie te sien nie; en hy is nie gevind nie, omdat God hom weggeneem het; want voor sy wegneming het hy getuienis ontvang dat hy God behaag het.

column2: Hebrews 11:6 But without faith [it is] impossible to please [him]: for he that cometh to God must believe that he is, and [that] he is a rewarder of them that diligently seek him.
column3: Hebreers 11:6 En sonder geloof is dit onmoontlik om God te behaag; want hy wat tot God gaan, moet glo dat Hy is en ’n beloner is van die wat Hom soek.

column2: Hebrews 11:7 By faith Noah, being warned of God of things not seen as yet, moved with fear, prepared an ark to the saving of his house; by the which he condemned the world, and became heir of the righteousness which is by faith.
column3: Hebreers 11:7 Deur die geloof het Noag, toe hy ’n goddelike waarskuwing ontvang het aangaande wat nog nie gesien was nie, met eerbiedige vrees die ark gereed gemaak tot redding van sy huisgesin, waardeur hy die wêreld veroordeel het en ’n erfgenaam geword het van die geregtigheid wat volgens die geloof is.

column2: Hebrews 11:8 By faith Abraham, when he was called to go out into a place which he should after receive for an inheritance, obeyed; and he went out, not knowing whither he went.
column3: Hebreers 11:8 Deur die geloof het Abraham, toe hy geroep is, gehoorsaam weggetrek na die plek wat hy as ’n erfenis sou ontvang; en hy het weggetrek sonder om te weet waar hy sou kom.

column2: Hebrews 11:9 By faith he sojourned in the land of promise, as [in] a strange country, dwelling in tabernacles with Isaac and Jacob, the heirs with him of the same promise:
column3: Hebreers 11:9 Deur die geloof het hy as vreemdeling gaan woon in die land van belofte soos in ’n vreemde land en in tente gewoon met Isak en Jakob, die mede-erfgename van dieselfde belofte.

column2: Hebrews 11:10 For he looked for a city which hath foundations, whose builder and maker [is] God.
column3: Hebreers 11:10 Want hy het die stad verwag wat fondamente het, waarvan God die boumeester en oprigter is.

column2: Hebrews 11:11 Through faith also Sara herself received strength to conceive seed, and was delivered of a child when she was past age, because she judged him faithful who had promised.
column3: Hebreers 11:11 Deur die geloof het Sara self ook krag ontvang om bevrug te word; en toe sy oor die leeftyd was, het sy gebaar, omdat sy Hom getrou geag het wat dit beloof het.

column2: Hebrews 11:12 Therefore sprang there even of one, and him as good as dead, [so many] as the stars of the sky in multitude, and as the sand which is by the sea shore innumerable.
column3: Hebreers 11:12 Daarom is daar ook gebore uit een vader, en dit ’n verstorwene, kinders soos sterre van die hemel in menigte en soos die sand aan die strand van die see, wat ontelbaar is.

column2: Hebrews 11:13 These all died in faith, not having received the promises, but having seen them afar off, and were persuaded of [them], and embraced [them], and confessed that they were strangers and pilgrims on the earth.
column3: Hebreers 11:13 In die geloof het hulle almal gesterwe sonder om die beloftes te verkry, maar hulle het dit uit die verte gesien en geglo en begroet, en het bely dat hulle vreemdelinge en bywoners op aarde was.
