column2: Hebrews 11:14 For they that say such things declare plainly that they seek a country.
column3: Hebreers 11:14 Want die wat sulke dinge sê, verklaar dat hulle ’n vaderland soek.

column2: Hebrews 11:15 And truly, if they had been mindful of that [country] from whence they came out, they might have had opportunity to have returned.
column3: Hebreers 11:15 En as hulle bly dink het aan dié vaderland waaruit hulle weggetrek het, sou hulle geleentheid gehad het om terug te keer.

column2: Hebrews 11:16 But now they desire a better [country], that is, an heavenly: wherefore God is not ashamed to be called their God: for he hath prepared for them a city.
column3: Hebreers 11:16 Maar nou verlang hulle na ’n beter een, dit is ’n hemelse. Daarom skaam God Hom nie vir hulle om hulle God genoem te word nie, want Hy het vir hulle ’n stad berei.

column2: Hebrews 11:17 By faith Abraham, when he was tried, offered up Isaac: and he that had received the promises offered up his only begotten [son],
column3: Hebreers 11:17 Deur die geloof het Abraham, toe hy op die proef gestel is, Isak geoffer; ja, hy wat die beloftes ontvang het, het sy eniggeborene geoffer,

column2: Hebrews 11:18 Of whom it was said, That in Isaac shall thy seed be called:
column3: Hebreers 11:18 aan wie gesê is: In Isak sal jou nageslag genoem word — want hy het gereken dat God mag het om selfs uit die dode op te wek;

column2: Hebrews 11:19 Accounting that God [was] able to raise [him] up, even from the dead; from whence also he received him in a figure.
column3: Hebreers 11:19 daaruit het hy hom ook, om so te spreek, terug ontvang.

column2: Hebrews 11:20 By faith Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau concerning things to come.
column3: Hebreers 11:20 Deur die geloof het Isak vir Jakob en Esau geseën met die oog op die toekoms.

column2: Hebrews 11:21 By faith Jacob, when he was a dying, blessed both the sons of Joseph; and worshipped, [leaning] upon the top of his staff.
column3: Hebreers 11:21 Deur die geloof het Jakob op sy sterfbed altwee die seuns van Josef geseën; en hy het aanbid terwyl hy leun op die knop van sy staf.

column2: Hebrews 11:22 By faith Joseph, when he died, made mention of the departing of the children of Israel; and gave commandment concerning his bones.
column3: Hebreers 11:22 Deur die geloof het Josef aan die einde van sy lewe melding gemaak van die uittog van die kinders van Israel en bevel gegee aangaande sy gebeente.

column2: Hebrews 11:23 By faith Moses, when he was born, was hid three months of his parents, because they saw [he was] a proper child; and they were not afraid of the king's commandment.
column3: Hebreers 11:23 Deur die geloof is Moses ná sy geboorte deur sy ouers drie maande lank weggesteek, omdat hulle gesien het dat die seuntjie mooi was; en hulle het nie die gebod van die koning gevrees nie.

column2: Hebrews 11:24 By faith Moses, when he was come to years, refused to be called the son of Pharaoh's daughter;
column3: Hebreers 11:24 Deur die geloof het Moses, toe hy grootgeword het, geweier om die seun van Farao se dogter genoem te word,

column2: Hebrews 11:25 Choosing rather to suffer affliction with the people of God, than to enjoy the pleasures of sin for a season;
column3: Hebreers 11:25 omdat hy verkies het om liewer sleg behandel te word saam met die volk van God as om ’n tyd lank die genot van die sonde te hê,

column2: Hebrews 11:26 Esteeming the reproach of Christ greater riches than the treasures in Egypt: for he had respect unto the recompence of the reward.
column3: Hebreers 11:26 en die smaad van Christus groter rykdom geag het as die skatte van Egipte, want hy het uitgesien na die beloning.

column2: Hebrews 11:27 By faith he forsook Egypt, not fearing the wrath of the king: for he endured, as seeing him who is invisible.
column3: Hebreers 11:27 Deur die geloof het hy Egipte verlaat sonder om die toorn van die koning te vrees, want hy het volgehou soos een wat die Onsienlike sien.

column2: Hebrews 11:28 Through faith he kept the passover, and the sprinkling of blood, lest he that destroyed the firstborn should touch them.
column3: Hebreers 11:28 Deur die geloof het hy die pasga gehou en die besprenkeling van die bloed, sodat die verderwer hulle eersgeborenes nie sou aanraak nie.

column2: Hebrews 11:29 By faith they passed through the Red sea as by dry [land]: which the Egyptians assaying to do were drowned.
column3: Hebreers 11:29 Deur die geloof het hulle die Rooi See deurgegaan soos oor droë grond, terwyl die Egiptenaars, toe hulle dit probeer, verdrink het.

column2: Hebrews 11:30 By faith the walls of Jericho fell down, after they were compassed about seven days.
column3: Hebreers 11:30 Deur die geloof het die mure van Jérigo geval nadat daar sewe dae lank omheen getrek was.

column2: Hebrews 11:31 By faith the harlot Rahab perished not with them that believed not, when she had received the spies with peace.
column3: Hebreers 11:31 Deur die geloof het Ragab, die hoer, nie saam met die ongehoorsames omgekom nie, omdat sy die spioene in vrede ontvang het.

column2: Hebrews 11:32 And what shall I more say? for the time would fail me to tell of Gedeon, and [of] Barak, and [of] Samson, and [of] Jephthae; [of] David also, and Samuel, and [of] the prophets:
column3: Hebreers 11:32 En wat sal ek nog meer sê? Want die tyd sal my ontbreek as ek van Gídeon, Barak en Simson en Jefta, Dawid en Samuel en die profete sou verhaal,

column2: Hebrews 11:33 Who through faith subdued kingdoms, wrought righteousness, obtained promises, stopped the mouths of lions,
column3: Hebreers 11:33 wat deur die geloof koninkryke oorweldig het, geregtigheid uitgeoefen, beloftes verkry, bekke van leeus toegestop,

column2: Hebrews 11:34 Quenched the violence of fire, escaped the edge of the sword, out of weakness were made strong, waxed valiant in fight, turned to flight the armies of the aliens.
column3: Hebreers 11:34 die krag van vuur uitgeblus, die skerpte van die swaard ontvlug, krag uit swakheid ontvang het, dapper gewees het in die oorlog, leërs van vreemdes op die vlug gedryf het.

column2: Hebrews 11:35 Women received their dead raised to life again: and others were tortured, not accepting deliverance; that they might obtain a better resurrection:
column3: Hebreers 11:35 Vroue het hulle dode deur opstanding teruggekry, en ander is gefolter en wou geen bevryding aanneem nie, om ’n beter opstanding te kan verkry.

column2: Hebrews 11:36 And others had trial of [cruel] mockings and scourgings, yea, moreover of bonds and imprisonment:
column3: Hebreers 11:36 Ander weer het die proef van bespottinge en géselinge deurstaan, ook van boeie en gevangenis.

column2: Hebrews 11:37 They were stoned, they were sawn asunder, were tempted, were slain with the sword: they wandered about in sheepskins and goatskins; being destitute, afflicted, tormented;
column3: Hebreers 11:37 Hulle is gestenig, in stukke gesaag, versoek, deur die swaard vermoor. Hulle het rondgeloop in skaapvelle en in bokvelle; hulle het gebrek gely, hulle is verdruk, mishandel —

column2: Hebrews 11:38 (Of whom the world was not worthy:) they wandered in deserts, and [in] mountains, and [in] dens and caves of the earth.
column3: Hebreers 11:38 die wêreld was hulle nie werd nie — hulle het in woestyne rondgedwaal en op berge en in spelonke en skeure in die grond.

column2: Hebrews 11:39 And these all, having obtained a good report through faith, received not the promise:
column3: Hebreers 11:39 En alhoewel hulle almal deur die geloof getuienis ontvang het, het hulle die belofte nie verkry nie,

column2: Hebrews 11:40 God having provided some better thing for us, that they without us should not be made perfect.
column3: Hebreers 11:40 omdat God iets beters oor ons beskik het, sodat hulle nie sonder ons volmaak sou word nie.

column2: Hebrews 12:1 Wherefore seeing we also are compassed about with so great a cloud of witnesses, let us lay aside every weight, and the sin which doth so easily beset [us], and let us run with patience the race that is set before us,
column3: Hebreers 12:1 DAAROM dan, terwyl ons so ’n groot wolk van getuies rondom ons het, laat ons ook elke las aflê en die sonde wat ons so maklik omring, en met volharding die wedloop loop wat voor ons lê,

column2: Hebrews 12:2 Looking unto Jesus the author and finisher of [our] faith; who for the joy that was set before him endured the cross, despising the shame, and is set down at the right hand of the throne of God.
column3: Hebreers 12:2 die oog gevestig op Jesus, die Leidsman en Voleinder van die geloof, wat vir die vreugde wat Hom voorgehou is, die kruis verdra het, die skande verag het en aan die regterkant van die troon van God gaan sit het.

column2: Hebrews 12:3 For consider him that endured such contradiction of sinners against himself, lest ye be wearied and faint in your minds.
column3: Hebreers 12:3 Want julle moet ag gee op Hom wat so ’n teëspraak van die sondaars teen Hom verdra het, sodat julle in jul siele nie vermoeid word en verslap nie.

column2: Hebrews 12:4 Ye have not yet resisted unto blood, striving against sin.
column3: Hebreers 12:4 Julle het nog nie ten bloede toe weerstand gebied in julle stryd teen die sonde nie.

column2: Hebrews 12:5 And ye have forgotten the exhortation which speaketh unto you as unto children, My son, despise not thou the chastening of the Lord, nor faint when thou art rebuked of him:
column3: Hebreers 12:5 En julle het die vermaning heeltemal vergeet wat tot julle as seuns spreek: My seun, ag die tugtiging van die Here nie gering nie en beswyk nie as jy deur Hom bestraf word nie;

column2: Hebrews 12:6 For whom the Lord loveth he chasteneth, and scourgeth every son whom he receiveth.
column3: Hebreers 12:6 want die Here tugtig hom wat Hy liefhet, en Hy kasty elke seun wat Hy aanneem.

column2: Hebrews 12:7 If ye endure chastening, God dealeth with you as with sons; for what son is he whom the father chasteneth not?
column3: Hebreers 12:7 As julle die tugtiging verdra, behandel God julle as seuns; want watter seun is daar wat die vader nie tugtig nie?

column2: Hebrews 12:8 But if ye be without chastisement, whereof all are partakers, then are ye bastards, and not sons.
column3: Hebreers 12:8 Maar as julle sonder tugtiging is, wat almal deelagtig geword het, dan is julle onegte kinders en nie seuns nie.

column2: Hebrews 12:9 Furthermore we have had fathers of our flesh which corrected [us], and we gave [them] reverence: shall we not much rather be in subjection unto the Father of spirits, and live?
column3: Hebreers 12:9 Verder, ons het ons vaders na die vlees as kastyders gehad, en ons het vir hulle ontsag gehad; moet ons nie veel meer aan die Vader van die geeste onderworpe wees en lewe nie?

column2: Hebrews 12:10 For they verily for a few days chastened [us] after their own pleasure; but he for [our] profit, that [we] might be partakers of his holiness.
column3: Hebreers 12:10 Want húlle het ons wel ’n kort tydjie na hulle beste wete getugtig; maar Hy tot ons beswil, sodat ons sy heiligheid kan deelagtig word.

column2: Hebrews 12:11 Now no chastening for the present seemeth to be joyous, but grievous: nevertheless afterward it yieldeth the peaceable fruit of righteousness unto them which are exercised thereby.
column3: Hebreers 12:11 Nou lyk elke tugtiging of dit op die oomblik nie ’n saak van blydskap is nie, maar van droefheid; later lewer dit egter ’n vredevolle vrug van geregtigheid vir die wat daardeur geoefen is.

column2: Hebrews 12:12 Wherefore lift up the hands which hang down, and the feeble knees;
column3: Hebreers 12:12 Daarom, rig die slap hande en die verlamde knieë weer op;

column2: Hebrews 12:13 And make straight paths for your feet, lest that which is lame be turned out of the way; but let it rather be healed.
column3: Hebreers 12:13 en maak reguit paaie vir julle voete, sodat wat kreupel is, nie uit lit raak nie, maar liewer gesond gemaak word.

column2: Hebrews 12:14 Follow peace with all [men], and holiness, without which no man shall see the Lord:
column3: Hebreers 12:14 Jaag die vrede na met almal, en die heiligmaking waarsonder niemand die Here sal sien nie;

column2: Hebrews 12:15 Looking diligently lest any man fail of the grace of God; lest any root of bitterness springing up trouble [you], and thereby many be defiled;
column3: Hebreers 12:15 en pas op dat niemand in die genade van God veragter nie; dat geen wortel van bitterheid opskiet en onrus verwek en baie hierdeur besoedel word nie.

column2: Hebrews 12:16 Lest there [be] any fornicator, or profane person, as Esau, who for one morsel of meat sold his birthright.
column3: Hebreers 12:16 Laat niemand ’n hoereerder wees nie, of ’n onheilige soos Esau, wat vir één spysgereg sy eersgeboortereg verkoop het.

column2: Hebrews 12:17 For ye know how that afterward, when he would have inherited the blessing, he was rejected: for he found no place of repentance, though he sought it carefully with tears.
column3: Hebreers 12:17 Want julle weet dat hy, toe hy ook later die seën wou beërwe, verwerp is, want hy het geen geleentheid vir berou gevind nie, al het hy dit met trane vurig begeer.

column2: Hebrews 12:18 For ye are not come unto the mount that might be touched, and that burned with fire, nor unto blackness, and darkness, and tempest,
column3: Hebreers 12:18 Want julle het nie gekom by ’n tasbare berg nie en ’n brandende vuur en donkerheid en duisternis en storm

column2: Hebrews 12:19 And the sound of a trumpet, and the voice of words; which [voice] they that heard intreated that the word should not be spoken to them any more:
column3: Hebreers 12:19 en basuingeklank en die geluid van woorde waarby die hoorders gesmeek het dat hulle geen woord meer sou toegevoeg word nie —

column2: Hebrews 12:20 (For they could not endure that which was commanded, And if so much as a beast touch the mountain, it shall be stoned, or thrust through with a dart:
column3: Hebreers 12:20 want hulle kon die gebod nie verdra nie: selfs as ’n dier die berg aanraak, moet dit gestenig word of met ’n pyl neergeskiet word.

column2: Hebrews 12:21 And so terrible was the sight, [that] Moses said, I exceedingly fear and quake:)
column3: Hebreers 12:21 En Moses, so vreeslik was die gesig, het gesê: Ek is verskrik en ek sidder.

column2: Hebrews 12:22 But ye are come unto mount Sion, and unto the city of the living God, the heavenly Jerusalem, and to an innumerable company of angels,
column3: Hebreers 12:22 Maar julle het gekom by die berg Sion en die stad van die lewende God, die hemelse Jerusalem en tienduisende engele,

column2: Hebrews 12:23 To the general assembly and church of the firstborn, which are written in heaven, and to God the Judge of all, and to the spirits of just men made perfect,
column3: Hebreers 12:23 by die feestelike vergadering en die gemeente van eersgeborenes wat in die hemele opgeskrywe is, en by God, die Regter van almal, en by die geeste van die volmaakte regverdiges,

column2: Hebrews 12:24 And to Jesus the mediator of the new covenant, and to the blood of sprinkling, that speaketh better things than [that of] Abel.
column3: Hebreers 12:24 en by Jesus, die Middelaar van die nuwe testament, en die bloed van die besprenkeling wat van beter dinge spreek as Abel.

column2: Hebrews 12:25 See that ye refuse not him that speaketh. For if they escaped not who refused him that spake on earth, much more [shall not] we [escape], if we turn away from him that [speaketh] from heaven:
column3: Hebreers 12:25 Pas op dat julle Hom wat spreek, nie afwys nie; want as húlle nie ontvlug het nie wat Hom afgewys het toe Hy op aarde ’n goddelike waarskuwing gegee het, veel minder óns wat ons van Hom afkeer nou dat Hy uit die hemele spreek.

column2: Hebrews 12:26 Whose voice then shook the earth: but now he hath promised, saying, Yet once more I shake not the earth only, but also heaven.
column3: Hebreers 12:26 Toe het sy stem die aarde geskud; maar nou het Hy belowe en gesê: Nog een maal laat Ek nie alleen die aarde nie, maar ook die hemel bewe.

column2: Hebrews 12:27 And this [word], Yet once more, signifieth the removing of those things that are shaken, as of things that are made, that those things which cannot be shaken may remain.
column3: Hebreers 12:27 En hierdie woord: nog een maal, wys duidelik op die verandering van die wankelbare dinge as geskape dinge, sodat die onwankelbare kan bly.

column2: Hebrews 12:28 Wherefore we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved, let us have grace, whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear:
column3: Hebreers 12:28 Daarom, omdat ons ’n onwankelbare koninkryk ontvang, laat ons dankbaar wees, en so God welbehaaglik dien met eerbied en vrees.

column2: Hebrews 12:29 For our God [is] a consuming fire.
column3: Hebreers 12:29 Want onse God is ’n verterende vuur.

column2: Hebrews 13:1 Let brotherly love continue.
column3: Hebreers 13:1 DIE broederliefde moet bly.

column2: Hebrews 13:2 Be not forgetful to entertain strangers: for thereby some have entertained angels unawares.
column3: Hebreers 13:2 Vergeet die gasvryheid nie, want daardeur het sommige, sonder om dit te weet, engele as gaste geherberg.

column2: Hebrews 13:3 Remember them that are in bonds, as bound with them; [and] them which suffer adversity, as being yourselves also in the body.
column3: Hebreers 13:3 Dink aan die gevangenes asof julle medegevangenes is, en aan die wat mishandel word, as mense wat self ook ’n liggaam het.

column2: Hebrews 13:4 Marriage [is] honourable in all, and the bed undefiled: but whoremongers and adulterers God will judge.
column3: Hebreers 13:4 Laat die huwelik in alle opsigte eerbaar wees en die bed onbesmet; want God sal hoereerders en egbrekers oordeel.

column2: Hebrews 13:5 [Let your] conversation [be] without covetousness; [and be] content with such things as ye have: for he hath said, I will never leave thee, nor forsake thee.
column3: Hebreers 13:5 Julle gedrag moet vry van geldgierigheid wees. Wees tevrede met wat julle het, want Hy het gesê: Ek sal jou nooit begewe en jou nooit verlaat nie.

column2: Hebrews 13:6 So that we may boldly say, The Lord [is] my helper, and I will not fear what man shall do unto me.
column3: Hebreers 13:6 Daarom kan ons met alle vrymoedigheid sê: Die Here is vir my ’n Helper, en ek sal nie vrees nie; wat sal ’n mens aan my doen?

column2: Hebrews 13:7 Remember them which have the rule over you, who have spoken unto you the word of God: whose faith follow, considering the end of [their] conversation.
column3: Hebreers 13:7 Gedenk julle voorgangers wat die woord van God aan julle verkondig het; aanskou die uiteinde van hulle lewenswandel en volg hulle geloof na.

column2: Hebrews 13:8 Jesus Christ the same yesterday, and to day, and for ever.
column3: Hebreers 13:8 Jesus Christus is gister en vandag dieselfde en tot in ewigheid.

column2: Hebrews 13:9 Be not carried about with divers and strange doctrines. For [it is] a good thing that the heart be established with grace; not with meats, which have not profited them that have been occupied therein.
column3: Hebreers 13:9 Moenie rondgeslinger word deur allerhande en vreemde leringe nie; want dit is goed dat die hart versterk word deur genade, nie deur voedsel nie, waarvan die wat daarin gewandel het, geen voordeel gehad het nie.

column2: Hebrews 13:10 We have an altar, whereof they have no right to eat which serve the tabernacle.
column3: Hebreers 13:10 Ons het ’n altaar waarvan die wat die tabernakel bedien, geen reg het om te eet nie;

column2: Hebrews 13:11 For the bodies of those beasts, whose blood is brought into the sanctuary by the high priest for sin, are burned without the camp.
column3: Hebreers 13:11 want die diere waarvan die bloed vir die sonde deur die hoëpriester in die heiligdom ingedra word — hulle liggame word buitekant die laer verbrand.

column2: Hebrews 13:12 Wherefore Jesus also, that he might sanctify the people with his own blood, suffered without the gate.
column3: Hebreers 13:12 Daarom het Jesus ook, om die volk deur sy eie bloed te heilig, buitekant die poort gely.

column2: Hebrews 13:13 Let us go forth therefore unto him without the camp, bearing his reproach.
column3: Hebreers 13:13 Laat ons dan uitgaan na Hom toe buitekant die laer en sy smaad dra.

column2: Hebrews 13:14 For here have we no continuing city, but we seek one to come.
column3: Hebreers 13:14 Want ons het hier geen blywende stad nie, maar ons soek die toekomstige.

column2: Hebrews 13:15 By him therefore let us offer the sacrifice of praise to God continually, that is, the fruit of [our] lips giving thanks to his name.
column3: Hebreers 13:15 Laat ons dan gedurig deur Hom aan God ’n lofoffer bring, dit is die vrug van die lippe wat sy Naam bely.

column2: Hebrews 13:16 But to do good and to communicate forget not: for with such sacrifices God is well pleased.
column3: Hebreers 13:16 Vergeet die weldadigheid en mededeelsaamheid nie, want God het ’n welbehae aan sulke offers.

column2: Hebrews 13:17 Obey them that have the rule over you, and submit yourselves: for they watch for your souls, as they that must give account, that they may do it with joy, and not with grief: for that [is] unprofitable for you.
column3: Hebreers 13:17 Wees gehoorsaam aan julle voorgangers en onderdanig, want hulle waak vir julle siele as diegene wat rekenskap moet gee, sodat hulle dit met blydskap kan doen en nie al sugtende nie; want dit is vir julle nie nuttig nie.

column2: Hebrews 13:18 Pray for us: for we trust we have a good conscience, in all things willing to live honestly.
column3: Hebreers 13:18 Bid vir ons, want ons is oortuig dat ons ’n goeie gewete het, omdat ons in alles goed wil wandel.

column2: Hebrews 13:19 But I beseech [you] the rather to do this, that I may be restored to you the sooner.
column3: Hebreers 13:19 Des te meer vermaan ek julle om dit te doen, sodat ek gouer aan julle teruggegee kan word.

column2: Hebrews 13:20 Now the God of peace, that brought again from the dead our Lord Jesus, that great shepherd of the sheep, through the blood of the everlasting covenant,
column3: Hebreers 13:20 MAG die God van die vrede, wat die groot Herder van die skape, naamlik onse Here Jesus Christus, deur die bloed van die ewige testament uit die dode teruggebring het,

column2: Hebrews 13:21 Make you perfect in every good work to do his will, working in you that which is wellpleasing in his sight, through Jesus Christ; to whom [be] glory for ever and ever. Amen.
column3: Hebreers 13:21 julle volmaak in elke goeie werk, om sy wil te doen, deur in julle te werk wat welbehaaglik is voor Hom deur Jesus Christus aan wie die heerlikheid toekom tot in alle ewigheid! Amen.

column2: Hebrews 13:22 And I beseech you, brethren, suffer the word of exhortation: for I have written a letter unto you in few words.
column3: Hebreers 13:22 En ek vermaan julle, broeders, verdra die woord van vermaning, want ek het ook maar kort aan julle geskrywe.

column2: Hebrews 13:23 Know ye that [our] brother Timothy is set at liberty; with whom, if he come shortly, I will see you.
column3: Hebreers 13:23 Julle moet weet dat die broeder Timótheüs vrygelaat is, saam met wie ek julle sal sien as hy spoedig kom.

column2: Hebrews 13:24 Salute all them that have the rule over you, and all the saints. They of Italy salute you.
column3: Hebreers 13:24 Groet al julle voorgangers en al die heiliges. Die wat van Italië is, groet julle.

column2: Hebrews 13:25 Grace [be] with you all. Amen. <<[Written to the Hebrews from Italy, by Timothy.]>>
column3: Hebreers 13:25 Die genade sy met julle almal! Amen.

column2: James 1:1 James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, to the twelve tribes which are scattered abroad, greeting.
column3: Jakobus 1:1 JAKOBUS, ’n dienskneg van God en die Here Jesus Christus, aan die twaalf stamme wat in die verstrooiing is: Groete!

column2: James 1:2 My brethren, count it all joy when ye fall into divers temptations;
column3: Jakobus 1:2 AG dit louter vreugde, my broeders, wanneer julle in allerhande versoekinge val,

column2: James 1:3 Knowing [this], that the trying of your faith worketh patience.
column3: Jakobus 1:3 omdat julle weet dat die beproewing van julle geloof lydsaamheid bewerk.

column2: James 1:4 But let patience have [her] perfect work, that ye may be perfect and entire, wanting nothing.
column3: Jakobus 1:4 Maar die lydsaamheid moet tot volle verwerkliking kom, sodat julle volmaak en sonder gebrek kan wees en in niks kortkom nie.

column2: James 1:5 If any of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God, that giveth to all [men] liberally, and upbraideth not; and it shall be given him.
column3: Jakobus 1:5 En as iemand van julle wysheid kortkom, laat hom dit van God bid, wat aan almal eenvoudig gee sonder om te verwyt, en dit sal aan hom gegee word.

column2: James 1:6 But let him ask in faith, nothing wavering. For he that wavereth is like a wave of the sea driven with the wind and tossed.
column3: Jakobus 1:6 Maar hy moet in die geloof bid, sonder om te twyfel; want hy wat twyfel, is soos ’n golf van die see wat deur die wind gedrywe en voortgesweep word.

column2: James 1:7 For let not that man think that he shall receive any thing of the Lord.
column3: Jakobus 1:7 Want dié mens moenie dink dat hy iets van die Here sal ontvang nie —

column2: James 1:8 A double minded man [is] unstable in all his ways.
column3: Jakobus 1:8 so ’n dubbelhartige man, onbestendig in al sy weë.

column2: James 1:9 Let the brother of low degree rejoice in that he is exalted:
column3: Jakobus 1:9 Maar laat die broeder wat gering is, roem in sy hoogheid,

column2: James 1:10 But the rich, in that he is made low: because as the flower of the grass he shall pass away.
column3: Jakobus 1:10 en die ryke in sy geringheid, want soos ’n blom van die gras sal hy verbygaan.

column2: James 1:11 For the sun is no sooner risen with a burning heat, but it withereth the grass, and the flower thereof falleth, and the grace of the fashion of it perisheth: so also shall the rich man fade away in his ways.
column3: Jakobus 1:11 Want die son gaan op met sy hitte en laat die gras verdor, en sy blom val af, en die sierlikheid van sy gedaante vergaan; so sal die ryke ook in sy weë verwelk.

column2: James 1:12 Blessed [is] the man that endureth temptation: for when he is tried, he shall receive the crown of life, which the Lord hath promised to them that love him.
column3: Jakobus 1:12 Salig is die man wat versoeking verdra, want as hy die toets deurstaan het, sal hy die kroon van die lewe ontvang wat die Here beloof het aan die wat Hom liefhet.

column2: James 1:13 Let no man say when he is tempted, I am tempted of God: for God cannot be tempted with evil, neither tempteth he any man:
column3: Jakobus 1:13 Laat niemand, as hy in versoeking kom, sê: Ek word deur God versoek nie. Want God kan deur die kwaad nie versoek word nie, en self versoek Hy niemand nie.

column2: James 1:14 But every man is tempted, when he is drawn away of his own lust, and enticed.
column3: Jakobus 1:14 Maar elkeen word versoek as hy deur sy eie begeerlikheid weggesleep en verlok word.

column2: James 1:15 Then when lust hath conceived, it bringeth forth sin: and sin, when it is finished, bringeth forth death.
column3: Jakobus 1:15 Daarna, as die begeerlikheid ontvang het, baar dit sonde; en as die sonde tot volle ontwikkeling gekom het, bring dit die dood voort.

column2: James 1:16 Do not err, my beloved brethren.
column3: Jakobus 1:16 Moenie dwaal nie, my geliefde broeders.

column2: James 1:17 Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, and cometh down from the Father of lights, with whom is no variableness, neither shadow of turning.
column3: Jakobus 1:17 Elke goeie gif en elke volmaakte gawe daal van bo af neer, van die Vader van die ligte, by wie daar geen verandering of skaduwee van omkering is nie.

column2: James 1:18 Of his own will begat he us with the word of truth, that we should be a kind of firstfruits of his creatures.
column3: Jakobus 1:18 Volgens sy wil het Hy ons voortgebring deur die woord van die waarheid, sodat ons as eerstelinge van sy skepsele kan wees.

column2: James 1:19 Wherefore, my beloved brethren, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, slow to wrath:
column3: Jakobus 1:19 SO dan, my geliefde broeders, elke mens moet gou wees om te hoor, stadig om te praat, stadig om toornig te word.

column2: James 1:20 For the wrath of man worketh not the righteousness of God.
column3: Jakobus 1:20 Want die toorn van ’n man bewerk nie die geregtigheid voor God nie.

column2: James 1:21 Wherefore lay apart all filthiness and superfluity of naughtiness, and receive with meekness the engrafted word, which is able to save your souls.
column3: Jakobus 1:21 Daarom, doen afstand van alle vuiligheid en oorvloed van boosheid, en ontvang met sagmoedigheid die ingeplante woord, wat in staat is om julle siele te red.

column2: James 1:22 But be ye doers of the word, and not hearers only, deceiving your own selves.
column3: Jakobus 1:22 En word daders van die woord en nie net hoorders wat julleself bedrieg nie.

column2: James 1:23 For if any be a hearer of the word, and not a doer, he is like unto a man beholding his natural face in a glass:
column3: Jakobus 1:23 Want as iemand ’n hoorder van die woord is en nie ’n dader nie, dié is soos ’n man wat sy natuurlike gesig in ’n spieël sien;

column2: James 1:24 For he beholdeth himself, and goeth his way, and straightway forgetteth what manner of man he was.
column3: Jakobus 1:24 want hy sien homself en gaan weg en vergeet dadelik hoe hy gelyk het.

column2: James 1:25 But whoso looketh into the perfect law of liberty, and continueth [therein], he being not a forgetful hearer, but a doer of the work, this man shall be blessed in his deed.
column3: Jakobus 1:25 Maar hy wat diep insien in die volmaakte wet van die vryheid en daarby bly, hy sal, omdat hy nie ’n vergeetagtige hoorder is nie, maar ’n dader van die werk, gelukkig wees in wat hy doen.

column2: James 1:26 If any man among you seem to be religious, and bridleth not his tongue, but deceiveth his own heart, this man's religion [is] vain.
column3: Jakobus 1:26 As iemand onder julle meen dat hy godsdienstig is en sy tong nie in toom hou nie, maar sy hart mislei, die godsdiens van hierdie man is tevergeefs.

column2: James 1:27 Pure religion and undefiled before God and the Father is this, To visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction, [and] to keep himself unspotted from the world.
column3: Jakobus 1:27 Reine en onbesmette godsdiens voor God en die Vader is dít: om wese en weduwees in hulle verdrukking te besoek en jou vlekkeloos te bewaar van die wêreld.

column2: James 2:1 My brethren, have not the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ, [the Lord] of glory, with respect of persons.
column3: Jakobus 2:1 MY broeders, laat julle geloof in onse Here Jesus Christus, die Here van die heerlikheid, nie wees met aanneming van die persoon nie.

column2: James 2:2 For if there come unto your assembly a man with a gold ring, in goodly apparel, and there come in also a poor man in vile raiment;
column3: Jakobus 2:2 Want as daar in julle vergadering ’n man inkom met goue ringe aan die vingers, met ’n pragtige kleed aan, en daar kom ook ’n arm man in met vuil klere aan;

column2: James 2:3 And ye have respect to him that weareth the gay clothing, and say unto him, Sit thou here in a good place; and say to the poor, Stand thou there, or sit here under my footstool:
column3: Jakobus 2:3 en as julle opsien na hom wat die pragtige kleed dra, en vir hom sê: Gaan u op hierdie goeie plek sit, en vir die arme sê julle: Gaan jy daar staan of hier onder my voetbank sit —

column2: James 2:4 Are ye not then partial in yourselves, and are become judges of evil thoughts?
column3: Jakobus 2:4 het julle dan nie by julleself onderskeid gemaak en regters met verkeerde oorlegginge geword nie?

column2: James 2:5 Hearken, my beloved brethren, Hath not God chosen the poor of this world rich in faith, and heirs of the kingdom which he hath promised to them that love him?
column3: Jakobus 2:5 Luister, my geliefde broeders — het God nie die armes van hierdie wêreld uitverkies as rykes in die geloof en erfgename van die koninkryk wat Hy beloof het aan die wat Hom liefhet nie?

column2: James 2:6 But ye have despised the poor. Do not rich men oppress you, and draw you before the judgment seats?
column3: Jakobus 2:6 Maar julle het die arm man oneer aangedoen. Is dit nie juis die rykes wat julle oorweldig en julle voor die regbanke sleep nie?

column2: James 2:7 Do not they blaspheme that worthy name by the which ye are called?
column3: Jakobus 2:7 Is dit nie hulle wat die edele Naam belaster oor julle aangeroep is nie?

column2: James 2:8 If ye fulfil the royal law according to the scripture, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself, ye do well:
column3: Jakobus 2:8 As julle ewenwel die koninklike wet volbring volgens die Skrif: Jy moet jou naaste liefhê soos jouself — dan doen julle goed.

column2: James 2:9 But if ye have respect to persons, ye commit sin, and are convinced of the law as transgressors.
column3: Jakobus 2:9 Maar as julle partydig is, doen julle sonde en word deur die wet as oortreders bestraf.

column2: James 2:10 For whosoever shall keep the whole law, and yet offend in one [point], he is guilty of all.
column3: Jakobus 2:10 Want wie die hele wet onderhou, maar in een opsig struikel, het aan almal skuldig geword.

column2: James 2:11 For he that said, Do not commit adultery, said also, Do not kill. Now if thou commit no adultery, yet if thou kill, thou art become a transgressor of the law.
column3: Jakobus 2:11 Want Hy wat gesê het: Jy mag nie egbreek nie, het ook gesê: Jy mag nie doodslaan nie. As jy nou nie egbreek nie, maar doodslaan, het jy ’n oortreder van die wet geword.

column2: James 2:12 So speak ye, and so do, as they that shall be judged by the law of liberty.
column3: Jakobus 2:12 Julle moet so spreek en so doen soos diegene wat deur die wet van vryheid geoordeel sal word.

column2: James 2:13 For he shall have judgment without mercy, that hath shewed no mercy; and mercy rejoiceth against judgment.
column3: Jakobus 2:13 Want die oordeel sal onbarmhartig wees oor die wat geen barmhartigheid bewys het nie; en die barmhartigheid roem teen die oordeel.

column2: James 2:14 What [doth it] profit, my brethren, though a man say he hath faith, and have not works? can faith save him?
column3: Jakobus 2:14 WAT baat dit, my broeders, as iemand sê dat hy die geloof het, maar hy het nie die werke nie? Dié geloof kan hom tog nie red nie?

column2: James 2:15 If a brother or sister be naked, and destitute of daily food,
column3: Jakobus 2:15 As daar nou ’n broeder of suster naak is en aan die daaglikse voedsel gebrek het,

column2: James 2:16 And one of you say unto them, Depart in peace, be [ye] warmed and filled; notwithstanding ye give them not those things which are needful to the body; what [doth it] profit?
column3: Jakobus 2:16 en een uit julle sou vir hulle sê: Gaan heen in vrede, word warm, word versadig, maar julle gee hulle nie wat vir die liggaam nodig is nie — wat baat dit?

column2: James 2:17 Even so faith, if it hath not works, is dead, being alone.
column3: Jakobus 2:17 Net so is ook die geloof, as dit geen werke het nie, in sigself dood.

column2: James 2:18 Yea, a man may say, Thou hast faith, and I have works: shew me thy faith without thy works, and I will shew thee my faith by my works.
column3: Jakobus 2:18 Maar iemand sal sê: Jy het die geloof en ek die werke. Toon my jou geloof uit jou werke, en ek sal jou uit my werke my geloof toon.

column2: James 2:19 Thou believest that there is one God; thou doest well: the devils also believe, and tremble.
column3: Jakobus 2:19 Jy glo dat God één is. Jy doen goed; die duiwels glo dit ook, en hulle sidder.

column2: James 2:20 But wilt thou know, O vain man, that faith without works is dead?
column3: Jakobus 2:20 Maar wil jy weet, o nietige mens, dat die geloof sonder die werke dood is?

column2: James 2:21 Was not Abraham our father justified by works, when he had offered Isaac his son upon the altar?
column3: Jakobus 2:21 Is Abraham, ons vader, nie uit die werke geregverdig toe hy Isak, sy seun, op die altaar geoffer het nie?

column2: James 2:22 Seest thou how faith wrought with his works, and by works was faith made perfect?
column3: Jakobus 2:22 Sien jy dat die geloof saamgewerk het met sy werke en dat die geloof volkome geword het uit die werke?

column2: James 2:23 And the scripture was fulfilled which saith, Abraham believed God, and it was imputed unto him for righteousness: and he was called the Friend of God.
column3: Jakobus 2:23 En die Skrif is vervul wat sê: En Abraham het God geglo, en dit is hom tot geregtigheid gereken, en hy is ’n vriend van God genoem.

column2: James 2:24 Ye see then how that by works a man is justified, and not by faith only.
column3: Jakobus 2:24 Sien julle dan nou dat die mens geregverdig word uit die werke en nie alleen uit die geloof nie?

column2: James 2:25 Likewise also was not Rahab the harlot justified by works, when she had received the messengers, and had sent [them] out another way?
column3: Jakobus 2:25 En is Ragab, die hoer, nie ook net so geregverdig uit die werke toe sy die boodskappers ontvang en met ’n ander pad weggestuur het nie?

column2: James 2:26 For as the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without works is dead also.
column3: Jakobus 2:26 Want soos die liggaam sonder gees dood is, so is ook die geloof sonder die werke dood.

column2: James 3:1 My brethren, be not many masters, knowing that we shall receive the greater condemnation.
column3: Jakobus 3:1 MOENIE baie leermeesters wees nie, my broeders, omdat julle weet dat ons ’n groter oordeel sal ondergaan.

column2: James 3:2 For in many things we offend all. If any man offend not in word, the same [is] a perfect man, [and] able also to bridle the whole body.
column3: Jakobus 3:2 Want ons almal struikel dikwels. As iemand in woorde nie struikel nie, is hy ’n volmaakte man, in staat om ook die hele liggaam in toom te hou.

column2: James 3:3 Behold, we put bits in the horses' mouths, that they may obey us; and we turn about their whole body.
column3: Jakobus 3:3 Kyk, ons sit stange in die perde se bekke, sodat hulle ons gehoorsaam kan wees, en ons stuur hulle hele liggaam daarmee.

column2: James 3:4 Behold also the ships, which though [they be] so great, and [are] driven of fierce winds, yet are they turned about with a very small helm, whithersoever the governor listeth.
column3: Jakobus 3:4 Kyk, ook die skepe, alhoewel hulle so groot is en deur hewige winde voortgedryf word, word gestuur deur ’n baie klein roer net waarheen die stuurman wil.

column2: James 3:5 Even so the tongue is a little member, and boasteth great things. Behold, how great a matter a little fire kindleth!
column3: Jakobus 3:5 Net so is die tong ook ’n klein lid en beroem hom op groot dinge — kyk hoe ’n groot hoop hout steek ’n klein vuurtjie aan die brand.

column2: James 3:6 And the tongue [is] a fire, a world of iniquity: so is the tongue among our members, that it defileth the whole body, and setteth on fire the course of nature; and it is set on fire of hell.
column3: Jakobus 3:6 Die tong is ook ’n vuur, die wêreld van ongeregtigheid. Net so ’n plek neem die tong onder ons lede in; dit besmet die hele liggaam en steek die hele lewensloop aan die brand en word uit die hel aangesteek.

column2: James 3:7 For every kind of beasts, and of birds, and of serpents, and of things in the sea, is tamed, and hath been tamed of mankind:
column3: Jakobus 3:7 Want elke soort natuur van wilde diere en voëls en kruipende sowel as seediere word getem en is getem deur die menslike natuur.

column2: James 3:8 But the tongue can no man tame; [it is] an unruly evil, full of deadly poison.
column3: Jakobus 3:8 Maar die tong kan geen mens tem nie; dit is ’n onbedwingbare kwaad, vol dodelike gif.

column2: James 3:9 Therewith bless we God, even the Father; and therewith curse we men, which are made after the similitude of God.
column3: Jakobus 3:9 Daarmee loof ons God en die Vader, en daarmee vervloek ons die mense wat na die gelykenis van God gemaak is.

column2: James 3:10 Out of the same mouth proceedeth blessing and cursing. My brethren, these things ought not so to be.
column3: Jakobus 3:10 Uit dieselfde mond kom seën en vervloeking. Dit, my broeders, behoort nie so te wees nie.

column2: James 3:11 Doth a fountain send forth at the same place sweet [water] and bitter?
column3: Jakobus 3:11 ’n Fontein laat tog nie uit dieselfde oog vars en bitter water opborrel nie?

column2: James 3:12 Can the fig tree, my brethren, bear olive berries? either a vine, figs? so [can] no fountain both yield salt water and fresh.
column3: Jakobus 3:12 ’n Vyeboom, my broeders, kan tog nie olywe voortbring, of ’n wingerdstok vye nie? So kan geen fontein brak en vars water voortbring nie.

column2: James 3:13 Who [is] a wise man and endued with knowledge among you? let him shew out of a good conversation his works with meekness of wisdom.
column3: Jakobus 3:13 WIE is wys en verstandig onder julle? Laat hom uit sy goeie lewenswandel sy werke in sagmoedige wysheid toon.

column2: James 3:14 But if ye have bitter envying and strife in your hearts, glory not, and lie not against the truth.
column3: Jakobus 3:14 Maar as julle bittere afguns en selfsug in julle hart het, moenie roem en lieg teen die waarheid nie.

column2: James 3:15 This wisdom descendeth not from above, but [is] earthly, sensual, devilish.
column3: Jakobus 3:15 Dít is nie die wysheid wat van bo kom nie, maar is aards, natuurlik, duiwels;

column2: James 3:16 For where envying and strife [is], there [is] confusion and every evil work.
column3: Jakobus 3:16 want waar afguns en selfsug is, daar is wanorde en allerhande gemene dade.

column2: James 3:17 But the wisdom that is from above is first pure, then peaceable, gentle, [and] easy to be intreated, full of mercy and good fruits, without partiality, and without hypocrisy.
column3: Jakobus 3:17 Maar die wysheid van bo is ten eerste rein, dan vredeliewend, vriendelik, geseglik, vol barmhartigheid en goeie vrugte, onpartydig en ongeveins.

column2: James 3:18 And the fruit of righteousness is sown in peace of them that make peace.
column3: Jakobus 3:18 En die vrug van die geregtigheid word gesaai in vrede vir die wat vrede maak.

column2: James 4:1 From whence [come] wars and fightings among you? [come they] not hence, [even] of your lusts that war in your members?
column3: Jakobus 4:1 WAARVANDAAN kom oorloë en vegterye onder julle? Kom hulle nie hiervandaan, van julle welluste wat in julle lede stryd voer nie?

column2: James 4:2 Ye lust, and have not: ye kill, and desire to have, and cannot obtain: ye fight and war, yet ye have not, because ye ask not.
column3: Jakobus 4:2 Julle begeer en julle het nie, julle pleeg moord en is naywerig en julle kan niks verkry nie. Julle veg en maak oorlog, en julle het nie, omdat julle nie bid nie.

column2: James 4:3 Ye ask, and receive not, because ye ask amiss, that ye may consume [it] upon your lusts.
column3: Jakobus 4:3 Julle bid en julle ontvang nie, omdat julle verkeerd bid, om dit in julle welluste deur te bring.

column2: James 4:4 Ye adulterers and adulteresses, know ye not that the friendship of the world is enmity with God? whosoever therefore will be a friend of the world is the enemy of God.
column3: Jakobus 4:4 Egbrekers en egbreeksters, weet julle nie dat die vriendskap van die wêreld vyandskap teen God is nie? Wie dan ’n vriend van die wêreld wil wees, word ’n vyand van God.

column2: James 4:5 Do ye think that the scripture saith in vain, The spirit that dwelleth in us lusteth to envy?
column3: Jakobus 4:5 Of meen julle dat die Skrif tevergeefs sê: Met jaloersheid begeer die Gees wat in ons woon?

column2: James 4:6 But he giveth more grace. Wherefore he saith, God resisteth the proud, but giveth grace unto the humble.
column3: Jakobus 4:6 Maar Hy gee groter genade; daarom sê Hy: God weerstaan die hoogmoediges, maar aan die nederiges gee Hy genade.

column2: James 4:7 Submit yourselves therefore to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.
column3: Jakobus 4:7 Onderwerp julle dan aan God; weerstaan die duiwel, en hy sal van julle wegvlug.

column2: James 4:8 Draw nigh to God, and he will draw nigh to you. Cleanse [your] hands, [ye] sinners; and purify [your] hearts, [ye] double minded.
column3: Jakobus 4:8 Nader tot God, en Hy sal tot julle nader. Reinig die hande, julle sondaars, en suiwer die harte, julle dubbelhartiges!

column2: James 4:9 Be afflicted, and mourn, and weep: let your laughter be turned to mourning, and [your] joy to heaviness.
column3: Jakobus 4:9 Weeklaag, treur en ween. Laat julle gelag in treurigheid verander word en julle blydskap in bedruktheid.

column2: James 4:10 Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and he shall lift you up.
column3: Jakobus 4:10 Verneder julle voor die Here, en Hy sal julle verhoog.

column2: James 4:11 Speak not evil one of another, brethren. He that speaketh evil of [his] brother, and judgeth his brother, speaketh evil of the law, and judgeth the law: but if thou judge the law, thou art not a doer of the law, but a judge.
column3: Jakobus 4:11 Broeders, moenie van mekaar kwaad spreek nie. Dié wat kwaad spreek van sy broeder en sy broeder oordeel, spreek kwaad van die wet en oordeel die wet; en as jy die wet oordeel, is jy nie ’n dader van die wet nie, maar ’n regter.

column2: James 4:12 There is one lawgiver, who is able to save and to destroy: who art thou that judgest another?
column3: Jakobus 4:12 Een is die Wetgewer, Hy wat mag het om te red en te verderf. Maar jy, wie is jy wat ’n ander oordeel?

column2: James 4:13 Go to now, ye that say, To day or to morrow we will go into such a city, and continue there a year, and buy and sell, and get gain:
column3: Jakobus 4:13 KOM nou, julle wat sê: Vandag of môre sal ons na dié en dié stad gaan en daar een jaar deurbring en handel drywe en wins maak —

column2: James 4:14 Whereas ye know not what [shall be] on the morrow. For what [is] your life? It is even a vapour, that appeareth for a little time, and then vanisheth away.
column3: Jakobus 4:14 julle wat nie eens weet wat môre sal gebeur nie. Want hoedanig is julle lewe? Dit is tog maar ’n damp wat vir ’n kort tydjie verskyn en daarna verdwyn.

column2: James 4:15 For that ye [ought] to say, If the Lord will, we shall live, and do this, or that.
column3: Jakobus 4:15 In plaas dat julle sê: As die Here wil en ons lewe, dan sal ons dit of dat doen.

column2: James 4:16 But now ye rejoice in your boastings: all such rejoicing is evil.
column3: Jakobus 4:16 Maar nou roem julle in jul grootpratery. Al sulke roem is verkeerd.

column2: James 4:17 Therefore to him that knoweth to do good, and doeth [it] not, to him it is sin.
column3: Jakobus 4:17 Wie dan weet om goed te doen en dit nie doen nie, vir hom is dit sonde.

column2: James 5:1 Go to now, [ye] rich men, weep and howl for your miseries that shall come upon [you].
column3: Jakobus 5:1 KOM nou, julle rykes, ween en huil oor die ellendes wat oor julle kom.

column2: James 5:2 Your riches are corrupted, and your garments are motheaten.
column3: Jakobus 5:2 Julle rykdom is bedorwe, en julle klere is deur die motte verniel.

column2: James 5:3 Your gold and silver is cankered; and the rust of them shall be a witness against you, and shall eat your flesh as it were fire. Ye have heaped treasure together for the last days.
column3: Jakobus 5:3 Julle goud en silwer is verroes, en hulle roes sal tot ’n getuienis teen julle wees en sal soos ’n vuur julle vlees verteer. Julle het skatte vergader in die laaste dae.

column2: James 5:4 Behold, the hire of the labourers who have reaped down your fields, which is of you kept back by fraud, crieth: and the cries of them which have reaped are entered into the ears of the Lord of sabaoth.
column3: Jakobus 5:4 Kyk, die loon van die arbeiders wat julle lande afgeoes het, wat deur julle agtergehou is, roep uit; en die geroep van die maaiers het gekom tot in die ore van die Here van die leërskare.

column2: James 5:5 Ye have lived in pleasure on the earth, and been wanton; ye have nourished your hearts, as in a day of slaughter.
column3: Jakobus 5:5 Julle het op die aarde ’n weelderige en losbandige lewe gelei; julle het jul harte vet gevoer soos op ’n slagdag.

column2: James 5:6 Ye have condemned [and] killed the just; [and] he doth not resist you.
column3: Jakobus 5:6 Veroordeel, vermoor het julle die regverdige; hy versit hom nie teen julle nie.

column2: James 5:7 Be patient therefore, brethren, unto the coming of the Lord. Behold, the husbandman waiteth for the precious fruit of the earth, and hath long patience for it, until he receive the early and latter rain.
column3: Jakobus 5:7 WEES dan geduldig, broeders, tot op die wederkoms van die Here. Kyk, die landbouer wag op die kostelike vrug van die aarde en het geduld daarmee totdat dit die vroeë en die laat reën ontvang het.

column2: James 5:8 Be ye also patient; stablish your hearts: for the coming of the Lord draweth nigh.
column3: Jakobus 5:8 Julle moet ook geduldig wees; versterk julle harte, want die wederkoms van die Here is naby.

column2: James 5:9 Grudge not one against another, brethren, lest ye be condemned: behold, the judge standeth before the door.
column3: Jakobus 5:9 Moenie teen mekaar sug nie, broeders, sodat julle nie veroordeel word nie. Kyk, die Regter staan voor die deur.

column2: James 5:10 Take, my brethren, the prophets, who have spoken in the name of the Lord, for an example of suffering affliction, and of patience.
column3: Jakobus 5:10 Neem as voorbeeld van lyding, my broeders, en van geduld die profete wat in die Naam van die Here gespreek het.

column2: James 5:11 Behold, we count them happy which endure. Ye have heard of the patience of Job, and have seen the end of the Lord; that the Lord is very pitiful, and of tender mercy.
column3: Jakobus 5:11 Kyk, ons reken hulle geluksalig wat verdra. Julle het gehoor van die lydsaamheid van Job, en julle het die einddoel van die Here met hom gesien, dat die Here vol medelye en ontferming is.

column2: James 5:12 But above all things, my brethren, swear not, neither by heaven, neither by the earth, neither by any other oath: but let your yea be yea; and [your] nay, nay; lest ye fall into condemnation.
column3: Jakobus 5:12 Maar bo alles, my broeders, moenie sweer nie: nie by die hemel nie, ook nie by die aarde nie en ook geen ander eed nie; maar laat julle ja ja wees en julle nee nee, sodat julle nie onder ’n oordeel val nie.

column2: James 5:13 Is any among you afflicted? let him pray. Is any merry? let him sing psalms.
column3: Jakobus 5:13 Is daar iemand onder julle wat ly? Laat hom bid. Is iemand opgeruimd? Laat hom psalmsing.

column2: James 5:14 Is any sick among you? let him call for the elders of the church; and let them pray over him, anointing him with oil in the name of the Lord:
column3: Jakobus 5:14 Is daar iemand siek onder julle? Laat hom die ouderlinge van die gemeente inroep, en laat hulle oor hom bid nadat hulle hom in die Naam van die Here met olie gesalf het.

column2: James 5:15 And the prayer of faith shall save the sick, and the Lord shall raise him up; and if he have committed sins, they shall be forgiven him.
column3: Jakobus 5:15 En die gebed van die geloof sal die kranke red, en die Here sal hom oprig. Selfs as hy sonde gedoen het, sal dit hom vergewe word.

column2: James 5:16 Confess [your] faults one to another, and pray one for another, that ye may be healed. The effectual fervent prayer of a righteous man availeth much.
column3: Jakobus 5:16 Bely mekaar julle misdade en bid vir mekaar, sodat julle gesond kan word. Die vurige gebed van ’n regverdige het groot krag.

column2: James 5:17 Elias was a man subject to like passions as we are, and he prayed earnestly that it might not rain: and it rained not on the earth by the space of three years and six months.
column3: Jakobus 5:17 Elía was ’n mens net soos ons, en hy het ernstig gebid dat dit nie moes reën nie, en dit het op die aarde drie jaar en ses maande lank nie gereën nie;

column2: James 5:18 And he prayed again, and the heaven gave rain, and the earth brought forth her fruit.
column3: Jakobus 5:18 en hy het weer gebid, en die hemel het reën gegee en die aarde het sy vrug laat uitspruit.

column2: James 5:19 Brethren, if any of you do err from the truth, and one convert him;
column3: Jakobus 5:19 Broeders, as een onder julle van die waarheid afgedwaal het en iemand hom bekeer,

column2: James 5:20 Let him know, that he which converteth the sinner from the error of his way shall save a soul from death, and shall hide a multitude of sins.
column3: Jakobus 5:20 laat hy weet dat die een wat ’n sondaar van sy dwaalweg bekeer, ’n siel uit die dood sal red en ’n menigte sondes sal bedek.

column2: 1 Peter 1:1 Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ, to the strangers scattered throughout Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia,
column3: 1 Petrus 1:1 PETRUS, ’n apostel van Jesus Christus, aan die vreemdelinge van die verstrooiing in Pontus, Galásië, Kappadócië, Asië en Bithínië,

column2: 1 Peter 1:2 Elect according to the foreknowledge of God the Father, through sanctification of the Spirit, unto obedience and sprinkling of the blood of Jesus Christ: Grace unto you, and peace, be multiplied.
column3: 1 Petrus 1:2 uitverkore volgens die voorkennis van God die Vader, in die heiligmaking van die Gees, tot gehoorsaamheid en besprenkeling met die bloed van Jesus Christus: Mag genade en vrede vir julle vermenigvuldig word!

column2: 1 Peter 1:3 Blessed [be] the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, which according to his abundant mercy hath begotten us again unto a lively hope by the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,
column3: 1 Petrus 1:3 GESEËND is die God en Vader van onse Here Jesus Christus wat na sy grote barmhartigheid ons die wedergeboorte geskenk het tot ’n lewende hoop deur die opstanding van Jesus Christus uit die dode,

column2: 1 Peter 1:4 To an inheritance incorruptible, and undefiled, and that fadeth not away, reserved in heaven for you,
column3: 1 Petrus 1:4 sodat ons ’n onverganklike en onbesmette en onverwelklike erfenis kan verkry, wat in die hemele bewaar is vir ons

column2: 1 Peter 1:5 Who are kept by the power of God through faith unto salvation ready to be revealed in the last time.
column3: 1 Petrus 1:5 wat in die krag van God bewaar word deur die geloof tot die saligheid wat gereed is om geopenbaar te word in die laaste tyd.

column2: 1 Peter 1:6 Wherein ye greatly rejoice, though now for a season, if need be, ye are in heaviness through manifold temptations:
column3: 1 Petrus 1:6 Daarin verheug julle jul, al word julle nou — as dit nodig is — ’n kort tydjie bedroef onder allerhande beproewinge,

column2: 1 Peter 1:7 That the trial of your faith, being much more precious than of gold that perisheth, though it be tried with fire, might be found unto praise and honour and glory at the appearing of Jesus Christ:
column3: 1 Petrus 1:7 sodat die beproefdheid van julle geloof, wat baie kosbaarder is as goud wat vergaan maar deur vuur gelouter word, bevind mag word tot lof en eer en heerlikheid by die openbaring van Jesus Christus;

column2: 1 Peter 1:8 Whom having not seen, ye love; in whom, though now ye see [him] not, yet believing, ye rejoice with joy unspeakable and full of glory:
column3: 1 Petrus 1:8 vir wie julle, al het julle Hom nie gesien nie, tog liefhet; in wie julle, al sien julle Hom nou nie, tog glo en julle verbly met ’n onuitspreeklike en heerlike blydskap,

column2: 1 Peter 1:9 Receiving the end of your faith, [even] the salvation of [your] souls.
column3: 1 Petrus 1:9 en die einddoel van julle geloof, die saligheid van julle siele, verkry.

column2: 1 Peter 1:10 Of which salvation the prophets have enquired and searched diligently, who prophesied of the grace [that should come] unto you:
column3: 1 Petrus 1:10 Aangaande hierdie saligheid het die profete wat geprofeteer het oor die genade wat vir julle bestem is, ondersoek en nagevors,

column2: 1 Peter 1:11 Searching what, or what manner of time the Spirit of Christ which was in them did signify, when it testified beforehand the sufferings of Christ, and the glory that should follow.
column3: 1 Petrus 1:11 en hulle het nagespeur op watter of hoedanige tyd die Gees van Christus wat in hulle was, gewys het, toe Hy vooruit getuig het van die lyde wat oor Christus sou kom en die heerlikheid daarna.

column2: 1 Peter 1:12 Unto whom it was revealed, that not unto themselves, but unto us they did minister the things, which are now reported unto you by them that have preached the gospel unto you with the Holy Ghost sent down from heaven; which things the angels desire to look into.
column3: 1 Petrus 1:12 Aan hulle is geopenbaar dat hulle nie vir hulleself nie, maar vir ons dié dinge bedien het wat julle nou aangekondig is deur dié wat die evangelie aan julle verkondig het in die Heilige Gees wat van die hemel gestuur is — dinge waarin die engele begerig is om in te sien.

column2: 1 Peter 1:13 Wherefore gird up the loins of your mind, be sober, and hope to the end for the grace that is to be brought unto you at the revelation of Jesus Christ;
column3: 1 Petrus 1:13 DAAROM, omgord die lendene van julle verstand, wees nugter en hoop volkome op die genade wat julle deel word by die openbaring van Jesus Christus.

column2: 1 Peter 1:14 As obedient children, not fashioning yourselves according to the former lusts in your ignorance:
column3: 1 Petrus 1:14 Soos gehoorsame kinders moet julle nie jul lewe inrig volgens die begeerlikhede wat tevore in julle onwetendheid bestaan het nie.

column2: 1 Peter 1:15 But as he which hath called you is holy, so be ye holy in all manner of conversation;
column3: 1 Petrus 1:15 Maar soos Hy wat julle geroep het, heilig is, moet julle ook in jul hele lewenswandel heilig word,

column2: 1 Peter 1:16 Because it is written, Be ye holy; for I am holy.
column3: 1 Petrus 1:16 omdat daar geskrywe is: Wees heilig, want Ek is heilig.

column2: 1 Peter 1:17 And if ye call on the Father, who without respect of persons judgeth according to every man's work, pass the time of your sojourning [here] in fear:
column3: 1 Petrus 1:17 En as julle Hom as Vader aanroep wat sonder aanneming van die persoon oordeel volgens elkeen se werk, wandel dan in vrees gedurende die tyd van julle vreemdelingskap;

column2: 1 Peter 1:18 Forasmuch as ye know that ye were not redeemed with corruptible things, [as] silver and gold, from your vain conversation [received] by tradition from your fathers;
column3: 1 Petrus 1:18 omdat julle weet dat julle nie deur verganklike dinge, silwer of goud, losgekoop is uit julle ydele lewenswandel wat deur die vaders oorgelewer is nie,

column2: 1 Peter 1:19 But with the precious blood of Christ, as of a lamb without blemish and without spot:
column3: 1 Petrus 1:19 maar deur die kosbare bloed van Christus, soos van ’n lam sonder gebrek en vlekkeloos,

column2: 1 Peter 1:20 Who verily was foreordained before the foundation of the world, but was manifest in these last times for you,
column3: 1 Petrus 1:20 wat wel vooruit geken is voor die grondlegging van die wêreld, maar in hierdie laaste tye geopenbaar is om julle ontwil,

column2: 1 Peter 1:21 Who by him do believe in God, that raised him up from the dead, and gave him glory; that your faith and hope might be in God.
column3: 1 Petrus 1:21 julle wat deur Hom glo in God wat Hom uit die dode opgewek en Hom heerlikheid gegee het, sodat julle geloof en hoop op God kan wees.

column2: 1 Peter 1:22 Seeing ye have purified your souls in obeying the truth through the Spirit unto unfeigned love of the brethren, [see that ye] love one another with a pure heart fervently:
column3: 1 Petrus 1:22 As julle in gehoorsaamheid aan die waarheid julle siele deur die Gees tot ongeveinsde broederliefde gereinig het, moet julle mekaar vurig liefhê uit ’n rein hart;

column2: 1 Peter 1:23 Being born again, not of corruptible seed, but of incorruptible, by the word of God, which liveth and abideth for ever.
column3: 1 Petrus 1:23 want julle is wedergebore nie uit verganklike saad nie, maar uit onverganklike, deur die lewende woord van God wat tot in ewigheid bly.

column2: 1 Peter 1:24 For all flesh [is] as grass, and all the glory of man as the flower of grass. The grass withereth, and the flower thereof falleth away:
column3: 1 Petrus 1:24 Want alle vlees is soos gras, en al die heerlikheid van die mens soos ’n blom van die gras. Die gras verdor en sy blom val af,

column2: 1 Peter 1:25 But the word of the Lord endureth for ever. And this is the word which by the gospel is preached unto you.
column3: 1 Petrus 1:25 maar die woord van die Here bly tot in ewigheid. En dit is die woord wat aan julle verkondig is.

column2: 1 Peter 2:1 Wherefore laying aside all malice, and all guile, and hypocrisies, and envies, and all evil speakings,
column3: 1 Petrus 2:1 LÊ dan af alle boosheid en alle bedrog en geveinsdheid en afguns en alle kwaadpratery;

column2: 1 Peter 2:2 As newborn babes, desire the sincere milk of the word, that ye may grow thereby:
column3: 1 Petrus 2:2 en verlang sterk soos pasgebore kindertjies na die onvervalste melk van die woord, dat julle daardeur kan opgroei,

column2: 1 Peter 2:3 If so be ye have tasted that the Lord [is] gracious.
column3: 1 Petrus 2:3 as julle ten minste gesmaak het dat die Here goedertieren is.

column2: 1 Peter 2:4 To whom coming, [as unto] a living stone, disallowed indeed of men, but chosen of God, [and] precious,
column3: 1 Petrus 2:4 Kom na Hom toe, die lewende steen wat deur die mense wel verwerp is, maar by God uitverkore en kosbaar is;

column2: 1 Peter 2:5 Ye also, as lively stones, are built up a spiritual house, an holy priesthood, to offer up spiritual sacrifices, acceptable to God by Jesus Christ.
column3: 1 Petrus 2:5 en laat julle ook soos lewende stene opbou, tot ’n geestelike huis, ’n heilige priesterdom, om geestelike offers te bring wat aan God welgevallig is deur Jesus Christus.

column2: 1 Peter 2:6 Wherefore also it is contained in the scripture, Behold, I lay in Sion a chief corner stone, elect, precious: and he that believeth on him shall not be confounded.
column3: 1 Petrus 2:6 Daarom staan dit ook in die Skrif: Kyk, Ek lê in Sion ’n uitverkore en kosbare hoeksteen, en die wat in Hom glo, sal nooit beskaam word nie.

column2: 1 Peter 2:7 Unto you therefore which believe [he is] precious: but unto them which be disobedient, the stone which the builders disallowed, the same is made the head of the corner,
column3: 1 Petrus 2:7 Vir julle dan wat glo, is Hy kosbaar; maar vir die ongelowiges geld die woord: Die steen wat die bouers verwerp het, dit het ’n hoeksteen geword; en: ’n Steen van aanstoot en ’n rots van struikeling —

column2: 1 Peter 2:8 And a stone of stumbling, and a rock of offence, [even to them] which stumble at the word, being disobedient: whereunto also they were appointed.
column3: 1 Petrus 2:8 vir dié wat hulle daarteen stamp, omdat hulle aan die woord ongehoorsaam is, waarvoor hulle ook bestem is.

column2: 1 Peter 2:9 But ye [are] a chosen generation, a royal priesthood, an holy nation, a peculiar people; that ye should shew forth the praises of him who hath called you out of darkness into his marvellous light:
column3: 1 Petrus 2:9 Maar julle is ’n uitverkore geslag, ’n koninklike priesterdom, ’n heilige volk, ’n volk as eiendom verkry, om te verkondig die deugde van Hom wat julle uit die duisternis geroep het tot sy wonderbare lig,

column2: 1 Peter 2:10 Which in time past [were] not a people, but [are] now the people of God: which had not obtained mercy, but now have obtained mercy.
column3: 1 Petrus 2:10 julle wat vroeër geen volk was nie, maar nou die volk van God is; aan wie toe geen barmhartigheid bewys is nie, maar nou bewys is.

column2: 1 Peter 2:11 Dearly beloved, I beseech [you] as strangers and pilgrims, abstain from fleshly lusts, which war against the soul;
column3: 1 Petrus 2:11 GELIEFDES, ek vermaan julle as bywoners en vreemdelinge om julle te onthou van vleeslike begeertes wat stryd voer teen die siel;

column2: 1 Peter 2:12 Having your conversation honest among the Gentiles: that, whereas they speak against you as evildoers, they may by [your] good works, which they shall behold, glorify God in the day of visitation.
column3: 1 Petrus 2:12 en hou julle lewenswandel onder die heidene skoon, sodat as hulle van julle kwaad spreek soos van kwaaddoeners, hulle op grond van die goeie werke wat hulle aanskou, God kan verheerlik in die dag van besoeking.

column2: 1 Peter 2:13 Submit yourselves to every ordinance of man for the Lord's sake: whether it be to the king, as supreme;
column3: 1 Petrus 2:13 Wees dan onderdanig aan elke menslike verordening ter wille van die Here — of dit die koning is as opperheer,

column2: 1 Peter 2:14 Or unto governors, as unto them that are sent by him for the punishment of evildoers, and for the praise of them that do well.
column3: 1 Petrus 2:14 of die goewerneurs as sy gesante, om wel kwaaddoeners te straf, maar die wat goed doen, te prys.

column2: 1 Peter 2:15 For so is the will of God, that with well doing ye may put to silence the ignorance of foolish men:
column3: 1 Petrus 2:15 Want so is dit die wil van God dat julle deur goed te doen die onkunde van die dwase mense tot swye sal bring,

column2: 1 Peter 2:16 As free, and not using [your] liberty for a cloke of maliciousness, but as the servants of God.
column3: 1 Petrus 2:16 as vrymense en nie asof julle die vryheid het as ’n dekmantel vir die boosheid nie, maar as diensknegte van God.

column2: 1 Peter 2:17 Honour all [men]. Love the brotherhood. Fear God. Honour the king.
column3: 1 Petrus 2:17 Julle moet almal eer, die broederskap liefhê, God vrees, die koning eer.

column2: 1 Peter 2:18 Servants, [be] subject to [your] masters with all fear; not only to the good and gentle, but also to the froward.
column3: 1 Petrus 2:18 DIENSKNEGTE, wees julle here onderdanig met alle vrees, nie alleen aan die wat goed en vriendelik is nie, maar ook aan die wat verkeerd is.

column2: 1 Peter 2:19 For this [is] thankworthy, if a man for conscience toward God endure grief, suffering wrongfully.
column3: 1 Petrus 2:19 Want dit is genade as iemand, ter wille van die gewete voor God, leed verdra deur onregverdig te ly.

column2: 1 Peter 2:20 For what glory [is it], if, when ye be buffeted for your faults, ye shall take it patiently? but if, when ye do well, and suffer [for it], ye take it patiently, this [is] acceptable with God.
column3: 1 Petrus 2:20 Want watter roem is daar as julle verdra wanneer julle sonde doen en geslaan word? Maar as julle verdra wanneer julle goed doen en ly — dit is genade by God.

column2: 1 Peter 2:21 For even hereunto were ye called: because Christ also suffered for us, leaving us an example, that ye should follow his steps:
column3: 1 Petrus 2:21 Want hiertoe is julle geroep, omdat Christus ook vir julle gely het en julle ’n voorbeeld nagelaat het, sodat julle sy voetstappe kan navolg;

column2: 1 Peter 2:22 Who did no sin, neither was guile found in his mouth:
column3: 1 Petrus 2:22 Hy wat geen sonde gedoen het nie, en in wie se mond geen bedrog gevind is nie;

column2: 1 Peter 2:23 Who, when he was reviled, reviled not again; when he suffered, he threatened not; but committed [himself] to him that judgeth righteously:
column3: 1 Petrus 2:23 wat, toe Hy uitgeskel is, nie terug uitgeskel het nie; toe Hy gely het, nie gedreig het nie, maar dit oorgegee het aan Hom wat regverdig oordeel;

column2: 1 Peter 2:24 Who his own self bare our sins in his own body on the tree, that we, being dead to sins, should live unto righteousness: by whose stripes ye were healed.
column3: 1 Petrus 2:24 wat self ons sondes in sy liggaam op die kruishout gedra het, sodat ons die sondes kan afsterwe en vir die geregtigheid lewe; deur wie se wonde julle genees is.

column2: 1 Peter 2:25 For ye were as sheep going astray; but are now returned unto the Shepherd and Bishop of your souls.
column3: 1 Petrus 2:25 Want julle was soos dwalende skape, maar nou het julle teruggekeer na die Herder en Opsiener van julle siele.

column2: 1 Peter 3:1 Likewise, ye wives, [be] in subjection to your own husbands; that, if any obey not the word, they also may without the word be won by the conversation of the wives;
column3: 1 Petrus 3:1 NET so moet julle, vroue, aan jul eie mans onderdanig wees, sodat, as sommige aan die woord ongehoorsaam is, hulle ook deur die wandel van die vroue sonder woorde gewin kan word

column2: 1 Peter 3:2 While they behold your chaste conversation [coupled] with fear.
column3: 1 Petrus 3:2 as hulle jul reine, godvresende wandel aanskou het.

column2: 1 Peter 3:3 Whose adorning let it not be that outward [adorning] of plaiting the hair, and of wearing of gold, or of putting on of apparel;
column3: 1 Petrus 3:3 Julle versiering moet nie uiterlik wees nie: haarvlegtery en omhang van goud en aantrek van klere nie,

column2: 1 Peter 3:4 But [let it be] the hidden man of the heart, in that which is not corruptible, [even the ornament] of a meek and quiet spirit, which is in the sight of God of great price.
column3: 1 Petrus 3:4 maar die verborge mens van die hart in die onverganklike versiering van ’n sagmoedige en stille gees, wat baie kosbaar is voor God.

column2: 1 Peter 3:5 For after this manner in the old time the holy women also, who trusted in God, adorned themselves, being in subjection unto their own husbands:
column3: 1 Petrus 3:5 Want so het vroeër ook die heilige vroue wat op God gehoop het, hulleself versier, en hulle was aan hul eie mans onderdanig,

column2: 1 Peter 3:6 Even as Sara obeyed Abraham, calling him lord: whose daughters ye are, as long as ye do well, and are not afraid with any amazement.
column3: 1 Petrus 3:6 soos Sara gehoorsaam was aan Abraham en hom heer genoem het; wie se kinders julle geword het as julle goed doen en geen enkele verskrikking vrees nie.

column2: 1 Peter 3:7 Likewise, ye husbands, dwell with [them] according to knowledge, giving honour unto the wife, as unto the weaker vessel, and as being heirs together of the grace of life; that your prayers be not hindered.
column3: 1 Petrus 3:7 Net so moet julle, manne, verstandig met hulle saamlewe en aan die vroulike geslag, as die swakkere, eer bewys, omdat julle ook mede-erfgename van die genade van die lewe is — sodat julle gebede nie verhinder mag word nie.

column2: 1 Peter 3:8 Finally, [be ye] all of one mind, having compassion one of another, love as brethren, [be] pitiful, [be] courteous:
column3: 1 Petrus 3:8 EN eindelik, wees almal eensgesind, medelydend, vol broederliefde en ontferming, vriendelik.

column2: 1 Peter 3:9 Not rendering evil for evil, or railing for railing: but contrariwise blessing; knowing that ye are thereunto called, that ye should inherit a blessing.
column3: 1 Petrus 3:9 Vergeld geen kwaad met kwaad of skeldwoorde met skeldwoorde nie, maar seën inteendeel, omdat julle weet dat julle hiertoe geroep is, sodat julle seën kan beërwe.

column2: 1 Peter 3:10 For he that will love life, and see good days, let him refrain his tongue from evil, and his lips that they speak no guile:
column3: 1 Petrus 3:10 Want wie die lewe wil liefhê en goeie dae wil sien, moet sy tong bewaar vir wat verkeerd is, en sy lippe dat hulle geen bedrog spreek nie.

column2: 1 Peter 3:11 Let him eschew evil, and do good; let him seek peace, and ensue it.
column3: 1 Petrus 3:11 Hy moet afwyk van wat verkeerd is, en doen wat goed is; hy moet vrede soek en dit najaag.

column2: 1 Peter 3:12 For the eyes of the Lord [are] over the righteous, and his ears [are open] unto their prayers: but the face of the Lord [is] against them that do evil.
column3: 1 Petrus 3:12 Want die oë van die Here is op die regverdiges en sy ore tot hulle gebed, maar die aangesig van die Here is teen die kwaaddoeners.

column2: 1 Peter 3:13 And who [is] he that will harm you, if ye be followers of that which is good?
column3: 1 Petrus 3:13 En wie is dit wat julle kwaad sal aandoen as julle navolgers is van die goeie?

column2: 1 Peter 3:14 But and if ye suffer for righteousness' sake, happy [are ye]: and be not afraid of their terror, neither be troubled;
column3: 1 Petrus 3:14 Maar as julle ook moet ly ter wille van die geregtigheid, salig is julle. En vrees hulle glad nie, en wees nie ontsteld nie.

column2: 1 Peter 3:15 But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts: and [be] ready always to [give] an answer to every man that asketh you a reason of the hope that is in you with meekness and fear:
column3: 1 Petrus 3:15 Maar heilig die Here God in julle harte en wees altyd bereid om verantwoording te doen aan elkeen wat van julle rekenskap eis omtrent die hoop wat in julle is, met sagmoedigheid en vrees;

column2: 1 Peter 3:16 Having a good conscience; that, whereas they speak evil of you, as of evildoers, they may be ashamed that falsely accuse your good conversation in Christ.
column3: 1 Petrus 3:16 met behoud van ’n goeie gewete, sodat in die saak waarin hulle van julle kwaad spreek soos van kwaaddoeners, húlle beskaam mag word wat julle goeie lewenswandel in Christus belaster.

column2: 1 Peter 3:17 For [it is] better, if the will of God be so, that ye suffer for well doing, than for evil doing.
column3: 1 Petrus 3:17 Want dit is beter, as die wil van God dit eis, dat julle ly wanneer julle goed doen as wanneer julle kwaad doen.

column2: 1 Peter 3:18 For Christ also hath once suffered for sins, the just for the unjust, that he might bring us to God, being put to death in the flesh, but quickened by the Spirit:
column3: 1 Petrus 3:18 Want Christus het ook eenmaal vir die sondes gely, Hy die Regverdige vir die onregverdiges, om ons tot God te bring — Hy wat wel gedood is na die vlees, maar lewend gemaak deur die Gees;

column2: 1 Peter 3:19 By which also he went and preached unto the spirits in prison;
column3: 1 Petrus 3:19 in wie Hy ook heengegaan en gepreek het vir die geeste in die gevangenis,

column2: 1 Peter 3:20 Which sometime were disobedient, when once the longsuffering of God waited in the days of Noah, while the ark was a preparing, wherein few, that is, eight souls were saved by water.
column3: 1 Petrus 3:20 wat eertyds ongehoorsaam was toe die lankmoedigheid van God een maal gewag het in die dae van Noag, onderwyl die ark gereed gemaak is, waarin weinig, dit is agt, siele deur water heen gered is;

column2: 1 Peter 3:21 The like figure whereunto [even] baptism doth also now save us (not the putting away of the filth of the flesh, but the answer of a good conscience toward God,) by the resurrection of Jesus Christ:
column3: 1 Petrus 3:21 waarvan die teëbeeld, die doop, ons nou ook red, nie as ’n aflegging van die vuilheid van die vlees nie, maar as ’n bede tot God om ’n goeie gewete — deur die opstanding van Jesus Christus

column2: 1 Peter 3:22 Who is gone into heaven, and is on the right hand of God; angels and authorities and powers being made subject unto him.
column3: 1 Petrus 3:22 wat heengegaan het na die hemel en aan die regterhand van God is, terwyl engele en magte en kragte aan Hom onderwerp is.

column2: 1 Peter 4:1 Forasmuch then as Christ hath suffered for us in the flesh, arm yourselves likewise with the same mind: for he that hath suffered in the flesh hath ceased from sin;
column3: 1 Petrus 4:1 OMDAT Christus dan vir ons na die vlees gely het, moet julle jul ook wapen met dieselfde gedagte, dat wie na die vlees gely het, opgehou het met die sonde,

column2: 1 Peter 4:2 That he no longer should live the rest of [his] time in the flesh to the lusts of men, but to the will of God.
column3: 1 Petrus 4:2 om die orige tyd in die vlees nie meer volgens die begeerlikhede van die mense te leef nie, maar volgens die wil van God.

column2: 1 Peter 4:3 For the time past of [our] life may suffice us to have wrought the will of the Gentiles, when we walked in lasciviousness, lusts, excess of wine, revellings, banquetings, and abominable idolatries:
column3: 1 Petrus 4:3 Want dit is genoeg dat ons die afgelope lewenstyd die wil van die heidene volbring het deur te wandel in ongebondenheid, begeerlikheid, dronkenskap, brasserye, drinkpartye en ongeoorloofde afgoderye.

column2: 1 Peter 4:4 Wherein they think it strange that ye run not with [them] to the same excess of riot, speaking evil of [you]:
column3: 1 Petrus 4:4 Daarom vind hulle dit vreemd as julle nie saamloop in dieselfde uitgieting van losbandigheid nie, en hulle laster.

column2: 1 Peter 4:5 Who shall give account to him that is ready to judge the quick and the dead.
column3: 1 Petrus 4:5 Hulle sal rekenskap gee aan Hom wat gereed staan om die lewende en die dode te oordeel.

column2: 1 Peter 4:6 For for this cause was the gospel preached also to them that are dead, that they might be judged according to men in the flesh, but live according to God in the spirit.
column3: 1 Petrus 4:6 Want daarom is ook aan die dode die evangelie verkondig, sodat hulle wel geoordeel kan word na die mens in die vlees, maar lewe na God in die gees.

column2: 1 Peter 4:7 But the end of all things is at hand: be ye therefore sober, and watch unto prayer.
column3: 1 Petrus 4:7 En die einde van alle dinge is naby; wees dan ingetoë en nugter, om te kan bid.

column2: 1 Peter 4:8 And above all things have fervent charity among yourselves: for charity shall cover the multitude of sins.
column3: 1 Petrus 4:8 Maar bo alles moet julle mekaar vurig liefhê, want die liefde sal ’n menigte sondes bedek.

column2: 1 Peter 4:9 Use hospitality one to another without grudging.
column3: 1 Petrus 4:9 Wees gasvry jeens mekaar sonder om te murmureer.

column2: 1 Peter 4:10 As every man hath received the gift, [even so] minister the same one to another, as good stewards of the manifold grace of God.
column3: 1 Petrus 4:10 Namate elkeen ’n genadegawe ontvang het, moet julle mekaar daarmee dien soos goeie bedienaars van die veelvuldige genade van God.

column2: 1 Peter 4:11 If any man speak, [let him speak] as the oracles of God; if any man minister, [let him do it] as of the ability which God giveth: that God in all things may be glorified through Jesus Christ, to whom be praise and dominion for ever and ever. Amen.
column3: 1 Petrus 4:11 As iemand spreek, laat dit wees soos woorde van God; as iemand dien, laat dit wees soos uit die krag wat God verleen, sodat God in alles verheerlik kan word deur Jesus Christus, aan wie die heerlikheid en krag toekom tot in alle ewigheid. Amen.

column2: 1 Peter 4:12 Beloved, think it not strange concerning the fiery trial which is to try you, as though some strange thing happened unto you:
column3: 1 Petrus 4:12 Geliefdes, verbaas julle nie oor die vuurgloed van vervolging onder julle wat tot julle beproewing dien, asof iets vreemds oor julle kom nie;

column2: 1 Peter 4:13 But rejoice, inasmuch as ye are partakers of Christ's sufferings; that, when his glory shall be revealed, ye may be glad also with exceeding joy.
column3: 1 Petrus 4:13 maar namate julle gemeenskap het aan die lyde van Christus, moet julle bly wees, sodat julle ook by die openbaring van sy heerlikheid met blydskap kan jubel.

column2: 1 Peter 4:14 If ye be reproached for the name of Christ, happy [are ye]; for the spirit of glory and of God resteth upon you: on their part he is evil spoken of, but on your part he is glorified.
